Text

IT was only just light enough to discern the five human forms in the dimness of [the garret]293-the garret ; the rays of the moon having to find their way through the deep window - embrasures of [the keep]294-the keep . Less illumination would have sufficed to disclose the ancient character of [the garret]293-the garret , with [its]293-the garret low ceiling , and the graduated mouldings of the cornice , giving the effect of a shallow dome . [The house]296-the house stood obviously very high , for one could see from the windows for miles over [a bleak country]297-a bleak country , coldly lit by the rays of the moon , which was almost at the full . Into the half light stole presently the sound of some lively instrument : a reel tune played , as it were , beneath one 's breath , but with all the revel and rollicking emphasis of that intoxicating primitive music . And then in correspondingly low relief , but with no less emphasis , [the occupants of [this singular ball - room]299-this singular ball - room]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room began to dance . One might have fancied [them]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room some midnight company of the dead , risen from [their]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room graves for this secret revelry , so strange was the appearance of [the moving figures]300-the moving figures , with the moonlight catching , as [they]300-the moving figures passed , the faces or the hands . [They]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room danced excellently well , as to the manner born , tripping in and out among the shadows , with occasional stamping , in time to the music , and now and again that wild Celtic shout or cry that sets the nerves athrill . In spite of the whole scene 's being enacted in a low key , it seemed only to gain in intensity from that circumstance , and in fantastic effect . Among [the dancers]301-the dancers was [one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy , and [her]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy little cry had a ring and a wildness that never failed to set [the others]303-the others going with new inspiration . [She]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy was [a slight , dark - haired girl , with a pale , rather mysterious face , and large eyes]304-a slight , dark - haired girl , with a pale , rather mysterious face , and large eyes . Not a word was spoken , and the reel went on for nearly ten minutes . At length [the girl with the dark hair]305-the girl with the dark hair gave a final shout , and broke away from the circle . With [her]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy desertion the dance flagged , and presently came to an end . The first breaking of the silence gave a slight shock , in spite of the subdued tones of [the speaker]306-the speaker . “ It is no use trying to dance a reel without [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[307-a tall youth] said [a tall youth]307-a tall youth , evidently [[her]308-her brother]309-her brother , if one might judge from [his]307-a tall youth almost southern colouring and melancholy eyes . In build and feature [he]307-a tall youth resembled [the elder sister]310-the elder sister , [Algitha]81-algitha , who had all the characteristics of [a fine northern race]311-a fine northern race . “ [Old Maggie]82-old maggie said the other day , that [Hadria]211-hadria 's dancing of the reel was no ‘ right canny , ’ ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha observed , in the same low tone that [all the occupants of the garret]312-all the occupants of the garret instinctively adopted . “ Ah ! ”[83-fred] cried [Fred]83-fred , “ [old Maggie]82-old maggie has always looked upon [Hadria]211-hadria as half bewitched since that night when [she]82-old maggie found [her]211-hadria here ‘ a wee bit bairn , ’ as [she]82-old maggie says , at this very window , in [her]211-hadria nightshirt , standing on tiptoe to see the moonlight . ”[83-fred] “ It frightened the poor old thing out of [her]211-hadria wits , of course , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha , who was leaning with crossed arms , in a corner of the deep - set window . The fine outlines of face and form were shewn in the strange light , as in a boldly - executed sketch , without detail . Pride and determination were the dominant qualities so indicated . [[Her]308-her sister]313-her sister stood opposite , the moonshine making the smooth pallor of [her]313-her sister face more striking , and emphasizing its mysterious quality . [The whole group of young faces , crowded together by the window , and lit up by the unsympathetic light]314-the whole group of young faces , crowded together by the window , and lit up by the unsympathetic light , had something characteristic and unusual in its aspect , that might have excited curiosity . “ Tell [us]3676-we the story of the garret , [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[84-austin] said [Austin]84-austin , [the youngest brother]315-the youngest brother , [a handsome boy of twelve , with curling brown hair and blue eyes]316-a handsome boy of twelve , with curling brown hair and blue eyes . “ [Hadria]211-hadria has told it hundreds of times , and [you]84-austin know it as well as [she]211-hadria does . ”[84-austin] “ But [I]84-austin want to hear it again — about the attack upon [the keep]294-the keep , and the shouting of [the men]3678-the men , while [the lady]3679-the lady was up here starving to death . ”[84-austin] But [Algitha]81-algitha shook [her]81-algitha head . “ [We]3676-we do n't come up here to tell stories , [we]3676-we must get to business . ”[81-algitha] “ Will [you]84-austin have the candle , or can [you]84-austin see ? ”[83-fred] asked [Fred]83-fred , [the second brother , a couple of years younger than [Hadria]211-hadria , whom [he]317-the second brother , a couple of years younger than hadria , whom he addressed addressed]317-the second brother , a couple of years younger than hadria , whom he addressed . [His]317-the second brother , a couple of years younger than hadria , whom he addressed features were irregular ; [his]317-the second brother , a couple of years younger than hadria , whom he addressed short nose and twinkling grey eyes suggesting a joyous and whimsical temperament . “ [I]83-fred think [I]83-fred had better have the candle ; [my]83-fred notes are very illegible . ”[83-fred] [Fred]83-fred drew forth a candle - end from [his]317-the second brother , a couple of years younger than hadria , whom he addressed pocket , stuck it into a quaint - looking stand of antique steel , much eaten with rust , and set the candle - end alight . [Algitha]81-algitha went into [the next room]318-the next room and brought in a couple of chairs . [Fred]83-fred followed [her]81-algitha example till there were enough for the party . [They]319-we all took [their]319-we places , and [Hadria]211-hadria , who had been provided with a seat facing [them]319-we , and with a rickety wooden table that trembled responsively to [her]211-hadria slightest movement , laid down [her]211-hadria notes and surveyed [[her]211-hadria audience]320-her audience . The faces stood out strangely , in the lights and shadows of [the garret]293-the garret . “ [Ladies]3680-ladies and [gentlemen]3681-gentlemen , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria began ; “ on the last occasion on which [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society held [its]3682-the preposterous society meeting , [we]319-we had the pleasure of listening to an able lecture on ‘ Character ’ by [[our]319-we respected member [Demogorgon]85-demogorgon]3683-our respected member demogorgon ”[211-hadria] ( [the speaker]306-the speaker bowed to [Ernest]86-ernest , and [the audience]323-the audience applauded ) . “ [My]323-the audience address to - night on ‘ Fate ’ is designed to contribute further ideas to this fascinating subject , and to pursue the enquiry more curiously . ”[323-the audience] [The audience]323-the audience murmured approval . “ [We]319-we were left at loggerheads , at the end of the last debate . [I]323-the audience doubted [Demogorgon]85-demogorgon 's conclusion , while admiring [his]85-demogorgon eloquence . To - night , [I]323-the audience will put before [you]323-the audience the view exactly contrary to [his]85-demogorgon . [I]323-the audience do not assert that [I]323-the audience hold this contrary view , but [I]323-the audience state it as well as [I]323-the audience am able , because [I]323-the audience think that it has not been given due consideration . ”[323-the audience] “ This will be warm , ”[83-fred] [Fred]83-fred was heard to murmur with a chuckle , to [an adjacent sister]325-an adjacent sister . [The speaker]306-the speaker looked at [her]306-the speaker notes . “ [I]306-the speaker will read , ”[306-the speaker] [she]306-the speaker said , “ a passage from [Emerson]87-emerson , which states very strikingly the doctrine that [I]306-the speaker am going to oppose . ”[306-the speaker] Hadria [her]306-the speaker paper aslant towards the candle - end , which threw a murky yellow light upon the background of [the garret]293-the garret , contrasting oddly with the thin , clear moonbeams . “ ‘ But the soul contains the event that shall befall it , for the event is only the actualization of its thoughts ; and what [we]3684-we pray to [ourselves]3684-we for is always granted . The event is the print of [your]3685-your form . It fits [you]3685-your like [your]3685-your skin . What [each]3686-each does is proper to [him]3686-each . Events are the children of [his]3686-each mind and body . ’ ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha leant forward . [The members of the Preposterous Society]328-the members of the preposterous society settled into attitudes of attention . [Hadria]211-hadria said that this was a question that could not fail to be of peculiar interest to [them]328-the members of the preposterous society all , who had [their]328-the members of the preposterous society lives before [them]328-the members of the preposterous society , to make or mar . It was an extremely difficult question , for it admitted of no experiment . [One]329-one could never go back in life and try another plan . [One]329-one could never make sure , by such a test , how much circumstance and how much innate ideas had to do with [one]329-one 's disposition . [Emerson]87-emerson insisted that [man]332-man makes [his]332-man circumstance , and history seemed to support that theory . How untoward had been , in appearance , the surroundings of [those who had made all the great movements and done all the great deeds of]333-those who had made all the great movements and done all the great deeds of [the world]334-the world . Let [one]329-one consider the poverty , persecution , the incessant discouragement , and often the tragic end of [[our]336-our greatest benefactors]337-our greatest benefactors . [Christ]88-christ was but one of [the host of the crucified]338-the host of the crucified . In spite of the theory which [the lecturer]339-the lecturer had undertaken to champion , [she]339-the lecturer believed that it was generally [those people who had difficult lives who did the beneficent deeds , and generally [those people who were encouraged and comfortable who went to sleep]341-those people who were encouraged and comfortable who went to sleep , or actively dragged down what [the thinkers and actors]342-the thinkers and actors had piled up . In great things and in small , such was the order of life]340-those people who had difficult lives who did the beneficent deeds , and generally those people who were encouraged and comfortable who went to sleep , or actively dragged down what the thinkers and actors had piled up . in great things and in small , such was the order of life . “ Hear , hear , ”[86-ernest] cried [Ernest]86-ernest , “ [my]86-ernest particular thunder ! ”[86-ernest] “ Wait a minute , ”[339-the lecturer] said [the lecturer]339-the lecturer . “ [I]339-the lecturer am going to annihilate [you]86-ernest with [your]86-ernest particular thunder . ”[339-the lecturer] [She]339-the lecturer paused for a moment , and [her]339-the lecturer eyes rested on the strange white landscape beyond the little group of faces upturned towards [her]339-the lecturer . “ Roughly , [we]336-our may say that [people]3687-people are divided into two orders : first , [the organizers]3688-the organizers , [the able]3689-the able , [those who build , who create cohesion , symmetry , reason , economy]3690-those who build , who create cohesion , symmetry , reason , economy ; and , secondly , [the destroyers]3691-the destroyers , [those who come wandering idly by , and unfasten , undo , relax]3692-those who come wandering idly by , and unfasten , undo , relax , disintegrate all that has been effected by the force and vigilance of [their]3687-people betters . This distinction is carried into even the most trivial things of life . Yet without that organization and coherence , the existence of [the destroyers themselves]3693-the destroyers themselves would become a chaos and a misery . ”[339-the lecturer] The oak table over which [Hadria]211-hadria bent forward towards [[her]211-hadria audience]320-her audience , appeared to be applauding this sentiment vigorously . It rocked to and fro on the uneven floor with great clamour . “ Thus , ”[306-the speaker] [the speaker]306-the speaker went on , “ [these relaxed and derivative people]3694-these relaxed and derivative people are living on the strength of [the strong]3695-the strong . [He]3696-he who is strong must carry with [him]3696-he , as a perpetual burden , [a mass of such pensioners , who are scared and shocked at [his]3696-he rude individuality]3697-a mass of such pensioners , who are scared and shocked at his rude individuality ; and if [he]3696-he should trip or stumble , if [he]3696-he should lose [his]3696-he way in the untrodden paths , in seeking new truth and a broader foundation for the lives of [men]3698-men , then a chorus of censure goes up from millions of little throats . ”[306-the speaker] “ Hear , hear ! ”[83-fred] cried [Algitha]81-algitha and [Fred]83-fred , and the table rocked enthusiastically . “ But when the good things are gained for which [the upholders]3699-the upholders have striven and perhaps given [their]3699-the upholders lives , then there are [no more greedy absorbers of the bounty]3700-no more greedy absorbers of the bounty than these same innumerable little throats . ”[306-the speaker] The table led the chorus of assent . “ And now , ”[339-the lecturer] said [the lecturer]339-the lecturer slowly , ” consider this in relation to the point at issue . [Emerson]87-emerson asserts that circumstance can always be conquered . But is not circumstance , to a large extent , created by [these destroyers]3701-these destroyers , as [I]339-the lecturer have called [them]3701-these destroyers ? Has [not the strongest soul to count with these , who weave the web of adverse conditions , whose dead weight has to be carried , whose work of destruction has to be incessantly repaired]3702-not the strongest soul to count with these , who weave the web of adverse conditions , whose dead weight has to be carried , whose work of destruction has to be incessantly repaired ? Who can dare to say ‘ [I]339-the lecturer am master of [my]339-the lecturer fate , ’ when [he]3696-he does not know how large may be the share of the general burden that will fall to [him]3696-he to drag through life , how great may be the number of these parasites who are living on the moral capital of [[their]3701-these destroyers generation]3703-their generation ? Surely circumstance consists largely in the inertia , the impenetrability of the destroyers . ”[339-the lecturer] [Ernest]86-ernest shewed signs of restiveness . [He]86-ernest shuffled on [his]86-ernest chair , made muttered exclamations . “ Presently , ”[339-the lecturer] said [the lecturer]339-the lecturer reassuringly . “ Or put it in another way , ”[339-the lecturer] [she]339-the lecturer went on . “ [A man]3704-a man may make a thing — circumstance included — but [he]3704-a man is not [a sort of moral spider]3705-a sort of moral spider ; [he]3704-a man ca n't spin it out of [his]3704-a man own inside . [He]3704-a man wants something to make it of . The formative force comes from within , but [he]3704-a man must have material , just as much as [a sculptor]3706-a sculptor must have [his]3706-a sculptor marble before [he]3706-a sculptor can shape [his]3706-a sculptor statue . There is a subtle relation between character and conditions , and it is this relation that determines Fate . Fate is as the statue of [the sculptor]3707-the sculptor . ”[339-the lecturer] “ That 's where [Hadria]211-hadria mainly differs from [you]3708-you , ”[83-fred] said [Fred]83-fred , “ [you]3708-you make the thing absolute ; [Hadria]211-hadria makes it a matter of relation . ”[83-fred] “ Exactly , ”[339-the lecturer] assented [the lecturer]339-the lecturer , catching the remark . “ Difficulties need not be really obstructive to the best development of a character or a power , nor a smooth path always favourable . Obstacles may be of a kind to stimulate [one person]3709-one person and to annihilate another . It is not a question of relative strength between character and circumstance , as [people]3687-people are so fond of asserting . That is mere gibberish . It means nothing . The two things can not be compared , for they are not of the same nature . [They]3711-they ca n't be reduced to a common denominator . ”[339-the lecturer] [Austin]84-austin appreciated this illustration , being head of [[his]84-austin class]349-his class for arithmetic . “ [We]3712-we shall never be able to take a reasonable view of this question till [we]3712-we get rid of that ridiculous phrase , ‘ If the soul is strong enough , it can overcome circumstance . ’ In [a room filled with carbonic acid instead of ordinary air]3713-a room filled with carbonic acid instead of ordinary air , [a giant]3714-a giant would succumb as quickly as [a dwarf]3715-a dwarf , and [his]3714-a giant strength would avail [him]3714-a giant nothing . Indeed , if there is a difference , it is in favour of [the dwarf]3716-the dwarf . ”[86-ernest] [Ernest]86-ernest frowned . This was all high treason against [[his]86-ernest favourite author]350-his favourite author . [He]86-ernest had given [[his]86-ernest sister]351-his sister a copy of [Emerson]87-emerson 's works last Christmas , in the hope that [her]351-his sister views might be enlightened , and this was the disgraceful use [she]351-his sister made of it ! “ Finally , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , smiling defiantly at [[her]211-hadria brother]309-her brother , “ let [us]3717-us put the question shortly thus : Given ( say ) great artistic power , given also a conscience and a strong will , is there any combination of circumstances which might prevent the artistic power ( assuming it to be of the highest order and strength ) from developing and displaying itself , so as to meet with general recognition ? ”[211-hadria] “ No , ”[86-ernest] asserted [Ernest]86-ernest , and there was a hesitating chorus on [his]86-ernest side . “ There seem to [me]211-hadria to be a thousand chances against it , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria continued . “ Artistic power , to begin with , is a sort of weakness in relation to the everyday world , and so , in some respects , is a nice conscience . [I]211-hadria think [Emerson]87-emerson is shockingly unjust . [His]87-emerson beaming optimism is a worship of success disguised under lofty terms . There is nothing to prove that [thousands]3718-thousands have not been swamped by maladjustment of character to circumstance , and [I]211-hadria would even go so far as to suggest that perhaps the very greatest of all are those whom [the world]334-the world has never known , because the present conditions are inharmonious with the very noblest and the very highest qualities . ”[211-hadria] No sooner was the last word uttered than the garret became the scene of the stormiest debate that had ever been recorded in the annals of [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society , [an institution that had lately celebrated [its]3682-the preposterous society fifth anniversary]354-an institution that had lately celebrated its fifth anniversary . [Hadria]211-hadria , fired by opposition , declared that the success of [great people]355-great people was due not simply to [their]355-great people greatness , but to some smaller and commoner quality which brought [them]355-great people in touch with [the majority]356-the majority , and so gave [their]355-great people greatness a chance . At this , there was such a howl of indignation that [Algitha]81-algitha remonstrated . “ [We]3720-we shall be heard , if [you]3721-you do n't take care , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria warned . “ [[My]211-hadria dear]3722-my dear [Algitha]81-algitha , there are [a dozen empty rooms between [us]3720-we]3723-a dozen empty rooms between us and [the inhabited part of [the house]296-the house]3724-the inhabited part of the house , not to mention the fact that [we]3720-we are a storey above [everyone]3726-everyone except the ghosts , so [I]211-hadria think [you]81-algitha may compose [yourself]81-algitha . ”[211-hadria] However , the excited voices were hushed a little as the discussion continued . One of the chief charms of [the institution]357-the institution , in the eyes of [the members of [the Society]359-the society]358-the members of the society , was [its]357-the institution secrecy . [The family]360-the family , though united by ties of warm affection to [[their]360-the family parents]361-their parents , did not look for encouragement from [them]360-the family in this direction . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton was too exclusively scientific in [his]89-mr. fullerton bent of thought , to sympathize with the kind of speculation in which [[his]89-mr. fullerton children]362-his children delighted , while [[their]362-his children mother]363-their mother looked with mingled pride and alarm at these outbreaks of individuality on the part of [[her]363-their mother daughters]364-her daughters , for whom [she]363-their mother craved the honours of [the social world]365-the social world . In [this out - of - the - way district]366-this out - of - the - way district , [society]367-society smiled upon conformity , and glared vindictively at the faintest sign of spontaneous thinking . Cleverness of execution , as in music , tennis , drawing , was forgiven , even commended ; but originality , though of the mildest sort , created the same agonizing disturbance in the select circle , as the sight of a crucifix is wo nt to produce upon [the father of Evil]368-the father of evil . Yet by some freak of fortune , [the whole family]369-the whole family at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee had shewn obstinate symptoms of individuality from [their]369-the whole family childhood , and , what was more distressing , the worst cases occurred in [the girls]370-the girls . In the debate just recorded , that took place on [Algitha]81-algitha 's twenty - second birthday , [Ernest]86-ernest had been [[Hadria]211-hadria 's principal opponent]371-hadria 's principal opponent , but [the others]303-the others had also taken the field against [her]81-algitha . “ [You]81-algitha have the easier cause to champion , ”[363-their mother] [she]363-their mother said , when there was a momentary lull , “ for all [your]81-algitha evidences can be pointed to and counted whereas [mine]363-their mother , poor things — pale hypotheses , nameless peradventures — lie in forgotten [church - yards]3727-church - yards — unthought of , unthanked , untrumpeted , and all [their]303-the others tragedy is lost in the everlasting silence . ”[363-their mother] “ [You]81-algitha will never make [people]3687-people believe in what might have been , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . “ [I]81-algitha do n't expect to . ”[81-algitha] [Hadria]211-hadria was standing by the window looking out over [the glimmering fields]373-the glimmering fields and [the shrouded white hills]374-the shrouded white hills . “ Life is as white and as unsympathetic as this , ”[363-their mother] [she]363-their mother said dreamily . “ [We]3729-our just dance [our]3729-our reel in [[our]3729-our garret]3730-our garret , and then it is all over ; and whether [we]3729-our do the steps as [our]3729-our fancy would have them , or a little otherwise , because of the uneven floor , or tired feet , or for lack of chance to learn the steps — heavens and earth , what does it matter ? ”[363-their mother] “ [Hadria]211-hadria ! ”[375-an astonished chorus] exclaimed [an astonished chorus]375-an astonished chorus . The sentiment was so entirely unlike any that [the ardent President of the Society]376-the ardent president of the society had ever been known to express before , that [brothers]377-brothers and [sisters]378-sisters crowded up to enquire into the cause of the unusual mood . “ Oh , it is only the moonlight that has got into [my]363-their mother head , ”[363-their mother] [she]363-their mother said , flinging back the cloudy black hair from [her]363-their mother brow . [Algitha]81-algitha 's firm , clear voice vibrated through [the room]379-the room . “ But [I]363-their mother think it matters very much whether [one]329-one 's task is done well or ill , ”[363-their mother] [she]363-their mother said , “ and [nobody]3732-nobody has taught [me]363-their mother to wish to make solid use of [my]363-their mother life so much as [you]211-hadria have , [Hadria]211-hadria . What possesses [you]211-hadria to - night ? ”[363-their mother] “ [I]363-their mother tell [you]211-hadria , the moonlight . ”[363-their mother] “ And something else . ”[363-their mother] “ Well , it struck [me]363-their mother , as [I]363-their mother stood there with [my]363-their mother head full of what [we]3733-we have been discussing , that the conditions of [a girl]3734-a girl 's life of [[our]3733-we own class]3735-our own class are pleasant enough , but they are stifling , absolutely stifling ; and not all the Emersons in [the world]334-the world will convince [me]363-their mother to the contrary . [Emerson]87-emerson never was [a girl]3734-a girl ! ”[363-their mother] There was a laugh . “ No ; but [he]87-emerson was [a great man]3738-a great man , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . “ Then [he]87-emerson must have had something of [the girl]3739-the girl in [him]87-emerson ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [I]211-hadria did n't mean that , but perhaps it is true . ”[211-hadria] “ If [he]87-emerson had been [a girl]3734-a girl , [he]87-emerson would have known that conditions do count hideously in [one]329-one 's life . [I]363-their mother think that there are more ‘ destroyers ’ to be carried about and pampered in this department of existence than in any other ( material conditions being equal ) . ”[363-their mother] “ Do [you]86-ernest mean that [a girl]3734-a girl would have more difficulty in bringing [her]3734-a girl power to maturity and getting it recognized than [a man]3704-a man would have ? ”[83-fred] asked [Fred]83-fred . “ Yes ; the odds are too heavy . ”[83-fred] “ A second - rate talent perhaps , ”[86-ernest] [Ernest]86-ernest admitted , “ but not a really big one . ”[86-ernest] “ [I]211-hadria should exactly reverse that statement , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ The greater the power and the finer [its]3744-its quality , the greater the inharmony between the nature and the conditions ; therefore the more powerful the leverage against it . [A small comfortable talent]3745-a small comfortable talent might hold its own , where [a larger one]3746-a larger one would succumb . That is where [I]211-hadria think [you]3747-you make [your]3747-you big mistake , in forgetting that the greatness of the power may serve to make the greatness of the obstacles . ”[211-hadria] “ So much the better for [me]81-algitha then , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha , with a touch of satire ; “ for [I]81-algitha have no idea of being beaten . ”[81-algitha] [She]81-algitha folded [her]81-algitha arms in a serene attitude of determination . “ Surely it only wants a little force of will to enable [you]3747-you to occupy [your]3747-you life in the manner [you]3747-you think best , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . “ That is often impossible for [a girl]3734-a girl , because prejudice and custom are against [her]3734-a girl . ”[86-ernest] “ But [she]3734-a girl ought to despise prejudice and custom , ”[380-the brother] cried [the brother]380-the brother , nobly . “ So [she]3734-a girl often would ; but then [she]3734-a girl has to tear through so many living ties that restrain [her]3734-a girl freedom . ”[380-the brother] [Algitha]81-algitha drew [herself]81-algitha up . “ If [one]329-one is unjustly restrained , ”[81-algitha] [she]81-algitha said , “ it is perfectly right to brave the infliction of the sort of pain that [people]3687-people feel only because [they]3687-people unfairly object to [one]329-one 's liberty of action . ”[81-algitha] “ But what a frightful piece of circumstance that is to encounter , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “ to have to buy the mere right to one 's liberty by cutting through prejudices that are twined in with the very heart - strings of those [one loves]3752-one loves ! Ah ! that particular obstacle has held many [a woman]3753-a woman helpless and suffering , like some wretched insect pinned alive to a board throughout a miserable lifetime ! What would [Emerson]87-emerson say to these cases ? That ‘ Nature magically suits [the man]3754-the man to [his]3754-the man fortunes by making these the fruit of [his]3754-the man character ’ ? Pooh ! [I]211-hadria think Nature more often makes [a man]3704-a man 's fortunes a veritable shirt of Nessus which burns and clings , and finally kills [him]3754-the man with anguish ! ”[211-hadria] ONCE more [the old stronghold of [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee]381-the old stronghold of dunaghee , inured for centuries to the changes of the elements , received the day 's greeting . The hues of dawn tinged the broad hill pastures , or “ airds , ”[81-algitha] as they were called , round about [the Tower of the Winds]382-the tower of the winds . [No one]383-no one was abroad yet in [the silent lands]384-the silent lands , except perhaps [a shepherd]385-a shepherd , tending [his]385-a shepherd flock . [The little farmstead of [Craw Gill]2-craw gill]386-the little farmstead of craw gill , that [lay at a distance of about a couple of miles down the valley , on the side of a ravine]387-lay at a distance of about a couple of miles down the valley , on the side of a ravine , was apparently dead asleep . [Cruachmore]3-cruachmore , [the nearest upland farm]388-the nearest upland farm , could scarcely be seen from [the stronghold]389-the stronghold . [The old tower]390-the old tower had been added to , perhaps two hundred years ago ; [a rectangular block projecting from the corner of [the original building]392-the original building]391-a rectangular block projecting from the corner of the original building , and then a second erection at right angles to the first , so as to form three sides of [an irregular courtyard]393-an irregular courtyard . This arrangement afforded some shelter from the winds which seldom ceased to blow in [these high regions]394-these high regions . [The spot]395-the spot had borne the same reputation for centuries , as the name of [the old tower]390-the old tower implied . [The Tower of the Winds]382-the tower of the winds stood desolately , in the midst of [a wide - eyed agricultural country]398-a wide - eyed agricultural country , and was approached only by a sort of farm track that ran up [hill and down dale]399-hill and down dale , in a most erratic course , to [the distant main road]400-the distant main road . [The country]401-the country was not mountainous , though [it]401-the country lay in [a northern district of [Scotland]4-scotland]402-a northern district of scotland ; [it]401-the country was bleak and solitary , with [vast bare fields of grass or corn]403-vast bare fields of grass or corn ; and below in [the valley]404-the valley , [a river that rushed sweeping over [its]405-a river that rushed sweeping over its rough bed rough bed]405-a river that rushed sweeping over its rough bed , silent where it ran deep , but chattering busily in the shallows . Here was verdure to one 's heart 's content ; [the whole country]406-the whole country being a singular mixture of bleakness on [the heights]407-the heights , and woodland richness in [the valleys]408-the valleys ; bitterly cold in the winter months , when the light deserted [the uplands]409-the uplands ridiculously early in the afternoon , leaving long mysterious hours that held [the great silent stretches of field]410-the great silent stretches of field and [hillside]411-hillside in shadow : a circumstance , which had , perhaps , not been without its influence in the forming of [Hadria]211-hadria 's character . [She]211-hadria , more than the others , seemed to have absorbed the spirit of the northern twilights . It was [her]211-hadria custom to wander alone over [the broad spaces of [the hills]413-the hills]412-the broad spaces of the hills , watching the sun set behind them , the homeward flight of the birds , the approach of darkness and the rising of the stars . Every instinct that was born in [her]211-hadria with [her]211-hadria Celtic blood — which lurked still in [the family]360-the family to the confounding of its fortunes — was fostered by the mystery and wildness of [her]211-hadria surroundings . Dawn and sunset had peculiar attractions for [her]211-hadria . Although [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society had not separated until unusually late on the previous night , [the President]416-the president was up and abroad on this exquisite morning , summoned by some “ message of range and of sweep — ”[211-hadria] to [the flushing stretches of pasture]417-the flushing stretches of pasture and [the windy hillside]418-the windy hillside . In spite of the view that [Hadria]211-hadria had expounded in [her]211-hadria capacity of [lecturer]419-lecturer , [she]211-hadria had an inner sense that somehow , after all , the will can perform astonishing feats in Fate 's despite . [Her]211-hadria intellect , rather than [her]211-hadria heart , had opposed the philosophy of [Emerson]87-emerson . [Her]211-hadria sentiment recoiled from admitting the possibility of such tragedy as [her]211-hadria expressed belief implied . This morning , the wonder and the grandeur of the dawn supplied arguments to faith . If the best in human nature were always to be hunted down and extinguished , if the efforts to rise in the scale of being , to bring gifts instead of merely absorbing benefits , were only by a rare combination of chances to escape the doom of annihilation , where was one to turn to for hope , or for a motive for effort ? How could one reconcile the marvellous beauty of [the universe]420-the universe , the miracles of colour , form , and , above all , of music , with such a chaotic moral condition , and such unlovely laws in favour of dulness , cowardice , callousness , cruelty ? [One]329-one aspired to be [an upholder and not a destroyer]422-an upholder and not a destroyer , but if it were a useless pain and a bootless venture — ? [Hadria]211-hadria tried to find some proof of the happier philosophy that would satisfy [her]211-hadria intellect , but it refused to be comforted . Yet as [she]211-hadria wandered in the rosy light over [the awakening fields]423-the awakening fields , [her]211-hadria heart sang within [her]211-hadria . [The world]334-the world was exquisite , life was a rapture ! [She]211-hadria could take existence in [her]211-hadria hands and form and fashion it at [her]211-hadria will , obviously , easily ; [her]211-hadria strength yearned for the task . Yet all the time , the importunate intellect kept insisting that feeling was deceptive , that health and youth and the freshness of the morning spoke in [her]211-hadria , and not reason or experience . Feeling was left untouched nevertheless . It was impossible to stifle the voices that prophesied golden things . Life was all before [her]211-hadria [she]211-hadria was full of vigour and longing and good will ; [the world]334-the world stretched forth as a fair territory , with magical pathways leading up to [dizzy mountain tops]426-dizzy mountain tops . With visions such as these , [the members of the Preposterous Society]328-the members of the preposterous society had fired [their]328-the members of the preposterous society imaginations , and gained impetus for [their]328-the members of the preposterous society various efforts and [their]328-the members of the preposterous society various ambitions . [Hadria]211-hadria had been among the most hopeful of [the party]428-the party , and had pointed to the loftier visions , and the more impersonal aims . Circumstance must give way , compromise was wrong ; [we]429-we had but a short time in [this world]430-this world , and mere details and prejudices must not be allowed to interfere with [one]329-one 's right to live to the utmost of one 's scope . But it was easier to state a law than to obey it ; easier to inspire [others]432-others with faith than to hold fast to it [oneself]329-one . The time for taking matters in one 's own hands had scarcely come . [A girl]3734-a girl was so helpless , so tied by custom . [One]329-one could engage , so far , only in guerilla warfare with [the enemy]435-the enemy , who lurked everywhere in ambush , ready to harass [the wayfarers with incessant petty attack]436-the wayfarers with incessant petty attack . But life must have something more to offer than this — life with its myriad interests , dramas , mysteries , arts , poetries , delights ! By [the river]437-the river , where [it]437-the river had worn for [itself]437-the river [a narrow ravine]438-a narrow ravine , with steep rocky sides or “ clints , ”[439-they] as [they]439-they were called , [several short tunnels or passages]440-several short tunnels or passages had been cut in places where the rock projected as far as the bank of [the river]437-the river , which was followed in [its]437-the river windings by a narrow footway , leading to [the farmstead of [Craw Gill]2-craw gill]442-the farmstead of craw gill . In one part , a series of [such tunnels , with intervals of open pathway]443-such tunnels , with intervals of open pathway , occurred in picturesque fashion , causing a singular effect of light and shade . As [Hadria]211-hadria stood admiring the glow of the now fully - risen sun , upon the wall of rock that rose beyond the opening of [the tunnel which [she]211-hadria had just passed through]444-the tunnel which she had just passed through , [she]211-hadria heard footsteps advancing along [the riverside path]445-the riverside path , and guessed that [Algitha]81-algitha and [Ernest]86-ernest had come to fetch [her]211-hadria , or to join in any absurd project that [she]211-hadria might have in view . Although [Algitha]81-algitha was two - and - twenty , and [Hadria]211-hadria only a year younger , [they]446-they were still guilty at times of wild escapades , with the connivance of [[their]446-they brothers]447-their brothers . Walks or rides at sunrise were ordinary occurrences in [the family]360-the family , and in summer , bathing in [the river]437-the river was a favourite amusement . “ [I]211-hadria thought [I]211-hadria recognised [your]450-the two figures footsteps , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , as [the two figures]450-the two figures appeared at the mouth of [the tunnel]451-the tunnel , the low rays of the sun lighting [them]450-the two figures up , for a moment , as [they]450-the two figures turned the sharp bend of [the narrow path]452-the narrow path , before entering the shadow . A quantity of brown dead leaves were strewn upon the floor of [the rock - passage]453-the rock - passage , blown in by the wind from [the pathway]454-the pathway at each end , or perhaps through the opening in the middle of [the tunnel]451-the tunnel that looked out upon [the rushing river]456-the rushing river . A willow - tree had found footing in the crevice of the rock just outside , and its branches , thinly decked with pale yellow leaves , dipped into the water just in front of the opening . When the wind blew off [the river]437-the river it would sweep the leaves of the willow into [the tunnel]451-the tunnel . “ Let 's make a bonfire , ”[86-ernest] suggested [Ernest]86-ernest . [They]450-the two figures collected the withered harvest of the winds upon [the cavern]459-the cavern floor , in a big brown heap , and then [Ernest]86-ernest struck a match and set light to it . [Algitha]81-algitha , in a large black cloak , stood over it with a hazel stick — like a wand — stirring and heaping on the fuel , as the mass began to smoulder and to send forth a thick white smoke that gradually filled [the cavern]459-the cavern , curling up into the rocky roof and swirling round and out by the square - cut mouth , to be caught there by the slight wind and illumined by the sun , which poured down upon the soft coils of the smoke , in so strange a fashion , as to call forth a cry of wonder from [the onlookers]461-the onlookers . Standing in the interval of open pathway between [the two rock - passages]462-the two rock - passages , and looking back at [the fire - lit cavern]463-the fire - lit cavern , with [its]463-the fire - lit cavern black shadows and flickering flame - colours , [Hadria]211-hadria was bewildered by what appeared to [her]211-hadria a veritable magic vision , beautiful beyond anything that [she]211-hadria had ever met in dream . [She]211-hadria stood still to watch , with a real momentary doubt as to whether [she]211-hadria were awake . [The figures , stooping over the burning heap]464-the figures , stooping over the burning heap , moved occasionally across the darkness , looking like [a witch]465-a witch and [her]465-a witch familiar spirit , who were conjuring , by uncanny arts , a vision of life , on the strange , white , clean - cut patch of smoke that was defined by the sunlit entrance to [the tunnel]451-the tunnel . [The witch]467-the witch stirred , and [her]465-a witch familiar added fuel , while behind [them]450-the two figures the smoke , rising and curdling , formed the mysterious background of light : opaque , and yet in a state of incessant movement , as of some white raging fire , thinner and more deadly than any ordinary earthly element , that seemed to sicken and flicker in the blast of a furnace , and then rushed upwards , and coiled and rolled across [the tunnel]451-the tunnel 's mouth . Presently , as a puff of wind swept away part of the smoke , a miraculous tinge of rosy colour appeared , changing , as one caught it , into gold , and presently to a milky blue , then liquid green , and a thousand intermediate tints corresponding to the altering density of the smoke — and then ! [Hadria]211-hadria caught [her]211-hadria breath — the blue and the red and the gold melted and moved and formed , under the incantation , into a marvellous vision of [distant lands]469-distant lands , [purple mountains]470-purple mountains , fair white cities , and wide kingdoms , so many , so great , that the imaginltion staggered at the vastness revealed , and offered , as it seemed , to [him]471-him who could grasp and perceive it . Among [those blue deeps]472-those blue deeps and [faint innumerable mountaintops]473-faint innumerable mountaintops , caught through a soft mist that continually moved and lifted , thinned and thickened , with changing tints , all the secrets , all the hopes , all the powers and splendours , of life lay hidden ; and the beauty of the vision was as the essence of poetry and of music — of all that is lovely in the world of art , and in [the world of the emotions]474-the world of the emotions . The question that had been debated so hotly and so often , as to the relation of the good and the beautiful , art and ethics , seemed to be answered by this bewildering revelation of sunlit smoke , playing across the face of a purple - tinted rock , and a few feet of grass - edged pathway . “ Come and see what visions [you]471-him have conjured up , [O witch]3756-o witch ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria . [Algitha]81-algitha gave a startled exclamation , as the smoke thinned and revealed that bewildering glimpse of [distant lands]469-distant lands , half seen , as through the atmosphere of a dream . [An exquisite city]476-an exquisite city , with [slender towers and temples]477-slender towers and temples , flashed , for a moment , through the mist curtain . “ If life is like that , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said at length , drawing a long breath , “ nothing on [this earth]3757-this earth ought to persuade [us]3758-us to forgo it ; [no one]383-no one has the right to hold one back from its possession . ”[211-hadria] “ [No one]383-no one , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria ; “ but [everyone]3726-everyone will try ! ”[211-hadria] “ Let [them]3726-everyone try , ”[81-algitha] returned [Algitha]81-algitha defiantly . [ERNEST]86-ernest and [[his]86-ernest two sisters]478-his two sisters walked homeward along [the banks of [the river]437-the river]479-the banks of the river , and thence up by a winding path to [the top of [the cliffs]482-the cliffs]481-the top of the cliffs . It was mild weather , and [they]483-they decided to pause in [the little temple of classic design]484-the little temple of classic design , which [some ancient owner of [the Drumgarran estate]486-the drumgarran estate]485-some ancient owner of the drumgarran estate , touched with a desire for the exquisiteness of Greek outline , had built on [a promontory of the rocks]487-a promontory of the rocks , among rounded masses of wild foliage ; a spot that commanded one of [the most beautiful reaches of [the river]437-the river]488-the most beautiful reaches of the river . The scene had something of classic perfection and serenity . “ [I]86-ernest admit , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest in response to some remark of [one of [[his]86-ernest sisters]491-his sisters]490-one of his sisters , “ [I]86-ernest admit that [I]86-ernest should not like to stay [here]3762-here during all the best years of [my]86-ernest life , without prospect of widening [my]86-ernest experience ; only as a matter of fact , [the world]334-the world is somewhat different from anything that [you]3764-you imagine , and by no means would [you]3764-you find it all beer and skittles . [Your]3764-you smoke and sun - vision is not to be trusted . ”[86-ernest] “ But think of the pride and joy of being able to speak in that tone of experience ! ”[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria mockingly . “ [One]329-one has to pay for experience , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest , shaking [his]86-ernest head and ignoring [her]211-hadria taunt . “ [I]211-hadria think [one]329-one has to pay more heavily for inexperience , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . “ Not if [one]329-one never comes in contact with [the world]334-the world . [Girls]3769-girls are protected from the realities of life so long as [they]3769-girls remain at [home]3770-home , and that is worth something after all . ”[211-hadria] [Algitha]81-algitha snorted . “ [I]81-algitha do n't know what [you]86-ernest are pleased to call realities , [[my]81-algitha dear]3722-my dear [Ernest]86-ernest , but [I]81-algitha can assure [you]86-ernest there are plenty of unpleasant facts , in this protected life of [ours]3772-ours . ”[81-algitha] “ [Nobody]3732-nobody can expect to escape unpleasant facts , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . “ Then for heaven 's sake , let [us]3772-ours purchase with [them]3774-them something worth having ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria cried . “ Hear , hear ! ”[81-algitha] assented [Algitha]81-algitha . “ Unpleasant facts being a foregone conclusion , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria added , “ the point to aim at obviously is interesting facts — and plenty of them . ”[211-hadria] [Ernest]86-ernest flicked a pebble off the parapet of the balustrade of [the little temple]492-the little temple , and watched it fall , with a silent splash , into [the river]437-the river . “ [I]86-ernest never met [girls]3769-girls before , who wanted to come out of [their]3769-girls cotton - wool , ”[86-ernest] [he]86-ernest observed . “ [I]86-ernest thought [girls]3769-girls loved cotton - wool . [They]3769-girls always seem to . ”[86-ernest] “ [Girls]90-girls seem an astonishing number of things that [they]90-girls are not , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ especially to [men]3698-men . [A poor benighted man]3778-a poor benighted man might as well try to get on to confidential terms with [the Sphinx]3779-the sphinx , as to learn the real thoughts and wishes of [a girl]3734-a girl . ”[211-hadria] “ [You]351-his sister two are exceptional , [you]351-his sister see , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . “ Oh , [everybody]3781-everybody 's exceptional , if [you]86-ernest only knew it ! ”[351-his sister] exclaimed [[his]86-ernest sister]351-his sister . “ [Girls]3769-girls , ”[351-his sister] [she]351-his sister went on to assert , “ are stuffed with certain stereotyped sentiments from [their]3769-girls infancy , and when that painful process is completed , [intelligent philosophers]3783-intelligent philosophers come and smile upon [the victims]3784-the victims , and point to [them]3784-the victims as proofs of the intentions of Nature regarding [our]3785-our sex , admirable examples of the unvarying instincts of [the feminine creature]3786-the feminine creature . In fact , ”[351-his sister] [Hadria]211-hadria added with a laugh , “ it 's as if [the trainer of that troop of performing poodles that [we]3785-our saw]3787-the trainer of that troop of performing poodles that we saw , the other day , at [Ballochcoil]5-ballochcoil , were to assure [the spectators]3788-the spectators that the amiable animals were inspired , from birth , by a heaven - implanted yearning to jump through hoops , and walk about on [their]3769-girls hind legs — ”[211-hadria] “ But there are such things as natural instincts , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . “ There are such things as acquired tricks , ”[86-ernest] returned [Hadria]211-hadria . A loud shout , accompanied by the barking of several dogs , announced the approach of [the two younger boys]495-the two younger boys . [Boys]496-boys and dogs had been taking [their]495-the two younger boys morning bath in [the river]437-the river . “ [You]495-the two younger boys have broken in upon a most interesting discourse , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . “ [Hadria]211-hadria was really coming out . ”[86-ernest] This led to a general uproar . When peace was restored , the conversation went on in desultory fashion . [Ernest]86-ernest and [Hadria]211-hadria fell apart into a more serious talk . [These two]498-these two had always been “ chums , ”[498-these two] from the time when [they]498-these two used to play at building houses of bricks on [the nursery floor]499-the nursery floor . There was deep and true affection between [them]498-these two . The day broke into splendour , and the warm rays , rounding the edge of [the eastward rock]500-the eastward rock , poured straight into [the little temple]492-the little temple . Below and around on the cliff - sides , the rich foliage of holly and dwarf oak , ivy , and rowan with its burning berries , was transformed into a mass of warm colour and shining surfaces . “ What always bewilders [me]211-hadria , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria said , bending over the balustrade among the ivy , “ is the enormous gulf between what might be and what is in human life . Look at [the world]334-the world — life 's most sumptuous stage — and look at life ! The one , splendid , exquisite , varied , generous , rich beyond description ; [the other , poor , thin , dull , monotonous , niggard , distressful]3790-the other , poor , thin , dull , monotonous , niggard , distressful — is that necessary ? ”[211-hadria] “ But all lives are not like that , ”[83-fred] objected [Fred]83-fred . “ [I]211-hadria speak only from [my]211-hadria own narrow experience , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ Oh , [she]211-hadria is thinking , as usual , of that unfortunate [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon ! ”[86-ernest] cried [Earnest]86-ernest . “ Of [her]211-hadria , and [the rest of the average , typical sort of people]3791-the rest of the average , typical sort of people that [I]86-ernest know , ”[86-ernest] [Hadria]211-hadria admitted . “ [I]211-hadria wish to heaven [I]211-hadria had a wider knowledge to speak from . ”[211-hadria] “ If [one]329-one is to believe what [one]329-one hears and reads , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha , “ a life must be full of sorrow indeed . ”[81-algitha] “ But putting aside the big sorrows , ”[313-her sister] said [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister , “ the ordinary every day existence that would be called prosperous , seems to [me]313-her sister to be dull and stupid to a tragic extent . ”[313-her sister] “ [The Gordons of]92-the gordons [Drumgarran]6-drumgarran once more ! [I]83-fred confess [I]83-fred ca n't see anything particularly tragic there , ”[83-fred] observed [Fred]83-fred , whose memory recalled troops of [stalwart young persons in flannels , engaged for hours , in sending a ball from one side of a net to the other]503-stalwart young persons in flannels , engaged for hours , in sending a ball from one side of a net to the other . “ It is more than tragic ; it is disgusting ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria with a shiver . [Algitha]81-algitha drew [herself]81-algitha together . [She]81-algitha turned to [[her]81-algitha eldest brother]504-her eldest brother . “ Look here , [Ernest]86-ernest ; [you]86-ernest said just now that [girls]3769-girls were shielded from the realities of life . Yet [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon was handed over by [[her]91-mrs. gordon protectors]3795-her protectors , when [she]91-mrs. gordon was little more than [a school - girl]3796-a school - girl , without knowledge , without any sort of resource or power of facing destiny , to — well , to the hateful realities of the life that [she]91-mrs. gordon has led now for over twenty years . There is nothing to win general sympathy in this case , for [Mr. Gordon]93-mr. gordon is good and kind ; but oh , think of the existence that [a ‘ protected , ’ carefully brought - up girl]3797-a ‘ protected , ’ carefully brought - up girl may be launched into ; before [she]3797-a ‘ protected , ’ carefully brought - up girl knows what [she]3797-a ‘ protected , ’ carefully brought - up girl is pledged to , or what [her]3797-a ‘ protected , ’ carefully brought - up girl ideas of life may be ! If that is what [you]3798-you call protection , for heaven 's sake let [us]3799-us remain defenceless . ”[81-algitha] [Fred]83-fred and [Ernest]86-ernest accused [[their]505-their elder sister]506-their elder sister of having been converted by [Hadria]211-hadria . [Algitha]81-algitha , honest and courageous in big things and in small , at once acknowledged the source of [her]81-algitha ideas . Not so long ago , [Algitha]81-algitha had differed from [the daughters of [the neighbouring houses]508-the neighbouring houses]507-the daughters of the neighbouring houses , rather in force of character than in sentiment . [She]81-algitha had followed the usual aims with unusual success , giving unalloyed satisfaction to [[her]81-algitha proud mother]509-her proud mother . [Algitha]81-algitha had taken it as a matter of course that [she]81-algitha would some day marry , and have [a house of [her]81-algitha own to reign in]510-a house of her own to reign in . [A home]511-a home , not [a husband]512-a husband , was the important matter , and [Algitha]81-algitha had trusted to [her]81-algitha attractions to make a good marriage ; that is , to obtain extensive regions for [her]81-algitha activities . [She]81-algitha craved a roomy stage for [her]81-algitha drama , and obviously there was only one method of obtaining it , and even that method was but dubious . But [Hadria]211-hadria had undermined this matter of fact , take - things - as - [you]513-you - find - [them]514-them view , and set [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister 's pride on the track . That master - passion once aroused in the new direction , [Algitha]81-algitha was ready to defend [her]81-algitha dignity as [a woman]3753-a woman , and as [a human being , to the death]517-a human being , to the death . [Hadria]211-hadria felt as [a magician]518-a magician might feel , who has conjured up spirits henceforth beyond [his]518-a magician control ; for obviously , [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister 's whole life would be altered by this change of sentiment , and , alas , [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's hopes must be disappointed . [The laird of [Clarenoc]7-clarenoc]521-the laird of clarenoc — [a fine property]522-a fine property , of which [Algitha]81-algitha might have been [mistress]523-mistress — had received polite discouragement , much to [his]521-the laird of clarenoc surprise and that of [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood . Even [Ernest]86-ernest , who was by no means worldly , questioned the wisdom of [[his]86-ernest sister]351-his sister 's decision ; for [the laird of [Clarenoc]7-clarenoc]521-the laird of clarenoc was [a good fellow]527-a good fellow , and after all , let [them]528-them talk as [they]528-them liked , what was to become of [a girl]3734-a girl unless [she]3734-a girl married ? This morning 's conversation therefore touched closely on burning topics . “ [[Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's people]3800-mrs. gordon 's people meant it for the best , [I]86-ernest suppose , ”[86-ernest] [Ernest]86-ernest observed , “ when [they]3800-mrs. gordon 's people married [her]3734-a girl to [a good man with a fine property]3801-a good man with a fine property . ”[86-ernest] “ That is just the ghastly part of it ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria ; “ from ferocious enemies [a girl]3734-a girl might defend [herself]3734-a girl , but what is [she]3734-a girl to do against the united efforts of [devoted friends]3803-devoted friends ? ”[211-hadria] “ [I]86-ernest do n't suppose [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon is aware that [she]3734-a girl is so ill - used ! ”[86-ernest] “ Another gruesome circumstance ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , with a half laugh ; “ for that only proves that [her]3734-a girl life has dulled [her]3734-a girl self - respect , and destroyed [her]3734-a girl pride . ”[211-hadria] “ But , [[my]86-ernest dear]3722-my dear , [every woman]3805-every woman is in the same predicament , if predicament it be ! ”[86-ernest] “ What a consolation ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed , “ all the foxes have lost [their]3803-devoted friends tails ! ”[211-hadria] “ It may be illogical , but [people]3687-people generally are immensely comforted by that circumstance . ”[86-ernest] The conversation waxed warmer and more personal . [Fred]83-fred took a conservative view of the question . [He]530-he thought that there were instincts implanted by Nature , which inspired [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon with a yearning for exactly the sort of existence that fate had assigned to [her]91-mrs. gordon . [Algitha]81-algitha , who had been the recipient of [that lady]531-that lady 's tragic confidences , broke into a shout of laughter . “ Well , [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins says — ”[81-algitha] This name was also greeted with a yell of derision . “ [I]83-fred do n't see why [[you]3722-my dear [girls]3769-girls]3807-you girls always scoff so at [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , ”[83-fred] said [Fred]83-fred , slightly aggrieved , “ [he]94-harold wilkins is generally thought a lot of by [girls]3769-girls . [All [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's sisters]3810-all mrs. gordon 's sisters adore [him]94-harold wilkins . ”[83-fred] “ [He]94-harold wilkins needs [no further worshippers]3811-no further worshippers , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . [Fred]83-fred was asked to repeat the words of [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , but to soften them down if too severe . “ [He]94-harold wilkins laughs at [your]3722-my dear pet ideas , ”[83-fred] said [Fred]83-fred ruthlessly . “ Break it gently , [Fred]83-fred , gently . ”[83-fred] “ [He]94-harold wilkins thinks that [a true woman]3812-a true woman esteems it [her]3812-a true woman highest privilege to — well , to be like [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon . ”[211-hadria] “ [Wise and learned youth]3813-wise and learned youth ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , resting [her]211-hadria chin on [her]211-hadria hand , and peering up into the blue sky , above [the temple]532-the temple . “ [Fool]3814-fool ! ”[81-algitha] exclaimed [Algitha]81-algitha . “ [He]94-harold wilkins says , ”[83-fred] continued [Fred]83-fred , determined not to spare those who were so overbearing in [their]533-their scorn , “ [he]94-harold wilkins says that [girls who have ideas like [yours]3816-you]3815-girls who have ideas like yours will never get [any fellow]3817-any fellow to marry [them]3815-girls who have ideas like yours . ”[83-fred] Laughter loud and long greeted this announcement . “ Laughter , ”[83-fred] observed [Fred]83-fred , when [he]534-he could make [himself]534-he heard , “ is among the simplest forms of argument . Does this merry outburst imply that [you]3816-you do n't care a button whether [you]3816-you are able to get [some one]3818-some one to marry [you]3816-you or not ? ”[83-fred] “ It does , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . “ Well , so [I]83-fred said to [Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , as a matter of fact , with [my]83-fred nose in the air , on [your]94-harold wilkins behalf , and [Wilkins]94-harold wilkins replied , ‘ Oh , it 's all very well while [girls]3769-girls are young and good - looking to be so high and mighty , but some day , when [they]3769-girls are left out in the cold , and all [[their]3769-girls friends]3820-their friends married , [they]3769-girls may sing a different tune . ’ Feeling there was something in this remark , ”[83-fred] [Fred]83-fred continued , “ [I]83-fred raised [my]83-fred nose two inches higher , and adopted the argument that [I]83-fred also resort to in extremis . [I]83-fred laughed . ‘ Well , [[my]83-fred dear fellow]3821-my dear fellow , ’ [Wilkins]94-harold wilkins observed calmly , ‘ [I]83-fred mean no offence , but what on earth is [a girl]3734-a girl to do with [herself]3734-a girl if [she]3734-a girl does n't marry ? ’ ”[83-fred] “ What did [you]94-harold wilkins reply ? ”[86-ernest] asked [Ernest]86-ernest with curiosity . “ Oh , [I]81-algitha said that was an unimportant detail , and changed the subject . ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha was still scornful , but [Hadria]211-hadria looked meditative . “ [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins has a practical mind , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria observed . “ After all , [he]94-harold wilkins is right , when [you]94-harold wilkins come to consider it . ”[211-hadria] “ [Hadria]211-hadria ! ”[313-her sister] remonstrated [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister , in dismay . “ [We]3823-we may as well be candid , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ There is uncommonly little that [a girl]3734-a girl can do ( or rather that [people]3687-people will let [her]3734-a girl do ) unless [she]3734-a girl marries , and that is why [she]3734-a girl so often does marry as a mere matter of business . But [I]211-hadria wish [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins would remember that fact , instead of insisting that it is [our]3823-we inherent and particular nature that urges [us]3823-we , one and all , to the career of [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon . ”[211-hadria] [Algitha]81-algitha was obviously growing more and more ruffled . [Fred]83-fred tried in vain to soothe [her]81-algitha feelings . [He]536-he joked , but [she]81-algitha refused to see the point . [She]81-algitha would not admit that [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins had facts on [his]94-harold wilkins side . “ If [one]329-one simply made up [one]329-one 's mind to walk through all the hampering circumstances , who or what could stop one ? ”[81-algitha] [she]81-algitha asked . “ [Algitha]81-algitha has evidently got some desperate plan in [her]81-algitha head for making mincemeat of circumstances , ”[83-fred] cried [Fred]83-fred , little guessing that [he]536-he had stated the exact truth . “ Do [you]81-algitha remember that [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon [herself]91-mrs. gordon waged a losing battle in early days , incredible as it may appear ? ”[211-hadria] asked [Hadria]211-hadria . [Algitha]81-algitha nodded slowly , [her]81-algitha eyes fixed on the ground . “ [She]91-mrs. gordon did not originally set out with the idea of being [a sort of amiable cow]3828-a sort of amiable cow . [She]91-mrs. gordon once aspired to be quite human ; [she]91-mrs. gordon really did , poor thing ! ”[81-algitha] “ Then why did n't [she]91-mrs. gordon do it ? ”[81-algitha] asked [Algitha]81-algitha contemptuously . “ Instead of doing a thing , [she]91-mrs. gordon had to be perpetually struggling for the chance to do it , which [she]91-mrs. gordon never achieved , and so [she]91-mrs. gordon was submerged . That seems to be the fatality in [a woman]3753-a woman 's life . ”[81-algitha] “ Well , there is one thing [I]81-algitha am very sure of , ”[81-algitha] announced [Algitha]81-algitha , leaning majestically against a column of [the temple]532-the temple , and looking like [a beautiful Greek maiden]538-a beautiful greek maiden , in [her]81-algitha simple gown , “ [I]81-algitha do not intend to be a cow . [I]81-algitha do not mean to fight a losing battle . [I]81-algitha will not wait at [home]3770-home meekly , till [some fool]3831-some fool holds out [his]3831-some fool sceptre to [me]81-algitha . ”[81-algitha] All eyes turned to [her]81-algitha , in astonishment . “ But what are [you]81-algitha going to do ? ”[539-them] asked a chorus of voices . [Hadria]211-hadria 's was not among [them]539-them , for [she]211-hadria knew what was coming . The debate of last night , and this morning 's discussion , had evidently brought to a climax a project that [Algitha]81-algitha had long had in [her]81-algitha mind , but had hesitated to carry out , on account of the distress that it would cause to [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother . [Algitha]81-algitha 's eyes glittered , and [her]81-algitha colour rose . “ [I]81-algitha am not going to be hawked about [the county]3832-the county till [I]81-algitha am disposed of . It does not console [me]81-algitha in the least , that [all the foxes]3833-all the foxes are without tails , ”[81-algitha] [she]81-algitha went on , taking short cuts to [her]81-algitha meaning , in [her]81-algitha excitement . “ [I]81-algitha am going to [London]8-london with [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan , to help [her]95-mrs. trevelyan in [her]95-mrs. trevelyan work . ”[81-algitha] “ By [Jove]96-jove ! ”[83-fred] exclaimed [Fred]83-fred . [Ernest]86-ernest whistled . [Austin]84-austin stared , with open mouth . Having recovered from the first shock of surprise , [the family]360-the family plied [[their]360-the family sister]542-their sister with questions . [She]81-algitha said that [she]81-algitha had long been thinking of accepting the post offered [her]81-algitha by [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan last year , and now [she]81-algitha was resolved . The work was really wise , useful work among [the poor]543-the poor , which [Algitha]81-algitha felt [she]81-algitha could do well . At [home]3770-home , there was nothing that [she]81-algitha did that [the housekeeper]545-the housekeeper could not do better . [She]81-algitha felt [herself]81-algitha fretting and growing irritable , for mere want of some active employment . This was utterly absurd , in an overworked world . [Hadria]211-hadria had [her]211-hadria music and [her]211-hadria study , at any rate , but [Algitha]81-algitha had nothing that seemed worth doing ; [she]81-algitha did not care to paint indifferently on china ; [she]211-hadria was a mere encumbrance — a destroyer as [Hadria]211-hadria put it — while there was so much , so very much , that waited to be done . [The younger sister]546-the younger sister made no comment . “ Next time [I]83-fred meet [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , ”[83-fred] said [Fred]83-fred , drawing a long breath , “ [I]83-fred will tell [him]94-harold wilkins that if [a girl]3734-a girl does not marry , [she]3734-a girl can devote [herself]3734-a girl to [the poor]543-the poor . ”[83-fred] “ Or that [she]3734-a girl can remain to be [the family consolation]3836-the family consolation , eh , [Hadria]211-hadria ? By [Jove]96-jove , what a row there will be ! ”[211-hadria] The notion of [Hadria]211-hadria in the capacity of the family consolation , created a shout of laughter . It had always been [her]211-hadria function to upset foregone conclusions , overturn orthodox views , and generally disturb the conformity of the family attitude . Now the sedate and established qualities would be expected of [her]211-hadria . [Hadria]211-hadria must be the stay and hope of [the house]296-the house ! [Fred]83-fred continued to chuckle , at intervals , over the idea . “ It does seem to indicate rather [a broken - down family]3837-a broken - down family ! ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . “ [I]211-hadria wish [one of [[you]3839-you boys]3840-you boys]3838-one of you boys would undertake the position instead of laughing at [me]211-hadria , ”[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria in mock resentment . “ [I]211-hadria wish [you]3839-you would go to eternal tennis - parties , and pay calls , and bills , and write notes , and do little useless necessary things , more or less all day . [I]211-hadria wish [you]3839-you had before [you]3839-you the choice between that existence and the career of [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , with the sole chance of escape from either fate , in ruthlessly trampling upon the bleeding hearts of [two beloved parents]3841-two beloved parents ! ”[211-hadria] “ Thank [you]3839-you kindly , ”[83-fred] said [Fred]83-fred , “ but [we]3842-we infinitely prefer to laugh at [you]3839-you . ”[83-fred] “ [Man]332-man 's eternal reply to [woman]3844-woman , admirably paraphrased ! ”[211-hadria] commented [Hadria]211-hadria . [Everyone]3726-everyone was anxious to know when [Algitha]81-algitha intended to go to [London]8-london . [Nobody]3732-nobody doubted for a moment that [she]81-algitha would hold to [her]81-algitha purpose ; as [Fred]83-fred said , [she]81-algitha was so “ beastly obstinate . ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha had not fixed any time . It would depend on [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother . [She]81-algitha wished to make things as little painful as possible . That it was [her]81-algitha duty to spare [her]81-algitha pain altogether by remaining at [home]3770-home , [Algitha]81-algitha refused to admit . [She]81-algitha and [Hadria]211-hadria had thought out the question from all sides . The work [she]81-algitha was going to do was useful , but [she]81-algitha did not justify [herself]81-algitha on that ground . [She]81-algitha claimed the right to [her]81-algitha life and [her]81-algitha liberty , apart from what [she]81-algitha intended to do with either . [She]81-algitha owed it to [her]81-algitha own conscience alone to make good use of [her]81-algitha liberty . “ [I]81-algitha do n't want to pose as [a philanthropist]3845-a philanthropist , ”[81-algitha] [she]81-algitha added , “ though [I]81-algitha honestly do desire to be of service . [I]81-algitha want to spread [my]81-algitha wings . And why should [I]81-algitha not ? [Nobody]3732-nobody turns pale when [Ernest]86-ernest wants to spread [his]86-ernest . How do [I]81-algitha know what life is like , or how best to use it , if [I]81-algitha remain satisfied with [my]81-algitha present ignorance ? How can [I]81-algitha even appreciate what [I]81-algitha possess , if [I]81-algitha have nothing to compare it with ? Of course , the truly nice and womanly thing to do , is to remain at [home]3770-home , waiting to be married . [I]81-algitha have elected to be unwomanly . ”[81-algitha] “ [I]86-ernest wonder how all this will turn out , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest , “ whether [you]81-algitha wo n't regret it some day when it is too late . ”[86-ernest] “ Do n't [people]3687-people always regret what [they]3687-people do — some day ? ”[211-hadria] asked [Hadria]211-hadria . “ Perhaps so , especially if [they]3687-people do it sooner than [other people]3849-other people . ”[211-hadria] “ When are [you]81-algitha going to make the announcement at [head quarters]3850-head quarters ? ”[83-fred] asked [Fred]83-fred . There was a pause . The colour had left [Algitha]81-algitha 's cheeks . [She]81-algitha answered at length with an effort — “ [I]81-algitha shall speak to [mother]3851-mother to - day . ”[81-algitha] [MRS . FULLERTON]97-mrs. fullerton had gone to [the study]552-the study , to consult with [[her]97-mrs. fullerton husband]553-her husband on some matter of domestic importance . [It]552-the study was [a long , low - pitched room]554-a long , low - pitched room , situated in [the part of [the house]296-the house that stood at right angles to [the central block]557-the central block , with long , narrow windows looking on to [a rough orchard]558-a rough orchard]555-the part of the house that stood at right angles to the central block , with long , narrow windows looking on to a rough orchard . A few old portraits , very yellow and somewhat grotesque , hung on the walls ; a wood fire burnt on the hob - grate , and beside [it]552-the study stood a vast arm chair , considerably worn , with depressions shewing where [its owner]559-its owner had been leaning [his]559-its owner head , day after day , when [he]559-its owner smoked [his]559-its owner pipe , or took [his]559-its owner after - dinner nap . The bookshelves were stocked with scientific works , and some volumes on philosophy of a materialistic character . With the exception of [Robert Burns]98-robert burns , [not one poet]560-not one poet was represented . [The owner of [the house]296-the house]561-the owner of the house sat before a big writing - table , which was covered with papers . [His]561-the owner of the house face was that of [a hard thinker]563-a hard thinker ; the head was fine in form , the forehead broad and high ; the features regular , almost severe . The severity was softened by a genial expression . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , though also obviously above the average of humanity , shewed signs of incomplete development . The shape of the head and brow promised many faculties that the expression of the face did not encourage [one]329-one to expect . [She]97-mrs. fullerton was finely built ; and carried [herself]97-mrs. fullerton with dignity . When [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughters]364-her daughters accompanied [her]97-mrs. fullerton on a round of calls in [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood , [they]364-her daughters expressed a certain quality in [her]97-mrs. fullerton appearance , in rough and ready terms : “ [Other married women]3852-other married women always look such fools beside [mother]3851-mother ! ”[364-her daughters] And [they]364-her daughters did . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton wore [her]97-mrs. fullerton fine black hair brushed neatly over [her]97-mrs. fullerton forehead ; [her]97-mrs. fullerton eyes were large , and keen in expression . The mouth shewed determination . It was easy to see that [this lady]567-this lady had unbounded belief in [[her]567-this lady husband]553-her husband 's wisdom , except in social matters , for which [he]553-her husband cared nothing . On that point [she]567-this lady had to keep [her]567-this lady ambitions to [herself]567-this lady . In questions of philosophy , [she]567-this lady had imbibed [his]553-her husband tenets unmodified , and though [she]567-this lady went regularly every Sunday to [the close little Scottish church at [Ballochcoil]5-ballochcoil]569-the close little scottish church at ballochcoil , [she]567-this lady had no more respect than [[her]567-this lady husband]553-her husband had , for the doctrines that were preached [there]571-there . “ No doubt it is all superstition and nonsense , ”[567-this lady] [she]567-this lady used to say , “ but in [this country]3854-this country , one ca n't afford to fly in the face of prejudice . It would seriously tell against [the girls]370-the girls . ”[567-this lady] “ Well , have [your]567-this lady own way , ”[567-this lady] [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton would reply , “ but [I]567-this lady ca n't see the use of always bothering about what [people]3687-people will think . What more do [the girls]370-the girls want than [a good home]3858-a good home and plenty of lawn - tennis ? [They]370-the girls 'll get [husbands]3859-husbands fast enough , without [your]567-this lady asphyxiating [yourself]567-this lady every Sunday in [their]370-the girls interests . ”[567-this lady] In [her]567-this lady youth , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had shewn signs of qualities which had since been submerged . [[Her]567-this lady husband]553-her husband had influenced [her]567-this lady development profoundly , to the apparent stifling of every native tendency . A few volumes of poetry , and other works of imagination , bore testimony to the lost sides of [her]567-this lady nature . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton thought imagination “ all nonsense , ”[89-mr. fullerton] and [[his]89-mr. fullerton wife]573-his wife had no doubt [he]89-mr. fullerton was right , though there was something to be said for [one or two of [the poets]575-the poets]574-one or two of the poets . The buried impulses had broken out , like a half - smothered flame , in [[her]567-this lady children]576-her children , especially in [[her]567-this lady younger daughter]577-her younger daughter . Singularly enough , [the mother]578-the mother regarded these qualities , partly inherited from [herself]578-the mother , as erratic and annoying . The memory of [her]578-the mother own youth taught [her]578-the mother no sympathy . It was a benumbed sort of life that [she]578-the mother led , in [[her]578-the mother picturesque old home , whose charm [she]578-the mother perceived but dimly with the remnants of [her]578-the mother lost aptitudes]579-her picturesque old home , whose charm she perceived but dimly with the remnants of her lost aptitudes . “ Picturesque ! ”[89-mr. fullerton] [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton used to cry with a snort ; “ why not say ‘ unhealthy ’ and be done with it ? ”[89-mr. fullerton] From these native elements of character , modified in so singular a fashion in [the mother]578-the mother 's life , [the children of this pair]581-the children of this pair had drawn certain of [their]581-the children of this pair peculiarities . The inborn strength and authenticity of [the parents]582-the parents had transmuted itself , in [the younger generation]583-the younger generation , to a spirit of free enquiry , and an audacity of thought which boded ill for [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton 's ambitions .
