The talent in [[her]567-this lady daughters]364-her daughters , from which [she]567-this lady had hoped so much , seemed likely to prove a most dangerous obstacle to [their]364-her daughters success . Why was it that [clever people]585-clever people were never sensible ? The gong sounded for luncheon . [Austin]84-austin put [his]84-austin head in at the door of [the study]552-the study , to ask if [[his]84-austin father]587-his father would shew [him]84-austin a drop of ditch - water through the microscope , in the afternoon . “ If [you]97-mrs. fullerton will provide the ditch - water , [I]89-mr. fullerton will provide the microscope , ”[89-mr. fullerton] promised [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton genially . Luncheon , usually a merry meal at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , passed off silently . There was a sense of oppression in the air . [Algitha]81-algitha and [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister made spasmodic remarks , and there were long pauses . The conversation was chiefly sustained by [the parents]582-the parents and the ever - talkative [Fred]83-fred . [The latter]590-the latter had some anecdotes to tell of the ravages made by wasps . “ If [Buchanan]99-buchanan would only adopt [my]89-mr. fullerton plan of destroying [them]3860-them , ”[89-mr. fullerton] said [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton , “ [we]3861-we should soon get rid of the pest . ”[89-mr. fullerton] “ It 's some chemical , is n't it ? ”[97-mrs. fullerton] asked [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton . “ Oh , no ; that 's no use at all ! [Wasps]100-wasps positively enjoy chemicals . What [you]89-mr. fullerton do is this—. ”[97-mrs. fullerton] And then followed a long and minute explanation of [his]89-mr. fullerton plan , which had the merit of extreme originality . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton had [his]89-mr. fullerton own particular way of doing everything , a piece of presumption which was naturally resented , with proper spirit , by [[his]89-mr. fullerton neighbours]591-his neighbours . [He]89-mr. fullerton found it an expensive luxury . In the management of [the estate]592-the estate , [he]89-mr. fullerton had outraged the feelings of [every landlord]593-every landlord and land - agent within a radius of many miles , but [he]89-mr. fullerton gained the affection of [[his]89-mr. fullerton tenants]594-his tenants , and this [he]89-mr. fullerton seemed to value more than the approval of [[his]89-mr. fullerton fellow - proprietors]595-his fellow - proprietors . In theory , [he]89-mr. fullerton stuck out for [his]89-mr. fullerton privileges ; in practice , [he]89-mr. fullerton was [the friend and brother of the poorest on [the estate]592-the estate]596-the friend and brother of the poorest on the estate . In [his]89-mr. fullerton mode of farming [he]89-mr. fullerton was as eccentric as in [his]89-mr. fullerton method of management . [He]89-mr. fullerton had taken Croachmore into [his]89-mr. fullerton own hands , and [this devoted farm]598-this devoted farm had become the subject of a series of drastic scientific experiments , to the great grief and indignation of [[his]89-mr. fullerton bailiff]599-his bailiff . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton believed implicitly in the value of these experiments , and so long as [[her]97-mrs. fullerton husband]553-her husband tried science only on [the farm]601-the farm [she]97-mrs. fullerton had no misgivings ; but , alas , [he]553-her husband had lately taken shares in [some company]602-some company , that was to revolutionize agriculture through an ingenious contrivance for collecting nitrogen from the atmosphere . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton was confident that the new method was to be a gigantic success . But on this point , [[his]89-mr. fullerton wife]573-his wife uneasily shook [her]573-his wife head . [She]573-his wife had even tried to persuade [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton to rid [himself]89-mr. fullerton of [his]89-mr. fullerton liability . It was so great , [she]573-his wife argued , and why should [one]329-one be made anxious ? But [[her]97-mrs. fullerton husband]553-her husband assured [her]573-his wife that [she]573-his wife did n't understand anything about it ; [women]606-women ought not to meddle in business matters ; it was a stupendous discovery , sure to make the fortunes of [the original shareholders]607-the original shareholders . “ When once the prejudice against a new thing has been got over , ”[608-the man of science] said [the man of science]608-the man of science , “ [you]97-mrs. fullerton will see — the thing will go like wild - fire . ”[608-the man of science] Many years afterwards , these words were remembered by [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , and [she]97-mrs. fullerton bitterly regretted that [she]97-mrs. fullerton had not urged the matter more strenuously . “ Well , [Algitha]81-algitha , ”[609-her father] said [[her]97-mrs. fullerton father]609-her father , wondering at [her]97-mrs. fullerton silence , “ how are the roses getting on ? And [I]609-her father hope [you]97-mrs. fullerton have not forgotten the sweet - brier that [you]97-mrs. fullerton promised to grow for [me]609-her father . ”[609-her father] “ Oh , no , [father]3862-father , the sweet - brier has been ordered , ”[81-algitha] returned [Algitha]81-algitha , without [her]81-algitha usual brightness of manner . “ Have [you]3862-father a headache ? ”[97-mrs. fullerton] enquired [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton . “ [I]97-mrs. fullerton hope [you]3862-father have not all been sitting up talking in [[Hadria]211-hadria 's room]3863-hadria 's room , as [you]3862-father are too fond of doing . [You]3862-father may think [yourselves]3862-father lucky to be born at this end of the century , instead of the other . ”[97-mrs. fullerton] “ Indeed [we]610-we do ! ”[86-ernest] exclaimed [Ernest]86-ernest . “ It 's getting jolly interesting ! “[86-ernest] In some respects , no doubt [we]610-we have advanced , ” observed [[his]86-ernest mother]3866-his mother , “[97-mrs. fullerton] but [I]0-i confess [I]0-i do n't understand all [your]86-ernest modern notions . [Everybody]3781-everybody seems to be getting discontented . [The poor]543-the poor want to be rich , and [the rich]613-the rich want to be [millionaires]614-millionaires ; [men]3698-men want to do [[their]3698-men master]616-their master 's work , and [women]606-women want to do [men]3698-men 's ; everything is topsy - turvy ! ” “[329-one] The question is : What constitutes being right side up ? ” said [Ernest]86-ernest . “[329-one] One ca n't exactly say what is topsy - turvy till [one]329-one knows that . ” “[329-one] When [I]0-i was young [we]610-we thought [we]610-we did know , ” said [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , “[610-we] but no doubt [we]610-we are old - fashioned . ” When luncheon was over , [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton went to [the garden]3867-the garden with [[his]89-mr. fullerton family]3868-his family , according to a time - honoured custom . [His]89-mr. fullerton love of flowers sometimes made [Hadria]211-hadria wonder whether [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father also had been born with certain instincts , which the accidents of life had stifled or failed to develop . Terrible was the tyranny of circumstance ! What had [Emerson]87-emerson been dreaming of ? [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton , with a rose - bud in [his]89-mr. fullerton button - hole , went off with [the boys]3870-the boys for a farming walk . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton returned to [the house]296-the house , and [the sisters]3872-the sisters were left pacing together in [the sheltered old garden]3873-the sheltered old garden , between two rows of gorgeous autumn flowers . [Hadria]211-hadria felt sick with dread of the coming interview . [Algitha]81-algitha was buoyed up , for the moment , by a strong conviction that [she]81-algitha was in the right . “[610-we] It ca n't be fair even for [parents]620-parents to order [one]329-one 's whole life according to [their]620-parents pleasure , ” [she]0-i said . “[622-other girls] [Other girls]622-other girls submit , [I]0-i know — ” “[622-other girls] And so [the world]334-the world is full of abortive , ambiguous beings , fit for nothing . [The average woman]624-the average woman always seem to [me]0-i to be muffled — or morbid . ” “[624-the average woman] That 's what [I]0-i should become if [I]0-i pottered about [here]3762-here much longer , ” said [Algitha—“morbid]101-algitha—“morbid[0-i] ; and if there is one thing on the face of the earth that [I]0-i loathe , it is morbidness . ” [Both sisters]3874-both sisters were instinctively trying to buttress up [Algitha]81-algitha 's courage , by strengthening [her]81-algitha position with additional arguments . “[628-one not see the bearings of the matter] Is it fair , ” [Hadria]211-hadria asked , “[628-one not see the bearings of the matter] to summon [children]626-children into [the world]334-the world , and then run up bills against [them]626-children for future payment ? It 's of no use disguising the unpleasant side of the matter . [A mother disappointed in [[her]636-her children]576-her children]637-a mother disappointed in her children must be [a desperately unhappy woman]639-a desperately unhappy woman . [She]636-her has nothing left ; for has [she]636-her not resigned everything for [them]576-her children ? But is sacrifice for ever to follow on sacrifice ? Ahl ! if it were not that [one is born with feelings and energies]644-one is born with feelings and energies and ambitions of [one]329-one 's own , [parents]620-parents might treat [one]329-one as [a showman]648-a showman treats [his]648-a showman marionettes , and [we]649-our should all be charmed to lie prone on [our]649-our backs , or to dance as may be convenient to [[our]649-our creators]650-our creators . Then [Hadria]211-hadria came to a standstill at the sun - dial , at the crossing of [the paths]3879-the paths , and began absently to trace the figures of the hours , with the stalk of a rose . “[653-most parents] After all , ” [she]211-hadria said , “[620-parents] [parents]620-parents are presumably not actuated by humanitarian motives in bringing one into [this wild world]656-this wild world . [They]620-parents do n't even profess to have felt an unselfish desire to see one enjoying [oneself]657-oneself at [their]620-parents expense ( though , as a matter of fact , what enjoyment [one]329-one has generally is at [their]620-parents expense ) . [People]3687-people are always enthusiastically congratulated on the arrival of [a new child]660-a new child , though it be the fourteenth , and the income two hundred a year ! This seems to point to a pronounced taste for [new children]661-new children , regardless of the consequences ! ” “[0-i] Oh , of course , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha , “[0-i] it 's one of the canons ! [Women]606-women , above all , are expected to jubilate at all costs . And [I]0-i think [most of [them]606-women]663-most of them do , more or less sincerely . ” “[606-women] Very well then , ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “[606-women] it is universally admitted that [children]626-children are summoned into [the world]334-the world to gratify parental instincts . Yet [the parents]582-the parents throw all the onus of existence , after all , upon [the children]667-the children , and make [them]667-the children pay for it , and apologise for it , and justify it by a thousand sacrifices and an ever - flowing gratitude . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am quite ready to give gratitude and sacrifice too , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha , “[0-i] but [I]0-i do n't feel that [I]0-i ought to sacrifice everything to an idea that seems to [me]0-i wrong . If [he]668-a human being has not that , what , in heaven 's name , has [he]668-a human being ? ” “[668-a human being] Anything but that ! ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria . While the momentous interview was going on , [Hadria]211-hadria walked restlessly up and down [the garden]3867-the garden , feverishly waiting . [The borders]3881-the borders were brilliant with vast sunflowers , white lilies , and blazing “[668-a human being] red - hot pokers ” tangled together in splendid profusion , a very type of richness and glory of life . Such was the sort of existence that [Hadria]211-hadria claimed from [Fate]102-fate . [Her]211-hadria eyes turned to [the bare , forlorn hills that even the August sunshine]3882-the bare , forlorn hills that even the august sunshine could not conjure into sumptuousness , and there [she]211-hadria saw the threatened reality . When at last [Algitha]81-algitha 's fine figure appeared at the further end of [the path]3883-the path , [Hadria]211-hadria hastened forward and took [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister 's arm . “[0-i] It was worse than [I]0-i had feared , ” [Algitha]81-algitha said , with a quiver in [her]0-i voice . “[0-i] [I]0-i know [I]0-i am right , and yet it seems almost more than [I]0-i am equal for . When [I]0-i told [mother]3851-mother , [she]3851-mother turned deadly white , and [I]0-i thought , for a moment , that [she]3851-mother was going to faint . Let 's sit down on this seat . ” “[211-hadria] Oh , it was horrible , [Hadria]211-hadria ! [Mother]103-mother must have been cherishing hopes about [us]670-us , in a way that [I]0-i do n't think [she]3851-mother quite knew [herself]3851-mother . After that first moment of wretchedness , [she]3851-mother flew into a passion of rage — that dreadful , tearing anger that [people]3687-people only feel when something of [themselves]3687-people is being wrenched away from [them]3687-people . [She]3851-mother said that [[her]3851-mother children]576-her children were all bad and unnatural ; that [she]3851-mother had spent [her]3851-mother whole life in [their]576-her children interests ; that if it had not been for [her]3851-mother , [we]670-us should all of [us]670-us have grown up without education or accomplishments , or looks , or anything else ; that [she]3851-mother watched over [us]670-us incessantly when [we]670-us were [little children]673-little children , denying [herself]3851-mother , spending [her]3851-mother youth in devotion to [us]670-us , when [she]3851-mother might have gone into [the world]334-the world , and had some brightness and pleasure . If [we]670-us imagined that [she]3851-mother had never felt the dulness of [her]3851-mother life , and never longed to go about and see [people]3687-people and things , [we]670-us were much mistaken . But [she]3851-mother had renounced everything [she]3851-mother cared for , from [her]3851-mother girlhood — [she]3851-mother was scarcely older than [I]0-i when [her]3851-mother sacrifices began — and now [[her]3851-mother children]576-her children gave no consideration to [her]3851-mother ; [they]576-her children were ready to scatter [themselves]576-her children hither and thither without a thought of [her]3851-mother , or [her]3851-mother wishes . [They]576-her children even talked scoffingly of the kind of life that [she]3851-mother had led for [them]576-her children — for [them]576-her children , [she]3851-mother repeated bitterly . ” [Hadria]211-hadria 's face had clouded . “[3851-mother] [Truly parents]677-truly parents must have a bad time of it ! ” [she]211-hadria exclaimed , “[677-truly parents] but does it really console [them]677-truly parents that [[their]677-truly parents children]654-their children should have a bad time of it too ? ” [Algitha]81-algitha was trembling and very pale . “[3851-mother] [Mother]3851-mother says [I]0-i shall ruin [my]0-i life by this fad . What real good am [I]0-i going to do ? [She]3851-mother says it is absurd the way [we]680-we talk of things [we]680-we know nothing about . ” “[3851-mother] But [she]3851-mother wo n't let [us]680-we know about things ; [one]329-one must talk about something ! ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria with a dispirited laugh . “[3851-mother] [She]3851-mother says [she]3851-mother has experience of life , and [we]680-we are ignorant of it . [I]0-i reminded [her]3851-mother that [our]680-we ignorance was not exactly [our]680-we fault . ” “[0-i] Ah ! precisely . [Parents]620-parents thrown [[their]620-parents children]654-their children 's ignorance in [their]620-parents teeth , having taken precious good care to prevent [their]620-parents knowing anything . [I]0-i ca n't understand [parents]620-parents ; [they]654-their children must have been young [themselves]654-their children once . Yet [they]654-their children seem to have forgotten all about it . [They]654-their children keep [us]680-we hoodwinked and infantile , and then launch [us]680-we headlong into life , with all its problems to meet , and all momentous decisions made for [us]680-we , past hope of undoing . ” [Hadria]211-hadria rose restlessly in [her]211-hadria excitement . “[654-their children] Surely [no creature]685-no creature was ever dealt with so insanely as [the well - brought - up girl]686-the well - brought - up girl ! Surely [no well - wisher]687-no well - wisher so sincere as [the average parent]688-the average parent ever ill - treated [his]688-the average parent charge so preposterously . ” Again there was a long silence , filled with painful thought . “[329-one] [One]329-one begins to understand a little , why [women]606-women do things that [one]329-one despises , and why [the proudest of [them]606-women]692-the proudest of them so often submit to absolute indignity . [You]693-you remember when [Mrs. Arbuthnot]104-mrs. arbuthnot and — ” “[104-mrs. arbuthnot] Ah , do n't ! ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha , flushing . “[104-mrs. arbuthnot] Nothing ought to induce [a woman]3753-a woman to endure that . ” “[104-mrs. arbuthnot] H'm — [I]0-i suspect [the world]334-the world that [we]680-we know nothing about , [Algitha]81-algitha , has ways and means of applying the pressure such as [you]81-algitha and [I]0-i scarcely dream of . ” [Hadria]211-hadria spoke with half - closed eyes that seemed to see deep and far . “[0-i] [I]0-i have read and heard things that have almost taken [my]0-i breath away ! [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i could kill [every man who acquiesces in the present order of things]696-every man who acquiesces in the present order of things . It is an insult to [every woman alive]697-every woman alive ! ” In [[Hadria]211-hadria 's room]3863-hadria 's room that night , [Algitha]81-algitha finally decided to delay [her]81-algitha going for another six months , hoping by that time that [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother would have grown used to the idea , and less opposed to it . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton dismissed it , as obviously absurd . But this high - handed treatment roused all the determination that [Algitha]81-algitha had inherited from [[her]81-algitha father]609-her father . The six months had to be extended , in order to procure funds . [Algitha]81-algitha had a small income of [her]81-algitha own , left [her]81-algitha by [[her]81-algitha godmother]3888-her godmother , [Miss Fortescue]105-miss fortescue . [She]81-algitha put aside this , for [her]81-algitha purpose . Further delay , through [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan , brought the season round again to autumn , before [Algitha]81-algitha was able to make [her]81-algitha final preparations for departure . “[698-them] Do try and reconcile [them]698-them to the idea , ” [she]81-algitha said to [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister , as [they]698-them stood on [the platform of [Ballochcoil station]3891-ballochcoil station]3890-the platform of ballochcoil station , very white and wretched - looking . “[698-them] It breaks [my]0-i heart to see [father]3862-father look so fixed and angry , and [mother]3851-mother so miserable . [I]0-i am not going away for ever . Dear [me]0-i , a day 's journey will bring [me]0-i back , at any time . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i 'll do [my]0-i best , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] here 's [[your]701-your train]702-your train ; what a clumsy instrument of fate it does look ! ” There was not much time for farewells . In a few minutes [the train]3892-the train was steaming out of [the station]3893-the station . [A solitary figure]3894-a solitary figure stood on [the platform]3895-the platform , watching the monster curving and diminishing along the line , with its white smoke soaring merrily into the air , in great rolling masses , that melted , as if by some incantation , from thick , snow - like whiteness to rapid annihilation . AS [Hadria]211-hadria drove over [the winding upland road]3896-the winding upland road back to [[her]211-hadria home]3897-her home , [her]211-hadria thoughts followed [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister into [her]211-hadria new existence , and then turned wistfully backwards to the days that had been marked off into the past by [Algitha]81-algitha 's departure . How bright and eager and hopeful [they]3899-they had all been , how full of enthusiasm and generous ambitions ! Even as [they]3899-they talked of battle , [they]3899-they stretched forth [their]3899-they hands for the crown of victory . At the last meeting of the Preposterous Society , [Ernest]86-ernest had repeated a poem of [his]86-ernest favourite [Emerson]87-emerson , called Days , and the poem , which was familiar to [Hadria]211-hadria , sounded in [her]211-hadria memory , as the pony trotted merrily along [the well - known homeward way]3900-the well - known homeward way . In spite of [Hadria]211-hadria 's memorable lecture of a year ago , it was still the orthodox creed of [the Society]359-the society , that [Circumstance]106-circumstance is [the handmaid of the Will]3902-the handmaid of the will ; that [one]329-one can demand of [one]329-one 's days “[0-i] bread , kingdoms , stars , or sky , ” and that the Days will obediently produce the objects desired . If [one has but the spirit that can soar high enough to really be resolved upon stars]3905-one has but the spirit that can soar high enough to really be resolved upon stars , or the ambition sufficiently vaulting to be determined on kingdoms , then — so ran the dogma — stars and kingdoms would be forthcoming , though obstacles were never so determined . [No member]3906-no member except [Hadria]211-hadria had ever dreamt of insinuating that one might have a very pronounced taste for stars and kingdoms — nay , a taste so dominant that life would be worthless unless they were achieved — yet might be forced , by the might of events , to forego them . [Hadria]211-hadria 's own heresy had been of the head rather than of the heart . But to - day , feeling began to share the scepticism of the intellect . What if one 's stars and kingdoms lay on the further side of a crime or a cruelty ? What then was left but to gather up [one]329-one 's herbs and apples , and bear , as best one might , the scorn of the unjust Days ? [Hadria]211-hadria cast about in [her]211-hadria mind for a method of utilizing to the best advantage possible , the means at [her]211-hadria disposal : to force circumstance to yield a harvest to [her]211-hadria will . To be [the family consolation]3836-the family consolation meant no light task , for [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was exacting by nature : [she]97-mrs. fullerton had given much , and [she]97-mrs. fullerton expected much in return . [Her]97-mrs. fullerton logic was somewhat faulty , but that could not be gracefully pointed out to [her]97-mrs. fullerton by [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter . Having allowed [her]97-mrs. fullerton own abilities to decay , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had developed an extraordinary power of interfering with the employment of the abilities of [others]432-others . [Hadria]211-hadria had rather underrated than exaggerated this difficulty . [[Her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother would keep [her]211-hadria for hours , discussing a trivial point of domestic business , giving elaborate directions about it , only to do it [herself]211-hadria in the end . [She]211-hadria spent [her]211-hadria whole life in trifles of this kind , or over social matters . Everything was done cumbrously , with an incredible amount of toil and consideration , and without any noticeable results . [Hadria]211-hadria , fighting against a multitude of harassing little difficulties , struggled to turn the long winter months to some use . But [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton broke the good serviceable time into jagged fragments . “[0-i] [I]0-i really ca n't see , ” said [the mother]578-the mother , when [the daughter]3913-the daughter proposed to set apart certain hours for household duties , and to have other portions of the day to [herself]3913-the daughter , “[0-i] [I]0-i really ca n't see why [a girl]3734-a girl 's little occupations should be treated with so much consideration . However , [I]0-i have no wish for grudging assistance . ” [Hadria]211-hadria 's temper was far indeed from perfect , and painful scenes often occurred . But as a rule , [she]211-hadria would afterwards be seized with a fit of remorse , knowing that [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother was suffering bitterly from [her]520-her mother keen disappointment about [Algitha]81-algitha . The failure of a life - long hope must try the endurance of [the bravest]3915-the bravest . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , seeing that [Hadria]211-hadria was more patient , quickly took advantage of the favourable moment , with a rapid instinct that had often done [her]211-hadria good service in the management of a niggard destiny . The valuable mood must not be allowed to die fruitless . [The elder girl]3916-the elder girl 's defection thus became , to [the mother]578-the mother , a sort of investment , bearing interest of docility in [the younger]3918-the younger . Because [the heartless Algitha]81-algitha had left [home]3770-home , it seemed to [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton that the very least that [Hadria]211-hadria could do , was to carry out [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's lightest wish . And so the weeks went by , in dreary , troublous fashion , cut into a hundred little barren segments . The mind had no space , or stretch , or solitude . It was incessantly harassed , and its impetus was perpetually checked . But [Hadria]211-hadria hoped on . This could not last for ever . Some day , doubtless , if [she]211-hadria sank not in spirit , the stars and the kingdoms would come . Meanwhile , the position of affairs was decidedly ridiculous . [She]211-hadria was here as [the family consolation]3836-the family consolation , and [nobody]3732-nobody seemed to be consoled ! [Her]211-hadria efforts had been sincere and even enthusiastic , but [the boys]3870-the boys only laughed at [her]211-hadria , in this rôle , and [nobody]3732-nobody was apparently in the least gratified ( except [those imps of [boys]496-boys]3925-those imps of boys ! ) . For a long time , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton seemed to be oblivious of [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter 's efforts , but one day , when [they]3928-they had been talking about [Algitha]81-algitha , [the mother]578-the mother said : “[705-your father] [[Your]704-you father]705-your father and [I]0-i now look to [you]704-you , [Hadria]211-hadria . [I]0-i do think that [you]704-you are beginning to feel a little what [your]704-you duty is . If [you]704-you also were to turn deserter in [our]706-our old age , [I]0-i think it would kill [us]706-our . ” [Hadria]211-hadria felt a thrill of horror . The network of Fate seemed to be fast closing round [her]211-hadria . The temporary was to become fixed . [She]211-hadria must act all [her]211-hadria days according to the conviction of [others]432-others , or [[her]211-hadria parents]3931-her parents would die of grief ! When [she]211-hadria went to [the hills]413-the hills that afternoon , [she]211-hadria felt as if [she]211-hadria must walk on and on into the dreamy distance , away from all these toils and claims , away into [the unknown world]3933-the unknown world and never return . But , alas ! the night descended and return [she]211-hadria must . These wild impulses could never be followed . The day had been peculiarly harassing and cut up ; [some neighbours]3934-some neighbours had been to afternoon tea and tennis , and the sight of [their]3934-some neighbours faces and the sound of [their]3934-some neighbours talk had caused , in [Hadria]211-hadria , an unutterable depression . The light , conventional phrases rang in [her]211-hadria ears still , the expression of the faces haunted [her]211-hadria , and into [her]211-hadria heart crept a chill that benumbed every wish and hope and faith that [she]211-hadria had ever cherished . [She]211-hadria sat up late into the night . Since freedom and solitude could not be had by day , the nights were often [her]211-hadria sole opportunity . At such times [she]211-hadria would work out [her]211-hadria musical ideas , which in the dead silence of [the house]296-the house were brought forth plentifully . These , from [her]211-hadria point of view , were the fruitful hours of the twenty - four . Thoughts would throng the darkness like swarms of living things . [Hadria]211-hadria 's mood found expression to - night in a singular and most melancholy composition . [She]211-hadria called it Futility . It was unlike anything that [she]211-hadria had ever done before , and [she]211-hadria felt that it shewed an access of musical power . [She]211-hadria dreamt an absurd dream : That [she]211-hadria was [herself]211-hadria one of [those girls with the high pattering accents , playing tennis without ceasing and with apparent cheerfulness]3936-those girls with the high pattering accents , playing tennis without ceasing and with apparent cheerfulness ; talking just as [they]3934-some neighbours had talked , and about just the same things ; and all the time , a vast circle of shadowy forms stood watching , beckoning , and exhorting and warning , and turning away , at last , in sorrowful contempt , because [she]211-hadria preferred to spend [her]211-hadria youth eternally in futilities . And then [they]3934-some neighbours all slowly drifted by with sad eyes fixed on [her]211-hadria , and [she]211-hadria was still left playing , playing . And it seemed as if whole weeks passed in that way , and [she]211-hadria grew mortally tired , but some power prevented [her]211-hadria from resting . The evil spell held [her]211-hadria enthralled . Always cheerful , always polite and agreeable , [she]211-hadria continued [her]211-hadria task , finding [herself]211-hadria growing accustomed to it at last , and duly resigned to the necessity , wearisome though it was . Then all hope that the game would ever cease went away , and [she]211-hadria played on , mechanically , but always with that same polite cheerfulness , as of afternoon calls . [She]211-hadria would not for [the world]334-the world admit that [she]211-hadria was tired . But [she]211-hadria was so tired that existence became a torture to [her]211-hadria , and [her]211-hadria heart seemed about to break with the intolerable strain — when [she]211-hadria woke up with a start , and found [herself]211-hadria lying in a constrained attitude , half - choked by the bed - clothes . [She]211-hadria did not see the comic side of the dream till next morning , when [she]211-hadria told it at breakfast for the benefit of [the family]360-the family . As [Hadria]211-hadria was [an ardent tennis - player]3939-an ardent tennis - player , it struck [[her]211-hadria brethren]3940-her brethren as a particularly inappropriate form of nightmare . [Hadria]211-hadria , at this time , went frequently with [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father on [his]609-her father farming walks , as [he]609-her father liked to have [one or more of [the family]360-the family]3942-one or more of the family with [him]609-her father . [She]211-hadria enjoyed these walks , for [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton would talk about philosophy and science , often of the most abstruse and entrancing kind . [[His]89-mr. fullerton children]362-his children were devoted to [him]89-mr. fullerton . During these expeditions , [they]362-his children always vied with [one another]3945-one another to ferret out the most absurd story to tell [him]89-mr. fullerton , [he]89-mr. fullerton being held as conqueror who made [[their]362-his children father]3946-their father laugh most heartily . Sometimes [they]362-his children all went in a body , armed with wild stories ; and occasionally , across [the open fields]3947-the open fields , a row of [eccentric - looking figures]3948-eccentric - looking figures might be seen , struggling in the grip of hilarious paroxysms ; [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton doubled up in the middle of [a turnip - field]3949-a turnip - field , perhaps , with [[his]89-mr. fullerton family]3868-his family in contortions round [him]89-mr. fullerton . The air of [the hills]413-the hills seemed to run to [their]362-his children heads , like wine . Roulades of laughter , hearty guffaws , might have been heard for surprising distances , much to the astonishment of [the sober labourers]3952-the sober labourers bending over [their]362-his children toil . [Ernest]86-ernest had to go back to [college]3953-college ; [Fred]83-fred and [Austin]84-austin to [school]3954-school . [The house]296-the house seemed very quiet and sad after [the boys]3870-the boys left , and [Hadria]211-hadria missed [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister more and more , as time went on . [Algitha]81-algitha wrote most happily . “[0-i] With all its drawbacks , this existence of hard work ( yet not too hard ) suits [me]0-i exactly . It uses up [my]0-i energies ; yet , in spite of the really busy life [I]0-i lead , [I]0-i literally have more leisure than [I]0-i used to have at [home]3770-home , where all through the day , there was some little detail to be attended to , some call to make , some convention to offer incense to , some prejudice to respect . Here , once [my]0-i day 's work is over , it is over , and [I]0-i have good solid hours of leisure . [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i have earned those hours when [they]708-they come ; also that [I]0-i have earned a right to [my]0-i keep , as [Wilfred Burton]107-wilfred burton , [the socialist]709-the socialist , puts it somewhat crudely . When [I]0-i go to bed at night , [I]0-i can say : ‘ Because of [me]0-i , this day , heavy hearts have been made a little lighter . ’ [I]0-i hear all sorts of opinions , and see all sorts of [people]3687-people . [I]0-i never was so happy in [my]0-i life . ” It was [Hadria]211-hadria 's habit still to take solitary rambles over [the country]401-the country . [A passionate lover of Nature]3959-a passionate lover of nature , [she]211-hadria found endless pleasure in its ever - changing aspects . Yet of late , a new feeling had begun to mutter angrily within [her]211-hadria : a resentment against these familiar sights and sounds , because they were the boundaries of [her]211-hadria horizon . [She]211-hadria hated the line of the round breezy hills where the row of fir - trees stood against the sky , because that was the edge of [[her]211-hadria world]3960-her world , and [she]211-hadria wanted to see what was beyond . [She]211-hadria must and would see what was beyond , some day . [Her]211-hadria hope was always vague ; for if [she]211-hadria dared to wonder how the curtain of life was to be lifted , [she]211-hadria had to face the fact that there was no reasonable prospect of such a lifting . Still , the utter horror of living on always , in this fashion , seemed to prove it impossible . On one dim afternoon , when the sun was descending , [Hadria]211-hadria 's solitary figure was noticed by [a white - haired lady]3961-a white - haired lady , presumably [a tourist]3962-a tourist , who had stopped to ask a question of [some farm labourers]3963-some farm labourers , working in [a field]3964-a field . [She]211-hadria ceased to listen to the information , on the subject of [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , that was given to [her]211-hadria in a broad Scottish dialect . The whole scene , which an instant before had impressed [her]211-hadria as one of beauty and peace , suddenly focussed itself round [the dark figure]3965-the dark figure , and grew sinister in its aspect . At that moment , nothing would have persuaded [the onlooker]3966-the onlooker that [the hastening figure]3967-the hastening figure was not hastening towards misfortune . [A woman of impulse]3968-a woman of impulse , [she]211-hadria set off in purposeless pursuit . [Hadria]211-hadria 's pace was very rapid ; [she]211-hadria was trying to outrun thought . It was impossible to live without hope , yet hope , in [this forlorn land]3969-this forlorn land , was growing faint and tired . [[Her]211-hadria pursuer]3970-her pursuer was [a remarkable - looking woman , no longer young , with [her]3961-a white - haired lady prematurely white hair drawn up from [her]3961-a white - haired lady brow with a proud sweep that suited well [her]3961-a white - haired lady sharply defined features and [her]3961-a white - haired lady air of defiance]3971-a remarkable - looking woman , no longer young , with her prematurely white hair drawn up from her brow with a proud sweep that suited well her sharply defined features and her air of defiance . [She]3961-a white - haired lady was carelessly dressed after the prevailing fashion , and gave the impression of not having [her]3961-a white - haired lady life successfully in hand , but rather of being driven by it , as by a blustering wind , against [her]3961-a white - haired lady inclination . The impression which had seized [her]211-hadria , a moment ago , deepened as [she]211-hadria went . Something in the scene and [the hastening figure]3967-the hastening figure roused a sense of dread . With [her]211-hadria , an impression was like a spark to gunpowder . [Her]211-hadria imagination blazed up . Life , in its most tragic aspect , seemed before [her]211-hadria in the lonely scene , with [the lonely figure]3973-the lonely figure , moving , as if in pursuit of a lost hope , towards the setting sun . If [Hadria]211-hadria had not paused on [the brow of [the hill]3975-the hill]3974-the brow of the hill , it is unlikely that [she]211-hadria would have been overtaken , but that pause decided the matter . [The stranger]3976-the stranger seemed suddenly to hesitate , wondering , apparently , what [she]211-hadria had done this eccentric thing for . [Hadria]211-hadria , feeling a presence behind [her]211-hadria , turned nervously round and gave a slight start . It was so rare to meet [anybody]3977-anybody on [these lonely hills]3978-these lonely hills , that the apparition of [a striking - looking woman with white hair , dark eyes , and a strange exalted sort of expression]3979-a striking - looking woman with white hair , dark eyes , and a strange exalted sort of expression , gave a shock of surprise . As [the lady]3679-the lady had stopped short , [Hadria]211-hadria supposed that [she]3679-the lady had lost [her]3679-the lady way , and wished to make some enquiries . “[0-i] Can [I]0-i direct [you]711-you , or give [you]711-you any assistance ? ” [she]0-i asked , after a second 's pause . “[0-i] Oh , thank [you]711-you , [you]711-you are very kind . [I]0-i have come over from [Ballochcoil]5-ballochcoil to explore [the country]401-the country . [I]0-i have been trying to find out the history of [the old houses of [the district]714-the district]713-the old houses of the district . Could [you]711-you tell [me]0-i , by the way , anything about [that house]715-that house with [the square tower at the end]716-the square tower at the end ; [I]0-i have been loitering round [it]715-that house half the afternoon . And [I]0-i would have given anything to know [its]715-that house history , and what it is like inside . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i can help [you]711-you there , for [that old house]717-that old house is [[my]0-i home]718-my home . If [you]711-you have time to come with [me]0-i now , [I]0-i will show [you]711-you all over [it]717-that old house , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , impulsively . “[0-i] That is too tempting an offer . And yet [I]0-i really do n't like to intrude in this way . [I]0-i am [a perfect stranger to [you]711-you]719-a perfect stranger to you and — [[your]711-you parents]720-your parents [I]0-i suppose ? ” “[0-i] [They]720-your parents will be delighted , ” [Hadria]211-hadria assured [[her]211-hadria new acquaintance]3981-her new acquaintance , somewhat imprudently . “[720-your parents] Well , [I]0-i ca n't resist the temptation , ” said [the latter]590-the latter , and [they]3983-they walked on together . [Hadria]211-hadria related what [she]211-hadria knew about the history of [the house]296-the house . Very scanty records had survived . [It]296-the house had obviously been [one of [the old Scottish strongholds]3986-the old scottish strongholds , built in the lawless days when [the country]401-the country was plunged in feuds and [chieftains]3988-chieftains lived on plunder]3985-one of the old scottish strongholds , built in the lawless days when the country was plunged in feuds and chieftains lived on plunder . [Mrs. McEwen]111-mrs. mcewen was a fine example of the best type of Scottish character ; warm of heart , honest of purpose , and full of a certain unconscious poetry , and a dignity that lingers still in districts where the railway whistle is not too often heard . [Hadria]211-hadria beamed . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria seemed both amused and gratified by [[her]211-hadria companion]3995-her companion 's worship , and the talk ran on , in a light and pleasant vein , differing from the talk of [the ordinary mortal]4052-the ordinary mortal , [Hadria]211-hadria considered , as champagne differs from [ditch - water]4053-ditch - water . In recording it for [Algitha]81-algitha 's benefit that evening , [Hadria]211-hadria found that [she]211-hadria could not reproduce the exhilarating quality , or describe the influence of [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's personality . It was as if , literally , a private and particular atmosphere had encompassed [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria was “[111-mrs. mcewen] alive all round , ” as [[her]211-hadria disciple]4054-her disciple asserted . [Her]211-hadria love of Nature was intense . [Hadria]211-hadria had never before realized that [she]211-hadria had been without full sympathy in this direction . [She]211-hadria awoke to a strange retrospective sense of solitude , feeling a new pity for [the eager little child of years ago]4055-the eager little child of years ago , who had wandered up to [the garret]293-the garret , late at night , to watch the moonlight spread its white shroud over [the hills]413-the hills . With every moment spent in the society of [Valeria Du Prel]109-valeria , new and clearer light seemed to [Hadria]211-hadria , to be thrown upon all the problems of existence ; not by any means only through what [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria directly said , but by what [she]109-valeria implied , by what [she]109-valeria took for granted , by what [she]109-valeria omitted to say . “[111-mrs. mcewen] It seems like a home - coming from long exile , ” [Hadria]211-hadria wrote to [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister . “[0-i] [I]0-i have been looking through a sort of mist , or as [one]329-one looks at one 's surroundings before quite waking . Now everything stands out sharp and cut , as objects do in the clear air of [the South]10-the south . Ah [me]0-i , [the South]10-the south ! [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria has spent much of [her]109-valeria life [there]571-there , and [my]0-i inborn smouldering passion for it , is set flaming by [her]109-valeria descriptions ! [You]770-you remember that brief little fortnight that [we]771-we spent with [mother]3851-mother and [father]3862-father in [Italy]11-italy ? [I]0-i seem now to be again under the spell of the languorous airs , the cloudless blue , [the white palaces]774-the white palaces , [the grey olive groves]775-the grey olive groves , and the art , the art ! Oh , [Algitha]81-algitha , [I]0-i must go to [the South]10-the south soon , soon , or [I]0-i shall die of [home]3770-home sickness ! [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria says that this is only one side of [me]0-i breaking out : that [I]0-i am northern at heart . [I]0-i think it is true , but meanwhile the thought of [the South]10-the south possesses [me]0-i . [I]0-i confess [I]0-i think [mother]3851-mother had some cause to be alarmed when [she]3851-mother saw [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , if [she]3851-mother wants to keep [us]778-us in a chastened mood , at [home]3770-home . It seems as if all of [me]0-i were in high carnival . Life is raised to a higher power . [I]0-i feel nearly omnipotent . Epics and operas are [child]780-child 's play to [me]0-i ! It is true [I]0-i have produced comparatively few ; but , oh , those that are to come ! [I]0-i feel fit for anything , from pitch - and - toss to manslaughter . [I]0-i think of the two , [I]0-i rather lean to the manslaughter . Oh , [I]0-i do n't mean it in the facetious sense ! that would be a terrible downfall from [my]0-i present altitudes . To such devices [the usual wretched girl , who has never drawn rebellious breath]781-the usual wretched girl , who has never drawn rebellious breath , or listened to the discourses of [Valeria Du Prel]109-valeria , has to turn for a living , or to keep ennui at bay . But [I]0-i , no , [the inimical sex]782-the inimical sex may possess [their]783-they souls in peace , as far as [I]0-i am concerned . [They]783-they might retort that [they]783-they never had felt nervous , but a letter has the same advantage as the pulpit : [the adversary]784-the adversary can never get up and contradict . “ [That ridiculous adversary]4059-that ridiculous adversary , [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , is staying again at [Drumgarren]12-drumgarren , and [I]784-the adversary hear from [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon that [he]4059-that ridiculous adversary thinks it very strange that [I]784-the adversary should see so much of [so extraordinary a person]4060-so extraordinary a person as [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria ! Opinions differ of course ; [I]784-the adversary think it very strange that [the Gordons]92-the gordons should see so much of [so ordinary a person]4061-so ordinary a person as [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins . [Everybody]3781-everybody makes much of [him]94-harold wilkins here , and , alas ! all [the girls]370-the girls run after [him]94-harold wilkins , and even fall in love with [him]94-harold wilkins ; why , [I]784-the adversary ca n't conceive . For if driven by dire compulsion of fate , to bend [one]329-one 's thoughts upon some prosaic example of that prosaic sex , why not choose one of the many far more attractive candidates available — [the Gordons]92-the gordons , [the McKenzies]114-the mckenzies , and so forth ? When [I]784-the adversary go to tennis parties with [mother]3851-mother — [they]4066-they are still playing upon [the asphalte courts]4067-the asphalte courts — and see the little dramas that go on , the jealousies and excitements , and general much - ado - about - nothing , [I]784-the adversary can scarcely believe that [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria really belongs to [the same planet]4068-the same planet as [ours]4069-ours . But [I]784-the adversary do n't feel so contemptuous as [I]784-the adversary did ; it is so pitiful . Out of [my]784-the adversary great wealth [I]784-the adversary can afford to be more generous . “[784-the adversary] And when [I]0-i see [those wretched girls]785-those wretched girls fluttering round [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , [I]0-i no longer turn up [my]0-i ‘ aughty nose ’ ( as [old Mrs. Brooks]115-old mrs. brooks used to say ) . [I]0-i only think to [myself]0-i , ‘ [Heavens]786-heavens and [earth]787-earth ! what an aching , empty life [those young women]788-those young women must lead , if [they]788-those young women are actually reduced for interest and amusement to the utterances of [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins ! ’ [They]788-those young women would have the pull of one though , if the utterances of [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins were the only utterances to be heard ! Perish the thought of such beggary ! ” The talks with [Valeria Du Prel]109-valeria grew more intimate , and more deeply interesting to [Hadria]211-hadria , every day . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria used often to look at [[her]109-valeria companion]3995-her companion in amazement . “[0-i] Where did [you]0-i come from ? ” [she]109-valeria exclaimed on one occasion . “[0-i] [One]329-one would suppose [you]0-i had lived several lives ; [you]0-i seem to know things in such a subtle , intimate fashion ! ” [She]109-valeria used to ponder over the problem , wondering what [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue would say to it . There appeared to be more here than mere heredity could account for . But science had never solved this problem ; originality seemed always to enter upon its career , uncaused and unaccountable . It was ever a miraculous phenomenon . [The Professor]4071-the professor had always said so . Still the heritage was rich enough , in this case . Heredity might have some discoverable part in the apparent marvel . [Each member of [the Fullerton family]4073-the fullerton family]4072-each member of the fullerton family had unusual ability of some kind . [Their]4072-each member of the fullerton family knowledge of science , and [their]4072-each member of the fullerton family familiarity with the problems of philosophy , had often astonished [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . [Hadria]211-hadria 's accounts of the Preposterous Society made [her]211-hadria laugh and exclaim at the same moment . [She]211-hadria gave an envious sigh at the picture of [the eager little group]4074-the eager little group , with [their]4074-the eager little group warmth of affection for [one another]3945-one another , and [their]4074-the eager little group vivid interests . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , with all [her]109-valeria sadness , was youthful in spirit . [Hadria]211-hadria found [her]109-valeria far younger than [many girls of [her]211-hadria own age]4076-many girls of her own age . This set [her]211-hadria thinking . [She]211-hadria observed how rigid [most people]4077-most people become in a few years , and how the personality grows wooden , in the daily repetition of the same actions and the same ideas . This stiffening process had been attributed to the malice of Time ; but now [Hadria]211-hadria began to believe that narrow and ungenerous thought lay at the root of the calamity . The entire life of [the little world in which [she]211-hadria had grown up]4078-the little world in which she had grown up , on all its sides , in all its ideals and sentiments , stood before [her]211-hadria , as if [some great painter]4079-some great painter had made a picture of it . [She]211-hadria had never before been able to stand so completely apart from the surroundings of [her]211-hadria childhood . And [she]211-hadria was able to do so now , not because [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria discoursed about it , but because [Hadria]211-hadria 's point of view had shifted sympathetically to the point of view of [[her]211-hadria companion]3995-her companion , through the instinctive desire to see how these familiar things would look to alien eyes . That which had seemed merely prosaic and dreary , became characteristic ; the very things which [she]211-hadria had taken most for granted were exactly those which turned out to be the significant and idiomatic facts . These had made permanent inroads into the mind and character . It was with these that [Hadria]211-hadria would have to reckon all [her]211-hadria days , under whatever conditions [she]211-hadria might hereafter be placed . Daily surroundings were not merely pleasant or unpleasant facts , otherwise of no importance ; they were the very material and substance of character ; the push and impetus , or the let and hindrance ; [the guardians]4081-the guardians or [the assassins of the soul]4082-the assassins of the soul . [MISS DU PREL]109-valeria had promised to allow [Hadria]211-hadria to drive [her]211-hadria to [Darachanarvan]13-darachanarvan , [a little town]4083-a little town on [the banks of [the river]437-the river]479-the banks of the river , about [seven miles across [country]4087-country]4086-seven miles across country . [Hadria]211-hadria was in high spirits , as [they]4088-their trundled along [the white roads]4089-the white roads with the wind in [their]4088-their faces , [the hills]413-the hills and the blue sky spread out before [them]4088-their , the pleasant sound of the wheels and the trotting of the pony setting [their]4088-their thoughts to rhythm . The trees were all shedding their last yellow leaves , and the air was full of those faded memories of better days , whirling in wild companies across [the road]4037-the road , rushing upward on the breast of some vagabond gust , drifting , spinning , shuddering along [the roadside]4092-the roadside , to lie there at last , quiet , among a host of [brothers]377-brothers , with little passing tremors , as if ( said [Valeria]109-valeria ) [they]4088-their were silently sobbing because of [their]4088-their banishment from [[their]4088-their kingdom of the air]4094-their kingdom of the air . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , though [she]109-valeria enjoyed the beauty of the day and the scenery , seemed sad of mood . “[0-i] This weather recalls so many autumns , ” [she]109-valeria said . “[0-i] It reminds [me]0-i too vividly of wonderful days , whose like [I]0-i shall never see again , and [friends , many of whom are dead]790-friends , many of whom are dead , and [many lost sight of in this inexorable coming and going of]791-many lost sight of in this inexorable coming and going of [people and things]792-people and things , this inexorable change that goes on for ever . [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i should go mad at times , because it will not stop , either in [myself]0-i or [others]432-others . ” “[0-i] Ah , that is a dreadful thought ! ” “[0-i] It comes to [me]0-i so insistently , perhaps , because of [my]0-i roving life , ” [she]0-i said . [She]0-i paused for a moment , and then [she]0-i fell into one of [her]0-i exalted moods , when [she]0-i seemed to lose consciousness of the ordinary conditions around [her]0-i , or rather to pierce deeper into their significance and beauty . [Her]0-i speech would , at such times , become rhythmic and picturesque ; [she]0-i evidently saw vivid images before [her]0-i , in which [her]0-i ideas embodied themselves . “[0-i] [Most people who live always in one place]794-most people who live always in one place see the changes creeping on so gradually that [they]794-most people who live always in one place scarcely feel them , but with [me]0-i this universal flux displays itself pitilessly , [I]0-i can not escape . Go where [I]0-i will , there is something to measure the changes by . A shoal of yellow leaves whispers to [me]0-i of seasons long ago , and the old past days , with [their]795-their own intimate character that nothing ever repeats , flash before [me]0-i again with the vividness of yesterday ; and a flight of birds — ah ! if [I]0-i could express what [they]795-their recall ! The dead years pass again in a great procession , a motley company — some like [emperors]796-emperors , crowned and richly dowered , with the sound of trumpets and the tramping of many obsequious feet ; and others like [beggars]797-beggars , despoiled and hungry , trudging along [a dusty high road]798-a dusty high road , or like grey pilgrims bound , with bleeding feet , for [a far - off shrine]799-a far - off shrine . ” [They]4095-they entered [a little beech - wood]4096-a little beech - wood , whose leaves made a light of their own , strange and mystical . “[800-you] [Yours]800-you must have been a wonderful life ! ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[800-you] Yes , [I]0-i have seen and felt many things , ” answered [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , stirred by the intoxication of the motion and the wind and the sunlight , “[0-i] life has been to [me]0-i a series of intense emotions , as it will be to [you]800-you , [I]0-i fear — ” “[800-you] [You]800-you fear ? ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[800-you] Yes ; for that means suffering . If [you]800-you feel , [you]800-you are at the mercy of all things . Every wind that blows uses [you]800-you as an Æolian harp . ” “[800-you] That must be charming , at least for [those who live in [[your]800-you neighbourhood]802-your neighbourhood]801-those who live in your neighbourhood , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[801-those who live in your neighbourhood] No ; for often the harp rings false . Its strings get loosened ; one hangs slack and jars , and where then is [your]800-you harmony ? ” “[329-one] [One]329-one would run the risk of many things rather than let one 's strings lie dumb , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[329-one] What a dangerous temperament [you]800-you have ! ” cried [Valeria]109-valeria , looking round at the glowing face beside [her]109-valeria . “[329-one] [I]0-i must take [my]0-i risks , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i doubt if [you]800-you know what risks there are . ” “[0-i] Then [I]0-i must find out , ” [she]0-i answered . “[0-i] [One]329-one plays with fire so recklessly before one has been burnt . ” [Hadria]211-hadria was silent . The words sounded ominous . “[329-one] Will can do so much , ” [she]0-i said at length . “[329-one] Do [you]800-you believe in the power of the human will to break the back of circumstance ? ” “[800-you] Oh , yes ; but the effort expended in breaking its back sometimes leaves [one]329-one prone , with a victory that arrives ironically too late . However [I]0-i do n't wish to discourage [you]800-you . There is no doubt that human will has triumphed over everything — but death . ” Again the sound of the pony 's hoofs sounded through the silence , in a cheerful trot upon [the white roads]4089-the white roads . [They]4098-they were traversing [an open , breezy country]4099-an open , breezy country , chequered with [wooded hollows]4100-wooded hollows , where generally [a village]4101-a village sought shelter from the winds . And [these patches of foliage]4102-these patches of foliage were golden and red in the meditative autumn sunshine , which seemed as if it were a little sad at the thought of parting with [the old earth]4103-the old earth for the coming winter . “[0-i] [I]0-i think the impossible lesson to learn would be renouncement , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i can not conceive how [anyone]806-anyone could say to [himself]806-anyone , while [he]806-anyone had longings and life still in [him]806-anyone , ‘ [I]0-i will give up this that [I]0-i might have learnt ; [I]0-i will stop short here where [I]0-i might press forward ; [I]0-i will allow this or that to curtail [me]0-i and rob [me]0-i of [my]0-i possible experience . ’ ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i confess that has been [my]0-i feeling too , though [I]0-i admire the spirit that can renounce . ” “[0-i] Admire ? Oh , yes , perhaps ; though [I]0-i am not so sure that the submissive nature has not been too much glorified — in theory . [Nobody]3732-nobody pays much attention to it in practice , by the way . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria laughed . “[3732-nobody] What [an observant young woman]808-an observant young woman [you]0-i are . ” “[808-an observant young woman] Renunciation is always preached to [girls]3769-girls , [you]810-you know , ” said [Hadria—“preached]117-hadria—“preached[810-you] to [them]3769-girls when as yet [they]3769-girls have nothing more than a rattle and a rag - doll to renounce . And later , when [they]3769-girls set about the business of [their]3769-girls life , and resign [their]3769-girls liberty , [their]3769-girls talents , [their]3769-girls health , [their]3769-girls opportunity , [their]3769-girls beauty ( if [they]3769-girls have it ) , then [people]3687-people gradually fall away from the despoiled and obedient being , and flock round the still unchastened creature who retains what [the gods]812-the gods have given [her]813-her , and asks for more . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i fear [you]0-i are indeed [a still unchastened creature]814-a still unchastened creature ! ” “[0-i] Certainly ; there is no encouragement to chasten [oneself]815-oneself . [People]3687-people do n't stand by [the docile members of Society]817-the docile members of society . [They]3687-people commend [[their]3687-people saints]818-their saints , but [they]3687-people drink to [[their]3687-people sinners]819-their sinners . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria smiled . “[3687-people] It is true , ” [she]109-valeria admitted . “[3687-people] [A woman]3753-a woman must not renounce too much if [she]3753-a woman desires to retain [her]3753-a woman influence . ” “[3687-people] Pas trop de zèle , ” [Hadria]211-hadria quoted . “[3687-people] There is something truly unmanageable about [you]0-i , [[my]0-i dear]3722-my dear ! ” cried [Valeria]109-valeria , much amused . “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i too have had just that sort of instinct , just that imperious demand , just that impatience of restraint . [I]0-i too regarded [myself]0-i and [my]0-i powers as [mine]0-i to use as [I]0-i would , responsible only to [my]0-i own conscience . [I]0-i decided to have freedom though the heavens should fall . [I]0-i was unfitted by temperament to face [the world]334-the world , but [I]0-i was equally unfitted to pay the price for protection — the blackmail that society levies on [a woman]3753-a woman : surrender of body and of soul . What could [one]329-one expect , in such a case , but disaster ? [I]0-i often envy now [the simple - minded woman who pays [her]825-the simple - minded woman who pays her price and has her reward price and has [her]825-the simple - minded woman who pays her price and has her reward reward]825-the simple - minded woman who pays her price and has her reward — such as it is . ” “[826-she] Ah ! such as it is ! ” echoed [Hadria]211-hadria . “[826-she] Who was it said , the other day , that [she]826-she thought [a wise woman]827-a wise woman always took things as they were , and made the best of them ? ” “[828-some dull spirit] [Some dull spirit]828-some dull spirit . ” “[828-some dull spirit] And yet [a practical spirit]829-a practical spirit . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am quite sure , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] that [the stokers of hell]830-the stokers of hell are [practical spirits]831-practical spirits . ” “[831-practical spirits] [[Your]0-i mother]832-your mother must have had [her]832-your mother work cut out for [her]832-your mother when [she]832-your mother undertook to bring [you]0-i up , ” exclaimed [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[832-your mother] So [she]832-your mother always insinuates , ” replied [Hadria]211-hadria demurely . [They]4104-they were spinning down hill now , into [a warm bit of country watered by [the river]437-the river]4105-a warm bit of country watered by the river , and [Hadria]211-hadria drew rein . [The spot]395-the spot was so pleasant that [they]4104-they alighted , tied the pony to a tree , and wandered over the grass to [the river]437-the river 's edge . [Hadria]211-hadria picked [her]211-hadria way from stone to slippery stone , into [the middle of [the river]437-the river]4109-the middle of the river , where there was comparatively safe standing room . Here [she]211-hadria was suddenly inspired to execute the steps of a reel , while [Valeria]109-valeria stood dismayed on the bank , expecting every moment , to see the dance end in the realms of the trout . But [Hadria]211-hadria kept [her]211-hadria footing , and continued to step it with much solemnity . Meanwhile , [two young men on horseback]4111-two young men on horseback were coming down [the road]4037-the road ; but as a group of trees hid it from [the river]437-the river at this point , [they]4111-two young men on horseback were not noticed . [The horsemen]4114-the horsemen stopped suddenly when [they]4111-two young men on horseback cleared the group of trees . The figure of [a young woman in mid - stream , dancing a reel with extreme energy and correctness , and without a smile]4115-a young woman in mid - stream , dancing a reel with extreme energy and correctness , and without a smile , was sufficiently surprising to arrest [them]4111-two young men on horseback . “[832-your mother] As [I]0-i thought , ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] it is [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins ! ” “[94-harold wilkins] [I]0-i shall be glad to see [this conquering hero]833-this conquering hero , ” said [Valeria]109-valeria . [Hadria]211-hadria , who had known [the young man]4116-the young man since [her]211-hadria childhood , waited calmly as [he]4116-the young man turned [his]4116-the young man horse 's head towards [the river]437-the river , and advanced across the grass , raising [his]4116-the young man hat . “[0-i] Good morning , [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton . ” “[112-miss fullerton] Good morning , ” [Hadria]211-hadria returned , from [her]211-hadria rock . “[833-this conquering hero] [You]833-this conquering hero seem to be having rather an agreeable time of it . ” “[833-this conquering hero] Very . Are [you]833-this conquering hero fond of dancing ? ” [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins was noted , far and wide , for [his]94-harold wilkins dancing , and the question was wounding . [He]94-harold wilkins was tall and loosely built , with brown expressionless eyes , dark hair , a pink complexion , shelving forehead , and a weak yet obstinate mouth . [[His]94-harold wilkins companion]4118-his companion also was tall and dark , but [his]94-harold wilkins face was pale , [his]94-harold wilkins forehead broad and high , and a black moustache covered [his]94-harold wilkins upper lip . [He]94-harold wilkins had raised [his]94-harold wilkins hat gracefully on finding that [the dancer in mid - stream]4119-the dancer in mid - stream was [an acquaintance of [[his]94-harold wilkins companion]4118-his companion]4120-an acquaintance of his companion , and [he]94-harold wilkins shewed great self - possession in appearing to regard the dancing of reels in these circumstances , as an incident that might naturally be expected . Not a sign of surprise betrayed itself in the face , not even a glimmer of curiosity . [Hadria]211-hadria was so tickled by this finished behaviour under difficulties , that [she]211-hadria took [her]211-hadria cue from it , and decided to treat the matter in the same polished spirit . [She]211-hadria too would take it all decorously for granted . [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins introduced [[his]94-harold wilkins friend]4122-his friend : [Mr. Hubert Temperley]118-hubert . [Hadria]211-hadria bowed gracefully in reply to [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert 's salute . “[833-this conquering hero] Do n't [you]834-you feel a little cramped out there ? ” asked [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins . “[834-you] Dear [me]0-i , no , ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria in mock surprise . “[834-you] What could induce [you]834-you to suppose [I]0-i would come out here if [I]0-i felt cramped ? ” “[834-you] Are [you]834-you — are [you]834-you thinking of coming on [shore]835-shore ? Can [I]0-i help [you]834-you ? ” “[834-you] Thank [you]834-you , ” replied [Hadria]211-hadria . “[834-you] This is a merely temporary resting - place . [We]836-we ought to be getting on ; [we]836-we have some miles yet to drive , ” and [she]211-hadria hurried [[her]211-hadria friend]4123-her friend away . [They]836-we were conducted to [the pony - cart]4124-the pony - cart by [the cavaliers]4125-the cavaliers , who raised [their]4125-the cavaliers hats , as [the ladies]4126-the ladies drove off at a merry pace , bowing [their]4126-the ladies farewells . “[3844-woman] The eternal riddle ! ” [Temperley]118-hubert exclaimed , as [they]836-we turned the corner of [the road]4037-the road . “[3844-woman] What is the eternal riddle ? ” [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins enquired . “[3844-woman] [Woman]3844-woman , [woman]3844-woman ! ” [Temperley]118-hubert replied , a little impatiently . [He]118-hubert had not found [young Wilkins]94-harold wilkins quick to catch [his]118-hubert meaning during the two hours ' ride , and it occurred to [him]118-hubert that [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton would have been [a more interesting companion]4128-a more interesting companion . [He]118-hubert made a good many enquiries about [her]112-miss fullerton and [[her]112-miss fullerton family]4129-her family , on the way back to [Drumgarren]12-drumgarren . “[3844-woman] [We]839-we are inviited to tennis at [[their]840-their house]841-their house , for next Tuesday , ” said [Harold]94-harold wilkins , “[3844-woman] so [you]842-you will have a chance of pursuing the acquaintance . For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i do n't admire [that sort of girl]843-that sort of girl . ” “[0-i] Do n't [you]0-i ? [I]0-i am attracted by originality .
