Does [she]211-hadria play well ? ” “[211-hadria] Well , [I]0-i suppose so . [She]211-hadria plays things without any tune that bore [one]329-one to death , but [I]0-i daresay [you]0-i would admire it . [She]211-hadria composes too , [I]0-i am told . ” “[211-hadria] Really ? Dear [me]0-i , [I]0-i must make a point of having a talk with [her]211-hadria , on the earliest opportunity . ” Meanwhile , [the occupants of [the pony - cart]4124-the pony - cart]4130-the occupants of the pony - cart had arrived at [Darachanarvan]13-darachanarvan , where [they]4130-the occupants of the pony - cart were to put up [the pony]4132-the pony and have luncheon . It was [a prosaic little Scottish town]4133-a prosaic little scottish town , with only a beautiful survival , here and there , from the past . After luncheon , [they]4130-the occupants of the pony - cart wandered down to [the banks of [the river]437-the river]479-the banks of the river , and watched [the trout]4136-the trout and [the running water]4137-the running water . [Hadria]211-hadria had long been wishing to find out what [[her]211-hadria oracle]4138-her oracle thought about certain burning questions on which [the sisters]3872-the sisters held such strong , and such unpopular sentiments , but just because the feeling was so keen , it was difficult to broach the subject . An opportunity came when [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria spoke of [her]109-valeria past . [Hadria]211-hadria was able to read between the lines . When [a mere girl]4140-a mere girl , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria had been thrown on [the world]334-the world — brilliant , handsome , impulsive , generous — to pass through a fiery ordeal , and to emerge with aspirations as high as ever , but with [her]109-valeria radiant hopes burnt out . But [she]109-valeria did not dwell on this side of the picture ; [she]109-valeria emphasized rather , the possibility of holding on through storm and stress to the truth that is born in one ; to belief in “[211-hadria] the noblest and wildest hopes ( if [you]850-you like to call them so ) that ever thrilled generous hearts . ” But [she]109-valeria gave no encouragement to certain of [[her]109-valeria companion]3995-her companion 's most vehement sentiments . [She]109-valeria seemed to yearn for exactly that side of life from which [the younger]3918-the younger shrank with so much horror . [She]109-valeria saw it under an entirely different aspect . [Hadria]211-hadria felt thrown back on [herself]211-hadria , lonely once more . “[851-you] [You]851-you have seen [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , ” [she]211-hadria said at length , “[91-mrs. gordon] what do [you]851-you think of [her]91-mrs. gordon ? ” “[851-you] Nothing ; [she]91-mrs. gordon does not inspire thought . ” “[851-you] Yet once [she]91-mrs. gordon was [a person]852-a person , not a thing . ” “[91-mrs. gordon] , If [a woman]3753-a woman ca n't keep [her]3753-a woman head above water in [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's position , [she]3753-a woman must be [a feeble sort of person]854-a feeble sort of person . ” “[3753-a woman] [I]0-i should not dare to say that , until [I]0-i had been put through [the mill]855-the mill [myself]0-i , and come out unpulverised . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria failed to see what there was so very dreadful in [[Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's lot]4144-mrs. gordon 's lot . [She]91-mrs. gordon had , perhaps , rather more [children]626-children than was necessary , but otherwise — “[0-i] Oh , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] [you]0-i might be [a mere man]856-a mere man ! That is just what [[my]0-i brothers]857-my brothers say . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't understand what [you]0-i mean , ” said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[0-i] Do explain . ” “[0-i] Do [you]0-i actually — [you]0-i of [all people]858-all people — not recognize and hate the idea that lies so obviously at the root of all the life that is swarming round [us]859-us — ? ” [Valeria]109-valeria studied [[her]109-valeria companion]3995-her companion 's excited face . “[0-i] Are [you]0-i in revolt against the very basis of existence ? ” [she]109-valeria asked curiously . “[0-i] No : at least ... but this is not what [I]0-i am driving at exactly , ” replied [Hadria]211-hadria , turning uneasily away from the close scrutiny . “[0-i] Do n't [you]0-i know — oh , do n't [you]0-i see — how many women secretly hate , and shrink from this brutal domestic idea that fashions [their]860-them fate for [them]860-them ? ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's interest quickened . “[0-i] Nothing strikes [me]0-i so much as the tamely acquiescent spirit of [the average woman]624-the average woman , and [I]0-i doubt if [you]0-i would find [another woman in [England]14-england]862-another woman in england to describe the domestic existence as [you]0-i do . ” “[862-another woman in england] Perhaps not ; tradition prevents [them]860-them from using bad language , but [they]860-them feel , [they]860-them feel . ” “[860-them] [Young girls]863-young girls perhaps , brought up very ignorantly , find life a little scaring at first , but [they]863-young girls soon settle down into [happy wives]864-happy wives and [mothers]865-mothers . ” “[865-mothers] As the fibre grows coarser , ” assented [Hadria]211-hadria . “[865-mothers] No ; as the affections awaken , and the instincts that hold society together , come into play . [I]0-i have revolted [myself]0-i from the conditions of life , but it is a hopeless business — beating [one]329-one 's wings against the bars . ” “[329-one] The bars are , half of them , of human construction , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[329-one] and against those one may surely be allowed to beat . ” “[329-one] Of human construction ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i mean that prejudice , rather than instinct , has built up the system that [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon so amiably represents . ” “[91-mrs. gordon] Prejudice has perhaps taken advantage of instinct to establish a somewhat tyrannical tradition , ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria admitted , “[91-mrs. gordon] but instinct is at the bottom of it . There is , of course , in [our]867-our society , no latitude for variety of type ; that is the fault of so many institutions . ” “[211-hadria] The ordinary domestic idea may have been suitable when [women]606-women were emerging from the condition of simple animals , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[120-nature] but now it seems to [me]0-i to be out of date . ” “[120-nature] It can never be entirely out of date , dear [Hadria]211-hadria . [Nature]120-nature has asked of [women]606-women a great and hard service , but [she]120-nature has given [them]606-women the maternal instinct and its joys , in compensation for the burden of this task , which would otherwise be intolerable and impossible . It can only be undertaken at the instigation of some stupendous impetus , that blinds [the victim]870-the victim to the nature of [her]120-nature mission . It must be a sort of obsession ; an intense personal instinct , amounting to madness . [Nature]120-nature , being determined to be well served in this direction , has supplied the necessary monomania , and the domestic idea , as [you]871-you call it , grows up round this central fact . ” [Hadria]211-hadria moved restlessly to and fro by [the river bank]4147-the river bank . “[329-one] [One]329-one presumes to look upon [oneself]329-one , at first — in [one]329-one 's earliest youth , ” [she]211-hadria said , “[329-one] as undoubtedly human , with human needs and rights and dignities . But this turns out to be an illusion . It is as an animal that one has to play the really important part in life ; it is by submitting to the demands of society , in this respect , that [one]329-one wins rewards and commendation . Of course , if one likes to throw in a few ornamental extras , so much the better ; it keeps up appearances and the aspect of refined sentiment — but the main point — ” “[871-you] [You]871-you are extravagant ! ” cried [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[871-you] That is not the right way to look at it . ” “[871-you] It is certainly not the convenient way to look at it . It is doubtless wise to weave as many garlands as [you]871-you can , to deck [yourself]871-you for the sacrifice . By that means , [you]871-you do n't quite see which way [you]871-you are going , because of the masses of elegant vegetation . ” “[871-you] Ah ! [Hadria]211-hadria , [you]871-you exaggerate , [you]871-you distort ; [you]871-you forget so many things — the sentiments , the affections , the thousand details that hallow that crude foundation which [you]871-you see only bare and unsoftened . ” “[871-you] A repulsive object tastefully decorated , is to [me]0-i only the more repulsive , ” returned [Hadria]211-hadria , with suppressed passion . “[871-you] There will come a day when [you]871-you will feel very differently , ” prophesied [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[871-you] Perhaps . Why should [I]0-i , more than [the others]303-the others , remain uninfluenced by the usual processes of blunting , and grinding down , and stupefying , till [one]329-one grows accustomed to [one]329-one 's function , [one]329-one 's intolerable function ? ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3722-my dear , [[my]0-i dear]3722-my dear ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry if [I]0-i shock [you]871-you , but that is how [I]0-i feel . [I]0-i have seen this sort of traditional existence and nothing else , all [my]0-i life , and [I]0-i have been brought up to it , with the rest — prepared and decked out like some animal for market — all in the most refined and graceful manner possible ; but how can [one]329-one help seeing through the disguise ; how can [one]329-one be blind to the real nature of the transaction , and to the fate that awaits [one]329-one — awaits [one]329-one as inexorably as death , unless by some force of [one]329-one 's own , with all the world — [friends]886-friends and [enemies]887-enemies — in opposition , [one]329-one can avert it ? ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria remained silent . “[871-you] [You]871-you can avert it , ” [she]109-valeria said at last ; “[871-you] but at what cost ? ” “[109-valeria] [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , [I]0-i would rather sweep a crossing , [I]0-i would rather beg in [the streets]889-the streets , than submit to the indignity of such a life ! ” “[871-you] Then what do [you]871-you intend to do instead ? ” “[871-you] Ah ! there 's the difficulty . What can [one]329-one do instead , without breaking [somebody]891-somebody 's heart ? Nothing , except breaking [one]329-one 's own . And even putting that difficulty aside , it seems as if [everyone]3726-everyone 's hand were against [a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for [her]894-a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for her]894-a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for her . ” “[894-a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for her] No , no , it is not so bad as that . There are many openings now for [women]606-women . ” “[606-women] But , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[606-women] as far as [I]0-i can gather , ordinary ability is not sufficient to enable [them]606-women to make a scanty living . The talent that would take [a man]3704-a man to the top of the tree is required to keep [a woman]3753-a woman in a meagre supply of bread and butter . ” “[606-women] Allowing for exaggeration , that is more or less the case , ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria admitted . “[606-women] [I]0-i have revolted against [the common lot]898-the common lot , ” [she]0-i went on after a pause , “[0-i] and [you]899-you see what comes of it ; [I]0-i am alone in [the world]334-the world . [One]329-one does not think of that when [one]329-one is quite young . ” “[329-one] Would [you]899-you rather be in [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's position than in [your]899-you own ? ” “[899-you] [I]0-i doubt not that [she]91-mrs. gordon is happier . ” “[899-you] But would [you]899-you change with [her]91-mrs. gordon , surrendering all that [she]91-mrs. gordon has surrendered ? ” “[899-you] Yes , if [I]0-i were of [her]91-mrs. gordon temperament . ” “[0-i] Ah ! [you]899-you always evade the question . Remaining [yourself]899-you , would [you]899-you change with [her]91-mrs. gordon ? ” “[899-you] [I]0-i would never have allowed [my]0-i life to grow like [hers]91-mrs. gordon . ” “[0-i] No , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , laughing , “[0-i] [you]899-you would probably have run away or killed [yourself]899-you or [somebody]891-somebody , long before this . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria could not honestly deny this possibility . After a pause [she]109-valeria said : “[899-you] [A woman]3753-a woman can not afford to despise the dictates of Nature . [She]3753-a woman may escape certain troubles in that way ; but Nature is not to be cheated , [she]3753-a woman makes [[her]3753-a woman victim]905-her victim pay [her]3753-a woman debt in another fashion . There is no escape . The centuries are behind one , with all [their]906-their weight of heredity and habit ; the order of society adds its pressure — [one]329-one 's own emotional needs . Ah , no ! it does not answer to pit [oneself]329-one against [one]329-one 's race , to bid defiance to the fundamental laws of life . ” “[906-their] Such then are the alternatives , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , moving close to [[the river]437-the river 's brink]4149-the river 's brink , and casting two big stones into the current . “[906-their] There stand the devil and [the deep sea]909-the deep sea . ” “[899-you] [You]899-you are too young to have come to that sad conclusion , ” said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[899-you] But [I]0-i have n't , ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i still believe in revolt . ” [The other]3994-the other shook [her]3994-the other head . “[0-i] And what about love ? Are [you]899-you going through life without the one thing that makes it bearable ? “ [I]109-valeria would not purchase it at such a cost . If [I]109-valeria ca n't have it without despoiling [myself]109-valeria of everything that is worth possessing , [I]109-valeria prefer to go without . ”[109-valeria] “ [You]899-you do n't know what [you]899-you say ! ”[109-valeria] exclaimed [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ But why ? Love would be ruined and desecrated . [I]109-valeria understand by it a sympathy so perfect , and a reverence so complete , that the conditions of ordinary domestic existence would be impossible , unthinkable , in connection with it . ”[109-valeria] “ So do [I]109-valeria understand love . But it comes , perhaps , once in a century , and if one is too fastidious , it passes by and leaves [one]329-one forlorn : at best , it comes only to open the gates of [Paradise]15-paradise , for a moment , and to close [them]4152-them again , and leave one in outer darkness . ”[109-valeria] “ Always ? ”[109-valeria] “ [I]109-valeria believe always , ”[109-valeria] answered [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . The running of [the river]437-the river sounded peacefully in the pause that followed . “ Well , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria at length , raising [her]211-hadria head with a long sigh , “ one can not do better than follow [one]329-one 's own instinct and thought of the moment . Regret may come , do what [one]329-one may . [One]329-one can not escape from [one]329-one 's own temperament . ”[211-hadria] “ [One]329-one can modify it . ”[109-valeria] “ [I]211-hadria can not even wish to modify [mine]211-hadria , so that [I]211-hadria should become amenable to these social demands . [I]211-hadria stand in hopeless opposition to the scheme of life that [I]211-hadria have grown up amongst , to the universal scheme of life indeed , as understood by [the world]334-the world up to this day . Audacious , is it not ? ”[211-hadria] “ [I]109-valeria like audacity , ”[109-valeria] returned [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ As [I]109-valeria understand [you]211-hadria , [you]211-hadria require an altogether new dispensation ! ”[109-valeria] [Hadria]211-hadria gave a half smile , conscious of [her]211-hadria stupendous demand . Then [she]211-hadria said , with a peculiar movement of the head , as if throwing off a heavy weight , and looking before [her]211-hadria steadily : “ Yes , [I]211-hadria require a new dispensation . ”[211-hadria] [HUBERT TEMPERLEY]118-hubert made a point of going to the tennis - party , on Tuesday , at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , in order to talk to [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton . [He]118-hubert had not expected to find original musical talent in [this out - of - the - way place]911-this out - of - the - way place . [Hadria]211-hadria was in a happy mood , for [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother had so far overcome [her]520-her mother prejudice against [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , as to ask [her]211-hadria to join the party . The festivity had , therefore , lost its usual quality of melancholy . It was a warm afternoon , and [every one]913-every one seemed cheerful “ and almost intelligent , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria commented . The first words that [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert uttered , made [her]211-hadria turn to [him]118-hubert , in surprise . [She]211-hadria was so unaccustomed to be interested in what [the people about here]914-the people about here had to say . [Even intelligent visitors]915-even intelligent visitors usually adopted the tone of [the inhabitants]916-the inhabitants . [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert 's manner was very polished . [His]118-hubert accent denoted mental cultivation . [He]118-hubert spoke with eloquence of literature , and praised enthusiastically most great names dating securely from the hallowed past . Of modern literature [he]118-hubert was [a stern critic]917-a stern critic ; of music [he]118-hubert spoke with ardour . “ [I]118-hubert hear that [you]211-hadria not only perform but compose , [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton , ”[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert said . “ As soon as [I]118-hubert heard that , [I]118-hubert felt that [I]118-hubert must make [your]211-hadria acquaintance . [[My]118-hubert friends]4159-my friends , [the Gordons]92-the gordons , are very charming , but [they]4159-my friends do n't understand a note of music , and [I]118-hubert am badly off for a kindred spirit . ”[118-hubert] “ [My]211-hadria composing is a very mild affair , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria answered . “ [I]211-hadria suppose [you]118-hubert are more fortunate . ”[211-hadria] “ Not much . [I]118-hubert am pretty busy [you]211-hadria see . [I]118-hubert have [my]118-hubert profession fession . [I]118-hubert play a good deal — the piano and the ' cello are [my]118-hubert instruments . But [my]118-hubert difficulty is to find [someone]4160-someone to accompany [me]118-hubert . [[My]118-hubert sister]4161-my sister does when [she]4161-my sister can , but of course with [a house]4162-a house and [family]4163-family to look after — [I]118-hubert am sometimes selfish enough to wish [she]4161-my sister had not married . [We]4164-we used to be [such good friends]4165-such good friends . ”[118-hubert] “ Is that all over ? ”[118-hubert] “ It is different . [She]4161-my sister always manages to be busy now , ”[118-hubert] said [Temperley]118-hubert in a slightly ironical tone . [He]118-hubert plunged once more , into a musical discussion . [Hadria]211-hadria had reluctantly to cut it short , in order to arrange tennis - matches . This task was performed as usual , somewhat recklessly . Polite and amiable in indiscriminate fashion , [Hadria]211-hadria ignored the secret jealousies and heart - burnings of [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood , only to recognise and repent [her]211-hadria mistakes when too late . To - day [she]211-hadria was even more unchastened than usual in [her]211-hadria dealings with inflammable social material . “ [Hadria]211-hadria ! ”[97-mrs. fullerton] cried [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , taking [her]211-hadria aside , “ How could [you]211-hadria ask [Cecilia Gordon]121-cecilia gordon to play with [young McKenzie]122-young mckenzie ? [You]211-hadria know [[their]122-young mckenzie families]4166-their families are not on speaking terms ! ”[97-mrs. fullerton] [Everyone]3726-everyone , except [the culprit]920-the culprit , had remarked the haughty manner in which [Cecilia]121-cecilia gordon wielded [her]121-cecilia gordon racket , and the gloomy silence in which the set was played . [Hadria]211-hadria , though not impenitent , laughed . “ How does [Miss Gordon]123-miss gordon manage to be energetic and chilling at the same time ! ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria exclaimed . [The Gordons]92-the gordons and [the McKenzies]921-the mckenzies , like [hostile armies]922-hostile armies , looked on grimly . [Everyone]3726-everyone felt awkward , and to feel awkward was nothing less than tragic , in the eyes of [the assembly]924-the assembly . “ Oh , [Hadria]211-hadria , how could [you]211-hadria ? ”[91-mrs. gordon] cried [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , coming up in [her]91-mrs. gordon elaborate toilette , which expressed almost as much of the character of [its wearer]925-its wearer as was indicated by [her]91-mrs. gordon thin , chattering tones , and unreposeful manner . [Her]91-mrs. gordon mode of dress was rich and florid — very obvious in its effects , very naïf . [She]91-mrs. gordon was built on a large scale , and might have been graceful , had not [her]91-mrs. gordon mental constitution refused to permit , or to inspire , that which physical construction seemed to intend . [She]91-mrs. gordon distributed smiles on all hands , of no particular meaning . Though still [a young woman]926-a young woman , [she]91-mrs. gordon looked worn and wearied . However , [her]91-mrs. gordon rôle was cheerfulness , and [she]91-mrs. gordon smiled on industriously . “ [I]211-hadria am so sorry , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ the quarrel went clean out of [my]211-hadria head . [They]4167-they are so well matched . But [[your]211-hadria sister - in - law]4168-your sister - in - law will never forgive [me]211-hadria . ”[211-hadria] “ Oh , well , never mind , [[my]91-mrs. gordon dear]3722-my dear ; it is [your]211-hadria way , [I]91-mrs. gordon know . Only of course it is awkward . ”[91-mrs. gordon] “ What can be done ? Shall [I]91-mrs. gordon run in and separate [them]4167-they ? ”[91-mrs. gordon] “ Oh , [Hadria]211-hadria , [you]211-hadria are ridiculous ! ”[211-hadria] “ [I]91-mrs. gordon was not meant for society , ”[91-mrs. gordon] [she]91-mrs. gordon said , in a depressed tone . “ Oh , [you]211-hadria will soon get into the way of it , ”[91-mrs. gordon] cried [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon encouragingly . “ [I]91-mrs. gordon am afraid [I]91-mrs. gordon shall . ”[91-mrs. gordon] [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon stared . “ [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert , [I]91-mrs. gordon can never make out what [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton really means . Do see if [you]211-hadria can . ”[91-mrs. gordon] “ How could [I]91-mrs. gordon expect to succeed where [you]211-hadria have failed ? ”[91-mrs. gordon] “ Oh , [[you]211-hadria [men]3698-men]4170-you men are so much cleverer than [[we]4172-we poor women]4173-we poor women , ”[927-the lady archly] cried [the lady archly]927-the lady archly . [Temperley]118-hubert was obviously of the same opinion . But [he]118-hubert found some appropriate [Chesterfieldian]124-chesterfieldian reply , while [Hadria]211-hadria , to [his]118-hubert annoyance , hurried off to [her]211-hadria duties , full of good resolutions . Having introduced [a couple of [sisters]378-sisters]928-a couple of sisters to [[their]928-a couple of sisters brother]930-their brother , [she]211-hadria grew desperate . A set had just ended , and [the sisters]3872-the sisters were asked to play . This time , no mistake had been made in the selection of [partners]932-partners , so far as the question of sentiment was concerned , but [they]3872-the sisters were fatally ill - assorted as to strength . However , [Hadria]211-hadria said with a sigh , if [their]3872-the sisters emotions were satisfied , it was really all [they]3872-the sisters could expect . Considering the number of family feuds , [she]211-hadria did not see [her]211-hadria way to arranging both points , to [everyone]3726-everyone 's satisfaction . [Hadria]211-hadria was surrounded by [a small group]934-a small group , among whom were [Temperley]118-hubert , [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , and [Mr. Hawkesley]125-mr. hawkesley , [the brother who had been introduced to [[his]125-mr. hawkesley sisters]491-his sisters]935-the brother who had been introduced to his sisters . “ How very handsome [Hadria]211-hadria is looking this afternoon , ”[91-mrs. gordon] said [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , “ and how becoming that dark green gown is . ”[91-mrs. gordon] [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton smiled . “ Yes , [she]211-hadria does look [her]211-hadria best to - day . [I]97-mrs. fullerton think [she]211-hadria has been improving , of late , in [her]211-hadria looks . ”[97-mrs. fullerton] “ That 's just what [we]938-the group that had gathered round hadria have all noticed . There is so much animation in [her]211-hadria face ; [she]211-hadria is such [a sweet girl]4174-a sweet girl . ”[109-valeria] [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , who was not of the stuff that martyrs are made of , muttered something incoherent and deserted [[her]109-valeria neighbour]937-her neighbour . [She]109-valeria came up to [the group that had gathered round [Hadria]211-hadria]938-the group that had gathered round hadria . “ Ah , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , ”[590-the latter] cried [the latter]590-the latter , “ [I]590-the latter am so glad to see [you]109-valeria at large again . [I]590-the latter was afraid [you]109-valeria were getting bored . ”[590-the latter] “ [I]109-valeria was , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria frankly , “ so [I]940-the young men came away . ”[940-the young men] [The young men]940-the young men laughed . “ If only [everybody]3781-everybody could go away when [he]3781-everybody was bored , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “ how peaceful it would be , and what small tennis - parties [one]329-one would have ! ”[211-hadria] “ Always excepting tennis - parties at [this house]4177-this house , ”[118-hubert] said [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert . “ [I]109-valeria do n't think [any house]4178-any house would survive , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ If [people]3687-people do not meet to exchange ideas , [I]109-valeria ca n't see the object of [their]3687-people meeting at all . ”[109-valeria] “ What a revolutionary sentiment ! ”[118-hubert] cried [Temperley]118-hubert , laughing . “ Where would [society]4180-society be , on that principle ? ”[118-hubert] [Hadria]211-hadria was called away , at that moment , and [the group]941-the group politely wavered between duty and inclination . [Temperley]118-hubert and [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria strolled off together , [his]118-hubert vast height bent deferentially towards [her]109-valeria . This air of deference proved somewhat superficial . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria found that [his]118-hubert opinions were of an immovable order , with very defined edges . In some indescribable fashion , those opinions partook of the general elegance of [his]118-hubert being . Not for worlds would [he]118-hubert have harboured an exaggerated or immoderate idea . In politics [he]118-hubert was conservative , but [he]118-hubert did not abuse [[his]118-hubert opponents]942-his opponents . [He]118-hubert smiled at [them]942-his opponents : [he]118-hubert saw no reason for supposing that [they]942-his opponents did not mean quite as well as [he]118-hubert did , possibly better . What [he]118-hubert did see reason to doubt , was [their]942-his opponents judgment . [His]118-hubert tolerance was urbane and superior . On all questions , however , whether [he]118-hubert knew much about [them]942-his opponents or little , [his]118-hubert judgment was final and absolute . [He]118-hubert swept away whole systems of thought that had shaken [the world]334-the world , with a confident phrase . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria looked at [him]118-hubert with increasing amazement . [He]118-hubert seemed unaccustomed to opposition . “ A vast deal of nonsense is talked in the name of philosophy , ”[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert observed , in a tone of gay self - confidence peculiar to [him]118-hubert , and more indicative of character than even what [he]118-hubert said . “ [People]3687-people seem to think that [they]3687-people have only to quote [Spencer]126-spencer or [Huxley]127-huxley , or take an interest in heredity , to justify [themselves]3687-people in throwing off all the trammels , as [they]3687-people would regard [them]3687-people , of duty and common sense . ”[118-hubert] “ [I]109-valeria have not observed that tendency , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ Really . [I]109-valeria regret to say that [I]109-valeria notice everywhere a disposition to evade responsibilities which , in former days , would have been honestly and contentedly accepted . ”[109-valeria] “ [Our]4182-we standards are all changing , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ It does not follow that [they]4183-they are changing for the worse . ”[109-valeria] “ It seems to [me]118-hubert that [they]4183-they are not so much changing , as disappearing altogether , ”[118-hubert] said [Temperley]118-hubert cheerfully , “ especially among [women]606-women . [We]4182-we hear a great deal about rights , but [we]4182-we hear nothing about duties . ”[118-hubert] “ [We]4182-we are perhaps , a little tired of hearing about duties , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ [You]118-hubert admit then what [I]118-hubert say , ”[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert returned placidly . “ [Every woman]3805-every woman wants to be [Mary]128-mary , and [no one]383-no one will be [Martha]129-martha . ”[118-hubert] “ [I]109-valeria make just the opposite complaint , ”[109-valeria] cried [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ Dear [me]109-valeria , quite a different way of looking at it . [I]109-valeria confess [I]109-valeria have scant patience with [these interfering women , who want to turn everything upside down]4187-these interfering women , who want to turn everything upside down , instead of quietly minding [their]4187-these interfering women , who want to turn everything upside down duties at [home]3770-home . ”[109-valeria] “ [I]109-valeria know it is difficult to make [people]3687-people understand , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , with malice . “ [I]118-hubert should esteem it a favour to be enlightened , ”[118-hubert] returned [Temperley]118-hubert . “ [You]118-hubert were just now condemning socialism , [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert , because [you]118-hubert say that it attempts to ignore the principle of the division of labour . Now , when [you]118-hubert lose patience with [the few women who are refusing to be Marthas]4190-the few women who are refusing to be marthas , [you]118-hubert ignore that principle [yourself]118-hubert . [You]118-hubert want [all women]4191-all women to do exactly the same sort of work , irrespective of [their]4191-all women ability or [their]4191-all women bent of mind . May [I]118-hubert ask why ? ”[118-hubert] “ Because [I]118-hubert consider that is the kind of work for which [they]4191-all women are best fitted , ”[118-hubert] replied [Temperley]118-hubert serenely . “ Then [you]118-hubert are to be judge and jury in the case ; [your]118-hubert opinion , not [theirs]4191-all women , is to decide the matter . Supposing [I]118-hubert were to take upon [myself]118-hubert to judge what [you]118-hubert were best fitted for , and were to claim , therefore , to decide for [you]118-hubert what sort of life [you]118-hubert should live , and what sort of work [you]118-hubert should undertake — ? ”[118-hubert] “ [I]118-hubert should feel every confidence in resigning [myself]118-hubert to [your]109-valeria able judgment , ”[118-hubert] said [Temperley]118-hubert , with a low bow . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria laughed . “ Ah , ”[109-valeria] [she]109-valeria said , “ [you]118-hubert are at present , on the conquering side , and can afford to jest on the subject . ”[109-valeria] “ It is no joke to jest with [an able woman]4192-an able woman , ”[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert returned . “ Seriously , [I]118-hubert have considerable sympathy with [your]109-valeria view , and no wish to treat it flippantly . But if [I]118-hubert am to treat it seriously , [I]118-hubert must admit frankly that [I]118-hubert think [you]109-valeria forget that , after all , [Nature]120-nature has something to say in this matter . ”[118-hubert] Engrossed in [their]944-they conversation , [they]944-they had , without thinking what [they]944-they were doing , passed through the open gate at the end of [the avenue]945-the avenue , and walked on along [the high road]946-the high road . Swarms of small birds flew out of the hedges , with a whirring sound , to settle further on , while an incessant chatter was kept up on each side . “ [I]118-hubert often think that [modern women]4193-modern women might take example from [these little creatures]4194-these little creatures , ”[118-hubert] said [Temperley]118-hubert , who , in common with [many self - sufficient persons]947-many self - sufficient persons , was fond of recommending humility to [others]432-others . “ [They]4194-these little creatures never attempt to shirk [their]4194-these little creatures lowly tasks on the plea of higher vocations . Not one turns from the path marked out by [[our]944-they great Mother]4195-our great mother , who also teaches [[her]4195-our great mother [human children]4197-human children]4196-her human children the same lesson of patient duty ; but , alas ! by [them]4194-these little creatures is less faithfully obeyed . ”[118-hubert] “ If [[our]944-they great Mother]4195-our great mother wanted instinct [she]4195-our great mother should not have bestowed reason , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria impatiently . [Temperley]118-hubert had fallen into the dulcet strains of one who feels , not only that [he]118-hubert stands as [the champion of true wisdom and virtue]949-the champion of true wisdom and virtue , but that [he]118-hubert is sure of support from [the vast majority of [[his]118-hubert fellows]951-his fellows]950-the vast majority of his fellows . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's brusqueness seemed to suit [her]109-valeria less admirable rôle . [Temperley]118-hubert was tolerant and regretful . If [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria would think for a moment , [she]109-valeria could not fail to see that Nature ... and so forth , in the same strain of “ pious devotion to [other people]3849-other people 's duties ”[109-valeria] as [[his]118-hubert companion]4118-his companion afterwards described it . [She]109-valeria chafed at the exhortation to “ think for a moment . ”[109-valeria] At that instant , the solitude was broken by the apparition of [a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat , coming towards [them]954-them up [the road]4037-the road . [He]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat was [a man of middle height and rather slim]956-a man of middle height and rather slim . [He]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat appeared about five - and - thirty years of age . [He]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat had fair hair , and a strange , whimsical face , irregular of feature , with a small moustache covering the upper lip . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria looked startled , as [she]109-valeria caught sight of the travel - stained figure . [She]109-valeria flushed deeply , and [her]109-valeria expression changed to one of bewilderment and uncertainty , then to one of incredulous joy . This is incredible ! ”[953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat] [They]958-they stood , with hand locked in hand , staring at [one another]3945-one another . “ By what happy misunderstanding am [I]4071-the professor thus favoured by [the gods]812-the gods ? ”[4071-the professor] exclaimed [the Professor]4071-the professor . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria explained [her]109-valeria presence . “ Prodigious ! ”[116-professor fortescue] cried [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . “ [Fate]102-fate must have some strange plots in the making , unless indeed [we]958-they fall to the discouraging supposition that [she]102-fate deigns to jest . ”[953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat] [He]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat said that [he]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat was on a walking tour , studying the geology of [the district]714-the district , and that [he]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat had written to announce [his]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat coming to [[his]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat old friends]962-his old friends , [Mr.]963-mr. and [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , and to ask [them]962-his old friends to put [him]953-a dusty wayfarer in knickerbockers and soft felt hat up . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria was greatly excited . It was so long since [they]964-they had met , and it was so delightful to meet again . [She]109-valeria had a hundred enquiries to make about [common friends]965-common friends , and about [the Professor]4071-the professor 's own doings . [She]109-valeria forgot [Temperley]118-hubert 's name , and [her]109-valeria introduction was vague . [The Professor]4071-the professor held out [his]4071-the professor hand cordially . This was in consequence of the new - comer 's kindliness of manner , and not at all because of [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , who had forgotten [Temperley]118-hubert 's elegant existence . [She]109-valeria had a look of surprise when [he]4071-the professor joined in the conversation . “ [I]4071-the professor can scarcely believe that it is ten years since [I]4071-the professor was [here]3762-here , ”[4071-the professor] cried [the Professor]4071-the professor , pausing to look over a gate at [the stretch of country]969-the stretch of country . “ [I]4071-the professor used to visit [[my]4071-the professor friends]4159-my friends at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee every autumn , and now if [some one]3818-some one were to assure [me]4071-the professor that [I]4071-the professor had been to sleep and dreamt a ten years ' dream , [I]4071-the professor should be disposed to credit it . Every detail the same ; the very cattle , the very birds — surely just those identical sparrows used to fly before [me]4071-the professor along the hedgerows , in the good old times , ten years ago ! Ah ! yes , it is only the human element that changes . ”[4071-the professor] “ [One]329-one is often so thankful for a change in that , ”[118-hubert] [Temperley]118-hubert remarked , with an urbane sort of cynicism . “ True , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria ; “ but what is so discouraging is that so often the charm goes , like the bloom of a peach , and only the qualities that one regrets remain and prosper . ”[109-valeria] “ [I]4071-the professor think [people]3687-people improve with time , as often as [they]3687-people fall off , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . [The others]303-the others shook [their]303-the others heads . “ To [him]4071-the professor that hath shall be given , but to [him]4071-the professor that hath not — ”[303-the others] [The Professor]4071-the professor smiled a little sadly , in quoting the significant words . “ Well , well , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said , turning to [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , “ [I]4071-the professor ca n't say how happy [I]4071-the professor am to see [you]109-valeria again . And of what fine Scottish stuff [the old man]4209-the old man is made — and a mind like crystal ! What arguments [we]4210-we used to have in [that old study of [his]4209-the old man]4211-that old study of his ! [I]4071-the professor can see [him]4209-the old man now . And how genial ! [A man]3704-a man could never forget it , who had once received [his]4209-the old man welcome . ”[4071-the professor] Such was [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's impression , when ten minutes later the meeting took place between [the Professor]4071-the professor and [[his]4071-the professor old friend]974-his old friend . [Hadria]211-hadria remembered [him]4071-the professor and [his]4071-the professor kindness to [her]211-hadria and [the rest of [the children]667-the children]976-the rest of the children , in the old days ; the stories [he]4071-the professor used to tell when [he]4071-the professor took [them]667-the children for walks , stories full of natural lore more marvellous than any fairy tale , though [he]4071-the professor could tell fairy tales too , by the dozen . [The tennis - party]982-the tennis - party began to break up , shortly after [the Professor]4071-the professor 's arrival . [Temperley]118-hubert lingered to the last . “ Is that [a son of [the celebrated Judge Temperley]131-temperley]4213-a son of the celebrated judge temperley ? ”[984-one of the bystanders] asked [one of [the bystanders]985-the bystanders]984-one of the bystanders . “ [[His]118-hubert eldest son]4214-his eldest son , ”[93-mr. gordon] answered [Mr. Gordon]93-mr. gordon ; “ [a man who ought to make [his]118-hubert mark , for [he]118-hubert has splendid chances and good ability . ”[93-mr. gordon] “ [I]131-temperley have scarcely had a word with [you]211-hadria , the whole afternoon]4215-a man who ought to make his mark , for he has splendid chances and good ability . ” “ i have scarcely had a word with you , the whole afternoon , ”[131-temperley] [Temperley]131-temperley said to [Hadria]211-hadria , who had sunk upon a seat , tired with making [herself]211-hadria agreeable , as [she]211-hadria observed . “ That is very sad ; but when [one]329-one has social gatherings , [one]329-one never does have a word with [anybody]3977-anybody . It was obvious that [he]93-mr. gordon found [her]211-hadria interesting , either as a study or in a less impersonal sense . [Hadria]211-hadria , feeling that [her]211-hadria character was being analysed , did what [many people]986-many people do without realizing it : [she]211-hadria instinctively arranged its lights and shades with a view to artistic effect . It was not till late that night , when the events of the day passed before [her]211-hadria in procession , that [she]211-hadria recognized what [she]211-hadria had done , and laughed at [herself]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria had not attempted to appear in a better light than [she]211-hadria deserved ; quite as often as not , [she]211-hadria submitted to appear in a worse light ; [her]211-hadria effort had been to satisfy some innate sense of proportion or form . The instinct puzzled [her]211-hadria . Also [she]211-hadria became aware that [she]211-hadria was interested in [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert . Good heavens , it is incredible ! ”[4071-the professor] [He]4071-the professor held out a thin , finely - formed hand , with a kind smile . “ [They]998-they change so much at that age , in a short time , ”[97-mrs. fullerton] said [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , with a glance of pride ; for [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter was looking brilliantly handsome , as [she]211-hadria stood before [them]998-they , with flushed cheeks and a soft expression , which the mere tones of [the Professor]4071-the professor 's voice had power to summon in most human faces . [The Professor]4071-the professor laughed and shook [his]4071-the professor head . “ And so this is really [[my]4071-the professor little playfellow]4230-my little playfellow ! ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor exclaimed , nodding meditatively . “ [I]4071-the professor remember [her]4230-my little playfellow so well ; [a queer , fantastic little being in those days]4231-a queer , fantastic little being in those days , with hair like a black cloud , and eyes that seemed to peer out of the cloud , with a perfect passion of enquiry . [She]4230-my little playfellow used to bewilder [me]4071-the professor , [I]4071-the professor remember , with [her]4230-my little playfellow strange , wise little sayings ! [Ernest]86-ernest , too , [I]4071-the professor remember : [a fine little chap with curly , dark hair]4232-a fine little chap with curly , dark hair — rather like [a young Italian]4233-a young italian , but with features less broadly cast ; drawn together and calmed by [his]86-ernest northern blood . [Hadria]211-hadria was astonished to see how animated [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother had become under [his]4071-the professor influence . [They]1007-us fell again to recalling old times ; little trivial incidents which had seemed so unimportant at the moment , but now carried a whole epoch with [them]1007-us , bringing back , with a rush , the genial memories . [Hadria]211-hadria remembered that soon after [his]4071-the professor last visit , [the Professor]4071-the professor had married [a beautiful wife]1009-a beautiful wife , and that about a year or so later , [the wife]1010-the wife had died . It was said that [she]1010-the wife had killed [herself]1010-the wife . This set [Hadria]211-hadria speculating . [The visitor]4013-the visitor reminded [[his]4013-the visitor companions]1012-his companions of various absurd incidents of the past , sending [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton into paroxysms of laughter that made [the whole party]1013-the whole party laugh in sympathy . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton too was already wiping [her]97-mrs. fullerton streaming eyes as [the Professor]4071-the professor talked on in [his]4071-the professor old vein , with just that particular little humorous manner of [his]4071-the professor that won its way so surely to the hearts of [[his]4071-the professor listeners]1015-his listeners . For a moment , in the midst of the bright talk and the mirth that [he]4071-the professor had created , [the Professor]4071-the professor lost the thread , and [his]4071-the professor face , as [he]4071-the professor stared into the glowing centre of the fire , had a desolate look ; but it was so quick to pass away that [one]329-one might have thought [oneself]329-one [the victim of a fancy]1018-the victim of a fancy . [His]1019-his was the next chuckle , and “ Do [you]89-mr. fullerton remember that day when — ? ”[1019-his] and so forth , [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton 's healthy roar following avalanche - like , upon the reminiscence . “ [We]4242-we thought [him]4071-the professor [a good and kind magician]4243-a good and kind magician when [we]4242-we were [children]626-children , ”[211-hadria] was [Hadria]211-hadria 's thought , “ and now [one]329-one is grown up , there is no disillusion . [He]4071-the professor is [a good and kind magician]4243-a good and kind magician still . ”[211-hadria] [He]4071-the professor seemed indeed to have the power to conjure forth from [their]1020-their hiding - places , the finer qualities of mind and temperament , which had lain dormant , perhaps for years , buried beneath daily accumulations of little cares and little habits . The creature that had once looked forth on [the world]334-the world , fresh and vital , was summoned again , to [his]4071-the professor own surprise , with all [his]4071-the professor ancient laughter and [his]4071-the professor tears . “ [This man]4247-this man , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria said to [herself]211-hadria , drawing a long , relieved breath , “ is the best and the most generous human being [I]211-hadria have ever met . ”[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria went to sleep , that night , with a sweet sense of rest and security , and an undefined new hope . If such natures were in existence , then there must be a great source of goodness and tenderness somewhere in [heaven or earth]1022-heaven or earth , and the battle of life must be worth the fighting . [THE Professor]4071-the professor 's presence in [the house]296-the house had a profound influence on [the inmates]1025-the inmates , one and all . The effect upon [[his]4071-the professor hostess]1026-his hostess was startling . [He]4071-the professor drew forth [her]1026-his hostess intellect , [her]1026-his hostess sense of humour , [her]1026-his hostess starved poetic sense ; [he]4071-the professor probed down among the dust and rust of years , and rescued triumphantly [the real woman]1027-the real woman , who was being stifled to death , with [her]1027-the real woman own connivance . [Hadria]211-hadria was amazed to see how [the new - comer]1028-the new - comer might express any idea [he]4071-the professor pleased , however heterodox , and [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother only applauded . [His]4071-the professor manner to [her]1026-his hostess was exquisitely courteous . [He]4071-the professor seemed to understand all that [she]1026-his hostess had lost in [her]1026-his hostess life , all its disappointments and sacrifices . On hearing that [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria was among [[the Professor]4071-the professor 's oldest friends]1031-the professor 's oldest friends , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton became suddenly cordial to [that lady]531-that lady , and could not show [her]531-that lady enough attention . The evenings were often spent in music , [Temperley]118-hubert being sometimes of the party . [He]118-hubert was [the only person not obviously among [[the Professor]4071-the professor 's admirers]1035-the professor 's admirers]1033-the only person not obviously among the professor 's admirers . “ However cultivated or charming [a person]852-a person may be , ”[118-hubert] [Temperley]118-hubert said to [Hadria]211-hadria , “ [I]118-hubert never feel that [I]118-hubert have found a kindred spirit , unless the musical instinct is strong . ”[118-hubert] “ Nor [I.]118-hubert ”[118-hubert] “ [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue has just that one weak point . ”[118-hubert] “ Oh , but [he]4071-the professor is musical , though [his]4071-the professor technical knowledge is small . ”[118-hubert] But [Temperley]118-hubert smiled dubiously . [The Professor]4071-the professor , freed from [his]4071-the professor customary hard work , was like [a schoolboy]1037-a schoolboy . [His]4071-the professor delight in the open air , in the freshness of [the hills]413-the hills , in the peace of the mellow autumn , was never - ending . [He]4071-the professor loved to take a walk before breakfast , so as to enjoy the first sweetness of the morning ; to bathe in [some clear pool of [the river]437-the river]1039-some clear pool of the river to come into healthy contact with [Nature]120-nature . Never was there a brighter or a wholesomer spirit . Yet the more [Hadria]211-hadria studied this clear , and vigorous , and tender nature , the more [she]211-hadria felt , in [him]4071-the professor , the absence of that particular personal hold on life which [so few human beings]1041-so few human beings are without , a grip usually so hard to loosten , that only the severest experience , and the deepest sorrow have power to destroy it . [Hadria]211-hadria 's letters to [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister , at this time , were full of enthusiasm . “ [You]1043-you can not imagine what it is , or perhaps [you]1043-you can imagine what it is to have the society of [three such people as [I]1043-you now see]4249-three such people as i now see almost every day . “[1043-you] [You]1043-you say [I]0-i represent [them]1044-them as impossible angels , such as earth never beheld , but [you]1043-you are wrong . [I]0-i represent [them]1044-them as [they]1044-them are . [I]0-i suppose [the Professor]4071-the professor has faults — though [he]4071-the professor does not show them to [us]1046-us — [they]1044-them must be of the generous kind , at any rate . [Father]134-father says that [he]134-father never could keep a farthing ; [he]134-father would always give it away to [undeserving people]1047-undeserving people . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , [I]0-i find on closer acquaintance , is not without certain jealousies and weaknesses , but these things just seem to float about as gossamer on [a mountain - side]1048-a mountain - side , and [one]329-one counts them in relation to [herself]329-one , in about the same proportion . [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert — [I]0-i do n't know quite what to say about [him]118-hubert . [He]118-hubert is a tiny bit too precise and finished perhaps — a little wanting in élan — but [he]118-hubert seems very enlightened and full of polite information ; and ah , [his]118-hubert music ! When [he]118-hubert is playing [I]0-i am completely carried away . If [he]118-hubert said then , ‘ [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton , may [I]0-i have the pleasure of [[your]112-miss fullerton society]1050-your society in [the infernal regions]1051-the infernal regions ? ’ [I]0-i should arise and take [his]118-hubert arm and reply , ‘ Delighted , ’ and off [we]1052-we would march . But what am [I]0-i saying ? [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert would never ask anything so absurd . “ [You]0-i would have thought that when [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria and [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue arrived on the scene , [I]118-hubert had about enough privileges ; but no , [Destiny]135-destiny , waking up at last to [her]4250-her duties , remembers that [I]118-hubert have a maniacal passion for music , and that this has been starved . So [she]4250-her hastens to provide for [me]118-hubert [a fellow maniac]4251-a fellow maniac , [a brother in Beethoven]4252-a brother in beethoven , who comes and fills [my]118-hubert world with music and [my]118-hubert soul with — But [I]118-hubert must not rave . The music is still in [my]118-hubert veins ; [I]118-hubert am not in a fit state to write reasonable letters . Here comes [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert for [our]4253-our practice . No more for the present . ”[118-hubert] [Temperley]118-hubert would often talk to [Hadria]211-hadria of [his]118-hubert early life , and about [[his]118-hubert mother]3866-his mother and [sister]1054-sister . Of [[his]118-hubert mother]3866-his mother [he]118-hubert spoke with great respect and affection , the respect perhaps somewhat conventional , and allowing [one]329-one to see , through its meshes , the simple fact that [she]3866-his mother was looked up to as [a good and dutiful parent]1057-a good and dutiful parent , who had worshipped [[her]3866-his mother son]1058-her son from [his]118-hubert birth , and perfectly fulfilled [his]118-hubert ideas of feminine excellency . From [her]3866-his mother [he]118-hubert had learnt the lesser Catechism and the Lord 's Prayer , since discarded , but useful in [their]1059-their proper season . Although [he]118-hubert had ceased to be [an orthodox Christian]1060-an orthodox christian , [he]118-hubert felt that [he]118-hubert was the better for having been trained in that creed . [He]118-hubert had a perfect faith in the system which had produced [himself]118-hubert . “ [I]118-hubert think [you]211-hadria would like [[my]118-hubert mother]4254-my mother , ”[118-hubert] said [Temperley]118-hubert . [Hadria]211-hadria could scarcely dispute this . “ And [I]211-hadria am sure [she]4254-my mother would like [you]118-hubert . ”[211-hadria] “ On that point [I]118-hubert can not offer an opinion . ”[118-hubert] “ Do n't [you]211-hadria ever come to [town]4255-town ? ”[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert asked . “ [We]4256-we go to [Edinburgh]16-edinburgh occasionally , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria replied with malice , knowing that [he]118-hubert meant [London]8-london . [He]118-hubert set [her]211-hadria right . “ No ; [[my]118-hubert father]4257-my father hates [London]8-london , and [mother]3851-mother never goes away without [him]4257-my father . ”[118-hubert] “ What a pity ! But do [you]118-hubert never visit [friends]886-friends in [town]4255-town ? ”[4071-the professor] “ Yes ; [[my]118-hubert sister]4161-my sister and [I]118-hubert have spent one or two seasons in [Park Lane]17-park lane , with [some cousins]4262-some cousins . ”[118-hubert] “ Why , do n't [you]118-hubert come this next season ? [You]118-hubert ought to hear some good music . ”[1061-the tête - a - tête] [The tête - a - tête]1061-the tête - a - tête was interrupted by [the Professor]4071-the professor . [Temperley]118-hubert looked annoyed . It struck [Hadria]211-hadria that [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue had a very sad expression when [he]116-professor fortescue was not speaking . [He]116-professor fortescue seemed to [her]211-hadria lonely , and in need of the sort of comfort that [he]116-professor fortescue brought so liberally to [others]432-others . Although [he]116-professor fortescue had talked to [Hadria]211-hadria about a thousand topics in which [they]1064-they were both interested , there had been nothing personal in [their]1064-they conversation . [He]116-professor fortescue was disposed , at times , to treat [her]211-hadria in a spirit of affectionate banter . “ To think that [I]116-professor fortescue should ever have dared to offer [this young lady acidulated drops]4263-this young lady acidulated drops ! ”[116-professor fortescue] [he]116-professor fortescue exclaimed on one occasion , when [Hadria]211-hadria was looking flushed and perturbed . “ Ah ! shall [I]211-hadria ever forget those acidulated drops ! ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria cried , brightening . “ [You]116-professor fortescue do n't mean to say that [you]116-professor fortescue would stoop to them now ? ”[211-hadria] “ It is not [one 's oldest friends]4264-one 's oldest friends who always know one best , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria replied demurely . “ [I]116-professor fortescue shall test [you]211-hadria , ”[116-professor fortescue] [he]116-professor fortescue said . And on that same day , [he]116-professor fortescue walked into [Ballochcoil]5-ballochcoil , and when [he]116-professor fortescue returned , [he]116-professor fortescue offered [her]211-hadria , with a solemn twinkle in [his]116-professor fortescue eye , a good - sized paper bag of the seductive sweetmeat ; taking up [his]116-professor fortescue position on the top of a low dyke , and watching [her]211-hadria , while [she]211-hadria proceeded to make of that plump white bag , a lank and emaciated bag , surprising to behold . [He]116-professor fortescue sat and looked on , enjoying [his]116-professor fortescue idleness with the zest of [a hard worker]1065-a hard worker . The twinkle of amusement faded gradually from [his]116-professor fortescue face , and the sadness that [Hadria]211-hadria had noticed the day before , returned to [his]116-professor fortescue eyes . [She]211-hadria was leaning against the dyke , pensively enjoying [her]211-hadria festive meal . The dark fresh blue of [her]211-hadria gown , and the unwonted tinge of colour in [her]211-hadria cheeks , gave a vigorous and healthful impression , in harmony with the weather - beaten stones and the windy breadth of [the northern landscape]1066-the northern landscape . [The Professor]4071-the professor studied the face with a puzzled frown . [He]4071-the professor flattered [himself]4071-the professor that [he]4071-the professor was [a subtle physiognomist]1068-a subtle physiognomist , but in this case , [he]4071-the professor would not have dared to pronounce judgment . Danger and difficulty might have been predicted , for it was a moving face , one that could not be looked upon quite coldly . And [the Professor]4071-the professor had come to the conclusion , from [his]4071-the professor experience of life , that the instinct of [the average human being whom another has stirred to strong emotion]1070-the average human being whom another has stirred to strong emotion , is to fasten upon and overwhelm [that luckless person]1071-that luckless person , to burden [him]1071-that luckless person with responsibilities , to claim as much of time , and energy , and existence , as can in any way be wrung from [him]1071-that luckless person , careless of the cost to [the giver]1072-the giver . [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue noticed , as [Hadria]211-hadria looked down , a peculiar dreaminess of expression , and something indefinable , which suggested a profoundly emotional nature . At present , the expression was softened . That this softness was not altogether trustworthy , however , [the Professor]4071-the professor felt sure , for [he]4071-the professor had seen , at moments , when something had deeply stirred [her]211-hadria , expressions anything but soft come into [her]211-hadria face . [He]4071-the professor thought [her]211-hadria capable of many things of which [the well - brought - up young Englishwoman]1074-the well - brought - up young englishwoman is not supposed to dream . It seemed to [him]4071-the professor , that [she]211-hadria had at least two distinct natures that were at war with one another : [the one greedy and pleasure - loving]1075-the one greedy and pleasure - loving , careless and even reckless ; the other deep - seeing and aspiring . But which of these two tendencies would experience probably foster ? “ [I]4071-the professor wonder what [you]211-hadria like best , next to acidulated drops , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said at length , with one of [his]4071-the professor half - bantering smiles . “ There are few things in [this wide world]4265-this wide world that can be mentioned in the same breath with them , but toffy also has its potency upon the spirit . ”[4071-the professor] “ [I]4071-the professor like not this mocking tone . ”[4071-the professor] “ Then [I]211-hadria will not mock , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . “ Yes , [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor went on meditatively , “ [you]211-hadria have grown up , if [an old friend]4266-an old friend may make such remarks , very much as [I]4071-the professor expected , from the promise of [your]211-hadria childhood . [You]211-hadria used to puzzle [me]4071-the professor even then . ”[4071-the professor] “ Do [I]211-hadria puzzle [you]4071-the professor now ? ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria asked . “ Inexpressibly ! ”[4071-the professor] “ How amusing ! But how ? ”[4071-the professor] “ [One]329-one can generally see at a glance , or pretty soon , the general trend of [a character]4268-a character . But not with [you]211-hadria . Nothing that [I]4071-the professor might hear of [you]211-hadria in the future , would very much surprise [me]4071-the professor . [I]4071-the professor should say to [myself]4071-the professor , ‘ Yes , the germ was there . ’ ”[4071-the professor] [Hadria]211-hadria paled a little . “ Either good or bad [you]4071-the professor mean ? ”[211-hadria] “ Well — ”[4071-the professor] “ Yes , [I]211-hadria understand . ”[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria drew [herself]211-hadria together , crossing [her]211-hadria arms , and looking over [the hills]413-the hills , with eyes that burned with a sort of fear and defiance mingled . It was a singular expression , which [the Professor]4071-the professor noted with a sense of discomfort . [Hadria]211-hadria slowly withdrew [her]211-hadria eyes from the horizon , and bent them on the ground . “ [You]4071-the professor must have read some of [my]211-hadria thoughts , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . “ [I]211-hadria often wonder how it is , that [the world]334-the world can drill [women]606-women into goodness at all . ”[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria raised [her]211-hadria head , and went on in a low , bitter tone : “ [I]211-hadria often wonder why it is , that [they]606-women do n't , one and all , fling up [their]606-women rôles and revenge [themselves]606-women to the best of [their]606-women ability — intentionally , [I]211-hadria mean — upon the world that makes [them]606-women live under a permanent insult . [I]211-hadria think , at times , that [I]211-hadria should thoroughly enjoy spending [my]211-hadria life in sheer , unmitigated vengeance , and if [I]211-hadria did”—she[211-hadria] clenched [her]211-hadria hands , and [her]211-hadria eyes blazed—“if [I]211-hadria did , [I]211-hadria would not do [my]211-hadria work by halves ! ”[211-hadria] “ [I]4071-the professor am sure [you]211-hadria would not , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor dryly . “ But [I]211-hadria shall not do anything of the kind , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria added in a different tone ; “ [women]606-women do n't . [They]606-women always try to be good , always , always — the more fools [they]606-women ! And the more [they]606-women are good , the worse things get . ”[211-hadria] “ Ah ! [I]4071-the professor thought there was some heterodox sentiment lurking here at high pressure ! ”[4071-the professor] exclaimed [the Professor]4071-the professor . [Hadria]211-hadria sighed . “ [I]211-hadria have just been receiving good advice from [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said , flushing at the remembrance , “ and [I]211-hadria think if [you]211-hadria knew the sort of counsel it was , that [you]211-hadria would understand [one]329-one 's feeling a little fierce and bitter . Oh , not with [her]91-mrs. gordon , [poor woman]4273-poor woman ! [She]91-mrs. gordon meant it in kindness . But the most cutting thing of all is , that what [she]91-mrs. gordon said is true ! ”[211-hadria] “ That is exactly the worst thing , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor , who seemed to have divined the nature of [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's advice . [Hadria]211-hadria coloured . It hurt as well as astonished [her]211-hadria , that [he]4071-the professor should guess what had been said . “ Ah ! [a woman]3753-a woman ought to be born without pride , or not at all ! [I]4071-the professor wish to heaven that [our]4275-our fatal sex could be utterly stamped out ! ”[4071-the professor] [The Professor]4071-the professor smiled , a little sadly , at [her]211-hadria vehemence . “ [We]4275-our are accused of being at the bottom of every evil under [heaven]4276-heaven , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria added , “ and [I]211-hadria think it is true . That is some consolation , at any rate ! ”[211-hadria] In spite of [her]211-hadria immense reverence for [the Professor]4071-the professor , [she]211-hadria seemed to have grown reckless as to [his]4071-the professor opinion . The next few days went strangely , and not altogether comprehensibly . There was a silent warfare between [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue and [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert . “ [I]4071-the professor have never in [my]4071-the professor life before ventured to interfere in such matters , ”[4071-the professor] [the Professor]4071-the professor said to [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria ; “ but if [that fellow]4277-that fellow marries [Hadria]211-hadria , [one or both]4278-one or both will live to rue it . ”[4071-the professor] “ [I]109-valeria think it 's the best thing that could happen to [her]211-hadria , ”[109-valeria] [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria declared . “ But [they]4279-they are not suited to one another , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ [Men]3698-men and [women]606-women seldom are ! ”[4071-the professor] “ Then why — ? ”[4071-the professor] [the Professor]4071-the professor began . “ [He]4277-that fellow is about as near as [she]211-hadria will get , ”[4071-the professor] [Valeria]109-valeria interrupted . “ [I]109-valeria will never stand in the way of [a girl]3734-a girl 's marrying [a good , honest man]4283-a good , honest man . There is not one chance in ten thousand that [Hadria]211-hadria will happen to meet exactly [the right person]4284-the right person . [I]109-valeria have made a mistake in [my]109-valeria life . [I]109-valeria shall do all in [my]109-valeria power to urge [her]211-hadria to avoid following in [my]109-valeria footsteps . ”[109-valeria] It was useless for [the Professor]4071-the professor to remonstrate . “ [I]109-valeria pity [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert , though [I]109-valeria am so fond of [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ If [he]118-hubert shatters [her]211-hadria illusions , [she]211-hadria will certainly shatter [his]118-hubert . ”[109-valeria] The event that [they]1087-they had been expecting , took place . During one of the afternoon practices , when , for a few minutes , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had left [the room]379-the room , [Temperley]118-hubert startled [Hadria]211-hadria by an extremely elegant proposal of marriage . [He]118-hubert did not seem surprised at [her]211-hadria refusal , though [he]118-hubert pleaded [his]118-hubert cause with no little eloquence . [Hadria]211-hadria found it a painful ordeal . [She]211-hadria shrank from the ungracious necessity to disappoint what appeared to be a very ardent hope . Happily , the interview was cut short by the entrance of [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton . [The old man]4209-the old man was not remarkable for finesse . [He]4209-the old man gave a dismayed “ Oh ! ”[4209-the old man] [He]4209-the old man coughed , suppressed a smile , and murmuring some lame enquiry as to the progress of the music , turned and marched out of [the room]379-the room . The sound of laughter was presently heard from [the dining - room below]1091-the dining - room below . “ [Father]134-father is really too absurd ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “ there is no tragedy that [he]134-father is incapable of roaring at ! ”[211-hadria] “ [I]118-hubert fear [[his]134-father daughter]993-his daughter takes after [him]134-father , ”[118-hubert] said [Temperley]118-hubert with a tragi - comic smile . When [Hadria]211-hadria next met [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father , [he]609-her father asked , with perfect but suspicious gravity , about the music that [they]1093-they had been practising that afternoon . [He]609-her father could not speak too highly of music as a pastime . [He]609-her father regretted having rushed in as [he]609-her father did — it must have been so disturbing to the music . Why not have a notice put up outside the door on these occasions : “ Engaged ”[1094-the meanest intelligence] ? Then [the meanest intelligence]1094-the meanest intelligence would understand , and the meanest intelligence was really a thing [one]329-one had to count with , in this blundering world ! [HUBERT TEMPERLEY]118-hubert left [Drumgarren]12-drumgarren suddenly . [He]609-her father said that [he]609-her father had business to attend to in [town]4255-town . “ [That foolish girl]4286-that foolish girl has refused [him]609-her father ! ”[109-valeria] exclaimed [Valeria]109-valeria , when [she]109-valeria heard of it . “ Thank heaven ! ”[109-valeria] ejaculated [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . [Valeria]109-valeria 's brow clouded . “ Why are [you]211-hadria so anxious about the matter ? ”[109-valeria] “ Because [I]109-valeria know that a marriage between [those two]4287-those two would end in misery . ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria spoke very seriously to [Hadria]211-hadria on the subject of marriage , urging the importance of it , and the wretchedness of growing old in solitude . “ Better even that , than to grow old in uncongenial company , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . [Valeria]109-valeria shrugged [her]109-valeria shoulders . “ [One]329-one could go away when it became oppressive , ”[109-valeria] [she]109-valeria suggested , at which [Hadria]211-hadria laughed . “ What an ideal existence ! ”[211-hadria] “ Are [you]211-hadria still dreaming of an ideal existence ? ”[211-hadria] “ Why not ? ”[211-hadria] “ Well , dream while [you]211-hadria may , ”[109-valeria] said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ [My]109-valeria time of dreaming was the happiest of all . ”[109-valeria] On one occasion , when [Hadria]211-hadria and [the Professor]4071-the professor went to call at [Craw Gill]2-craw gill , [they]1098-our found [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria in the gloomiest of moods . Affection , love?—the very blood and bones of tragedy . Solitude , indifference?—its heart . And if for [men]3698-men [the world]334-the world was a delusion , for [women]606-women it was a torture - chamber . [Nature]120-nature was dead against [them]606-women . “ Why do [you]4071-the professor say that ? ”[211-hadria] asked [Hadria]211-hadria . “ Because of the blundering , merciless way [she]109-valeria has made [us]1098-our ; because of the needs that [she]109-valeria has put into [our]1098-our hearts , and the preposterous payment that [she]109-valeria demands for [their]606-women fulfilment ; because of the equally preposterous payment [she]109-valeria exacts , if [we]1098-our elect to do without that which [she]109-valeria teaches [us]1098-our to yearn for . ”[211-hadria] [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , admitting the dilemma , laid the blame on the stupidity of [mankind]1102-mankind . The discussion was excited , for [Valeria]109-valeria would not allow the guilt to be thus shifted . In vain [the Professor]4071-the professor urged that Nature offers a large choice to humanity , for the developing , balancing , annulling of its various forces of good and evil , and that it is only when the choice is made that heredity steps in and fixes it . This process simulates Necessity , or what [we]1104-we call [Nature]120-nature . “ [Heredity]136-heredity may be [a powerful friend]4289-a powerful friend , or [a bitter enemy]4290-a bitter enemy , according as [we]1098-our treat [her]109-valeria , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said . “ Then [our]1098-our sex must have treated [her]109-valeria very badly ! ”[109-valeria] cried [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “ Or [our]1098-our sex must have obliged [yours]4291-yours to treat [her]109-valeria badly , which comes to the same thing , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . [They]1106-they had agreed to take a walk by [the river]437-the river , towards [Ballochcoil]5-ballochcoil . It was hoped that the fresh air and sunshine would cheer [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . [The Professor]4071-the professor led the conversation to [her]109-valeria favourite topic : ancient Greek literature , but this only inspired [her]109-valeria to quote the discouraging opinion of [the Medea of Euripedes]137-the medea of euripedes . [The Professor]4071-the professor laughed . “ [I]4071-the professor see it is a really bad attack , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said . “ [I]4071-the professor sympathize . [I]4071-the professor have these inconsolable moods [myself]4071-the professor , sometimes . ”[4071-the professor] [They]1106-they came upon [the Greek temple on [the cliff - side]1111-the cliff - side]1110-the greek temple on the cliff - side , and paused there to rest , for a few minutes . It was too cold to linger long under the slender columns . [They]1106-they walked on , till [they]1106-they came in sight of [the bare little church of Ballochcoil]1112-the bare little church of ballochcoil . [The Professor]4071-the professor instinctively turned to compare [the two buildings]1114-the two buildings . “ The contrast between them is so extraordinary , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor exclaimed . Nothing could have been more eloquent of the difference in the modes of thought which [they]1114-the two buildings respectively represented . “ If only , [they]1114-the two buildings had not made such fools of [[their]1114-the two buildings women]4292-their women , [I]211-hadria should like to have lived at [Athens]19-athens in the time of [Pericles]138-pericles ! ”[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [I]109-valeria , ”[109-valeria] said [Valeria]109-valeria , “ would choose rather the Middle Ages , with [their]1114-the two buildings mysticism and [their]1114-the two buildings romance . ”[109-valeria] The discussion on this point continued till [the church]1115-the church was reached . A psalm was being sung , in a harsh but devout fashion , by [the congregation]1116-the congregation . The sound managed to find its way to the sweet outer air , though the ugly rectangular windows were all jealously closed against its beneficence . The sky had become overcast , and a few drops of rain having given warning of a shower , it was thought advisable to take shelter in [the porch]1117-the porch , till it was over . The psalm was ground out slowly , and with apparent fervour , to the end . Then the voice of [the minister]1118-the minister was heard wrestling in prayer . [The Professor]4071-the professor looked grave and sad , as [he]4071-the professor stood listening . It was possible to hear almost all the prayer through the red baize door , and the words , hackneyed though they were , and almost absurd in [their]1120-their pious sing - song , had a naïf impressiveness and , to [the listener]1121-the listener , an intense pathos . [The minister]1118-the minister prayed for help and comfort for [[his]1118-the minister congregation]1123-his congregation . There had been much sickness in [the village]1124-the village during the summer , and [many were in trouble]1125-many were in trouble . [The good man]1126-the good man put forth [his]1126-the good man petition to [the merciful and mighty Father]1127-the merciful and mighty father , that strength might be given to [the sufferers to bear all that was sent in chastisement]1128-the sufferers to bear all that was sent in chastisement , for [they]1128-the sufferers to bear all that was sent in chastisement knew that nothing would be given beyond [their]1128-the sufferers to bear all that was sent in chastisement ability to endure . [He]1126-the good man assured [the great and mighty Lord]1129-the great and mighty lord that [He]1126-the good man had power to succour , and that [His]1126-the good man love was without end ; [he]1126-the good man prayed that as [His]1126-the good man might and [His]1126-the good man glory were limitless , so might [His]1126-the good man mercy be to [the miserable sinners who had offended [Him]1126-the good man]1130-the miserable sinners who had offended him . Age after age , this same prayer , in different forms , had besieged the throne of heaven . Age after age , [the spirit of man]1131-the spirit of man had sought for help , and mercy , and inspiration , in the Power that was felt , or imagined , behind the veil of mystery . From [the village]1124-the village at [the foot of the hill]1133-the foot of the hill , vague sounds floated up , and presently , among [them]1124-the village and above [them]1124-the village , could be heard the yelping and howling of a dog . [The minister]1118-the minister , at the moment , was glorifying [[his]1118-the minister Creator]1135-his creator and [his]1118-the minister race at the same time , by addressing [Him]1118-the minister as “ [Thou]4293-thou who hast given unto [us]4294-us , [[Thy]4293-thou servants]4295-thy servants , dominion over the beasts of [the field]4296-the field and over every living thing , that [they]4295-thy servants may serve [us]4294-us and minister unto [us]4294-us — rdquo ; Again , and more loudly , came the cry of distress . “[1118-the minister] [I]0-i must go and see what is the matter , ” exclaimed [the Professor]4071-the professor . At the moment , the howling suddenly ceased , and [he]4071-the professor paused . [The minister]1118-the minister was still appealing to [[his]1118-the minister God]4299-his god for mercy . “[0-i] Out of the deep have [I]0-i cried unto [Thee]1136-thee , [O Lord]1137-o lord — , ” and then there was a general prayer , in which the voices of [the congregation]1116-the congregation joined .
