Some more singing and praying took place , before the sound of a sudden rush and movement announced the conclusion of the service . “[0-i] [We]1138-we had better go , ” said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . [They]1138-we had no more than time to leave [the porch]1117-the porch , before the doors burst open , and [the people]4302-the people streamed forth . A whiff of evil - smelling air issued from [the building]4303-the building , at the same time . The dog was howling more piteously than ever . [Someone]4160-someone complained of the disturbance that had been caused by the creature 's cries , during worship . [The congregation]1116-the congregation continued to pour out , dividing into little groups to discuss the sermon or something of more mundane interest . An appearance of superhuman respectability pervaded [the whole body]4306-the whole body . [The important people]4307-the important people , some of whom had [[their]4307-the important people carriages]4308-their carriages waiting to drive [them]4307-the important people [home]3770-home , lingered a few moments , to exchange greetings , and to discuss sporting prospects or achievements . Meanwhile , one of the creatures over whom [God]139-god had given [them]4307-the important people dominion , was wailing in vain appeal . “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't stand this , ” cried [the Professor]4071-the professor , and [he]4071-the professor started off . “[0-i] [I]0-i will come too , ” [Hadria]211-hadria announced . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria said that [she]109-valeria could not endure the sight of suffering , and would await [their]4307-the important people return . And then occurred the incident that made this afternoon memorable to [Hadria]211-hadria . In [her]211-hadria last letter to [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister , [she]211-hadria had said that [she]211-hadria could not imagine [the Professor]4071-the professor contemptuous or angry . [She]211-hadria had reason now to change [her]211-hadria mind . [His]4071-the professor face was at once scornful and sad . For a moment , [Hadria]211-hadria thought that [he]4071-the professor was displeased with [her]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i sometimes feel , ” [he]4071-the professor said , with a scornful bitterness that [she]211-hadria had not suspected in [him]4071-the professor , “[0-i] [I]0-i sometimes feel that this precious humanity of [ours]1139-ours that [we]1139-ours are eternally worshipping and exalting , is but a mean , miserable thing , after all , not worth a moment 's care or effort . [One]329-one 's sympathy is wasted . Look at [these good people]1141-these good people whining to [[their]1141-these good people heavenly [Father]134-father]1142-their heavenly father about [their]1141-these good people own hurts , craving for a pity of which [they]1141-these good people have not a spark themselves!—puffed up with [their]1141-these good people little lordship over the poor beasts that [they]1141-these good people do not hesitate to tear , and hurt , and torture , for [their]1141-these good people own pleasure , or [their]1141-these good people own benefit,—to whom [they]1141-these good people , in [their]1141-these good people turn , love to play [the God]1143-the god . [Cowards]1144-cowards ! And having used [[their]1141-these good people Godhead]1145-their godhead for purposes of cruelty , [they]1141-these good people fling [themselves]1141-these good people howling on [their]1141-these good people knees before [[their]1141-these good people Almighty Deity]1146-their almighty deity and beg for mercy , which [He]1146-their almighty deity too knows how to refuse ! ” “[1146-their almighty deity] Thank heaven ! ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria drew a deep sigh of relief . Without precisely realizing the fact , [she]211-hadria had been gradually sinking into an unformulated conviction that [human beings]4313-human beings are , at heart , ruthless and hard , as soon as [they]4313-human beings are brought beyond the range of familiar moral claims , which have to be respected on pain of popular censure . Self - initiated pity was nowhere to be found . The merciless coldness of [many excellent people]4314-many excellent people ( kind and tender , perhaps , within these accepted limits ) had often chilled [her]211-hadria to the heart , and prompted a miserable doubt of the eventual victory of good over evil in [the world]334-the world , which [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father always insisted was ruled by mere brute force , and would be so ruled to the end of time . [She]211-hadria had tried to find a wider , more generous , and less conventional standard in [her]211-hadria oracle , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , but to [her]211-hadria bitter disappointment , [that lady]531-that lady had shrugged [her]531-that lady shoulders a little callously , as soon as [she]531-that lady was asked to extend [her]531-that lady sympathy outside [the circle of chartered candidates for [her]531-that lady merciful consideration]4318-the circle of chartered candidates for her merciful consideration . [Hadria]211-hadria 's hero - worship had suffered a severe rebuff . Now , as [the Professor]4071-the professor spoke , it was as if a voice from [heaven]4276-heaven had bidden [her]211-hadria believe and hope fearlessly in [her]211-hadria race , and in its destiny . “[1146-their almighty deity] [I]0-i had almost come to shrink a little from [people]3687-people , ” [she]0-i said , “[0-i] as from something cruel and savage , at heart , without a grain of real , untaught pity . ” “[0-i] There is only just enough to swear by , ” said [the Professor]4071-the professor sadly . “[0-i] [We]1148-we are [a lot of half - tamed savages]1149-a lot of half - tamed savages , after all , but [we]1148-we may be thankful that a capacity for almost infinite development is within [us]1148-we . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish to [heaven]4276-heaven [we]1148-we could get on a little faster , ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria . The incident proved , in the end , a fortunate one for [the homeless , and almost starving terrier , of [plebeian lineage , whose wail of distress]4323-plebeian lineage , whose wail of distress had summoned [two friends]4324-two friends to the rescue]4322-the homeless , and almost starving terrier , of plebeian lineage , whose wail of distress had summoned two friends to the rescue . [The creature]4325-the creature had been ill - treated by [some boys]4326-some boys , who found Sunday afternoon hang heavy on [their]4326-some boys hands . [The Professor]4071-the professor carried the injured animal across [the fields]4328-the fields and through [the woods]4329-the woods , to [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee . Here the wounds were dressed , and here [the grateful creature]4330-the grateful creature found [a new and blissful home]4331-a new and blissful home . [His]4330-the grateful creature devotion to [the Professor]4071-the professor was unbounded ; [he]4330-the grateful creature followed [him]4071-the professor everywhere . [Hadria]211-hadria 's reverence and admiration rose to the highest pitch of enthusiasm . [[Her]211-hadria father]609-her father laughed at [her]211-hadria . “[0-i] Just as if [any decent fellow]1151-any decent fellow would not have done as much for [a wounded brute]1152-a wounded brute ! ” “[1151-any decent fellow] There must have been a strange dearth of decent fellows in [church]1153-church that morning then . ” It was not merely the action , but the feeling revealed by [the Professor]4071-the professor 's words on that occasion , that had turned [Hadria]211-hadria 's sentiment towards [him]4071-the professor , into one of worship . [Algitha]81-algitha warned [her]211-hadria that even [the Professor]4071-the professor was human . [Hadria]211-hadria said [she]211-hadria did not believe it , or rather [she]211-hadria believed that [he]4071-the professor was inordinately , tenderly , superlatively human , and that [he]4071-the professor had gone many steps farther in that direction than [the rest of [[his]4071-the professor generation]4337-his generation]4336-the rest of his generation . [He]4071-the professor was dowered with instincts and perceptions belonging to [some kinder , nobler race than [ours]4339-ours]4338-some kinder , nobler race than ours . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria looked grave . [She]109-valeria took occasion to mention that [the Professor]4071-the professor had never ceased to grieve for [[his]4071-the professor wife]573-his wife , to whom [he]4071-the professor had been passionately attached , and that [he]4071-the professor , almost alone among [men]3698-men , would never love [any other woman]4343-any other woman . “[0-i] [I]0-i admire [him]1154-him only the more for that , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] Do n't let [yourself]0-i care too much for [him]1154-him . ” “[0-i] Too much ! ” “[0-i] Do n't fall in love with [him]1154-him , if [I]0-i must be frank . ” [Hadria]211-hadria was silent . “[0-i] If [one]329-one were to fall in love at all , [I]0-i do n't see how it would be possible to avoid [his]1154-him being [the man]3754-the man , ” [she]0-i pronounced at last . “[0-i] [I]0-i defy any creature with the least vestige of a heart to remain indifferent to [him]1154-him . ” ( [Valeria]109-valeria coloured . ) “[0-i] Why there is n't [a man]3704-a man , [woman]3844-woman , [child]780-child , or animal about the place who does n't adore [him]1154-him and what can [I]0-i do ? ” THE autumn was now on the wane ; the robins sang clear , wild little songs in the shrubberies , the sunshine fell slanting across the grass . And at night , the stars twinkled with a frosty brilliancy , and the flowers were cut down by cruel invisible hands . The long dark evenings and the shrieking winds of winter were before them . With the shortening of the days , and the sweeping away of great shoals of leaves , in the frequent gales , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's mood grew more and more sombre . At last [she]0-i announced that [she]0-i could stand the gloom of [this wild North]4344-this wild north no longer . [She]0-i had made arrangements to return to [London]8-london , on the morrow . As suddenly as [she]0-i had appeared on the scene , [she]0-i vanished , leaving but one day to grieve at the prospect of parting . It was through an accidental turn in the conversation , on this last day , that the difference between [her]0-i creed and [the Professor]4071-the professor 's was brought to light , accounting to [Hadria]211-hadria for many things , and increasing , if possible , [her]0-i admiration for [the unconscious Professor]4346-the unconscious professor . As for [her]0-i own private and personal justification for hope , [Valeria]109-valeria asserted that [she]0-i had none . Not even the thought of [her]0-i work — usually a talisman against depression — had any power to comfort . Who cared for [her]0-i work , unless [she]0-i perjured [herself]0-i , and told the lies that [the public]4347-the public loved to hear ? “[0-i] What should [we]1160-we all do , ” asked [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] if there were not [a few people like [you]1162-you]1161-a few people like you and [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , in [the world]334-the world , to keep [us]1160-we true to [[our]1160-we best selves]1164-our best selves , and to point to something infinitely better than that best ? ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria brightened for a moment . “[1162-you] What does it matter if [you]1162-you do not provide mental food for [the crowd]631-the crowd , seeking nourishment for [their]631-the crowd vulgarity ? Let [them]631-the crowd go starve . ” “[631-the crowd] But [they]631-the crowd do n't ; [they]631-the crowd go and gorge elsewhere . Besides , the question of starvation faces [me]0-i rather than [them]631-the crowd . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria was still disposed to find fault with the general scheme of things , which [she]109-valeria regarded as responsible for [her]109-valeria own woes , great and little . Survival of the fittest ! What was that but another name for the torture and massacre of [the unfit]4348-the unfit ? [Nature]120-nature 's favourite instruments were war , slaughter , famine , misery ( mental and physical ) , sacrifice and brutality in every form , with a special malignity in [her]109-valeria treatment of the most highly developed and [the noblest of the race]4349-the noblest of the race . [The Professor in vain]4350-the professor in vain pointed out that [Valeria]109-valeria 's own revolt against the brutality of Nature , was proof of some higher law in Nature , now in course of development . “[631-the crowd] The horror that is inspired in [human beings by that brutality]1166-human beings by that brutality is just as much a part of Nature as the brutality itself , ” [he]4350-the professor in vain said , and [he]4350-the professor in vain insisted that the supreme business of [man]332-man , was to evolve a scheme of life on a higher plane , wherein [the weak]4352-the weak shall not be forced to agonize for the strong , so far as [mankind]1102-mankind can intervene to prevent it . Let [man]332-man follow the dictates of pity and generosity in [his]332-man own soul . [They]4355-they would never lead [him]332-man astray . While [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria laid the whole blame upon natural law , [the Professor]4071-the professor impeached [humanity]4357-humanity . [Men]3698-men , [he]4350-the professor in vain declared , cry out against the order of things , which [they]3698-men , in a large measure , have [themselves]3698-men created . “[631-the crowd] But , good heavens ! the whole plan of life is one of rapine . [We]1167-we did not fashion the spider to prey upon the fly , or the cat to play with the wounded mouse . [We]1167-we did not ordain that [the strong]3695-the strong should fall upon [the weak]4352-the weak , and tear and torture [them]4352-the weak for [their]4352-the weak own benefit . Surely [we]1167-we are not responsible for the brutalities of the animal creation . ” “[4352-the weak] No , but [we]1167-we are responsible when [we]1167-we imitate [them]4352-the weak , ” said [the Professor]4071-the professor . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria somewhat inconsequently attempted to defend such imitation , on the ground that sacrifice is a law of life , a law of which [she]109-valeria had just been bitterly complaining . But at this , [the Professor]4071-the professor would only laugh . [[His]4071-the professor opponent]4361-his opponent indignantly cited scientific authority of the most solemn and weighty kind ; [the Professor]4071-the professor shook [his]4071-the professor head . Familiarity with [weighty scientific authorities]4363-weighty scientific authorities had bred contempt . “[1167-we] Vicarious sacrifice ! ” [he]4071-the professor exclaimed , with a sudden outbreak of the scorn and impatience that [Hadria]211-hadria had seen in [him]4071-the professor on one other occasion , “[0-i] [I]0-i never heard a doctrine more insane , more immoral , or more suicidal ! ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria hugged [herself]109-valeria in the thought of [her]109-valeria long list of [scouted authorities]4364-scouted authorities . [They]4364-scouted authorities had assured [her]109-valeria that [our]1171-we care of [the weak]4352-the weak , by interfering with the survival of the fittest , is injuring [the race]4366-the race . “[1167-we] Go down into [the slums of [[our]1171-we great cities]1172-our great cities]1170-the slums of our great cities , or to [the pestilential East]1173-the pestilential east , and there observe the survival of [the fittest]1174-the fittest , undisturbed by human knowledge or human pity , ” recommended [the Professor]4071-the professor . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria failed to see how this proved anything more than bad general conditions . “[1174-the fittest] It proves that however bad general conditions may be , [some wretches]1175-some wretches will always survive ; [the ‘ fittest , ’ of course , to endure filth and misery]1176-the ‘ fittest , ’ of course , to endure filth and misery . Selection goes on without ceasing ; but if the conditions are bad , [the surviving type]1177-the surviving type will be miserable . Mere unaided natural selection obviously can not be trusted to produce a fine race . ” Nothing would convince [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria that the preservation of [weakly persons]4368-weakly persons was not injurious to [the community]4369-the community . To this [the Professor]4071-the professor replied , that what is lost by [their]1180-short - sighted people salvation is more than paid back by the better conditions that secured it . [The strong]3695-the strong , [he]4071-the professor said , were strengthened and enabled to retain [their]3695-the strong strength by that which saves the lives of [the weak]4352-the weak . “[1178-you] Besides , do [you]1178-you suppose [a race]1179-a race could gain , in the long run , by defiance of its best instincts ? Never ! If the laws of health in body and in mind were at variance , leaving [us]1171-we a hard choice between physical and moral disease , then indeed no despair could be too black . But all experience and all insight testify to the exact opposite . Heavens , how [short - sighted people]1180-short - sighted people are ! It is not the protection of [the weak]4352-the weak , but the evil and stupid deeds that have made [them]1180-short - sighted people so , that [we]1171-we have to thank for the miseries of disease . And for [our]1171-we redemption — powers of [the universe]420-the universe ! it is not to the cowardly sacrifice of [the unfortunate]1183-the unfortunate that [we]1171-we must trust , but to a more brotherly spirit of loyalty , a more generous treatment of [all who are defenceless]1184-all who are defenceless , a more faithful holding together among [ourselves]1171-we — [weak and strong , favoured and luckless]1185-weak and strong , favoured and luckless . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria was silent for a moment . [Her]109-valeria sympathy but not [her]109-valeria hope had been roused . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could believe in [your]1178-you scheme of redemption , ” [she]0-i said ; “[0-i] but , alas ! sacrifice has been the means of progress from the beginning of all things , and so [I]0-i fear it will be to the end . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what it will be at the end , ” said [the Professor]4071-the professor , dryly ; “[0-i] for the present , [I]0-i oppose with the whole strength of [my]0-i belief and [my]0-i conscience , the cowardly idea of surrendering [individuals to the ferocity of a jealous and angry power]1186-individuals to the ferocity of a jealous and angry power , in the hope of currying favour for the rest . [We]1171-we might just as well set up national altars and sacrifice [victims]1187-victims , after the franker fashion of [the ancients]1188-the ancients . Morally , the principles are precisely the same . ” “[4357-humanity] Scarcely ; for [our]1171-we object is to benefit [humanity]4357-humanity . ” “[4357-humanity] And [theirs]4357-humanity . [Poor humanity]1190-poor humanity ! ” cried [the Professor]4071-the professor . “[1190-poor humanity] What crimes are [we]1171-we not ready to commit in [thy]4357-humanity name ! ” “[1190-poor humanity] That can not be a crime which benefits [mankind]1102-mankind , ” argued [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[1190-poor humanity] It is very certain that it can not eventually benefit [mankind]1102-mankind , if it be a crime , ” [he]4071-the professor retorted . “[1190-poor humanity] This sequence of ideas makes one dizzy ! ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria . [The Professor]4071-the professor smiled . “[1190-poor humanity] Moreover , ” [he]4071-the professor added , “[1171-we] [we]1171-we know that society has formed the conditions of existence for [each of [[her]1194-her members]1195-her members]1193-each of her members ; the whole material of [his]1193-each of her members misfortune , if [he]1193-each of her members be ill - born and ill - conditioned . Is society then to turn and rend [[her]1194-her unlucky child]1196-her unlucky child whose misery was [her]1194-her own birthday gift ? Shall [we]1171-we , who are only too ready , as it is , to trample upon [others]432-others , in [our]1171-we haste and greed — shall [we]1171-we be encouraged in this savage selfishness by what dares to call itself science , to play [one another]3945-one another false , instead of standing , with united front , to the powers of darkness , and scorning to betray [[our]1171-we fellows]1199-our fellows , human or animal , in the contemptible hope of gaining by the treachery ? Ah ! [you]1200-you may quote [authorities]1201-authorities , wise and good , till [you]1200-you are hoarse ! ” cried [the Professor]4071-the professor , with a burst of energy ; “[1201-authorities] but [they]1201-authorities will not convince [me]0-i that black is white . [I]0-i care not who may uphold the doctrine of vicarious sacrifice ; it is monstrous , it is dastardly , it is damnable ! ” There are some sentences and some incidents that fix themselves , once for all , in the memory , often without apparent reason , to remain as an influence throughout life . In this fashion , the afternoon 's discussion registered itself in the memory of [the silent member of [the trio]4378-the trio]4377-the silent member of the trio . In [her]4377-the silent member of the trio dreams that night , [those three concluding and energetic adjectives]4379-those three concluding and energetic adjectives played strange pranks , as , in dreams , words and phrases often will . [Her]4377-the silent member of the trio deep regret at [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's departure , [her]4377-the silent member of the trio dread of [her]4377-the silent member of the trio own future , [her]4377-the silent member of the trio growing sense of the torment , and horror , and sacrifice that form so large a part of the order of [the world]334-the world , all appeared to be united fantastically in malignant and threatening form , in the final words of [the Professor]4071-the professor : “[1201-authorities] It is monstrous , it is dastardly , it is damnable ! ” The agony of [the whole earth]4382-the whole earth seemed to hang over the sleeper , hovering and black and intolerable , crushing [her]4377-the silent member of the trio with a sense of hopeless pity and fatigue . And on waking , though the absurd masquerading of words and thoughts had ceased , [she]4377-the silent member of the trio was still weighed down with the horror of the dream , which [she]4377-the silent member of the trio knew had a corresponding reality still more awful . And there was no adversary to all this anguish ; [everybody]3781-everybody acquiesced , nay , [everybody]3781-everybody threw on yet another log to [the martyr]4385-the martyr 's pile , and coolly watched the hungry flames at [their]3781-everybody work , for “[1201-authorities] Nature , ” [they]3781-everybody all agreed , demanded sacrifice . It was in vain to turn for relief to [the wise and good]4386-the wise and good ; [the “[1201-authorities] wise ”]4387-the “ wise ” insisted on keeping up the altar fires that [they]4387-the “ wise ” might appease [the blood - thirsty goddess]4388-the blood - thirsty goddess by a continuous supply of [victims]1187-victims ( for the noble purpose of saving [the others]303-the others ) ; [the “[1201-authorities] good ”]4391-the “ good ” trusted to the decision of [the wise]4392-the wise ; [they]4387-the “ wise ” were humbly content to allow [others]432-others to judge for [them]4387-the “ wise ” for by this means would [they]4387-the “ wise ” not secure some of the spoils ? No , no ; there was no help anywhere on [earth]787-earth , no help , no help . So ran [Hadria]211-hadria 's thoughts , in the moments of vivid sensation , between sleeping and waking . “[1201-authorities] Suffering , sacrifice , oppression : there is nothing else under the sun , under the sun . ” Perhaps a brilliant beam that had found its way , like a message of mercy , through the blind , and shone straight on to the pillow , had suggested the form of the last thought . [Hadria]211-hadria moved [her]211-hadria hand into the ray , that [she]211-hadria might feel the warmth and “[1201-authorities] the illusion of kindness . ” There was [one person]3709-one person , and at the moment , [only one , whose existence was comforting to remember]4396-only one , whose existence was comforting to remember . The hundreds of kind and [good people , who were merely kind and good where popular sentiment expected or commended such conduct]4397-good people , who were merely kind and good where popular sentiment expected or commended such conduct , gave no re - assurance ; on the contrary , [they]4397-good people , who were merely kind and good where popular sentiment expected or commended such conduct proved the desperation of [our]4398-our plight , since wisdom and goodness [themselves]4397-good people , who were merely kind and good where popular sentiment expected or commended such conduct were busy at the savage work . When [the party]428-the party met at breakfast , an hour later , [the Professor]4071-the professor caused universal consternation , by announcing that [he]4071-the professor would be obliged to return to [London]8-london on that very day , having received a letter , by the morning 's post , which left [him]4071-the professor no choice . [The very butler]4401-the very butler paused , for a perceptible period , while handing ham and eggs to [the guest]4009-the guest . Forks and knives were laid down ; letters remained unopened . “[1201-authorities] It 's no use [your]1202-your attempting to go , [[my]0-i dear]3722-my dear [Chantrey]132-chantrey , ” said [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton , “[132-chantrey] [we]1204-we have grown accustomed to the luxury of [[your]1202-your society]1050-your society , and [we]1204-we ca n't get on without it . ” But [the Professor]4071-the professor explained that [his]4071-the professor departure was inevitable , and that [he]4071-the professor must go by [the morning train]4404-the morning train . [He]4071-the professor and [Hadria]211-hadria had time for a short walk to [the river]437-the river , by the pathway of [the tunnels]4406-the tunnels . “[1202-your] What are [your]1202-your plans for the winter ? ” [the Professor]4071-the professor asked . “[0-i] [I]0-i hope that [you]1202-your will find time to develop [your]1202-your musical gift . It ought to be used and not wasted , or worse than wasted , as all forces are , unless [they]1206-they find [their]1206-they legitimate outlet . Do n't be persuaded to do fancy embroidery , as a better mode of employing energy . [You]1202-your have peculiar advantages of a hereditary kind , if only [you]1202-your can get a reasonable chance to use them . [I]0-i have unbounded faith in [the Fullerton stock]1207-the fullerton stock . It has all the elements that ought to produce powers of the highest order . [You]1202-your know [I]0-i have always cherished a warm affection for [[your]1202-your parents]720-your parents , but ten years more of experience have taught [me]0-i better how to value that sterling sincerity and honour in [[your]1202-your father]705-your father , united with so much kindliness , not to mention [his]705-your father qualities of brain ; and then [[your]1202-your mother]832-your mother 's strong sense of duty , [her]832-your mother ability , [her]832-your mother native love of art , and [her]832-your mother wonderful devotion . These are qualities that [one]329-one does not meet with every day , and [the children of such parents]1212-the children of such parents start in life with splendid material to fashion into character and power . ” “[0-i] [Algitha]81-algitha will be worthy of [[our]1213-our parents]1214-our parents , [I]0-i think , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] though [she]81-algitha has commenced [her]81-algitha career by disobeying [them]1214-our parents . ” “[0-i] And [you]0-i too must turn [your]0-i power to account . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i ca n't conceive how difficult it is . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can very easily . [I]0-i see that the sacrifice of [her]81-algitha own development , which [[your]0-i mother]832-your mother has made for [your]0-i sakes , is taking its inevitable revenge upon [her]81-algitha , and upon [you]0-i all . [One]329-one ca n't doom [one]329-one 's best powers to decay , however excellent the motive , without bringing punishment upon [oneself]329-one and [[one]329-one 's children]1219-one 's children , in some form or other . [You]0-i will have to fight against that penalty . [I]0-i know [you]0-i will not have a smooth time of it ; but who has , except [cowards and weakliings]1220-cowards and weakliings ? [Your]0-i safeguard will be in [your]0-i work . ” “[0-i] And [my]0-i difficulty , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] In [the world]334-the world that [I]0-i was born into ( for [my]0-i sins ) , when one tries to do something that [other people]3849-other people do n't do , it is like trying to get up early in [a house]4162-a house where the breakfast - hour is late . Nothing fits in with [one]329-one 's eccentric custom ; everything conspires to discourage it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could give [you]0-i a helping hand , ” said [the Professor]4071-the professor wistfully ; “[0-i] but [one]329-one is so powerless . [Each of [us]1227-our]1226-each of us has to fight the real battle of life alone . [Nobody]3732-nobody can see with [our]1227-our eyes , or feel with [our]1227-our nerves . The crux of the difficulty [each]3686-each bears for [himself]3686-each . But friendship can help [us]1227-our to believe the struggle worth while ; it can sustain [our]1227-our courage and it can offer sympathy in victory,—but still more faithfully in defeat . ” [HADRIA]211-hadria had determined upon making a strong and patient effort to pursue [her]211-hadria work during the winter , while doing [her]211-hadria best , at the same time , to please [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother , and to make up to [her]520-her mother , as well as [she]211-hadria could , for [Algitha]81-algitha 's departure . [She]211-hadria would not be dismayed by difficulties : as [the Professor]4071-the professor said , only cowards and [weaklings]4411-weaklings escaped these . [She]211-hadria treated [herself]211-hadria austerely , and found [her]211-hadria power of concentration increasing , and [her]211-hadria hold on [herself]211-hadria greater . But , as usual , [her]211-hadria greatest effort had to be given , not to the work itself , but to win opportunity to pursue it . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton opposed [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter 's endeavours as firmly as ever . It was not good for [a girl]3734-a girl to be selfishly pre - occupied . [She]211-hadria ought to think of [others]432-others . If [Hadria]211-hadria yielded the point on any particular occasion , [her]211-hadria mood and [her]211-hadria work were destroyed : if [she]211-hadria resisted , they were equally destroyed , through the nervous disturbance and the intense depression which followed the winning of a liberty too dearly bought . The incessant rising and quelling of [her]211-hadria impulse and [her]211-hadria courage — like the ebb and flow of tides — represented a vast amount of force not merely wasted , but expended in producing a dangerous wear and tear upon the system . The process told upon [her]211-hadria health , and was the beginning of the weakening and unbalancing of the splendid constitution which [Hadria]211-hadria , in common with [every member of [the family]360-the family]4415-every member of the family , enjoyed as a birthright . The injury was insidious but serious . [Hadria]211-hadria , unable to command any certain part of the day , began to sit up at night . This led to a direct clash of wills . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton said that [the girl]3739-the girl was doing [her]3739-the girl best to ruin [her]211-hadria health for life ; [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton wished to know why [Hadria]211-hadria , who had all the day at [her]211-hadria disposal , could not spend the night rationally . “[0-i] But [I]0-i have n't all the day , or any part of it , for certain , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] If [you]0-i grudge the little services [you]0-i do for [me]0-i , pray abandon [them]1230-them , ” said [the mother]578-the mother , genuinely hurt . [Hadria]211-hadria entered [[her]211-hadria room]4419-her room , one evening , tired out and profoundly depressed . A table , covered with books , stood beside the fire . [She]211-hadria gave the top - heavy pile an impatient thrust and the mass fell , with a great crash , to the floor . A heap of manuscript — [her]211-hadria musical achievement for the past year — was involved in the fall . [She]211-hadria contemplated the wreck gravely . “[0-i] Yes , it is [I]0-i who am weak , not circumstance that is strong . If [I]0-i could keep [my]0-i mind unmoved by the irritations ; if [I]0-i could quarrel with [mother]3851-mother , and displease [father]3862-father , and offend all [the world]334-the world without a qualm , or without losing the delicate balance of thought and mood necessary for composition , then [I]0-i should , to some extent , triumph over [my]0-i circumstances ; [I]0-i should not lose so much time in this wretched unstringing . Only were [I]0-i so immovably constituted , is it probable that [I]0-i should be able to compose at all ? ” [She]211-hadria drew the score towards [her]211-hadria . “[3687-people] [People]3687-people are surprised that [women]606-women have never done anything noteworthy in music . [People]3687-people are so intelligent ! ” [She]211-hadria turned over the pages critically . If only this instinct were not so overwhelmingly strong ! [Hadria]211-hadria wondered how many [other women , from the beginning of history]4420-other women , from the beginning of history , had cursed the impulse to create ! Fortunately , it was sometimes extinguished altogether , as to - night , for instance , when every impression , every desire was swept clean out of [her]211-hadria , and [her]211-hadria mind presented a creditable blank , such as really ought to satisfy [the most exacting social mentor]4421-the most exacting social mentor . In such a state , [a woman]3753-a woman might be induced to accept anything ! [Hadria]211-hadria brought out two letters from [her]211-hadria pocket ; one from [the Professor]4071-the professor , the other from [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . The latter had been writing frequently of late , pointing out the danger of [Hadria]211-hadria 's exaggerated ideas , and the probability of [their]4424-their ruining [her]211-hadria happiness in life . [Valeria]109-valeria had suffered [herself]109-valeria from “[3687-people] ideas , ” and knew how fatal they were . Life could not be exactly as [one]329-one would have it , and it was absolutely necessary , in order to avoid misery for [oneself]329-one and [others]432-others , to consent to take things more or less as they were ; to make up [one]329-one 's mind to bend a little , rather than have to break , in the end . Things were never quite so shocking as they seemed to [one]329-one 's youthful imagination . [The world]334-the world was made up of compromises . Good was mixed with evil everywhere . The domestic idea , as [Hadria]211-hadria called it , might be , in its present phase , somewhat offensive , but it could be redeemed in its application , in the details and “[1237-they] extenuating circumstances . ” [Valeria]109-valeria could not warn [Hadria]211-hadria too earnestly against falling into the mistake that [Valeria]109-valeria [herself]109-valeria had made . [She]109-valeria had repudiated the notion of anything short of an ideal union ; a perfect comradeship , without the shadow of restraint or bondage in the relationship ; and not having found it , [she]109-valeria had refused the tie altogether . [She]109-valeria could not bring [herself]109-valeria to accept the lesser thing , having conceived the possibility of the greater . [She]109-valeria now saw [her]109-valeria error , and repented it . [She]109-valeria was reaping the penalty in a lonely and unsatisfied life . For a long time [her]109-valeria work had seemed to suffice , but [she]109-valeria felt now that [she]109-valeria had been trusting to a broken reed . [She]109-valeria was terrified at [her]109-valeria solitude . [She]109-valeria could not face the thought of old age , without a single close tie , without a [home]3770-home , without a hold upon [her]109-valeria race . [She]109-valeria ended by entreating [Hadria]211-hadria not to refuse marriage merely because [she]109-valeria could not find [a man]3704-a man to agree with [her]109-valeria in everything , or capable of entering into the spirit of the relationship that perhaps would unite [the men]3678-the men and [women of the future]4433-women of the future . It was a pity that [Hadria]211-hadria had not been born a generation later , but since [she]109-valeria had come into [the world]334-the world at this time of transition , [she]109-valeria must try to avoid the tragedy that threatens [all spirits who are pointing towards the new order]4435-all spirits who are pointing towards the new order , while the old is still working out its unexhausted impetus . This reiterated advice had begun to trouble [Hadria]211-hadria . It did not convince [her]211-hadria , but [Valeria]109-valeria 's words were incessantly repeating themselves in [her]211-hadria mind working as a ferment among [her]211-hadria thoughts . The letters from [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria and [the Professor]4071-the professor were to [her]211-hadria , a source of great pleasure and of great pain . In [her]211-hadria depressed moods , they would often rather increase [her]211-hadria despondency , because [the writers]4437-the writers used to take for granted so many achievements that [she]211-hadria had not been able to accomplish . “[1237-they] [They]1237-they think [I]0-i am living and progressing as [they]1237-they are ; [they]1237-they do not know that the riot and stir of intellectual life has ceased . [I]0-i am like a creature struggling in a quicksand . ” On [the Professor]4071-the professor 's letter , the comments were of a different character . [He]4071-the professor had recommended [her]211-hadria to read certain books , and reminded [her]211-hadria that [no possessor of good books]4439-no possessor of good books could lack the privilege of spiritual sanctuary . “[0-i] Ah ! yes , [I]0-i know few pleasures so great as that of finding [one]329-one 's own idea , or hope , or longing , finely expressed , half - born thoughts alive and of stately stature ; and then the exquisite touches of art upon quick nerves , the enlarging of the realms of imagination , knowledge , the heightening of perceptions , intuitions ; finally the blessed power of escaping from [oneself]1239-oneself , with the paradoxical reward of greater self - realization ! But , ah , [Professor]1240-professor , to [me]0-i there is a ‘ but ’ even here . [I]0-i am oppressed by a sense of the discrepancy between [the world]334-the world that books disclose to [me]0-i , and [the world that [I]0-i [myself]0-i inhabit]1242-the world that i myself inhabit . In books , the impossibilities are all left out . They give [you]1243-you no sense of the sordid Inevitable that looms so large on [the grey horizon]1244-the grey horizon . Another more personal quarrel that [I]0-i have with books is on account of [their]1245-their attacking all [my]0-i pet prejudices , and sneering at [the type of woman that [I]0-i have the misfortune to belong to]1246-the type of woman that i have the misfortune to belong to . [I]0-i am always exhorted to cure [myself]0-i of being [myself]0-i . Nothing less would suffice . Now this is wounding . All [my]0-i particular feelings , [my]0-i strongest beliefs , are condemned , directly or by inference . [I]0-i could almost believe that there is a literary conspiracy to reform [me]0-i . [The “ true women ”[1247-the “ true women ” of literature] of literature]1247-the “ true women ” of literature infallibly think and feel precisely as [I]0-i do not think and feel , while the sentiments that [I]0-i detest — woe is [me]0-i — are lauded to the skies . Truly , if [we]1248-we [women]606-women do n't know exactly what [we]1248-we ought to think and feel , it is not for want of telling . Yet [you]1250-you say , [Professor]1240-professor , in this very letter , that the sense of having a peculiar experience is always an illusion , that every feeling of [ours]1248-we has been felt before , if not in [our]1248-we own day , then in the crowded past , with its throngs of forgotten lives and unrecorded experiences . [I]0-i wish to heaven [I]0-i could meet [those who have had exactly mine]1252-those who have had exactly mine ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria did not keep up an active correspondence with [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria or with [the Professor]4071-the professor . [She]211-hadria had no idea of adding to the burden of [their]4441-their busy lives , by wails for sympathy . It seemed to [her]211-hadria feeble , and contemptible , to ask to be dragged up by [their]4441-their strength , instead of exerting [her]211-hadria own . If that were insufficient , why then let [her]211-hadria go down , as [thousands]3718-thousands had gone down before [her]211-hadria . As [a miser]4443-a miser telling [his]4443-a miser gold , [she]211-hadria would read and re - read those occasional letters , written amidst the stress of life at high pressure , and bearing evidence of that life of thought and work , in [their]4441-their tense , full - packed phrases . With what a throb of longing and envy [Hadria]211-hadria used to feel the vibration through [her]211-hadria own nerves ! It was only when completely exhausted and harassed that the response was lacking . To - night everything seemed to be obliterated . [Her]211-hadria hope , [her]211-hadria interest were , for the moment , tired out . [[Her]211-hadria friends]4444-her friends would be disappointed in [her]211-hadria , but there was no help for it . [She]211-hadria picked up the score of [her]211-hadria music , and stood , with a handful of the once precious offspring of [her]211-hadria brain held out towards the flames . Then [she]211-hadria drew it back , and half closed [her]211-hadria eyes in self - scrutinizing thought . “[1252-those who have had exactly mine] Come now , ” [she]211-hadria said to [herself]211-hadria , “[1253-you] are [you]1253-you sincere in [your]1253-you intention of giving up ? Are [you]1253-you pot doing this in a fit of spite against destiny ? as if destiny cared two straws . Heavens ! what a poor little piece of melodrama . And to think that [you]1253-you should have actually taken [yourself]1253-you in it by it . [One]329-one acts so badly with only [oneself]329-one for [audience]1255-audience . [You]1253-you know perfectly well that [you]1253-you are not going to give in , [you]1253-you are not going to attempt to stifle that which is the centre of [your]1253-you life : [you]1253-you have not courage for such slow suicide . Do n't add insincerity to the other faults that are laid to [your]1253-you account — ” [She]211-hadria mused over the little self - administered lecture . And probing down into [her]211-hadria consciousness , [she]211-hadria realized that [she]211-hadria could not face the thought of surrender . [She]211-hadria meant to fight on . The notion of giving in had been seized instinctively , for a moment of rest . Nothing should really make [her]211-hadria cease the struggle , until the power itself had been destroyed . [She]211-hadria was sure of it , in [her]211-hadria heart , in spite of failures and miserably inadequate expressions of it . Suddenly , as a shaft of light through parting clouds , came bursting forth , radiant , rejoicing , that sense of power , large , resistless , genial as morning sunshine . Yes , yes , let [them]4445-they say what [they]4445-they might , discourage , smile , or frown as [they]4445-they would , the faculty was given to [her]211-hadria , and [she]211-hadria would fight for opportunity to use it while [she]211-hadria had breath . AS if it had all been ingeniously planned , the minutest incidents and conditions of [Hadria]211-hadria 's life conspired towards the event that was to decide its drift for ever . Often , in the dim afternoon , [she]211-hadria would sit by the window and watch the rain sweeping across [the country]401-the country , longing then for [Temperley]118-hubert 's music , which used to make the wild scene so unspeakably beautiful . Now there was no music , no music anywhere , only this fierce and mournful rush of the wind , which seemed as if it were trying to utter some universal grief . At sunset , braving the cold , [she]211-hadria would mount the creaking staircase , pass along [the silent upper corridors]4447-the silent upper corridors , and on through [the empty rooms]4448-the empty rooms to [the garret in [the tower]3991-the tower]4449-the garret in the tower . The solitude was a relief ; the strangeness of the scene appealed to some wild instinct , and to the intense melancholy that lurks in the Celtic nature . Even at night , [she]211-hadria did not shrink from braving the glooms and silences of [the deserted upper floor]4451-the deserted upper floor , nor the solitude of [the garret]293-the garret , which appeared the deeper , from the many memories of happy evenings that it evoked . [She]211-hadria wished [Ernest]86-ernest would come [home]3770-home . It was so long since [she]211-hadria had seen [[her]211-hadria favourite brother]4454-her favourite brother . [She]211-hadria could not bear the thought of [his]86-ernest drifting away from [her]211-hadria . What talks [they]4455-they had had in [this old garret]4456-this old garret ! These nights in [the tower]3991-the tower , among the winds , soothed the trouble of [her]211-hadria spirit as nothing else had power to do . The mystery of life , the thrill of existence , touched [her]211-hadria with a strange joy that ran perilously near to pain . What vast dim possibilities lurked out there , in [the hollows of [the hills]413-the hills]4458-the hollows of the hills ! What inspiration thundered in the voice of the prophet wind ! Once , [she]211-hadria had gone [downstairs]4460-downstairs and out , alone , in a tearing storm , to wander across [the bleak pastures]4461-the bleak pastures , wrapt round by the wind as by a flame ; at one with the desperate elemental thing . [The wanderer]4462-the wanderer felt [herself]211-hadria caught into the heart of [some vast unknown power , of which the wind was but a thrall]4463-some vast unknown power , of which the wind was but a thrall , until [she]211-hadria became , for a moment , consciously part of that which was universal . [Her]211-hadria personality grew dim [she]211-hadria stood , as it seemed , face to face with Nature , divided from the ultimate truth by only a thin veil , to temper the splendour and the terror . Then the tension of personal feeling was loosened . [She]211-hadria saw how entirely vain and futile were the things of life that [we]4464-we grieve and struggle over . It was not a side , an aspect of existence , but the whole of it that seemed to storm round [her]211-hadria , in the darkness . No wonder , when the wind was let loose among [the mountains]4465-the mountains , that [the old Highland people]4466-the old highland people thought that [their]4466-the old highland people dead were about [them]4466-the old highland people . All night long , after [Hadria]211-hadria returned to [[her]211-hadria room]4419-her room in [the keep]294-the keep , the wind kept up its cannonade against the walls , hooting in the chimneys with derisive voices , and flinging itself , in mad revolt , against [the old - established hills]4469-the old - established hills and [the stable earth]4470-the stable earth , which changed its forms only in slow obedience to the persuadings of the elements , in the passing of centuries . It cared nothing for the passion of a single storm . And then came reaction , doubt . After all , humanity was a puny production of the Ages . [Men]3698-men and [women]606-women were like the struggling animalculæ that [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father had so often shewn [the boys]3870-the boys , in a drop of [magnified ditch - water]4475-magnified ditch - water ; yet not quite like those microscopic insects , for the stupendous processes of life had at last created a widening consciousness , a mind which could perceive the bewildering vastness of Nature and its own smallness , which could , in some measure , get outside its own particular ditch , and the strife and struggle of it , groping upwards for larger realities — “[1253-you] Over [us]1256-us stars and under [us]1256-us graves . ” To go down next morning to breakfast ; to meet the usual homely events , was bewildering after such a night . Which was dream : this or that ? So solid and convincing seemed , at times , the interests and objects of every day , that [Hadria]211-hadria would veer round to a sudden conviction that these things , or what they symbolized , were indeed the solid facts of human life , and that all other impressions arose from the disorderly working of overcharged brain - cells . It was a little ailment of youth and would pass off . Had it been possible to describe to [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father the impressions made upon [her]211-hadria by [the world]334-the world and Nature , as they had presented themselves to [her]211-hadria imagination from [her]211-hadria childhood , [he]609-her father would have prescribed change of air and gymnastics . Perhaps that was the really rational view of the matter . But what if these hygienic measures cured [her]211-hadria of the haunting consciousness of mystery and vastness ; what if [she]211-hadria became convinced of the essential importance of the Gordon pedigree , or of the amount of social consideration due to [the family who had taken [Clarenoc]7-clarenoc]4478-the family who had taken clarenoc ? Would that alter the bewildring truths of which [she]211-hadria would have ceased to think ? No ; it would only mean that the animalcule had returned to the occupations of [[its]7-clarenoc ditch]4479-its ditch , while [the worlds]4480-the worlds and [the peoples]4481-the peoples went spinning to [their]4481-the peoples destiny . “[1253-you] Do the duty that lies nearest [thee]1257-thee , ” counselled [everybody]3781-everybody : [people of all kinds , books of all kinds]4483-people of all kinds , books of all kinds . “[1253-you] Cheap , well - sounding advice , ” thought [Hadria]211-hadria , “[1253-you] sure of popularity ! Continue to wriggle industriously , O animalcule , in [that particular ditch wherein it has pleased [heaven]4276-heaven to place [thee]1257-thee]1258-that particular ditch wherein it has pleased heaven to place thee ; seek not the flowing stream and [the salt ocean]1260-the salt ocean ; and if , some clear night , a star finds room to mirror itself in [[thy]1257-thee little stagnant world]1261-thy little stagnant world , shining through the fat weeds and slime that almost shut out the heavens , pray be careful not to pay too much heed to [the high - born luminary]1262-the high - born luminary . Look to [your]1257-thee wriggling ; that is [your]1257-thee proper business . [An animalcule that does not wriggle]1263-an animalcule that does not wriggle must be morbid or peculiar . All will tender , in different forms of varying elegance , the safe and simple admonition : ‘ Wriggle and be damned to [you]1257-thee ! ’ ” It was at this somewhat fevered moment , that [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert appeared , once more , upon the scene . [Hadria]211-hadria was with [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother , taking tea at [Drumgarren]12-drumgarren , when [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , catching the sounds of [carriage wheels]4485-carriage wheels , announced that [she]91-mrs. gordon was expecting [Hubert]118-hubert and [[his]118-hubert sister]351-his sister for a visit . In another second , [the travellers]4487-the travellers were in [the drawing - room]737-the drawing - room . [Hubert]118-hubert 's self - possession was equal to the occasion . [He]118-hubert introduced [[his]118-hubert sister]351-his sister to [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton and [Hadria]211-hadria . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley was [his]118-hubert junior by a year ; [a slight , neatly - built young woman , with a sort of tact that went on brilliantly up to a certain point , and then suddenly collapsed altogether]4490-a slight , neatly - built young woman , with a sort of tact that went on brilliantly up to a certain point , and then suddenly collapsed altogether . [She]141-miss temperley had [[her]141-miss temperley brother]309-her brother 's self - complacency , and an air of encouragement which [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon seemed to find most gratifying . [She]141-miss temperley dressed perfectly , in quiet Parisian fashion . [Hadria]211-hadria saw that [[her]141-miss temperley brother]309-her brother had taken [her]141-miss temperley into [his]309-her brother confidence , or [she]141-miss temperley concluded so from something in [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley 's manner . [The latter]590-the latter treated [Hadria]211-hadria with a certain familiarity , as if [she]590-the latter had known [her]211-hadria for some time , and [she]590-the latter had a way of seeming to take [her]211-hadria apart , when addressing [her]211-hadria , as if there were a sort of understanding between [them]4494-them . It was here that [her]141-miss temperley instinct failed [her]141-miss temperley ; for [she]141-miss temperley seemed unaware that this assumption of an intimacy that did not exist was liable to be resented , and that it might be unpleasant to be expected to catch special remarks sent over the heads of [the others]303-the others , although ostensibly for the common weal . [Hadria]211-hadria thought that [she]211-hadria had never seen so strange a contrast as [this young woman]4496-this young woman 's behaviour , within and without the circle of [her]141-miss temperley perceptions . It was the more remarkable , since [her]211-hadria mind was bent upon the details and niceties of conduct , and the nuances of existence . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall come and see [you]1264-you as soon as [I]0-i can , ” [she]0-i promised , when [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton rose to leave . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley kept [her]141-miss temperley word . [She]141-miss temperley was charmed with [the old house]742-the old house , praising authoritatively . “[0-i] This is an excellent piece of carving ; far superior to the one in [the dining - room]1265-the dining - room . Ah , yes , that is charming ; so well arranged . [You]1264-you ought to have a touch of blue there to make it perfect . ” [Hubert]118-hubert shewed good taste in keeping away from [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , except to pay [his]118-hubert call on [Mr.]4498-mr. and [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton . “[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria , ” said [[his]118-hubert sister]351-his sister , “[211-hadria] [I]0-i am going to call [you]211-hadria by [your]211-hadria pretty Christian name , and [I]0-i want [you]211-hadria to call [me]0-i [Henriette]142-henriette . [I]0-i feel [I]0-i have known [you]211-hadria much longer than ten days , because [Hubert]118-hubert has told [me]0-i so much about [you]211-hadria , and [your]211-hadria music . [You]211-hadria play charmingly . So much [native talent]1266-native talent . [You]211-hadria want good training , of course ; but [you]211-hadria really might become [a brilliant performer]1267-a brilliant performer . [Hubert]118-hubert is quite distressed that [you]211-hadria should not enjoy more advantages . [I]0-i should like so much if [you]211-hadria could come and stay with [us]1268-us in [town]4255-town , and have some good lessons . Do think of it . ” [Hadria]211-hadria flushed . “[0-i] Oh , thank [you]0-i , [I]0-i could not do that — [I]0-i — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i understand [you]211-hadria , dear [Hadria]211-hadria , ” said [Henriette]142-henriette , drawing [her]142-henriette chair closer to the fire . “[211-hadria] [You]211-hadria know , [Hubert]118-hubert can never keep anything of great importance from [me]0-i . ” [She]0-i looked arch . [Hadria]211-hadria muttered something that might have discouraged a less persistent spirit , but [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley paid no attention . “[118-hubert] [Poor Hubert]118-hubert ! [I]0-i have had to be [a ministering angel]1270-a ministering angel to [him]118-hubert during these last months . ” “[1270-a ministering angel] Why do [you]0-i open up this subject , [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley ? ” “[0-i] [Henriette]142-henriette , if [you]211-hadria please , ” cried [that young woman]4500-that young woman , with the air of [a playful potentate who has requested [a favoured courtier]4502-a favoured courtier to drop the ceremonious “[211-hadria] [Your]211-hadria Majesty]4501-a playful potentate who has requested a favoured courtier to drop the ceremonious “ your majesty ” in private conversation . “[0-i] It was [I]0-i who made [him]118-hubert accept [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's invitation . [He]118-hubert very nearly refused it . [He]118-hubert feared that it would be unpleasant for [you]211-hadria . But [I]0-i insisted on [his]118-hubert coming . Why should [he]118-hubert not ? [He]118-hubert would like so much to come here more often , but again [he]118-hubert fears to displease [you]211-hadria . [He]118-hubert is not a [Temperley]141-miss temperley for nothing . [They]1271-they are not of the race of [fools who rush in where angels fear to tread]1272-fools who rush in where angels fear to tread . ” “[1271-they] Are [they]1271-they not ? ” asked [Hadria]211-hadria absently . “[1273-we] [We]1273-we both see [your]211-hadria difficulty , ” [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley went on . “[211-hadria] [Hubert]118-hubert would not so misunderstand [you]211-hadria — [the dear fellow]1274-the dear fellow is full of delicacy — and [I]0-i should dearly love to hear [him]118-hubert play to [your]211-hadria accompaniment ; [he]118-hubert used to enjoy those practices so much . Would [you]211-hadria think [him]118-hubert intrusive if [he]118-hubert brought [his]118-hubert ' cello some afternoon ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria , not without an uneasy qualm , agreed to the suggestion , though by no means cordially . [Accordingly brother]4503-accordingly brother and [sister]1054-sister arrived , one afternoon , for the practice . [Henriette]142-henriette took the leadership , visibly employed tact and judgment , talked a great deal , and was surprisingly delicate , as beseemed a [Temperley]141-miss temperley . [Hadria]211-hadria found the occasion somewhat trying nevertheless , and [Hubert]118-hubert stumbled , at first , in [his]118-hubert playing . In a few minutes , however , [both musicians]4505-both musicians became possessed by the music , and then all went well . [Henriette]142-henriette sat in an easy chair and listened critically . Now and then [she]142-henriette would call out “[211-hadria] bravo , ” or “[211-hadria] admirable , ” and when the performance was over , [she]142-henriette was warm in [her]142-henriette congratulations . [Hadria]211-hadria was flushed with the effort and pleasure of the performance . “[211-hadria] [I]0-i never heard [Hubert]118-hubert 's playing to such advantage , ” said [[his]118-hubert sister]351-his sister . “[118-hubert] [I]0-i seem to hear it for the first time . [You]1275-you really ought to practise together often . ” Another afternoon was appointed ; [Henriette]142-henriette left [Hadria]211-hadria almost no choice . After the next meeting , the constraint had a little worn off , and the temptation to continue the practising was very strong . [Henriette]142-henriette 's presence was reassuring . And then [Hubert]118-hubert seemed so reasonable , and had apparently put the past out of [his]118-hubert mind altogether . After the practice , [brother]4507-brother and [sister]1054-sister would linger a little in [the drawing - room]737-the drawing - room , chatting . [Hubert]118-hubert appeared to advantage in [[his]118-hubert sister]351-his sister 's society . [She]142-henriette had a way of striking [his]118-hubert best vein . [Her]142-henriette own talent ran with [his]118-hubert , appealed to it , and created the conditions for its display . [Her]142-henriette presence and inspiration seemed to produce , on [his]118-hubert ability , a sort of cumulative effect . [Henriette]142-henriette set all the familiar machinery in motion ; pressed the right button , and [[her]142-henriette brother]309-her brother became brilliant . A slight touch of diffidence in [his]118-hubert manner softened the effect of [his]118-hubert usual complacency . [Hadria]211-hadria liked [him]118-hubert better than [she]211-hadria had liked [him]118-hubert on [his]118-hubert previous visit . [His]118-hubert innate refinement appealed to [her]211-hadria powerfully . Moreover , [he]118-hubert was cultivated and well - read , and [his]118-hubert society was agreeable . Oh , why did this everlasting , matrimonial idea come in and spoil everything ? Why could not [men]3698-men and [women]606-women have interests in common , without wishing instantly to plunge into a condition of things which hampered and crippled [them]4514-them so miserably ? [Hadria]211-hadria was disposed to under - rate all defects , and to make the most of all virtues in [Hubert]118-hubert , at the present moment . [He]118-hubert had come at just the right time to make a favourable impression upon [her]211-hadria ; for the loneliness of [her]211-hadria life had begun to leave its mark , and to render [her]211-hadria extremely sensitive to influence . [She]211-hadria was [an alien among [the people of [her]211-hadria circle]4516-the people of her circle]4515-an alien among the people of her circle ; and [she]211-hadria felt vaguely guilty in failing to share [their]4516-the people of her circle ideas and ambitions . [Their]4516-the people of her circle glances , [their]4516-the people of her circle silences , conveyed a world of cold surprise and condemnation . [Hubert]118-hubert was tolerance [itself]118-hubert compared with [the majority of [[her]211-hadria associates]4518-her associates]4517-the majority of her associates . [She]211-hadria felt almost as if [he]118-hubert had done [her]211-hadria a personal kindness when [he]118-hubert omitted to look astonished at [her]211-hadria remarks , or to ignore them as “[1275-you] awkward . ” Yet [she]211-hadria felt uneasy about this renewal of the practices , and tried to avoid them as often as possible , though sorely against [her]211-hadria inclination . They were so great a relief and enjoyment . [Her]211-hadria inexperience , and [her]211-hadria carelessness of conventional standards , put [her]211-hadria somewhat off [her]211-hadria guard . [Hubert]118-hubert showed no signs of even remembering the interview of last year , that had been cut short by [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father 's entrance . Why should [she]211-hadria insist on keeping it in mind ? It was foolish . Moreover [she]211-hadria had been expressly given to understand , in a most pointed manner , that [her]211-hadria conduct would not be misinterpreted if [she]211-hadria allowed [him]118-hubert to come occasionally . From several remarks that [Temperley]141-miss temperley made , [she]211-hadria saw that [he]118-hubert too regarded the ordinary domestic existence with distaste . It offended [his]118-hubert fastidiousness . [He]118-hubert was fastidious to [his]118-hubert finger - tips . It amused [Hadria]211-hadria to note the contrast between [him]118-hubert and [Mr. Gordon]93-mr. gordon , who was [a typical father of [a family]4521-a family]4520-a typical father of a family ; limited in [his]93-mr. gordon interests to that circle ; [an amiable ruler of [a tiny , somewhat absurd little world]4523-a tiny , somewhat absurd little world , pompous and important and inconceivably dull]4522-an amiable ruler of a tiny , somewhat absurd little world , pompous and important and inconceivably dull . The bourgeois side of this life was evidently displeasing to [Hubert]118-hubert . Good taste was [his]118-hubert fetish . From [his]118-hubert remarks about [women]606-women , [Hadria]211-hadria was led to observe how subtly critical [he]118-hubert was with regard to feminine qualities , and wondered if [his]118-hubert preference for [herself]118-hubert ought to be regarded as a great compliment . [Henriette]142-henriette congratulated [her]142-henriette on having been admired by [the fastidious Hubert]118-hubert . “[1275-you] Let [us]1276-us hope it speaks well for [me]0-i , ” [Hadria]211-hadria replied with a cynical smile , “[1275-you] but [I]0-i have so often noticed that [men who are very difficult to please]1277-men who are very difficult to please , choose for the domestic hearth [the most dreary and unattractive woman of [their]1277-men who are very difficult to please acquaintance]1278-the most dreary and unattractive woman of their acquaintance ! [I]0-i sometimes doubt if [men]3698-men ever do marry [the women [they]3698-men most admire]1280-the women they most admire . ” “[3698-men] [They]3698-men do , when [they]3698-men can win [them]3698-men , ” said [Henriette]142-henriette . DURING [Henriette]142-henriette 's visit , one of the meetings of [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society fell due , and [she]142-henriette expressed a strong wish to be present . [She]142-henriette also craved the privilege of choosing the subject of discussion . Finally , [she]142-henriette received a formal request from [the members]4526-the members to give the lecture [herself]142-henriette . [She]142-henriette was full of enthusiasm about [the Society]359-the society ( such an educating influence ! ) , and prepared [her]142-henriette paper with great care . There had been a tendency among [the circle]4528-the circle , to politely disagree with [Henriette]142-henriette . [Her]142-henriette ideas respecting various burning topics were at variance with the trend of opinion at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , and [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley was expected to take this opportunity of enlightening [the family]360-the family . [The family]360-the family was equally resolved not to be enlightened . “[0-i] [I]0-i have chosen for [my]0-i subject to - night , ” said [the lecturer]339-the lecturer , “[0-i] one that is beginning to occupy public attention very largely : [I]0-i mean the sphere of [woman in society]1281-woman in society . ” [The audience]323-the audience , among whom [Hubert]118-hubert had been admitted at [[his]118-hubert sister]351-his sister 's earnest request , drew [themselves]323-the audience together , and a little murmur of battle ran along the line . [Henriette]142-henriette 's figure , in [her]142-henriette well - fitting Parisian gown , looked singularly out of place in [the garret]293-the garret , with the crazy old candle - holder beside [her]142-henriette , the yellow flame of the candle flinging fantastic shadows on the vaulted roof , preposterously distorting [her]142-henriette neat form , as if in wicked mockery . The moonlight streamed in , as usual on the nights chosen by [the Society]359-the society for [their]359-the society meetings . [Henriette]142-henriette 's paper was neatly expressed , and its sentiments were admirable . [She]142-henriette maintained a perfect balance between the bigotry of the past and the violence of the present . [Her]142-henriette phrases seemed to rock , like a pair of scales , from excess to excess , on either side . [She]142-henriette came to rest in the exact middle . This led to the Johnsonian structure , or , as [Hadria]211-hadria afterwards said , to the style of a Times leading article : “[0-i] While [we]1282-we remember on the one hand , [we]1282-we must not forget on the other — ” At the end of the lecture , [the audience]323-the audience found [themselves]323-the audience invited to sympathize cautiously and circumspectly with the advancement of [women]606-women , but led , at the same time , to conclude that good taste and good feeling forbade [any really nice woman]4538-any really nice woman from moving a little finger to attain , or to help [others]432-others to attain , the smallest fraction more of freedom , or an inch more of spiritual territory , than was now enjoyed by [her]142-henriette sex . When , at some future time , wider privileges should have been conquered by the exertions of [someone else]4540-someone else , then [the really nice woman]4541-the really nice woman could saunter in and enjoy the booty . But till then , let [her]142-henriette leave boisterous agitation to [others]432-others , and endear [herself]142-henriette to all around [her]142-henriette by [her]142-henriette patience and [her]142-henriette loving self - sacrifice . “[0-i] That pays better for the present , ” [Hadria]211-hadria was heard to mutter to [an adjacent member]4543-an adjacent member . [The lecturer]339-the lecturer , in [her]339-the lecturer concluding remarks , gave a smile of ineffable sweetness , sadly marred , however , by the grotesque effect of the flickering shadows that were cast on [her]339-the lecturer face by the candle . After all , duty not right was the really important matter , and [the lecturer]339-the lecturer thought that it would be better if [one]329-one heard the former word rather oftener in connection with [the woman]4547-the woman 's question , and the latter word rather more seldom . Then , with new sweetness , and in a tone not to be described , [she]339-the lecturer went on to speak of the natural responsibilities and joys of [her]339-the lecturer sex , drawing a moving , if somewhat familiar picture of those avocations , than which [she]339-the lecturer was sure there could be nothing higher or holier . For some not easily explained cause , the construction of this sentence gave it a peculiar unctuous force : “[0-i] than which , ” as [Fred]83-fred afterwards remarked , “[0-i] would have bowled over [any but the most hardened sinner]1283-any but the most hardened sinner . ” For weeks after this memorable lecture , if [any very lofty altitude]4548-any very lofty altitude had to be ascended in conversational excursions , [the aspirant]4549-the aspirant invariably smiled with ineffable tenderness and lightly scaled the height , murmuring “[0-i] than which ” to [a vanquished audience]4550-a vanquished audience . The lecture was followed by a discussion that rather took the stiffness out of [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley 's phrases . [The whole party]1013-the whole party was roused . [Algitha]81-algitha had to whisper a remonstrance to [the boys]3870-the boys , for [their]3870-the boys solemn questions were becoming too preposterous . The lecture was discussed with much warmth . There was a tendency to adopt the form “[0-i] than which ” with some frequency . Bursts of laughter startled a company of rats in the wainscoting , and there was a lively scamper behind the walls . No obvious opposition was offered . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley 's views were examined with gravity , and indeed in a manner almost pompous . But by the end of that trying process , [they]3870-the boys had a sadly bedraggled and plucked appearance , much to [[their]3870-the boys parent]4553-their parent 's bewilderment . [She]81-algitha endeavoured to explain further , and was met by guilelessly intelligent questions , which had the effect of depriving the luckless objects of [their]3870-the boys solitary remaining feather . [The members of the society]358-the members of the society continued to pine for information , and [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley endeavoured to provide it , till late into the night . The discussion finally drifted on to dangerous ground . [Algitha]81-algitha declared that [she]81-algitha considered that [no man]4555-no man had any just right to ask [a woman]3753-a woman to pledge [herself]3753-a woman to love [him]4555-no man and live with [him]4555-no man for the rest of [her]3753-a woman life . How could [she]81-algitha ? [Hubert]118-hubert suggested that [the woman]4547-the woman made the same claim on [the man]3754-the man . “[0-i] Which is equally absurd , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha . “[0-i] Just as if [any two people]1284-any two people , when [they]1284-any two people are beginning to form [their]1284-any two people characters , could possibly be sure of [their]1284-any two people sentiments for the rest of [their]1284-any two people days . [They]1284-any two people have no business to marry at such an age . [They]1284-any two people are bound to alter . ” “[1284-any two people] But [they]1284-any two people must regard it as [their]1284-any two people duty not to alter with regard to [one another]3945-one another , ” said [Henriette]142-henriette . “[1284-any two people] Quite so ; just as [they]1284-any two people ought to regard it as [their]1284-any two people duty among other things , not to grow old , ” suggested [Fred]83-fred . “[1284-any two people] Then , [Algitha]81-algitha , do [you]81-algitha mean that [they]1284-any two people may fall in love elsewhere ? ” [Ernest]86-ernest inquired . “[81-algitha] [They]1284-any two people very likely will do so , if [they]1284-any two people make such an absurd start , ” [Algitha]81-algitha declared . “[81-algitha] And if [they]1284-any two people do ? ” “[81-algitha] Then , if the sentiment stands test and trial , and proves genuine , and not a silly freak , the fact ought to be frankly faced . [Husband]1286-husband and [wife]1287-wife have no business to go on keeping up a bond that has become false and irksome . ” [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley broke into protest . “[81-algitha] But surely [you]81-algitha do n't mean to defend such faithlessness . ” [Algitha]81-algitha would not admit that it was faithlessness . [She]81-algitha said it was mere honesty . [She]81-algitha could see nothing inherently wrong in falling in love genuinely after [one]329-one arrived at years of discretion . [She]81-algitha thought it inherently idiotic , and worse , to make a choice that ought to be for life , at years of indiscretion . Still , [people]3687-people were idiotic , and that must be considered , as well as all the other facts , such as the difficulty of really knowing [each other]4561-each other before marriage , owing to social arrangements , and also owing to the training , which made [men]3698-men and [women]606-women always pose so ridiculously towards [one another]3945-one another , pretending to be something that [they]3945-one another were not . “[81-algitha] Well done , [Algitha]81-algitha , ” cried [Ernest]86-ernest , laughing ; “[81-algitha] [I]0-i like to hear [you]81-algitha speak out . Now tell [me]0-i frankly : supposing [you]81-algitha married quite young , before [you]81-algitha had had much experience ; supposing [you]81-algitha afterwards found that [you]81-algitha and [[your]81-algitha husband]1288-your husband had both been deceiving [yourselves]81-algitha and [each other]4561-each other , unconsciously perhaps ; and suppose , when more fully awakened and developed , [you]81-algitha met [another fellow]1290-another fellow and fell in love with [him]1290-another fellow genuinely , what would [you]81-algitha do ? ” “[1291-she] Oh , [she]1291-she would just mention it to [[her]1291-she husband]553-her husband casually , ” [Fred]83-fred interposed with a chuckle , “[1291-she] and disappear . ” “[1291-she] [I]0-i should certainly not go through terrific emotions and self - accusations , and think the end of [the world]334-the world had come , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha serenely . “[0-i] [I]0-i should calmly face the situation . ” “[1291-she] Calmly ! [She]1291-she by supposition being madly in love ! ” ejaculated [Fred]83-fred , with a chuckle . “[1291-she] Calmly , ” repeated [Algitha]81-algitha . “[1291-she] And [I]0-i should consider carefully what would be best for [all concerned]1294-all concerned . If [I]0-i decided , after mature consideration and self - testing , that [I]0-i ought to leave [[my]0-i husband]1295-my husband , [I]0-i should leave [him]1295-my husband , as [I]0-i should hope [he]1295-my husband would leave [me]0-i , in similar circumstances . That is [my]0-i idea of right . ” “[0-i] And is this also [your]0-i idea of right , [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton ? ” asked [Temperley]141-miss temperley , turning , in some trepidation , to [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] That seems to [me]0-i right in the abstract . One ca n't pronounce for particular cases where circumstances are entangled . ” [Hubert]118-hubert sank back in [his]118-hubert chair , and ran [his]118-hubert hand over [his]118-hubert brow . [He]118-hubert seemed about to speak , but [he]118-hubert checked [himself]118-hubert . “[0-i] Where did [you]0-i get such extraordinary ideas from ? ” cried [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . “[0-i] [They]1296-they were like [Topsy]144-topsy ; they growed , ” said [Fred]83-fred . “[144-topsy] [We]1297-we have been in the habit of speculating freely on all subjects , ” said [Ernest]86-ernest , “[144-topsy] ever since [we]1297-we could talk . This is the blessed result ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am not quite so sure now , that the Preposterous Society meets with [my]0-i approval , ” observed [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . “[0-i] If [you]0-i had been brought up in the bosom of [this Society]1298-this society , [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , [you]0-i too , perhaps , would have come to this . Think of it ! ” “[832-your mother] Does [[your]0-i mother]832-your mother know what sort of subjects [you]0-i discuss ? ” There was a shout of laughter . “[103-mother] [Mother]103-mother used often to come into [the nursery]1300-the nursery and surprise [us]1297-we in hot discussion on the origin of evil , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[103-mother] Do n't [you]0-i believe what [she]103-mother says , [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , ” cried [Fred]83-fred ; “[3851-mother] [mother]3851-mother never could teach [Hadria]211-hadria the most rudimentary notions of accuracy . ” “[103-mother] [Her]103-mother failure with [[my]0-i brothers]857-my brothers , was in the department of manners , ” [Hadria]211-hadria observed . “[103-mother] Then [she]103-mother does not know what [you]0-i talk about ? ” persisted [Henriette]142-henriette . “[103-mother] [You]0-i ask [her]103-mother , ” prompted [Fred]83-fred , with undisguised glee . “[0-i] [She]103-mother never attends [our]1297-we meetings , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha . “[103-mother] Well , well , [I]0-i can not understand it ! ” cried [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . “[103-mother] However , [you]0-i do n't quite know what [you]0-i are talking about , and one must n't blame [you]0-i . ” “[103-mother] No , do n't , ” urged [Fred]83-fred ; “[103-mother] [we]1297-we are [a sensitive family]1303-a sensitive family . ” “[103-mother] Shut up ! ” cried [Ernest]86-ernest with a warning frown . “[103-mother] Oh , [you]0-i are a coarse - grained exception ; [I]0-i speak of the family average , ” [Fred]83-fred answered with serenity . [Henriette]142-henriette felt that nothing more could be done with [this strange audience]4565-this strange audience . [Her]142-henriette business was really with [the President of [the Society]359-the society]4566-the president of the society .
