[She]1504-the cook has told [you]0-i of [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's arrival ? ” “[1504-the cook] [She]1504-the cook has told [me]0-i nothing of the sort . ” [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley did not look overjoyed . There had never been much cordiality between [him]4831-him and [Valeria]109-valeria since the afternoon when [they]4832-they had met at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , and found [their]4832-they sentiments in hopeless opposition . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria took no interest in [Hubert]118-hubert , though [she]109-valeria admired [his]118-hubert character . [She]109-valeria had every wish to make [herself]109-valeria agreeable to [him]118-hubert , but [her]109-valeria efforts in that direction were somewhat what neutralized by an incurable absence of mind . If [she]109-valeria was not interested , as [Hadria]211-hadria said , [she]109-valeria was seldom affable . Possibly [Hubert]118-hubert 's request to [her]109-valeria , years ago at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , to “[1504-the cook] think for a moment ” had not been forgiven . “[1504-the cook] Where is [she]1564-she ? Oh ! — ” The exclamation was in consequence of [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's appearing at the door of [the library]4805-the library , whence [she]0-i surveyed [the group]941-the group with absent - minded intentness . [Valeria]109-valeria woke up with a start , and responded to [Hubert]118-hubert 's greeting in an erratic fashion , replying tragically , to a casual enquiry as to [her]109-valeria health , that [she]109-valeria had been frightfully ill . “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was dying . But one never dies , ” [she]0-i added in a disgusted tone , whereat [Hadria]211-hadria heartlessly laughed , and hurried [the visitor]4013-the visitor [upstairs]4836-upstairs to help [her]109-valeria to unpack . “[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria , ” said [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , while [that lady]531-that lady was confusedly trying to disentangle hat and hair , hat - pin and head , without involving the entire system in a common ruin—“Valeria[109-valeria] , [we]1565-we are [not a remarkable people at [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene]1566-not a remarkable people at craddock dene . [We]1565-we may be worthy , [we]1565-we may have [our]1565-we good points , but [we]1565-we are not brilliant ( except [the cook]1504-the cook ) . Should [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming fail to impress [you]109-valeria as [a person of striking personality]1568-a person of striking personality , [I]0-i ask [you]109-valeria , as a favour , not to emblazon that impression on every feature : should [he]159-joseph fleming address to [you]109-valeria a remark that [you]109-valeria do not find interesting , and it is quite conceivable that [he]159-joseph fleming may — do not glare at [him]159-joseph fleming scornfully for a moment , and — ” [Hadria]211-hadria was not allowed to finish the sentence . “[159-joseph fleming] As if [I]0-i ever did any such thing — and [people]3687-people are so dull , ” said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . A few “[159-joseph fleming] curried details , ” as [the hostess]4838-the hostess dejectedly described the fare , had been supplemented with vegetables , fruit , and impromptu preparations of eggs , and the luncheon was pronounced excellent and ample . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria said that [she]109-valeria hoped [the butcher]1545-the butcher would always forget to send the meat . [She]109-valeria liked these imaginative meals . [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley purposely misunderstood [her]109-valeria to say “[159-joseph fleming] imaginary meals , ” and hoped that next time [she]109-valeria came , [Hadria]211-hadria would not have [an oratorio]4840-an oratorio in course of composition . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria expressed a fiery interest in the oratorio . “[0-i] [I]0-i judge the presence of [oratorio]1570-oratorio by the absence of food , ” [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley explained suavely . [Hadria]211-hadria watched the encounter with a mingled sense of amusement and discomfort . [Valeria]109-valeria was in no danger . To be morally crushed by [an adversary]4841-an adversary , it is necessary that [one]329-one should be at least aware that [the adversary]784-the adversary is engaged in crushing one : a consciousness that was plainly denied to [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . [Many a man far less able than [Hubert]118-hubert]4844-many a man far less able than hubert had power to interest [her]211-hadria , while [he]118-hubert could not even hold [her]211-hadria attention . [She]211-hadria used to complain to [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue that [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley 's ideas never seemed to have originated in [his]118-hubert own brain : they had been imported ready - made . [Hubert]118-hubert was among [the many who shrink and harden into mental furrows]4845-the many who shrink and harden into mental furrows as time passes . What [he]118-hubert had thought at twenty , at thirty - five had acquired sanctity and certainty , from having been the opinion of [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert for all those favoured years . [He]118-hubert had no suspicion that the views which [he]118-hubert cherished in so dainty and scholarly a fashion were simply an edition de luxe of the views of [everybody else]4846-everybody else . But [[his]118-hubert wife]573-his wife had made that discovery long ago . [He]118-hubert smiled at the views of [everybody else]4846-everybody else : [his]118-hubert own were put forth as something choice and superior . [He]118-hubert had the happy knack of being bourgeois with the air of [an artist]4849-an artist . If one could picture [one]329-one 's grocer weighing out sugar in a Spanish cloak and [brigand]4851-brigand 's hat , it would afford an excellent symbol of [his]118-hubert spiritual estate . To be perfectly commonplace in a brilliantly original way , is to be notable after all . [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming seemed puzzled by [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , at whom [he]118-hubert glanced uneasily from time to time , wondering what [she]109-valeria would say next . At [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene , [ladies]3680-ladies usually listened with a more or less breathless deference when [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley spoke . [This new - comer]4853-this new - comer seemed recklessly independent . [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley endeavoured to lead the conversation in ways of peace , but [Valeria]109-valeria was evidently on the war - path . [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley was polite and ironical , with undermeanings for [Hadria]211-hadria 's benefit . “[0-i] If [one]329-one asks impossible things of life , [one]329-one is apt to be disappointed , [I]0-i fear , ” [he]1574-you said serenely . “[0-i] Ask for the possible and natural harvest of [a woman]3753-a woman 's career , and see if [you]1574-you do n't get it . ” “[1574-you] Let a canary plead for its cage , in short , and its commendable prayer will be answered ! ” “[1574-you] If [you]1574-you like to put it thus ungraciously . [I]0-i should say that one who makes the most of [his]1575-his opportunities , as [they]1576-they stand , fares better than [he]1575-his who sighs for [other worlds]1577-other worlds to conquer . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose that is what [[his]1575-his relatives]1578-his relatives said to [Columbus]170-columbus , ” observed [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[0-i] And how do [you]1574-you know [they]1578-his relatives were not right ? ” [he]1575-his retorted . [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley gave the signal to rise . “[1574-you] Let 's go for a walk , ” [she]154-mrs. temperley suggested , “[1574-you] the afternoon invites [us]1579-we . Look at it . ” The brilliant sunshine and the exercise brought about a more genial mood . Only once was there anything approaching friction , and then it was [Hadria]211-hadria [herself]211-hadria who caused it . “[1574-you] Yes , [we]1579-we all flatter [ourselves]1579-we that [we]1579-we are observing life , when [we]1579-we are merely noting the occasions when some musty old notion of [ours]1579-we happens , by chance , to get fulfilled . ” [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert at once roused [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's interest by the large stores of information that [he]118-hubert had to pour forth on the history of [the district]714-the district , from its earliest times to the present . [He]118-hubert recalled the days when [these lands that looked so smooth and tended had been mere wastes of [marsh and forest]4856-marsh and forest]4855-these lands that looked so smooth and tended had been mere wastes of marsh and forest . How quickly these great changes were accomplished ! [Valeria]109-valeria stood on the brow of [a wide corn - field]4857-a wide corn - field , looking out over [the sleeping country]4858-the sleeping country . A century , after all , was not much more than [one person]3709-one person 's lifetime , yet in scarcely nine of these — nine little troubled lifetimes — what incredible things had occurred in [this island of ours]4860-this island of ours ! How did it all come about ? “[1574-you] Not assuredly , ” [Valeria]109-valeria remarked with sudden malice , “[1574-you] by taking things as [they]1580-they stood , and making the best of [them]1580-they with imbecile impatience . If [everyone]3726-everyone had done that , what sort of an [England]14-england should [I]0-i have had stretching before [my]0-i eyes at this moment ? ” “[1582-you] [You]1582-you would not have been here to see , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , lazily rolling stones down [the hill]3975-the hill with [her]211-hadria foot . “[1582-you] [We]1583-we should [all of [us]1583-we]1584-all of us have been dancing round some huge log - fire on [the borders of [a primeval forest]1586-a primeval forest]1585-the borders of a primeval forest , and instead of browsing on salads , as [we]1583-we did to - day , [we]1583-we should be sustaining [ourselves]1583-we on the unholy nourishment of boiled parent or grilled aunt . ” [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert 's refined appearance and manner seemed to raise an incarnate protest against this revolting picture . For some occult reason , the imagination of all was at work especially and exclusively on the figure of [that polished gentleman in war - paint and feathers]4862-that polished gentleman in war - paint and feathers , sporting round the cauldron that contained the boiled earthly remains of [[his]118-hubert relations]4863-his relations . [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming betrayed the common thought by remarking that it would be very becoming to [him]159-joseph fleming . “[0-i] Ah ! [I]0-i wish [we]1583-we were [all savages in feathers and war - paint]1587-all savages in feathers and war - paint , dancing on the edge of [some wild forest]1588-some wild forest , with nothing but [the sea]1589-the sea and the sky for limits ! ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria surprised [[her]109-valeria audience]320-her audience by this earnest aspiration . “[1590-you] Do [you]1590-you feel inclined to revert ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria enquired . “[1590-you] Because if so , [I]0-i shall be glad to join [you]1590-you . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think there is a slight touch of the savage about [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , ” observed [Fleming]159-joseph fleming pensively . “[154-mrs. temperley] [I]0-i mean , do n't [you]1590-you know — of course—. ” “[1590-you] [You]1590-you are quite right ! ” cried [Valeria]109-valeria . “[1590-you] [I]0-i have often noticed a sort of wildness that crops up now and then through a very smooth surface . [Hadria]211-hadria may sigh for [the woodlands]1591-the woodlands , yet — ! ” THE first break in the unity of [the Fullerton family]4073-the fullerton family had occurred on the occasion of [Hadria]211-hadria 's marriage . The short period that elapsed between that memorable New - Year's - Eve and the wedding had been a painful experience for [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee . [Hadria]211-hadria 's conduct had shaken [[her]211-hadria brothers]4866-her brothers ' faith in [her]211-hadria and in [all womankind]4867-all womankind . [Ernest]86-ernest especially had suffered disillusion . [He]86-ernest had supposed [her]211-hadria above the ordinary , pettier weaknesses of [humanity]4357-humanity . [[Other fellows]4869-other fellows ' sisters]4870-other fellows ' sisters had seemed to [him]86-ernest miserable travesties of [their]4870-other fellows ' sisters sex compared with [her]211-hadria . ( There was one exception only , to this rule . ) But now , what was [he]86-ernest to think ? [She]211-hadria had shattered [his]86-ernest faith . If [she]211-hadria had n't been “[1592-herself] so cocksure of [herself]1592-herself , ” [he]86-ernest would n't have minded so much ; but after all [she]211-hadria had professed , to go and marry , and marry [a starched specimen like that]4871-a starched specimen like that ! [Fred]83-fred was equally emphatic . For a long time [he]86-ernest had regarded it all as a joke . [He]86-ernest shook [his]86-ernest head knowingly , and said that sort of thing would n't go down . When [he]86-ernest was at length convinced , [he]86-ernest danced with rage . [He]86-ernest became cynical . [He]86-ernest had no patience with [girls]3769-girls . [They]3769-girls talked for talking 's sake . It meant nothing . [Algitha]81-algitha understood , better than [[her]81-algitha brothers]4866-her brothers could understand , how [Hadria]211-hadria 's emotional nature had been caught in some strange mood , how the eloquent assurances of [[her]211-hadria lover]4642-her lover might have half convinced [her]211-hadria . [Algitha]81-algitha 's own experience of proposals set [her]81-algitha on the track of the mystery . “[1592-herself] It is most misleading , ” [she]81-algitha pointed out , to [[her]81-algitha scoffing brothers]4875-her scoffing brothers . “[329-one] [One]329-one would suppose that marrying was the simplest thing in [the world]334-the world — nothing perilous , nothing to object to about it . [A man]3704-a man proposes to [you]1596-you as if [he]3704-a man were asking [you]1596-you for the sixth waltz , only [his]3704-a man manner is perfervid . And [my]0-i belief is that half [the girls who accept]1597-the girls who accept do n't realize that [they]1597-the girls who accept are agreeing to anything much more serious . ” “[1598-the more fools] [The more fools]1598-the more fools [they]1597-the girls who accept ! ” “[3704-a man] True ; but it really is most bewildering . Claims , obligations , all the ugly sides of the affair are hidden away ; [the man]3754-the man is at [his]3754-the man best , full of refinement and courtesy and unselfishness . And if [he]3754-the man persuades [the girl]3739-the girl that [he]3754-the man really does care for [her]3739-the girl , how can [she]3739-the girl suppose that [she]3739-the girl can not trust [her]3739-the girl future to [him]3754-the man — if [he]3754-the man loves [her]3739-the girl ? And yet [she]3739-the girl ca n't ! ” “[3739-the girl] How can [a man]3704-a man suppose that [one girl]1602-one girl is going to be different from [every other girl]1603-every other girl ? ” asked [Fred]83-fred . “[3754-the man] Different , [you]1604-you mean , from what [he]3754-the man supposes [every other girl]1603-every other girl to be , ” [Algitha]81-algitha corrected . “[3754-the man] It 's [his]3754-the man own look - out if [he]3754-the man 's such [a fool]1606-a fool . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i believe [Hadria]211-hadria married because [she]211-hadria was sick of being [the family consolation]3836-the family consolation , ” said [Ernest]86-ernest . “[211-hadria] Well , of course , the hope of escape was very tempting . [[You]1608-you boys]3840-you boys do n't know what [she]211-hadria went through . [We]3840-you boys all regret [her]211-hadria marriage to [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert — though between [ourselves]3840-you boys , not more than [he]118-hubert regrets it , if [I]0-i am not much mistaken — but it is very certain that [she]211-hadria could not have gone on living at [home]3770-home much longer , as things were . ” [Fred]83-fred said that [she]211-hadria ought to have broken out after [Algitha]81-algitha 's fashion , if it was so bad as all that . “[0-i] [I]0-i think [mother]3851-mother would have died if [she]211-hadria had , ” said [the sister]4876-the sister . “[0-i] [Hadria]211-hadria was awkwardly placed , ” [Fred]83-fred admitted . “[211-hadria] Do [you]1612-you remember that evening in [the garret]293-the garret when [we]3840-you boys all told [her]211-hadria what [we]3840-you boys thought ? ” asked [Ernest]86-ernest . [Nobody]3732-nobody had forgotten that painful occasion . “[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria said then that if the worst came to the worst , [she]211-hadria would simply run away . What could prevent [her]211-hadria ? ” “[1615-his] [That wretched sister of [his]1615-his]1614-that wretched sister of his ! ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha . “[1615-his] If it had n't been for [her]211-hadria , the marriage would never have taken place . [She]211-hadria got the ear of [mother]3851-mother after the engagement , and [I]0-i am certain it was through [her]211-hadria influence that [mother]3851-mother hurried the wedding on so . If only there had been a little more time , it could have been prevented . And [Henriette]142-henriette knew that . [She]142-henriette is as knowing — ” “[142-henriette] [I]0-i wish [we]3840-you boys had strangled [her]142-henriette . ” “[142-henriette] [I]0-i shall never forget , ” [Algitha]81-algitha went on , “[142-henriette] that night when [Hadria]211-hadria was taken with a fit of terror — it was nothing less — and wrote to break off the engagement , and [that woman]1618-that woman undertook to deliver the letter and lost it , on purpose [I]0-i am always convinced , and then the favourable moment was over . ” “[211-hadria] What made [her]211-hadria so anxious for the marriage beats [me]0-i , ” cried [Ernest]86-ernest . “[211-hadria] It was not a particularly good match from a mercenary point of view . ” “[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria thought [us]3840-you boys [an interesting family to marry into]1619-an interesting family to marry into , ” suggested [Fred]83-fred , “[211-hadria] which is undeniable . ” “[211-hadria] Then [she]211-hadria must be greatly disappointed at seeing so little of [us]3840-you boys ! ” cried [Ernest]86-ernest . In the early days , [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley had stayed frequently at [the Red House]4718-the red house , and [Hadria]211-hadria had been cut off from [[her]211-hadria own family]4879-her own family , who detested [Henriette]142-henriette . For a year or more , there had been a fair promise of a successful adjustment of the two incongruous natures in the new conditions . [They]3840-you boys both tried to keep off dangerous ground and to avoid collisions of will . [They]3840-you boys made the most of [their]3840-you boys one common interest , although even here [they]3840-you boys soon found [themselves]3840-you boys out of sympathy . [Hubert]118-hubert 's instincts were scholastic and lawful , [Hadria]211-hadria was disposed to daring [innovation]171-innovation . [Her]211-hadria bizarre compositions shocked [him]118-hubert painfully . [The two]4880-the two jarred on one another , in great things and in small . The halcyon period was short - lived . The dream , such as it was , came to an end . [Hubert]118-hubert turned to [[his]118-hubert sister]351-his sister , in [his]118-hubert bewilderment and disappointment . [They]3840-you boys had both counted so securely on the effect of experience and the pressure of events to teach [Hadria]211-hadria the desirable lesson , and [they]3840-you boys were dismayed to find that , unlike [other women]4882-other women , [she]211-hadria had failed to learn it . [Henriette]142-henriette was in despair . It was [she]142-henriette who had brought about the ill - starred union . How could [she]142-henriette ever forgive [herself]142-henriette ? How repair the error [she]142-henriette had made ? Only by devoting [herself]142-henriette to [[her]142-henriette brother]309-her brother , and trying patiently to bring [[his]309-her brother wife]573-his wife to a wiser frame of mind . A considerable time had elapsed , during which [Hadria]211-hadria saw [[her]211-hadria brothers]4866-her brothers and [sister]1054-sister only at long intervals . [Ernest]86-ernest had become estranged from [her]211-hadria , to [her]211-hadria great grief . [He]86-ernest was as courteous and tender in [his]86-ernest manner to [her]211-hadria as of yore , but there was a change , not to be mistaken . [She]211-hadria had lost [the brother of [her]211-hadria girlhood]4887-the brother of her girlhood for ever . While it bitterly grieved , it did not surprise [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria acknowledged in dismay the inconsistency of [her]211-hadria conduct . [She]211-hadria must have been mad ! The universal similarity in the behaviour of [girls]3769-girls , [herself]211-hadria included , alarmed [her]211-hadria . Was there some external will that drove [them]3769-girls all , in hordes , to [their]3769-girls fate ? Were all the intricacies of event and circumstance , of [their]3769-girls very emotion , merely the workings of that ruthless cosmic will by which [the individual]4889-the individual was hypnotised and ruled ? As usual at critical moments , [Hadria]211-hadria had been solitary in [her]211-hadria encounter with the elements of [Fate]102-fate . There were conflicts that even [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister knew nothing about , the bewilderments and temptations of a nature hampered in its action by its own voluminous qualities and its caprice . [[Her]211-hadria brothers]4866-her brothers supposed that in a short time [Hadria]211-hadria would be “[211-hadria] wearing bonnets and a card - case , and going the rounds with an elegant expression like the rest of [them]1620-them . ” How different were the little local facts of life — the little chopped - up life that accumulates in odds and ends from moment to moment — from the sun - and - smoke vision of early irresponsible days ! [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was pleased with the marriage , not merely because [[Hubert]118-hubert 's father]4892-hubert 's father , [Judge Temperley]131-temperley , could secure for [[his]4892-hubert 's father son]4893-his son a prosperous career , but because [she]97-mrs. fullerton was so thankful to see [a strange , unaccountable girl like [Hadria]211-hadria]4894-a strange , unaccountable girl like hadria settling quietly down , with [a couple of [children]626-children]4895-a couple of children to keep [her]211-hadria out of mischief . That was what it had come to ! Perhaps [they]4866-her brothers calculated a little too surely . Possibly [even two children]4897-even two children might not keep [her]211-hadria entirely out of mischief . Out of what impulse of malice had [Fate]102-fate pitched upon [the most essentially mutinous and erratic of the whole brood]4898-the most essentially mutinous and erratic of the whole brood , for the sedatest rôle ? But perhaps [Fate]102-fate , too , had calculated unscientifically . Mischief was always possible , if [one]329-one gave [one]329-one 's mind to it . Or was [she]211-hadria growing too old to have the spirit for thorough - going devilry ? [Youth]172-youth seemed rather an affair of mental outlook than of years . [She]211-hadria felt twenty years older since [her]211-hadria marriage . [She]211-hadria wondered why it was that marriage did not make [all women wicked,—openly and actively so]4901-all women wicked,—openly and actively so . If ever there was an arrangement by which every evil instinct and every spark of [the devil]1352-the devil was likely to be aroused and infuriated , surely the customs and traditions that clustered round [this estate]4903-this estate constituted that dangerous combination ! Hardship , difficulty , tragedy could be faced , but not the humiliating , the degrading , the contemptible . [Hadria]211-hadria had [her]211-hadria own particular ideas as to what ought to be set down under these headings . [Most women]4904-most women , [she]211-hadria found , ranked certain elements very differently , with lavish use of halos and gilding in [their]4904-most women honour , feeling perhaps , [she]211-hadria hinted , the dire need of such external decoration . Good heavens ! Did [no other woman]4905-no other woman realize the insult of it all ? [Hadria]211-hadria knew [so few women]4906-so few women intimately ; none intimately enough to be convinced that no such revolt lay smouldering beneath [their]4906-so few women smiles . [She]211-hadria had a lonely assurance that [she]211-hadria had never met [the sister - soul]4907-the sister - soul ( for such there must be by the score , as silent as [she]211-hadria ) , who shared [her]211-hadria rage and [her]211-hadria detestations . [Valeria]109-valeria , with all [her]109-valeria native pride , regarded these as proof of a big flaw in an otherwise sound nature . Yet how deep , how passionately strong , these feelings were , how gigantic the flaw ! What possessed [people]3687-people that [they]3687-people did not see what was so brutally clear ? As [young girls]863-young girls led forth unconscious into the battle , with a bandage over [their]863-young girls eyes , and cotton - wool in [their]863-young girls ears — yes , then it was inevitable that [the !]4910-the ! should see and hear nothing . Had [they]863-young girls been newly imported from [the moon]4911-the moon [they]863-young girls could scarcely have less acquaintance with terrestrial conditions ; but afterwards , when ruthlessly , with the grinning assistance of [the onlookers]461-the onlookers , the facts of the social scheme were cynically revealed , and [the rôle]4913-the rôle imperiously allotted — with much admonition and moving appeals to conscience and religion , and all [the other aides - de - camp at command]4914-the other aides - de - camp at command — after all that , how in the name of [heaven]4276-heaven could [they]863-young girls continue to “[211-hadria] babble of [green fields]1621-green fields ” ? Was it conceivable that among [the thousands of women to whom year after year the facts were disclosed , not one understood and not one]4916-the thousands of women to whom year after year the facts were disclosed , not one understood and not one — hated ? A flame sprang up in [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes . There must be [other women]4882-other women somewhere at this very moment , whose whole being was burning up with this bitter , this sickening and futile hatred ! But how few , how few ! How vast was [the meek majority]4918-the meek majority , fattening on indignity , proud of [their]4918-the meek majority humiliation ! Yet how wise [they]4918-the meek majority were after all . It hurt so to hate — to hate like this . Submission was an affair of temperament , a gift of birth . Nature endowed with a serviceable meekness those whom [she]211-hadria designed for insult . Yet it might not be meekness so much as mere brutal necessity that held [them]863-young girls all in thrall — the inexorable logic of conditions . [Fate]102-fate knew better than to assail [the victim]870-the victim point blank , and so put [her]870-the victim on [her]870-the victim guard . No ; [she]211-hadria lured [her]870-the victim on gently , cunningly , closing behind [her]870-the victim , one by one , the doors of escape , persuading [her]870-the victim , forcing [her]870-the victim to fasten on [her]870-the victim own tethers , appealing to a thousand qualities , good and bad ; now to a moment 's weakness or pity , now to [her]870-the victim eternal fear of grieving [others]432-others ( that was a well - worked vein ! ) , now to [her]870-the victim instinct of self - sacrifice , now to grim necessity itself , profiting too by the increasing discouragements , the vain efforts , the physical pain and horrible weariness , the crowding of little difficulties , harassments , the troubles of [others]432-others — ah ! how infinite were these ! so that there was no interval for breathing , and scarcely time or space to cope with the legions of the moment ; the horizon was black with [their]4918-the meek majority advancing hosts ! And this assuredly was no unique experience . [Hadria]211-hadria remembered how [she]211-hadria had once said that if the worst came to the worst , it would be easy to run away . To [her]211-hadria inexperience desperate remedies had seemed so simple , so feasible — the factors of life so few and unentwined . [She]211-hadria had not understood how prolific are [our]4922-us deeds , how an act brings with it a large and unexpected progeny , which surround [us]4922-us with new influences and force upon [us]4922-us unforeseen conditions . Yet frequent had been the impulse to adopt that girlish solution of the difficulty . [She]211-hadria had no picturesque grievances of the kind that would excite sympathy . On the contrary , popular feeling would set dead against [her]211-hadria ; [she]211-hadria would be acting on an idea that [nobody]3732-nobody shared , not even [[her]211-hadria most intimate friend]4924-her most intimate friend . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria had arrived at the conclusion that [she]109-valeria did not understand [Hadria]211-hadria . [She]109-valeria had attributed many of [her]211-hadria peculiarities to [her]211-hadria unique education and [her]211-hadria inexperience . [Hadria]211-hadria had indeed changed greatly since [her]211-hadria marriage , but not in the manner that might have been expected . On the contrary , a closer intimacy with popular social ideals had fired [her]211-hadria with a more angry spirit of rebellion . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria had met examples of every kind of eccentricity , but [she]109-valeria had never before come upon so marked an instance of this particular type . [Hadria]211-hadria 's attitude towards life had suggested to [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria the idea of [[her]109-valeria heroine]4005-her heroine , [Caterina]173-caterina . [She]211-hadria remonstrated with [Hadria]211-hadria , assuring [her]211-hadria that no insult towards [women]606-women was intended in the general scheme of society , and that it was a mistake to regard it in so resentful a spirit . “[211-hadria] But that is just the most insulting thing about it , ” [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed . “[211-hadria] Insult is so much a matter of course that [people]3687-people are surprised if one takes umbrage at it . Read this passage from [Aristotle]174-aristotle that [I]0-i came upon the other day . [He]174-aristotle is perfectly calm and amiable , entirely unconscious of offence , when [he]174-aristotle says that ‘ [a wife]1373-a wife ought to shew [herself]1373-a wife even more obedient to the rein than if [she]1373-a wife entered [the house]296-the house as [a purchased slave]1625-a purchased slave . For [she]1373-a wife has been bought at a high price , for the sake of sharing life and bearing [children]626-children , than which no higher or holier tie can possibly exist . ’ ( [Henriette]142-henriette to the very life ! ) ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria laughed , and re - read the passage from the Politics , in some surprise . “[1627-you] Do [you]1627-you suppose insult is deliberately intended in that graceful sentiment ? ” asked [Hadria]211-hadria . “[1627-you] Obviously not . If [any woman of that time]1628-any woman of that time had blazed up in anger at the well - meant speech , [she]1628-any woman of that time would have astonished and grieved [[her]1628-any woman of that time contemporaries]1629-her contemporaries . [Aristotle]174-aristotle doubtless professed a high respect for women who followed [his]174-aristotle precepts — as [men]3698-men do now when [we]1631-our are obedient . ” “[174-aristotle] Of course , [our]1631-our society in this particular has not wandered far from the Greek idea , ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria observed pensively . [Hadria]211-hadria pronounced the paradox , “[174-aristotle] The sharpness of the insult lies in its not being intended . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria could not prevail upon [her]211-hadria to modify the assertion . [Hadria]211-hadria pointed out that [the Greeks]175-the greeks also meant no offence in regarding [[their]175-the greeks respectable women]4927-their respectable women as [simple reproductive agents of inferior human quality]4928-simple reproductive agents of inferior human quality . “[174-aristotle] And though [our]1631-our [well - brought - up girls]1632-well - brought - up girls shrink from the frank speech , [they]1632-well - brought - up girls do not appear to shrink from the ideas of [the old Greeks]1633-the old greeks . [They]1632-well - brought - up girls do n't mind playing the part of cows so long as [one]329-one does n't mention it . ” About eighteen months ago , [the village]1124-the village had been full of talk and excitement in consequence of the birth of [an heir to [the house of [Engleton]27-engleton]4931-the house of engleton]4930-an heir to the house of engleton , [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton 's mission in life being frankly regarded as unfulfilled during the previous three or four years , when [she]176-lady engleton had disappointed the hopes of [the family]360-the family . [Hadria]211-hadria listened scornfully . In [her]211-hadria eyes , the crowning indignity of the whole affair was [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton 's own smiling acceptance of the position , and [her]176-lady engleton complacent eagerness to produce [the tardy inheritor of the property]4933-the tardy inheritor of the property and honours . This expression of sentiment had , by some means , reached [the Vicarage]4698-the vicarage and created much consternation . [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker asserted that it was right and Christian of [the lady]3679-the lady to desire that which gave [every one]913-every one so much pleasure . “[329-one] A climax of feminine abjectness ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria had exclaimed in [Henriette]142-henriette 's presence . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , after endeavouring to goad [[her]141-miss temperley sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law into the expression of jubilant congratulations , was met by the passionate declaration that [she]141-miss temperley felt more disposed to weep than to rejoice , and more disposed to curse than to weep . Obviously , [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley had reason to be uneasy about [her]141-miss temperley part in bringing about [[her]141-miss temperley brother]309-her brother 's marriage . These sudden overflows of exasperated feeling had become less frequent as time went on , but [the neighbours]1469-the neighbours looked askance at [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . Though a powder - magazine may not always blow up , one passes it with a grave consciousness of vast stores of inflammable material lying somewhere within , and who knows what spark might set the thing spouting to the skies ? When [the occasional visitors]4940-the occasional visitors had left , life in [the village]1124-the village settled down to its normal level , or more accurately , to [its]1124-the village normal flatness as regarded general contours , and its petty inequalities in respect to local detail . It reminded [Hadria]211-hadria of the landscape which stretched in quiet long lines to the low horizon , while close at hand , [the ground]4942-the ground fussed and fretted itself into minor ups and downs of no character , but with all the trouble of [a mountain district in [its]1124-the village complexities of slope and hollow]4943-a mountain district in its complexities of slope and hollow . [Hadria]211-hadria suffered from a gnawing home - sickness ; a longing for the rougher , bleaker scenery of [the North]28-the north . The tired spirit translated [the homely English country]4944-the homely english country , so deeply reposeful in [its]4944-the homely english country spirit , into an image of dull unrest . If only those broken , stupid lines could have been smoothed out into the grandeur of [a plain]4945-a plain , [Hadria]211-hadria thought that it would have comforted [her]211-hadria , as if a song had moved across it with the long - stretching winds . As it was , to look from [her]211-hadria window only meant to find repeated the trivialities of life , more picturesque indeed , but still trivialities . It was the estimable and domestic qualities of Nature that presented themselves : Nature in [her]211-hadria most maternal and uninspired mood — Mother earth submissive to the dictatorship of [man]332-man , permitting [herself]211-hadria to be torn , and wounded , and furrowed , and harrowed at [his]332-man pleasure , yielding [her]211-hadria substance and [her]211-hadria life to sustain the produce of [his]332-man choosing , [her]211-hadria body and [her]211-hadria soul abandoned supine to [his]332-man caprice . The sight had an exasperating effect upon [Hadria]211-hadria . Its symbolism haunted [her]211-hadria . The calm , sweet English landscape affected [her]211-hadria at times with a sort of disgust . It was , perhaps , the same in kind as the far stronger sensation of disgust that [she]211-hadria felt when [she]211-hadria first saw [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton with [[her]176-lady engleton new - born child]4947-her new - born child , full of pride and exultation . It was as much as [she]211-hadria could do to shake hands with [the happy mother]4948-the happy mother . When [Valeria]109-valeria expressed dismay at so strange a feeling [Hadria]211-hadria had refused to be treated as [a solitary sinner]4949-a solitary sinner . There were [plenty of fellow - culprits]4950-plenty of fellow - culprits , [she]109-valeria said , only [they]4950-plenty of fellow - culprits did not dare to speak out . Let [Valeria]109-valeria study [girls]3769-girls and judge for [herself]109-valeria . [Hadria]211-hadria was challenged to name [a girl]3734-a girl . Well , [Algitha]81-algitha for one . [Hadria]211-hadria also suspected [Marion Jordan]177-marion jordan , well - drilled though [she]177-marion jordan was by [her]177-marion jordan dragoon of [a mother]4953-a mother . [Valeria]109-valeria would not hear of it . [Marion Jordan]177-marion jordan ! the gentlest , timidest , most typical of [young English girls]4954-young english girls ! Impossible ! “[329-one] [I]0-i am almost sure of it , nevertheless , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] Oh , believe [me]0-i , it is common enough ! [Few]1635-few grasp it intellectually perhaps , but [thousands]3718-thousands feel the insult ; of that [I]0-i am morally certain . ” “[0-i] What leads [you]0-i to think so in [Marion]177-marion jordan 's case ? ” “[0-i] Some look , or tone , or word ; something slight , but to [my]0-i mind conclusive . [Fellow - sinners]1637-fellow - sinners detect [one another]3945-one another , [you]0-i know . ” “[1637-fellow - sinners] Well , [I]0-i do n't understand what [the world]334-the world is coming to ! ” exclaimed [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[0-i] Where are the natural instincts ? ” “[0-i] Sprouting up for the first time perhaps , ” [Hadria]211-hadria suggested . “[0-i] [They]1640-they seem to be disappearing , if what [you]0-i say has the slightest foundation . ” “[0-i] Oh , [you]0-i are speaking of only one kind of instinct . The others have all been suppressed . Perhaps [women]606-women are not altogether animals after all . The thought is startling , [I]0-i know . Try to face it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never supposed [they]1640-they were , ” cried [Valeria]109-valeria , a little annoyed . “[1640-they] But [you]0-i never made allowance for the suppressed instincts , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't believe they can be suppressed . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i believe they can be not merely suppressed , but killed past hope of recovery . And [I]0-i also believe that there may be , that there must be , ideas and emotions fermenting in [people]3687-people 's brains , quite different from those that [they]3687-people are supposed and ordered to cherish , and that [these heresies]1643-these heresies go on working in secret for years before [they]1643-these heresies become even suspected , and then suddenly [the population]1644-the population exchange confessions . ” “[1644-the population] After that the Deluge ! ” exclaimed [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[0-i] [You]0-i describe the features of a great revolution . ” “[0-i] So much the better , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria ; “[0-i] and when the waters sink again , a nice fresh clean world ! ” ON [the lawn of [the Red House]4718-the red house]4955-the lawn of the red house , [a little group]4957-a little group was collected under the big walnut tree . The sunlight fell through the leaves on the singing tea - kettle and the cups and saucers , and made bright patches on the figures and the faces assembled round the tea - table . [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert had again brought [[his]118-hubert friend]4122-his friend [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , in the forlorn hope , [he]118-hubert said , of being able to give [him]159-joseph fleming something to eat and drink . [Ernest]86-ernest and [Algitha]81-algitha and [Fred]83-fred were of [the party]428-the party . [They]4957-a little group had come down from Saturday till Monday . [Ernest]86-ernest was studying for [the Bar]4960-the bar . [Fred]83-fred had entered [[a merchant]4961-a merchant 's office]4962-a merchant 's office in [the city]4963-the city , and hated [his]118-hubert work cordially . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria was still at [the Red House]4718-the red house . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had called by chance this afternoon , and [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker , [[the vicar]4965-the vicar 's wife]4966-the vicar 's wife , with two of [[her]162-mrs. walker countless daughters]4967-her countless daughters , had come by invitation . [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker was [a middle - aged , careworn , rather prim - looking woman]4968-a middle - aged , careworn , rather prim - looking woman . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was handsome . Bright auburn hair waved back in picturesque fashion from a piquant face , and constituted more than half [her]176-lady engleton claim to beauty . The brown eyes were bright and vivacious . The mouth was seldom quite shut . It scarcely seemed worth while , [the loquacious lady]4969-the loquacious lady had confessed . [She]176-lady engleton showed a delicate taste in dress . Shades of brown and russet made a fine harmony with [her]176-lady engleton auburn hair , and the ivory white and fresh red of [her]176-lady engleton skin . [She]176-lady engleton and [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley always enjoyed a sprightly interchange of epigrams . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had the qualities that [Hubert]118-hubert had admired in [Hadria]211-hadria before [their]4970-their marriage , and [she]176-lady engleton was entirely free from the other characteristics that had exasperated [him]118-hubert so desperately since that hideous mistake that [he]118-hubert had made . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had originality and brilliancy , but [she]176-lady engleton knew how to combine these qualities with perfect obedience to the necessary conventions of life . [She]176-lady engleton had the sparkle of champagne , without the troublesome tendency of that delicate beverage to break bounds , and brim over in iridescent , swelling , joyous foam , the discreet edges of such goblets as custom might decree for the sunny vintage . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton sparkled , glowed , nipped even at times , was of excellent dry quality , but [she]176-lady engleton never frothed over . [She]176-lady engleton always knew where to stop ; [she]176-lady engleton had the genius of moderation . [She]176-lady engleton stood to [Hadria]211-hadria as a correct rendering of a cherished idea stands to a faulty one . [She]176-lady engleton made [Hubert]118-hubert acutely feel [his]118-hubert misfortune , and shewed [him]118-hubert [his]118-hubert lost hope , [his]118-hubert shattered ideal . “[0-i] Is the picture finished ? ” [he]118-hubert enquired , as [he]118-hubert handed [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton [her]176-lady engleton tea . “[0-i] What , the view from [[your]1645-you field]1646-your field ? That 's the worst of visitors . One 's little immortal works do get put aside , poor things . ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton broke into the light laugh that had become almost mechanical with [her]0-i . “[1645-you] [[Your]1645-you friends]1648-your friends grudge the hours [you]1645-you spend in [[your]1645-you studio]1649-your studio , ” said [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . “[1648-your friends] Oh , [they]1648-your friends do n't mind , so long as [I]0-i give [them]1648-your friends as much time as [they]1648-your friends want , ” [she]154-mrs. temperley said . “[0-i] [I]0-i have to apologise and compromise , do n't [you]1645-you know , but , with a little management , [one]329-one can get on . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton gave a little scream . “[154-mrs. temperley] [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , come to the rescue . [He]1710-your brother says [we]1711-us grovel consistently and always . ” [Ernest]86-ernest laughed , and protested . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton pretended to be mortally offended . [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley was sorry [she]154-mrs. temperley could give no redress . [She]154-mrs. temperley had suffered from [Ernest]86-ernest 's painful frankness from [her]154-mrs. temperley youth upwards . The conversation grew discursive . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton enjoyed the pastime of lightly touching the edges of what [she]176-lady engleton called “[1710-your brother] advanced ” thought . [She]176-lady engleton sought the society of people like [the two Professors]1667-the two professors and [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , in order to hear what dreadful and delightful things [they]5013-they really would say . [I]0-i do n't know if [you]154-mrs. temperley have all read the book ? [The heroine]1712-the heroine finds [herself]1712-the heroine differing in [her]1712-the heroine view of life from [everyone round [her]1712-the heroine]1713-everyone round her . [She]1712-the heroine is married , but [she]1712-the heroine has made no secret of [her]1712-the heroine scorn for the old ideals , and has announced that [she]1712-the heroine has no intention of being bound by them . ” [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley glanced uneasily at [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[1712-the heroine] Accordingly [she]1712-the heroine does even as [she]1712-the heroine had said , ” continued [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[1712-the heroine] [She]1712-the heroine will not brook that interference with [her]1712-the heroine liberty which marriage among [us]1714-us [old - fashioned people]1715-old - fashioned people generally implies . [[Your]1718-you daughters]1719-your daughters would perhaps like a game of tennis with [[my]0-i brothers]857-my brothers presently . ” [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker yielded uneasily . “[162-mrs. walker] But before [Caterina]173-caterina takes the law into [her]173-caterina own hands , in this way , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton continued , “[173-caterina] [she]173-caterina is troubled with doubts . [She]173-caterina sometimes wonders whether [she]173-caterina ought not , after all , to respect the popular standards ( notwithstanding the compact ) , instead of disturbing [everybody]3781-everybody by clinging to [her]173-caterina own . It was the best method in [Caterina]173-caterina 's case , but not in all . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria did not explain very clearly what [she]109-valeria meant . [Women]606-women made too much of difficulties , [she]109-valeria thought . Somehow [people]3687-people had managed to overcome obstacles . Look at — and then followed a list of shining examples . “[0-i] [I]0-i believe [you]1723-you would blame [a modern woman who imitated]1724-a modern woman who imitated [them]1725-them , ” said [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . “[1723-you] [These women]1726-these women have the inestimable advantage of being dead . ” “[1726-these women] Ah , yes , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton agreed , with a laugh , “[1726-these women] [[we]1727-we [women]606-women]1728-we women may be anything [we]1727-we like — in the last century . ” “[606-women] The tides of a hundred years or so sweeping over one 's audacious deed , soften the raw edges . Then it is tolerated in the landscape ; indeed , it grows mossy and picturesque . ” [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley made this comparison . “[606-women] And then think how useful it becomes to prove that a daring deed can be done , given only the necessary stuff in brain and heart . ” [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker looked at [Algitha]81-algitha in dismay . “[329-one] [One]329-one can throw it in the teeth of [one 's contemporaries]1731-one 's contemporaries , ” added [Algitha]81-algitha , “[329-one] if [they]1731-one 's contemporaries fail to produce a dramatic climax of the same kind . ” Only , ”[154-mrs. temperley] said [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , “ if [they]1731-one 's contemporaries do venture upon [their]1731-one 's contemporaries own dreadful deed — the deed demanded by [their]1731-one 's contemporaries particular modern predicament — then [we]1727-we all shriek vigorously . ”[154-mrs. temperley] “ Oh , [we]1727-we shriek less than [we]1727-we used to , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ It is quite a relief to be able to retain [one]329-one 's respectability on easier terms . ”[176-lady engleton] “ In such a case as [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria depicts ? When [[Hadria]211-hadria 's parents]1740-hadria 's parents visited [the Red House]4718-the red house , [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley was asked to meet [them]1740-hadria 's parents , by special request . [Henriette]142-henriette employed tact on a grand scale , and achieved results in proportion . [Valeria]109-valeria spoke with sublime scorn of this attempt . “ To try and pump information out of [a friend]727-a friend ! Why not listen at the key - hole , and be done with it ! ”[109-valeria] [Henriette]142-henriette 's neat hair would have stood on end , had [she]142-henriette heard [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria fit adjectives to [her]142-henriette conduct . “ [I]211-hadria have learnt not to expect a nice sense of honour from [superior persons with unimpeachable sentiments]5053-superior persons with unimpeachable sentiments , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [You]211-hadria are certainly [a good hater]5054-a good hater ! ”[109-valeria] cried [Valeria]109-valeria , with a laugh . “ Oh , [I]109-valeria do n't hate [Henriette]142-henriette ; [I]109-valeria only hate unimpeachable sentiments . ”[109-valeria] The sentiments that [Henriette]142-henriette represented had become , to [Hadria]211-hadria , as the walls of [a prison from which [she]142-henriette could see no means of escape]1744-a prison from which she could see no means of escape . [She]142-henriette had found that life took no heed either of [her]142-henriette ambitions or of [her]142-henriette revolts . “ And so [I]142-henriette growl , ”[142-henriette] [she]142-henriette said . [She]142-henriette might hate and chafe in secret to [her]142-henriette heart 's content ; external conformity was the one thing needful . “ [Hadria]211-hadria will be so different when [she]211-hadria has [children]626-children , ”[3726-everyone] [everyone]3726-everyone had said . And so [she]142-henriette was ; but the difference was alarmingly in the wrong direction . Throughout history , [she]142-henriette reflected , [children]626-children had been the unfailing means of bringing [women]606-women into line with tradition . Who could stand against [them]626-children ? [They]626-children had been able to force the most rebellious to [their]626-children knees . An appeal to the maternal instinct had quenched the hardiest spirit of revolt . No wonder the instinct had been so trumpeted and exalted ! [Women]606-women might harbour dreams and plan insurrections ; but [[their]606-women children]654-their children — [little ambassadors of the established and expected]1750-little ambassadors of the established and expected — were argument enough to convince [the most hardened sceptics]1751-the most hardened sceptics . [Their]626-children helplessness was more powerful to suppress revolt than [regiments of [armed soldiers]1753-armed soldiers]1752-regiments of armed soldiers . Such were the thoughts that wandered through [Hadria]211-hadria 's mind as [she]211-hadria bent [her]211-hadria steps towards [the cottage near [Craddock Church]33-craddock church]1754-the cottage near craddock church , where , according to [the gravedigger]4776-the gravedigger 's account , [the baby of the unhappy schoolmistress]1756-the baby of the unhappy schoolmistress was being looked after by [Mrs. Gullick]156-mrs. gullick . About a week later , [Craddock Dene]164-craddock dene was amazed by the news that [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley had taken [the child of [Ellen Jervis]184-ellen jervis]1765-the child of ellen jervis under [her]154-mrs. temperley protection . [The child]4983-the child is the result of great sorrow and suffering ; it is the price of [a woman]3753-a woman 's life ; [a woman who offended [the world]334-the world , having lived for nearly forty weary obedient years , in circumstances dreary enough to have turned [twenty saints into as many sinners]5076-twenty saints into as many sinners]5074-a woman who offended the world , having lived for nearly forty weary obedient years , in circumstances dreary enough to have turned twenty saints into as many sinners . Ah ! how [I]109-valeria hate it ! ”[109-valeria] “ Is it then hatred that prompts the deed ? ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria looked thoughtfully towards [the church tower]1772-the church tower , in whose shadow [the mother of the babe]1773-the mother of the babe lay sleeping . “ Can [you]211-hadria ever quite unravel [your]211-hadria own motives , [Valeria]109-valeria ? Hatred ? Yes ; there is a large ingredient of hatred . Without it , probably [this poor infant]5079-this poor infant would have been left to struggle through life alone , with a mill - stone round [its]5079-this poor infant neck , and a miserable constitution into the bargain . [I]211-hadria hope to rescue [its]5079-this poor infant constitution . But [that poor woman]5080-that poor woman 's story touched [me]211-hadria closely . It is so hard , so outrageous ! The emptiness of [her]5080-that poor woman existence ; the lack of outlet for [her]5080-that poor woman affections ; the endless monotony ; and then the sudden new interest and food for the starved emotions ; the hero - worship that is latent in [us]5081-us all ; and then — good heavens!—for a touch of poetry , of romance in [her]5080-that poor woman life , [she]5080-that poor woman would have been ready to believe in the professions of [the devil]1352-the devil [himself]1352-the devil — and [this man]4247-this man was [a very good understudy for the devil]5084-a very good understudy for the devil ! Ah ! If ever [I]211-hadria should meet [him]4247-this man ! ”[211-hadria] “ What would [you]211-hadria do ? ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria asked curiously . “ Avenge [her]5080-that poor woman , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria with set lips . “ Easier said than done , [[my]211-hadria dear]3722-my dear ! ”[211-hadria] [Gossip]186-gossip asserted that [the father of the child]1774-the father of the child was [a man of some standing]1775-a man of some standing , the bolder spirits even accusing [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton [himself]157-lord engleton . But this was conjecture run wild , and [nobody]3732-nobody seriously listened to it . [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker was particularly scandalized with [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley 's ill - advised charity . [Hadria]211-hadria had the habit of regarding [[the clergyman]1777-the clergyman 's wife]1778-the clergyman 's wife as [another of [[society]367-society 's victims]1781-society 's victims]1779-another of society 's victims . [She]211-hadria placed side by side [the schoolmistress]4793-the schoolmistress in [her]4793-the schoolmistress sorrow and disgrace , and [the careworn woman at [the Vicarage]4698-the vicarage]1783-the careworn woman at the vicarage , with [[her]1783-the careworn woman at the vicarage eleven children]1785-her eleven children , and [her]1783-the careworn woman at the vicarage shrivelled nature , poor and dead as an autumn leaf that shivers before the wind . [They]1786-they had both suffered — so [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley dared to assert — in the same cause . [They]1786-they were both [victims of the same creed]1787-victims of the same creed . It was a terrible cultus , a savage idol that had devoured [them]1786-they both , as cruel and insatiable as [the brazen god of old]1788-the brazen god of old , with [his]1788-the brazen god of old internal fires , which [the faithful fed devoutly]1789-the faithful fed devoutly , with [shrinking girls]1790-shrinking girls and [screaming children]1791-screaming children . “ [I]109-valeria still fail to understand why [you]211-hadria adopt [this child]5063-this child , ”[109-valeria] said [Valeria]109-valeria . “ [[My]109-valeria Caterina]5087-my caterina would never have done it . ”[109-valeria] “ [The little creature]5088-the little creature interests [me]211-hadria , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ It is a tiny field for the exercise of the creative forces . [Every one]913-every one has some form of active amusement . Some like golf , others flirtation . [I]211-hadria prefer this sort of diversion . ”[211-hadria] “ But [you]211-hadria have [[your]211-hadria own children]5090-your own children to interest [you]211-hadria , surely far more than this one . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria 's face grew set and defiant . “ [They]5090-your own children represent to [me]211-hadria the insult of society — [my]211-hadria own private and particular insult , the tribute exacted of [my]211-hadria womanhood . It is through [them]5090-your own children that [I]211-hadria am to be subdued and humbled . Just once in a way , however , the thing does not quite ‘ come off . ’ ”[211-hadria] “ What has set [you]211-hadria on edge so , [I]109-valeria wonder . ”[109-valeria] “ [People]3687-people , traditions , unimpeachable sentiments . ”[211-hadria] “ [Yours]211-hadria are not unimpeachable at any rate ! ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria cried laughing . “ [Caterina]173-caterina is [an angel]5092-an angel compared with [you]211-hadria , and yet [[my]109-valeria publisher]5093-my publisher has [his]5093-my publisher doubts about [her]173-caterina . ”[109-valeria] “ [Caterina]173-caterina would do as [I]211-hadria do , [I]211-hadria know , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [Those who are looked at askance by]5094-those who are looked at askance by [the world]334-the world appeal to [my]211-hadria instincts . [I]211-hadria shall be able to teach [this child]5063-this child , perhaps , to strike a blow at the system which sent [[her]5063-this child mother]520-her mother to [a dishonoured grave]5098-a dishonoured grave , while it leaves [the man]3754-the man for whose sake [she]5063-this child risked all this , in peace and the odour of sanctity . ”[211-hadria] Time seemed to be marked , in [the sleepy village]1792-the sleepy village , by [the baby]1487-the baby 's growth . [Valeria]109-valeria , who thought [she]109-valeria was fond of [babies]1794-babies , used to accompany [Hadria]211-hadria on [her]109-valeria visits to [the cottage]1763-the cottage , but [she]109-valeria treated [the infant]1796-the infant so much as if it had been a guinea - pig or a rabbit that [the nurse]1797-the nurse was indignant . The weeks passed in rapid monotony , filled with detail and leaving no mark behind [them]1798-them , no sign of movement or progress . The cares of [the house]296-the house , [the children]667-the children , left only limited time for walking , reading , correspondence , and such music as could be wrung out of a crowded day . An effort on [Hadria]211-hadria 's part , to make serious use of [her]211-hadria musical talent had been frustrated . But a pathetic , unquenchable hope always survived that presently , when this or that corner had been turned , this or that difficulty overcome , conditions would be conquered and opportunity arrive . Not yet had [she]211-hadria resigned [her]211-hadria belief that the most harassing and wearying and unceasing business that [a human being]668-a human being can undertake , is compatible with the stupendous labour and the unbounded claims of [an artist]4849-an artist 's career . The details of practical life and petty duties sprouted up at every step . If [they]1798-them were put aside , even for a moment , the wheels of daily existence became clogged and then all opportunity was over . [Hope]187-hope had begun to alternate with a fear lest that evasive corner should never be turned , that little crop of interruptions never cease to turn up . And yet it was so foolish . Each obstacle in itself was paltry . It was [their]667-the children number that overcame [one]329-one , as the tiny arrows of [the Lilliputs]188-the lilliputs overcame [Gulliver]189-gulliver . [One of [[Hadria]211-hadria 's best friends in [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene]1805-hadria 's best friends in craddock dene]1804-one of hadria 's best friends in craddock dene was [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , who had become very intimate at [the Red House]4718-the red house during the last year or two . [Hadria]211-hadria used to tire of the necessity to be apparently rational ( such was [her]211-hadria own version ) , and found it a relief to talk nonsense , just as [she]211-hadria pleased , to [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , who never objected or took offence , if [he]159-joseph fleming occasionally looked surprised . [Other men]1807-other men might have thought [she]211-hadria was laughing at [them]667-the children , but [Joseph]159-joseph fleming made no such mistake when [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley broke out , as [she]154-mrs. temperley did now and then , in fantastic fashion . [She]154-mrs. temperley was standing , one morning , on [the little bridge over [the stream]1809-the stream that ran at a distance of a few hundred yards from [the Red House]4718-the red house]1808-the little bridge over the stream that ran at a distance of a few hundred yards from the red house . [The two boys]1811-the two boys were bespattering [themselves]1811-the two boys in [the meadow below]1812-the meadow below , by [the water]1813-the water 's verge . [They]1811-the two boys called up at intervals to [[their]1811-the two boys mother]363-their mother the announcement of some new discovery of flower or insect . Watching the stream sweeping through [the bridge]1815-the bridge , [she]154-mrs. temperley seemed the centre of a charming domestic scene to [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , who chanced to pass by with [his]159-joseph fleming dogs . [He]159-joseph fleming addressed [himself]159-joseph fleming to [her]154-mrs. temperley maternal feelings by remarking what handsome and clever boys [they]1811-the two boys were . “ Handsome and clever ? ”[154-mrs. temperley] [she]154-mrs. temperley repeated . “ Is that all [you]159-joseph fleming can say , [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming ? When [you]159-joseph fleming set about it , [I]154-mrs. temperley think [you]159-joseph fleming might provide a little better food for one 's parental sentiment . [I]154-mrs. temperley suppose [you]159-joseph fleming will go and tell [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker that [her]162-mrs. walker dozen and a half are all handsome and clever too ! ”[154-mrs. temperley] “ Not so handsome and clever as [yours]159-joseph fleming , ”[159-joseph fleming] replied [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming , a little aghast at this ravenous maternal vanity . “ What wretched poverty of expression ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria complained . “ [I]211-hadria ask for bread , and truly [you]159-joseph fleming give [me]211-hadria a stone . ”[211-hadria] [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming eyed [[his]159-joseph fleming companion]4118-his companion askance . “ [I]159-joseph fleming — [I]159-joseph fleming admire [[your]159-joseph fleming boys]5100-your boys immensely , as [you]159-joseph fleming know , ”[159-joseph fleming] [he]159-joseph fleming said . “ Not enough , not enough . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ What can [I]211-hadria say more ? ”[211-hadria] “ [A mother]4953-a mother has to find in [[her]4953-a mother children]576-her children all that [she]4953-a mother can hope to find in life , and [she]4953-a mother naturally desires to make the most of [them]576-her children , do n't [you]159-joseph fleming see ? ”[159-joseph fleming] “ Ah ! yes , quite so , ”[159-joseph fleming] said [Joseph]159-joseph fleming dubiously . “ [Nobody]3732-nobody , [I]159-joseph fleming suppose , likes to be commonplace all round ; [one]329-one must have some poetry somewhere — so [most women]4904-most women idealize [[their]4904-most women children]654-their children , and if [other people]3849-other people wo n't help [them]654-their children in the effort , do n't [you]159-joseph fleming see ? it is most discouraging . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ Are [you]159-joseph fleming chaffing , or what ? ”[159-joseph fleming] [Joseph]159-joseph fleming enquired . “ No , indeed ; [I]159-joseph fleming am perilously serious . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ [I]159-joseph fleming can well understand how [a mother]4953-a mother must get absorbed in [[her]4953-a mother children]576-her children , ”[159-joseph fleming] said [Joseph]159-joseph fleming . “ [I]159-joseph fleming suppose it 's a sort of natural provision . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ Think of [Mrs. Allan]190-mrs. allan with [her]190-mrs. allan outrageous eight — all making mud - pies ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria ; “ a magnificent ‘ natural provision ! ’ A small income , [a small house]5110-a small house , with those pervasive eight . [You]159-joseph fleming know the stampede when one goes to call ; the aroma of bread and butter ( there are few things more inspiring ) ; [the cook]1504-the cook always about to leave ; [Mrs. Allan]190-mrs. allan with a racking headache . It is indeed not difficult to understand how [a mother]4953-a mother would get absorbed in [[her]4953-a mother children]576-her children . Why , [their]576-her children pinafores alone would become absorbing . ”[211-hadria] “ Quite so , ”[159-joseph fleming] said [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming . Then a little anxious to change the subject : “ Oh , by the way , have [you]159-joseph fleming heard that [the Priory]31-the priory is really to be inhabited at last ? [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald has almost decided to take it . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ Really ? that will be exciting for [Craddock Dene]164-craddock dene . [We]5114-we shall have another household to dissect and denounce . [Providence]191-providence watches over [us]5114-we all , [I]211-hadria verily believe . ”[211-hadria] “ [I]159-joseph fleming hope so , ”[159-joseph fleming] [Joseph]159-joseph fleming replied gravely . “ Truly [I]211-hadria hope so too , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria said , no less seriously , “ for indeed [we]5114-we need it . ”[211-hadria] [Joseph]159-joseph fleming was too simple to be greatly surprised at anything that [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley might say . [He]159-joseph fleming had decided that [she]154-mrs. temperley was a little eccentric , and that explained everything ; just as [he]159-joseph fleming explained instances of extraordinary reasoning power in a dog by calling it “ instinct . ”[159-joseph fleming] Whatever [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley might do was slightly eccentric , and had [she]154-mrs. temperley suddenly taken it into [her]154-mrs. temperley head to dance a fandango on [the public road]1817-the public road , it would have merely put a little extra strain on that word . By dint of not understanding [her]154-mrs. temperley , [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming had grown to feel towards [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley a genuine liking , conscious , in [his]159-joseph fleming vague way , that [she]154-mrs. temperley was kind at heart , however bitter or strange [she]154-mrs. temperley might sometimes be in [her]154-mrs. temperley speech . Moreover , [she]154-mrs. temperley was not always eccentric or unexpected . There would come periods when [she]154-mrs. temperley would say and do very much as [[her]154-mrs. temperley neighbours]1818-her neighbours said and did ; looking then pale and lifeless , but absolutely beyond the reach of hostile criticism , as [[her]154-mrs. temperley champion]1819-her champion would suggest to [carping neighbours]1820-carping neighbours . [Not the most respected of [the ladies who turned up [their]1822-the ladies who turned up their disapproving noses disapproving noses]1822-the ladies who turned up their disapproving noses]1821-not the most respected of the ladies who turned up their disapproving noses , was more dull or more depressing than [Hadria]211-hadria could be , on occasion , as [she]211-hadria had [herself]211-hadria pointed out ; and would not this soften stony hearts ? When [she]211-hadria discovered that [[her]211-hadria kindly neighbour]1823-her kindly neighbour had been fighting [her]211-hadria battles for [her]211-hadria , [she]211-hadria was touched ; but [she]211-hadria asked [him]1823-her kindly neighbour not to expend [his]1823-her kindly neighbour strength on [her]211-hadria behalf . [She]211-hadria tried in vain to convince [him]1823-her kindly neighbour that [she]211-hadria did not care to be invited too often to submit to the devitalizing processes of social intercourse , to which [the families of [the district]714-the district]1824-the families of the district shrank not from subjecting [themselves]1824-the families of the district . If [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming chanced to call at [the Red House]34-the red house after [her]211-hadria return from one of these entertainments , [he]159-joseph fleming was sure to find [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley in one of [her]154-mrs. temperley least comprehensible moods . But whatever [she]211-hadria might say , [he]159-joseph fleming stood up for [her]211-hadria among [the neighbours]1469-the neighbours with persistent loyalty . [He]159-joseph fleming decked [her]211-hadria with virtues that [she]211-hadria did not possess , and represented [her]211-hadria to [the sceptical district]1827-the sceptical district , radiant in domestic glory . [Hadria]211-hadria thus found [herself]211-hadria in an awkwardly uncertain position ; either [she]211-hadria was looked at askance , as eccentric , or [she]211-hadria found [herself]211-hadria called upon to make good expectations of saintliness , such as never were on [land]1828-land or [sea]1829-sea . [Saintly]192-saintly ? [Hadria]211-hadria shook [her]211-hadria head . [She]211-hadria could imagine [no one]383-no one further from such a condition than [she]211-hadria was at present , and [she]211-hadria felt it in [her]211-hadria , to swing down and down to the very opposite pole from [that serene altitude]1831-that serene altitude . [She]211-hadria admitted that , from a utilitarian point of view , [she]211-hadria was making a vast mistake . As things were , [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker and [Mrs. Allan]190-mrs. allan , laboriously spinning [[their]1832-their ponderous families]1833-their ponderous families on [their]1832-their own axes , in a reverent spirit , had chosen the better part . But [Hadria]211-hadria did not care . [She]211-hadria would not settle down to make the best of things , as even [Algitha]81-algitha now recommended , “ since there [she]211-hadria was , and there was no helping it . ”[81-algitha] “ [I]211-hadria will never make the best of things , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . “ [I]211-hadria know nothing that gives such opportunities to [the Devil]1352-the devil . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria had characteristically left the paradox unjustified . “ What do [you]211-hadria mean ? ”[81-algitha] asked [Algitha]81-algitha . “ Surely [the enemy of good]5116-the enemy of good has most hold over the discontented spirit . ”[81-algitha] [Hadria]211-hadria likened the contented to [stagnant pools]1834-stagnant pools , wherein corruptions grow apace . “ It is only [the discontented ocean that remains , for all its storms]5117-the discontented ocean that remains , for all its storms , fresh and sane to the end . ”[211-hadria] But though [she]211-hadria said this , for opposition 's sake perhaps , [she]211-hadria had [her]211-hadria doubts about [her]211-hadria own theory . Discontent was certainly [the initiator of all movement]1835-the initiator of all movement ; but there was a kind of sullen discontent that stagnated and ate inwards , like a disease . Better a cheerful sin or two than allow that to take hold ! “ But then there is this sickly feminine conscience to deal with ! ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria exclaimed . “ It clings to the worst of [us]5118-us still , and prevents the wholesome big catastrophes that might bring salvation . ”[211-hadria] ANOTHER year had blundered itself away , leaving little trace behind it , in [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene . [[The schoolmistress]4793-the schoolmistress 's grave]1837-the schoolmistress 's grave was greener and [[her]4793-the schoolmistress child]1838-her child rosier than of yore . [Little Martha]129-martha had now begun to talk , and promised to be pretty and fair - haired like [[her]129-martha mother]520-her mother . [The boys]3870-the boys and [Algitha]81-algitha had come to spend Saturday and Sunday at [the Red House]4718-the red house . [Hadria]211-hadria hunted out a stupendous card - case ( a wedding gift from [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon ) , erected on [her]211-hadria head a majestic bonnet , and announced to [the company]4609-the company that [she]211-hadria was going for a round of visits . There was a yell of laughter . [Hadria]211-hadria advanced across [the lawn]1843-the lawn with quiet dignity , bearing [her]211-hadria card - case as one who takes part in a solemn ceremony . “ Where did [you]211-hadria fall in with that casket ? ”[83-fred] enquired [Fred]83-fred . “ And who was [the architect of [the cathedral]5120-the cathedral]5119-the architect of the cathedral ? ”[86-ernest] asked [Ernest]86-ernest . “ This casket , as [you]211-hadria call it , was presented to [me]86-ernest by [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon . There were many derisive comments . “ Gothic , ”[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest , “ pure Gothic . ”[86-ernest] “ [I]83-fred should have described it as ‘ Early Perpendicular , ’ ”[83-fred] objected [Fred]83-fred . “ Do n't display [your]211-hadria neglected education ; it 's beyond all question Gothic . Look at the steeple and the gargoyles and the handsome vegetation . [Ruskin]193-ruskin would revel in it ! ”[83-fred] “ Are [you]211-hadria really going about in that thing ? ”[81-algitha] asked [Algitha]81-algitha . [Hadria]211-hadria wished to know what was the use of designing [a Gothic cathedral]1846-a gothic cathedral if [one]329-one could n't go about in [it]1846-a gothic cathedral . The bonnet was , in truth , a daring caricature of the prevailing fashion , just sufficiently serious in expression to be wearable . “ Well , [I]86-ernest never before met [a woman who would deliberately flout [[her]5122-a woman who would deliberately flout her neighbours by wearing preposterous millinery neighbours]1818-her neighbours by wearing preposterous millinery]5122-a woman who would deliberately flout her neighbours by wearing preposterous millinery ! ”[86-ernest] [Ernest]86-ernest exclaimed . [Mrs. Allan]190-mrs. allan , who had small opportunity of seeing the fashions , seemed impressed if slightly puzzled by it . [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan evidently thought it “ loud . ”[179-mrs. jordan] [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker supposed it fashionable , but regretted that this sort of thing was going to be worn this season .
