[I]0-i daresay [you]2069-you know the view pretty well . ” “[2069-you] [I]0-i doubt , ” [she]211-hadria answered , with the instinct of extravagance that annoyed [Hubert]118-hubert , “[2069-you] [I]0-i doubt if [I]0-i know anything else . ” [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton brought a portfolio full of sketches for [her]211-hadria to see . “[0-i] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton has been busy . ” As [Hadria]211-hadria laid down the last sketch , [her]211-hadria eyes wandered round [the softly - lighted , dimly beautiful room]5371-the softly - lighted , dimly beautiful room , and suddenly [she]211-hadria was seized with a swift , reasonless , overpowering sense of happiness that [she]211-hadria felt to be atmospheric and parenthetical in character , but all the more keen for that reason , while it lasted . The second black inexorable semicircle was ready to enclose the little moment , but its contents had the condensed character of that which stands within limits , and reminded [her]211-hadria , with a little sting , as of spur to horse , of [her]211-hadria sharp , terrible aptitude for delight and [her]211-hadria hunger for it . Why not , why not ? What pinched , ungenerous philosophy was it that insisted on voluntary starvation ? [One]329-one saw [its offspring]5373-its offspring in the troops of thin white souls that hurry , like ghosts , down [the avenues of Life]5374-the avenues of life . Again [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald 's stealthy glance was directed towards [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . “[2071-he] [He]2071-he is as determined to analyse [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were a chemical compound , ” [she]0-i said to [herself]0-i . “[2071-he] Perhaps [we]2072-we may as well join [the group]941-the group , ” suggested [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton . It opened to admit [the new comers]5375-the new comers , disclosing [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , in a gown of pale amber brocade , enthroned upon a straight - backed antique sofa . The exquisiteness of the surroundings which [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had a peculiar gift in arranging , the mellow candlelight , the flowers and colours , seem to have satisfied in [Valeria]109-valeria an inborn love of splendour that often opened hungry and unsatisfied jaws . [She]109-valeria had never looked so brilliant or so handsome . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald 's face cleared . [He]181-professor theobald explained to [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley that [they]2072-we had been discussing the complexity of human character , and had come to the conclusion that it was impossible to really understand even [the simplest man]5376-the simplest man or [woman alive]5377-woman alive . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald said that it was a dispensation of Providence which intended [the human race for social life]5378-the human race for social life . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton upbraided [the author of the cynical utterance]5379-the author of the cynical utterance . “[941-the group] Which of [us]2072-we can dare to face [his]2074-his own basest self ? ” [the culprit]920-the culprit demanded . “[941-the group] If [any one]2075-any one is so bold , [I]0-i fear [I]0-i must accuse [him]2076-him ( or even [her]2077-her ) of lack of self - knowledge rather than give praise for spotlessness . ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i do n't believe all these dreadful things about [[my]0-i fellows]2078-my fellows ! ” cried [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , flinging up [her]0-i fine head defiantly ; “[329-one] [one]329-one is likely to find in [them]2078-my fellows more or less what [one]329-one expects . It 's the same everywhere . If [you]2081-you go seeking mole - hills and worms , and put nose to ground on the scent for carrion , [you]2081-you will find them all , with the range of [snow - capped Alps]2082-snow - capped alps in full view , and the infinite of blue above [your]2081-you blind head ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria , in justice , could not refuse to acknowledge that [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald was open - minded . “[2081-you] True , ” [he]181-professor theobald said , “[2081-you] it is dangerous to seek for evil , unless [you]2081-you naturally love it , and then — ” “[2081-you] [You]2081-you are past praying for , ” said [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . “[2081-you] Or at least [you]2081-you never pray , ” added [Hadria]211-hadria . [Both Professors]5381-both professors looked at [her]211-hadria , each with an expression of enquiry . It was difficult to understand from exactly what sources of experience or intuition the singular remark could have sprung . The conversation took a slight swerve . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald contended that all [our]2083-our fond distinctions of vice and virtue , right and wrong , were mere praise and blame of conditions and events . “[2081-you] [We]2083-our like to fancy the qualities of character inherent , while really they are laid on by slow degrees , like paint , and [we]2083-our name [our]2083-our acquaintance by the colour of [his]2084-his last coat . ” This view offended [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming and [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton rallied round [her]109-valeria . [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert joined [them]5381-both professors . [Man]332-man , the sublime , the summit of the creation , the end and object of the long and painful processes of nature ; sin - spotted perhaps , weak and stumbling , but still the masterpiece of the centuries — was [this great and mysterious creature to be thought of irreverently as a mere plain surface for paint]5383-this great and mysterious creature to be thought of irreverently as a mere plain surface for paint ? Only consider it ! [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald 's head went down between [his]181-professor theobald shoulders as [he]181-professor theobald laughed . “[2085-the sublime creature] [The sublime creature]2085-the sublime creature would not look well unpainted , believe [me]0-i . ” “[2084-his] [He]2084-his dare not appear in that plight even to [himself]2084-his , if [Theobald]181-professor theobald be right in what [he]181-professor theobald stated just now , ” said [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . “[181-professor theobald] Life to [a character]4268-a character is like varnish to wood , ” asserted [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria “[181-professor theobald] it brings out the grain . ” “[0-i] Ah ! ” cried [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . “[0-i] Then [you]0-i insist on varnish , [I]0-i on paint . ” “[0-i] There is a difference . ” “[0-i] And it affects [your]2087-you respective views throughout , ” added [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , “[0-i] for if the paint theory be correct , then it is true that to know [[one]329-one 's fellows]2089-one 's fellows is impossible , [you]2087-you can only know the upper coat ; whereas if the truth lies in varnish , the substance of the nature is revealed to [you]2087-you frankly , if [you]2087-you have eyes to trace the delicacies of the markings , which tell the secrets of sap and fibre , of impetus and check : all the inner marvels of life and growth that go forward in that most botanic thing , the human soul . ” “[116-professor fortescue] [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue is eloquent , but [he]116-professor fortescue makes [one]329-one feel distressingly vegetable , ” said [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . “[116-professor fortescue] Oh ! not unless [one]329-one has [a human soul]2092-a human soul , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton reassured [him]116-professor fortescue . “[116-professor fortescue] Am [I]0-i to understand that [you]0-i would deprive [me]0-i of [mine]0-i ? ” [he]116-professor fortescue asked , with a courtly bow . “[0-i] Not at all ; [souls]2093-souls are private property , or ought to be . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish one could persuade the majority of that ! ” cried [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . “[0-i] Impossible , ” said [Theobald]181-professor theobald . “[0-i] The chief interest of [man]332-man is the condition of [[his]332-man neighbour]2095-his neighbour 's soul . ” “[332-man] Could [he]332-man not be induced to look after [his]332-man own ? [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton observed that [people]3687-people were always speaking ill of [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , but [he]157-lord engleton never could see that [she]154-mrs. temperley was worse than [[her]154-mrs. temperley neighbours]1818-her neighbours . [She]154-mrs. temperley was cleverer ; that might be [her]154-mrs. temperley offence . [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux observed in [her]195-madame bertaux short , decisive way that [Craddock Dene]164-craddock dene might have settled down with [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley peaceably enough , if it had n't been for [her]195-madame bertaux action about [[the schoolmistress]4793-the schoolmistress 's child]5413-the schoolmistress 's child . “[2138-her] Yes ; that has offended [everybody]3781-everybody , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[3781-everybody] What action was that ? ” asked [Theobald]181-professor theobald , turning slowly towards [[his]181-professor theobald hostess]1026-his hostess . “[3781-everybody] Oh , have n't [you]2140-you heard ? That really speaks well for [this house]4177-this house . [You]2140-you ca n't accuse [us]2142-us of gossip . ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton related the incident . “[2140-you] By the way , [you]2140-you must remember [that poor woman]5080-that poor woman , [Professor]181-professor theobald . Do n't [you]2140-you know [you]2140-you were here at the school - feast that [we]2142-us gave one summer in [the park]2144-the park , when [all the children]2145-all the children came and had tea and games , and [you]2140-you helped [us]2142-us so amiably to look after [them]2145-all the children ? ” [The Professor]4071-the professor remembered the occasion perfectly . “[2140-you] And do n't [you]2140-you recollect [a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought [the children]667-the children]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children ? [We]2142-us all used to admire [her]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children . [She]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children was a particularly graceful , refined - looking creature . [She]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children had read a great deal and was quite cultivated . [I]0-i often used to think [she]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children must feel very solitary at [Craddock]23-craddock , with not a soul to sympathize with [her]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children tastes . [Mr.]2148-mr. and [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker used to preach to [her]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children , poor soul , reproving [her]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children love of reading , which took [her]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children thoughts away from [her]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children duties and [her]2146-a very pretty , rather timid , fair - haired woman who brought the children sphere . ” [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux snorted significantly . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had remarked a strange , sad look in [Ellen Jervis]184-ellen jervis 's eyes , and owned to having done [her]176-lady engleton best to circumvent [the respected pastor]5416-the respected pastor and [[his]5416-the respected pastor wife]573-his wife , by lending [her]176-lady engleton books occasionally , and encouraging [her]176-lady engleton to think [her]176-lady engleton own thoughts , and get what happiness [she]176-lady engleton could out of [her]176-lady engleton communings with larger spirits than [she]176-lady engleton was likely to find in [Craddock]23-craddock . Of course [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker now gave [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton to understand that [she]176-lady engleton was partly responsible for [the poor woman]5418-the poor woman 's misfortune . [She]176-lady engleton attributed it to [Ellen]184-ellen jervis 's having had “[162-mrs. walker] all sorts of ideas in [her]2149-her head ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i admit that if not having all sorts of ideas in one 's head is a safeguard , the unimpeachable virtue of a district is amply accounted for . ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald chuckled . [He]181-professor theobald enquired if [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton knew [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley 's motive in adopting [the child]4983-the child . “[162-mrs. walker] Oh , partly real kindness ; but [I]0-i think , between [ourselves]2150-ourselves , that [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley likes to be a little eccentric . [Most people]4077-most people have the instinct to go with [the crowd]631-the crowd . [Hadria Temperley]211-hadria has the opposite fault . [She]211-hadria loves to run counter to it , even when it is pursuing a harmless course . ” Some weeks had now passed since the arrival of [the two Professors]1667-the two professors . The meetings in [the Priory garden]1677-the priory garden had been frequent . [They]5422-they had affected for the better [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald 's manner . [Valeria]109-valeria 's laws had curbed the worst side of [him]181-professor theobald , or prevented [it]181-professor theobald from shewing itself so freely . [He]181-professor theobald felt the atmosphere of [the little society]5423-the little society , and acknowledged that it was “[211-hadria] taming the savage beast . ” As for [his]181-professor theobald intellect it took to blazing , as if , [he]181-professor theobald said , without false modesty , a torch had been placed in pure oxygen . “[0-i] [My]0-i brain takes fire here and flames . [I]0-i should make a very creditable beacon if the burning of brains and the burning of faggots were only of equal value . ” The little feud between [him]181-professor theobald and [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley had been patched up . [She]154-mrs. temperley felt that [she]154-mrs. temperley had been rude to [him]181-professor theobald , on one occasion at any rate , and desired to make amends . [He]181-professor theobald had become more cautious in [his]181-professor theobald conduct towards [her]154-mrs. temperley . During this period of the Renaissance , as [Hadria]211-hadria afterwards called the short - lived epoch , [little Martha]129-martha was visited frequently . [[Her]129-martha protectress]5424-her protectress had expected to have to do battle with hereditary weakness on account of [[her]129-martha mother]520-her mother 's sufferings , but [the child]4983-the child [shewed]5427-shewed no signs of this . Either the common belief that mental trouble in [the mother]578-the mother is reflected in [the child]4983-the child , was unfounded , or the evil could be overcome by the simple beneficence of pure air , good food , and warm clothing . [Hadria]211-hadria had begun to feel a more personal interest in [her]211-hadria charge . [She]211-hadria had taken it under [her]211-hadria care of [her]211-hadria own choice , without the pressure of any social law or sentiment , and in these circumstances of freedom , its helplessness appealed to [her]211-hadria protective instincts . [She]211-hadria felt the relationship to be a true one , in contradistinction to the more usual form of protectorate of [woman]3844-woman to [child]780-child . “[211-hadria] There is nothing in it that gives offence to [one]329-one 's dignity as [a human being]668-a human being , ” [she]211-hadria asserted , “[2155-you] which is more than can be said of the ordinary relation , especially if it be legal . ” [She]211-hadria was issuing from [little [Martha]129-martha 's cottage]5432-little martha 's cottage on one splendid morning , when [she]211-hadria saw [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald coming up [the road]4037-the road from [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene . [He]181-professor theobald caught sight of [Hadria]211-hadria , hesitated , coloured , glanced furtively up [the road]4037-the road , and then , seeing [he]181-professor theobald was observed , came forward , raising [his]181-professor theobald cap . “[2155-you] [You]2155-you ca n't imagine what a charming picture [you]2155-you make ; [the English cottage]2156-the english cottage creeper - covered and smiling ; [the nurse]1797-the nurse and [child at the threshold]2158-child at the threshold equally smiling , [yourself]2155-you a very emblem of spring in [your]2155-you fresh gown , and [a domestic tabby to complete the scene]2159-a domestic tabby to complete the scene . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could come and see it , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria was waving a twig of lavender , and [little Martha]129-martha was making grabs at it , and laughing [her]129-martha gurgling laugh of babyish glee . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald stood in [the road]4037-the road facing up hill towards [Craddock]23-craddock , whose church tower was visible from here , just peeping through the spring foliage of [the vicarage garden]5436-the vicarage garden . [He]181-professor theobald only now and again looked round at the picture that [he]181-professor theobald professed to admire . “[0-i] Do [you]2155-you want to see [a really pretty child]2160-a really pretty child , [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald ? Because if so , come here . ” [He]181-professor theobald hesitated , and a wave of dark colour flooded [his]181-professor theobald face up to the roots of [his]181-professor theobald close - clipped hair . [He]181-professor theobald paused a moment , and then bent down to open the little gate . [His]181-professor theobald stalwart figure , in the diminutive enclosure , reduced it to the appearance of [a doll 's garden]5437-a doll 's garden . “[2155-you] Step carefully or [you]2155-you will crush [the young ménage]2161-the young ménage , ” [Hadria]211-hadria advised . [The rosy - cheeked nurse]5438-the rosy - cheeked nurse looked with proud expectancy at the face of [the strange gentleman]5439-the strange gentleman , to note the admiration that [he]181-professor theobald could not but feel . [His]181-professor theobald lips were set . [The Professor]4071-the professor evidently knew [his]4071-the professor duty and proceeded to admire with due energy . [Little Martha]129-martha shrank away a little from the bearded face , and [her]129-martha lower lip worked threateningly , but the perilous moment was staved over by means of [the Professor]4071-the professor 's watch , hastily claimed by [Hannah]212-hannah , who dispensed with ceremony in the emergency . [Martha]129-martha 's eyes opened wide , and the little hands came out to grasp the treasure . [Hadria]211-hadria stood and laughed at the sight of [the gigantic Professor]5442-the gigantic professor , helplessly tethered by [his]181-professor theobald own chain to [the imperious baby , in whose fingers the watch was tightly clasped]5443-the imperious baby , in whose fingers the watch was tightly clasped . [The child]4983-the child was in high delight at the loquacious new toy — so superior to foolish fluffy rabbits that could not tick to save [their]2161-the young ménage skins . [Martha]129-martha had no notion of relinquishing [her]129-martha hold , so [they]5445-they need not tug in that feeble way ; if [they]5445-they pulled too hard , [she]129-martha would yell ! [She]129-martha evidently meant business , said [[her]129-martha captive]5446-her captive . So long as [they]5445-they left [her]129-martha the watch , [they]5445-they might do as [they]5445-they pleased ; [she]129-martha was perfectly indifferent to the accidental human accompaniments of the new treasure , but on that one point [she]129-martha was firm . [She]129-martha proceeded to stuff the watch into [her]129-martha mouth as far as it would go . [The Professor]4071-the professor was dismayed . “[2155-you] It 's all right , ” [Hadria]211-hadria reassured [him]4071-the professor . “[2162-you] [You]2162-you have hold of the chain . ” “[2162-you] Did [you]2162-you entice [me]0-i into this truly ridiculous position in order to laugh at [me]0-i ? ” enquired [the prisoner]5448-the prisoner . “[2162-you] [I]0-i would not laugh at [you]2162-you for [the world]334-the world . ” “[0-i] Really [this young person]2164-this young person has the most astonishing grip ! How long does [her]2164-this young person fancy generally remain faithful to a new toy ? ” “[2164-this young person] Well — [I]0-i hope [you]2162-you are not pressed for time , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria maliciously . [The Professor]4071-the professor groaned , and struggled in the toils . “[0-i] Come , [little one]2165-little one , open the fingers . Oh no , no , [we]2166-we must n't cry . ” [Martha]129-martha kept [her]129-martha features ready for that purpose at a moment 's notice , should any nonsense be attempted . [The victim]870-the victim looked round miserably . “[2166-we] Is there nothing that will set [me]0-i free from [these tender moorings]2167-these tender moorings ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria shook [her]211-hadria head and laughed . “[2162-you] [You]2162-you are chained by the most inflexible of all chains , ” [she]2164-this young person said : “[2162-you] [your]2162-you own compunction . ” “[2168-you little tyrant] Oh , [[you]2165-little one little tyrant]2168-you little tyrant ! ” exclaimed [the Professor]4071-the professor , shaking [his]4071-the professor fist in [the baby]1487-the baby 's face , at which [she]2164-this young person laughed a taunting and triumphant laugh . Then , once more , the object of dispute went into [her]2164-this young person mouth . [Martha]129-martha gurgled with joy . “[2168-you little tyrant] What am [I]0-i to do ? ” cried [[her]0-i victim]905-her victim helplessly . “[2169-she] Nothing . [She]2169-she has [you]2162-you securely because [you]2162-you fear to hurt [her]2169-she . ” “[2170-little imp] [Little imp]2170-little imp ! Come now , let [me]0-i go please . Oh , please , [Miss Baby]213-miss baby — [[your]2162-you Majesty]2171-your majesty : will nothing soften [you]2162-you ? [She]2169-she is beginning early to take advantage of the chivalry of the stronger sex , and [I]0-i doubt not [she]2169-she will know how to pursue [her]2169-she opportunity later on . ” “[0-i] Oh ! is that [your]0-i parable ? Into [my]0-i head came quite a different one — à propos of what [we]2172-we were talking of yesterday in [Griffin - land]38-griffin - land . ” “[2173-the eternal feminine] Ah , [the eternal feminine]2173-the eternal feminine ! ” cried [the Professor]4071-the professor . “[2173-the eternal feminine] Yes , [you]0-i were very brilliant , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i now stand for [an excellent type of woman]2174-an excellent type of woman , [Professor]1240-professor : strong , but chained . ” “[1240-professor] Oh , thank [you]1240-professor ! ( [Infant]214-infant , [I]0-i implore ! ) ” “[1487-the baby] [The baby]1487-the baby ably impersonates Society with all its sentiments and laws , written and unwritten . ” “[1487-the baby] Ah!—and [my]0-i impounded property ? ” “[1487-the baby] [Woman]3844-woman 's life and freedom . ” “[1487-the baby] Ingenious ! And the chain ? ( Oh , [inexorable babe]2178-inexorable babe , have mercy on the sufferings of imprisoned vigour ! ) ” “[2169-she] [Her]2169-she affections , [her]2169-she pity , [her]2169-she compunction , which forbid [her]2169-she to wrench away [her]2169-she rightful property , because ignorant and tender hands are grasping it . The analogy is a little mixed , but no matter . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should enjoy the intellectual treat that is spread before [me]0-i better , in happier circumstances , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . ” “[154-mrs. temperley] Apply [your]1240-professor remark to [your]1240-professor prototype — intelligently , ” [she]0-i added . “[0-i] [My]0-i intelligence is rapidly waning ; [I]0-i am benumbed . [I]0-i fail to follow the intricacies of analogy , in this constrained position . ” “[2169-she] Ah , so does [she]2169-she ! ” “[2169-she] Oh , [pitiless cherub]2179-pitiless cherub , [my]0-i muscles ache with this monotony . ” “[2169-she] And [hers]2169-she , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[2169-she] Come , come , life is passing ; [I]0-i have but one ; relax these fetters , or [I]0-i die . ” [Martha]129-martha frowned and fretted . [She]129-martha even looked shocked , according to [Hadria]211-hadria , who stood by laughing . [The baby]1487-the baby , [she]129-martha pointed out , failed to understand how [[her]129-martha captive]5446-her captive could so far forget [himself]5446-her captive as to desire to regain [his]5446-her captive liberty . “[2169-she] [She]2169-she reminds [you]2180-you , sternly , that this is [your]2180-you proper sphere . ” “[2169-she] Perdition ! ” [he]5446-her captive exclaimed . “[2169-she] As a general rule , ” [she]129-martha assented . [The Professor]4071-the professor laughed , and said [he]4071-the professor was tired of being [a Type]5458-a type . At length a little gentle force had to be used , in spite of furious resentment on the part of [the baby]1487-the baby . [A more injured and ill - treated mortal]5460-a more injured and ill - treated mortal could not have been imagined . [She]2169-she set up a heaven - piercing wail , evidently overcome with indignation and surprise at the cruel treatment that [she]2169-she had received . What horrid selfishness to take [oneself]5461-oneself and [[one]329-one 's property]5463-one 's property away , when [an engaging innocent]5464-an engaging innocent enjoys grasping it and stuffing it into its mouth ! “[2169-she] Do n't [you]2180-you feel [a guilty monster]2181-a guilty monster ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria enquired , as the lament of [the offended infant]5465-the offended infant followed [them]2182-we up [the road]4037-the road . “[2181-a guilty monster] [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i were slinking off after a murder ! ” [he]2180-you exclaimed ruefully . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder if [we]2182-we ought n't to go back and try again to soothe [the child]4983-the child . ” [He]2180-you paused irresolutely . [Hadria]211-hadria laughed . “[2180-you] [You]2180-you do make a lovely allegory ! ” [she]211-hadria exclaimed . “[2180-you] This sense of guilt , this disposition to go back — this attitude of apology — it is speaking , inimitable ! ” “[2180-you] But meanwhile [that wretched child]2184-that wretched child is shrieking itself into a fit ! ” cried the allegory , with the air of [a repentant criminal]5467-a repentant criminal . “[2184-that wretched child] Whenever [you]2180-you open [your]2180-you mouth , out falls a symbol , ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria . “[2184-that wretched child] Be calm ; [Hannah]212-hannah will soon comfort [her]2184-that wretched child , and it is truer kindness not to remind [her]2184-that wretched child again of [her]2184-that wretched child grievance , [poor little soul]2185-poor little soul . But [we]2182-we will go back if [you]2180-you like ( [you]2180-you are indeed [a true woman]3812-a true woman ! ) , and [you]2180-you can say [you]2180-you are sorry [you]2180-you made so free with [your]2180-you own possessions , and [you]2180-you wish [you]2180-you had done [your]2180-you duty better , and are eager to return and let [[Her]2184-that wretched child Majesty]2187-her majesty hold [you]2180-you captive . [[Your]2180-you prototype]2188-your prototype always does , [you]2180-you know , and [she]2188-your prototype is nearly always pardoned , on condition that [she]2188-your prototype never does anything of that kind again . ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald seemed too much concerned about [the child , who was still wailing]5468-the child , who was still wailing , to pay much attention to any other topic . [He]181-professor theobald turned to retrace [his]181-professor theobald steps . “[2188-your prototype] [I]0-i think [you]2180-you make a mistake , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[2180-you] As soon as [she]2188-your prototype sees [you]2180-you [she]2188-your prototype will want the watch , and then [you]2180-you will be placed between the awful alternatives of voluntarily surrending ing [your]2180-you freedom , and heartlessly refusing to present [yourself]2180-you to [her]2188-your prototype as a big plaything . In one respect [you]2180-you have not yet achieved a thorough fidelity to [[your]2180-you model]2189-your model ; [you]2180-you do n't seem to enjoy sacrifice for its own sake . That will come with practice . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [that child]2190-that child would leave off crying . ” [Hadria]211-hadria stopped in [the road]4037-the road to laugh at [the perturbed Professor]5470-the perturbed professor . “[2188-your prototype] [She]2188-your prototype will presently . That is only a cry of anger , not of distress . [I]0-i would not leave [her]2188-your prototype , if it were . Yes ; [your]2180-you vocation is clearly allegorical . Feminine to [your]2180-you finger - tips , in this truly feminine predicament . [We]2191-we are all — [nous autres femmes]2192-nous autres femmes — like [the hero of the White Ship , who is described by [some delightful boy]2194-some delightful boy in an examination paper as being ‘ melted by the shrieks of [a near relation]2195-a near relation]2193-the hero of the white ship , who is described by some delightful boy in an examination paper as being ‘ melted by the shrieks of a near relation . ’ ” [The Professor]4071-the professor stumbled over a stone in [the road]4037-the road , and looked back at it vindictively . “[2196-the near relation] [The near relation]2196-the near relation does so want to hold [one]329-one 's watch and to stuff it into [his]2196-the near relation mouth , and [he]2196-the near relation shrieks so movingly if one brutally removes [one]329-one 's property and [person]2199-person ! ” “[2196-the near relation] Alas ! [I]0-i ca n't see the bearings of things . ” “[0-i] As allegory , [you]0-i are as perfect as ever . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i seem to be a sort of involuntary [Pilgrim]215-pilgrim 's Progress ! ” [he]5473-he exclaimed . “[0-i] Ah , indeed ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] and how the symbolism of that old allegory would fit this subject ! ” “[0-i] With [me]0-i for [wretched hero]2200-wretched hero , [I]0-i suppose ! ” “[0-i] [Your]0-i archetype;—with a little adaptation — yes , and wonderfully little — [the Slough of Despond]2201-the slough of despond , [Doubting Castle]42-doubting castle , [the Valley of the Shadow of Death]2202-the valley of the shadow of death — they all fall into place . But the end — that would be a difficulty . ” “[2205-the pilgrim] One for [your]0-i sex to solve , ” said [the Professor]4071-the professor . When [they]5475-they arrived at [the cottage]1763-the cottage the wails were dying away , and [Hadria]211-hadria advised that [they]5475-they should leave well alone . So [[the baby]1487-the baby 's victim]5478-the baby 's victim somewhat reluctantly retired . “[2205-the pilgrim] After all , [you]0-i see , if [one]329-one has strength of purpose , [one]329-one can achieve freedom , ” [he]4071-the professor observed . “[329-one] At the expense of the affections , it would seem , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . The walk was pursued towards [Craddock]164-craddock dene . [Hadria]211-hadria said [she]211-hadria had to ask [Dodge]155-dodge , [the old gravedigger]4772-the old gravedigger , if [he]4772-the old gravedigger could give a few days ' work in [the garden at [the Red House]4718-the red house]5480-the garden at the red house . [The Professor]4071-the professor was walking for walking 's sake . “[2208-she] [She]2208-she is [a pretty child]2209-a pretty child , is n't [she]2208-she ? ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[2208-she] Very ; [an attractive mite]2210-an attractive mite ; but [she]2208-she has a will of [her]2208-she own . ” “[2208-she] Yes ; [I]0-i confess [I]0-i have a moment of exultation when [that child]2190-that child sets up one of [her]2208-she passionate screams — the thrilling shriek of a near relation ! ” “[2208-she] Really , why ? ” “[2208-she] [She]2208-she has to make [her]2208-she way in [the world]334-the world . [She]2208-she must not be too meek . [[Her]2208-she mother]520-her mother was a victim to the general selfishness and stupidity . [She]520-her mother was too gentle and obedient ; too apt to defer to [others]432-others , to be able to protect [herself]520-her mother . [I]0-i want [[her]520-her mother child]1838-her child to be strengthened for the battle by a good long draught of happiness , and to be armed with that stoutest of all weapons — perfect health . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i are very wise , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , ” murmured [the Professor]4071-the professor . “[154-mrs. temperley] [Mon Dieu]205-mon dieu ! if one had always to judge for [others]432-others and never for [oneself]2217-oneself , what [Solons]2218-solons [we]2219-we should all be ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i hear that [you]0-i have taken [the child]4983-the child under [your]0-i protection . [She]4983-the child may think [herself]4983-the child fortunate . It is an act of real charity . ” [Hadria]211-hadria winced . “[0-i] [I]0-i fear not . [I]0-i have grown very much attached to [Martha]129-martha now , [poor little soul]2185-poor little soul ; but when [I]0-i decided to adopt [her]129-martha , [I]0-i was in a state of red - hot fury . ” “[0-i] Against whom , may [I]0-i ask ? ” “[0-i] Against [[the child]4983-the child 's father]2223-the child 's father , ” [Hadria]211-hadria replied shortly . “[0-i] YES , [mum]1416-mum , [I]0-i see [un]2225-un go up to [the churchyard]1413-the churchyard . [He]2223-the child 's father 's tidyin ' up [the place]981-the place a bit for the weddin ' . ” “[2223-the child 's father] The wedding ? ” repeated [Hadria]211-hadria vaguely . [The bride]5491-the bride had come . “[159-joseph fleming] See the ideal and ethereal being whom [you]2247-you have been so faithfully impersonating all the afternoon ! ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria . [A fair , faint , admirably gentle creature , floating in a mist of tulle]5516-a fair , faint , admirably gentle creature , floating in a mist of tulle , was wafted out of the brougham , the spring sunshine burnishing the pale hair , and flashing a dazzling sword - like glance on the string of diamonds at [her]219-marion throat . It seemed too emphatic , too keen a greeting for [the faint ambiguous being]5517-the faint ambiguous being , about to put the teaching of [her]219-marion girlhood , and [her]219-marion pretty hopes and faiths , to the test . [She]219-marion gave a start and shiver as [she]219-marion stepped out into the brilliant day , turning with a half - scared look to [the crowd of faces]5518-the crowd of faces . It seemed almost as if [she]219-marion were seeking help in a blind , bewildered fashion . [Hadria]211-hadria had an impulse . “[219-marion] What would [she]219-marion think if [I]0-i were to run down those steps and drag [her]219-marion away ? ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald shook [his]181-professor theobald head . Within [the church]1115-the church , [the procession]5520-the procession moved up [the aisle]5521-the aisle , to the sound of the organ . [Hadria]211-hadria compared the whole ceremony to some savage rite of sacrifice : [priest]5522-priest and [people]3687-people with [the victim]870-the victim , chosen for [her]219-marion fairness , decked as is meet for [victims]1187-victims . “[219-marion] But [she]219-marion may be happy , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton suggested when the ceremony was over , and the organ was pealing out the wedding march . “[219-marion] That does not prevent the analogy . What a magnificent hideous thing the marriage - service is ! and how exactly it expresses the extraordinary mixture of the noble and the brutal that is characteristic of [our]2248-our notions about these things ! ” “[5491-the bride] [The bride]5491-the bride is certainly allowed to remain under no misapprehension as to [her]5491-the bride function , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton admitted , with a laugh that grated on [Hadria]211-hadria . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had fallen behind with [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , who had turned up among [the crowd]631-the crowd . “[5491-the bride] But , after all , why mince matters ? ” “[5491-the bride] Why indeed ? ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton seemed to have expected dissent . “[0-i] [I]0-i think , ” [she]0-i said , “[0-i] that [we]2248-our are getting too squeamish nowadays as to speech . [Women]606-women are so frightened to call a spade a spade . ” “[606-women] It is the spade that is ugly , not the name . ” “[606-women] But , [[my]0-i dear]3722-my dear ? ” “[3722-my dear] Oh , it is not a question of squeamishness , it is the insult of the thing . One insult after another , and [everyone]3726-everyone stands round , looking respectable . ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton laughed and said something to lead [[her]176-lady engleton companion]3995-her companion on . [She]176-lady engleton liked to listen to [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley when [she]176-lady engleton was thoroughly roused . “[3722-my dear] It is the hideous mixture of the delicately civilised with the brutally savage that makes [one sick]2253-one sick . A frankly barbarous ceremony , where there was no pretence of refinement and propriety and so forth , would be infinitely less revolting . ” “[3722-my dear] Which [your]3722-my dear language is plain , ” observed [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , much amused . “[3722-my dear] [I]0-i hope so . Did n't [you]3722-my dear see how it all hurt [that poor girl]2254-that poor girl ? One of [her]2254-that poor girl training too — suspended in mid air — not an earthward glance . [You]3722-my dear know [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan 's views on the education of [girls]3769-girls . [Poor girls]2256-poor girls . [They]2256-poor girls are morally skinned , in such a way as to make contact with Fact a veritable torture , and then suddenly [they]2256-poor girls are sent forth defenceless into Life to be literally curry - combed . ” “[2256-poor girls] [They]2256-poor girls adjust [themselves]2256-poor girls , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[2256-poor girls] Adjust [themselves]2256-poor girls ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria vindictively flicked off the head of a dandelion with [her]211-hadria parasol . “[2256-poor girls] [They]2256-poor girls awake to find [they]2256-poor girls have been living in [a Fool 's Paradise]2257-a fool 's paradise — [a little upholstered corner with stained glass windows and rose - coloured light]2258-a little upholstered corner with stained glass windows and rose - coloured light . [They]2256-poor girls find that suddenly [they]2256-poor girls are expected to place in the centre of [their]2256-poor girls life everything that up to that moment [they]2256-poor girls have scarcely been allowed even to know about ; [they]2256-poor girls find that [they]2256-poor girls must obediently veer round , with the amiable adaptability of a well - oiled weather - cock . Every instinct , every prejudice must be thrown over . All the effects of [their]2256-poor girls training must be instantly overcome . And all this with perfect subjection and cheerfulness , on pain of moral avalanches and deluges , and heaven knows what convulsions of conventional nature ! ” “[2256-poor girls] There certainly is some curious incongruity in [our]2259-our training , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton admitted . “[2256-poor girls] Incongruity ! Think what it means for [a girl]3734-a girl to have been taught to connect the idea of something low and evil with that which nevertheless is to lie at the foundation of all [her]3734-a girl after life . That is what it amounts to , and [people]3687-people complain that [women]606-women are not logical . ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton laughed . “[3687-people] Fortunately things work better in practice than might be expected , judging them in the abstract . How [bashful Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald seems suddenly to have become ! Why does n't [he]181-professor theobald join [us]2259-our , [I]0-i wonder ? However , so much the better ; [I]0-i do like to hear [you]2263-you talk heresy . ” “[2263-you] [I]0-i do more than talk it , [I]0-i mean it , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i fail utterly to get at the popular point of view . ” But [you]2263-you misrepresent it — there are modifying facts in the case . ”[0-i] “ [I]176-lady engleton do n't see [them]5528-them . [Girls]3769-girls are told : ‘ So and so is not a nice thing for [you]2263-you to talk about . Wait , however , until the proper signal is given , and then woe betide [you]2263-you if [you]2263-you do n't cheerfully accept it as [your]2263-you bounden duty . ’ If that does not enjoin abject slavishness and deliberate immorality of the most cold - blooded kind , [I]176-lady engleton simply do n't know what does . ”[176-lady engleton] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton seemed to ponder somewhat seriously , as [she]176-lady engleton stood looking down at the grave beside [her]176-lady engleton . “ How [we]5530-we ever came to have tied [ourselves]5530-we into such an extraordinary mental knot is what bewilders [me]176-lady engleton , ”[176-lady engleton] [Hadria]211-hadria continued , “ and still more , why it is that [we]5530-we all , by common consent , go on acting and talking as if the tangled skein ran smooth and straight through one 's fingers . ”[211-hadria] “ Chiefly , perhaps , because [women]606-women wo n't speak out , ”[176-lady engleton] suggested [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ [They]2265-they have been so drilled , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “ so gagged , so deafened , by ‘ the shrieks of near relations . ’ ”[211-hadria] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was asking for an explanation , when the wedding - bells began to clang out from [the belfry]2264-the belfry , merry and roughly rejoicing . “ Tom - boy bells , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria called [them]2265-they . [She]211-hadria was thinking of [[Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan 's daughters]2281-mrs. jordan 's daughters . “ What became of [their]2281-mrs. jordan 's daughters personality all that time [I]211-hadria can not imagine : [[their]2281-mrs. jordan 's daughters woman]5545-their woman 's nature that [one]329-one hears so much about , and from which such prodigious feats were to be looked for , in the future . ”[211-hadria] “ Yes , that is where the inconsistency of [a girl]3734-a girl 's education strikes [me]176-lady engleton most , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ If [she]3734-a girl were intended for [the cloister]5548-the cloister one could understand it . It is inconceivable , and yet [good people]5554-good people do it , without a suspicion of the real nature of [their]5554-good people conduct , which it would n't be polite to describe . ”[176-lady engleton] [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan — [her]179-mrs. jordan face irradiated with satisfaction — was acknowledging the plaudits of [the villagers]2235-the villagers , who shouted more or less in proportion to the eye - filling properties of [the departing guests]2283-the departing guests . [Hadria]211-hadria was seized with a fit of laughter . It was an awkward fact , that [she]211-hadria never could see [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan 's majestic form and noble bonnet without feeling the same overwhelming impulse to laugh . “ This is disgraceful conduct ! ”[176-lady engleton] cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . [Hadria]211-hadria was clearly in one of [her]211-hadria most reckless moods to - day . “ [You]176-lady engleton have led [me]211-hadria on , and must take the consequences ! ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria cried . “ Imagine , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria continued with diabolical deliberation , “ if [Marion]219-marion , on any day previous to this , had gone to [[her]219-marion mother]520-her mother and expressed an overpowering maternal instinct — a deep desire to have [a child]754-a child ! ”[211-hadria] “ Good heavens ! ”[176-lady engleton] exclaimed [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ Why so shocked , since it is so holy ? ”[176-lady engleton] “ But that is different . ”[211-hadria] “ Ah ! then it is holy only when the social edict goes forth , and proclaims the previous evil good and the previous good evil . ”[211-hadria] “ Come , come ; the inconsistency is not quite so bad as that . ( How [that man]5238-that man does dawdle ! ) ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria shrugged [her]211-hadria shoulders . “ It seems to [me]211-hadria so ; for now suppose , on the other hand , that [this same Marion]5558-this same marion , on any day subsequent to this , should go to [that same mother]5559-that same mother , and announce an exactly opposite feeling — a profound objection to the maternal function — how would [she]219-marion be received ? Heavens , with what pained looks , with what platitudes and proverbs , with what reproofs and axioms and sentiments ! [She]219-marion would issue forth from that interview like [another St. Sebastian , stuck all over with wounds and arrows]5560-another st. sebastian , stuck all over with wounds and arrows . ‘ Sacred mission , ’ ‘ tenderest joy , ’ ‘ holiest mission , ’ ‘ highest vocation’—one knows the mellifluous phrases . ”[211-hadria] “ But after all [she]219-marion would be wrong in [her]219-marion objection . The instinct is a true one , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ Oh , then why should [she]219-marion be pelted for expressing it previously , if the question is not indiscreet ? ”[176-lady engleton] “ Well , it would seem rather gruesome , if [girls]3769-girls were to be overpowered with that passion . ”[211-hadria] “ So [we]5562-we are all to be horribly shocked at the presence of an instinct to - day , and then equally shocked and indignant at its absence to - morrow ; [our]5562-we sentiment being determined by the performance or otherwise of the ceremony [we]5562-we have just witnessed . It really shows a touching confidence in the swift adaptability of [the woman]4547-the woman 's sentimental organization ! ”[176-lady engleton] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton gave an uneasy laugh , and seemed lost in uncomfortable thought . [She]176-lady engleton enjoyed playing with unorthodox speculations , but [she]176-lady engleton objected to have [her]176-lady engleton customary feelings interfered with , by a reasoning which [she]176-lady engleton did not see [her]176-lady engleton way to reduce to a condition of uncertainty . [She]176-lady engleton liked to leave a question delicately balanced , enjoying all the fun of “ advanced ”[176-lady engleton] thought without endangering [her]176-lady engleton favourite sentiments . Like [many women of talent]2284-many women of talent , [she]176-lady engleton was intensely maternal , in the instinctive sense ; and for that reason had a vague desire to insist on [all other women]2285-all other women being equally so ; but the notion of the instinct becoming importunate in [a girl]3734-a girl revolted [her]176-lady engleton ; a state of mind that struggled to justify itself without conscious entrenchment behind mere tradition . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton sincerely tried to shake off prejudice . “ [You]5564-you are in a mixed condition of feeling , [I]211-hadria see , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria said . “ [I]211-hadria am not surprised . [Our]5565-we whole scheme of things indeed is so mixed , that the wonder only is [we]5565-we are not all in a state of chronic lunacy . [I]211-hadria believe , as a matter of fact , that [we]5565-we are ; but as [we]5565-we are [all lunatics together]5566-all lunatics together , there is [no one]383-no one left to put [us]5565-we into [asylums]5568-asylums . ”[211-hadria] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton laughed . “ The present age is truly a strange one , ”[176-lady engleton] [she]176-lady engleton exclaimed . “ Do [you]5564-you think so ? It always seems to [me]176-lady engleton that the present age is finding out for the first time how very strange all the other ages have been . ”[176-lady engleton] “ However that may be , it seems to [me]211-hadria , that a sort of shiver is going through all Society , as if it had suddenly become very much aware of things and could n't make them out — nor itself . ”[211-hadria] “ Like [a creature beginning to struggle through a bad illness]5569-a creature beginning to struggle through a bad illness . [I]211-hadria do think it is all extremely remarkable , especially the bad illness . ”[211-hadria] “ [You]5564-you are as strange as [your]5564-you epoch , ”[176-lady engleton] cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton “ It is a sorry sign when one remarks health instead of disease . ”[211-hadria] “ Upon [my]211-hadria word , [you]5564-you have a wholesome confidence in [yourself]5564-you ! ”[211-hadria] “ [I]211-hadria do not , in that respect , differ from [[my]211-hadria kind]5570-my kind , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria returned calmly . “ It is that which was that seems to [you]5564-you astonishing , not that which is to be , ”[211-hadria] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton commented , pensively . “ For [my]176-lady engleton part [I]176-lady engleton confess [I]176-lady engleton am frightened , almost terrified at times , at that which is to be . ”[176-lady engleton] “ [I]211-hadria am frightened , terrified , so that the thought becomes unbearable , at that which is , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . There was a long silence . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton appeared to be again plunged in thought . “ The maternal instinct — yes ; it seems to be round that unacknowledged centre that the whole storm is raging . ”[176-lady engleton] “ A desperate question that [Society]43-society shrinks from in terror : whether [women]606-women shall be expected to conduct [themselves]606-women as if the instinct had been weighed out accurately , like weekly stores , and given to [all alike]5572-all alike , or whether choice and individual feeling is to be held lawful in this matter — there is the red - hot heart of the battle . ”[176-lady engleton] “ Remember [men of science]5573-men of science are against freedom in this respect . ( [I]211-hadria do wish [[our]5573-men of science man of science]5574-our man of science would make haste . ) ”[211-hadria] “ [They]5573-men of science rush to the rescue when [they]5573-men of science see the sentimental defences giving way , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ If the ‘ sacred privilege ’ and ‘ noblest vocation ’ safeguards wo n't hold , science must throw up entrenchments . ”[211-hadria] “ [I]176-lady engleton prefer the more romantic and sentimental presentment of the matter , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ Naturally . Ah ! it is pathetic , the way [we]5573-men of science have tried to make things decorative ; but it wo n't hold out much longer . [Women]606-women are driving [[their]606-women masters]5576-their masters to plain speaking — the ornaments are being dragged down . And what do [we]5573-men of science find ? Bare and very ugly fact . And if [we]5573-men of science venture to hint that this unsatisfactory skeleton may be modified in form , science becomes stern . [She]211-hadria wishes things , in [this department]5577-this department , left as they are . [Women]606-women are made for purposes of reproduction ; let [them]5573-men of science clearly understand that . No picking and choosing . ”[176-lady engleton] “ [Men]3698-men pick and choose , it is true , ”[176-lady engleton] observed [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton in a musing tone , as if thinking aloud . “ Ah , but that 's different — a real scientific argument , though [a superficial observer]5580-a superficial observer might not credit it . At any rate , it is quite sufficiently scientific for this particular subject . [[Our]5573-men of science leaders of thought]5581-our leaders of thought do n't bring out [their]5581-our leaders of thought Sunday - best logic on this question . [They]5581-our leaders of thought lounge in dressing - gown and slippers . [One]329-one gets to know the oriental pattern of that dressing - gown and the worn - down heels of those old slippers . ”[176-lady engleton] “ [They]5581-our leaders of thought may be right though , notwithstanding [their]5581-our leaders of thought logic , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ By good luck , not good guidance . [I]176-lady engleton wonder what [her]211-hadria Serene Highness Science would say if [she]211-hadria heard [us]5573-men of science ? ”[176-lady engleton] “ That [we]5573-men of science [two ignorant creatures]5583-two ignorant creatures are very presumptuous . ”[176-lady engleton] “ Yes , [people]3687-people always fall back on that , when [they]3687-people ca n't refute [you]176-lady engleton . ”[176-lady engleton] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton smiled . “ [I]176-lady engleton should like to hear the question discussed by [really competent persons]5585-really competent persons . ( Well , if luncheon is dead cold it will be [his]5585-really competent persons own fault . ) ”[176-lady engleton] “ Oh , [really competent persons]5585-really competent persons will tell [us]5573-men of science all about the possibilities of [woman]3844-woman : [her]3844-woman feelings , desires , capabilities , and limitations , now and for all time to come . And the wildly funny thing is that [women]606-women are ready , with open mouths , to reverently swallow this male verdict on [their]606-women inherent nature , as if it were gospel divinely inspired . [I]211-hadria may appear a little inconsistent , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria added with a laugh , “ but [I]211-hadria do think [women]606-women are [fools]5590-fools ! ”[211-hadria] [They]2287-they had strolled on along [the path]3883-the path till [they]2287-they came to [[the schoolmistress]4793-the schoolmistress 's grave]1837-the schoolmistress 's grave , which was green and daisy - covered , as if many years had passed since [her]4793-the schoolmistress burial . [Hadria]211-hadria stood , for a moment , looking down at it . “ [Fools]5590-fools , [fools]5590-fools , [unutterable , irredeemable fools]5593-unutterable , irredeemable fools ! ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria burst out . “ [[My]211-hadria dear]3722-my dear , [[my]211-hadria dear]3722-my dear , [we]2287-they are in [a churchyard]1522-a churchyard , ”[211-hadria] remonstrated [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , half laughing . “ [We]2287-they are at [this grave]5597-this grave , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [The poor woman]5418-the poor woman would have been among the first to approve of the whole scheme , though it places [her]5418-the poor woman here beneath the daisies . ”[211-hadria] “ Exactly . Am [I]211-hadria not justified then in crying ‘ fool ’ ? Do n't imagine that [I]211-hadria exclude [myself]211-hadria , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria added . “ [I]176-lady engleton think [you]3722-my dear might be less liable to error if [you]3722-my dear were rather more of [a fool]1606-a fool , if [I]176-lady engleton may say so , ”[176-lady engleton] observed [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ Oh error ! [I]176-lady engleton daresay . [One]329-one can guard against that , after a fashion , by never making a stretch after truth . And the reward comes , of its kind . How green [the grave]4790-the grave is . The grass grows so fast on [graves]5602-graves . ”[176-lady engleton] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton could not bear [a churchyard]1522-a churchyard . It made [one]329-one think too seriously . “ Oh , [you]3722-my dear need n't unless [you]3722-my dear like ! ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria with a laugh . “ Indeed [a churchyard]1522-a churchyard might rather teach [us]5604-us what nonsense it is to take things seriously — [our]5604-us little affairs . [This poor woman]5605-this poor woman , a short while ago , was dying of grief and shame and agony , and [the village]1124-the village was stirred with excitement , as if the solar system had come to grief . It all seemed so stupendous and important , yet now — look at that tall grass waving in the wind ! ”[211-hadria] [PROFESSOR THEOBALD]181-professor theobald had been engaged , for the last ten minutes , in instructing [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming and a few stragglers , among whom was [Dodge]155-dodge , in the characteristics of ancient architecture . [He]181-professor theobald was pointing out the fine Norman window of [the south transept]2293-the south transept , [Joseph]159-joseph fleming nodding wearily , [Dodge]155-dodge leaning judicially on [his]181-professor theobald broom and listening with attention . [Joseph]159-joseph fleming , as [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton remarked , was evidently bearing [the Normans]221-the normans a bitter grudge for making interesting arches . [The Professor]181-professor theobald seemed to have no notion of tempering the wind of [his]181-professor theobald instruction to [the shorn lambs of [[his]181-professor theobald audience]1987-his audience]2294-the shorn lambs of his audience . “ [I]176-lady engleton ca n't understand why [he]159-joseph fleming does not join [us]5607-us , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ It must be nearly luncheon time . However , it does n't much matter , as [everyone]3726-everyone seems to be up here . [I]176-lady engleton wonder , ”[176-lady engleton] [she]176-lady engleton went on after a pause , “ what [the bride]5491-the bride would think if [she]5491-the bride had heard [our]5607-us conversation this morning ! ”[176-lady engleton] “ Probably [she]5491-the bride would recognize many a half - thought of [her]5491-the bride own , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton shook [her]176-lady engleton head . “ [They]5610-they alarm [me]176-lady engleton , all these ideas . For [myself]176-lady engleton , [I]176-lady engleton feel bound to accept the decision of [wise and good men , who have studied social questions deeply]5611-wise and good men , who have studied social questions deeply . ”[176-lady engleton] Personal feeling had finally overcome [her]176-lady engleton desire to fight off the influence of tradition . “ [I]176-lady engleton do not feel competent to judge in a matter so complex , and must be content to abide by the opinions of [those who have knowledge and experience]5612-those who have knowledge and experience . ”[176-lady engleton] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton thus retreated hastily behind cover . That was a strategic movement always available in difficulties , and it left [[one]329-one 's companion]2297-one 's companion in speculation alone in the open , arrogantly sustaining an eagle - gaze in the sun 's face . The advantages of feminine humility were obvious . [One]329-one could come out for a skirmish and then run for shelter , in awkward moments . [No woman]5158-no woman ought to venture out on [the bare plain]2300-the bare plain without a provision of the kind . [Hadria]211-hadria had a curious sensation of being so exposed , when [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton retreated behind [her]211-hadria “ good and [wise men]5613-wise men , ”[211-hadria] and [she]211-hadria had the usual feminine sense of discomfort in the feeling of presumption that it produced . Heredity asserted itself , as it will do , in the midst of the fray , just when [its victim]2301-its victim seems to have shaken [himself]2301-its victim free from the mysterious obsession . But [Hadria]211-hadria did not visibly flinch . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton received the impression that [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley was too sure of [her]154-mrs. temperley own judgment to defer even to the wisest . [She]176-lady engleton experienced a pleasant little glow of humility , wrapping [herself]176-lady engleton in it , as in a protecting garment , and unconsciously comparing [her]176-lady engleton more moderate and modest attitude favourably with [[her]176-lady engleton companion]3995-her companion 's self - confidence . Just at that moment , [Hadria]211-hadria 's self - confidence was gasping for breath . But [her]176-lady engleton sense of the comic in [[her]176-lady engleton companion]3995-her companion 's tactics survived , and set [her]176-lady engleton off in an apparently inconsequent laugh , which goaded [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton into retreating further , to an encampment of pure orthodoxy . “ [I]176-lady engleton fear there is an element of the morbid , in all this fretful revolt against the old - established destiny of [our]5614-our sex , ”[176-lady engleton] [she]176-lady engleton said . The advance - guard of [[Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald 's party]2304-professor theobald 's party was coming up . [The Professor]4071-the professor [himself]4071-the professor still hung back , playing [the Ancient Mariner]2306-the ancient mariner to [[Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming 's Wedding Guest]2307-joseph fleming 's wedding guest . [Most unwilling]2308-most unwilling was [that guest]2309-that guest , [most pertinacious that mariner]2310-most pertinacious that mariner . [Hadria]211-hadria had turned to speak to [Dodge]155-dodge , who had approached , broom in hand . “ Seems only yesterday as [we]5614-our was a diggin ' o ' that there grave , do n't it , [mum]1416-mum ? ”[2311-i] [he]2311-i remarked pleasantly , including [Hadria]211-hadria in the credit of the affair , with native generosity . “ [It]5616-it does indeed , [Dodge]155-dodge . [She]1416-mum did n't die in peace , whatever [she]1416-mum be a doin' now , not [she]1416-mum did n't , pore thing . [I]211-hadria was jest a tellin ' [the gentleman]2242-the gentleman ”[211-hadria] ( [Dodge]155-dodge indicated [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald with a backward movement of the thumb ) , “ about [the schoolmarm]5620-the schoolmarm . [He]181-professor theobald was talkin ' like a sermon — beautiful — about the times wen [the church]1115-the church was built ; and about [them]5622-them as come over from [France]44-france and beat [the English]223-the english — shameful thing for [[our]5614-our soldiers]5623-our soldiers , ' pears to [me]211-hadria , not as [I]211-hadria believes all [them]5622-them tales . [Mr. Walker]217-mr. walker says as learnin ' is a pitfall , which [I]211-hadria do n't swaller everything as [Mr. Walker]217-mr. walker says neither . Seems to [me]211-hadria as it do n't do to be always believin ' wot 's told [yer]5624-yer , or there 's no sayin ' wot sort o ' things [you]5624-yer would n't come to find inside o ' [yer]5624-yer , before [you]5624-yer 'd done . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria admitted the danger of indiscriminate absorption , but pointed out that if caution were carried too far , one might end by finding nothing inside of one at all , which also threatened to be attended with inconvenience . [Dodge]155-dodge seemed to feel that the désagréments in this last case were trivial as compared with those of the former . “ [Dodge]155-dodge is [a born sceptic]5625-a born sceptic , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ What would [you]155-dodge say , [Dodge]155-dodge , if [some tiresome , reasonable person]5626-some tiresome , reasonable person were to come and point out something to [you]155-dodge that [you]155-dodge could n't honestly deny , and yet that seemed to upset all the ideas that [you]155-dodge had felt were truest and best ? ”[155-dodge] [Dodge]155-dodge scratched [his]2312-his head . “ [I]155-dodge should say as what [he]2312-his said was n't true , ”[155-dodge] replied [Dodge]155-dodge . “ But if [you]176-lady engleton could n't help seeing that it was true ? ”[155-dodge] “ That ud be [arkard]224-arkard , ”[155-dodge] [Dodge]155-dodge admitted . “ Then what would [you]176-lady engleton do ? ”[155-dodge] [Dodge]155-dodge leant upon the broom - handle , apparently in profound thought . [His]2312-his words were waited for . “ [I]2312-his think , ”[2312-his] [he]2312-his announced at last , “ as [I]2312-his should n't do nothin' partic'lar . ”[2312-his] “ [Dodge]155-dodge , [you]155-dodge really are [an oracle]5627-an oracle ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed . “ What could more simply describe the action of [[our]5628-our Great Majority]5629-our great majority ? ”[211-hadria] “ [You]155-dodge are positively impish in [your]155-dodge mood to - day ! ”[176-lady engleton] exclaimed [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ What should [we]5628-our do without [our]5628-our Great Majority , as [you]155-dodge call it ? It is absolutely necessary to put some curb on the wild impulses of pure reason”—a[176-lady engleton] sentiment that [Hadria]211-hadria greeted with chuckles of derision . [We]5651-we were sort o ' friendly , and wen [I]176-lady engleton heard ' [er]5652-er a taking on so bad , [I]176-lady engleton jes ' went and stood alongside , and [I]176-lady engleton sez , ‘ Wy [Ellen Jervis]184-ellen jervis , ’ [I]176-lady engleton sez , ‘ vot be [you]184-ellen jervis a cryin ' for ? ’ But [she]5640-a better girl kep ' on sobbin ' and would n't answer nothin' .
