Ca n't [somebody]891-somebody do nothin' for [you]2230-dear ? ’ “[176-lady engleton] ‘ No ; [nobody]3732-nobody in [the world]334-the world can help [me]0-i , and [nobody]3732-nobody wants to ; it would be better if [I]0-i was under [there]571-there . ’ And [she]0-i points to the ground just where [she]0-i lies now — [I]0-i give [you]2326-you [my]0-i word [she]0-i did — and sure enough , before another six months had gone by , there [she]0-i lay under the sod , ' xacly on the spot as [she]0-i had pointed to . [She]0-i was [a sinner]2327-a sinner , there 's no denyin ' , but [she]0-i ' ad to suffer for it more nor most . ” “[0-i] Very sad , ” observed [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald nervously , with a glance at [Hadria]211-hadria , as if expecting derision . “[0-i] It is a hard case , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , “[0-i] but [I]0-i suppose error has to be paid for . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i do n't know ' xacly , ” said [Dodge]155-dodge , “[0-i] it depends . ” “[0-i] On the sex , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i have known [them]2328-them as spent all [their]2328-them lives a ' injurin ' of [others]432-others , and no harm seemed to come to ['em]2330-'em . And [I]0-i 've seed [them]2328-them as would n't touch a fly and always doin' [[their]2328-them neighbours]2331-their neighbours a kind turn , wot never ' ad a day 's luck . ” “[0-i] Let [us]2332-us hope it will be made up in [the next world]2333-the next world , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . [Dodge]155-dodge hoped it would , but there was something in the turn of [his]181-professor theobald head that seemed to denote a disposition to base [his]181-professor theobald calculations on this , rather than on [the other world]5656-the other world . [He]181-professor theobald was expected [home]3770-home by [[his]181-professor theobald wife]573-his wife , at this hour , so wishing [the company]4609-the company good day , and pocketing [the Professor]4071-the professor 's gratuity with a gleam of satisfaction in [his]181-professor theobald shrewd and honest face , [he]181-professor theobald trudged off with [his]181-professor theobald broom down [the path]3883-the path , and out by the wicket - gate into [the village street]4710-the village street . “[0-i] [I]0-i never heard that part of the story before , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , when [the gravedigger]4776-the gravedigger had left . It was new to [everybody]3781-everybody . “[0-i] It brings [her]2334-her nearer , makes one realize [her]2334-her suffering more painfully . ” [Hadria]211-hadria was silent . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald cast a quick , scrutinizing glance at [her]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i can understand better now how [you]0-i were induced to take [the poor child]2335-the poor child , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton remarked . [They]5665-they were strolling down [the path]3883-the path , and [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald was holding open the gate for [[his]181-professor theobald companions]1012-his companions to pass through . [His]181-professor theobald hand seemed to shake slightly . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't enjoy probing [my]0-i motives on that subject , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] Why ? [I]0-i am sure [they]2336-they were good . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't help hoping that [that child]2190-that child may live to avenge [[her]2190-that child mother]520-her mother ; to make [some man]2339-some man know what it is to be horribly miserable — but , oh , [I]0-i suppose it 's like trying to reach the feelings of a rhinoceros ! ” “[154-mrs. temperley] There [you]154-mrs. temperley are much mistaken , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , ” said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “[154-mrs. temperley] [Men]3698-men are as sensitive , in some respects , as [women]606-women . ” “[606-women] So much the better . ” “[606-women] Then do [you]154-mrs. temperley think it quite just to punish [one man]2342-one man for the sin of another ? ” “[154-mrs. temperley] No ; but there is a deadly feud between [the sexes]2343-the sexes : it is a hereditary vendetta : the duty of vengeance is passed on from generation to generation . ” “[154-mrs. temperley] Oh , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley ! ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton 's tone was one of reproach . “[154-mrs. temperley] Yes , it is vindictive , [I]0-i know ; [one]329-one does not grow tender towards [the enemy]435-the enemy at the grave of [Ellen Jervis]184-ellen jervis . ” “[184-ellen jervis] At least , there were [two sinners]2346-two sinners , [not only one]2347-not only one . ” “[2346-two sinners] [Only one]1549-only one dies of a broken heart . ” “[1549-only one] But why attempt revenge ? ” “[1549-only one] Oh , a primitive instinct . And anything is better than this meek endurance , this persistent heaping of penalties on [the scapegoat]2349-the scapegoat . ” No good ever came of mere revenge , however , ”[181-professor theobald] said [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . “ Sometimes that is the only form of remonstrance that is listened to , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ When [people]3687-people have the law in [their]3687-people own hands and [Society]43-society at [their]3687-people back , [they]3687-people can afford to be deaf to mere verbal protest . ”[211-hadria] “ As for [the child]4983-the child , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , “ [she]4983-the child will be in no little danger of a fate like [[her]4983-the child mother]520-her mother 's . ”[176-lady engleton] [Hadria]211-hadria 's face darkened . “ At least then , [she]4983-the child shall have some free and happy hours first ; at least [she]4983-the child shall not be driven to it by the misery of moral starvation , starvation of the affections . [She]4983-the child shall be protected from [the solemn fools — with sawdust for brains and a mechanical squeaker for heart]5672-the solemn fools — with sawdust for brains and a mechanical squeaker for heart — who , on principle , cut off from [[her]4983-the child mother]520-her mother all joy and all savour in life , and then punished [her]4983-the child for falling a victim to the starved emotional condition to which [they]5672-the solemn fools — with sawdust for brains and a mechanical squeaker for heart had reduced [her]4983-the child . ”[211-hadria] “ The matter seems complex , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , “ and [I]176-lady engleton do n't see how revenge comes in . ”[176-lady engleton] “ It is a passion that has never been eradicated . Oh , if [I]211-hadria could but find [that man]5238-that man ! ”[211-hadria] “ [A man]3704-a man is a hard thing to punish,—unless [he]3704-a man is in love with [one]329-one . ”[211-hadria] “ Well , let [him]3704-a man be in love ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria fiercely . THE sound of music stole over [the gardens of [the Priory]1664-the priory]2350-the gardens of the priory , at sunset . It was the close of one of the most exquisite days of Spring . A calm had settled over [the country]401-the country with the passing away of [the sun - god]2353-the sun - god . [His]2353-the sun - god attendant winds and voices had been sacrificed on [his]2353-the sun - god funeral pyre . [Two figures]2354-two figures sat on [the terrace]1680-the terrace by the open window of [the drawing - room]737-the drawing - room , listening to the utterance , in music , of a tumultuous , insurgent spirit . In [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , the musical passion was deeply rooted , as it is in most profoundly sympathetic and tender natures . [Algitha]81-algitha anxiously watched the effect of [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister 's playing on [[her]81-algitha companion]3995-her companion . The wild power of [the composer]2359-the composer was not merely obvious , it was overwhelming . It was like “ a sudden storm among mountains , ”[2359-the composer] “ the wind - swept heavens at midnight , ”[2359-the composer] “ [the lonely sea]5677-the lonely sea ”[2359-the composer] : [he]2359-the composer struggled for the exactly - fitting simile . There was none , because of its many - sidedness . Loneliness remained as an ever - abiding quality . There were moon - glimpses and sun - bursts over the scenery of the music ; there was sweetness , and a vernal touch that thrilled [the listeners]2360-the listeners as with the breath of flowers and the fragrance of earth after rain , but always , behind all fancy and grace and tenderness , and even passion , lurked that spectral loneliness . [The performer]2361-the performer would cease for some minutes , and presently begin again in a new mood . The music was always characteristic , often wild and strange , yet essentially sane . “ There is a strong Celtic element in it , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ This is a very wonderful gift . [I]4071-the professor suppose [one]329-one never does really know [[one]329-one 's fellows]2089-one 's fellows : [her]329-one music to - night reveals to [me]4071-the professor new sides of [Hadria]211-hadria 's character . ”[4071-the professor] “ [I]81-algitha confess [they]5681-they alarm [me]81-algitha , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . “ Truly , this is not the sort of power that can be safely shut up and stifled . It is the sort of power for which everything ought to be set aside . That is [my]81-algitha impression of it . ”[81-algitha] “ [I]81-algitha am worried about [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha said . “ [I]81-algitha know [her]211-hadria better than [most people]4077-most people , and [I]81-algitha know how hard [she]211-hadria takes things and what explosive force that musical instinct of [hers]211-hadria has . Yet , it is impossible , as things are , for [her]211-hadria to give it real utterance . [She]211-hadria can only open the furnace door now and then . ”[81-algitha] [The Professor]4071-the professor shook [his]4071-the professor head gravely . “ It wo n't do : it is n't safe . And why should such a gift be lost ? ”[4071-the professor] “ That 's what [I]81-algitha say ! Yet what is to be done ? There is [no one really to blame]5683-no one really to blame . As for [Hubert]118-hubert , [I]81-algitha am sorry for [him]118-hubert . [He]118-hubert had not the faintest idea of [Hadria]211-hadria 's character , though [she]211-hadria did [her]211-hadria best to enlighten [him]118-hubert . It is hard for [him]118-hubert ( since [he]118-hubert feels it so ) and it is desperate for [her]211-hadria . [You]5684-you are such [an old friend]4266-an old friend , that [I]81-algitha feel [I]81-algitha may speak to [you]5684-you about it . [You]5684-you see what is going on , and [I]81-algitha know it is troubling [you]5684-you as it does [me]81-algitha . ”[81-algitha] “ It is indeed . If [I]4071-the professor am not very greatly mistaken , here is real musical genius of the first order , going to waste : strong forces being turned in upon the nature , to its own destruction ; and , as [you]5684-you say , it seems as if nothing could be done . It is the more ironically cruel , since [Hubert]118-hubert is [himself]118-hubert musical . ”[4071-the professor] “ Oh , yes , but in quite a different way . [His]118-hubert fetish is good taste , or what [he]118-hubert thinks such . [Hadria]211-hadria 's compositions set [his]118-hubert teeth on edge . [His]118-hubert nature is conventional through and through . [He]118-hubert fears adverse comment more than any earthly thing . And yet the individual opinions that compose the general ‘ talk ’ that [he]118-hubert so dreads , are nothing to [him]118-hubert . [He]118-hubert despises [them]2360-the listeners heartily . But [he]118-hubert would give [his]118-hubert soul ( and particularly [Hadria]211-hadria 's ) rather than incur a whisper from [people collectively]5686-people collectively . ”[4071-the professor] “ That is a very common trait . If [we]5687-we feared only the opinions that [we]5687-we respect , [our]5687-we fear would cover but a small area . ”[81-algitha] The music stole out again through the window . The thoughts of [the listeners]2360-the listeners were busy . It was not until quite lately that [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue had fully realised the nature of [Hadria]211-hadria 's present surroundings . It had taken all [his]116-professor fortescue acuteness and [his]116-professor fortescue sympathy to enable [him]116-professor fortescue to perceive the number and strength of the little threads that hampered [her]211-hadria spontaneity . As [she]211-hadria said , they were made of heart - strings . A vast spider 's web seemed to spread its tender cordage round [each household]2365-each household , for the crippling of every winged creature within its radius . Fragments of torn wings attested the struggles that had taken place among [the treacherous gossamer]2366-the treacherous gossamer . “ And the maddening thing is , ”[81-algitha] cried [Algitha]81-algitha , “ that there is [nobody to swear at]5688-nobody to swear at . Swearing at systems and ideas , as [Hadria]211-hadria says , is a Barmecide feast to one 's vindictiveness . ”[81-algitha] “ It is the tyranny of affection that has done so much to ruin the lives of [women]606-women , ”[4071-the professor] [the Professor]4071-the professor observed , in a musing tone . Then after a pause : “ [I]4071-the professor fear [[your]81-algitha poor mother]5690-your poor mother has never got over [your]81-algitha little revolt , [Algitha]81-algitha . ”[4071-the professor] “ Never , [I]81-algitha am sorry to say . If [I]81-algitha had married and settled in [Hongkong]45-hongkong , [she]5690-your poor mother would scarcely have minded , but as it is , [she]5690-your poor mother feels deserted . Of course [the boys]3870-the boys are away from [home]3770-home more than [I]81-algitha am , yet [she]5690-your poor mother is not grieved at that . [You]5693-you see how vast these claims are . Nothing less than [one]329-one 's entire life and personality will suffice . ”[81-algitha] “ [[Your]5693-you mother]832-your mother feels that [you]5693-you are throwing [your]5693-you life away , remember . But truly it seems , sometimes , as if [people]3687-people were determined to turn affection into a curse instead of a blessing ! ”[4071-the professor] “ [I]81-algitha never think of it in any other light , ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha announced serenely . [The Professor]4071-the professor laughed . “ Oh , there are exceptions , [I]4071-the professor hope , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said . “ Love , like everything else that is great , is very , very rare . [We]5697-we call the disposition to usurp and absorb [another person by that name]5698-another person by that name , but woe betide [him]5699-him or [her]5700-her who is the object of such a sentiment . Yet happily , the real thing is to be found now and again . And from that arises freedom . ”[4071-the professor] [Hadria]211-hadria was playing some joyous impromptu , which seemed to express the very spirit of [Freedom]229-freedom [herself]211-hadria . “ [I]81-algitha think [Hadria]211-hadria has something of the gipsy in [her]211-hadria , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . “ [She]211-hadria is so utterly and hopelessly unfitted to be [the wife of [a prim , measured , elegant creature like [Hubert]118-hubert — good fellow though [he]118-hubert is — and to settle down for life at [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene]5702-a prim , measured , elegant creature like hubert — good fellow though he is — and to settle down for life at craddock dene]5701-the wife of a prim , measured , elegant creature like hubert — good fellow though he is — and to settle down for life at craddock dene . ”[81-algitha] “ Yes , ”[4071-the professor] returned [the Professor]4071-the professor , “ it has occurred to [me]4071-the professor , more than once , that there must be a drop of nomad blood somewhere among the ancestry . ”[4071-the professor] “ [Hadria]211-hadria always says [herself]211-hadria , that [she]211-hadria is [a vagabond in disguise]5703-a vagabond in disguise . ”[4071-the professor] [He]4071-the professor laughed . Then , as [he]4071-the professor drew out a tobacco - pouch from [his]4071-the professor pocket and proceeded to light [his]4071-the professor pipe , [he]4071-the professor went on , in quiet meditative fashion , as if thinking aloud : “ The fact of the matter is , that in [this world]430-this world , the dead weight of the mass bears heavily upon the exceptional natures . It comes home to [one]329-one vividly , in cases like this . The stupidity and blindness of [each individual]5706-each individual goes to build up the dead wall , the impassable obstacle , for some other spirit . The burden that [we]5707-our have cast upon [the world]334-the world has to be borne by [[our]5707-our fellow man]5709-our fellow man or [woman]3844-woman , and perhaps is doomed to crush [a human soul]2092-a human soul . ”[4071-the professor] “ It seems to [me]81-algitha that [most people]4077-most people are engaged in that crushing industry , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha with a shrug . “ Do n't [I]81-algitha know [their]4077-most people bonnets , and [their]4077-most people frock - coats and [their]4077-most people sneers ! ”[81-algitha] [The Professor]4071-the professor smiled . [He]4071-the professor thought that most of [us]2371-us were apt to take that attitude at times . [The same spirit]2372-the same spirit assumed different forms . “ While [we]5707-our are sneering at [[our]5707-our fellow mortal]5713-our fellow mortal , and assuring [him]5713-our fellow mortal loftily that [he]5713-our fellow mortal can certainly prevail , if only [he]5713-our fellow mortal is strong enough , it may be [our]5707-our particular dulness or [our]5707-our hardness that is dragging [him]5713-our fellow mortal down to a tragic failure , before [our]5707-our eyes . ”[2372-the same spirit] The sun was low when [the player]2373-the player came out to [the terrace]1680-the terrace and took [her]2373-the player favourite seat on the parapet . [The gardens]2375-the gardens were steeped in profound peace . [One]329-one could hear no sound for miles round . [The broad country]2377-the broad country made [itself]2377-the broad country closely felt by [its]2377-the broad country stirring silence . [The stretches of fields beyond [fields]2379-fields]2378-the stretches of fields beyond fields , the woodlands in their tender green , the long , long sweep of [the quiet land]2380-the quiet land , formed a benign circle round [the garden]3867-the garden , and led the sense of peace out and out to [the horizon]2382-the horizon , where the liquid light of the sky touched [the hills]413-the hills . The face of [the Professor]116-professor fortescue had a transparent look and a singular beauty of expression , such as is seen on the faces of the dead , or on the faces of [those who are carried beyond themselves by some generous enthusiasm]2384-those who are carried beyond themselves by some generous enthusiasm . [They]2385-they watched , in silence , the changes creeping over the heavens , the subtle transmutations of tint ; [the fairylands of cloud]2386-the fairylands of cloud , growing like dreams , and melting in golden annihilation ; the more delicate and exquisite , the sooner the end . The first pale hints of splendour had spread , till [the whole West]2387-the whole west was throbbing with the radiance . But it was short - lived . The soul of the light , with its vital vibrating quality , seemed to die , and then slowly the glow faded , till every sparkle was gone , and the amphitheatre of the sky lay cold , and dusk , and empty . It was not till the last gleam had melted away that a word was spoken . “ It is like a prophecy , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ To - morrow the dawn , remember . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria 's thoughts ran on in the silence . The dawn ? Yes ; but all that lost splendour , [those winged islands]2388-those winged islands , [those wild ranges of mountain where the dreams dwell]2389-those wild ranges of mountain where the dreams dwell ; to - morrow 's dawn brings no resurrection for [them]2385-they . Other pageants there will be , other cloud - castles , but never again just those . Had [the Professor]4071-the professor been following [her]211-hadria thoughts ? “ Life , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said , “ offers [her]211-hadria gifts as [the Sibyl]230-the sibyl [her]211-hadria books ; they grow fewer as [we]2385-they refuse them . ”[4071-the professor] “ Ah ! that is the truth that clamours in [my]4071-the professor brain , warning and pointing to [an empty temple]5714-an empty temple , like the deserted sky , a little while ahead . ”[4071-the professor] “ Be warned then . ”[4071-the professor] “ Ah ! but what to do ? [I]4071-the professor am out of [myself]4071-the professor now with the spring ; there are so many benign influences . [I]4071-the professor too have [winged islands]5715-winged islands , and [wild ranges where the dreams]5716-wild ranges where the dreams dwell ; life is a fairy - tale ; but there is always that terror of the departure of the sun . ”[4071-the professor] “ Carpe diem . ”[4071-the professor] [Hadria]211-hadria turned a startled and eager face towards [the Professor]4071-the professor , who was leaning back in [his]4071-the professor chair , thoughtfully smoking . The smoke curled away serenely through the calm air of the evening . “ [You]211-hadria have a great gift , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said . “ [One]329-one is afraid of taking a thing too seriously because it is one 's own . ”[4071-the professor] [The Professor]4071-the professor turned almost angrily . “ Good heavens , what does it matter whose it is ? There may be a sort of inverted vanity in refusing fair play to a power , on that ground . Alas ! here is one of the first morbid signs of the evil at work upon [you]211-hadria . If [you]211-hadria had been wholesomely moving and striving in the right direction , do [you]211-hadria think [you]211-hadria would have been guilty of that piece of egotism ? ”[4071-the professor] “ Vanity pursues one into hidden corners of the mind . [I]4071-the professor am so used to that sort of spirit among [women]606-women . Apparently [I]4071-the professor have caught the infection . ”[4071-the professor] “ [I]4071-the professor would not let it go farther , ”[4071-the professor] advised [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ To do [myself]211-hadria justice , [I]211-hadria think it is superficial , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria with a laugh . “ [I]211-hadria would dare anything , anything for a chance of freedom , for — , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria broke off , hesitating . “ [I]211-hadria remember once — years ago , when [I]211-hadria was quite [a girl]3734-a girl — seeing a young ash - tree that had got jammed into a chink so that it could n't grow straight , or spread , as [its]5720-its inner soul , poor stripling , evidently inspired it to grow . Outside , there were [hundreds of upright , vigorous , healthful young trees]5721-hundreds of upright , vigorous , healthful young trees , fulfilling that innate idea in apparent gladness , and with obvious general advantage , since they were growing into sound , valuable trees , straight of trunk , nobly developed . [I]211-hadria felt like the poor sapling in the cranny , that had just the same natural impetus of healthy growth as all the others , but was forced to become twisted , and crooked , and stunted and wretched . [I]211-hadria think [most women]4904-most women have to grow in a cranny . It is generally known as [their]4904-most women Sphere . ”[211-hadria] [Algitha]81-algitha gave an approving chuckle . “ [I]211-hadria noticed , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria added , “ that the desperate struggle to grow of that young tree had begun to loosen the masonry of [the edifice that cramped [it]5720-its]5723-the edifice that cramped it . There was a great dangerous - looking crack right across [the building]4303-the building . [The tree]5725-the tree was not saved from deformity , but it had its revenge ! Some day that [noble institution]5726-noble institution would come down by the run . ”[211-hadria] “ Yes . Well , the thing to do is to get out of it , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ [You]211-hadria really advise that ? ”[4071-the professor] “ Advise ? [One]329-one dare not advise . It is too perilous . No general theories will hold in all instances . ”[211-hadria] “ Tell [me]211-hadria , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ what are the qualities in [a human being]668-a human being that make [him]668-a human being most serviceable , or least harmful ? ”[211-hadria] “ What qualities ? ”[116-professor fortescue] [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue watched the smoke of [his]116-professor fortescue pipe curling away , as if [he]116-professor fortescue expected to find the answer in its coils . [He]116-professor fortescue answered slowly , and with an air of reflection . “ Mental integrity , and mercy . A resolute following of reason ( in which [I]116-professor fortescue should include insight ) to its conclusion , though the heavens fall , and [an unfailing fellow]5729-an unfailing fellow - feeling for the pain and struggle and heartache and sin that life is so full of . But one must add the quality of imagination . Without imagination and its fruits , [the world]334-the world would be [a howling wilderness]5731-a howling wilderness . ”[116-professor fortescue] “ [I]81-algitha wish [you]4071-the professor would come down with [me]81-algitha , some day , to [the East End]46-the east end and hold out the hand of fellowship to [some of [the sufferers there]5733-the sufferers there]5732-some of the sufferers there , ”[81-algitha] cried [Algitha]81-algitha . “ [I]81-algitha am , at times , almost in despair at the mass of evil to be fought against , but somehow [you]4071-the professor always make [me]81-algitha feel , [Professor]1240-professor , that the race has all the qualities necessary for redemption enfolded within itself . ”[81-algitha] “ But assuredly it has ! ”[4071-the professor] cried [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ And assuredly those redeeming qualities will germinate . Otherwise the race would extinguish [itself]5735-itself in cruelty and corruption . Let [people]3687-people talk as [they]3687-people please about the struggle for existence , it is through the development of the human mind and the widening of human mercy that better things will come . ”[4071-the professor] “ [One]329-one sees , now and then , in a flash , what [the world]334-the world may some day be , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ The vision comes , perhaps , with the splendour of a spring morning , or opens , scroll - like , in a flood of noble music . It sounds unreal , yet it brings a sense of conviction that is irresistible . ”[211-hadria] “ [I]4071-the professor think it was [Pythagoras]231-pythagoras who declared that the woes of [men]3698-men are the work of [their]3698-men own hands , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ So are [their]3698-men joys . Nothing ever shakes [my]4071-the professor belief that what the mind of [man]332-man can imagine , that it can achieve . ”[4071-the professor] “ But there are so many pulling the wrong way , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha sadly . “ Ah , [one man]2342-one man may be miserable through the deeds of [others]432-others ; the race can only be miserable through its own . ”[81-algitha] After a pause , [Algitha]81-algitha put a question : How far was it justifiable to give pain to [others]432-others in following [one]329-one 's own idea of right and reasonable ? How far might one attempt to live a life of intellectual integrity and of the widest mercy that [one]329-one 's nature would stretch to ? [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue saw no limits but those of [one]329-one 's own courage and ability . [Algitha]81-algitha pointed out that in most lives the limit occurred much sooner . If “ others”—those[81-algitha] tyrannical and absorbent “ others”—had[2401-their] intricately bound up [their]2401-their notions of happiness with the prevention of any such endeavour , and if those notions were of the usual negative , [home]3770-home - comfort - and - affection order , narrowly personal , fruitful in nothing except a sort of sentimental egotism that spread over [a whole family]2403-a whole family — what [Hadria]211-hadria called an egotism à douze — how far ought these ideas to be respected , and at what cost ? [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue was unqualified in [his]116-professor fortescue condemnation of the sentiment which erected sacrificial altars in the family circle . [He]116-professor fortescue spoke scornfully of the doctrine of renunciation , so applied , and held [the victims who brought [their]2404-the victims who brought their gifts of power and liberty more culpable than those who demanded them gifts of power and liberty more culpable than those who demanded [them]2404-the victims who brought their gifts of power and liberty more culpable than those who demanded them]2404-the victims who brought their gifts of power and liberty more culpable than those who demanded them , since the duty of resistance to recognised wrong was obvious , while great enlightenment was needed to teach [one]329-one to forego an unfair privilege or power that all [the world]334-the world concurred in pressing upon [one]329-one . “ Then [you]211-hadria think [a person]852-a person — even [a feminine person]5744-a feminine person — justified in giving pain by resisting unjust demands ? ”[211-hadria] “ [I]211-hadria certainly think that all attempts to usurp [another person]1312-another person 's life on the plea of affection should be stoutly resisted . But [I]211-hadria recognise that cases must often occur when resistance is practically impossible . ”[211-hadria] “ [One]329-one ought not to be too easily melted by the ‘ shrieks of [a near relation]2195-a near relation , ’ ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ Ah , [I]211-hadria have a good mind to try . [I]211-hadria do n't fear any risk for [myself]211-hadria , nor any work ; the stake is worth it . [I]211-hadria do n't want to grow cramped and crooked , like [my]211-hadria poor ash - tree . Perhaps this may be a form of vanity too ; [I]211-hadria do n't know , [I]211-hadria was going to say [I]211-hadria do n't care . ”[211-hadria] The scent of young leaves and of flowers came up , soft and rich from [the garden]3867-the garden , and as [Hadria]211-hadria leant over the parapet , a gust of passionate conviction of power swept over [her]211-hadria ; not merely of [her]211-hadria own personal power , but of some vast , flooding , beneficent well - spring from which [her]211-hadria own was fed . And with the inrush , came a glimpse as of [heaven]4276-heaven [itself]4276-heaven . “ [I]211-hadria wonder , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said after a long silence , “ why it is that when [we]5748-we know for dead certain , [we]5748-we call it faith . ”[211-hadria] “ Because , [I]211-hadria suppose , [our]5748-we certainty is certainty only for [ourselves]5748-we . If [you]211-hadria have found some such conviction to guide [you]211-hadria in [this wild world]656-this wild world , [you]211-hadria are very fortunate . [We]5748-we need all [our]5748-we courage and [our]5748-we strength — ”[211-hadria] “ And just a little more , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria added . “ Yes ; sometimes just a little more , to save [us]5748-we from its worst pitfalls . ”[211-hadria] It struck both [Hadria]211-hadria and [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister that [the Professor]4071-the professor was looking very ill and worn this evening . “ [You]211-hadria are always giving help and sympathy to [others]432-others , and [you]211-hadria never get any [yourself]211-hadria ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed . But [the Professor]4071-the professor laughed , and asserted that [he]4071-the professor was being spoilt at [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene . [They]2413-they had risen , and were strolling down [the yew avenue]2414-the yew avenue . A little star had twinkled out . “ [I]4071-the professor am very glad to have [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue 's opinion of [your]211-hadria composition , [Hadria]211-hadria . [I]4071-the professor was talking to [him]116-professor fortescue about [you]211-hadria , and [he]116-professor fortescue quite agrees with [me]4071-the professor . ”[4071-the professor] “ What ? that [I]4071-the professor ought to — ? ”[4071-the professor] “ That [you]4071-the professor ought not to go on as [you]4071-the professor are going on at present . ”[4071-the professor] “ But that is so vague . ”[4071-the professor] “ [I]4071-the professor suppose [you]4071-the professor have long ago tried all the devices of self - discipline ? ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ There are ways , of course , of arming [oneself]5751-oneself against minor difficulties , of living within a sort of citadel . Naturally much force has to go in keeping up the defences , but it is better than having none to keep up . ”[4071-the professor] [Hadria]211-hadria gave a quiet smile . “ There is not a method , mental or other , that [I]2416-i have not tried , and tried hard . If it had not been for the sternest self - discipline , [my]2416-i mind at this moment , would be so honeycombed with small pre - occupations ( pleasant and otherwise ) , that it would be incapable of consecutive ideas of any kind . As it is , [I]2416-i feel a miserable number of holes here”—she[2416-i] touched [her]2416-i brow—“a loss of absorbing power , at times , and a mental slackness that is really alarming . What remains of [me]4071-the professor has been dragged ashore as from a wreck , amidst a rush of wind and wave . But just now , thanks greatly to [your]211-hadria sympathy and [Algitha]81-algitha 's , [I]4071-the professor seem restored to [myself]4071-the professor . [I]4071-the professor can never describe the rapture of that sensation to one who has never felt [himself]5751-oneself sinking down and down into darkness , to a dim hell , where the doom is a slow decay instead of the fiery pains of burning . ”[4071-the professor] “ This is all wrong , wrong ! ”[4071-the professor] cried [the Professor]4071-the professor anxiously . “ Ah ! but [I]4071-the professor feel now , such certainty , such courage . It seems as if [Fate]102-fate were giving [me]4071-the professor one more chance . [I]4071-the professor have often run very close to making a definite decision — to dare everything rather than await [this fool]5752-this fool 's disaster . But then comes that everlasting feminine humility , sneaking up with its simper : ‘ Is not this presumptuous , selfish , mistaken , wrong ? What business have [you]211-hadria , one out of so many , to break roughly through the delicate web that has been spun for [your]211-hadria kindly detention ? ’ Of course [my]4071-the professor retort is : ‘ What business have [they]5753-they to spin the web ? ’ But [one]329-one can never get up a real sense of injured innocence . It is always [the spiders who seem injured and innocent]5755-the spiders who seem injured and innocent . However , this time [I]4071-the professor am going to try , though the heavens fall ! ”[4071-the professor] A figure appeared , in the dusk , at the further end of [the avenue]945-the avenue . It proved to be [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , who had come to find [Hadria]211-hadria . [Henriette]142-henriette had arrived unexpectedly by [the late afternoon train]2419-the late afternoon train , and [Valeria]109-valeria had volunteered to announce [her]142-henriette arrival to [[her]142-henriette sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law . “ Ah ! ”[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria , “ heaven helps [him]5756-him who helps [himself]5756-him ! This will fit in neatly with [my]211-hadria plans . ”[211-hadria] [VALERIA DU PREL]109-valeria , finding that [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley proposed a visit of some length , returned to [town]4255-town by [the early morning train]2422-the early morning train . “ [Valeria]109-valeria , do [you]109-valeria know anyone in [Paris]35-paris to whom [you]109-valeria could give [me]211-hadria a letter of introduction ? ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria asked , at the last moment , when there was just time to write the letter , and no more . “ Are [you]109-valeria going to [Paris]35-paris ? ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria asked , startled . “ Please write the letter and [I]109-valeria will tell [you]109-valeria some day what [I]109-valeria want it for . ”[109-valeria] “ Nothing very mad , [I]109-valeria hope ? ”[109-valeria] “ No , only a little — judiciously mad . ”[109-valeria] “ Well , there is [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux , in [the Avenue Kleber]5757-the avenue kleber , but [her]195-madame bertaux [you]109-valeria know already . [She]232-madame vauchelet is about sixty ; [a widow]5760-a widow ; [[her]232-madame vauchelet husband]553-her husband was in the diplomatic service . ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria made these hurried comments while writing the letter . “ [She]232-madame vauchelet is musical too , and will introduce [you]109-valeria , perhaps , to [the great Joubert]233-the great joubert , and [others of that set]5762-others of that set . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria looked rather anxiously at [Hadria]211-hadria and [[her]211-hadria sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law , as [they]2426-they stood on the steps to bid [her]211-hadria good - bye . There was a look of elation mixed with devilry , in [Hadria]211-hadria 's face . [The two figures]450-the two figures turned and entered [the house]296-the house together , as [the pony - cart]4124-the pony - cart passed through the gate . [Hadria]211-hadria always gave [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley much opportunity for the employment of tact , finding this tact more elucidating than otherwise to the designs that it was intended to conceal ; it affected them in the manner of a magnifying - glass . About a couple of years ago , the death of [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother had thrown [Henriette]142-henriette on [her]211-hadria own resources , and set free a large amount of energy that craved a legitimate outlet . [The family with whom [she]211-hadria was now living in [London]8-london , not being related to [her]211-hadria]2431-the family with whom she was now living in london , not being related to her , offered but limited opportunities . [Henriette]142-henriette 's eye was fixed , with increasing fondness , upon [the Red House]4718-the red house . There lay the callow brood marked out by Nature and [man]332-man , for [her]211-hadria ministrations . With infinite adroitness , [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley questioned [[her]141-miss temperley sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law , by inference and suggestion , about the affairs of [the household]2435-the household . [Hadria]211-hadria evaded the attempt , but rejoiced , for reasons of [her]211-hadria own , that it was made . [She]211-hadria began to find the occupation diverting , and characteristically did not hesitate to allow [[her]211-hadria critic]2436-her critic to form most alarming conclusions as to the state of matters at [the Red House]4718-the red house . [She]211-hadria was pensive , and mild , and a little surprised when [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , with a suppressed gasp , urged that the question was deeply serious . It amused [Hadria]211-hadria to reproduce , for [Henriette]142-henriette 's benefit , the theories regarding the treatment and training of [children]626-children that [she]211-hadria had found current among [the mothers of [the district]714-the district]2439-the mothers of the district . [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux happened to call during the afternoon , and [that outspoken lady]2441-that outspoken lady scoffed openly at these theories , declaring that [women]606-women made idiots of [themselves]606-women on behalf of [[their]606-women children]654-their children , whom [they]606-women preposterously ill - used with unflagging devotion . “ The moral training of [young minds]5767-young minds is such a problem , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette , after [the visitor]4013-the visitor had left , “ it must cause [you]211-hadria many an anxious thought . ”[142-henriette] [Hadria]211-hadria arranged [herself]211-hadria comfortably among cushions , and let every muscle relax . “ [The boys]3870-the boys are so young yet , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said drowsily . “ [I]211-hadria have no doubt that will all come , later on . ”[211-hadria] “ But , [[my]142-henriette dear]3722-my dear [Hadria]211-hadria , unless [they]3870-the boys are trained now — ”[142-henriette] “ Oh , there is plenty of time ! ”[211-hadria] “ Do [you]211-hadria mean to say — ? ”[211-hadria] “ Only what [other people]3849-other people say . Nothing in the least original , [I]142-henriette assure [you]211-hadria . [I]142-henriette see the folly and the inconvenience of that now . [I]142-henriette have consulted hoary experience . [I]142-henriette have sat reverently at the feet of [old nurses]5771-old nurses . [I]142-henriette have talked with [mothers]865-mothers in the spirit of [a disciple]5773-a disciple , and [I]142-henriette have learnt , oh , so much ! ”[142-henriette] “ [Mothers]865-mothers are most anxious about the moral training of [[their]865-mothers little ones]5775-their little ones , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette , in some bewilderment . “ Of course , but [they]865-mothers do n't worry about it so early . [One]329-one ca n't expect accomplished morality from [poor little dots of five and six]5777-poor little dots of five and six . The charm of infancy would be gone . ”[142-henriette] [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley explained , remonstrated . [Hadria]211-hadria was limp , docile , unemphatic . Perhaps [Henriette]142-henriette was right , [she]142-henriette did n't know . A sense of honour ? ( [Hadria]211-hadria suppressed a smile . ) Could [one]329-one , after all , expect of six what [one]329-one did not always get at six and twenty ? Morals altogether seemed a good deal to ask of [irresponsible youth]2447-irresponsible youth . [Henriette]142-henriette could not overrate the importance of early familiarity with the difference between right and wrong . Certainly it was important , but [Hadria]211-hadria shrank from an extreme view . [One]329-one must not rush into it without careful thought . “ But meanwhile [the children]667-the children are growing up ! ”[142-henriette] cried [Henriette]142-henriette , in despair . [Hadria]211-hadria had not found that [experienced mothers]2449-experienced mothers laid much stress on that fact . Besides , there was considerable difficulty in the matter . [Henriette]142-henriette did not see it . The difference between right and wrong could easily be taught to [a child]754-a child . Perhaps so , but it seemed to be thought expedient to defer the lesson till the distant future ; at least , if [one]329-one might judge from the literature especially designed for growing minds , wherein clever villainy was exalted , and deeds of ferocious cruelty and revenge occurred as a daily commonplace among [heroes]2452-heroes . The same policy was indicated by the practice of allowing [children]626-children to become familiar with the sight of slaughter , and of violence of every kind towards animals , from earliest infancy . [Hadria]211-hadria concluded from all this , that it was thought wise to postpone the moral training of [the young]2454-the young till a more convenient season . [Henriette]142-henriette looked at [[her]142-henriette sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law , with a sad and baffled mien . [Hadria]211-hadria 's expression was solemn , and as much like that of [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker as [she]211-hadria could make it , without descending to obvious caricature . “ Do [you]142-henriette think it quite wise , [Henriette]142-henriette , to run dead against the customs of ages ? Do [you]142-henriette think it safe to ignore the opinion of [countless generations of those who were older and wiser than [ourselves]5780-ourselves]5779-countless generations of those who were older and wiser than ourselves ? ”[211-hadria] “ Dear [me]141-miss temperley , how [you]142-henriette have changed ! ”[141-miss temperley] cried [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . “ Advancing years ; the sobering effects of experience , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria explained . [She]211-hadria was grieved to find [Henriette]142-henriette at variance with [those who had practical knowledge of education]2456-those who had practical knowledge of education . As [the child]4983-the child grew up , [one]329-one could easily explain to [him]4983-the child that the ideas and impressions that [he]4983-the child might have acquired , in early years , were mostly wrong , and had to be reversed . That was quite simple . Besides , unless [he]4983-the child were [a born idiot of criminal tendencies]2459-a born idiot of criminal tendencies , [he]4983-the child was bound to find it out for [himself]4983-the child . “ But , [[my]211-hadria dear]3722-my dear [Hadria]211-hadria , it is just the early years that are the impressionable years . Nothing can quite erase those first impressions . ”[211-hadria] “ Oh , do [you]211-hadria think so ? ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria mildly . “ Yes , indeed , [I]142-henriette think so , ”[142-henriette] cried [Henriette]142-henriette , losing [her]142-henriette temper . “ Oh , well of course [you]211-hadria may be right . ”[142-henriette] [Hadria]211-hadria had brought out a piece of embroidery ( about ten years old ) , and was working peacefully . On questions of hygiene , [she]211-hadria was equally troublesome . [She]211-hadria had taken hints , [she]211-hadria said , from [mothers of [large families]2461-large families]2460-mothers of large families . [Henriette]142-henriette laid stress upon fresh air , even in [the house]296-the house . [Hadria]211-hadria believed in fresh air ; but was it not going a little far to have it in [the house]296-the house ? [Henriette]142-henriette shook [her]142-henriette head . Fresh air was always necessary . In moderation , perhaps , [Hadria]211-hadria admitted . But the utmost care was called for , to avoid taking cold . [She]211-hadria laid great stress upon that . [Children]626-children were naturally so susceptible . In [all the nurseries that [she]211-hadria had visited]2465-all the nurseries that she had visited , where every possible precaution was taken against draughts , [the children]667-the children were incessantly taking cold . “ Perhaps the precautions made [them]667-the children delicate , ”[142-henriette] [Henriette]142-henriette suggested . But this paradox [Hadria]211-hadria could not entertain . “ Take care of the colds , and the fresh air will take care of itself , ”[211-hadria] was [her]211-hadria general maxim . “ But , [[my]211-hadria dear]3722-my dear [Hadria]211-hadria , do [you]211-hadria mean to tell [me]211-hadria that [the people about here]914-the people about here are so benighted as really not to understand the importance to the system of a constant supply of pure air ? ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria puckered up [her]211-hadria brow , as if in thought . “ Well , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said , “ [several mothers]5784-several mothers have mentioned it , but [they]5784-several mothers take more interest in fluid magnesia and tonics . ”[211-hadria] [Henriette]142-henriette looked dispirited . At any rate , there was no reason why [Hadria]211-hadria should not be more enlightened than [[her]211-hadria neighbours]1818-her neighbours , on these points . [Hadria]211-hadria shook [her]211-hadria head deprecatingly . [She]211-hadria hoped [Henriette]142-henriette would not mind if [she]211-hadria quoted the opinion of [old Mr. Jordan]218-mr. jordan , whose language was sometimes a little strong . [He]218-mr. jordan said that [he]218-mr. jordan did n't believe all that “ damned nonsense about fresh air and drains ! ”[142-henriette] [Henriette]142-henriette coughed . “ It is certainly not safe to trust entirely to [nurses]5785-nurses , however devoted and experienced , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria insisted . [Hadria]211-hadria shrugged [her]211-hadria shoulders . If [the nurse]1797-the nurse did constitutionally enjoy a certain stuffiness in [[her]1797-the nurse nurseries]2469-her nurseries — well [the children]667-the children were out half the day , and it could n't do [them]667-the children much harm . ( [Hadria]211-hadria bent low over [her]211-hadria embroidery . ) The night ? “ Oh ! then [one]329-one must , of course , expect to be a little stuffy . ”[211-hadria] “ But , ”[141-miss temperley] cried [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , almost hopeless , “ impure air breathed , night after night , is an incessant drain on the strength , even if each time it only does a little harm . ”[141-miss temperley] [Hadria]211-hadria smiled over [her]211-hadria silken arabesques . “ Oh , [nobody]3732-nobody ever objects to things that only do a little harm . ”[211-hadria] There was a moment of silence . [Henriette]142-henriette thought that [Hadria]211-hadria must indeed have changed very much during the last years . Well , of course , when very young , [Hadria]211-hadria said , [one]329-one had extravagant notions : one imagined all sorts of wild things about the purposes of the human brain : not till later did [one]329-one realize that [the average brain]2473-the average brain was merely an instrument of adjustment , a sort of spirit - level which enabled its owner to keep accurately in line with [other people]3849-other people . [Henriette]142-henriette ought to rejoice that [Hadria]211-hadria had thus come to bow to the superiority of the collective wisdom . But [Henriette]142-henriette had [her]142-henriette doubts . [Hadria]211-hadria carefully selected a shade of silk , went to the light to reassure [herself]211-hadria of its correctness , and returned to [her]211-hadria easy chair by the fire . [Henriette]142-henriette resumed [her]142-henriette knitting . [She]142-henriette was making stockings for [[her]142-henriette nephews]2475-her nephews . “ [Henriette]142-henriette , do n't [you]142-henriette think it would be rather a good plan if [you]142-henriette were to come and live [here]3762-here and manage affairs — morals , manners , hygiene , and everything ? ”[142-henriette] [Henriette]142-henriette 's needles stopped abruptly , and a wave of colour came into [her]142-henriette face , and a gleam of sudden joy to [her]142-henriette eyes . “ [[My]142-henriette dear]3722-my dear , what do [you]142-henriette mean ? ”[142-henriette] “ [Hubert]118-hubert , of course , would be only too delighted to have [you]142-henriette [here]3762-here , and [I]142-henriette want to go away . ”[142-henriette] “ For heaven 's sake — ”[142-henriette] “ Not exactly for heaven 's sake . For [my]142-henriette own sake , [I]142-henriette suppose : frankly selfish . It is , perhaps , the particular form that [my]142-henriette selfishness takes — an unfortunately conspicuous form . So many of [us]5791-we can have a nice cosy pocket edition that does n't show . However , that 's not the point . [I]142-henriette know [you]142-henriette would be happier doing this than anything else , and that [you]142-henriette would do it perfectly . [You]142-henriette have the kind of talent , if [I]142-henriette may say so , that makes [an admirable ruler]5792-an admirable ruler . When it has a large political field [we]5791-we call it ‘ administrative ability ’ ; when it has a small domestic one , [we]5791-we speak of it as ‘ good housekeeping . ’ It is a precious quality , wherever it appears . [You]142-henriette have no scope for it at present . ”[142-henriette] [Henriette]142-henriette was bewildered , horrified , yet secretly thrilled with joy on [her]142-henriette own account . Was there a quarrel ? Had any cloud come over the happiness of [the home]2476-the home ? [Hadria]211-hadria laughed and assured [her]142-henriette to the contrary . But where was [she]142-henriette going , and for how long ? What did [she]142-henriette intend to do ? Did [Hubert]118-hubert approve ? And could [she]142-henriette bear to be away from [[her]142-henriette children]576-her children ? [Hadria]211-hadria thought this was all beside the point , especially as [the boys]3870-the boys were shortly going to [school]3954-school . The question was , whether [Henriette]142-henriette would take the charge . Certainly , if [Hadria]211-hadria came to any such mad decision , but that , [Henriette]142-henriette hoped , might be averted . What would [people]3687-people say ? Further discussion was checked by a call from [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker , whom [Hadria]211-hadria had the audacity to consult on questions of education and hygiene , leading [her]142-henriette , by dexterous generalship , almost over the same ground that [she]142-henriette had traversed [herself]142-henriette , inducing [the unconscious lady]2481-the unconscious lady to repeat , with amazing accuracy , [Hadria]211-hadria 's own reproduction of local views . “ Now am [I]142-henriette without authority in [my]142-henriette ideas ? ”[142-henriette] [she]142-henriette asked , after [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker had departed . [Henriette]142-henriette had to admit that [she]142-henriette had at least [one supporter]2482-one supporter . “ But [I]142-henriette believe , ”[142-henriette] [she]142-henriette added , “ that [your]211-hadria practice is better than [your]211-hadria preaching . ”[142-henriette] “ It seems to be an ordinance of Nature , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ that these things shall never correspond . ”[211-hadria] [HADRIA]211-hadria said nothing more about [her]211-hadria project , and when [Henriette]142-henriette alluded to it , answered that it was still unfurnished with detail . [She]142-henriette merely wished to know , for certain , [Henriette]142-henriette 's views . [She]142-henriette admitted that there had been some conversation on the subject between [Hubert]118-hubert and [herself]142-henriette , but would give no particulars . [Henriette]142-henriette had to draw [her]142-henriette own conclusions from [Hadria]211-hadria 's haggard looks , and the suppressed excitement of [her]142-henriette manner . [Henriette]142-henriette always made a point of being present when [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue called , as [she]142-henriette did not approve of [his]116-professor fortescue frequent visits . [She]142-henriette noticed that [he]116-professor fortescue gave a slight start when [Hadria]211-hadria entered . In a few days , [she]211-hadria had grown perceptibly thinner . [Her]211-hadria manner was restless . A day or two of rain had prevented the usual walks . When it cleared up again , the season had taken a stride . Still more glorious was the array of tree and flower , and their indescribable freshness suggested the idea that [they]2483-they were bathed in the mysterious elixir of life , and that if one touched [them]2483-they , eternal youth would be the reward . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald gazed at [Hadria]211-hadria with startled and enquiring eyes , when [they]2484-they met again . “ [You]211-hadria look tired , ”[181-professor theobald] [he]181-professor theobald said . “ [I]181-professor theobald am , rather . The spring is always a little trying . ”[181-professor theobald] Especially this spring , [I]0-i find . ” [The gardens of the Priory]2350-the gardens of the priory were now at the very perfection of [their]2350-the gardens of the priory beauty . The supreme moment had come of flowing wealth of foliage and delicate splendour of blossom , yet the paleness of green and tenderness of texture were still there . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald said suddenly , that [Hadria]211-hadria looked as if [she]211-hadria were turning over some project very anxiously in [her]211-hadria mind — a project on which much depended . “[0-i] [You]181-professor theobald are very penetrating , ” [she]0-i replied , after a moment 's hesitation , “[181-professor theobald] that is exactly what [I]0-i am doing . When [I]0-i was [a girl]3734-a girl , [[my]0-i brothers]857-my brothers and [sisters]378-sisters and [I]0-i used to discuss the question of the sovereignty of the will . [Most of [us]2489-us]2488-most of us believed in it devoutly . [We]2489-us regarded circumstance as an annoying trifle , that [no person who respected [himself]2490-no person who respected himself would allow to stand in his way would allow to stand in [his]2490-no person who respected himself would allow to stand in his way way]2490-no person who respected himself would allow to stand in his way . [I]0-i want to try that theory and see what comes of it . ” “[181-professor theobald] [You]181-professor theobald alarm [me]0-i , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . ” “[154-mrs. temperley] Yes , [people]3687-people always do seem to get alarmed when one attempts to put [their]3687-people favourite theories in practice . ” “[3687-people] But really — for [a woman]3753-a woman — ” “[3753-a woman] The sovereignty of the will is a dangerous doctrine ? ” “[3753-a woman] Well , as things are ; [a young woman]926-a young woman , [a beautiful woman]2494-a beautiful woman . ” “[2494-a beautiful woman] [You]181-professor theobald recall an interesting memory , ” [she]154-mrs. temperley said . “[2494-a beautiful woman] Ah , that is unkind . ” [Her]154-mrs. temperley smile checked [him]181-professor theobald . “[2494-a beautiful woman] When [you]181-professor theobald fall into a mocking humour , [you]181-professor theobald are quite impracticable . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i merely smiled , ” [she]154-mrs. temperley said , “[0-i] sweetly , as [I]0-i thought . ” “[0-i] It is really cruel ; [I]0-i have not had a word with [you]181-professor theobald for days , and [the universe]420-the universe has become [a wilderness]2496-a wilderness . ” “[0-i] [A pleasant wilderness]2497-a pleasant wilderness , ” [she]154-mrs. temperley observed , looking round . “[0-i] Nature is a delightful background , but a poor subject . ” “[181-professor theobald] Do [you]181-professor theobald think so ? [I]0-i often fancy [one]329-one 's general outlook would be nicer , if one had an indistinct human background and a clear foreground of unspoiled Nature . But that may be a jaundiced view . ” [Hadria]211-hadria went off to meet [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , who was coming down [the avenue]945-the avenue with [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald instinctively began to follow and then stopped , reddening , as [he]181-professor theobald met the glance of [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . [He]181-professor theobald flung [himself]181-professor theobald into conversation with [her]141-miss temperley , and became especially animated when [he]181-professor theobald was passing [Hadria]211-hadria , who did not appear to notice [him]181-professor theobald . As [both Professors]5381-both professors were to leave [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene at the end of the week , this was the last meeting in [the Priory gardens]5796-the priory gardens . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley found [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald entertaining , but at times a little incoherent . “[181-professor theobald] Why , there is [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria ! ” exclaimed [Henriette]142-henriette . “[109-valeria] What [an erratic person]2499-an erratic person [she]109-valeria is . [She]109-valeria went to [London]8-london the day before yesterday , and now [she]109-valeria turns up suddenly without a word of warning . ” This confirmed [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald 's suspicions that something serious was going on at [the Red House]4718-the red house . [Valeria]109-valeria explained [her]109-valeria return to [Hadria]211-hadria , by saying that [she]109-valeria had felt so nervous about what [the latter]590-the latter might be going to attempt , that [she]109-valeria had come back to see if [she]109-valeria could be of help , or able to ward off any rash adventure . There was a pleasant open space among [the shrubberies]5799-the shrubberies , where several seats had been placed to command a dainty view of [the garden]3867-the garden and lawns , with [the house]296-the house in the distance , and here [the party]428-the party gradually converged , in desultory fashion , coming up and strolling off again , as the fancy inspired [them]428-the party . Cigars were lighted , and a sense of sociability and enjoyment suffused itself , like a perfume , among [the group]941-the group . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was delighted to see [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria again . [She]176-lady engleton did so want to continue the hot discussion [they]2500-they were having at [the Red House]4718-the red house that afternoon , when [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert would be so horridly logical . [He]118-hubert smiled and twisted [his]118-hubert moustache . “[109-valeria] [We]2500-they were interrupted by [some caller]2501-some caller , and had to leave the argument at a most exciting moment . ” “[2501-some caller] An eternally interesting subject ! ” said [Temperley]154-mrs. temperley ; “[3844-woman] what [woman]3844-woman is , what [she]3844-woman is not . ” “[3844-woman] [My]0-i dread is that presently , the need for dissimulation being over , all the delightful mystery will have vanished , ” said [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . “[0-i] [I]0-i should tire , in a day , of [a woman [I]0-i could understand]2503-a woman i could understand . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i tempt one to enquire the length of the reign of [a satisfactory enigma]2504-a satisfactory enigma , ” cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[3844-woman] Precisely the length of [her]3844-woman ability to mystify [me]0-i , ” [he]181-professor theobald replied . “[3844-woman] [[Your]0-i future wife]2505-your future wife ought to be given a hint . ” “[2505-your future wife] Oh ! [a wife]1373-a wife , in no case , could hold [me]0-i : the mere fact that it was [my]0-i duty to adore [her]1373-a wife , would be chilling . And when added to that , [I]0-i knew that [she]1373-a wife had placed it among the list of [her]1373-a wife obligations to adore [me]0-i — well , that would be the climax of disenchantment . ” [Hubert]118-hubert commended [his]118-hubert wisdom in not marrying . “[1373-a wife] [The only person]2507-the only person [I]0-i could conceivably marry would be [[my]0-i cook]2014-my cook ; in that case there would be no romance to spoil , no vision to destroy . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i fear this is a cloak for a poor opinion of [our]2509-our sex , [Professor]1240-professor . ” “[1240-professor] On the contrary . [I]0-i admire [your]0-i sex too much to think of subjecting [them]2511-them to such an ordeal . [I]0-i could not endure to regard [a woman [I]0-i had once admired , as a matter of course , a commonplace in [my]0-i existence]2512-a woman i had once admired , as a matter of course , a commonplace in my existence . ” [Henriette]142-henriette plunged headlong into the fray , in opposition to [the Professor]4071-the professor 's heresy . The conversation became general . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald fell out of it . [He]181-professor theobald was furtively watching [Hadria]211-hadria , whose eyes were strangely bright . [She]211-hadria was sitting on the arm of a seat , listening to the talk , with a little smile on [her]211-hadria lips . [Her]211-hadria hand clasped the back of the seat rigidly , as if [she]211-hadria were holding something down . The qualities and defects of [the female character]5806-the female character were frankly canvassed , each view being held with fervour , but expressed with urbanity . [Women]606-women were always so and so ; [women]606-women were absolutely never so and so : [women]606-women felt , without exception , thus and thus ; on the contrary , [they]606-women were entirely devoid of such sentiments . A large experience and wide observation always supported each opinion , and [eminent authorities]5810-eminent authorities swarmed to the standard . “[0-i] [I]0-i do think that [women]606-women want breadth of view , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[606-women] [They]606-women sometimes want accuracy of statement , ” observed [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald , with a possible second meaning in [his]181-professor theobald words . “[606-women] It seems to [me]0-i [they]606-women lack concentration . [They]606-women are too versatile , ” was [Hubert]118-hubert 's comment . “[606-women] [They]606-women want a sense of honour , ” was asserted . “[606-women] And a sense of humour , ” [some one]3818-some one added . “[606-women] [They]606-women want a feeling of public duty . ” “[606-women] [They]606-women want a spice of [the Devil]1352-the devil ! ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria . There was a laugh . [Hubert]118-hubert thought this was a lack not likely to be felt for very long . [It]5812-it was under rapid process of cultivation . “[1352-the devil] Why , it is a commonplace , that if [a woman]3753-a woman is bad , [she]3753-a woman is always very bad , ” cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[3753-a woman] A new and intoxicating experience , ” said [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . “[0-i] [I]0-i sympathize . ” “[0-i] New ? ” [[his]116-professor fortescue colleague]1971-his colleague murmured , with a faint chuckle . “[0-i] [You]2516-you distress [me]0-i , ” said [Henriette]142-henriette . [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue held that [woman]3844-woman 's “[2516-you] goodness ” had done as much harm in [the world]334-the world as [men]3698-men 's badness . [The one]5817-the one was merely the obverse of the other . “[0-i] This is strange teaching ! ” cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . [The Professor]4071-the professor reminded [her]176-lady engleton that truth was always stranger than fiction . “[0-i] To [the best men]2517-the best men , ” observed [Valeria]109-valeria , “[606-women] [women]606-women show all [their]606-women meanest qualities . It is the fatality of [their]606-women training . ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had noted the same trait in other subject races . “[606-women] Pray , do n't call [us]2519-us [a subject race]2520-a subject race ! ” remonstrated [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[2520-a subject race] Ah , yes , the truth , ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “[2520-a subject race] [we]2519-us starve for the truth . ” “[2520-a subject race] [You]2521-you are courageous , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . ” “[154-mrs. temperley] Like [the Lady of Shallott]2522-the lady of shallott , [I]0-i am sick of shadows . ” “[0-i] The bare truth , on this subject , is hard for [a woman]3753-a woman to face . ” “[3753-a woman] It is harder , in the long run , to waltz eternally round it with averted eyes . ” “[3753-a woman] But , dear [me]0-i , why is the truth about [ourselves]2519-us hard to face ? ” demanded [Valeria]109-valeria . “[0-i] [I]0-i am placed between the horns of a dilemma : [one lady]2524-one lady clamours for the bare truth : another forbids [me]0-i to say anything unpleasing . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i withdraw [my]0-i objection , ” [Valeria]109-valeria offered . “[0-i] The ungracious task shall not be forced upon unwilling chivalry , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] If [our]2519-us conditions have been evil , some scars must be left and may as well be confessed . Among the faults of [women]606-women , [I]0-i should place a tendency to trade upon and abuse real chivalry and generosity when [they]2526-they meet [them]2526-they : a survival perhaps from the Stone Age , when [the fittest to bully]2527-the fittest to bully were [the surviving elect of society]2528-the surviving elect of society . ” [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes sparkled with suppressed excitement . “[2531-you] Freedom alone teaches [us]2519-us to meet generosity , generously , ” said [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue ; “[2529-you] [you]2529-you ca n't get the perpendicular virtues out of any but [the really free - born]2530-the really free - born . ” “[2529-you] Then do [you]2531-you describe [women]606-women 's virtues as horizontal ? ” enquired [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , half resentfully . “[2531-you] In so far as [they]606-women follow the prevailing models . [Women]606-women 's love , friendship , duty , the conduct of life as a whole , speaking very roughly , has been lacking in the quality that [I]0-i call perpendicular ; a quality implying something more than upright . ” “[2531-you] [You]2531-you seem to value but lightly [the woman]4547-the woman 's acknowledged readiness for self - sacrifice , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[2531-you] That , [I]0-i suppose , is only a despised horizontal virtue . ” “[3753-a woman] Very frequently . ” “[3753-a woman] Because it is generally more or less abject , ” [Hadria]211-hadria put in . “[3753-a woman] The sacrifice is made because [the woman]4547-the woman is [a woman]3753-a woman . It is the obeisance of sex ; the acknowledgment of servility ; not a simple desire of service . ” “[2537-the adorable creature] [The adorable creature]2537-the adorable creature is not always precisely obeisant , ” observed [Theobald]181-professor theobald . “[2537-the adorable creature] No ; as [I]0-i say , [she]2537-the adorable creature may be capricious and cruel enough to those who treat [her]2537-the adorable creature justly and generously ” ( [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes instinctively turned towards [the distant Priory]31-the priory , and [Valeria]109-valeria 's followed [them]5819-them ) ; “[2537-the adorable creature] but ask [her]2537-the adorable creature to sacrifice [herself]2537-the adorable creature for nothing ; ask [her]2537-the adorable creature to cherish the selfishness of [some bully or fool]2538-some bully or fool ; assure [her]2537-the adorable creature that it is [her]2537-the adorable creature duty to waste [her]2537-the adorable creature youth , lose [her]2537-the adorable creature health , and stultify [her]2537-the adorable creature mind , for the sake of [somebody]891-somebody 's whim , or [somebody]891-somebody 's fears , or [somebody]891-somebody 's absurdity , then [she]2537-the adorable creature needs no persuasion . [She]2537-the adorable creature goes to the stake smiling . [She]2537-the adorable creature swears the flames are comfortably warm , no more . Are they diminishing [her]2537-the adorable creature in size ? Oh no — not at all — besides [she]2537-the adorable creature was rather large , for [a woman]3753-a woman . [She]2537-the adorable creature smiles encouragement to [the other chained figures]2543-the other chained figures , at the other stakes . [Her]2537-the adorable creature reward ? [She]2537-the adorable creature has done [her]2537-the adorable creature duty , and sent [half a dozen souls]2545-half a dozen souls to hell ! ” [Henriette]142-henriette uttered a little cry . “[2537-the adorable creature] Where [one]329-one expects to meet [her]2537-the adorable creature ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria added . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald was chuckling gleefully . [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes kindled . “[2548-our nice , well - behaved , average woman] Yes , it is like wine ; clear , intoxicating sparkling wine , and its fumes are mounting ! Why does civilisation never provide for these moments ? ” “[154-mrs. temperley] What would [you]154-mrs. temperley have ? A modified feast of [Dionysius]236-dionysius ? ” “[236-dionysius] Why not ? [The whole earth]4382-the whole earth joins in the festival and sings , except [mankind]1102-mankind . Some frolic of music and a stirring dance!—But ah ! [I]0-i suppose , in [this tamed [England]14-england of [ours]2547-we]2551-this tamed england of ours , [we]2547-we should feel it artificial ; [we]2547-we should fear to let [ourselves]2547-we go . [She]197-helen revolted against the tyranny that held [her]197-helen shut in , enslaved , body and soul , in [that wonderful Greek world of [hers]197-helen]2565-that wonderful greek world of hers .
