It was at [his]553-her husband door that the siege of [Troy]37-troy ought to be laid . [I]0-i only wish elopements always caused as much commotion ! ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton laughed , and [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley tried to catch [Hadria]211-hadria 's eye . “[2568-you] Well , that is a strange idea ! And do [you]2568-you really think [Helen]197-helen did not sin ? Seriously now . ” “[2568-you] [I]0-i do n't know . There is no evidence on that point . ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton laughed again . “[2568-you] [You]2568-you do amuse [me]0-i . Assuming that [Helen]197-helen did not sin , [I]0-i suppose [you]2568-you would ( if only for the sake of paradox ) accuse [the virtuous Greek matrons]2569-the virtuous greek matrons — who sat at [home]3770-home , and wove , and span , and bore [children]626-children — of sinning against the State ! ” “[2569-the virtuous greek matrons] Certainly , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , undismayed . “[2569-the virtuous greek matrons] It was [they]2569-the virtuous greek matrons who insidiously prepared the doom for [[their]2569-the virtuous greek matrons country]2572-their country , as [they]2569-the virtuous greek matrons wove and span and bore [children]626-children , with stupid docility . As surely as [an enemy]2574-an enemy might undermine the foundations of [a city]2575-a city till it fell in with a crash , so surely [they]2574-an enemy brought ruin upon [Greece]47-greece . ” “[2574-an enemy] Oh , [Hadria]211-hadria , [you]211-hadria are quite beside [yourself]211-hadria to - day ! ” cried [Henriette]142-henriette . “[211-hadria] A love of paradox will lead [you]211-hadria far ! ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[211-hadria] [We]2576-we have always been taught to think [a nation]2577-a nation sound and safe whose [women]606-women were docile and domestic . ” “[211-hadria] What nation , under those conditions , has ever failed to fall in with a mighty crash , like [[my]0-i undermined city]2579-my undermined city ? [Greece]47-greece [herself]47-greece could not hold out . Ah , yes ; [we]2576-we have [our]2576-we revenge ! a sweet , sweet revenge ! ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was looking much amused and a little dismayed , when [she]176-lady engleton and [[her]176-lady engleton companions]5823-her companions rejoined [the party]428-the party . “[0-i] [I]0-i never heard [anyone]806-anyone say so many dreadful things in so short a space of time , ” [she]0-i cried . “[211-hadria] [You]211-hadria are distinctly shocking . ” “[211-hadria] [I]0-i am frank , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i fancy [we]2576-we should all go about with [our]2576-we hair permanently on end , if [we]2576-we spoke out in chorus . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't quite like to hear [you]211-hadria say that , [Hadria]211-hadria . ” “[211-hadria] [I]0-i mean no harm — merely that [every one]913-every one thinks thoughts and feels impulses that would be startling if expressed in speech . Do n't [we]2576-we all know how terrifying a thing speech is , and thought ? [a chartered libertine]2582-a chartered libertine . ” “[2582-a chartered libertine] Why , [you]211-hadria are saying almost exactly what [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald said the other day , and [we]2576-we were so shocked . ” “[181-professor theobald] And yet [my]0-i meaning has scarcely any relation to [his]181-professor theobald , ” [Hadria]211-hadria hastened to say . “[181-professor theobald] [He]181-professor theobald meant to drag down all belief in goodness by reminding [us]2576-we of dark moments and hours ; by placarding the whole soul with the name of some shadow that moves across it , [I]0-i sometimes think from [another world]2583-another world , some deep under - world that yawns beneath [us]2576-we and sends up blackness and fumes and strange cries . ” [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes had wandered far away . “[0-i] Are [you]211-hadria never tormented by an idea , an impression that [you]211-hadria know does not belong to [you]211-hadria ? ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton gave a startled negative . “[0-i] [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , come and tell [me]0-i what [you]116-professor fortescue think of this strange doctrine ? ” “[116-professor fortescue] If [we]2576-we had to be judged by [our]2576-we freedom from rushes of evil impulse , rather than by [our]2576-we general balance of good and evil wishing , [I]0-i think those would come out best , [who had fewest thoughts and feelings of any kind to record]2584-who had fewest thoughts and feelings of any kind to record . ” [The subject]5825-the subject attracted [a small group]934-a small group . “[0-i] Unless goodness is only a negative quality , ” [Valeria]109-valeria pointed out , “[0-i] a mere absence , it must imply a soul that lives and struggles , and if it lives and struggles , it is open to the assaults of the devil . ” “[329-one] Yes , and it is liable to go under too sometimes , [one]329-one must not forget , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[329-one] although [most people]4077-most people profess to believe so firmly in the triumph of the best — how [I]0-i ca n't conceive , since the common life of every day is an incessant harping on the moral : [the smallest , meanest , poorest , thinnest , vulgarest qualities in]2587-the smallest , meanest , poorest , thinnest , vulgarest qualities in [man]332-man and [woman]3844-woman are those selected for survival , in the struggle for existence . ” There was a cry of remonstrance from [idealists]5827-idealists . “[0-i] But what else do [we]2576-we mean when [we]2576-we talk by common consent of [the world]334-the world 's baseness , harshness , vulgarity , injustice ? It means surely — and think of it!—that it is composed of [men]3698-men and [women]606-women with the best of [them]2593-them killed out , as a nerve burnt away by acid ; a heart won over to meaner things than it set out beating for ; a mind persuaded to nibble at edges of dry crust that might have grown stout and serviceable on generous diet , and mellow and inspired with noble vintage . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i really are shockingly Bacchanalian to - day , ” cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . [Hadria]211-hadria laughed . “[0-i] Metaphorically , [I]0-i am [a toper]2594-a toper . The wonderful clear sparkle , the subtle flavour , the brilliancy of wine , has for [me]0-i a strange fascination ; it seems to signify so much in life that [women]606-women lose . ” “[0-i] True . What beverage should one take as a type of what [they]2596-they gain by the surrender ? ” asked [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , who was disposed to hang back towards orthodoxy , in the presence of [[her]176-lady engleton uncompromising neighbour]5828-her uncompromising neighbour . “[0-i] Oh , toast and water ! ” replied [Hadria]211-hadria . THE speed was glorious . Back flashed [field]5829-field and hill and copse , and the dear “[0-i] companionable hedgeways . ” Back flew iterative telegraph posts with Herculean swing , into the Past , looped together in rhythmic movement , marking the pulses of old Time . On , with rack and roar , into the mysterious Future . [One]329-one could sit at the window and watch the machinery of Time 's foundry at work ; the hammers of [his]329-one forge beating , beating , the wild sparks flying , the din and chaos whirling round one 's bewildered brain;—Past becoming Present , Present melting into Future , before [one]329-one 's eyes . To sit and watch the whirring wheels ; to think “[0-i] Now it is thus and thus ; presently , another slice of earth and sky awaits [me”—ye Gods]239-me”—ye gods , it is not to be realized ! The wonder of [the flying land]5832-the flying land — [England]14-england , [England]14-england with [[her]14-england gentle homesteads]5833-her gentle homesteads , [[her]14-england people of [the gentle voices]5835-the gentle voices]5834-her people of the gentle voices ; and [the unknown wonder of [that other land]5837-that other land]5836-the unknown wonder of that other land , soon to change [its]5837-that other land exquisite dream - features for the still more thrilling , appealing marvel of reality — could it all be true ? Was this the response of [the genius of the ring]5838-the genius of the ring , the magic ring that [we]5839-we call will ? And would [the complaisant genius]5840-the complaisant genius always appear and obey [one]329-one 's behests , in this strange fashion ? Thoughts ran on rhythmically , in the steady , flashing movement through verdant [England]14-england . The Real ! that was the truly exquisite , the truly great , the true realm of the imagination ! What imagination was ever born to conceive or compass it ? A rattle under [a bridge]5842-a bridge , a roar through [a tunnel]5843-a tunnel , and on again , through [Kentish orchards]5844-kentish orchards . A time of blossoming . Disjointed , delicious impressions followed one another in swift succession , often superficially incoherent , but threaded deep , in the stirred consciousness , on a silver cord:—the unity of the creation was as obvious as its multiplicity . Images of the Past joined hands with visions of [the Future]48-the future . In [these sweet green meadows]5845-these sweet green meadows , [men]3698-men had toiled , as thralls , but a few lifetimes ago , and [they]3698-men had gathered together , as [Englishmen]5847-englishmen do , first to protest and reasonably demand , and then to buy [their]3698-men freedom with [their]3698-men lives . [[Their]3698-men country - woman]5848-their country - woman sent a message of thanksgiving , backward through the centuries , to [these stout champions of [the land]5850-the land 's best heritage]5849-these stout champions of the land 's best heritage , and breathed an aspiration to be worthy of the kinship that [she]5848-their country - woman claimed . The rattle and roar grew into a symphony — full , rich , magnificent , and then , with a rush , came a stirring musical conception : it seized the imagination . Oh , why were [they]3698-men stopping ? It was [a little country station]5851-a little country station , but [many passengers]5852-many passengers were on [the platform]3895-the platform . [A careworn looking woman]5854-a careworn looking woman and [a little girl]1940-a little girl entered [the carriage]2272-the carriage , and [the little girl]5857-the little girl fixed [her]5857-the little girl eyes on [[her]5857-the little girl fellow - traveller]5858-her fellow - traveller with singular persistence . Then the more practical features of the occasion came into view , and all had an enthralling quality of reality — poetry . The sound of the waiting engine breathing out its white smoke into the brilliant air , [the powerful creature quiescent but ready , with the turn of a handle , to put forth its slumbering might]5859-the powerful creature quiescent but ready , with the turn of a handle , to put forth its slumbering might ; the crunching of footsteps on the gravel , the wallflowers and lilacs in [the little station garden]5860-the little station garden , the blue of the sky , and ah ! the sweetness of the air when one leant out to look along the interminable straight line of rails , leading — whither ? Even the very details of [one]329-one 's travelling gear : the tweed gown meet for service , the rug and friendly umbrella , added to the feeling of overflowing satisfaction . [The little girl]5857-the little girl stared more fixedly than ever . A smile and the offer of a flower made [her]5857-the little girl look down , for a minute , but the gaze was resumed . Wherefore ? Was the inward tumult too evident in the face ? Well , no matter . [The world]334-the world was beautiful and wide ! [The patient monster]5864-the patient monster began to move again , with a gay whistle , as if [he]5864-the patient monster enjoyed this chase across [country]4087-country , on the track of Time . [He]5864-the patient monster was soon at full speed again , on [his]5864-the patient monster futile race : [a hapless idealist in pursuit of lost dreams]5866-a hapless idealist in pursuit of lost dreams . [The little girl]5857-the little girl watched the dawn of a smile on the face of [the kind , pretty lady who had given [her]5857-the little girl the flower]5868-the kind , pretty lady who had given her the flower . [A locomotive]5869-a locomotive figuring as [an idealist]5870-an idealist ! Where would [one]329-one 's fancy lead one to next ? Ah [the sea]1589-the sea ! heaving busily , and flashing under the morning radiance . Would [they]5873-they have a good crossing ? The wind was fresh . How dreamy and bright and windy [the country]401-the country looked , and how salt was the sea - breeze ! Very soon [they]5873-they would arrive at [Folkestone]49-folkestone . Rugs and umbrellas and hand - bags must be collected . The simple , solid commonplace of it all , touched some wholesome spring of delight . What a speed [the train]3892-the train was going at ! [One]329-one could scarcely stand in [the jolting carriage]5877-the jolting carriage . [Old Time]240-old time must not make too sure of [his]329-one victory . [One]241-one felt a wistful partisanship for [[his]329-one snorting rival]5878-his snorting rival , striving for ever to accomplish the impossible . [The labouring visionary]5879-the labouring visionary was not without significance to [aspiring mortals]5880-aspiring mortals . [The outskirts of [the town]5882-the town]5881-the outskirts of the town were coming in sight ; [grey houses bleakly climbing chalky heights]5883-grey houses bleakly climbing chalky heights . It would be well to put on a thick overcoat at once . It was certain to be cold in [the Channel]50-the channel . Luckily [Hannah]212-hannah had a head on [her]212-hannah shoulders , and could be trusted to follow the directions that had been given [her]212-hannah . The last five minutes seemed interminable , but they did come to an end . There was an impression of sweet salt air , of wind and voices , of [a hurrying crowd]5884-a hurrying crowd ; occasionally a French sentence pronounced by [one of [the officials]5886-the officials]5885-one of the officials , reminiscent of a thousand dreams and sights of [foreign lands]5887-foreign lands ; and then [the breezy quay and waiting steamboat]5888-the breezy quay and waiting steamboat . The sound of that quiet , purposeful hiss of the steam sent a thrill along the nerves . [Hannah]212-hannah and [[her]212-hannah charge]5889-her charge were safely on board ; [the small luggage]5890-the small luggage followed , and lastly [Hadria]211-hadria traversed [the narrow bridge]5891-the narrow bridge , wondering when the moment would arrive for waking up and finding [herself]211-hadria in [[her]211-hadria little bedroom at [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene]5892-her little bedroom at craddock dene ? What was [she]211-hadria thinking of ? Dream ? This was no dream , [this bold , blue , dancing water]5893-this bold , blue , dancing water , this living sunshine , this salt and savour and movement and brilliancy ! The other was the dream ; it seemed to be drifting away already . The picture of [the village]1124-the village and [the house]296-the house and [the meadows]5896-the meadows , and [the low line of [the hills]413-the hills]5897-the low line of the hills was recalled as through a veil ; it would not stand up and face the emphatic present . At the end of a few months , would there be anything left of [her]211-hadria connexion with [the place where [she]211-hadria had passed six — seven years of [her]211-hadria life]5899-the place where she had passed six — seven years of her life ? and such years ! [They]5900-they had put scars on [her]211-hadria soul , as deep and ghastly as ever red - hot irons had marked on tortured flesh . Perhaps it was because of this rabid agony undergone , that now [she]211-hadria seemed to have scarcely any clinging to [her]211-hadria home,—for the present at any rate . And [she]211-hadria knew that [she]211-hadria left only sorrow for conventional disasters behind [her]211-hadria . The joy of freedom and its intoxication drowned every other feeling . It was sheer relief to be away , to stretch [oneself]5901-oneself in mental liberty and leisure , to look round at earth and sky and [the hurrying crowds]5902-the hurrying crowds , in quiet enjoyment ; to possess [one]329-one 's days , [one]329-one 's existence for the first time , in all these long years ! It was as the home - coming of [a dispossessed heir]5905-a dispossessed heir . This freedom did not strike [her]211-hadria as strange , but as obvious , as familiar . It was the first condition of a life that was worth living . And yet never before had [she]211-hadria known it . [Ernest]86-ernest and [Fred]83-fred and even [Austin]84-austin had enjoyed it from boyhood , and in far greater completeness than [she]211-hadria could ever hope to possess it , even now . Yet even this limited , this comparative freedom , which [a man]3704-a man could afford to smile at , was intoxicating . Heavens ! under what a leaden cloud of little obligations and restraints , and loneliness and pain , [she]211-hadria had been living ! And for what purpose ? To make obeisance to [a phantom public]5907-a phantom public , not because [she]211-hadria cared one iota for the phantom or its opinions , but because [husband]1286-husband and [parents]620-parents and [relations]5910-relations were terrified at the prospect of a few critical and disapproving remarks , that [they]5907-a phantom public would not even hear ! How mad it all was ! It was not true feeling , not affection , that prompted [Hubert]118-hubert 's opposition ; it was not care for [his]118-hubert real happiness that inspired [Henriette]142-henriette with such ardour in this cause ; [they]5911-they would both be infinitely happier and more harmonious in [Hadria]211-hadria 's absence . The whole source of [their]5911-they distress was the fear of what [people]3687-people would say when the separation became known to [the world]334-the world . That was the beginning and the end of the matter . Why could not [the stupid old world]5914-the stupid old world mind [its]5914-the stupid old world own business , in heaven 's name ? [Good people]5554-good people , especially [good women of the old type]5916-good women of the old type , would all counsel the imbecile sacrifice . [They]5554-good people would all condemn this step . Indeed , the sacrifice that [Hadria]211-hadria had refused to make , was so common , so much a matter of course , that [her]211-hadria refusal appeared startling and preposterous : scarcely less astonishing than if [a neighbour at dinner]5917-a neighbour at dinner , requesting [one]329-one to pass the salt , had been met with a rude “[0-i] [I]0-i sha n't . ” “[0-i] A useful phrase at times , of the nature of a tonic , amidst [our]2597-our enervating civilisation , ” [she]211-hadria reflected . There was a tramping of [passengers]5919-passengers up and down [the deck]5920-the deck . [People]3687-people walked obliquely , with head to windward . [Only two ladies who had abandoned hope from the beginning]5922-only two ladies who had abandoned hope from the beginning , suffered from the crossing . [The coast of [France]44-france]5928-the coast of france had become clear , some time ago ; [they]2599-we were making the passage very quickly to - day . Presently , [the boat]5930-the boat had arrived in [the bright old town]5931-the bright old town , and every detail of outline and colour was standing forth brilliantly , as if the whole scene had been just washed over with clear water and all the tints were wet . The first impression was keen . The innumerable differences from English forms and English tones sprang to the eye . A whiff of foreign smell and a sound of foreign speech reached [the passengers]5932-the passengers at about the same moment . [The very houses]5933-the very houses looked unfamiliarly built , and even the letters of printed names of [hotels and shops]5934-hotels and shops had a frivolous , spindly appearance — elegant but frail . The air was different from English air . Some bouillon and a slice of fowl were very acceptable at [the restaurant at [the station]3893-the station]5935-the restaurant at the station , after the business of examining the luggage was over . [Hannah]212-hannah , evidently nourishing a sense of injury against [the natives]5937-the natives for [their]5937-the natives eccentric jargon , and against [the universe]420-the universe for the rush and discomfort of the last quarter of an hour , was disposed to express [her]212-hannah feelings by a marked lack of relish for [her]212-hannah food . [The child , who had become accustomed to the noise and movement]5944-the child , who had become accustomed to the noise and movement , behaved better than had been expected . [Hannah]212-hannah was much struck with this sign of awakening intelligence . It was more than [the good nurse]5945-the good nurse showed [herself]212-hannah . [She]212-hannah scarcely condescended to glance at the panorama of [French fields]5946-french fields , [French hills]5947-french hills and streams that were rushing by . How pale and ethereal [they]5948-they were , these Gallic coppices and woodlands ! And with what a dainty lightness the foliage spread itself to the sun , French to its graceful finger - tips ! [That grey old house , with high lichen - stained roof and narrow windows — where but in sunny [France]44-france]5949-that grey old house , with high lichen - stained roof and narrow windows — where but in sunny france could one see [its]5949-that grey old house , with high lichen - stained roof and narrow windows — where but in sunny france like?—and [the little farmsteads]5950-the little farmsteads and [villages]5951-villages , full of indescribable charm . [One]329-one felt [oneself]329-one in [a land of [artists]5954-artists]5953-a land of artists . There was no inharmonious , no unfitting thing anywhere . [Man]242-man had wedded [himself]242-man to [Nature]120-nature , and [his]242-man works seemed to receive [her]120-nature seal and benediction . English landscape was beautiful , and it had a particular charm to be found nowhere else in [the world]334-the world ; but in revenge , there was something here that [England]14-england could not boast . Was it fanciful to see in the characteristics of vegetation and scenery , the origin or expression of the difference of the two races at their greatest ? “[2601-the babies] Ah , if [I]0-i were only [a painter]2603-a painter ! ” [They]5956-they were passing [some fields]5957-some fields where , in the slanting rays of the sun , [peasants in blue blouses]5958-peasants in blue blouses and [several women]5959-several women were bending over [their]5958-peasants in blue blouses toil . It was a subject often chosen by [French artists]5960-french artists . [Hadria]211-hadria understood why . [One of [the labourers]5962-the labourers]5961-one of the labourers stood watching [the train]3892-the train , and [she]211-hadria let [her]211-hadria eyes rest on [the patient figure]5964-the patient figure till [she]211-hadria was carried beyond [[his]5961-one of the labourers little world]5965-his little world . What was [he]5961-one of the labourers thinking , [that toil - bent peasant]5968-that toil - bent peasant , as [the train]3892-the train flashed by ? What tragedy or comedy was [he]5961-one of the labourers playing on [[his]5961-one of the labourers rural stage]5970-his rural stage ? [Hadria]211-hadria sat down and shut [her]211-hadria eyes , dazzled by the complex mystery and miracle of life , and almost horrified at the overwhelming thought of the millions of these obscure human lives burning [themselves]2605-themselves out , everywhere , at every instant , like so many altar - candles to [the unknown God]5971-the unknown god ! “[2605-themselves] And [each one of [them]2605-themselves]2604-each one of them takes [himself]2604-each one of them as seriously as [I]0-i take [myself]0-i : perhaps more seriously . Ah , if [one]329-one could but pause to smile at one 's tragic moments , or still better , at one 's sublime ones . But it ca n't be done . [A remembrancer]2607-a remembrancer would have to be engaged , to prevent lapses into the sublime,—and how furious [one]329-one would be when [he]2607-a remembrancer nudged [one]329-one , with [his]2607-a remembrancer eternal : ‘ Beware ! ’ ” It was nearly eight o'clock when [the train]3892-the train plunged among the myriad lights of [the great city]5973-the great city . The brilliant beacon of [the Eiffel Tower]53-the eiffel tower sat high up in the sky , like an exile star . Gaunt and grim was [the vast station]5974-the vast station , with [its]5974-the vast station freezing purplish electric light . Yet even [here]3762-here , to [Hadria]211-hadria 's stirred imagination , there was a certain quality in [the Titanic building]5976-the titanic building , which removed [it]5976-the titanic building from the vulgarity of English utilitarian efforts of the same order . In a fanciful mood , one might imagine a tenth circle of the Inferno , wherein those stern grey arches should loftily rise , in blind and endless sequence , limbing an abode of horror , a place of punishment for [those , empty - hearted , who had lived without colour and sunshine , in voluntary abnegation , caring only for gain and success]5977-those , empty - hearted , who had lived without colour and sunshine , in voluntary abnegation , caring only for gain and success . The long delay in the examination of the luggage , the fatigue of the journey , tended to increase the disposition to regard [the echoing edifice]5978-the echoing edifice , with [its]5974-the vast station cold hollow reverberations , as a Circle of [the Doomed]54-the doomed . It was as if [they]3892-the train passed from [the realm of [the Shades]55-the shades]5979-the realm of the shades through [the Gates of Life]56-the gates of life , when at length [the cab]5980-the cab rattled out of [the courtyard of [the station]3893-the station]5981-the courtyard of the station , and turned leftwards into [the brilliant streets of [Paris]35-paris]5983-the brilliant streets of paris . It was hard to realize that all this stir and light and life had been going on night after night , for all these years , during which [one]329-one had sat in [the quiet drawing - room at [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene]5985-the quiet drawing - room at craddock dene , trying wistfully , hopelessly , to grasp the solid fact of [an unknown vast reality]5986-an unknown vast reality , through a record here and there . The journey was a long one to [the Rue Boissy d'Anglas]5987-the rue boissy d'anglas , but tired as [she]5988-she was , [Hadria]211-hadria did not wish it shorter . Even [Hannah]212-hannah was interested in [the brilliantly lighted shops and cafés]5989-the brilliantly lighted shops and cafés and the splendour of [the boulevards]5990-the boulevards . Now and again , the dark deserted form of [a church]5991-a church loomed out , lonely , amidst the gaiety of [Parisian street]5992-parisian street - life . Some electric lamp threw a distant gleam upon calm classic pillars , which seemed to hold aloof , with a quality of reserve rarely to be noticed in things [Parisian]57-parisian . [Hadria]211-hadria greeted [it]5993-it with a feeling of gratitude . [The great Boulevard]58-the great boulevard was ablaze and swarming with life . [The cafés]5994-the cafés were full ; the gilt and mirrors and the crowds of consommateurs within , all visible as [one]329-one passed along [the street]5996-the street , while , under the awning outside , [crowds]5997-crowds were sitting smoking , drinking , reading the papers . Was it really possible that only this morning , [those quiet English fields]5998-those quiet english fields had been dozing round one , [those sleepy villagers]5999-those sleepy villagers spreading [their]5999-those sleepy villagers slow words out , in expressing an absence of idea , over the space of time in which a [Parisian]57-parisian conveyed a pocket philosophy ? [The cabman]6000-the cabman directed [[his]6000-the cabman vehicle]6001-his vehicle down [the Rue Royale]6002-the rue royale , passing [the stately Madeleine]6003-the stately madeleine , with [its]6003-the stately madeleine guardian sycamores , and out into [the windy spaciousness of [the Place de la Concorde]6005-the place de la concorde]6004-the windy spaciousness of the place de la concorde . [A wondrous city]6006-a wondrous city ! [Hannah]212-hannah pointed out the electric light of [the Eiffel Tower]53-the eiffel tower to [her]212-hannah charge , and [Martha]129-martha put out [her]129-martha small hands , demanding the toy on the spot . The festooned lights of [the Champs Elysées]6007-the champs elysées swung themselves up , in narrowing line , till [they]5997-crowds reached the pompous arch at the summit , and among the rich trees of [those Elysian fields]6008-those elysian fields gleamed the festive lamps of cafés chantants . “[2607-a remembrancer] Si Madame desire encore quelque chose ? ” [The neat maid , in picturesque white cap and apron]6009-the neat maid , in picturesque white cap and apron , stood with [her]6009-the neat maid , in picturesque white cap and apron hand on the door of [the little bedroom]6010-the little bedroom , on [one of the highest storeys of [the pension]6012-the pension]6011-one of the highest storeys of the pension . Half of one of the long windows had been set open , and the sounds of the rolling of vehicles over [the smooth asphalte]6013-the smooth asphalte , mingled with those of voices , were coming up , straight and importunate , into [the dainty bedroom]6014-the dainty bedroom . The very sounds seemed nearer and clearer in [this keen - edged land]6015-this keen - edged land . The bed stood in one corner , canopied with white and blue ; a thick carpet gave a sense of luxury and deadened the tramp of footsteps ; a marble mantel - piece was surmounted by a mirror , and supported a handsome bronze clock and two bronze ornaments . The furniture was of solid mahogany . A nameless French odour pervaded the atmosphere , delicate , subtle , but unmistakeable . And out of the open window , one could see a series of other lighted windows , all of exactly the same tall graceful design , opening in the middle by the same device and the same metal handle that had to be turned in order to open or close the window . Within , [the rooms]6016-the rooms obviously modelled [themselves]6016-the rooms on the one unvarying ideal . [A few figures]6017-a few figures could be seen coming and going , busy at work or play . Above the steep roofs , a blue - black sky was alive with brilliant stars . “[2607-a remembrancer] Merci ; ” [Madame]195-madame bertaux required nothing more . JUST at first , it was a sheer impossibility to do anything but bask and bathe in the sunny present , to spend the days in wandering incredulously through vernal [Paris]35-paris , over whose bursting freshness and brilliancy the white clouds seemed to be driven , with the same joy of life . [The city]4963-the city was crammed ; [the inhabitants]916-the inhabitants poured forth in swarms to enjoy , in true French fashion , the genial warmth and the universal awakening after the long capricious winter . It was actually hot in the sun , and fresh light clothing became a luxury , like a bath after a journey . The year had raised its siege , and there was sudden amity between [man]332-man and [Nature]120-nature . [Shrivelled man]6021-shrivelled man could relax the tension of resistance to cold and damp and change , and go forth into the sun with cordial insouciance . In many of the faces might be read this kindly amnesty , although there were some so set and fixed with past cares that not even the soft hand of a Parisian spring could smooth away the lines , or even touch the spirit . [These Hadria]211-hadria passed with an aching pity . [Circumstance]106-circumstance had been to [them]6017-a few figures [a relentless taskmaster]6022-a relentless taskmaster . Perhaps [they]6017-a few figures had not rubbed the magic ring of will , and summoned [the obedient genius]6023-the obedient genius . Perhaps circumstance had forbidden [them]6017-a few figures even the rag wherewith to rub — or the impulse . Sallying forth from the pension , [Hadria]211-hadria would sometimes pause , for a moment , at the corner of [the street]5996-the street , where [it]5996-the street opened into [the Place de la Concorde]6005-the place de la concorde , irresolute , because of the endless variety of possible ways to turn , and [places to visit]6026-places to visit . [She]211-hadria seldom made definite plans the day before , unless it were for the pleasure of changing them . The letter of introduction to [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet had remained unpresented . The sense of solitude , combined for the first time with that of freedom , was too delightful to forego . [One]329-one must have time to realize and appreciate the sudden calm and serenity ; the sudden absence of claims and obstructions and harassing criticisms . Heavens , what a price [people]3687-people consented to pay for the privilege of human ties ! what hard bargains were driven in the kingdom of the affections ! [Thieves]6029-thieves , [extortionists]6030-extortionists , [usurers]6031-usurers — and in the name of all the virtues ! “[2607-a remembrancer] Yes , solitude has charms ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria inwardly exclaimed , as [she]211-hadria stood watching the coming and going of [people]3687-people , the spouting of fountains , the fluttering of big sycamore leaves in the Champs Elysées . Unhappily , the solitude made difficulties . But meanwhile there was [a large field to be explored]6033-a large field to be explored , where these difficulties did not arise , or could be guarded against . [Her]211-hadria sex was a troublesome obstruction . “[2607-a remembrancer] One does not come of centuries of [chattel - women]2610-chattel - women for nothing ! ” [she]211-hadria wrote to [Algitha]81-algitha . [Society]367-society bristled with insults , conscious and unconscious . Nor had [one]329-one lived the brightest , sweetest years of [one]329-one 's life tethered and impounded , without feeling the consequences when the tether was cut . There were dreads , shrinkings , bewilderments , confusions to encounter ; the difficulties of pilotage in [unknown seas]6037-unknown seas , of self - knowledge , and guidance suddenly needed in new ranges of the soul ; fresh temptations , fresh possibilities to deal with ; everything untested , the alphabet of worldly experience yet to learn . But all this was felt with infinitely greater force a little later , when the period of solitude was over , and [Hadria]211-hadria found [herself]211-hadria in the midst of [a little society whose real codes and ideas [she]211-hadria had gropingly to learn]6038-a little society whose real codes and ideas she had gropingly to learn . Unfamiliar ( in any practical sense ) with life , even in [[her]211-hadria own country]6039-her own country , [she]211-hadria had no landmarks or finger - posts , of any kind , in [this new land]6040-this new land . [Her]211-hadria sentiment had never been narrowly British , but now [she]211-hadria realized [her]211-hadria nationality over - keenly ; [she]211-hadria felt [herself]211-hadria almost grotesquely English , and had a sense of insular clumsiness amidst [a uprightly , dexterous people]6041-a uprightly , dexterous people . Conscious of a thousand illusive , but very real differences in point of view , and in nature , between [the two nations]6042-the two nations , [she]211-hadria had a baffled impression of walking among mysteries and novelties that [she]211-hadria could not grasp . [She]211-hadria began to be painfully conscious of the effects of the narrow life that [she]211-hadria had led , and of the limitations that had crippled [her]211-hadria in a thousand ways hitherto scarcely realized . “[329-one] [One]329-one begins to learn everything too late , ” [she]211-hadria wrote to [Algitha]81-algitha . “[329-one] This ought all to have been familiar long ago . [I]0-i do n't know anything about [the world in which [I]0-i live]2612-the world in which i live . [I]0-i have never before caught so much as a distant glimpse of it . And even now there are strange thick wrappings from the past that cling tight round and hold [me]0-i aloof , strive as [I]0-i may to strip off that past - made personality , and to understand , by touch , what things are made of . [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i would risk anything in order to really know that . Why should [a woman]3753-a woman treat [herself]3753-a woman as if [she]3753-a woman were [Dresden china]243-dresden china ? [She]3753-a woman is more or less insulted and degraded whatever happens , especially if [she]3753-a woman obeys what [[our]2614-our generation]2615-our generation is pleased to call the moral law . The more [I]0-i see of life , the more hideous seems the position that [women]606-women hold in relation to the social structure , and the more sickening the current nonsense that is talked about [us]2614-our and [our]2614-our ‘ missions ’ and ‘ spheres . ’ It is so feeble , so futile , to try to ornament an essentially degrading fact . It is such insolence to talk to [us]2614-our — good heavens , to us!—about holiness and sacredness , when [men ( to whom surely a sense of humour has been denied]2617-men ( to whom surely a sense of humour has been denied ) divide [[their]2617-men ( to whom surely a sense of humour has been denied women]4292-their women into two great classes , [both of whom [they]2617-men ( to whom surely a sense of humour has been denied insult and enslave , insisting peremptorily on the existence of each division , but treating [one class]2620-one class as private and the other as public property]2619-both of whom they insult and enslave , insisting peremptorily on the existence of each division , but treating one class as private and the other as public property . [One]329-one might as well talk to [driven cattle in the shambles about [their]2622-driven cattle in the shambles about their ‘ sacred mission ’ as to women ‘ sacred mission ’ as to [women]606-women]2622-driven cattle in the shambles about their ‘ sacred mission ’ as to women . It is an added mockery , a gratuitous piece of insolence . ” Having been , from childhood , more or less at issue with [her]3753-a woman surroundings , [Hadria]211-hadria had never fully realized [their]6043-their power upon [her]3753-a woman personality . But now daily a fresh recognition of [her]3753-a woman continued imprisonment , baffled [her]3753-a woman attempt to look at things with clear eyes . [She]3753-a woman struggled to get round and beyond that past - fashioned self , not merely in order to see truly , but in order to see at all . And in doing so , [she]3753-a woman ran the risk of letting go what [she]3753-a woman might have done better to hold . [She]3753-a woman felt painfully different from [these people among whom [she]3753-a woman found [herself]3753-a woman]6044-these people among whom she found herself . [Her]3753-a woman very trick of pondering over things sent [her]3753-a woman spinning to hopeless distances . [They]6043-their seemed to ponder so wholesomely little . [Their]6043-their intelligence was devoted to matters of the moment ; [they]6043-their were keen and well - finished and accomplished . [Hadria]211-hadria used to look at [them]6043-their in astonishment . How did [these quick - witted people]6045-these quick - witted people manage to escape the importunate inquisitive demon , the familiar spirit , who pursued [her]3753-a woman incessantly with [his]3753-a woman queries and suggestions ? [He]3753-a woman would stare up from [river]6046-river and [street]6047-street and [merry gardens]6048-merry gardens ; [his]3753-a woman haunting eyes looked mockingly out of green realms of stirring foliage , and [his]3753-a woman voice was like a sardonic echo to the happy voices of [the children]667-the children , laughing at [their]667-the children play under the flickering shadows , of [mothers]865-mothers discussing [their]865-mothers cares and interests , of [men in blouses]6051-men in blouses , at work by [the water - side]6052-the water - side , or solemn , in frock - coats , with pre - occupations of business and bread - winning . [The demon]6053-the demon had [his]6053-the demon own reflections on all these seemingly ordinary matters , and so bizarre were they at times , so startling and often so terrible , that [one]329-one found [oneself]329-one shivering in full noontide , or smiling , or thrilled with passionate pity at “[3698-men] the sad , strange ways of [men]3698-men . ” It was sweet to stretch one 's cramped wings to the sun , to ruffle and spread them , as a released bird will , but it was startling to find already little stiff habits arisen , little creaks and hindrances never suspected , that made flight in the high air not quite effortless and serene . The Past is never past ; immortal as [the Gods]812-the gods , it lives enthroned in [the Present]59-the present , and sets its limits and lays its commands . Cases have been known of [a man blind from birth]6056-a man blind from birth being restored to sight , at mature age . For a time , the appearance of objects was strange and incomprehensible . [Their]6057-their full meaning was not conveyed to [him]3753-a woman ; they remained riddles . [He]3753-a woman could not judge the difference between near and far , between solid and liquid ; [he]3753-a woman had no experience , dating from childhood , of the apparent smallness of distant things , of the connexion between the impression given to the touch by solids and their effect on the eye . [He]3753-a woman had all these things to learn . A thousand trifling associations , of which [those with normal senses are scarcely conscious]6058-those with normal senses are scarcely conscious , had to be stumblingly acquired , as [a child]754-a child learns to connect sound and sight , in learning to read . Such were the changes of consciousness that [Hadria]211-hadria found [herself]211-hadria going through ; only realising each phase of the process after it was over , and the previous confusion of vision had been itself revealed , by the newly and often painfully acquired coordinating skill . But , as generally happens , in the course of passing from ignorance to knowledge , the intermediate stage was chaotic . Objects loomed up large and indistinct , as through a mist ; vague forms drifted by , half revealed , to melt away again ; here and there were clear outlines and solid impressions , to be deemed trustworthy and given a place of honour ; thence a disproportion in the general conception ; it being almost beyond human power to allow sufficiently for that which is unknown . For some time , however , the dominant impression on [Hadria]211-hadria 's mind was of [her]211-hadria own gigantic ignorance . This ignorance was far more confusing and even misleading than it had been when its proportions were less defined . The faint twinkle of light revealed the dusky outline , bewildering and discouraging the imagination . Intuitive knowledge was disturbed by the incursion of scraps of disconnected experience . This condition of mind made [her]211-hadria an almost insoluble pyschological problem . Since [she]211-hadria was evidently [a woman of pronounced character]6060-a woman of pronounced character , [her]211-hadria bewilderment and tentitive attitude were not allowed for . [Her]211-hadria actions were regarded as deliberate and cool - headed , when often they would be the outcome of sheer confusion , or chance , or perhaps of a groping experimental effort . The first three weeks in [Paris]35-paris had been given up to enjoying the new conditions of existence . But now practical matters claimed consideration . The pension in [the Rue Boissy d'Anglas]5987-the rue boissy d'anglas was not suitable as [a permanent abode]6062-a permanent abode . [Rooms]6063-rooms must be looked for , combining cheapness with a good situation , within easy distance of the scene of [Hadria]211-hadria 's future musical studies , and also within reach of [some park]6064-some park or [gardens]2029-gardens for [Martha]129-martha 's benefit . [This ideal place of abode]6066-this ideal place of abode was at last found . It cost rather more than [Hadria]211-hadria had wished to spend on mere [lodging]6067-lodging , but otherwise it seemed perfect . It was in [a quiet street between [the Champs Elysées]6007-the champs elysées and [the river]437-the river]6068-a quiet street between the champs elysées and the river . [Two great thoroughfares]6071-two great thoroughfares ran , at a respectful distance , on either side , with [omnibuses]6072-omnibuses always passing . [Hadria]211-hadria could be set down within a few minutes ' walk of [the School of Music]6073-the school of music , or , if [she]211-hadria liked to give the time , could walk the whole way to [her]211-hadria morning 's work , through [some of the most charming parts of [Paris]35-paris]6074-some of the most charming parts of paris . As for [Martha]129-martha , [she]211-hadria was richly provided with [playgrounds]6075-playgrounds . [The Bois]60-the bois could be quickly reached , and there were always [the Champs Elysées]61-the champs elysées or the walk beneath the chestnuts by [the river]437-the river , along [the Cours de la Reine]6077-the cours de la reine and the length of [the quays]6078-the quays . Even [Hannah]212-hannah thought the situation might do . [Hadria]211-hadria had begun [her]211-hadria studies at [the School of Music]6073-the school of music , and found the steady work not only a profound , though somewhat stern enjoyment , but a solid backbone to [her]211-hadria new existence , giving it cohesion and form . [Recreation]244-recreation deserved its name , after work of this kind . Any lurking danger of too great speculative restlessness disappeared . There had been a moment when the luxurious joy of mere wandering observation and absorption , threatened to become overwhelming , and to loosen some of the rivets of the character . But work was to the sum - total of impulse what the central weight was to one of [Martha]129-martha 's toys : a leaden ballast that always brought the balance right again , however wildly [the little tyrant]6080-the little tyrant might swing the creature off the perpendicular . When [Hadria]211-hadria used to come in , pleasantly tired with [her]211-hadria morning 's occupation , and the wholesome heat of the sun , to take [her]211-hadria simple déjeuner in [the little apartment]6081-the little apartment with [Martha]129-martha , a frivolous five minutes would often be spent by [the two]4880-the two in endeavouring to overcome the rigid principles of that well - balanced plaything . But always the dead weight at its heart frustrated [their]4880-the two attempts . [Martha]129-martha played the most inconsiderate pranks with its centre of gravity , but quite in vain . When [a little French boy from the étage above]6083-a little french boy from the étage above was allowed to come and play with [Martha]129-martha , [she]129-martha proceeded to experiment upon [his]6083-a little french boy from the étage above centre of gravity in the same way , and seemed much surprised when [Jean Paul Auguste]245-jean paul auguste not only howled indignantly , but did n't swing up again after [he]6083-a little french boy from the étage above was over - turned . [He]6083-a little french boy from the étage above remained supine , and had to be reinstated by [Hadria]211-hadria and [Hannah]212-hannah , and comforted with sweetmeats . [Martha]129-martha 's logic received one of [its]129-martha first checks . [She]129-martha evidently made up [her]129-martha mind that logic was a fallacious mode of inference , and determined to abandon it for the future . These rebuffs in infancy , [Hadria]211-hadria conjectured , might account for much ! About three weeks passed in almost pure enjoyment and peace ; and then it was discovered that the cost of living , in spite of an extremely simple diet , was such as might have provided epicurean luxuries for [a family of ten]6084-a family of ten . [Hadria]211-hadria 's enquiries among [[her]211-hadria acquaintances]6085-her acquaintances elicited cries of consternation . Obviously [the landlady , who did the marketing]6086-the landlady , who did the marketing , must be cheating on a royal scale , and there was nothing for it but to move . [Hadria]211-hadria suggested to [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , whose advice [she]211-hadria always sought in practical matters , that perhaps [the landlady]6087-the landlady might be induced to pursue [her]6087-the landlady lucrative art in moderation ; could [she]6087-the landlady not put it honestly down in the bill “[3698-men] Peculation — so much per week ? ” [Madame Vauchlelet]234-madame vauchlelet was horrified . “[3698-men] Impossible ! ” [she]234-madame vauchlelet cried ; [one]329-one must seek [another apartment]6089-another apartment . If only [Hannah]212-hannah understood French and could do the marketing [herself]212-hannah . But [Hannah]212-hannah scorned the outlandish lingo , and had a poor opinion of [the nation]6090-the nation as a whole . It was fatiguing and somewhat discouraging work to begin , all over again , the quest of [rooms]6063-rooms , especially with the difficulty about [the landlady]6087-the landlady always in view , and no means of ascertaining [her]6087-the landlady scale of absorption . It really seemed a pity that it could not be mentioned as an extra , like coal and lights . Then [one]329-one would know what one was about . This uncertain liability , with an extremely limited income , which was likely to prove insufficient unless some addition could be made to it , was trying to the nerves . In order to avoid too great anxiety , [Hadria]211-hadria had to make up [her]211-hadria mind to [a less attractive suite of rooms]6094-a less attractive suite of rooms , [farther out of [town]4255-town]6095-farther out of town , and [she]211-hadria found it desirable to order many of the comestibles [herself]211-hadria . [Hadria]211-hadria began to think wistfully of [a more permanent ménage in [this entrancing capital]6100-this entrancing capital , where there were still worlds within [worlds to explore]6101-worlds to explore]6099-a more permanent ménage in this entrancing capital , where there were still worlds within worlds to explore . But [she]232-madame vauchelet wondered at the powerful physique of [the nation]6090-the nation that could submit to the trial daily . [Hadria]211-hadria was brimming over with pleasure in [[her]211-hadria new home]6110-her new home , which breathed [Paris]35-paris from every pore . [She]211-hadria had already surrounded [herself]211-hadria with odds and ends of [her]211-hadria own , with books and a few flowers . If only this venture turned out well , how delightful would be the next few months . [Hadria]211-hadria did not clearly look beyond that time . To [her]211-hadria , it seemed like a century . [Her]211-hadria only idea as to the farther future was an abstract resolve to let nothing short of absolute compulsion persuade [her]211-hadria to renounce [her]211-hadria freedom , or subject [herself]211-hadria to conditions that made the pursuit of [her]211-hadria art impossible . How to carry out the resolve , in fact and detail , was a matter to consider when the time came . If one were to consider future difficulties as well as deal with immediate ones , into what crannies and interstices were the affairs of the moment to be crammed ? There has probably never been a human experience of even a few months of perfect happiness , of perfect satisfaction with conditions , even among [the few men and women who know how to appreciate the bounty of Fate]6111-the few men and women who know how to appreciate the bounty of fate , when [she]211-hadria is generous , and to take the sting out of minor annoyances by treating [them]6111-the few men and women who know how to appreciate the bounty of fate lightly . [Hadria]211-hadria was ready to shrug [her]211-hadria shoulders at legions of these , so long as the main current of [her]211-hadria purpose were not diverted . But [she]211-hadria could not steel [herself]211-hadria against the letters that [she]211-hadria received from [England]14-england . [Everyone]3726-everyone was deeply injured but bravely bearing up . [[Her]211-hadria family]4129-her family was [a stricken and sorrowing family]6114-a stricken and sorrowing family . Being naturally heroic , it said little but thought the more . Relations whose names [Hadria]211-hadria scarcely remembered , seemed to have waked up at the news of [her]211-hadria departure and claimed [their]4129-her family share of the woe . [Obscure Temperleys]150-the temperleys raised astounded heads and mourned . [Henriette]142-henriette wrote that [she]142-henriette was really annoyed at the way in which [everybody]3781-everybody was talking about [Hadria]211-hadria 's conduct . It was most uncomfortable . [She]142-henriette hoped [Hadria]211-hadria was able to be happy . [Hubert]118-hubert was ready to forgive [her]211-hadria and to receive [her]211-hadria back , in spite of everything . [Henriette]142-henriette entreated [her]211-hadria to return ; for [her]211-hadria own sake , for [Hubert]118-hubert 's sake , for [the children]667-the children 's . [They]667-the children were just going off to [school]3954-school , [poor little boys]6118-poor little boys . [Henriette]142-henriette , although so happy at [the Red House]4718-the red house , was terribly grieved at this sad misunderstanding . It seemed so strange , so distressing . [Henriette]142-henriette had thoroughly enjoyed looking after dear [Hubert]118-hubert and [the sweet children]6120-the sweet children . [They]667-the children were in splendid health . [She]142-henriette had been very particular about hygiene . [Hubert]118-hubert and [she]142-henriette had seen a good deal of [the Engletons]194-the engletons lately . How charming [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was ! So much tact .
