[She]176-lady engleton hated to make [herself]176-lady engleton conspicuous ; the very ideal of [a true lady]6123-a true lady , if one might use the much - abused word . [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue was reported to be still far from well . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had not taken [the Priory]31-the priory after all . [It]31-the priory was too large . It looked so deserted and melancholy now . [Henriette]142-henriette always finished [her]142-henriette letters with an entreaty to [Hadria]211-hadria to return . [People]3687-people were talking so . [They]3687-people suspected the truth ; although , of course , [one]329-one had hoped that the separation would be supposed to be temporary — as indeed [Henriette]142-henriette trusted it would prove . [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux , who had just returned from [England]14-england to [[her]195-madame bertaux beloved [Paris]35-paris]6126-her beloved paris , reported to [Hadria]211-hadria , when [she]195-madame bertaux called on [the latter]590-the latter in [[her]195-madame bertaux new abode]6128-her new abode , that [everyone]3726-everyone was talking about the affair with as much eagerness as if the fate of [the empire]6130-the empire had depended on it . [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux recommended indifference and silence . [She]195-madame bertaux observed , in [her]195-madame bertaux sharp , good - natured , impatient way , that [reforming confirmed drunkards]6131-reforming confirmed drunkards , converting [the heathen]6132-the heathen , making saints out of [sinners]6133-sinners , or a silk purse out of a sow 's ear , would be [mere child]6134-mere child 's play compared with the task of teaching [the average idiot]6135-the average idiot to mind [his]6135-the average idiot own business . THE new ménage went well . [Therèse]246-therèse was a treasure , and [[Martha]129-martha 's willing slave]6136-martha 's willing slave . Expenses were kept fairly reasonable by [her]211-hadria care and knowledge . Still it must not be forgotten that the little income needed supplementing . [Hadria]211-hadria had been aware of this risk from the first , but had faced it , regarding it as the less perilous of the alternatives that [she]211-hadria had to choose between . The income was small , but it was [her]211-hadria own absolutely , and [she]211-hadria must live on that , with such auxiliary sums as [she]211-hadria could earn . [She]211-hadria hoped to be able to make a little money by [her]211-hadria compositions . The future was all vague and unknown , but one thing was at least certain : it cost money to live , and in some way or other it had to be made . [She]211-hadria told [[her]211-hadria kind friend]6137-her kind friend , [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , of [her]211-hadria plan . [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet consulted [[her]232-madame vauchelet musical friends]6138-her musical friends . [People]3687-people were sympathetic , but rather vague in [their]3687-people advice . It was always difficult , this affair . The beginning was hard . [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard , [a kindly , highly - cultivated man of about sixty , who had heard [Hadria]211-hadria]6140-a kindly , highly - cultivated man of about sixty , who had heard hadria play , took great interest in [her]211-hadria talent , and busied [himself]247-m. thillard on [her]211-hadria behalf . [He]247-m. thillard said [he]247-m. thillard would like to interest [the great Jouffroy]248-jouffroy in this work . It had so distinct and remarkable an individuality that [Dr. Thillard]249-dr. thillard was sure [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy would be enchanted with it . For [himself]249-dr. thillard , [he]249-dr. thillard held that it shewed a development of musical form and expression extremely remarkable . [He]249-dr. thillard could not quite understand it . There was , [he]249-dr. thillard knew not what , in it , of strange and powerful ; a music of [the North]28-the north ; something of bizarre , something of mysterious , even of terrible , “[3698-men] une emotion épouvantable , ” cried [Mr. Thillard]250-mr. thillard , working [himself]249-dr. thillard to a climax as the theme inspired [him]249-dr. thillard , “[3698-men] There is genius in that work , but certainly genius . ” [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet nodded gravely at this pronouncement . It ought to be published , [she]232-madame vauchelet said . But this supreme recompense of genius was apparently hard to achieve . The score was sent from [publisher]6141-publisher to [publisher]6141-publisher : “[3698-men] from pillar to post , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[3698-men] if one might venture on a phrase liable to misconstruction on the lips of disappointed ambition . ” But at the end of a long and wearisome delay , the little packet was returned in a tattered condition to [its discouraged author]6143-its discouraged author . [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard made light of this . It was always thus at first . [One]329-one must have patience . “[329-one] [One]329-one must live , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[329-one] or at least such is the prejudice under which [one]329-one has been brought up . ” “[3698-men] All will come , ” said [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard . “[3698-men] [You]2627-you will see . ” On one sunny afternoon , when [Hadria]211-hadria had returned , thrilled and inspired by a magnificent orchestral performance at [the Châtelet]6145-the châtelet , [she]211-hadria found [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard , and [the great Jouffroy]248-jouffroy waiting in [[her]211-hadria salon]6146-her salon . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy was small , eccentric , fiery , with keen eager eyes , thick black hair , and overhanging brows , [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard reminded [Madame Temperley]251-madame temperley of [her]251-madame temperley kind permission to present to [her]251-madame temperley [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . [Madame Temperley]251-madame temperley was charmed and flattered by [Monsieur]6147-monsieur 's visit . It was an exciting afternoon . [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet was eager to hear the opinion of [the great man]6148-the great man , and anxious for [Hadria]211-hadria to make a good impression . [The warm - hearted Frenchwoman]6149-the warm - hearted frenchwoman , who had lost [a daughter]6150-a daughter , of whom [Hadria]211-hadria reminded [her]211-hadria , had been untiring in [her]211-hadria kindness , from the first . [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , in [her]232-madame vauchelet young days , had cherished a similar musical ambition , and [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy always asserted that [she]232-madame vauchelet might have done great things , as [a performer]6151-a performer , had not the cares of [a family]4521-a family put an end to all hope of bringing [her]232-madame vauchelet gifts to fruition . The piano was opened . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy played . [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , with [her]232-madame vauchelet large veil thrown back , [her]232-madame vauchelet black cashmere folds falling around [her]232-madame vauchelet , sat in the large arm - chair , a dignified and graceful figure , listening gravely . The kindly , refined face of [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard beamed with enjoyment ; an occasional cry of admiration escaping [his]247-m. thillard lips , at some exquisite touch from [the master]6153-the master . The time slipped by , with bewildering rapidity . [Monsieur Thillard]252-monsieur thillard asked if [they]6154-they might be allowed to hear some of [Madame]232-madame vauchelet 's compositions — those which [she]232-madame vauchelet had already been so amiable as to play to [him]247-m. thillard . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy settled [himself]248-jouffroy to listen ; [his]248-jouffroy shaggy eyebrows lowering over [his]248-jouffroy eyes , not in severity but in fixity of attention . [Hadria]211-hadria trembled for a moment , as [her]211-hadria hands touched the keys . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy gave a nod of satisfaction . If there had been no such quiver of nerves [he]248-jouffroy would have doubted . So [he]248-jouffroy said afterwards to [Mr. Thillard]250-mr. thillard and [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet . After listening , for a time , without moving a muscle , [he]248-jouffroy suddenly sat bolt upright and looked round at [the player]2373-the player . The character of the music , always individual , had grown more marked , and at this point an effect was produced which appeared to startle [the musician]6156-the musician . [He]248-jouffroy withdrew [his]248-jouffroy gaze , after a moment , muttering something to [himself]248-jouffroy , and resumed [his]248-jouffroy former attitude , slowly and gravely nodding [his]248-jouffroy head . There was a long silence after the last of the lingering , questioning notes had died away . “[3698-men] Is [Madame]232-madame vauchelet prepared for work , for hard , faithful work ? ” The answer was affirmative . [She]232-madame vauchelet was only too glad to have the chance to work . “[232-madame vauchelet] Has [Madame]232-madame vauchelet inexhaustible patience ? ” “[232-madame vauchelet] In this cause — yes . ” “[232-madame vauchelet] And can [she]232-madame vauchelet bear to be misunderstood ; to be derided for departure from old rules and conventions ; to have [her]232-madame vauchelet work despised and refused , and again refused , till at last the dull ears shall [he]2628-he opened and all [the stupid world]2629-the stupid world shall run shouting to [her]232-madame vauchelet feet ? ” The colour rushed into [Hadria]211-hadria 's cheeks . “[205-mon dieu] Voila . ” exclaimed [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet . [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard beamed with satisfaction . “[205-mon dieu] Did [I]0-i not tell [you]0-i ? ” [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy clapped [[his]248-jouffroy friend]4122-his friend on the back with enthusiasm . “[0-i] Il faut travailler , ” [he]248-jouffroy said , “[0-i] mais travailler ! ” [He]248-jouffroy questioned [Hadria]211-hadria minutely as to [her]211-hadria course of study , approved it on the whole , suggesting alterations and additions . [He]248-jouffroy asked to look through some more of [her]211-hadria work . “[205-mon dieu] [Mon Dieu]205-mon dieu , ” [he]248-jouffroy ejaculated , as [his]248-jouffroy quick eye ran over page after page . “[205-mon dieu] If [Madame]232-madame vauchelet has a character as strong as [her]232-madame vauchelet genius , [her]232-madame vauchelet name will one day be on the lips of all [the world]334-the world . ” [He]248-jouffroy looked at [her]211-hadria searchingly . “[232-madame vauchelet] [I]0-i knew it ! ” exclaimed [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard . “[2631-madame] [Madame]2631-madame , je vous félicite . ” “[2631-madame] Ah ! ” cried [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , with a shake of [his]248-jouffroy black shaggy head , “[2631-madame] this is not a fate to be envied . C'est dur ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am bewildered ! ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria at last , in a voice that seemed to [her]0-i to come from somewhere a long way off . The whole scene had acquired the character of a dream . [The figures]6158-the figures moved through miles of clear distance . [Her]0-i impressions were chaotic . While a strange , deep confirmation of [the musician]6156-the musician 's words , seemed to stir within [her]0-i as if they had long been familiar , [her]0-i mind entirely refused credence . [He]6156-the musician had gone too far . Had [he]6156-the musician said a remarkable talent , but — Yet was it not , after all , possible ? [Nature]120-nature scattered [her]120-nature gifts wildly and cruelly : cruelly , because [she]120-nature cared not into what cramped nooks and crannies [she]120-nature poured [her]120-nature maddening explosive : cruelly , because [she]120-nature hurled this fire from [heaven]4276-heaven with indiscriminate hand , to set alight one dared not guess how many chained martyrs at [their]6161-their stakes . Nature did not pick and choose the subjects of [her]120-nature wilful ministrations . [She]120-nature seemed to scatter at random , out of sheer gaieté de coeur , as [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy had said , and if some golden grain chanced to be gleaming in this soul or that , what cause for astonishment ? The rest might be the worst of dross . As well might the chance occur to [one of [Nature]120-nature 's children]6162-one of nature 's children as to another . [She]120-nature did not bestow even one golden grain for nothing , bien sûr ; [she]120-nature meant to be paid back with interest . Just one bright bead of the whole vast circlet of the truth : perhaps it was [hers]120-nature , but more likely that [these kind friends]6163-these kind friends had been misled by [their]6163-these kind friends sympathy . [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy came next day to have a long talk with [Hadria]211-hadria about [her]120-nature work and [her]120-nature methods . [He]248-jouffroy was absolutely confident of what [he]248-jouffroy had said , but [he]248-jouffroy was emphatic regarding the necessity for work ; steady , uninterrupted work . Everything must be subservient to the one aim . If [she]120-nature contemplated anything short of complete dedication to [her]120-nature art — well ( [he]248-jouffroy shrugged [his]248-jouffroy shoulders ) , it would be better to amuse [herself]120-nature . There could be no half - measures with art . True , there were thousands of [people who practised a little of this and a little of that]6164-people who practised a little of this and a little of that , but [Art]253-art would endure no such disrespect . It was the affair of a lifetime . [He]248-jouffroy had known [many women with great talent]6165-many women with great talent , but , alas ! [they]6165-many women with great talent had not persistence . Only last year [a charming , beautiful young woman]6166-a charming , beautiful young woman , with — mon Dieu!—a talent that might have placed [her]6166-a charming , beautiful young woman on the topmost rank of [singers]6167-singers , had married against the fervent entreaties of [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , and now [he]248-jouffroy shrugged [his]248-jouffroy shoulders with a gesture of pitying contempt—“elle[0-i] est mère tout simplement . ” [Her]6166-a charming , beautiful young woman force had gone from [herself]6166-a charming , beautiful young woman into [the plump infant]6168-the plump infant , whose “[0-i] cris dechirants ” were all that now remained to the world of [[his]248-jouffroy mother]3866-his mother 's once magnificent voice . Hélas ! how many brilliant careers had [he]248-jouffroy not seen ruined by this fatal instinct ! [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy 's passion for [his]248-jouffroy art had overcome the usual sentiment of [the Frenchman]6170-the frenchman , and even the strain of Jewish blood . [He]248-jouffroy did not think [a woman of genius well lost for a child]6171-a woman of genius well lost for a child . [He]248-jouffroy grudged [her]6166-a charming , beautiful young woman to the fetish la famille . [He]248-jouffroy went so far as to say that , even without the claims of genius , [a woman]3753-a woman ought to be permitted to please [herself]3753-a woman in the matter . When [he]248-jouffroy heard that [Madame]232-madame vauchelet had [two children]6173-two children , and yet had not abandoned [her]232-madame vauchelet ambition , [he]248-jouffroy nodded gravely and significantly . “[0-i] But [Madame]232-madame vauchelet has courage , ” [he]248-jouffroy commented . “[232-madame vauchelet] [She]232-madame vauchelet must have braved much censure . ” It was the first case of the kind that had come under [his]248-jouffroy notice . [He]248-jouffroy hoped much from it . [His]248-jouffroy opinion of the sex would depend on [Hadria]211-hadria 's power of persistence . In consequence of [numberless pupils who had shewn great promise]6174-numberless pupils who had shewn great promise , and then had satisfied [themselves]6174-numberless pupils who had shewn great promise with “[2632-a stupid maternity] [a stupid maternity]2632-a stupid maternity , ” [Jouffrey]254-jouffrey was inclined to regard [women]606-women with contempt , not as regards [their]606-women talent , which [he]248-jouffroy declared was often astonishing , but as regards [their]606-women persistency of character and purpose . [One]329-one could not rely on [them]606-women . [They]606-women had enthusiasm — Oh , but enthusiasm à faire peur , but presently “[2632-a stupid maternity] [un monsieur avec des moustaches seduisantes]2633-un monsieur avec des moustaches seduisantes ” approaches , and then “[2632-a stupid maternity] Phui , c'est tout fini ! ” There was something of fatality in the affair . The instinct was terrible ; a demoniacal possession . It was for [women]606-women a veritable curse , a disease . [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy had pronounced views on the subject . [He]248-jouffroy regarded the maternal instinct as the scourge of genius . It was , for [women]606-women , [the devil]1352-the devil 's truncheon , [his]1352-the devil rod of empire . This “[2632-a stupid maternity] reproductive rage ” held [them]606-women — in spite of all [their]606-women fine intuitions and astonishing ability — after all on the animal plane ; cut [them]606-women off from the little band of [those who could break up new ground in human knowledge , and explore new heights of Art and Nature]6180-those who could break up new ground in human knowledge , and explore new heights of art and nature . “[0-i] [I]0-i speak to [you]2634-you thus , [Madame]232-madame vauchelet , not because [I]0-i think little of [your]2634-you sex , but because [I]0-i grudge [them]2635-them to the monster who will not spare [us]2636-us even one ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria worked with sufficient energy to please even [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . [Her]211-hadria heart was in it , and [her]211-hadria progress rapid . Everything was organized , in [her]211-hadria life , for the one object . At [the School of Music]6073-the school of music , [she]211-hadria was in an atmosphere of work , [everyone]3726-everyone being bent on the same goal , each detail arranged to further [the students]6183-the students in [their]6183-the students efforts . It was like walking on [a pavement]6184-a pavement after struggling uphill on loose sand ; like breathing sea - breezes after inhaling a polluted atmosphere . In old days , [Hadria]211-hadria used to be haunted by a singular recurrent nightmare : that [she]211-hadria was toiling up [a steep mountain made of hard slippery rock]6185-a steep mountain made of hard slippery rock , the summit always receding as [she]211-hadria advanced . Behind [her]211-hadria was a vast precipice down which [she]211-hadria must fall if [she]211-hadria lost [her]211-hadria footing ; and always , [she]211-hadria saw hands without bodies attached to [them]6186-them placing stones in the path , so that they rolled down and had to be evaded at the peril of [her]211-hadria life . And each time , after one set of stones was evaded , and [she]211-hadria thought there would be a time of respite , another batch was set rolling , amid thin , scarcely audible laughter , which came on the storm - wind that blew precipice - wards across [the mountain]6187-the mountain ; and invariably [she]211-hadria awoke just as a final avalanche of cruel stones had sent [her]211-hadria reeling over the hideous verge . [One]329-one is disposed to make light of the sufferings gone through in a dream , though it would trouble most of [us]6189-us to explain why , since the agony of mind is often as extreme as possibly could be endured in actual life . From the day of [her]211-hadria arrival in [Paris]35-paris , [Hadria]211-hadria was never again tormented with this nightmare . Composition went on rapidly now . Soon there was a little pile of new work for [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy 's inspection . [He]248-jouffroy was delighted , criticizing severely , but always encouraging to fresh efforts . As for the publishing , that was a different matter . In spite of [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy 's recommendation , [publishers]6190-publishers could not venture on anything of a character so unpopular . The music had merit , but it was eccentric . [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy was angry . [He]248-jouffroy declared that [he]248-jouffroy would play something of [Madame]232-madame vauchelet 's at the next Châtelet concert . There would be opposition , but [he]248-jouffroy would carry [his]248-jouffroy point . And [he]248-jouffroy did . But [the audience]323-the audience received it very coldly . Although [Hadria]211-hadria had expected such a reception , [she]211-hadria felt a chill run through [her]211-hadria , and a sinking of the heart . It was like a cold word that rebuffs an offer of sympathy , or an appeal for it . It sent [her]211-hadria back into depths of loneliness , and reminded [her]211-hadria how cut off [she]211-hadria was from [the great majority of [[her]211-hadria fellows]4821-her fellows]6192-the great majority of her fellows , after all . And then [Guy de Maupassant]255-guy de maupassant 's dreadful “[0-i] Solitude ” came to [her]211-hadria memory . There is no way ( [the hero of the sketch]6194-the hero of the sketch asserts ) by which [a man]3704-a man can break the eternal loneliness to which [he]3704-a man is foredoomed . [He]248-jouffroy can not convey to [others]432-others [his]248-jouffroy real impressions or emotion , try as [he]248-jouffroy may . By a series of assertions , hard to deny , [the hero]6197-the hero arrives at a terrible conclusion amounting to this : Art , affection , are in vain ; [we]6198-we know not what [we]6198-we say , nor whom [we]6198-we love . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy came out of [the theatre]6199-the theatre , snorting and ruffled . “[2637-they] But [they]2637-they are imbeciles , all ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria thought that perhaps [she]211-hadria was [the “[2637-they] imbecile ”]6200-the “ imbecile ” ; it was a possibility to be counted with , but [she]211-hadria dared not say so to [the irate Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . [He]248-jouffroy was particularly angry , because [the audience]323-the audience had confirmed [his]248-jouffroy own fear that only very slowly would the quality of the music be recognized by even [the more cultivated public]6202-the more cultivated public . [It]6203-it had invaded fresh territory , [he]248-jouffroy said , added to the range of expression , and was meanwhile a new language to [casual listeners]6204-casual listeners . It was rebel music , offensive to [the orthodox]5549-the orthodox . [Hubert]118-hubert had always said that “[0-i] it was out of the question , ” and [he]118-hubert appeared to have been right . “[0-i] Bah , ce ne sont que des moutons ! ” exclaimed [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . If the work had been poorer , less original , there would not have been this trouble . Was there not some other method by which [Madame]232-madame vauchelet could earn what was necessary , en [attendant]6206-attendant ? In one of [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue 's letters , [he]248-jouffroy had reminded [Hadria]211-hadria of [his]248-jouffroy eagerness to help [her]211-hadria . Yet , what could [he]248-jouffroy do ? [He]248-jouffroy had influence in [the world of]6207-the world of science , but [Hadria]211-hadria could not produce anything scientific ! [She]211-hadria bethought [her]211-hadria of trying to write light descriptive articles , of a kind depending not so much on literary skill as on subject and epistolary freshness of touch . These [she]211-hadria sent to [the Professor]4071-the professor , not without reluctance , knowing how overburdened [he]4071-the professor already was with work and with applications for help and advice . [He]4071-the professor approved of [her]211-hadria idea , and advised the articles being sent the round of the magazines and papers . Through [his]4071-the professor influence , one of the shorter articles was accepted , and [Hadria]211-hadria felt encouraged . [Her]211-hadria day was now very full . The new art was laborious , severely simple in character , though [she]211-hadria studiously made [her]211-hadria articles . [[Her]211-hadria acquaintances]6085-her acquaintances had multiplied very rapidly of late , and although this brought into [her]211-hadria experience much that was pleasant and interesting , the demands of an enlarging circle swallowed an astonishing number of hours . An element of trouble had begun to come into the life that had been so full of serenity , as well as of regular and strenuous work . [Hadria]211-hadria was already feeling the effects of anxiety and hurry . [She]211-hadria had not come with untried powers to the fray . The reserve forces had long ago been sapped , in the early struggles , beginning in [her]211-hadria girlhood and continuing at increasing pressure ever since . There was only enough nerve - force to enable [one]329-one to live from hand to mouth . Expenditure of this force having been so often in excess of income , economy had become imperative . Yet , economy was difficult . [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy was always spurring [her]211-hadria to work , to throw over everything for this object ; letters from [England]14-england incessantly urged a very different course ; [[friends]886-friends in [Paris]35-paris]6212-friends in paris pressed [her]211-hadria to visit [them]6212-friends in paris , to accompany [them]6212-friends in paris hither and thither , to join musical parties , to compose little songs ( some bagatelle in celebration of a birthday or wedding ) , to drive to [the further end of [the town]5882-the town]6213-the further end of the town to play to [this person]6215-this person or that who had heard of [Madame]232-madame vauchelet 's great talent . [Hadria]211-hadria was glad to do anything [she]211-hadria could to express [her]211-hadria gratitude for the kindness [she]211-hadria had received on all hands , but , alas ! there were only a certain number of hours in the day , and only a certain number of years in [one]329-one 's life , and art was long . Moreover , nerves were awkward things to play with . Insidiously , treacherously , difficulties crept up . Even here , where [she]211-hadria seemed so free , the peculiar claims that are made , by common consent , on [a woman]3753-a woman 's time and strength began to weave their tiny cords around [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria took warning , and put an end to any voluntary increase of [her]211-hadria circle , but the step had been taken a little too late . The mischief was done . To give pain or offence for the sake of an hour or two , more or less , seemed cruel and selfish , yet [Hadria]211-hadria often longed for the privilege that [every man]1703-every man enjoys , of quietly pursuing [his]1703-every man work without giving either . A disastrous sense of hurry and fatigue began to oppress [her]211-hadria . This was becoming serious . [She]211-hadria must make a stand . Yet [her]211-hadria attempts at explanation were generally taken as polite excuses for neglecting [those who had been kind and cordial]6219-those who had been kind and cordial . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy taxed [her]211-hadria with looking tired . [One]329-one must not be tired . [One]329-one must arrange the time so as to secure ample rest and recreation after the real work was over . [Women]606-women were so foolish in that way . [They]606-women did everything feverishly . [They]606-women imagined [themselves]606-women to have inexhaustible nerves . [Hadria]211-hadria hinted that it was perhaps others who demanded of [them]606-women what was possible only to inexhaustible nerves . True ; towards [women]606-women , [people]3687-people behaved as [idiots]6225-idiots . How was it possible to produce [one]329-one 's best , if repose were lacking ? Serenity was necessary for all production . As well expect [water]6227-water perpetually agitated to freeze , as expect [the crystals of the mind]6228-the crystals of the mind to produce [themselves]6228-the crystals of the mind under the influence of incessant disturbance . Work ? Yes . Work never harmed [any man]6229-any man or [woman]3844-woman . It was harassment that killed . Work of the mind , of the artistic powers , that was a tonic to the whole being . But little distractions , irregular duties , worries , uncertainties — [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy shook [his]248-jouffroy head ominously . And not only to [the artist]6231-the artist were [they]6232-they fatal . It was these that drew such deep lines on the faces of [women still young]6233-women still young . It was these that destroyed ability and hope , and killed [God]139-god only knew how many of [His]139-god good gifts ! Poverty : that could be endured with all its difficulties , if that were the one anxiety . It was never the one but the multitude of troubles that destroyed . Serenity there must be . [A man]3704-a man knew that , and insisted on having it . [Friends]886-friends were [no true friends]6236-no true friends if [they]886-friends robbed one of it . For [him]3704-a man , [he]3704-a man had a poor opinion of that which [people]3687-people called affection , regard . As for [l'amour]256-l'amour , that was the supreme egotism . The affections were simply a means to “[0-i] make [oneself]2638-oneself paid . ” Affection ! Bah ! [One]329-one did not offer it for nothing , bien sûr ! It was through this insufferable pretext that [one]329-one arrived at governing others . “[2638-oneself] Comment ? [Your]2639-you presence can give [me]0-i happiness , and [you]2639-you will not remain always beside [me]0-i ? It is nothing to [you]2639-you how [I]0-i suffer ? To [me]0-i whom [you]2639-you love [you]2639-you refuse this small demand ? ” [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy opened [his]248-jouffroy eyes , with a scornful glare . “[2639-you] It is in that fashion , [I]0-i promise [you]2639-you , that [one]329-one can rule ! ” “[0-i] Ah , [monsieur]2641-monsieur , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[0-i] [you]2641-monsieur are [a keen observer]1958-a keen observer . How [I]0-i wish [you]2641-monsieur could live [a woman]3753-a woman 's life for a short time . [You]2641-monsieur are wise now , but after that — ” “[232-madame vauchelet] [Madame]232-madame vauchelet , [I]0-i have sinned in [my]0-i day , perhaps to merit purgatorial fires ; but , without false modesty , [I]0-i do not think that [I]0-i have justly incurred the penalty [you]232-madame vauchelet propose to [me]0-i . ” [Hadria]211-hadria laughed . “[232-madame vauchelet] It would be a strange piece of poetic justice , ” [she]211-hadria said , “[232-madame vauchelet] if all [the men who have sinned beyond forgiveness in this incarnation]2644-the men who have sinned beyond forgiveness in this incarnation , should be doomed to appear in the next , as [well - brought - up women]2645-well - brought - up women . ” [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy smiled . “[2649-mon dieu] Fancy [some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens]2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens , as [[one]329-one 's maiden aunt]2648-one 's maiden aunt . ” [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy grinned . “[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] Ce serait dur ! ” “[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] Ah , [mon Dieu]2649-mon dieu ! ” cried [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , “[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] if [men]3698-men had to endure in the next world that which [they]3698-men have made [women]606-women suffer in this — that would be an atrocious justice ! ” STUBBORNLY [Hadria]211-hadria sent [her]211-hadria packets to [the publishers]6240-the publishers ; [the publishers]6240-the publishers as firmly returned [them]6240-the publishers . [She]211-hadria had two sets flying now , like tennis balls , [she]211-hadria wrote to [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria : one set across [the Channel]6242-the channel . [The publishers]6240-the publishers , [she]211-hadria feared , played the best game , but [she]211-hadria had the English quality of not knowing when [she]211-hadria was beaten . [Valeria]109-valeria had succeeded in finding a place for two of the articles . This was encouraging , but funds were running alarmingly low . [The apartement]6244-the apartement would have either to be given up , or to be taken on for another term , at the end of the week . A decision must be made . [Hadria]211-hadria was dismayed to find [her]211-hadria strength beginning to fail . That made the thought of the future alarming . With health and vigour nothing seemed impossible , but without that — It seemed absurd that there should be so much difficulty about earning a living . [Other women]4882-other women had done it . [Valeria]109-valeria had always made light of the matter — when [she]109-valeria had the theory of the sovereignty of the will to support . Another couple of articles which seemed to [[their]6240-the publishers creator]6246-their creator to possess popular qualities were sent off . But after a weary delay , [they]6240-the publishers shared the fate of [[their]6240-the publishers predecessors]6247-their predecessors . [Hadria]211-hadria now moved into [a smaller suite of rooms]6248-a smaller suite of rooms , parting regretfully with [Therèse]246-therèse , and flinging [herself]211-hadria once more on the mercy of [a landlady]6249-a landlady . This time [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard had discovered [the lodging]6250-the lodging for [her]211-hadria ; [a shabby , but sunny little house]6251-a shabby , but sunny little house , kept by [a motherly woman with a reputation for perfect honesty]6252-a motherly woman with a reputation for perfect honesty . Expenses were thus kept down , but unhappily very little was coming in to meet [them]6240-the publishers . It was impossible to pull through the year at this rate . But , of course , there was daily hope of something turning up . The arrival of the post was always an exciting moment . At last [Hadria]211-hadria wrote to ask [Algitha]81-algitha to try and sell for [her]211-hadria a spray of diamonds , worth about eighty pounds . Time must be gained , at all hazards . [Algitha]81-algitha tried everywhere , and enquired in all directions , but could not get more than five - and - twenty pounds for it . [She]211-hadria felt anxious about [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister , and thought of coming over to [Paris]35-paris to see [her]313-her sister , in order to talk over some matters that could no longer be kept out of sight . [Algitha]81-algitha had wished to give [Hadria]211-hadria an opportunity for work and rest , and to avoid recurrence of worry ; but it was no longer possible or fair to conceal the fact that there were troubles looming ahead , at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee . [[Their]6254-their father]3946-their father had suffered several severe losses through some bank failures ; and now [that wretched company in which [he]3946-their father had always had such faith]6256-that wretched company in which he had always had such faith appeared to be shaky , and if that were also to smash , the state of affairs would be desperate . [[Their]6254-their father]3946-their father , in [his]3946-their father optimistic fashion , still believed that [the company]4609-the company would pull through . Of course all this anxiety was telling seriously on [[their]6254-their mother]363-their mother . And , alas [she]363-their mother had been fretting very much about [Hadria]211-hadria . After [Algitha]81-algitha 's misdeed , this second blow struck hard . [One]329-one must act on [one]329-one 's own convictions and not on those of [somebody else]6262-somebody else , however beloved [that other person]6263-that other person might be , but truly the penalty of daring to take an independent line of action was almost unbearably severe . It really seemed , at times , as if there were nothing for it but to fold [one]329-one 's hands and do exactly as [one]329-one was bid . [Algitha]81-algitha was beginning to wonder whether [her]81-algitha own revolt was about to be expiated by a life - long remorse ! “[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] Ah , if [mother]3851-mother had only not sacrificed [herself]3851-mother for [us]2653-us , how infinitely grateful [I]0-i should feel to [her]3851-mother now ! What sympathy there might have been between [us]2653-us all ! If [she]3851-mother had but given [herself]3851-mother a chance , how [she]3851-mother might have helped [us]2653-us , and what [a friend]727-a friend [she]3851-mother might have been to [us]2653-us , and [we]2653-us to [her]3851-mother ! But [she]3851-mother would not . ” [Algitha]81-algitha said that [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother evidently felt [Hadria]211-hadria 's departure as a disgrace to [the family]360-the family . It was pathetic to hear [her]520-her mother trying to answer [people]3687-people 's casual questions about [her]520-her mother , so as to conceal the facts without telling an untruth . [Hadria]211-hadria was overwhelmed by this letter . [Her]211-hadria first impulse was to pack up and go straight to [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee . But as [Algitha]81-algitha was [there]571-there now , this seemed useless , at any rate for the present . And ought [she]81-algitha after all to abandon [her]81-algitha project , for which so much had been risked , so much pain inflicted ? The question that [she]81-algitha and [Algitha]81-algitha thought [they]2653-us had decided long ago , began to beat again at the door of [her]81-algitha conscience and [her]81-algitha pity . [Her]81-algitha reason still asserted that the suffering which [people]3687-people entail upon [themselves]3687-people , through a frustrated desire to force [their]3687-people own law of conduct on [others]432-others , must be borne by [themselves]3687-people , as the penalty of [their]3687-people own tyrannous instinct and of [their]3687-people own narrow thought . It was utterly unfair to thrust that natural penalty of prejudice and of self - neglect on to the shoulders of [others]432-others . Why should [they]3687-people be protected from the appointed punishment , by the offering of another life on the altar of [their]3687-people prejudice ? Why should such a sacrifice be made in order to gratify [their]3687-people tyrannical desire to dictate ? It was not fair , it was not reasonable . Yet this conclusion of the intellect did not prevent the pain of pity and compunction , nor an inconsequent sense of guilt . Meanwhile it would be best , perhaps , to await [Algitha]81-algitha 's arrival , when affairs might be in a less uncertain state . All decision must be postponed till then . “[3851-mother] Try and come soon , ” [she]81-algitha wrote to [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister . To add to the anxieties of the moment , [little Martha]129-martha seemed to lose in energy since coming to [the new abode]6274-the new abode , and [Hadria]211-hadria began to fear that [the house]296-the house was not quite healthy . [It]296-the house was very cheap , and [the landlady]6087-the landlady was honest , but if it had this serious drawback , another move , with probably another drawback , seemed to threaten . This was particularly troublesome , for who could tell how long it would be possible to remain in [Paris]35-paris ? [Hadria]211-hadria thought of the doctrine of the sovereignty of the will , and of all the grand and noble things that [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society had said about it , not to mention [Emerson]87-emerson and [others]432-others — and [she]211-hadria smiled . However , [she]211-hadria worked on , putting aside [her]211-hadria anxieties , as far as was possible . [She]211-hadria would not fail for lack of will , at any rate . But it was a hard struggle . [Martha]129-martha had to be very carefully watched just now . Happily , after a few anxious days , [she]129-martha began to recover [her]129-martha fresh colour and [her]129-martha high spirits . The move would not be necessary , after all . [Hadria]211-hadria had become more and more attached to [the child]4983-the child , whose lovable qualities developed with [her]4983-the child growth . [She]4983-the child was becoming singularly like [[her]4983-the child unhappy mother]6280-her unhappy mother , in feature and in colouring . [Her]4983-the child eyes were large and blue and sweet , with a little touch of pathos in them that [Hadria]211-hadria could not bear to see . It seemed almost like the after - glow of [the mother]578-the mother 's suffering . Although adding to [Hadria]211-hadria 's anxieties , [the child]4983-the child gave a sense of freshness and youth to [the little ménage]6283-the little ménage . [She]211-hadria made the anxieties easier to bear . [Hadria]211-hadria came in , one morning , from [her]211-hadria work , tired and full of foreboding . Hat and cloak were laid aside , and [she]211-hadria sank into an arm - chair , lying back to lazily watch the efforts of [the child]4983-the child to overturn [the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because [he]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest was less amenable than [the rest]5069-the rest]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest . [Martha]129-martha looked up for sympathy . [She]129-martha wished to be helped in [her]129-martha persistent efforts to get the better of [this upstart blue man with the red cap , who serenely resumed [his]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest erect position just as often as [he]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest was forced to the ground]6287-this upstart blue man with the red cap , who serenely resumed his erect position just as often as he was forced to the ground . [He]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest was [a stout , healthy - looking person]6288-a stout , healthy - looking person , inclining to embonpoint ; bound to succeed , if only from sheer solidity of [person]2199-person . [Hadria]211-hadria was drawn into the game , and [the two]4880-the two spent a good half hour on the rug together , playing with that and other toys which [Martha]129-martha toddled off to the cupboard to collect . [The child]4983-the child was in great delight . [Hadria]211-hadria was playing with [her]4983-the child ; [she]211-hadria liked that better than having [Jean Paul Auguste]245-jean paul auguste to play with . [He]245-jean paul auguste took [her]211-hadria toys away and always wanted to play a different game . The clock struck two . [Hadria]211-hadria felt that [she]211-hadria ought to go and see [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet ; it was more than a week since [she]211-hadria had called , and [the kind old friend]6292-the kind old friend was always gently pained at an absence of that length . Then there was an article to finish , and [she]211-hadria ought really to write to [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee and [Henriette]142-henriette and — well [the rest]5069-the rest must wait . Several other calls were also more than due , but it was useless even to consider those to - day . In spite of an oppressive sense of having much to do — perhaps because of it — [Hadria]211-hadria felt as if it were a sheer impossibility to rise from that hearthrug . Besides , [Martha]129-martha would not hear of it . A desire to rest , to idle , to float down [the stream]1809-the stream , instead of trying always to swim against it , became overpowering . The minutes passed away . “[3851-mother] The question is , [Martha]129-martha , ” [Hadria]211-hadria said gravely , as [she]211-hadria proceeded to pile up [a towering edifice of bricks]6295-a towering edifice of bricks , at [the child]4983-the child 's command , “[129-martha] the question is : Are [we]2655-we going to stick to [our]2655-we plan , or are [we]2655-we going to be beaten ? Oh , take care , do n't pull down [the fairy palace]2656-the fairy palace ! That is a bad trick that [little fingers]2657-little fingers have . No , no , [I]0-i must have [[my]0-i fairy palace]2658-my fairy palace ; [I]0-i wo n't have [it]2658-my fairy palace pulled down . It is getting so fine , too ; minarets and [towers]2659-towers , and domes and pinnacles , all mixed beautifully . Such an architecture as [you]2660-you never saw ! But some day perhaps [you]2660-you will see it . Those blue eyes look as if they were made for seeing it , in the time to come . ” “[2662-a pretty house] Pretty eyes ! ” said [Martha]129-martha with frank vanity , and then : “[2662-a pretty house] [Pretty house]2661-pretty house ! ” “[2662-a pretty house] It is indeed [a pretty house]2662-a pretty house ; [they]2662-a pretty house all are . But [they]2662-a pretty house are so horribly shaky . The minarets are top - heavy , [I]0-i fear . That 's the fault of [the makers of these bricks]2663-the makers of these bricks . [They]2663-the makers of these bricks ought to make the solid ones in proper proportion . But [they]2663-the makers of these bricks ca n't be persuaded . ” “[2663-the makers of these bricks] Knock it down , ” said [Martha]129-martha , thrusting forth a mischievous hand , which was caught in time to prevent entire destruction of the precious edifice . Half the minarets had fallen . “[2664-they] [They]2664-they must go up again , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[2664-they] How cruel to spoil all the work and all the beauty . ” But [Martha]129-martha laughed with the delight of easy conquest . [She]129-martha watched with great interest the reconstruction , and seemed anxious that every detail should be finished and worthy [her]129-martha iconoclasm . Having satisfied [herself]129-martha that [her]129-martha strength would not be wasted on an incomplete object , [she]129-martha made a second attempt to lay [the palace]6297-the palace low . Again [she]129-martha was frustrated . [The building]4303-the building had soared , by this time , to an ambitious height , and [its]4303-the building splendour had reached the limits of the materials at command . The final pinnacle which was required to cope [the structure]1845-the structure had been mislaid . [Hadria]211-hadria was searching for it , when [Martha]129-martha , seizing [her]129-martha chance , struck [the palace]6297-the palace a blow in its very heart , and in an instant , the whole was a wreck . “[2664-they] Oh , if that is to be the way of it , why should [I]0-i build ? asked [Hadria]211-hadria . [Martha]129-martha gave the command for another ornamental object which [she]129-martha might destroy . “ [One]329-one would suppose [you]129-martha were [a County - Council]6302-a county - council , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed , “ or [the practical man]6303-the practical man . No , [you]129-martha shall have no more beauty to annihilate , [little Vandal]257-little vandal . ”[211-hadria] [Martha]129-martha , however , was now engaged in dissecting a doll , and presently a stream of sawdust from its chest announced that [she]129-martha had accomplished [her]129-martha dearest desire . [She]129-martha had found out what was inside that human effigy . “ [I]129-martha wish [I]129-martha could get at the sawdust that [I]129-martha am stuffed with , ”[129-martha] [Hadria]211-hadria thought dreamily , as [she]211-hadria watched the doll grow flabbier . “ It is wonderful how [little one]2165-little one does know [one]329-one 's own sawdust . It would be convenient to feel a little surer just now , for evidently [I]211-hadria shall need it all very soon . And [I]211-hadria feel somewhat like that doll , with the stream pouring out and the body getting limp . ”[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria rose at last , and went to the window . The radiance of sun and green trees and the stir of human life ; the rumble of omnibuses and the sound of wheels ; the suggestion to the imagination of [the river]437-the river just a little way off , and [the merry little bateaux - mouches]2666-the merry little bateaux - mouches — it was too much . [Hadria]211-hadria rang for [Hannah]212-hannah ; asked [her]212-hannah to take [the child]4983-the child for a walk in [the Bois]60-the bois , stooped down to kiss the little upturned face , and went off . In another ten minutes [she]211-hadria was on board one of [the steam - boats]2668-the steam - boats , on [her]211-hadria way up [the river]437-the river . [She]211-hadria had no idea whither [she]211-hadria was going ; [she]211-hadria would leave that to chance . [She]211-hadria only desired to feel the air and the sun and have an opportunity to think . [She]211-hadria soothed [her]211-hadria uneasiness at the thought of [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet 's disappointment by promising [herself]211-hadria to call to - morrow . [She]211-hadria sat watching [the boats]2670-the boats and the water and [the gay banks of [the river]437-the river]2671-the gay banks of the river with a sense of relief , and a curious sort of fatalism , partly suggested perhaps , by the persistent movement of [the boat]5930-the boat , and the interminable succession of new scenes , all bubbling with human life , full of the traces of past events . One layer of consciousness was busily engaged in thinking out the practical considerations of the moment , another was equally busy with the objective and picturesque world of [the river side]2674-the river side . If the two or more threads of thought were not actually followed at the same instant , the alternation was so rapid as not to be perceived . What was to be done ? How was the situation to be met , if the worst came to the worst ? Ah ! what far harder contests had gone on in [these dwellings]2675-these dwellings that one passed by the hundred . What lives of sordid toil had been struggled through , in the effort to earn the privilege of continuing to toil ! [Hadria]211-hadria was inspired by keen curiosity concerning [these homes]2676-these homes and [gardens]2029-gardens , and the whole panorama that opened before [her]211-hadria , as [the little steamer]2678-the little steamer puffed up [the river]437-the river . [She]211-hadria longed to penetrate below the surface and decipher the strange palimpsest of human life . What scenes , what tragedies , what comedies , [those bright houses]2680-those bright houses and [demure little villas]2681-demure little villas concealed . It was not exactly consoling to remember how small [her]211-hadria own immediate difficulties were in comparison to those of others , but it seemed to help [her]211-hadria to face [them]2682-them . [She]211-hadria would not be discouraged . [She]211-hadria had [her]211-hadria liberty , and that had to be paid for . Surely patience would prevail in the end . [She]211-hadria had learnt so much since [she]211-hadria left [home]3770-home ; among other things , the habit of facing practical difficulties without that dismay which carefully - nurtured women inevitably feel on [their]2684-their first movement out of shelter . Yes , [she]211-hadria had learnt much , surprisingly much , in the short time . [Her]211-hadria new knowledge contained perhaps rather dangerous elements , for [she]211-hadria had begun to realize [her]211-hadria own power , not only as [an artist]4849-an artist , but as [a woman]3753-a woman . In this direction , had [she]211-hadria so chosen .... [Her]211-hadria thoughts were arrested at this point , with a wrench . [She]211-hadria felt the temptation assail [her]211-hadria , as of late it had been assailing [her]211-hadria faintly , to explore [this territory]2687-this territory . But no , that was preposterous . It was certainly not that [she]211-hadria regarded [herself]211-hadria as accountable , in this matter , to [any one]2075-any one but [herself]211-hadria ; it was not that [she]211-hadria acknowledged the suzerainty of [[her]211-hadria husband]553-her husband . A mere legal claim meant nothing to [her]211-hadria , and [he]553-her husband knew it . But there were moral perils of no light kind to be guarded against ; the danger such as [a gambler]2690-a gambler runs , of being drawn away from the real objects of life , of losing hold of [one]329-one 's main purpose , to say nothing of the probable moral degeneration that would result from such experiment . Yet there was no blinking the fact that the desire had been growing in [Hadria]211-hadria to test [her]211-hadria powers of attraction to the utmost , so as to discover exactly their range and calibre . [She]211-hadria felt rather as [a boy]2692-a boy might feel who had come upon a cask of gunpowder , and longed to set a match to it , just to see exactly how high it would blow off the roof . [She]211-hadria had kept the growing instincts at bay , being determined that nothing avoidable should come between [her]211-hadria and [her]211-hadria purpose . And then — well considering in what light [most men]1974-most men , in [their]1974-most men hearts , regarded [women]606-women — if one might judge from [their]1974-most men laws and [their]1974-most men conduct and [their]1974-most men literature , and the society that [they]1974-most men had organized — admiration from this sex was a thing scarcely to be endured . Yet superficially , it was gratifying . Why it should be so , was difficult to say , since it scarcely imposed upon [one]329-one 's very vanity . Yet it was easy enough to understand how [women who had no very dominant interest in life]2696-women who had no very dominant interest in life , might come to have a thirst for masculine homage and for power over [men]3698-men till it became like [the gambler]2698-the gambler 's passion for play ; and surely it had something in it of the same character . [The steamer]2699-the steamer was stopping now at [St. Cloud]64-st. cloud . Yielding to an impulse , [Hadria]211-hadria alighted at [the landing - stage]2700-the landing - stage and walked on through [the little town]2701-the little town towards [the palace]6297-the palace . The sun was deliciously hot ; its rays struck through to the skin , and seemed to pour in life and well - being . [The wayfarer]957-the wayfarer stood looking up [the steep green avenue]2704-the steep green avenue , resting for a moment , before [she]957-the wayfarer began the ascent . At [the top of [the hill]3975-the hill]2705-the top of the hill [she]211-hadria paused again to look out over [Paris]35-paris , which lay spread far and wide beneath [her]211-hadria , glittering and brilliant ; [the Eiffel Tower]53-the eiffel tower rising above domes and spires , in solitary inconsequence . It seemed to [her]211-hadria as if [she]211-hadria were looking upon [the world]334-the world and upon life , for the last time . A few weeks hence , would [she]211-hadria be able to stand there and see [the gay city]2708-the gay city at [her]211-hadria feet ? [She]211-hadria plunged back along one of [the converging avenues]2709-the converging avenues , yielding to the fascination of green alleys leading one knows not whither . Wandering on for some time , [she]211-hadria finally drifted [down hill]2710-down hill again , towards [the stately little garden near [the palace]6297-the palace]2711-the stately little garden near the palace . [She]211-hadria was surprised by a hurrying step behind [her]211-hadria , and [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy 's voice in [her]211-hadria ear . [She]211-hadria was about to greet [him]248-jouffroy in [her]211-hadria usual fashion , when [he]248-jouffroy stopped [her]211-hadria by plunging head foremost into a startling tirade — about [her]211-hadria art , and [her]211-hadria country , and [her]211-hadria genius , and [his]248-jouffroy despair ; and finally [his]248-jouffroy resolve that [she]211-hadria should not belong to the accursed list of women who gave up [their]2713-their art for “ la famille . ”[248-jouffroy] The more [Hadria]211-hadria tried to discover what had happened and what [he]248-jouffroy meant , the faster [he]248-jouffroy spoke and the more wildly [he]248-jouffroy gesticulated . [He]248-jouffroy had seen how [she]211-hadria was drifting away from [her]211-hadria work and becoming entangled in little affairs of no importance , and [he]248-jouffroy would not permit it . [He]248-jouffroy cared not what [her]211-hadria circumstances might be ; [she]211-hadria had a great talent that [she]211-hadria had no right to sacrifice to any circumstances whatever . [He]248-jouffroy had come to save [her]211-hadria . Not finding [her]211-hadria at [[her]211-hadria apartement]2714-her apartement , [he]248-jouffroy had concluded that [she]211-hadria had taken refuge at [[her]211-hadria beloved [St. Cloud]64-st. cloud]2715-her beloved st. cloud . [Mon Dieu]205-mon dieu ! was [he]248-jouffroy to allow [her]211-hadria to be taken away from [her]211-hadria work , dragged back to a narrow circle , crushed , broken , ruined — [she]211-hadria who could give such a sublime gift to [[her]211-hadria century]2716-her century — but it was impossible ! It would tear [his]248-jouffroy heart . [He]248-jouffroy would not permit it ; [she]211-hadria must promise [him]248-jouffroy not to allow [herself]211-hadria to be persuaded to abandon [her]211-hadria purpose , no matter on what pretext [they]2717-they tried to lure [her]211-hadria . [Hadria]211-hadria , in vain , enquired the cause of this sudden excitement . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy only repeated [his]248-jouffroy exhortations . Why did [she]211-hadria not cut [herself]211-hadria entirely adrift from [[her]211-hadria country]2718-her country , [her]211-hadria ties ? “ They are to [you]211-hadria , [Madame]2631-madame , an oppression , a weariness , a — ”[211-hadria] “ M. [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , [I]248-jouffroy have never spoken to [you]248-jouffroy about these things . [I]248-jouffroy can not see how [you]248-jouffroy are in a position to judge . ”[248-jouffroy] “ Ah , but [I]248-jouffroy know . Have [I]248-jouffroy not heard cette chère [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux describe the life of [an English village]1946-an english village ? And have [I]248-jouffroy not seen — ? ”[248-jouffroy] “ Seen what ? ”[211-hadria] “ [Cette dame]258-cette dame . [I]248-jouffroy have seen [her]211-hadria at [[your]211-hadria apartment]6308-your apartment this afternoon . Do not annihilate [me]248-jouffroy , [Madame]195-madame bertaux ; [I]248-jouffroy mean not to offend [you]211-hadria . [The lady]3679-the lady has come from [England]14-england on purpose to entrap [you]211-hadria ; [she]3679-the lady came last night , and [she]3679-the lady stays at [the Hotel du Louvre]6310-the hotel du louvre . [She]3679-the lady spoke to [me]248-jouffroy of [you]211-hadria . ”[248-jouffroy] [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy raised [his]248-jouffroy hands to heaven . “ Ha ! then [I]248-jouffroy understood , and [I]248-jouffroy fled hither to save [you]211-hadria . ”[248-jouffroy] “ Tell [me]3679-the lady , tell [me]3679-the lady quickly , [Monsieur]6311-monsieur , has [she]3679-the lady fair hair and large grey eyes . Is [she]3679-the lady tall ? ”[3679-the lady] No , [the lady]3679-the lady was small , with dark hair , and brown , clever eyes . “ [A lady]6312-a lady , elegant , well - dressed , but , ah ! [a woman to destroy the soul of [an artist]4849-an artist merely by [her]3679-the lady presence]6313-a woman to destroy the soul of an artist merely by her presence . [I]3679-the lady told [her]3679-the lady that [you]211-hadria had decided to remain in [France]44-france , to adopt [it]44-france as [[your]211-hadria country]6315-your country , for it was [the country]401-the country of [your]211-hadria soul ! ”[3679-the lady] “ Good heavens ! ”[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria , unable to repress a little burst of laughter , in spite of [her]211-hadria disappointment and foreboding . “ [I]248-jouffroy told [her]3679-the lady that [[your]211-hadria friends]1648-your friends would not let [you]211-hadria go back to [England]14-england , to [the land of fogs]6318-the land of fogs , [the land of]6319-the land of [the bourgeois]6320-the bourgeois . [The lady]3679-the lady seemed astonished , even indignant , ”[248-jouffroy] continued [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , waving [his]248-jouffroy hands excitedly , “ and [she]3679-the lady endeavoured to make [me]248-jouffroy silent , but [she]3679-the lady did not have success , [I]248-jouffroy promise [you]211-hadria . [I]248-jouffroy appealed to [her]3679-the lady . [I]248-jouffroy pointed out to [her]3679-the lady [your]211-hadria unique power . [I]248-jouffroy reminded [her]3679-the lady that such power is a gift supreme to [the world]334-the world , which [the world]334-the world must not lose . For the making of [little ones]6324-little ones and the care of [the ménage]6325-the ménage , there were [other women]4882-other women , but [you]211-hadria — [you]211-hadria were [a priestess in [the temple of art]6328-the temple of art]6327-a priestess in the temple of art , [you]211-hadria were without prejudice , without the bourgeois conscience , grâce au ciel ! [you]211-hadria had the religion of [the artist]6231-the artist , and [your]211-hadria worship was paid at [the shrine of [Apollo]259-apollo]6330-the shrine of apollo . [Enfin]260-enfin , [I]248-jouffroy counselled [this elegant lady]6331-this elegant lady to return to [England]14-england and to leave [you]211-hadria in peace . Always with a perfect politeness , ”[248-jouffroy] added [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , panting from excess of emotion . [Hadria]211-hadria tried in vain to gather the object of this sudden visit on the part of [Henriette]142-henriette ( for [Henriette]142-henriette [the elegant lady]2720-the elegant lady must certainly be ) . “ [I]211-hadria must return at once , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . “ [I]211-hadria fear something must have gone wrong at [home]3770-home . ”[211-hadria] [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy danced with fury . “ But [I]248-jouffroy tell [you]211-hadria , [Madame]195-madame bertaux , that [she]6331-this elegant lady will drag [you]211-hadria back to [[your]211-hadria fogs]6333-your fogs ; [she]6331-this elegant lady will tell [you]211-hadria some foolish story , [she]6331-this elegant lady will address [herself]6331-this elegant lady to [your]211-hadria pity . [[Your]211-hadria family]6334-your family has doubtless become ill . [Families]6335-families have that habit when [they]6335-families desire to achieve something . Bah , it is easy to become ill when [one]329-one is angry , and so to make [oneself]329-one pitied and obeyed . It is a common usage . [Madame]195-madame bertaux , beware ; it is for [you]211-hadria the critical moment . [One]329-one must choose . ”[248-jouffroy] “ It is not always a matter of choice , [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . ”[211-hadria] “ Always , ”[2721-he] [he]2721-he insisted . [He]2721-he endeavoured to induce [her]2722-her to linger , to make a decision on the spot . But [Hadria]211-hadria hastened on towards [the river]437-the river . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy followed in despair . [He]2721-he ceased not to urge upon [her]2722-her the peril of the moment and the need for resolute action . [He]2721-he promised to help [her]2722-her by every means in [his]2721-he power , to watch over [her]2722-her career , to assist [her]2722-her in bringing [her]2722-her gift to maturity . Never before had [he]2721-he felt a faith so profound , or an interest so fervid in the genius of [any woman]1369-any woman . [One]329-one had , after all , regarded [them]2726-them ( “ les femmes ”[329-one] ) as accomplished animals . “ But of whom [one]329-one demands the duties of [human beings]4313-human beings and the courage of [heroes]2452-heroes , ”[211-hadria] added [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [Justement]261-justement , ”[248-jouffroy] cried [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . But [Madame]195-madame bertaux had taught [him]2721-he a superb truth . For [her]195-madame bertaux , [he]2721-he felt a sentiment of admiration and reverence the most profound . [She]195-madame bertaux had been to [him]2721-he a revelation . [He]2721-he entreated [her]195-madame bertaux to bestow upon [him]2721-he the privilege of watching over [her]195-madame bertaux career . Let [her]195-madame bertaux only make the wise decision now , everything would arrange itself . It needed only courage . “ This is the moment for decision . Remain now among [us]6341-us , and pursue [your]195-madame bertaux studies with a calm mind , and [I]248-jouffroy promise [you]195-madame bertaux — [I]248-jouffroy , [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , who have the right to speak on this matter — [I]248-jouffroy promise [you]195-madame bertaux shall have a success beyond the wildest dreams of [your]195-madame bertaux ambition . [Madame]2631-madame , [you]195-madame bertaux do not guess [your]195-madame bertaux own power . [I]248-jouffroy know how [your]195-madame bertaux genius can be saved to [the world]334-the world ; [I]248-jouffroy know [the artist]6231-the artist 's nature . Have [I]248-jouffroy not had the experience of twenty years ? [I]248-jouffroy know what feeds and rouses it , and [I]248-jouffroy know what kills it . And this [I]248-jouffroy tell [you]195-madame bertaux , [Madame]195-madame bertaux , that if [you]195-madame bertaux stay here , [you]195-madame bertaux have a stupendous future before [you]195-madame bertaux ; if [you]195-madame bertaux return to [your]195-madame bertaux fogs and [your]195-madame bertaux tea - parties — ah , then , [Madame]195-madame bertaux , [your]195-madame bertaux genius will die and [your]195-madame bertaux heart will be broken . ”[248-jouffroy] IT was with great reluctance that [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy acceded to [Hadria]211-hadria 's wish to return [home]3770-home alone . [She]211-hadria watched [the river banks]2728-the river banks , and [the boats]2670-the boats coming and passing , with a look of farewell in [her]211-hadria eyes . [She]211-hadria meant to hold out to the utmost limits of the possible , but [she]211-hadria knew that the possible had limits , and [she]211-hadria awaited judgment at the bar of destiny . [She]211-hadria hurried [home]3770-home on arriving at [the quay]2731-the quay , and found [Henriette]142-henriette waiting for [her]211-hadria . “ What is it ? Tell [me]142-henriette at once , if anything is wrong . ”[142-henriette] “ Then [you]248-jouffroy knew [I]141-miss temperley was [here]3762-here ! ”[141-miss temperley] exclaimed [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . “ Yes ; [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy told [me]141-miss temperley . [He]248-jouffroy found [me]141-miss temperley at [St. Cloud]64-st. cloud . Tea was brought in by [Hannah]212-hannah , and a few questions were asked and answered . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley having been installed in an easy chair , and [her]141-miss temperley cloak and hat removed , said that [her]141-miss temperley stay in [Paris]35-paris was uncertain as to length . It would depend on many things . [Hadria]211-hadria rang for the tray to be taken away , after tea was over , and as [Hannah]212-hannah closed the door , a sensation of sick apprehension overcame [her]211-hadria , for a moment . [Henriette]142-henriette had obviously come to [Paris]35-paris in order to recapture [the fugitive]2733-the fugitive , and meant to employ all [her]142-henriette tact in the delicate mission . [She]142-henriette was devoted to [Hubert]118-hubert and [the children]667-the children , heart and soul , and would face anything on [their]2735-their behalf , including the present disagreeable task . [Hadria]211-hadria looked at [[her]211-hadria sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law with admiration . [She]211-hadria offered homage to the prowess of [the enemy]435-the enemy . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley held a commanding position , fortified by ideas and customs centuries old , and supported by [allies on every side]2738-allies on every side . It ran through [Hadria]211-hadria 's mind that it was possible to refuse to allow the subject to be broached , and thus escape the encounter altogether . It would save many words on both sides . But [Henriette]142-henriette had always been in [Hubert]118-hubert 's confidence , and it occurred to [Hadria]211-hadria that it might be well to define [her]211-hadria own position once more , since it was thus about to be directly and frankly attacked . Moreover , [Hadria]211-hadria began to be fired with the spirit of battle . It was not merely for [herself]211-hadria , but on behalf of [[her]211-hadria sex]2739-her sex , that [she]211-hadria longed to repudiate the insult that seemed to [her]211-hadria , to be involved in [Henriette]142-henriette 's whole philosophy . However , if [the enemy]435-the enemy [shewed]2741-shewed no signs of hostility , [Hadria]211-hadria resolved that [she]211-hadria also would keep the truce . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley had already mentioned that [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was now staying at [the Red House]34-the red house , for change of air . [She]97-mrs. fullerton had been far from well , and of course was worrying very much over these money troubles and perils ahead , as well as about [Hadria]211-hadria 's present action . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had [herself]97-mrs. fullerton suggested that [Henriette]142-henriette should go over to [Paris]35-paris to see what could be done to patch up the quarrel . “ Ah ! ”[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria , and a cloud settled on [her]211-hadria brow . [Henriette]142-henriette had indeed come armed cap à pie ! Do [you]211-hadria never think of that ? ”[211-hadria] There was another long pause . [The two women]2742-the two women sat opposite [one another]3945-one another . [I]2745-he admit it and regret it deeply . [Hubert]118-hubert lost [his]118-hubert temper ; that is the fact of the matter . [He]118-hubert thought [himself]118-hubert bitterly wronged by [you]211-hadria . ”[2745-he] Quite so ; [he]2745-he felt it a bitter wrong that [I]0-i should claim that liberty of action which [I]0-i warned [him]2745-he before [our]2746-our marriage that [I]0-i should claim . [You]142-henriette have kept [yourself]142-henriette thoroughly informed of [our]2756-our affairs .
