[[Your]142-henriette mentor]2763-your mentor must indeed be slumbering . [You]142-henriette are simply scathing — on [my]0-i behalf ! Have [you]142-henriette come all the way from [England]14-england for this ? ” “[142-henriette] [You]142-henriette wo n't understand . [I]0-i mean that motherhood has duties . [You]142-henriette ca n't deny that . ” “[142-henriette] [I]0-i can and [I]0-i do . ” [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley stared . “[0-i] [You]142-henriette will find [no human being]2764-no human being to agree with [you]142-henriette , ” [she]141-miss temperley said at length . “[142-henriette] That does not alter [my]0-i opinion . ” “[142-henriette] Oh , [Hadria]211-hadria , explain [yourself]142-henriette ! [You]142-henriette utter paradoxes . [I]0-i want to understand [your]142-henriette point of view . ” It is simple enough . [I]0-i deny that motherhood has duties except when it is absolutely free , absolutely uninfluenced by the pressure of opinion , or by any of the innumerable tyrannies that [most children]6354-most children have now to thank for [their]6354-most children existence . ”[0-i] [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley shook [her]141-miss temperley head . “ [I]141-miss temperley do n't see that any ‘ tyranny , ’ as [you]142-henriette call it , exonerates [a mother]4953-a mother from [her]4953-a mother duty to [[her]4953-a mother child]1838-her child . ”[141-miss temperley] “ There [we]6357-our differ . Motherhood , in [our]6357-our present social state , is the sign and seal as well as the means and method of [a woman]3753-a woman 's bondage . It forges chains of [her]3753-a woman own flesh and blood ; it weaves cords of [her]3753-a woman own love and instinct . [She]3753-a woman agonizes , and the fruit of [her]3753-a woman agony is not even legally [hers]3753-a woman . Name [me]0-i a position more abject ! [A woman with [a child]754-a child in [her]6359-a woman with a child in her arms arms]6359-a woman with a child in her arms is , to [me]0-i , the symbol of an abasement , an indignity , more complete , more disfiguring and terrible , than any form of humiliation that [the world]334-the world has ever seen . ”[0-i] “ [You]0-i must be mad ! ”[141-miss temperley] exclaimed [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . “ That symbol has stood to [the world]334-the world for all that is sweetest and holiest . ”[141-miss temperley] “ [I]0-i know it has ! So profound has been [our]6357-our humiliation ! ”[0-i] “ [I]211-hadria do n't know what to say to [anyone so wrong - headed]6363-anyone so wrong - headed and so twisted in sentiment . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria smiled thoughtfully . “ While [I]211-hadria am about it , [I]211-hadria may as well finish this disclosure of feeling , which , again [I]211-hadria warn [you]0-i , is not peculiar to [myself]211-hadria , however [you]0-i may lay that flattering unction to [your]0-i soul . [I]211-hadria have seen and heard of many a saddening evidence of [our]6357-our sex 's slavery since [I]211-hadria came to [this terrible and wonderful city]6364-this terrible and wonderful city : the crude , obvious buying and selling that [we]6357-our all shudder at ; but hideous as it is , to [me]211-hadria it is far less awful than this other respectable form of degradation that [everyone]3726-everyone glows and smirks over . ”[211-hadria] [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley clasped [her]141-miss temperley hands in despair . “ [I]141-miss temperley simply ca n't understand [you]211-hadria . What [you]211-hadria say is rank heresy against all that is most beautiful in human nature . ”[141-miss temperley] “ Surely the rank heresy is to be laid at the door of those who degrade and enslave that which [they]6366-they assert to be most beautiful in human nature . But [I]211-hadria am not speaking to convince ; merely to shew where [you]0-i can not count upon [me]211-hadria for a point of attack . Try something else . ”[211-hadria] “ But it is so strange , so insane , as it seems to [me]211-hadria . Do [you]211-hadria mean to throw contempt on [motherhood]6367-motherhood per se ? ”[211-hadria] “ [I]141-miss temperley am not discussing motherhood per se ; [no woman]5158-no woman has yet been in a position to know what it is per se , strange as it may appear . [No woman]5158-no woman has yet experienced it apart from the enormous pressure of law and opinion that has , always , formed part of its inevitable conditions . [The illegal mother]6370-the illegal mother is hounded by [[her]6370-the illegal mother fellows]4821-her fellows in one direction ; [the legal mother]6372-the legal mother is urged and incited in another : free motherhood is unknown amongst [us]6373-us . [I]141-miss temperley speak of it as it is . To speak of it per se , for the present , is to discuss the transcendental . ”[141-miss temperley] There was a moment 's excited pause , and [Hadria]211-hadria then went on more rapidly . “ [You]0-i know well enough , [Henriette]142-henriette , what [thousands of women there are to whom the birth of [[their]6374-thousands of women there are to whom the birth of their children is an intolerable burden , and a fierce misery from which many would gladly seek escape by death . and indeed many do seek escape by death children]654-their children is an intolerable burden , and a fierce misery from which many would gladly seek escape by death . And indeed many do seek escape by death]6374-thousands of women there are to whom the birth of their children is an intolerable burden , and a fierce misery from which many would gladly seek escape by death . and indeed many do seek escape by death . What is the use of this eternal conspiracy of silence about that which [every woman out of [her]6376-every woman out of her teens teens]6376-every woman out of her teens knows as well as [she]6376-every woman out of her teens knows [her]6376-every woman out of her teens own name ? ”[211-hadria] But [Henriette]142-henriette preferred to ignore that side of [her]142-henriette experience . [She]142-henriette murmured something about the maternal instinct , and its potency . “ [I]211-hadria do n't deny the potency of the instinct , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ but [I]211-hadria do say that it is shamefully presumed upon . Strong it obviously must be , if industrious cultivation and encouragements and threats and exhortations can make it so ! All the Past as well as all the weight of opinion and training in the Present has been at work on it , thrusting and alluring and coercing [the woman]4547-the woman to [her]4547-the woman man - allotted fate . ”[211-hadria] “ Nature - allotted , if [you]0-i please , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette . “ There is no need for alluring or coercing . ”[142-henriette] “ Why do it then ? Now , be frank , [Henriette]142-henriette , and try not to be offended . Would [you]0-i feel no sense of indignity in performing a function of this sort ( however noble and so on [you]0-i might think it per se ) , [you]0-i knew that it would be demanded of [you]0-i as a duty , if [you]0-i did not welcome it as a joy ? ”[211-hadria] “ [I]211-hadria should acknowledge it as a duty , if [I]211-hadria did not welcome it as a joy . ”[211-hadria] “ In other words , [you]0-i would accept the position of [a slave]2562-a slave . ”[142-henriette] “ How so ? ”[211-hadria] “ By bartering [your]0-i womanhood , by using these powers of body , in return for food and shelter and social favour , or for the sake of so - called ‘ duty ’ irrespective of — perhaps in direct opposition to [your]0-i feelings . How then do [you]0-i differ from [the slave woman who produces a progeny of [young slaves]6380-young slaves]6379-the slave woman who produces a progeny of young slaves , to be disposed of as shall seem good to [[her]6379-the slave woman who produces a progeny of young slaves perhaps indulgent master]6381-her perhaps indulgent master ? [I]211-hadria see no essential difference . ”[211-hadria] “ [I]142-henriette see the difference between honour and ignominy , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette . [Hadria]211-hadria shook [her]211-hadria head , sadly . “ The differences are all in detail and in circumstance . [I]211-hadria am sorry if [I]211-hadria offend [your]0-i taste . The facts are offensive . The bewildering thing is that the facts themselves never seem to offend [you]0-i ; only the mention of them . ”[211-hadria] “ It would take too long to go into this subject , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette . “ [I]142-henriette can only repeat that [I]142-henriette fail to understand [your]0-i extraordinary views of the holiest of human instincts . ”[142-henriette] “ That catch - word ! And [you]0-i use it rashly , [Henriette]142-henriette , for do [you]0-i not know that the deepest of all degradation comes of misusing that which is most holy ? ”[211-hadria] “ [A woman who does [her]6382-a woman who does her duty duty]6382-a woman who does her duty is not to be accused of misusing anything , ”[141-miss temperley] cried [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley hotly . “ Is there then no sin , no misuse of power in sending into [the world]334-the world swarms of fortuitous , poverty - stricken human souls , as those souls must be who are born in bondage , with the blended instincts of [the slave]6384-the slave and [the master]6153-the master for a proud inheritance ? It sounds awful [I]141-miss temperley know , but truth is apt to sound awful . Motherhood , as [our]6386-our wisdom has appointed it , among [civilized people]6387-civilized people , represents a prostitution of the reproductive powers , which precisely corresponds to that other abuse , which seems to most of [us]6386-our so infinitely more shocking . ”[141-miss temperley] [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley preferred not to reply to such a remark , and the entrance of [little Martha]129-martha relieved the tension of the moment . [Henriette]142-henriette , though [she]142-henriette bore [the child]4983-the child a grudge , could not resist [her]4983-the child when [she]142-henriette came forward and put up [her]142-henriette face to be kissed . “ [She]4983-the child is really growing very pretty , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette , in a tone which betrayed the agitation which [she]142-henriette had been struggling to hide . [Martha]129-martha ran for [her]129-martha doll and [[her]129-martha blue man]2766-her blue man , and was soon busy at play , in a corner of [the room]379-the room , building [Eiffel Towers]66-eiffel towers out of stone bricks , and knocking [them]66-eiffel towers down again . “ [I]211-hadria do n't yet quite understand , [Henriette]142-henriette , [your]142-henriette object in coming to [Paris]35-paris . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria 's voice had grown calmer . “ [I]211-hadria came to make an appeal to [your]142-henriette sense of duty and [your]142-henriette generosity . ”[211-hadria] “ Ah ! ”[142-henriette] “ [I]142-henriette came , ”[142-henriette] [Henriette]142-henriette went on , bracing [herself]142-henriette as if for a great effort , “ to remind [you]142-henriette that when [you]142-henriette married , [you]142-henriette entered into a contract which [you]142-henriette now repudiate . ”[142-henriette] [Hadria]211-hadria started up , reddening with anger . “ [I]211-hadria did no such thing , and [you]142-henriette know it , [Henriette]142-henriette . How do [you]142-henriette dare to sit there and tell [me]211-hadria that ? ”[211-hadria] “ [I]141-miss temperley tell [you]142-henriette nothing but the truth . [Every woman who marries enters , by that fact , into a contract]6388-every woman who marries enters , by that fact , into a contract . ”[141-miss temperley] [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley had evidently regarded this as a strong card and played it hopefully . [Hadria]211-hadria was trembling with anger . [She]211-hadria steadied [her]211-hadria voice . “ Then [you]142-henriette actually intended to entrap [me]211-hadria into this so - called contract , by leading [me]211-hadria to suppose that it would mean nothing more between [Hubert]118-hubert and [myself]211-hadria than an unavoidable formality ! [You]142-henriette tell [me]211-hadria this to [my]211-hadria face , and do n't appear to see that [you]142-henriette are confessing an act of deliberate treachery . ”[211-hadria] “ Nonsense , ”[142-henriette] cried [Henriette]142-henriette . “ There was nothing that [any sane person]6389-any sane person would have objected to , in [our]6390-our conduct . ”[142-henriette] [Hadria]211-hadria stood looking down scornfully on [[her]211-hadria sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law . [She]211-hadria shrugged [her]211-hadria shoulders , as if in bewilderment . “ And yet [you]142-henriette would have felt [yourselves]142-henriette stained with dishonour for the rest of [your]142-henriette lives had [you]142-henriette procured anything else on false pretences ! But [a woman]3753-a woman — that is a different affair . The code of honour does not here apply , it would seem . Any fraud may be honourably practised on [her]3753-a woman , and wild is the surprise and indignation if [she]3753-a woman objects when [she]3753-a woman finds it out . ”[211-hadria] “ [You]142-henriette are perfectly mad , ”[142-henriette] cried [Henriette]142-henriette , tapping angrily with [her]142-henriette fingers on the arm of [her]142-henriette chair . “ What [I]142-henriette say is true , whether [I]142-henriette be mad or sane . What [you]142-henriette call the ‘ contract ’ is simply a cunning contrivance for making [a woman]3753-a woman and [[her]3753-a woman possible children]6393-her possible children the legal property of [a man]3704-a man , and for enlisting [her]3753-a woman own honour and conscience to safeguard the disgraceful transaction . ”[142-henriette] “ Ah , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette , on the watch for [her]142-henriette opportunity , “ then [you]142-henriette admit that [her]3753-a woman honour and conscience are enlisted ? ”[142-henriette] “ Certainly , in the case of [most women]4904-most women . That enlistment is a masterpiece of policy . To make [a prisoner]6396-a prisoner [[his]6396-a prisoner own warder]6397-his own warder is surely no light stroke of genius . But that is exactly what [I]142-henriette refused to be from the first , and [no one]383-no one could have spoken more plainly . And now [you]142-henriette are shocked and pained and aggrieved because [I]142-henriette wo n't eat [my]142-henriette words . There is indeed war to the knife between [the sexes]2343-the sexes ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria stood with [her]211-hadria elbows on the back of a high arm - chair , [her]211-hadria chin resting on [her]211-hadria hands . “ It is not fair to use that word . [You]142-henriette neither of [you]142-henriette lack brains , at any rate . ”[211-hadria] [Henriette]142-henriette clenched [her]142-henriette hands in the effort of self - control . “ In ninety - nine cases out of a hundred , [our]6402-we forecasts would have come true , ”[142-henriette] [she]142-henriette said . “ [I]142-henriette mean — ”[142-henriette] “ That is refreshingly frank , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [We]6402-we thought [we]6402-we acted for the best . ”[211-hadria] “ Oh , if it comes to that , [the Spanish Inquisitors]6406-the spanish inquisitors doubtless thought that [they]6406-the spanish inquisitors were acting for the best , when [they]6406-the spanish inquisitors made bonfires of [heretics]6407-heretics in [the market - places]6408-the market - places . ”[142-henriette] [Henriette]142-henriette bent [her]142-henriette head and clasped the arms of the chair , tightly . “ Well , if there be [any one at fault in the matter]6409-any one at fault in the matter , [I]142-henriette am [the culprit]920-the culprit , ”[142-henriette] [she]142-henriette said in a voice that trembled . “ It was [I]142-henriette who assured [Hubert]118-hubert that experience would alter [you]118-hubert . [She]211-hadria went to the window and stood leaning against the casement , with crossed arms . But [Hadria]211-hadria was only roused by the remonstrance . “ [It]6414-it is [cunning , shallow , heartless women , who really fare best in [our]6416-us society]6415-cunning , shallow , heartless women , who really fare best in our society ; its conditions suit [them]6415-cunning , shallow , heartless women , who really fare best in our society . [We]6416-us live in a scientific age ; [the fittest]1174-the fittest survive . Let [us]6416-us be ‘ fit . ’ ”[141-miss temperley] “ Let [us]6416-us be womanly , let [us]6416-us do [our]6416-us duty , let [us]6416-us hearken to [our]6416-us conscience ! ”[142-henriette] cried [Henriette]142-henriette . “ Thank [you]142-henriette ! That is the conclusion to which [you]142-henriette drive [me]142-henriette and [the rest of [us]6416-us]1660-the rest of us , [Henriette]142-henriette . ”[142-henriette] “ [Charity]262-charity demands that [I]141-miss temperley do not believe what [you]142-henriette say , ”[141-miss temperley] said [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley . “ Oh , do n't trouble to be charitable ! ”[141-miss temperley] [Henriette]142-henriette heaved a deep sigh . “ [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[142-henriette] [she]142-henriette said , “ are [you]211-hadria going to allow [your]211-hadria petty rancour about this — well , [I]142-henriette will call it error of [ours]6416-us , if [you]211-hadria like to be severe — are [you]211-hadria going to bear malice and ruin [your]211-hadria own life and [Hubert]118-hubert 's and [the children]667-the children 's ?
