[I]0-i — ” “[0-i] When have [I]0-i disputed that ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria advanced towards [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , and stood looking [her]141-miss temperley full in the face . “[0-i] [I]0-i believe that [Hubert]118-hubert has acted conscientiously , according to [his]118-hubert standard . But [I]0-i detest [his]118-hubert standard . [He]118-hubert did not think it wrong or treacherous to behave as [he]118-hubert did towards [me]0-i . But it is that very fact that [I]0-i so bitterly resent . [I]0-i could have forgiven [him]118-hubert a sin against [myself]0-i alone , which [he]118-hubert acknowledged to be a sin . But this is a sin against [my]0-i entire sex , which [he]118-hubert does not acknowledge to be a sin . It is the insolence that is implied in supposing it allowable for [a man]3704-a man to trick [a woman]3753-a woman in that way , without the smallest damage to [his]3704-a man self - respect , that sticks so in [my]0-i throat . What does it imply as regards [his]118-hubert attitude towards [all women]4191-all women ? Ah ! it is that which makes [me]0-i feel so rancorous . And [I]0-i resent [Hubert]118-hubert 's calm assumption that [he]118-hubert had a right to judge what was best for [me]0-i , and even to force [me]0-i , by fraud , into following [his]118-hubert view , leaving [me]0-i afterwards to adjust [myself]0-i with circumstance as best [I]0-i might : to make [my]0-i bitter choice between unconditional surrender , and the infliction of pain and distress , on [him]118-hubert , on [[my]0-i parents]2780-my parents , on [everybody]3781-everybody . Ah , [you]0-i calculated cunningly , [Henriette]142-henriette ! [I]0-i am [a coward about giving pain]2782-a coward about giving pain , little as [you]0-i may now be disposed to credit it . [You]0-i have tight hold of the end of [my]0-i chain . ” [Hadria]211-hadria was pacing restlessly up and down [the room]379-the room . [Little Martha]129-martha ran out with [her]129-martha doll , and offered it , as if with a view to chase away the perturbed look from [Hadria]211-hadria 's face . [The latter]590-the latter stooped mechanically and took the doll , smiling [her]129-martha thanks , and stroking [the child]4983-the child 's fair curls tenderly . Then [she]129-martha recommenced [her]129-martha walk up and down [the room]379-the room , carrying the doll carefully on [her]129-martha arm . “[0-i] Take care of [dolly]2783-dolly , ” [Martha]129-martha recommended , and went back to [her]129-martha other toys . “[0-i] Yes , [Henriette]142-henriette , [you]142-henriette and [Hubert]118-hubert have made [your]142-henriette calculations cleverly . [You]142-henriette have advocates only too eloquent in [[my]0-i woman]2784-my woman 's temperament . [You]142-henriette have succeeded only too well by [your]142-henriette fraud , through which [I]0-i now stand here , with a life in fragments , bound , chafe as [I]0-i may , to choose between alternative disasters for [myself]0-i and for all of [us]2785-us . Had [you]142-henriette two only acted straightly with [me]0-i , and kindly allowed [me]0-i to judge for [myself]0-i , instead of treacherously insisting on judging for [me]0-i , this knot of [your]142-henriette tying which [you]142-henriette naïvely bring [me]0-i to unravel , would never have wrung the life out of [me]0-i as it is doing now — nor would it have caused [you]142-henriette and [Hubert]118-hubert so much virtuous distress . ” [Hadria]211-hadria recommenced [her]211-hadria restless pacing to and fro . “[211-hadria] But , [Hadria]211-hadria , do be calm , do look at the matter from [our]2785-us point of view . [I]0-i have owned [my]0-i indiscretion . ” ( [Hadria]211-hadria gave a little scornful cry . ) “[0-i] Surely [you]211-hadria are not going to throw over all allegiance to [[your]211-hadria husband]1288-your husband on that account , even granting [he]1288-your husband was to blame . ” [Hadria]211-hadria stopped abruptly . “[0-i] [I]0-i deny that [I]0-i owe allegiance to [a man who so treated [me]0-i]2787-a man who so treated me . [I]0-i do n't deny that [he]1288-your husband had excuses . The common standards exonerate [him]1288-your husband ; but , good heavens , a sense of humour , if nothing else , ought to save [him]1288-your husband from making this grotesque claim on [[his]1288-your husband victim]2788-his victim ! To preach the duties of [wife]1287-wife and [mother]3851-mother to [me]0-i ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria broke into a laugh . “[3851-mother] It is inconceivably comic . ” [Henriette]142-henriette shrugged [her]142-henriette shoulders . “[0-i] [I]0-i fear [my]0-i sense of humour is defective . [I]0-i ca n't see the justice of repudiating the duty of one 's position , since there the position is , an accomplished fact not to be denied . Why not make the best of it ? ” “[142-henriette] [Henriette]142-henriette , [you]142-henriette are amazing ! Supposing [a wicked bigamist]2791-a wicked bigamist had persuaded [a woman]3753-a woman to go through a false marriage ceremony , and when [she]3753-a woman became aware of [her]3753-a woman real position , imagine [him]1288-your husband saying to [her]3753-a woman , with grave and virtuous mien , ‘ [[My]0-i dear]3722-my dear , why repudiate the duties of [your]3753-a woman position , since there [your]3753-a woman position is , an accomplished fact not to be denied ? ’ ” “[1288-your husband] Oh , that 's preposterous , ” cried [Henriette]142-henriette . “[1288-your husband] It 's preposterous and it 's parallel . ” “[118-hubert] [Hubert]118-hubert did not try to entrap [you]142-henriette into doing what was wrong . ” “[118-hubert] [We]2794-we need not discuss that , for it is not the point . The point is that the position ( be that right or wrong ) was forced on [the woman]4547-the woman in both cases by fraud , and is then used as a pretext to exact from [her]4547-the woman the desired conduct ; what [the author of the fraud]2796-the author of the fraud euphoniously calls ‘ duty . ’ ” “[142-henriette] [You]142-henriette are positively insulting ! ” cried [Henriette]142-henriette , rising . By this time , [Hadria]211-hadria had allowed the doll to slip back , and its limp body was hanging down disconsolately from [her]211-hadria elbow , although [she]211-hadria was clutching it , with absent - minded anxiety , to [her]211-hadria side , in the hope of arresting its threatened fall . “[142-henriette] Oh , look at dolly , look , look ! ” cried [Martha]129-martha reproachfully . [Hadria]211-hadria seized [its]211-hadria legs and pulled [it]211-hadria back again , murmuring some consolatory promise to [its mistress]1682-its mistress . “[142-henriette] It is strange how [you]142-henriette succeed in putting [me]0-i on the defensive , [Henriette]142-henriette — [I]0-i who have been wronged . A horrible wrong it is too . It has ruined [my]0-i life . [You]142-henriette will never know all that it implies , never , never , though [I]0-i talk till Doomsday . [Nobody]3732-nobody will — except [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . ” [Henriette]142-henriette gave a horrified gesture . “[116-professor fortescue] [I]0-i believe [you]142-henriette are in love with [that man]5238-that man . That is the cause of all this wild conduct . ” [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley had lost self - control for a moment . [Hadria]211-hadria looked at [her]142-henriette steadily . “[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]142-henriette pardon . [I]0-i spoke in haste , [Hadria]211-hadria . [You]142-henriette have [your]142-henriette faults , but [Hubert]118-hubert has nothing to fear from [you]142-henriette in that respect , [I]0-i am sure . ” “[118-hubert] Really ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria had come forward and was standing with [her]211-hadria left elbow on the mantel - piece , the doll still tucked under [her]211-hadria right arm . “[118-hubert] And [you]142-henriette think that [I]0-i would , at all hazards , respect a legal tie which no feeling consecrates ? ” “[142-henriette] [I]0-i do [you]142-henriette that justice , ” murmured [Henriette]142-henriette , turning very white . “[142-henriette] [You]142-henriette think that [I]0-i should regard [myself]0-i as so completely the property of [a man whom [I]0-i do not love , and who actively dislikes [me]0-i , as to hold [my]0-i very feelings in trust for [him]118-hubert]2799-a man whom i do not love , and who actively dislikes me , as to hold my very feelings in trust for him . Disabuse [yourself]142-henriette of that idea , [Henriette]142-henriette . [I]0-i claim rights over [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i will hold [myself]0-i in pawn for [no man]4555-no man . This is no news either to [you]142-henriette or to [Hubert]118-hubert . Why pretend that it is ? ” [Henriette]142-henriette covered [her]142-henriette face with [her]142-henriette hands . “[0-i] [I]0-i can but hope , ” [she]0-i said at length , “[0-i] that even now [you]142-henriette are saying these horrible things out of mere opposition . [I]0-i can not , [I]0-i simply can not believe , that [you]142-henriette would bring disgrace upon [us]2801-us all . ” “[142-henriette] If [you]142-henriette chose to regard it as a disgrace that [I]0-i should make so bold as to lay claim to [myself]0-i , that , it seems to [me]0-i , would be [your]142-henriette own fault . ” [Henriette]142-henriette sprang forward white and trembling , and clutched [Hadria]211-hadria 's arm excitedly . “[142-henriette] Ah ! [you]142-henriette could not ! [you]142-henriette could not ! Think of [[your]142-henriette mother]832-your mother and [father]3862-father , if [you]142-henriette will not think of [[your]142-henriette husband]1288-your husband and [children]626-children . [You]142-henriette terrify [me]0-i ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria was moved with pity at [Henriette]142-henriette 's white quivering face . “[142-henriette] Do n't trouble , ” [she]211-hadria said , more gently . “[142-henriette] There is no thunderbolt about to fall in [our]2806-us discreet circle . ” ( A hideous crash from the overturning of one of [Martha]129-martha 's [Eiffel Towers]66-eiffel towers seemed to belie the words . ) [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley 's clutch relaxed , and [she]141-miss temperley gave a gasp of relief . “[142-henriette] Tell [me]0-i , [Hadria]211-hadria , that [you]211-hadria did not mean what [you]211-hadria said . ” “[211-hadria] [I]0-i ca n't do that , for [I]0-i meant it , every syllable . ” “[0-i] Promise [me]0-i then at least , that before [you]211-hadria do anything to bring misery and disgrace on [us]2806-us all , [you]211-hadria will tell [us]2806-us of [your]211-hadria intention , and give [us]2806-us a chance of putting [our]2806-us side of the matter before [you]211-hadria . ” “[211-hadria] Of protecting [your]211-hadria vested interests , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria ; “[211-hadria] [your]211-hadria right of way through [my]0-i flesh and spirit . ” “[211-hadria] Of course [you]211-hadria put it unkindly . ” “[211-hadria] [I]0-i will not make promises for the future . The future is quite enough hampered with the past , without setting anticipatory traps and springes for unwary feet . But [I]0-i refuse this promise merely on general principles . [I]0-i am not about to distress [you]211-hadria in that particular way , though [I]0-i think [you]211-hadria would only have [yourselves]211-hadria to blame if [I]0-i were . ” [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley drew another deep breath , and the colour began to return to [her]141-miss temperley face . “[0-i] So far , so good , ” [she]141-miss temperley said . “[0-i] Now tell [me]0-i — Is there nothing that would make [you]211-hadria accept [your]211-hadria duties ? ” “[0-i] Even if [I]0-i were to accept what [you]211-hadria call [my]0-i duties , it would not be in the spirit that [you]211-hadria would desire to see . It would be in cold acknowledgment of the force of existing facts — facts which [I]0-i regard as preposterous , but admit to be coercive . ” [Henriette]142-henriette sank wearily into [her]142-henriette chair . “[211-hadria] Do [you]211-hadria then hold it justifiable for [a woman]3753-a woman to inflict pain on those near to [her]3753-a woman , by a conduct that [she]3753-a woman may think justifiable in itself ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria hesitated for a moment . “[211-hadria] [A woman]3753-a woman is so desperately entangled , and restricted , and betrayed , by common consent , in [our]2809-our society , that [I]0-i hold [her]3753-a woman justified in using desperate means , as one who fights for dear life . [She]3753-a woman may harden [her]3753-a woman heart — if [she]3753-a woman can . ” “[3753-a woman] [I]0-i am thankful to think that [she]3753-a woman very seldom can ! ” cried [Henriette]142-henriette . “[3753-a woman] Ah ! that is [our]2809-our weak point ! For a long time to come , [we]2809-our shall be overpowered by [our]2809-our own cage - born instincts , by [our]2809-our feminine conscience that has been trained so cleverly to dog [the woman]4547-the woman 's footsteps , in [man]332-man 's interest — [[his]332-man detective]2812-his detective in plain clothes ! ” “[0-i] Of course , if [you]0-i repudiate all moral claim — ” began [Henriette]142-henriette , weakly . “[0-i] [I]0-i will not insult [your]0-i intelligence by considering that remark . ” “[0-i] Are [you]0-i determined to harden [yourself]0-i against every appeal ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria looked at [[her]211-hadria sister - in - law]4937-her sister - in - law , in silence . “[0-i] Why do n't [you]0-i answer [me]0-i , [Hadria]211-hadria ? ” “[0-i] Because [I]0-i have just been endeavouring , evidently in vain , to explain in what light [I]0-i regard appeals on this point . ” “[0-i] Then [Hubert]118-hubert and [the children]667-the children are to be punished for what [you]0-i are pleased to call [his]118-hubert fraud — the fraud of [a man in love with [you]0-i]2814-a man in love with you , anxious to please [you]0-i , to agree with [you]0-i , and believing [you]0-i too good and noble to allow [his]118-hubert life to be spoilt by [this girl]2815-this girl 's craze for freedom . It is inconceivable ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i fear that [Hubert]118-hubert must be prepared to endure the consequences of [his]118-hubert actions , like [the rest of [us]2817-we]1660-the rest of us . It is the custom , [I]0-i know , for the sex that [men]3698-men call weaker , to saddle [themselves]3698-men with the consequences of [men]3698-men 's deeds , but [I]0-i think [we]2817-we should have a saner , and a juster world if the custom were discontinued . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i have missed one of the noblest lessons of life , [Hadria]211-hadria , ” cried [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , rising to leave . “[211-hadria] [You]0-i do not understand the meaning of self - sacrifice . ” “[211-hadria] A principle that , in [woman]3844-woman , has been desecrated by misuse , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[211-hadria] There is no power , no quality , no gift or virtue , physical or moral , that [we]2817-we have not been trained to misuse . Self - sacrifice stands high on the list . ” [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley shrugged [her]141-miss temperley shoulders , sadly and hopelessly . “[0-i] [You]0-i have fortified [yourself]0-i on every side . [My]0-i words only prompt [you]0-i to throw up another earthwork at the point attacked . [I]0-i do harm instead of good . [I]0-i will leave [you]0-i to think the matter over alone . ” [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley moved towards the door . “[0-i] Ah , [you]0-i are clever , [Henriette]142-henriette ! [You]0-i know well that [I]0-i am far better acquainted with the weak points of [my]0-i own fortifications than [you]0-i can be , who did not build them , and that when [I]0-i have done with the defence against [you]0-i , [I]0-i shall commence the attack [myself]0-i . [You]0-i have all the advantages on [your]0-i side . [Mine]0-i is a forlorn hope:—a handful of Greeks at [Thermopylae]67-thermopylae against [all the host of [the Great King]2822-the great king]2821-all the host of the great king . [We]2823-we are foredoomed ; [the little band]2824-the little band must fall , but some day , [Henriette]142-henriette , when [you]0-i and [I]0-i shall be no more troubled with these turbulent questions — some day , [these great blundering hosts of barbarians]2825-these great blundering hosts of barbarians will be driven back , and [the Greek]263-the greek will conquer . Then [the realm of liberty]2826-the realm of liberty will grow wide ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i begin to hate the very name ! ” exclaimed [Henriette]142-henriette . [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes flashed , and [she]211-hadria stood drawn up , straight and defiant , before the mantel - piece . “[0-i] Ah ! there is [a fiercer Salamis]2827-a fiercer salamis and [a crueller Marathon yet to be fought]2828-a crueller marathon yet to be fought , before [the world]334-the world will so much as guess what freedom means . [I]0-i have no illusions now , regarding [my]0-i own chances , but [I]0-i should hold it as an honour to stand and fall at [Thermopylae]67-thermopylae , with [Leonidas]264-leonidas and [[his]264-leonidas Spartans]2830-his spartans . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i believe that some day [you]0-i will see things with different eyes , ” said [Henriette]142-henriette . The doll fell with a great crash , into the fender among the fire - irons , and there was a little burst of laughter . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley passed through the door , at the same instant , with great dignity . AS [Hadria]211-hadria had foretold , [she]141-miss temperley commenced the attack on [herself]141-miss temperley as soon as [Henriette]142-henriette had departed , and all night long , the stormy inner debate was kept up . [Her]211-hadria mind never wavered , but [her]211-hadria heart was rebellious . [Hubert]118-hubert deserved to pay for [his]118-hubert conduct ; but if [we]6432-we all had to pay for [our]6432-we conduct to the uttermost farthing , that would be hard , if just . If [Hadria]211-hadria assumed the burden of [Hubert]118-hubert 's debt , it would mean what [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy had pointed out . [Hubert]118-hubert 's suffering would be only on account of offended public opinion ; [hers]211-hadria — but then [[her]211-hadria parents]3931-her parents would suffer as well as [Hubert]118-hubert . Round and round went the thoughts , like vast wheels , and when towards morning , [she]211-hadria dozed off a little , the wheels were still turning in a vague , weary way , and as they turned , the life seemed to be crushed gradually out of the sleeper . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy came to enquire whether the decision had been made . [He]248-jouffroy was in a state of great excitement . [He]248-jouffroy gave fervent thanks that [Hadria]211-hadria had stood firm . “[0-i] [You]2831-you do not forget [my]0-i words , [Madame]195-madame bertaux ? ” “[195-madame bertaux] [I]0-i shall never forget them , [Monsieur]2832-monsieur . ” [Henriette]142-henriette discreetly forbore to say anything further on the subject of dispute . [She]142-henriette waited , hopefully . “[2832-monsieur] [Hubert]118-hubert has been troubled about the money that [[your]0-i father]705-your father set apart , on [your]0-i marriage , as a contribution to the household expenses , ” [she]142-henriette said , one morning . “[0-i] [[Your]0-i father]705-your father did not place it all in [your]0-i name . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] It is tied up , in some way , for the use of [the family]360-the family . [I]0-i have a small sum only in [my]0-i own control . ” “[118-hubert] [Hubert]118-hubert is now leaving half of it to accumulate . The other half has still to go towards the expenses at [the Red House]4718-the red house . [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i approve ? ” “[0-i] Certainly , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [[My]0-i father]4257-my father designed it for that purpose . ” “[4257-my father] But [Hubert]118-hubert feared [you]0-i might be running short of money , and wished to send [you]0-i some ; but [the trustees]2838-the trustees say it is against the conditions of the trust . ” “[2838-the trustees] So [I]0-i suppose . ” “[2838-the trustees] [I]0-i wanted [you]0-i to know about it , that is all , ” said [Henriette]142-henriette , “[0-i] Also , [I]0-i should like to say that though [Hubert]118-hubert does not feel that [he]118-hubert can ask [you]0-i to return to [the Red House]4718-the red house , after what has happened — [he]118-hubert can not risk [your]0-i refusing — yet [I]0-i take it on [myself]0-i to tell [you]0-i , that [he]118-hubert would only be too glad if [you]0-i would go back . ” “[0-i] Thank [you]0-i , [I]0-i understand . ” Next morning , [Henriette]142-henriette came with a letter in [her]142-henriette hand . “[0-i] Bad news ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed . The letter announced the failure of [the Company]4609-the company . It was the final blow . [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee would have to be given up . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton 's settlement was all that [she]97-mrs. fullerton and [[her]97-mrs. fullerton husband]553-her husband would now have to live upon . [Hadria]211-hadria sat gazing at the letter , with a dazed expression . Almost before the full significance of the calamity had been realized , a telegram arrived , announcing that [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had fallen dangerously ill . The rest of that day was spent in packing , writing notes , settling accounts , and preparing for departure . “[0-i] When — how are [you]0-i going ? ” cried [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , in dismay . “[0-i] By [the night boat]2840-the night boat , by [the night boat]2840-the night boat , ” [Hadria]211-hadria replied hurriedly , as if the hurry of [her]211-hadria speech would quicken [her]211-hadria arrival in [England]14-england . [The great arches of [the station]3893-the station]6436-the great arches of the station which had appealed to [her]211-hadria imagination , at the moment of arrival , swept upward , hard and grey , in the callous blue light . [Hadria]211-hadria breathed deep . Was [she]211-hadria [the same person who had arrived that night , with every nerve thrilled with hope and resolve]6438-the same person who had arrived that night , with every nerve thrilled with hope and resolve ? Ah ! there had been so much to learn , and the time had been so short . Starting with [her]211-hadria present additional experience , [she]211-hadria could have managed so much better . But of what use to think of that ? How different the homeward journey from the intoxicating outward flight , in the heyday of the spring ! What did that telegram mean ? Ill ; dangerously , dangerously . The words seemed to be repeated cruelly , insistently , by the jogging of [the train]3892-the train and the rumble of the wheels . The anxiety gnawed on , rising at times into terror , dulling again to a steady ache . And then remorse began to fit a long - pointed fang into a sensitive spot in [her]211-hadria heart . In vain to resist . It was securely placed . Let reason hold [her]211-hadria peace . A thousand fears , regrets , self - accusations , revolts , swarmed insect - like in [Hadria]211-hadria 's brain , as [the train]3892-the train thundered through the darkness , every tumultuous sound and motion exaggerated to the consciousness , by the fact that there was no distraction of the attention by outside objects . Nothing offered itself to the sight except the strange lights and shadows of the lamp thrown on the cushions of [the carriage]2272-the carriage ; [Henriette]142-henriette 's figure in one corner , [Hannah]212-hannah , with [the child]4983-the child , in another , and the various rugs and trappings of wandering Britons . Everything was contracted , narrow . [The sea - passage]6443-the sea - passage had the same sinister character . [Hadria]211-hadria compared it to the crossing of [the Styx]68-the styx in [[Charon]265-charon 's gloomy ferry - boat]6444-charon 's gloomy ferry - boat . [She]211-hadria felt a patriotic thrill on hearing the first mellow English voice pronouncing the first kindly English sentence . The simple , slow , honest quality of the English nature gave [one]329-one a sense of safety . What splendid raw material to make [a nation]2577-a nation out of ! But , ah , it was sometimes dull to live with ! These impressions , floating vaguely in the upper currents of the mind , were simultaneous with a thousand thoughts and anxieties , and gusts of bitter fear and grief . What would be the end of it all ? This uprooting from [the old home]6447-the old home — it wrung [one]329-one 's heart to think of it . Scarcely could the thought be faced . [[Her]211-hadria father]609-her father , [an exile from [[his]609-her father beloved fields and [hills]6452-hills]6451-his beloved fields and hills]6450-an exile from his beloved fields and hills ; [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother banished from [[her]520-her mother domain]6454-her domain of so many years , and after all these disappointments and mortifications and sorrows ! It was piteous . Where would [they]6455-they live ? What would [they]6455-they do ? [Hadria]211-hadria fought with [her]211-hadria tears . Ah ! it was hard for [old people]6456-old people to have to start life anew , bitterly hard . This was the moment for [[their]6456-old people children]654-their children to flock to [their]6456-old people rescue , to surround [them]6456-old people with care , with affection , with devotion ; to make [them]6456-old people feel that at least something that could be trusted , was left to [them]6456-old people from the wreck . “[0-i] Ah ! [poor mother]2842-poor mother , [poor kind father]2843-poor kind father , [you]2843-poor kind father were very good to [us]2844-us all , very , very good ! ” [MRS . FULLERTON]97-mrs. fullerton 'S illness proved even more serious than [the doctor]1471-the doctor had expected . [She]97-mrs. fullerton asked so incessantly for [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughters]364-her daughters , especially [Hadria]211-hadria , that all question of difference between [her]97-mrs. fullerton and [Hubert]118-hubert was laid aside , by tacit consent , and [the sisters]3872-the sisters took [their]3872-the sisters place at [[their]3872-the sisters mother]363-their mother 's bedside . [The doctor]1471-the doctor said that [the patient]6463-the patient must have been suffering , for many years , from an exhausted state of the nerves and from some kind of trouble . Had [she]4254-my mother had any great disappointment or anxiety ? [Hadria]211-hadria and [Algitha]81-algitha glanced at [one another]3945-one another . “[2843-poor kind father] Yes , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha , “[2843-poor kind father] [[my]0-i mother]4254-my mother has had a lot of [troublesome children]2846-troublesome children to worry and disappoint [her]4254-my mother . ” “[2846-troublesome children] Ah ! ” exclaimed [the doctor]1471-the doctor , nodding [his]1471-the doctor head . “[2846-troublesome children] Well , now has come a crisis in [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton 's condition . This illness has been incubating for years . [She]97-mrs. fullerton must have undergone mental misery of a very acute kind , whether or not the cause may have been adequate . If [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children desire to keep [her]97-mrs. fullerton among [them]576-her children , it will be necessary to treat [her]97-mrs. fullerton with the utmost care , and to oppose [her]97-mrs. fullerton in nothing . Further disappointment or chagrin , [she]97-mrs. fullerton has no longer the power to stand . There are complications . [Her]97-mrs. fullerton heart will give trouble , and all [your]2848-your vigilance and forbearance are called for , to avoid serious consequences . [I]0-i think it right to speak frankly , for everything depends — and always hereafter will depend — on [the patient]6463-the patient 's being saved as much as possible from the repetition of any former annoyance or sorrow . At best , there will be much for [her]97-mrs. fullerton to endure ; [I]0-i dread an uprooting of long familiar habits for [any one of [her]97-mrs. fullerton age]2850-any one of her age . [Her]97-mrs. fullerton life , if not [her]97-mrs. fullerton reason , are in [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children 's hands . ” A time of terrible anxiety followed , for [the inmates of [the Red House]4718-the red house]6466-the inmates of the red house . [The doctor]1471-the doctor insisted on [a trained nurse]6469-a trained nurse . [Algitha]81-algitha and [Hadria]211-hadria felt uneasy when [they]576-her children were away , even for a moment , from [the sick - room]6470-the sick - room , but [the doctor]1471-the doctor reminded [them]576-her children of the necessity , for [the patient]6463-the patient 's sake as well as [their]576-her children own , of keeping up [their]576-her children strength . [He]1471-the doctor warned [them]576-her children that there would be a long strain upon [them]576-her children , and that any lack of common sense , as regards [their]576-her children own health , would certainly diminish [the patient]6463-the patient 's chances of recovery . [Nobody]3732-nobody had [his]3732-nobody clearest judgment and [his]3732-nobody quickest observation at command , when nervously exhausted . Everything might depend on a moment 's decision , a moment 's swiftness of insight . The warning was not thrown away , but [both sisters]3874-both sisters found the incessant precautions trying . Every thought , every emotion was swallowed up in the one awful anxiety . “[211-hadria] Oh , [Hadria]211-hadria , [I]0-i feel as if this were [my]0-i fault , ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha , on one still , ominous night , after [she]81-algitha had resigned [her]81-algitha post at the bedside to [the nurse]1797-the nurse , who was to fill it for a couple of hours , after which [Hadria]211-hadria took [her]211-hadria turn of watching . “[211-hadria] [You]211-hadria ? It was [I]0-i , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , with trembling lips . “[0-i] [Mother]103-mother has never been strong , ” [Algitha]81-algitha went on . “[103-mother] And [my]0-i leaving [home]3770-home was the beginning of all this trouble . ” “[0-i] And [my]0-i leaving [home]3770-home the end of it , ” [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister added . [Algitha]81-algitha was walking restlessly to and fro . “[0-i] And [I]0-i went to [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee so often , so often , ” [she]0-i cried tearfully , “[0-i] so that [mother]3851-mother should not feel deserted , and [you]2855-you too came , and [the boys]3870-the boys when [they]3870-the boys could . But [she]103-mother never got over [my]0-i leaving ; [she]103-mother seemed to resent [my]0-i independence , [my]0-i habit of judging for [myself]0-i ; [she]103-mother hated every detail in which [I]0-i differed from [the girls [she]103-mother knew]2857-the girls she knew . If [I]0-i had married and gone to [the Antipodes]69-the antipodes , [she]103-mother would have been quite satisfied , but — ” “[103-mother] Ah , why do [people]3687-people need [human souls]2859-human souls for [their]3687-people daily food ? ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria mournfully . [She]211-hadria flung open the window of [the bedroom]6478-the bedroom , and looked out over the deadly stillness of [the fields]4328-the fields and the heavy darkness . “[103-mother] But [they]3687-people do need [them]2859-human souls , ” [she]211-hadria said , in the same quiet , hopeless tone , “[3687-people] and the souls have got to be provided . ” “[1471-the doctor] What is the time ? ” asked [Algitha]81-algitha . A clock had struck , outside . “[1471-the doctor] Could it be the clock of [Craddock church]33-craddock church ? The sound must have stolen down [hill]2860-hill , through the still air . ” “[1471-the doctor] It struck three . ” “[1471-the doctor] [You]2861-you ought to get some sleep , ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha . “[1471-the doctor] Remember what [the doctor]1471-the doctor said . ” “[1471-the doctor] [I]0-i feel so nervous , so anxious . [I]0-i could not sleep . ” “[0-i] Just for a few minutes , ” [Algitha]81-algitha urged . [Hadria]211-hadria consented at last , to go into [[her]211-hadria room]4419-her room , which adjoined [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister 's , and lie down on the bed . The door was open between [the rooms]6016-the rooms . “[0-i] [You]2861-you must do the same , ” [she]211-hadria stipulated . There was silence for some minutes , but the silence swarmed with the ghosts of voices . The air seemed thick with shapes , and terrors , and strange warnings . [The doctor]1471-the doctor had not disguised the fact that [the patient]6463-the patient was fighting hard for life , and that it was impossible to predict the result . Everything depended on whether [her]211-hadria strength would hold out . The weakness of the heart was an unfortunate element in the case . To save strength and give plentiful nourishment , without heightening the fever , must be the constant effort . [Algitha]81-algitha 's experience stood [her]211-hadria in good stead . [Her]211-hadria practical ability had been quickened and disciplined by [her]211-hadria work . [She]211-hadria had trained [herself]211-hadria in nursing , among other things . [Hadria]211-hadria 's experience was small . [She]211-hadria had to summon [her]211-hadria intelligence to the rescue . [The Fullerton stock]1207-the fullerton stock had never been deficient in this particular . In difficult moments , when rule and tradition had done [their]6486-their utmost , [Hadria]211-hadria had often some original device to suggest , to fit the individual case , which tided [them]6486-their over a crisis , or avoided some threatening predicament . “[2861-you] Are [you]2861-you sleeping ? ” asked [Algitha]81-algitha , very softly . “[2861-you] No , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria ; “[2861-you] [I]0-i feel very uneasy to - night . [I]0-i think [I]0-i will go down . ” “[0-i] Do try to get a little rest first , [Hadria]211-hadria ; [your]211-hadria watch is next , and [you]211-hadria must not go to it fagged out . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know , but [I]0-i feel full of dread . [I]0-i must just go and see that all is right . ” “[0-i] Then [I]0-i will come too , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha . [They]6487-they stole down [stairs]6488-stairs together , in the dim light of the oil lamps that were kept burning all night . The clock struck the half - hour as [they]6487-they passed along [the landing]6489-the landing . A strange fancy came to [Hadria]211-hadria , that a dusky figure drifted away before [her]211-hadria , as [she]211-hadria advanced . It seemed as though death had receded at [her]211-hadria approach . The old childish love for [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother had revived in all its force , during this long fight with [the reaper of souls]6491-the reaper of souls . [She]211-hadria felt all [her]211-hadria energies strung with the tension of battle . [She]211-hadria fought against a dark horror that [she]211-hadria could not face . Knowing , and realising vividly , that if [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother lived , [her]211-hadria own dreams were ended for ever , [she]211-hadria wrestled with desperate strength for the life that was at stake . [[Her]211-hadria father]609-her father 's silent wretchedness was terrible to see . [He]609-her father would not hear a word of doubt as to [the patient]6463-the patient 's recovery . [He]609-her father grew angry if [anyone]806-anyone hinted at danger . [He]609-her father insisted that [[his]609-her father wife]573-his wife was better each day . [She]2863-she would soon be up and well again . “[0-i] Never well again , ” [the doctor]1471-the doctor had confided to [Hubert]118-hubert , “[0-i] though [she]2863-she may possibly pull through . ” [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton 's extravagant hopefulness sent a thrill along the nerves . It was as if [he]609-her father had uttered the blackest forebodings . The present crisis had stirred a thousand feelings and associations , in [Hadria]211-hadria , which had long been slumbering . [She]211-hadria seemed to be sent back again , to the days of [her]211-hadria childhood . The intervening years were blotted out . [She]211-hadria realized now , with agonising vividness , the sadness of [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's life , the long stagnation , the slow decay of disused faculties , and the ache that accompanies all processes of decay , physical or moral . Not only the strong appeal of old affection , entwined with the earliest associations , was at work , but the appeal of womanhood itself:—the grey sad story of [a woman]3753-a woman 's life , bare and dumb and pathetic in its irony and pain : the injury from without , and then the self - injury , its direct offspring ; unnecessary , yet inevitable ; the unconscious thirst for the sacrifice of [others]432-others , the hungry claims of a nature unfulfilled , the groping instinct to bring the balance of renunciation to the level , and indemnify [oneself]6501-oneself for the loss suffered and the spirit offered up . And that propitiation had to be made . It was as inevitable as that the doom of [Orestes]266-orestes should follow the original crime of [the house of [Atreus]70-atreus]6502-the house of atreus . [Hadria]211-hadria 's whole thought and strength were now centred on the effort to bring about that propitiation , in [[her]211-hadria own person]6503-her own person . [She]211-hadria prepared the altar and sharpened the knife . In that subtle and ironical fashion , [her]211-hadria fate was steadily at work . [The sick - room]6470-the sick - room was very still when [the sisters]3872-the sisters entered . It was both warm and fresh . A night - light burnt on the table , where cups and bottles were ranged , a spirit - lamp and kettle , and other necessaries . The night - light threw long , stealthy shadows over [the room]379-the room . The fire burnt with a red glow . The bed lay against the long wall . As [the two figures]450-the two figures entered , there was a faint sound of quick panting , and a moan . [Hadria]211-hadria rushed to the bedside . “[2863-she] Quick , quick , some brandy , ” [she]211-hadria called . [Algitha]81-algitha flew to the table for the brandy , noticing with horror , as [she]211-hadria passed , that [the nurse]1797-the nurse had fallen asleep at [her]1797-the nurse post . [Algitha]81-algitha shook [her]1797-the nurse hastily . “[2863-she] Go and call [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton , ” [she]211-hadria said sharply,”and[89-mr. fullerton] quick , quick . ” [The patient]6463-the patient was sinking . [The nurse]1797-the nurse vanished . [Algitha]81-algitha had handed the cup of brandy to [Hadria]211-hadria . [The sisters]3872-the sisters stood by the bedside , scarcely daring to breathe . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton entered hurriedly , with face pallid and drawn . “[89-mr. fullerton] What is it ? Is [she]2864-she — ? ” “[2864-she] No , no ; [I]0-i hope not . Another moment it would have been too late , but [I]0-i think [we]2865-we were in time . ” [Hadria]211-hadria had administered the brandy , and stood watching breathlessly , for signs of revival . [She]211-hadria gave one questioning glance at [Algitha]81-algitha . [Her]211-hadria trust in [the nurse]1797-the nurse was gone . [Algitha]81-algitha signed hope . [The patient]6463-the patient 's breathing was easier . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder if [we]2865-we ought to give a little more ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria whispered . “[3862-father] Wait a minute . Ah ! do n't speak to [her]2864-she , [father]3862-father ; [she]2864-she needs all [her]2864-she strength . ” The ticking of the clock could be heard , in the dim light . [Algitha]81-algitha was holding [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother 's wrist . “[2864-she] Stronger , ” [she]211-hadria said , [Hadria]211-hadria drew a deep sigh . “[2864-she] [We]2865-we must give food presently . No more brandy . ” “[2864-she] [She]2864-she 's all right again , all right again ! ” cried [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton , eagerly . [The nurse]1797-the nurse went to prepare the extract which [the doctor]1471-the doctor had ordered for [the patient]6463-the patient , when quickly - digested nourishment was required . It gave immediate strength . The brandy had stimulated the sinking organs to a saving effort ; the food sustained the system at the level thus achieved . The perilous moment was over . “[2864-she] Thank heaven ! ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha , when [the patient]6463-the patient 's safety was assured , and [she]81-algitha sank back on the pillow , with a look of relief on [her]81-algitha worn face . “[2864-she] If it had not been for [you]2864-she , [Hadria—.]267-hadria—. What 's the matter ? Are [you]2864-she ill ? ” [Algitha]81-algitha rushed forward , and [the nurse]1797-the nurse dragged up a chair . [Hadria]211-hadria had turned deadly white , and [her]211-hadria hand groped for support . [She]211-hadria drew [herself]211-hadria together with a desperate effort , and sat down breathing quickly . “[0-i] [I]0-i am not going to faint , ” [she]211-hadria said , reassuringly . “[0-i] It was only for a moment . ” [She]211-hadria gave a shudder . “[0-i] What a fight it was ! [We]2867-we were only just in time — ” A low voice came from the bed . [The patient]6463-the patient was talking in [her]6463-the patient sleep . “[2867-we] Tell [Hadria]211-hadria to come [home]3770-home if [she]211-hadria does not want to kill [me]0-i . Tell [her]211-hadria to come [home]3770-home ; it is [her]211-hadria duty . [I]0-i want [her]211-hadria . ” Then , after a pause , “[211-hadria] [I]0-i have always done [my]0-i duty,—I have sacrificed [myself]0-i for [the children]667-the children . Why do [they]667-the children desert [me]0-i , why do [they]667-the children desert [me]0-i ? ” And then came a low moaning cry , terrible to hear . [The sisters]3872-the sisters were by the bedside , in a moment . [[Their]3872-the sisters father]3946-their father stood behind [them]3872-the sisters . “[667-the children] [We]2871-we are here , [mother dear]2872-mother dear ; [we]2871-we are here watching by [you]2872-mother dear , ” [Hadria]211-hadria murmured , with trembling voice . [Algitha]81-algitha touched the thin hand , quietly . “[2871-we] [We]2871-we are with [you]2872-mother dear , [mother]3851-mother , ” [she]81-algitha repeated . “[3851-mother] Do n't [you]2872-mother dear know that [we]2871-we have been with [you]2872-mother dear for a long time ? ” [The sick woman]6523-the sick woman seemed to be soothed by the words . “[2874-both] Both here , [both]2874-both ? ” [she]6523-the sick woman muttered vaguely . And then a smile spread over the sharpened features ; [she]6523-the sick woman opened [her]6523-the sick woman eyes and looked wistfully at the two faces bending over [her]6523-the sick woman . A look of happiness came into [her]6523-the sick woman dimmed eyes . “[2874-both] [[My]0-i girls]2875-my girls , ” [she]6523-the sick woman said in a dreamy voice , “[2874-both] [[my]0-i girls]2875-my girls have come back to [me]0-i — [I]0-i knew [they]2875-my girls were [good girls]2877-good girls — ” Then [her]6523-the sick woman eyes closed , and [she]6523-the sick woman fell into a profound and peaceful slumber . “[2875-my girls] BUT , [Doctor]2878-doctor , is there no hope that with care and time , [she]2879-she will be able to walk again ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry to say , none whatever . [I]0-i am only thankful that [[my]0-i patient]2880-my patient has survived at all . It was little short of a miracle , and [you]2878-doctor must be thankful for that . ” [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had always been [an active woman]6524-an active woman , in spite of not being very robust , and a life passed on a couch had peculiar terrors for [her]97-mrs. fullerton . The nervous system had been wrecked , not by any one shock or event , but by the accumulated strains of a lifetime . The constitution was broken up , once and for all . [A cottage]1766-a cottage had been taken , as near as possible to [the Red House]4718-the red house , where [the old couple]6527-the old couple were to settle for the rest of [their]6527-the old couple days , within reach of [[their]6527-the old couple children]654-their children and [grandchildren]6529-grandchildren . Every wish of [the invalid]6530-the invalid must be respected , just or unjust . Absolute repose of mind and body was imperatively necessary , and this could only be attained for [her]97-mrs. fullerton by a complete surrender , on the part of [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children , of any course of action that [she]97-mrs. fullerton seriously disapproved . The income was too limited to allow of [Algitha]81-algitha 's returning to [[her]81-algitha parents]3931-her parents ; otherwise [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton would have wished it . [Algitha]81-algitha had now to provide for [herself]81-algitha , as the allowance that [[her]81-algitha father]609-her father had given [her]81-algitha could not be continued . [She]81-algitha had previously done [her]81-algitha work for nothing , but now [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan , under whose care [she]81-algitha had been living , offered [her]81-algitha a paid post in [a Convalescent Home in which [she]81-algitha was interested]6534-a convalescent home in which she was interested . “[0-i] [I]0-i am exceptionally fortunate , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha , “[95-mrs. trevelyan] for [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan has arranged most kindly , so that [I]0-i can get away to see [mother]3851-mother and [father]3862-father at the end of every week . ” Both [Mr.]6535-mr. and [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had taken it for granted that [Hadria]211-hadria would remain at [the Red House]4718-the red house , and that [Hubert]118-hubert would “[95-mrs. trevelyan] forgive ” [her]211-hadria , as [they]6537-they put it . Circumstances seemed to take it equally for granted . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton would now depend entirely on [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children for every solace and pleasure . [She]97-mrs. fullerton would require cheering , amusing , helping , in a thousand ways . [Algitha]81-algitha was to come down each week from Saturday till Monday , and [the brothers]6539-the brothers when [they]6539-the brothers could . During the rest of the week , [the invalid]6530-the invalid would depend on [[her]97-mrs. fullerton younger daughter]577-her younger daughter . [Hadria]211-hadria 's leaving [home]3770-home , and the rumour of a quarrel between [her]211-hadria and [Hubert]118-hubert , had conduced to [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother 's illness , perhaps had even caused it . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had taken it bitterly to heart . It had become obvious that [Hadria]211-hadria would have now to remain at [the Red House]4718-the red house , for [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's sake , and that being so , [she]97-mrs. fullerton and [Hubert]118-hubert agreed that it was useless to discuss any other reasons for and against it . [Hubert]118-hubert was only too glad of [her]211-hadria return , for appearance ' sake . [Neither of [them]6539-the brothers]6546-neither of them thought , for a moment , of what [Henriette]142-henriette called a “[95-mrs. trevelyan] reconciliation . ” What had passed before [Hadria]211-hadria 's departure had revealed finally , the hopelessness of such an attempt . Matters settled down heavily and with an air of finality . If only [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother 's declining years were happy and peaceful , that would be something of importance gained , but , alas ! [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton seemed anything but happy . [Her]97-mrs. fullerton helplessness was hard to bear , and [she]97-mrs. fullerton felt the worldly downfall , severely . All this , and the shattered state of [her]97-mrs. fullerton nerves tended to make [her]97-mrs. fullerton exacting and irritable ; and as [she]97-mrs. fullerton had felt seriously aggrieved for so many years of [her]97-mrs. fullerton life , [she]97-mrs. fullerton now regarded the devotion of [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children as a debt tardily paid , and the habit grew insensibly upon [her]97-mrs. fullerton of increasing [her]97-mrs. fullerton demands , as [she]97-mrs. fullerton found [everyone]3726-everyone so ready to submit to [them]3726-everyone . The possession of power had its usual effect . [She]97-mrs. fullerton knew no mercy in its use . [[Her]97-mrs. fullerton daughters]364-her daughters were made to feel that if [they]364-her daughters had been less headstrong and selfish in the past , [she]97-mrs. fullerton would have been [a vigorous and active woman to this day]6551-a vigorous and active woman to this day . Obviously , the very least [they]364-her daughters could do , was to try by all means in [their]364-her daughters power , to lighten the burden [they]364-her daughters had laid upon [her]97-mrs. fullerton . Yet [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was , by nature , unselfish . [She]97-mrs. fullerton would have gladly sacrificed [herself]97-mrs. fullerton for [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children 's good , as indeed [she]97-mrs. fullerton had persistently and doggedly sacrificed [herself]97-mrs. fullerton for [them]576-her children , during [their]576-her children childhood , but naturally [she]97-mrs. fullerton had [her]97-mrs. fullerton own view of what constituted [their]576-her children “[95-mrs. trevelyan] good . ” It did not consist in wasting [one]329-one 's youth and looks among [the slums of [the East End]6555-the east end]6554-the slums of the east end , or in deserting [[one]329-one 's [home]3770-home]6557-one 's home to study music and mix in a set of [second - rate people]6559-second - rate people , in [an out - of - the - way district of [Paris]35-paris]6560-an out - of - the - way district of paris . As for [Hadria]211-hadria 's conduct about [little Martha]129-martha , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton could scarcely bring [herself]97-mrs. fullerton to speak about it . It terrified [her]97-mrs. fullerton . [She]97-mrs. fullerton thought it indicated some taint of madness in [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter 's mind . [Two charming children of [her]97-mrs. fullerton own]6562-two charming children of her own and — but [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , with a painful flush , would turn [her]97-mrs. fullerton mind from the subject . [She]97-mrs. fullerton had to believe [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter either mad or bad , and that was terrible to [her]97-mrs. fullerton maternal pride . [She]97-mrs. fullerton could indeed scarcely believe that it had not all been a painful dream , for [Hadria]211-hadria was now so good and dutiful , so tender and watchful ; how could [she]211-hadria have behaved so abominably , so crazily ? Every day [Hadria]211-hadria came to [the cottage]1763-the cottage , generally with a bunch of fresh flowers to place by [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's couch , and then all the affairs of [the household]2435-the household were talked over and arranged , [the daughter]3913-the daughter doing what was needed in the way of ordering provisions or writing notes , for [the invalid]6530-the invalid could now write only with the greatest difficulty . Then [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton liked to have a chat , to hear what was in the papers , what was going on in [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood , and to discuss all sorts of dreary details , over and over again . Books that [Hadria]211-hadria would sometimes bring were generally left unread , unless they were light novels of a rigidly conventional character . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton grew so excited in [her]97-mrs. fullerton condemnation of any other kind , that it was dangerous to put them before [her]97-mrs. fullerton . In the evenings , [the old couple]6527-the old couple liked to have a rubber , and often [Hubert]118-hubert and [Hadria]211-hadria would make up the necessary quartett ; [four silent human beings]6571-four silent human beings , who sat like [solemn children]6572-solemn children at [their]6572-solemn children portentous play , while the clock on the mantelpiece recorded the moments of [their]6527-the old couple lives that [they]6527-the old couple dedicated to the mimic battle . Hours and hours were spent in this way . But [Hadria]211-hadria found that [she]0-i could not endure it every night , much to the surprise of [[her]0-i parents]3931-her parents . The monotony , the incessant recurrence , had a disastrous effect on [her]0-i nerves , suggesting wild and desperate impulses . “[95-mrs. trevelyan] [I]0-i should go out of [my]0-i mind , if [I]0-i had no breaks , ” [she]0-i said at last , after trying it for some months . “[0-i] In the interests of future rubbers , [I]0-i must leave off , now and then . [He]2883-he that plays and runs away , will live to play another day . ” [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton thought it strange that [Hadria]211-hadria could not do even this little thing for [[her]211-hadria parents]3931-her parents , without grumbling , but [she]0-i did not wish to make a martyr of [her]211-hadria . [They]3931-her parents must try and find [some one else]6575-some one else to take [her]211-hadria place occasionally . Sometimes [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming would accept the post , sometimes [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton , and often [Ernest]86-ernest or [Fred]83-fred , whose comparatively well - ordered minds were not sent off [their]3931-her parents balance so easily as [Hadria]211-hadria 's . In this fashion , the time went by , and the new state of affairs already seemed a hundred years old . [Paris]35-paris was a clear , but far - off dream . An occasional letter from [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet or [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , who mourned and wailed over [Hadria]211-hadria 's surrender of [her]211-hadria work , served to remind [her]211-hadria that it had once been actual and living . There still existed [a [Paris]35-paris far away beyond [the hills]413-the hills]6576-a paris far away beyond the hills , brilliant , vivid , exquisite , inspiring , and at this very moment [the people]4302-the people were coming and going , [the river]437-the river was flowing , the little steamers plying,—but how hard it was to realise ! [The family]360-the family was charmed with the position of affairs . “[2883-he] It is such a mercy things have happened as [they]2884-they have ! ” was the verdict , delivered with much wise shaking of heads . “[2884-they] There can be no more mad or disgraceful behaviour on the part of [[Hubert]118-hubert 's wife]2885-hubert 's wife , that is one comfort . [She]2885-hubert 's wife ca n't murder [[her]2885-hubert 's wife mother]520-her mother outright , though [she]2885-hubert 's wife has not been far off it ! ” From the first , [Hadria]211-hadria had understood what the future must be . These circumstances could not be overcome by any deed that [she]211-hadria could bring [herself]211-hadria to do . Even [Valeria]109-valeria was baffled . [Her]211-hadria theories would not quite work . [Hadria]211-hadria looked things straight in the face . That which was strongest and most essential in [her]211-hadria must starve ; there was no help for it , and [no one]383-no one was directly to blame , not even [herself]211-hadria . [Fate]102-fate , chance , [Providence]191-providence , [the devil]1352-the devil , or whatever it was , had determined against [her]211-hadria particular impulses and [her]211-hadria particular view of things . After all , it would have been rather strange if these powers had happened exactly to agree with [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria was not so ridiculous ( [she]211-hadria told [herself]211-hadria ) as to feel personally aggrieved , but so long as fate , chance , [Providence]191-providence , or the devil , gave [her]211-hadria emotions and desires and talent and will , it was impossible not to suffer . [She]211-hadria might fully recognise that the suffering was of absolutely no importance in the great scheme of things , but that did not make the suffering less . If it must be , it must be , and there was an end to it . Should [someone]4160-someone gain by it , that was highly satisfactory , and more than could be said of most suffering , which exists , it would seem , only to increase and multiply after the manner of some dire disease . This was what [Hadria]211-hadria dreaded in [her]211-hadria own case : that the loss would not end with [her]211-hadria . [The children]667-the children , [Martha]129-martha , [everyone who came under [her]211-hadria influence]6585-everyone who came under her influence , must share in it . [Henriette]142-henriette irritated [her]211-hadria by an approving sweetness of demeanour , carefully avoiding any look of triumph , or rather triumphing by that air which said : “[2885-hubert 's wife] [I]0-i would n't crow over [you]2887-you for [the world]334-the world ! ” [She]142-henriette was evidently brimming over with satisfaction . A great peril , [she]142-henriette felt , had been averted . [The family]360-the family and [its]360-the family reputation were saved . “[0-i] [You]2889-you appear to think that the eyes of [Europe]71-europe are riveted on [the Temperley family]2890-the temperley family , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria ; “[2889-you] an august race , [I]0-i know , but there are one or two other branches of [the human stock in existence]2891-the human stock in existence . ” “[329-one] [One]329-one must consider what [people]3687-people say , ” said [Henriette]142-henriette . [Hadria]211-hadria 's time now was filled more and more with detail , since there were two households instead of one to manage . The new charge was particularly difficult , because [she]211-hadria had not a free hand . Without entirely abandoning [her]211-hadria music , it had , perforce , to fall into abeyance . Progress was scarcely possible . But as [Henriette]142-henriette pointed out — it gave so much pleasure to [others]432-others — when [Hadria]211-hadria avoided music that was too severely classical . At [Craddock Place]29-craddock place , one evening , [she]211-hadria was taken in to dinner by [a callow youth]6588-a callow youth , who found a fertile subject for [his]6588-a callow youth wit , in the follies and excesses of what [he]6588-a callow youth called the “[3687-people] new womanhood . ” It was so delightful , [he]6588-a callow youth said , to come to [the country]401-the country , where [women]606-women were still charming in the good old way . [He]6588-a callow youth knew that this new womanhood business was only a phase , do n't [you]6591-you know , but upon [his]6588-a callow youth word , [he]6588-a callow youth was getting tired of it . Not that [he]6588-a callow youth had any objection to [women]606-women being well educated ( [Hadria]211-hadria was glad of that ) , but [he]6588-a callow youth could not stand it when [they]606-women went out of [their]606-women sphere , and put [themselves]606-women forward and tried to be emancipated , and all that sort of nonsense . [Hadria]211-hadria was not surprised that [he]6588-a callow youth could not stand it . There had been a scathing article , [the youth]6593-the youth said , in one of the evening papers . [He]6588-a callow youth wondered how the “[3687-people] New Woman ” felt after reading it ! It simply made mincemeat of [her]606-women . “[269-mr. st. george] Wretched creature ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed . [The youth]6593-the youth wished that [women]606-women would really do something , instead of making all this fuss . [Hadria]211-hadria agreed that it was a pity [they]606-women were so inactive . Could not [one or two of the more favoured sex]6596-one or two of the more favoured sex manage to inspire [them]606-women with a little initiative ? [The youth]6593-the youth considered that [women]606-women were , by nature , passive and reflective , not original . [Hadria]211-hadria thought the novelty of that idea not the least of its charms . [The youth]6593-the youth allowed that , in [her]6593-the youth own way , and in [her]6593-the youth own sphere , [woman]3844-woman was charming and singularly intelligent . [He]6588-a callow youth had no objection to [her]6593-the youth developing as much as [she]6593-the youth pleased , in proper directions . ( [Hadria]211-hadria felt really encouraged . ) But it was so absurd to pretend that [women]606-women could do work that was peculiar to [men]3698-men . ( [Hadria]211-hadria agreed , with a chuckle . ) When had [they]6603-they written one of [Shakespeare]268-shakespeare 's dramas ? ( When indeed ? History was ominously silent on that point . ) “[269-mr. st. george] [Hadria]211-hadria , what is amusing [you]211-hadria ? ” enquired [[her]211-hadria hostess]4819-her hostess , across the table . “[211-hadria] Oh , well — only the discouraging fact that [no woman]5158-no woman , as [Mr. St. George]269-mr. st. george convincingly points out , has ever written one of [Shakespeare]268-shakespeare 's dramas ! ” “[269-mr. st. george] Oh , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton with a broad smile , “[269-mr. st. george] but [you]211-hadria know , [Mr. St. George]269-mr. st. george , [we]2895-we really have n't had quite the same chances , have [we]2895-we ? ” Perhaps not quite , as far as literature went , [the youth]6593-the youth admitted tolerantly , but there was failure in original work in every direction . This was no blame to [women]606-women ; [they]606-women were not made that way , but facts had to be recognised . [Women]606-women 's strength lay in a different domain — in [the home]2476-the home . It was of no use to try to fight against Nature . Look at music for instance ; [one]329-one required no particular liberty to pursue that art , yet where were [the women - composers]6610-the women - composers ? If there was so much buried talent among [women]606-women , why did n't [they]6610-the women - composers arise and bring out operas and [oratorios]6612-oratorios ? [Hadria]211-hadria could n't understand it ; especially as the domestic life was arranged , one might almost say , with a special view to promoting musical talent in [the mistress of [the household]2435-the household]6613-the mistress of the household . Yet where were [those oratorios]6615-those oratorios ? [She]211-hadria shook [her]211-hadria head . [Mr. St. George]269-mr. st. george , [she]211-hadria thought , had clearly proved that the inherent nature of [women]606-women was passive and imitative , while that of [man]332-man , even in the least remarkable examples of the sex , was always powerful and original to the verge of the perilous ! “[0-i] [I]0-i think [we]2896-we had better go to [the drawing - room]737-the drawing - room , ” said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , discreetly . [The youth]6593-the youth twirled [his]6593-the youth moustaches thoughtfully , as [the ladies]4126-the ladies filed out . [Hadria]211-hadria 's happiest hours were now those that [she]211-hadria spent with [little Martha]129-martha , who was growing rapidly in stature and intelligence gence . [The child]4983-the child 's lovable nature blossomed sweetly under the influence of [Hadria]211-hadria 's tenderness . When wearied , and sad at heart , an hour in [the Priory garden]1677-the priory garden , or a saunter along [the road - side]6622-the road - side with [little Martha]129-martha , was like the touch of a fresh breeze after the oppression of [a heated room]6623-a heated room . [Hadria]211-hadria 's attachment to [the child]4983-the child had grown and grown , until it had become almost a passion . How was [the child]4983-the child to be saved from the usual fate of womanhood ? [Hadria]211-hadria often felt a thrill of terror , when the beautiful blue eyes looked out , large and fearless , into the world that was just unfolding before [them]6626-them , in its mysterious loveliness . [The little girl]5857-the little girl gave promise of beauty . Even now there were elements that suggested a moving , attracting nature . “[0-i] At [her]2898-her peril , ” thought [Hadria]211-hadria , “[3753-a woman] [a woman]3753-a woman moves and attracts . If [I]0-i can only save [her]2898-her ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria had not seen [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue since [her]211-hadria return from [Paris]35-paris . [She]211-hadria felt that [he]116-professor fortescue , and [he]116-professor fortescue alone , could give [her]211-hadria courage , that [he]116-professor fortescue and [he]116-professor fortescue alone could save [her]211-hadria from utter despondency . If only [he]116-professor fortescue would come ! For the first time in [her]211-hadria life , [she]211-hadria thought of writing to ask [him]116-professor fortescue for personal help and advice . Before [she]211-hadria had carried out this idea , the news came that [he]116-professor fortescue was ill , that [the doctor]1471-the doctor wished [him]116-professor fortescue to go abroad , but that [he]116-professor fortescue was forced to remain in [England]14-england , for another three months , to complete some work , and to set some of [his]116-professor fortescue affairs in order . [Hadria]211-hadria , in desperation , was thinking of throwing minor considerations to the winds , and going to see for [herself]211-hadria the state of affairs ( it could be managed without [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's knowledge , and so would not endanger [her]211-hadria health or life ) , when [the two boys]1811-the two boys were sent back hastily from [school]3954-school , where scarlet fever had broken out . [They]1811-the two boys must have caught the infection before leaving , for [they]1811-the two boys were both taken ill . [Valeria]109-valeria came down to [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene , for the day . [She]109-valeria seemed almost distraught . [Hadria]211-hadria could see [her]109-valeria only at intervals . [The sick children]6632-the sick children required all [her]109-valeria attention . [Valeria]109-valeria wished to visit [them]6632-the sick children . [She]109-valeria had brought [the poor boys]6633-the poor boys each a little gift . “[0-i] But [you]2900-you may take the fever , ” [Hadria]211-hadria remonstrated . [Valeria]109-valeria gave a scornful snort . “[2900-you] Are [you]2900-you tired of life ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ? Yes . It is absurd . What do [they]2903-they care for [a faded , fretful woman]2904-a faded , fretful woman ? ” “[2903-they] [You]0-i know how [[your]0-i friends]1648-your friends care for [you]0-i , [Valeria]109-valeria . But [I]0-i , who want much more than that , shall never get even that . [I]0-i threw away the chance when [I]0-i had it , and now [I]0-i shall end [my]0-i days , starving . ” [Hadria]211-hadria was silent . [She]211-hadria felt that these words covered something more than their ostensible meaning . “[0-i] [I]0-i fear [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue is very ill , ” said [Valeria]109-valeria restlessly . It is eating [my]0-i heart out — have [you]211-hadria never suspected , never guessed — ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria , with a startled look , paused to consider , and then , stroking back the beautiful white hair with light touch , [she]0-i said , “[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i have known without knowing that [I]0-i knew . [We]2913-we were alike in that . With [me]0-i , too , it was once for all . Anxiety about [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue now made a gloomy background to the responsibilities of [Hadria]211-hadria 's present life . [Valeria]109-valeria 's occasional visits were its bright spots . [She]109-valeria looked forward to [them]6634-them , with pathetic eagerness . The friendship became closer than it had ever been before , since [Valeria]109-valeria had confided [her]109-valeria sad secret . “[0-i] Yet , [Valeria]109-valeria , [I]0-i envy [you]109-valeria . ” “[0-i] Envy [me]0-i ? ” [she]109-valeria repeated blankly . “[0-i] [I]0-i have never known what a great passion like that means ; [I]0-i have never felt what [you]109-valeria feel , and surely to live [one]329-one 's life with all its pettiness and pain , yet never to know its extreme experiences , is sadder than to have those experiences and suffer through them . ” “[109-valeria] Ah , yes , [you]109-valeria are right , ” [Valeria]109-valeria admitted . “[109-valeria] [I]0-i would not be without it if [I]0-i could . ” The thought of what [she]109-valeria had missed was beginning to take a hold upon [Hadria]211-hadria . [Her]0-i life was passing , passing , and the supreme gifts would never be [hers]0-i . [She]0-i must for ever stand outside , and be satisfied with shadows and echoes . “[109-valeria] Are [you]109-valeria very miserable , [Hadria]211-hadria ? ” [Valeria]109-valeria asked , one day . “[109-valeria] [I]0-i am benumbed a little now , ” [Hadria]211-hadria replied . “[0-i] That must be , if one is to go on at all . It is a provision of nature , [I]0-i suppose . All that was threatening before [I]0-i went to [Paris]35-paris , is now being fulfilled . [I]0-i can scarcely realize how [I]0-i could ever have had the hopefulness to make that attempt . [I]0-i might have known [I]0-i could not succeed , as things are . How could [I]0-i ? But [I]0-i am glad of the memory . It pains [me]0-i sometimes , when all the acute delight and charm return , at the call of some sound or scent , some vivid word ; but [I]0-i would not be without the memory and the dream — [my]0-i little illusion . ” “[0-i] Supposing , ” said [Valeria]109-valeria after a long pause , “[0-i] that [you]109-valeria could live [your]109-valeria life over again , what would [you]109-valeria do ? ” “[109-valeria] [I]0-i do n't know . It is [my]0-i impression that in [my]0-i life , as in the lives of [most women]4904-most women , all roads lead to [Rome]72-rome . Whether [one]329-one does this or that , [one]329-one finds [oneself]329-one in pretty much the same position at the end . It does n't answer to rebel against the recognized condition of things , and it does n't answer to submit . Only generally [one]329-one must , as in [my]0-i case . A choice of calamities is not always permitted . ” “[329-one] It is so difficult to know which is the least , ” said [Valeria]109-valeria . “[329-one] [I]0-i do n't believe there is a ‘ least . ’ [They]2923-they are both unbearable . It is a question which best fits [one]329-one 's temperament , which leads soonest to resignation . ” “[211-hadria] Oh , [Hadria]211-hadria , [you]211-hadria would never achieve resignation ! ” cried [Valeria]109-valeria . “[211-hadria] Oh , some day , perhaps ! ” [Valeria]109-valeria shook [her]109-valeria head . [She]109-valeria had no belief in [Hadria]211-hadria 's powers in that direction . Hopelessness was [her]109-valeria nearest approach to that condition of cheerful acquiescence which , [Hadria]211-hadria had [herself]211-hadria said , profound faith or profound stupidity can perhaps equally inspire . “[211-hadria] At least , ” said [Valeria]109-valeria , “[211-hadria] [you]211-hadria know that [you]211-hadria are useful and helpful to those around [you]211-hadria . [You]211-hadria make [[your]211-hadria mother]832-your mother happy . ” “[211-hadria] No , [[my]0-i mother]4254-my mother is not happy . [My]0-i work is negative . [I]0-i just manage to prevent [her]4254-my mother dying of grief . [One]329-one must not be too ambitious in [this stern world]2928-this stern world . [One]329-one ca n't make [people]3687-people happy merely by reducing [oneself]329-one , morally , to a jelly . Sometimes , by that means , [one]329-one can dodge battle and murder and sudden death . ” “[329-one] It is terrible ! ” cried [Valeria]109-valeria . “[329-one] But meanwhile [one]329-one lays the seed of future calamities , to avoid which [some other future woman]2933-some other future woman will have to become jelly . The process always reminds [me]0-i of the old practice of [the Anglo - Saxon kings]2934-the anglo - saxon kings , who used to buy off [the Danes]270-the danes when [they]2934-the anglo - saxon kings threatened invasion , and so pampered [the enemy]435-the enemy whom [[their]2934-the anglo - saxon kings successors]2936-their successors would afterwards have to buy off at a still more ruinous cost . [I]0-i am buying off [the Danes]270-the danes , [Valeria]109-valeria . ” “[109-valeria] DO [you]2937-you know it is a year to - day , since [we]2938-we came to [this cottage]2939-this cottage ? ” exclaimed [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton . “[2937-you] How the time flies ! ” The remark was made before [the party]428-the party settled to the evening 's whist . “[2937-you] [You]2937-you are looking very much better than [you]2937-you did a month after [your]2937-you illness , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , ” said [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , who was to take a hand , while [Hadria]211-hadria played [Grieg]271-grieg or Chopin , or Scottish melodies to please [the old people]6636-the old people . [The whist - players]6637-the whist - players enjoyed music during the game . “[97-mrs. fullerton] Ah , [I]0-i shall never be well , ” said [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton . “[0-i] One ca n't recover from long worry , [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming . Shall [we]2938-we cut for [partners]932-partners ? ” It was [a quaint , low - pitched little room , filled with familiar furniture from [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , which recalled [the old place at every turn]6639-the old place at every turn]6638-a quaint , low - pitched little room , filled with familiar furniture from dunaghee , which recalled the old place at every turn . The game went on in silence . The cards were dealt , taken up , shuffled , sorted , played , massed together , cut , dealt , sorted , and so on , round and round ; [four grave faces]6640-four grave faces deeply engrossed in the process , while [the little room]6641-the little room was filled with music . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had begun to feel slightly uneasy about [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter . “[159-joseph fleming] So much nursing has told upon [her]2941-she , ” said [everyone]3726-everyone . The illness of [the two boys]1811-the two boys had come at an unfortunate moment . [She]2941-she looked worn and white , and dreadfully thin . [She]2941-she seemed cheerful , and at times [her]2941-she mood was even merry , but [she]2941-she could not recover strength . At the end of the day , [she]2941-she would be completely exhausted . This had not been surprising at first , after the long strain of nursing , but [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton thought it was time that [she]2941-she began to mend . [She]97-mrs. fullerton feared that [Hadria]211-hadria spent too many hours over [her]211-hadria composing ; [she]211-hadria sat up at night , perhaps . What good did all this composing do ? [Nobody]3732-nobody ever heard of it . Such a sad pity that [she]97-mrs. fullerton could not see the folly of persevering in the fruitless effort . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was sure that [Hadria]211-hadria saw [too few people]6646-too few people , lived too monotonous a life . [Craddock Place]29-craddock place was filled with [guests]4588-guests just now , and [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton used [her]176-lady engleton utmost persuasion to induce [Hubert]118-hubert and [Hadria]211-hadria to come to dinner , or to join the party , in the evening , whenever [they]4588-guests could . [Hadria]211-hadria shrank from the idea . It was adding another burden to [her]211-hadria already failing strength . To talk coherently , to be lively and make [oneself]6648-oneself agreeable , to have to think about [one]329-one 's dress,—it all seemed inexpressibly wearisome . But [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was so genuinely eager to administer [her]176-lady engleton cure that [Hadria]211-hadria yielded , half in gratitude , half in order to save the effort of further resistance . [She]211-hadria dragged [herself]211-hadria [upstairs]4836-upstairs to dress , wishing to heaven [she]211-hadria had refused , after all . The thought of the lights , the sound of voices , the complexity of elements and of life that [she]211-hadria had to encounter , made [her]211-hadria shrink into [herself]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria had only one evening gown suitable for the occasion . It was of some white silken stuff , with dull rich surface . A bunch of yellow roses and green leaves formed the decoration . [Hubert]118-hubert approved of [her]211-hadria appearance . To [her]211-hadria own surprise [she]211-hadria felt some new feeling creep into [her]211-hadria , under the influence of the exquisite attire . It put [her]211-hadria a little more in tune . At least there were beautiful and dainty things in [the world]334-the world . The fresh green of the rose leaves , and the full yet delicate yellow of the fragrant roses on the creamy lace , evoked a feeling akin to the emotion stirred by certain kinds of music ; or , in other words , the artistic sensibility had been appealed to through colour and texture , instead of through harmony . [The drawing - room at [Craddock Place]29-craddock place]6652-the drawing - room at craddock place was glowing with subdued candle - light . [[Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton 's rooms]6653-lady engleton 's rooms carried one back to a past epoch , among the dainty fancies and art of a sore leisurely and less vulgar century . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton admitted nothing that had not the quality of distinction , let have what other quality it might . [Hadria]211-hadria 's mood , initiated at [home]3770-home , received impetus at [Craddock Place]29-craddock place . It was a luxurious mood . [She]211-hadria desired to receive rather than to give : to be delicately ministered to ; to claim the services of generations of [artists , who had toiled with fervour to attain that grand ease and simplicity , through faithful labour and the benison of heaven]6655-artists , who had toiled with fervour to attain that grand ease and simplicity , through faithful labour and the benison of heaven . [Hadria]211-hadria had attracted many eyes as [she]211-hadria entered [the room]379-the room . Unquestionably [she]211-hadria was looking [her]211-hadria best to - night , in spite of [her]211-hadria extreme pallor . [She]211-hadria was worthy to take [her]211-hadria place among the beautiful objects of art that [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had collected found [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria had the same quality . [Hubert]118-hubert vaguely perceived this . [He]118-hubert heard the idea expressed in so many words by a voice that [he]118-hubert knew . [He]118-hubert looked round , and saw [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald bending confidentially towards [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming . “[159-joseph fleming] Oh , [Professor]1240-professor , [I]0-i did not know [you]1240-professor were to be here to - night ! ” “[1240-professor] What has [your]1240-professor guardian spirit been about , not to forewarn [you]1240-professor ? ” asked [the Professor]4071-the professor . “[0-i] [I]0-i am thinking of giving [my]0-i guardian spirit a month 's learning , ” returned [Hubert]118-hubert ; “[0-i] [he]2943-he has been extremely neglectful of late .
