And how have [you]1240-professor been getting on all this time , [Professor]1240-professor ? ” [Theobald]181-professor theobald gave some fantastic answer , and crossed [the room]379-the room to [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , who was by this time surrounded by a group of acquaintances , among [them]6659-them [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux , who had just come from [Paris]35-paris , and had news of [all [Hadria]211-hadria 's friends]6660-all hadria 's friends [there]571-there . “[1240-professor] [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , may [I]0-i also ask for one passing glance of recognition ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria turned round with a little start , and a sudden unaccountable sense of disaster . “[154-mrs. temperley] [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald ! ” [She]211-hadria did not look pleased to see [him]181-professor theobald , and as [they]6662-they shook hands , [his]181-professor theobald mouth shut sharply , as it always did when [his]181-professor theobald self- love was wounded . Then , a gleam of resolve or cunning came into [his]181-professor theobald face , and the next instant [he]181-professor theobald was at [his]181-professor theobald suavest . “[181-professor theobald] Do [you]154-mrs. temperley know , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , [I]0-i scarcely recognized [you]154-mrs. temperley when [you]154-mrs. temperley first came in . ‘ Who can [this beautiful , distinguished - looking woman]2945-this beautiful , distinguished - looking woman be ? ’ [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i . ” [Hadria]211-hadria smiled maliciously . “[0-i] [You]181-professor theobald think [I]0-i am so much changed ? ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald began to chuckle . “[181-professor theobald] The trowel , [I]0-i see , is still [your]154-mrs. temperley weapon , ” [she]0-i added , “[154-mrs. temperley] but [I]0-i am surprised that [you]154-mrs. temperley have not learnt to wield the implement of sway with more dexterity , [Professor]1240-professor . ” “[1240-professor] [I]0-i am not accustomed to deal with such quick - witted ladies , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . ” “[154-mrs. temperley] [You]154-mrs. temperley shew [your]154-mrs. temperley hand most frankly , ” [she]0-i answered ; “[154-mrs. temperley] it almost disarms one . ” A few introductory chords sounded through [the room]379-the room . [Hadria]211-hadria was sitting in front of the window , across which the pale green curtains had been drawn . Many eyes wandered towards [her]211-hadria . “[154-mrs. temperley] [I]0-i should like to paint [you]154-mrs. temperley just like that , ” murmured [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton ; “[154-mrs. temperley] [you]154-mrs. temperley ca n't imagine what a perfect bit of harmony [you]154-mrs. temperley make , with [my]0-i brocade . ” [A cousin of [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton]6664-a cousin of lord engleton was at the piano . [He]6664-a cousin of lord engleton played an old French gavotte . “[154-mrs. temperley] That is the finishing touch , ” added [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , below [her]176-lady engleton breath . “[154-mrs. temperley] [I]0-i should like to paint [you]154-mrs. temperley and the curtains and [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton 's gavotte all together . ” The performance was received with enthusiasm . It deepened [Hadria]211-hadria 's mood , set [her]211-hadria pulses dancing . [She]211-hadria assented readily to the request of [[her]211-hadria hostess]4819-her hostess that [she]211-hadria should play . [She]211-hadria chose something fantastic and dainty . It had a certain remoteness from life . “[178-claude moreton] Like one of [Watteau]272-watteau 's pictures , ” said [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton , who was hanging over the piano . [He]178-claude moreton was tall and dark , with an expression that betrayed [his]178-claude moreton enthusiastic temperament . [A group]6666-a group had collected , among [them]6666-a group [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . Beside [him]178-claude moreton stood [Marion Fenwick]273-marion fenwick , [the bride whose wedding had taken place at [Craddock Church]33-craddock church about eighteen months before]6667-the bride whose wedding had taken place at craddock church about eighteen months before . It seemed as if [Hadria]211-hadria were exercising some influence of a magnetic quality . [She]211-hadria was always the point of attraction , whether [she]211-hadria created a spell with [her]211-hadria music , or [her]211-hadria speech , or [her]211-hadria mere personality . In [her]211-hadria present mood , this was peculiarly gratifying . The long divorce from initiative work which events had compelled , the loss of nervous vigour , the destruction of dream and hope , had all tended to throw [her]211-hadria back on more accessible forms of art and expression , and suggested passive rather than active dealings with life . [She]211-hadria was wearied with petty responsibilities , and what [she]211-hadria called semi - detached duties . It was a relief to sit down in white silk and lace , and draw [people]3687-people to [her]211-hadria simply by the cheap spell of good looks and personal magnetism . That [she]211-hadria possessed these advantages , [her]211-hadria life in [Paris]35-paris had made obvious . It was the first time that [she]211-hadria had been in contact with a large number of widely differing types , and [she]211-hadria had found that [she]211-hadria could appeal to [them]6669-them all , if [she]211-hadria would . Since [her]211-hadria return to [England]14-england , anxieties and influences extremely depressing had accustomed [her]211-hadria to a somewhat gloomy atmosphere . To - night the atmosphere was light and soft , brilliant and enervating . “[178-claude moreton] This is [my]0-i Capua , ” [she]211-hadria said laughingly , to [[her]211-hadria hostess]4819-her hostess . It invited every luxurious instinct to come forth and sun itself . [Marion Fenwick]273-marion fenwick 's soft , sweet voice , singing Italian songs to the accompaniment of the guitar , repeated the invitation . It was like a fairy gift . Energy would be required to refuse it . And why , in heaven 's name , if [she]211-hadria might not have what [she]211-hadria really wanted , was [she]211-hadria to be denied even the poor little triumphs of ornamental womanhood ? Was the social order which had frustrated [her]211-hadria own ambitions to dominate [her]211-hadria conscience , and persuade [her]211-hadria voluntarily to resign that one kingdom which can not be taken from [a woman]3753-a woman , so long as [her]211-hadria beauty lasts ? Why should [she]211-hadria abdicate ? [The human being]5264-the human being was obviously susceptible to personality beyond all other things . And beauty moved [that absurd creature]6673-that absurd creature preposterously . There , at least , [the woman who chanced to be born with these superficial attractions]6674-the woman who chanced to be born with these superficial attractions , had a royal territory , so long as [she]211-hadria could prevent [[her]211-hadria clamorous fellows]6675-her clamorous fellows from harassing and wearing those attractions away . By no direct attack could the jealous powers dethrone [her]211-hadria . [They]6675-her clamorous fellows could only do it indirectly , by appealing to the conscience which [they]6675-her clamorous fellows had trained ; to the principles that [they]6675-her clamorous fellows had instilled ; by convincing [the woman]4547-the woman that [she]4547-the woman owed [herself]4547-the woman , as a debt , to [[her]4547-the woman legal owner]6677-her legal owner , to be paid in coined fragments of [her]4547-the woman being , till [she]4547-the woman should end in inevitable bankruptcy , and [the legal owner]6678-the legal owner [himself]6678-the legal owner found [her]4547-the woman a poor investment ! It would have startled that roomful of [people , who expressed everything circuitously , pleasantly , without rough edges]6679-people , who expressed everything circuitously , pleasantly , without rough edges , had [they]6679-people , who expressed everything circuitously , pleasantly , without rough edges read beneath [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley 's spoken words , these unspoken thoughts . [Marion Fenwick]273-marion fenwick 's songs and the alluring softness of [her]273-marion fenwick guitar , seemed the most fitting accompaniment to the warm summer night , whose breath stirred gently the curtains by the open window , at the far end of [the room]379-the room . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was delighted with the success of [her]176-lady engleton efforts . [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley had not looked so brilliant , so full of life , since [[her]154-mrs. temperley mother]520-her mother 's illness . Only yesterday , when [she]154-mrs. temperley met [her]154-mrs. temperley returning from [the Cottage]1763-the cottage , [her]154-mrs. temperley eyes were like those of [a dying woman]6683-a dying woman , and now — ! “[0-i] [People]3687-people say ill - natured things about [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , ” [she]154-mrs. temperley confided to [an intimate friend]6684-an intimate friend , “[3687-people] but that is because [they]3687-people do n't understand [her]154-mrs. temperley . ” [People]3687-people might have been forgiven for not understanding [her]154-mrs. temperley , as perhaps [[her]154-mrs. temperley hostess]4819-her hostess felt , noticing [Hadria]211-hadria 's animation , and the extraordinary power that [she]154-mrs. temperley was wielding over [everyone in [the room]379-the room]6687-everyone in the room , young and old . That power seemed to burn in the deep eyes , whose expression changed from moment to moment . [Hadria]211-hadria 's cheeks , for once , had a faint tinge of colour . The mysterious character of [her]211-hadria beauty became more marked . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald followed [her]211-hadria , with admiring and studious gaze . Whether [she]211-hadria had felt remorseful for [her]211-hadria somewhat unfriendly greeting at the beginning of the evening , or from some other cause , [her]211-hadria manner to [him]181-professor theobald had changed . It was softer , less mocking . [He]181-professor theobald perceived it instantly , and pursued [his]181-professor theobald advantage . [The party]428-the party still centred eagerly round the piano . [Hadria]211-hadria was under the influence of music ; therefore less careful and guarded than usual , more ready to sway on the waves of emotion . And beyond all these influences , tending in the same direction , was the underlying spirit of rebellion against the everlasting “[3687-people] [Thou]2948-thou shalt not ” that met [a woman]3753-a woman at every point , and turned [her]211-hadria back from all paths save one . And following that one ( so ran [Hadria]211-hadria 's insurrectionary thoughts ) , [the obedient creature]6691-the obedient creature had to give up every weapon of [her]211-hadria womanhood ; every grace , every power ; tramping along [that crowded highway]6692-that crowded highway , whereon [wayworn sisters toil forward , with bandaged eyes , and bleeding feet]6693-wayworn sisters toil forward , with bandaged eyes , and bleeding feet ; and as [their]2949-their charm fades , in the pursuing of [their]2949-their dusty pilgrimage , the shouts , and taunts , and insults , and laughter of [[their]2949-their taskmasters]6694-their taskmasters follow [them]2949-their , while still [they]2949-their stumble on to [the darkening land that awaits [them]2949-their]6695-the darkening land that awaits them , at the journey 's end : Old Age , [the vestibule of Death]6696-the vestibule of death . [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes gleamed strangely . “[2949-their] [They]2949-their shall not have [their]2949-their way with [me]0-i too easily . [I]0-i can at least give [[my]0-i pastors]2950-my pastors and [masters]2951-masters a little trouble . [I]0-i can at least fight for it , losing battle though it be . ” [The only person who seemed to resist [Hadria]211-hadria 's influence to - night]6697-the only person who seemed to resist hadria 's influence to - night , was [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan , [the mother of [Marion Fenwick]273-marion fenwick]6698-the mother of marion fenwick . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear madam]2952-my dear madam , ” said [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald , bending over the portly form of [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan , “[0-i] [a woman]3753-a woman 's first duty is to be charming . ” “[0-i] Oh , that comes naturally , [Professor]1240-professor , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria , “[1240-professor] though it is rather for [you]1240-professor than for [me]0-i to say that . [You]1240-professor are always missing opportunities . ” “[1240-professor] Believe [me]0-i , [I]0-i will miss [them]2955-them no more , ” [he]1240-professor said emphatically . “[1240-professor] Tell [us]2956-us [your]2952-my dear madam idea of [a woman]3753-a woman 's duty , [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan , ” prompted [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux maliciously . [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan delivered [herself]179-mrs. jordan of various immemorial sentiments which met the usual applause . But [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux said brusquely that [she]195-madame bertaux thought if that sort of thing were preached at [women]606-women much longer , [they]606-women would end by throwing over duty altogether , in sheer disgust at the whole one - sided business . [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan bristled , and launched [herself]179-mrs. jordan upon a long and virtuous sentence . [[Her]179-mrs. jordan daughter]3909-her daughter [Marion]273-marion fenwick looked up sharply when [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux spoke . Then a timid , cautious glance fell on [[her]3909-her daughter mother]520-her mother . [Marion]273-marion fenwick had lost [her]273-marion fenwick freshness and [her]273-marion fenwick exquisite ætherial quality ; otherwise there was little change in [her]273-marion fenwick appearance . [Hadria]211-hadria was struck by the way in which [she]211-hadria had looked at [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux , and it occurred to [her]211-hadria that [Marion Fenwick]273-marion fenwick was probably not quite so acquiescent and satisfied as [[her]211-hadria friends]4444-her friends supposed . But [she]211-hadria would not speak out . Early training had been too strong for [her]211-hadria . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald was unusually serious to - night . [He]181-professor theobald did not respond to [Hadria]211-hadria 's flippancy . [He]181-professor theobald looked at [her]211-hadria with grave , sympathetic eyes . [He]181-professor theobald seemed to intimate that [he]181-professor theobald understood all that was passing in [her]211-hadria mind , and was not balked by sprightly appearances . There was no sign of cynicism now , no bandying of compliments . [His]181-professor theobald voice had a new ring of sincerity . It was a mood that [Hadria]211-hadria had noticed in [him]181-professor theobald once or twice before , and when it occurred , [her]211-hadria sympathy was aroused ; [she]211-hadria felt that [she]211-hadria had done [him]181-professor theobald injustice . This was evidently [the real man]6703-the real man ; [his]181-professor theobald ordinary manner must be merely the cloak that [the civilized being]6704-the civilized being acquires the habit of wrapping round [him]181-professor theobald , as a protection against the curiosity of [[his]181-professor theobald fellows]951-his fellows . [The Professor]4071-the professor [himself]4071-the professor expressed it almost in those words : “[2952-my dear madam] It is because of the infinite variety of type and the complexity of modern life which [the individual]4889-the individual is called upon to encounter , that a sort of fancy dress has to be worn by all of [us]2959-we , as a necessary shield to [our]2959-we individuality and [our]2959-we privacy . [We]2959-we can not go through the complex process of adjustment to each new type that [we]2959-we come across , so by common consent , [we]2959-we wear [our]2959-we domino , and respect the unwritten laws of the great bal masqué that [we]2959-we call [society]367-society . ” The conversation took more and more intimate and serious turns . [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan was the only check upon it . [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux followed up [her]195-madame bertaux first heresy by [others]432-others even more bold . “[329-one] Whenever one wants very particularly to have [one]329-one 's way about a matter , ” [she]195-madame bertaux said , “[329-one] [one]329-one sneaks off and gets [somebody else]6262-somebody else persuaded that it is [his]6262-somebody else duty to sacrifice [himself]6262-somebody else for [us]2959-we — c'est tout simple — and the chances are that [he]6262-somebody else meekly does it . If [he]6262-somebody else does n't , at least [one]329-one has the satisfaction of making [him]6262-somebody else feel [a guilty wretch]2965-a guilty wretch , and setting [oneself]329-one up with a profitable grievance for life . ” “[329-one] To [the true woman]2966-the true woman , ” said [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan , who had ruled [[her]179-mrs. jordan family]4129-her family with a rod of iron for thirty stern years , “[329-one] there is no joy to equal that of self - sacrifice . ” “[329-one] Except that of exacting it , ” added [Hadria]211-hadria . “[329-one] [I]0-i advise [everyone]3726-everyone desirous of dominion to preach that duty , in and out of season , ” said [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux . “[0-i] It is seldom that [the victims]3784-the victims even howl , so well have [we]2959-we trained [them]3784-the victims . ” “[2959-we] Truly [I]0-i hope so ! ” cried [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . “[2959-we] It must be most galling when [their]3784-the victims lamentations prevent [one]329-one from committing [one]329-one 's justifiable homicide in peace and quietness . Imagine the discomfort of having [a half - educated victim]2971-a half - educated victim to deal with , who ca n't hold [his]2971-a half - educated victim tongue and let one perform the operation quietly and comfortably . It is enough to embitter [any Christian]2972-any christian ! ” The party broke up , with many cordial expressions of pleasure , and several plans were made for immediately meeting again . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was delighted to see that [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley entered with animation , into some projects for picnics and excursions in [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood . “[2972-any christian] Did [I]0-i not tell [you]2973-you that all [you]2973-you wanted was a little lively society ? ” [she]0-i said , with genuine warmth , as [the two women]2742-the two women stood in [the hall]4592-the hall , a little apart from [the others]303-the others . [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyelids suddenly fell and reddened slightly . “[0-i] Oh , [you]2973-you are so kind ! ” [she]0-i exclaimed , in a voice whose tones betrayed the presence of suppressed tears . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , in astonishment , stretched out a sisterly hand , but [Hadria]211-hadria had vanished through the open hall door into the darkness without . [MRS . TEMPERLEY]154-mrs. temperley was much discussed at [Craddock Place]29-craddock place . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald preserved the same grave mood whenever [she]0-i was present . [He]181-professor theobald only returned to [his]181-professor theobald usual manner , in [her]0-i absence . “[2973-you] [Theobald]181-professor theobald has on [his]181-professor theobald Mrs. Temperley manner , ” [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton used to say . [The latter]590-the latter was [himself]590-the latter among [[her]0-i admirers]6714-her admirers . “[2973-you] [I]0-i begin to be afraid that [Claude]178-claude moreton is taking [her]2974-her too seriously , ” [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton remarked to [[her]176-lady engleton husband]553-her husband . [He]553-her husband had fired up on one occasion when [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald said something flippant about [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley . [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton 's usual calmness had caused the sudden outburst to be noticed with surprise . [He]553-her husband hated [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . “[178-claude moreton] What possesses [you]2975-you both to let [that fellow]4277-that fellow come [here]3762-here so much ? ” “[4071-the professor] [The Professor]4071-the professor ? Oh , [he]4071-the professor is [a very old friend]2979-a very old friend , [you]2975-you know , and extremely clever . [One]329-one has to put up with [his]4071-the professor manner . ” [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton grunted . “[329-one] These , at any rate , are no reasons why [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley should put up with [his]4071-the professor manner ! ” “[154-mrs. temperley] But , [[my]0-i dear]3722-my dear [Claude]178-claude moreton , as [you]2975-you are always pointing out , [the Professor]4071-the professor has a special manner which [he]4071-the professor keeps exclusively for [her]154-mrs. temperley . ” The special manner had already worked wonders . [The Professor]4071-the professor was to [Hadria]211-hadria by far [the most entertaining person of the party]6717-the most entertaining person of the party . [He]4071-the professor had always amused [her]211-hadria , and even the first time [she]211-hadria saw [him]4071-the professor , [he]4071-the professor had exercised a strange , unpleasant fascination over [her]211-hadria , which had put [her]211-hadria on the defensive , for [she]211-hadria had disliked and distrusted [him]4071-the professor . The meetings in [the Priory gardens]5796-the priory gardens had softened [her]211-hadria hostility , and now [she]211-hadria began to feel more and more that [she]211-hadria had judged [him]4071-the professor unfairly . In those days [she]211-hadria had a strong pre - occupying interest . [He]4071-the professor had arrived on the scene at an exciting moment , just when [she]211-hadria was planning out [her]211-hadria flight to [Paris]35-paris . [She]211-hadria had not considered [the Professor]4071-the professor 's character very deeply . There were far too many other things to think of . It was simpler to avoid [him]4071-the professor . But now everything had changed . The present moment was not exciting ; [she]211-hadria had no plans and projects in [her]211-hadria head ; [she]211-hadria was not about to court the fate of [Icarus]274-icarus . That fate had already overtaken [her]211-hadria . The waves were closing over - head ; [her]211-hadria wings were wet and crippled , in the blue depths . Why not take what [the gods]812-the gods had sent and make the most of it ? [The Professor]4071-the professor had all sorts of strange lore , which [he]4071-the professor used , in [his]4071-the professor conversations with [Hadria]211-hadria , almost as [a fisherman]6722-a fisherman uses [his]6722-a fisherman bait . If [she]211-hadria shewed an inclination to re - join the rest of [the party]428-the party , [he]4071-the professor always brought out some fresh titbit of curious learning , and [Hadria]211-hadria was seldom able to resist the lure . [They]6724-they met often , almost of necessity . It was impossible to feel a stranger to [the Professor]4071-the professor , in these circumstances of frequent and informal meeting . Often when [Hadria]211-hadria happened to be alone with [him]4071-the professor , [she]211-hadria would become suddenly silent , as if [she]211-hadria no longer felt the necessity to talk or to conceal [her]211-hadria weariness . [The Professor]4071-the professor knew it too well ; [he]4071-the professor saw how heavily the burden of life weighed upon [her]211-hadria , and how it was often almost more than [she]211-hadria could do , to drag through the day . [She]211-hadria craved for excitement , no matter of what kind , in order to help [her]211-hadria to forget [her]211-hadria weariness . [Her]211-hadria anxiety about [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue preyed upon [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria was restless , overwrought , with every nerve on edge , unable now for consecutive work , even had events permitted it . [She]211-hadria followed the advice and took the medicines of [a London doctor]6727-a london doctor , whom [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had entreated [her]211-hadria to consult , but [she]211-hadria gained no ground . “[4071-the professor] [I]0-i begin to understand how it is that [people]3687-people take to drinking , ” [she]211-hadria said to [Algitha]81-algitha , who used to bemoan this vice , with its terrible results , of which [she]211-hadria had seen so much . “[0-i] Ah ! do n't talk of it in that light way ! ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha . “[0-i] It is the fashion to treat it airily , but if [people]3687-people only knew what an awful curse it is , [I]0-i think [they]3687-people would feel ashamed to be ‘ moderate ’ and indifferent about it . ” “[3687-people] [I]0-i do n't mean to treat it or anything that brings harm and suffering ‘ moderately , ’ ” returned [Hadria]211-hadria . “[0-i] [I]0-i mean only that [I]0-i can see why the vice is so common . It causes forgetfulness , and [I]0-i suppose [most people]4077-most people crave for that . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think , [Hadria]211-hadria , if [I]0-i may be allowed to say so , that [you]211-hadria are finding [your]211-hadria excitement in another direction . ” “[211-hadria] [You]211-hadria mean that [I]0-i am trying to find a substitute for the pleasures of drunkenness in those of flirtation . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should not like to think that [you]211-hadria had descended to conscious flirtation . ” [Hadria]211-hadria looked steadily into the flames . [They]6728-they were in the morning - room , where towards night - fall , even in summer , a small fire usually burnt in [the grate]6729-the grate . “[211-hadria] When [I]0-i remember what [you]211-hadria used to think and what [you]211-hadria used to be to [us]2986-us all , in the old days at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , [I]0-i feel bitterly pained at what [you]211-hadria are doing , [Hadria]211-hadria . [You]211-hadria do n't know where it may lead to , and besides it seems so beneath [you]211-hadria in every way . ” “[211-hadria] Appeals to the conscience ! ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria , “[211-hadria] [I]0-i knew [they]2987-they would begin ! ” “[0-i] [You]0-i knew what would begin ? ” “[0-i] Appeals , exhortations to forego the sole remaining interest , opportunity , or amusement that is left one ! Ah , dear [Algitha]81-algitha , [I]0-i know [you]211-hadria mean it kindly and [I]0-i admire [you]211-hadria for speaking out , but [I]0-i am not going to be cajoled in that way ! [I]0-i am not going to be turned back and set tramping along [the stony old road]2988-the stony old road , so long as [I]0-i can find a pleasanter by - way to loiter in . It sounds bad [I]0-i know . [Our]2989-our drill affects [us]2989-our to the last , through every fibre . [My]0-i duty ! By what authority do [people]3687-people choose for [me]0-i [my]0-i duty ? If [I]0-i can be forced to abide by [their]3687-people decision in the matter , let [them]3687-people be satisfied with [their]3687-people power to coerce [me]0-i , but let [them]3687-people leave [my]0-i conscience alone . It does not dance to [their]3687-people piping . ” “[3687-people] But [you]211-hadria can not care for this sort of excitement , [Hadria]211-hadria . ” “[211-hadria] If [I]0-i can get nothing else — ? ” “[211-hadria] Even then , [I]0-i ca n't see what [you]211-hadria can find in it to make [you]211-hadria willing to sink from [your]211-hadria old ideals . ” “[211-hadria] Ideals ! [A woman with ideals]2991-a woman with ideals is like a drowning creature with a millstone round its neck ! [I]0-i have had enough of ideals ! ” “[0-i] It is a sad day to [me]0-i when [I]0-i hear [you]211-hadria say so , [Hadria]211-hadria ! ” [the sister]4876-the sister exclaimed . “[211-hadria] [Algitha]81-algitha , there is just one solitary weapon that ca n't be taken from [a woman]3753-a woman — and so it is considerately left to [her]3753-a woman . Ah , it is a dangerous toy when brandished dexterously ! Sometimes it sends [a man or two]2993-a man or two away howling . [[Our]2994-our pastors]2995-our pastors and [masters]2951-masters have a wholesome dread of the murderous thing — and what wails , and satires , and lamentations it inspires ! Consult the literature of [all lands]2997-all lands and ages ! Heaven - piercing ! The only way of dealing with the awkward dilemma is to get [the woman]4547-the woman persuaded to be ‘ good , ’ and to lay down [her]4547-the woman weapon of [her]4547-the woman own accord , and let it rust . How many [women]606-women have been so persuaded ! Not [I]0-i ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know , and [I]0-i understand how [you]211-hadria feel ; but oh , [Hadria]211-hadria , this is not the way to fight , this will bring no good to [anyone]806-anyone . And as for admiration , the admiration of [men]3698-men — why , [you]211-hadria know it is not worth having — of this sort . ” “[0-i] Oh , do [I]0-i not know it ! It is less than worthless . But [I]0-i am not seeking anything of permanent value ; [I]0-i am seeking excitement , and the superficial satisfaction of brandishing the weapon that [everyone]3726-everyone would be charmed to see [me]0-i lay in the dust . [I]0-i wo n't lay it down to please [anybody]3977-anybody . Dear [me]0-i , it will soon rust of its own accord . [You]211-hadria might as well ask [some luckless warrior who stands at bay , facing overwhelming odds]3004-some luckless warrior who stands at bay , facing overwhelming odds , to yield up [his]3004-some luckless warrior who stands at bay , facing overwhelming odds sword and leave [himself]3004-some luckless warrior who stands at bay , facing overwhelming odds defenceless . It is an insult to [one]329-one 's common sense . ” [Algitha]81-algitha 's remonstrance seemed only to inflame [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister 's mood , so [she]81-algitha said no more . But [she]81-algitha watched [Hadria]211-hadria 's increasingly reckless conduct , with great uneasiness . “[329-one] It really is exciting ! ” exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria , with a strange smile . [The whole party]1013-the whole party had migrated for the day , to [the hills]413-the hills at a distance of about ten miles from [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene . [A high spot]6734-a high spot had been chosen , on the edge of [woodland shade]6735-woodland shade , looking out over a wide distance of [plain and far - off ranges]6736-plain and far - off ranges . Here , as [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton remarked , [they]3006-they were to spoil [the landscape]6737-the landscape , by taking [their]3006-they luncheon . “[329-one] Or what is worse , by giving [ourselves]3006-they rheumatism , ” added [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton . “[329-one] What grumbling creatures [men]3698-men are ! ” exclaimed [[his]157-lord engleton wife]573-his wife , “[329-one] and what pleasures [they]3698-men lose for [themselves]3698-men and make impossible for [others]432-others , by this stupid habit of dwelling upon the disadvantages of a situation , instead of on its charms . ” “[3006-they] [We]3006-they ought to dwell upon the fowl and the magnificent prospect , and ignore the avenging rheumatism , ” said [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton . “[3009-you] Oh no , guard against it , ” advised [Algitha]81-algitha , with characteristic common sense . “[3009-you] Sit on this waterproof , for instance . ” “[3009-you] Ah , there [you]3009-you have the true philosophy ! ” cried [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . “[3009-you] Contentment and forethought . Observe the symbol of forethought . ” [He]181-professor theobald spread the waterproof to the wind . “[3009-you] There is nothing like a contented spirit ! ” cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[3009-you] Who is it that says [you]3009-you knock [a man]3704-a man into [a ditch]3011-a ditch , and then [you]3009-you tell [him]3704-a man to remain content in the position in which [Providence]191-providence has placed [him]3704-a man ? ” asked [Hadria]211-hadria . “[3009-you] Even contentment has its dangers , ” said [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton , dreamily . At the end of the meal , [Hadria]211-hadria rose from the rug where [she]211-hadria had been reclining , with the final assertion , that [she]211-hadria thought [the man who was knocked into the ditch]6739-the man who was knocked into the ditch and told to do [his]6739-the man who was knocked into the ditch duty there , would do the best service to [mankind]1102-mankind , as well as to [himself]6739-the man who was knocked into the ditch , by making a horrid clamour and trying to get out again . [A group]6666-a group collected round [her]211-hadria , almost immediately . “[275-mrs. fenwick] [Mrs. Fenwick]275-mrs. fenwick , wo n't [you]275-mrs. fenwick give [us]3012-us a song ! ” cried [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux . “[275-mrs. fenwick] [I]0-i see [you]275-mrs. fenwick have been kind enough to bring [your]275-mrs. fenwick guitar . ” [Marion]273-marion fenwick was enthroned upon the picnic - basket , with much pomp , and [her]273-marion fenwick guitar placed in [her]273-marion fenwick hand by [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton . [Her]273-marion fenwick figure , in [her]273-marion fenwick white gown and large straw hat , had for background the shadows of [thick woods]6742-thick woods . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald sank down on the grass at [Hadria]211-hadria 's side . [She]211-hadria felt that [his]178-claude moreton mood was agitated . [She]211-hadria could not be in much doubt as to its cause . The reckless rôle that [she]211-hadria had been playing was bringing its result . [Hadria]211-hadria was half alarmed , half exultant . [She]211-hadria had a strange , vague notion of selling [her]211-hadria life dearly , to [the enemy]435-the enemy . Only , of late , this feeling had been mixed with another , of which [she]211-hadria was scarcely conscious . The subtle fascination which [the Professor]4071-the professor exercised over [her]211-hadria had taken a stronger hold , far stronger than [she]211-hadria knew . [She]211-hadria was sitting on a little knoll , [her]211-hadria arm resting on [her]211-hadria knee , and [her]211-hadria cheek in [her]211-hadria hand . In the exquisitely graceful attitude , was an element of self - abandonment . It seemed as if [she]211-hadria had grown tired of guiding and directing [herself]211-hadria , and were now commending [herself]211-hadria to fate or fortune , to do with [her]211-hadria as [they]6745-they would , or must . [Marion]273-marion fenwick struck a quiet chord . [Her]273-marion fenwick voice was sweet and tender and full , admirably suited to the song . Every nerve in [Hadria]211-hadria answered to [her]273-marion fenwick tones . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald shifted [his]181-professor theobald position slightly . The song was greeted with a vague stir among [the silent audience]6746-the silent audience . A little breeze gave a deep satisfied sigh , among the trees . Several other songs followed , and then [the party]428-the party broke up . [They]428-the party were to amuse [themselves]428-the party as [they]428-the party pleased during the afternoon , and to meet on the same spot for five o'clock tea . “[275-mrs. fenwick] [I]0-i wish [Hadria]211-hadria would not be so reckless ! ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha anxiously . “[211-hadria] Have [you]0-i seen [her]211-hadria lately ? ” “[0-i] When last [I]0-i saw [her]211-hadria , ” said [Valeria]109-valeria , “[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria had strolled off with [the Professor]4071-the professor and [Mr. Moreton]276-mr. moreton . [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming and [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton were following with [Mrs. Fenwick]275-mrs. fenwick . ” “[275-mrs. fenwick] There is safety in numbers , at any rate , but [I]0-i am distressed about [her]211-hadria . It is all very well what [she]211-hadria says , about not allowing [[her]211-hadria woman]3014-her woman 's sole weapon to be wrenched from [her]211-hadria , but [she]211-hadria ca n't use it in this way , safely . [One]329-one ca n't play with human emotions without coming to grief . ” “[329-one] [A man]3704-a man , at any rate , has no idea of being led an emotional dance , ” said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[3704-a man] [Hadria]211-hadria has , [I]0-i believe , at the bottom of [her]211-hadria heart , a lurking desire to hurt [men]3698-men , because [they]3698-men have hurt [women]606-women so terribly , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha . “[211-hadria] [One]329-one can understand the impulse , but the worst of it is , that one is certain to pay back the score on [the good man]1126-the good man , and let the other go free . ” [Algitha]81-algitha shook [her]81-algitha head , regretfully . “[211-hadria] Did [Hadria]211-hadria never show this impulse before ? ” “[211-hadria] Never in [my]0-i life have [I]0-i seen [her]211-hadria exercise [her]211-hadria power so ruthlessly . ” “[211-hadria] [I]0-i rather think [she]211-hadria is wise after all , ” said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria reflectively . “[0-i] [She]211-hadria might be sorry some day never to have tasted what [she]211-hadria is tasting now . ” “[211-hadria] But it seems to [me]0-i dreadful . There is [not a man who is not influenced by [her]211-hadria in the strangest manner ; even poor [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , who used to look up to [her]211-hadria so]3021-not a man who is not influenced by her in the strangest manner ; even poor joseph fleming , who used to look up to her so . In [my]0-i opinion , [she]211-hadria is acting very wrongly . ” “[211-hadria] ‘ [He]3022-he that has eaten [his]3022-he fill does not pity the hungry , ’ as the Eastern proverb puts it . Come now , [Algitha]81-algitha , imagine [yourself]81-algitha to be cut off from the work that supremely interests [you]81-algitha , and thrown upon [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene without hope of respite , for the rest of [your]81-algitha days . Do n't [you]81-algitha think [you]81-algitha too might be tempted to try experiments with a power whose strength [you]81-algitha had found to be almost irresistible ? ” “[81-algitha] Perhaps [I]0-i should , ” [Algitha]81-algitha admitted . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't say [she]211-hadria is doing right , but [you]81-algitha must remember that [you]81-algitha have not the temperament that prompts to these outbursts . [I]0-i suppose that is only to say that [you]81-algitha are better than [Hadria]211-hadria , by nature . [I]0-i think perhaps [you]81-algitha are , but remember [you]81-algitha have had the life and the work that [you]81-algitha chose above all others — [she]211-hadria has not . ” “[211-hadria] Heaven knows [I]0-i do n't set [myself]0-i above [Hadria]211-hadria , ” cried [Algitha]81-algitha . “[0-i] [I]0-i have always looked up to [her]211-hadria . Do n't [you]81-algitha know how painful it is when [people]3687-people [you]81-algitha respect do things beneath [them]3687-people ? ” “[81-algitha] [Hadria]211-hadria will disappoint [us]3024-us all in some particular , ” said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . “[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria will not correspond exactly to [anybody]3977-anybody 's theory or standard , not even [her]211-hadria own . It is a defect which gives [her]211-hadria character a quality of the unexpected , that has for [me]0-i , infinite attraction . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria had never shewn so much disposition to support [Hadria]211-hadria 's conduct as now , when disapproval was general . [She]109-valeria had a strong fellow - feeling for [a woman who desired to use [her]6748-a woman who desired to use her power power]6748-a woman who desired to use her power , and [she]109-valeria was half disposed to regard [her]6748-a woman who desired to use her power conduct as legitimate . At any rate , it was a temptation almost beyond one 's powers of resistance . If [a woman]3753-a woman might not do this , what , in heaven 's name , might [she]3753-a woman do ? Was [she]3753-a woman not eternally referred to [[her]3753-a woman woman]3014-her woman 's influence , [[her]3753-a woman woman]3014-her woman 's kingdom ? Surely a day 's somewhat murderous sport was allowable in [that realm]6752-that realm ! After all , energy , ambition , nervous force , must have an outlet somewhere . [Men]3698-men could look after [themselves]3698-men . [They]3698-men had no mercy on [women]606-women when [they]3698-men lay in [their]3698-men power . Why should [a woman]3753-a woman be so punctilious ? “[3754-the man] Only [the man]3754-the man is sure to get the best of it , ” [she]3753-a woman added , bitterly . “[3754-the man] [He]3754-the man loses so little . It is a game where the odds are all on one side , and the conclusion foregone . ” Unexpectedly , the underwood behind the speakers was brushed aside and [Hadria]211-hadria appeared before [them]3028-we . [She]211-hadria looked perturbed . “[3754-the man] What is it ? Why are [you]3027-you by [yourself]3027-you ? ” “[3754-the man] Oh , [[our]3028-we party]3029-our party split up , long ago , into cliques , and [we]3028-we all became so select , that , at last , [we]3028-we reduced [each clique]3030-each clique to [one member]3031-one member . Behold the very acme of selectness ! ” [Hadria]211-hadria stood before [them]3028-we , in an attitude of hauteur . “[3027-you] This sounds like evasion , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha . “[3027-you] And if it were , what right have [you]3027-you to try to force [me]0-i to tell what [I]0-i do not volunteer ? ” “[3027-you] True , ” said [[her]0-i sister]313-her sister ; “[3027-you] [I]0-i beg [your]3027-you pardon . ” [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria rose . “[0-i] [I]0-i will leave [you]3027-you to [yourselves]3027-you , ” [she]0-i said , walking away . [Hadria]211-hadria sat down and rested one elbow on the grass , looking over the sweep of [the hill]3975-the hill towards the distance . “[0-i] That is almost like [our]3028-we old vision in [the caves]3032-the caves , [Algitha]81-algitha ; [mist]3033-mist and [distant lands]469-distant lands — it was a false prophecy . [You]3027-you were talking about [me]0-i when [I]0-i came up , were [you]3027-you not ? ” “[3027-you] Did [you]3027-you hear ? ” “[3027-you] No , but [I]0-i feel sure of it . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i confess it , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha . “[0-i] [We]3028-we are both very uneasy about [you]3027-you . ” “[0-i] If [one]329-one never did anything all [one]329-one 's life to make [[one]329-one 's friends]3038-one 's friends uneasy , [I]0-i wonder if [one]329-one would have any fun . ” [Algitha]81-algitha shook [her]81-algitha head anxiously . “[3040-some accredited sage] ‘ Choose what [you]3027-you want and pay for it , ’ is the advice of [some accredited sage]3040-some accredited sage , ” [Hadria]211-hadria observed . “[3040-some accredited sage] [Women]606-women have to pay so high , ” said [Algitha]81-algitha . “[606-women] So much the worse , but there is such a thing as false economy . ” “[211-hadria] But seriously , [Hadria]211-hadria , if one may speak frankly , [I]0-i ca n't see that the game is worth the candle . [You]211-hadria have tested [your]211-hadria power sufficiently . What more do [you]211-hadria want ? [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton is too nice and too good [a man]3704-a man to trifle with . And poor [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming ! That is to [me]0-i beyond everything . ” [Hadria]211-hadria flushed deeply . “[0-i] [I]0-i never dreamt that [he]178-claude moreton — [I]0-i — [I]0-i never tried , never thought for a moment — ” “[0-i] Ah ! that is just the danger , [Hadria]211-hadria . [Your]211-hadria actions entail unintended consequences . As [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria says , ‘ It is always [the good men whom [one wounds]3044-one wounds]3043-the good men whom one wounds ; the others wound [us]3045-us . ’ ” [Hadria]211-hadria was silent . “[109-valeria] And [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton , ” continued [Algitha]81-algitha presently . “[178-claude moreton] [He]178-claude moreton is far too deeply interested in [you]211-hadria , far too absorbed in what [you]211-hadria say and do . [I]0-i have watched [him]178-claude moreton . It is cruel . ” [Hadria]211-hadria grew fierce . “[178-claude moreton] Has [he]178-claude moreton never cruelly injured [a woman]3753-a woman ? Has [he]178-claude moreton not at least given moral support to the hideous indignities that [all womanhood]3047-all womanhood has to endure at [men]3698-men 's hands ? At best one can make [a man]3704-a man suffer . But [men]3698-men also humiliate [us]3045-us , degrade [us]3045-us , jeer at , ridicule the miseries that [they]3698-men and [their]3698-men society entail upon [us]3045-us . Yet for sooth , [they]3698-men must be spared the discomfort of becoming a little infatuated with [a woman]3753-a woman for a time — a short time , at worst ! [Their]3698-men feelings must be considered so tenderly ! ” “[3698-men] But what good do [you]211-hadria do by [your]211-hadria present conduct ? ” asked [Algitha]81-algitha , sticking persistently to the practical side of the matter . “[0-i] [I]0-i am not trying to do good . [I]0-i am merely refusing to obey these rules for [our]3045-us guidance , which are obviously drawn up to safeguard [man]332-man 's property and privilege . Whenever [I]0-i can find [a man - made precept]3053-a man - made precept , that will [I]0-i carefully disobey ; whenever [the ruling powers]3054-the ruling powers seek to guide [me]0-i through [my]0-i conscience , there shall [they]3054-the ruling powers fail ! ” “[211-hadria] [You]211-hadria forget that in playing with the feelings of [others]432-others [you]211-hadria are placing [yourself]211-hadria in danger , [Hadria]211-hadria . How can [you]211-hadria be sure that [you]211-hadria wo n't [yourself]211-hadria fall desperately in love with [one of [[your]211-hadria intended victims]3057-your intended victims]3056-one of your intended victims ? ” [Hadria]211-hadria 's eyes sparkled . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish to heaven [I]0-i only could ! ” [she]211-hadria exclaimed . “[0-i] [I]0-i would give [my]0-i right hand to be in the sway of a complete undoubting , unquestioning passion that would make all suffering and all life seem worth while ; some emotion to take the place of [my]0-i lost art , some full and satisfying sense of union with [a human soul]2092-a human soul to rescue [one]329-one from the ghastly solitude of life . But [I]0-i am raving like [a girl]3734-a girl . [I]0-i am crying for the moon . ” “[0-i] Ah , take care , take care , [Hadria]211-hadria ; that is a mood in which one may mistake [any twopenny - halfpenny little luminary]3061-any twopenny - halfpenny little luminary for the impossible moon . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i should be almost ready to bless the beautiful illusion , ” cried [Hadria]211-hadria passionately . IN the conversation with [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister , the name which [Hadria]211-hadria had dreaded to hear had not been mentioned . [She]211-hadria felt as if [she]211-hadria could not have met [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister 's eyes , at that moment , had [she]211-hadria alluded to [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald ; for only five minutes before , in the wood , [he]181-professor theobald had spoken to [her]211-hadria in a way that was scarcely possible to misunderstand , though [his]181-professor theobald wording was so cautious that [she]211-hadria could not have taken offence , had [she]211-hadria been so minded , without drawing upon [herself]211-hadria the possible retort . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear lady]3062-my dear lady , [you]3062-my dear lady have completely misunderstood [me]0-i . ” The thought made [her]211-hadria flush painfully . But suppose [he]181-professor theobald really had meant what [his]181-professor theobald words seemed to imply ? [He]181-professor theobald could intend no insult , because [he]181-professor theobald despised , and knew that [she]211-hadria despised , popular social creeds . Into what new realms was [she]211-hadria drifting ? There was something attractive to [Hadria]211-hadria , in the idea of defying [the world]334-the world 's laws . It was not as the dutiful property of another , but as [herself]211-hadria , [a separate and responsible individual]6761-a separate and responsible individual , that [she]211-hadria would act and feel , rightly or wrongly , as the case might be . That was a matter between [herself]211-hadria and [her]211-hadria conscience , not between [herself]211-hadria and [the world]334-the world or [[her]211-hadria legal owner]6677-her legal owner . [The Professor]4071-the professor 's ambiguous and yet startling speech had forced [her]211-hadria to consider [her]211-hadria position . [She]211-hadria remembered how [her]211-hadria instinct had always been to hold [him]181-professor theobald aloof from [her]211-hadria life , just because , as [she]211-hadria now began to believe , there was something in [him]181-professor theobald that powerfully attracted [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria had feared an attraction that appeared unjustified by [the man]3754-the man 's character . But now the fascination had begun to take a stronger grip , as the pre - occupying ideas of [her]211-hadria life had been chased from their places . It had insensibly crept in to fill the empty throne . So long as [she]211-hadria had cherished hope , so long as [she]211-hadria was still struggling , this insidious half - magnetic influence had been easily resisted . Now , [she]211-hadria was set adrift ; [her]211-hadria anchor was raised ; [she]211-hadria lay at the wind 's mercy , half - conscious of the peril and not caring . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had an acute perception of the strange and confused struggle that was going on in [her]211-hadria mind . But [he]181-professor theobald had no notion of the peculiar reasons , in [her]211-hadria case , for an effect that [he]181-professor theobald knew to be far from rare among [women]606-women ; [he]181-professor theobald did not understand the angry , corroding action of a strong artistic impulse that was incessantly baulked in full tide . The sinister , menacing voices of that tide had no meaning for [him]181-professor theobald , except as expressing a malaise which [he]181-professor theobald had met with a hundred times before . [He]181-professor theobald put it down to an excess of emotional or nervous energy , in a nature whose opportunities did not offer full scope to its powers . [He]181-professor theobald had grasped the general conditions , but [he]181-professor theobald had not perceived the particular fact that added tenfold to the evil which exists in the more usual , and less complicated case . [He]181-professor theobald thought but little of a musical gift , having no sympathy with music ; and since [he]181-professor theobald had never known what it was to receive anything but help and encouragement in the exercise of [his]181-professor theobald own talents , the effect upon the mind and character of such an experience as [Hadria]211-hadria 's , was beyond the range of [his]181-professor theobald conceptions . [He]181-professor theobald understood subtly , and misunderstood completely , at one and the same time . But to [Hadria]211-hadria , every syllable which revealed how much [he]181-professor theobald did understand , seemed to prove , by implication , that [he]181-professor theobald understood the whole . It never occurred to [her]211-hadria that [he]181-professor theobald was blinder than [Henriette]142-henriette [herself]142-henriette , to the real centre and heart of the difficulty . It has been said that what [the human being]5264-the human being longs for above all things , is to be understood : that [he]181-professor theobald prefers it infinitely to being over - rated . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald gave [Hadria]211-hadria this desired sensation . [His]181-professor theobald attraction for [her]211-hadria was composed of many elements , and it was enhanced by the fact that [she]211-hadria had now grown so used to [his]181-professor theobald presence , as to cease to notice many little traits that had repelled [her]211-hadria , at the beginning . [Her]211-hadria critical instincts were lulled . Thus had come to pass that which is by no means an uncommon incident in human history : a toleration for and finally a strong attraction towards [a nature that began by creating distrust , and even dislike]6768-a nature that began by creating distrust , and even dislike . [Hadria]211-hadria 's instinct now was to hunt up reasons for desiring the society of [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald , for the gladness that [she]211-hadria felt at the prospect of seeing [him]181-professor theobald . [She]211-hadria wished to explain to [herself]211-hadria how it was that [he]181-professor theobald had become so prominent a figure in [her]211-hadria life . It was surprising how rapidly and how completely [he]181-professor theobald had taken a central position . [Her]211-hadria feeling towards [him]181-professor theobald , and [her]211-hadria admiring affection for [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , were as different as night from day . [She]211-hadria shrank from comparing the two emotions , because at the bottom of [her]211-hadria heart , [she]211-hadria felt how infinitely less fine and sound was this latter attachment , how infinitely less to be welcomed . If [any one]2075-any one spoke disparagingly of [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald , [Hadria]211-hadria 's instinct was to stand up for [him]181-professor theobald , to find ingenious reasons for [his]181-professor theobald words or [his]181-professor theobald conduct that threw upon [him]181-professor theobald the most favourable light , and [her]211-hadria object was as much to persuade [herself]211-hadria as to convince [[her]211-hadria interlocutor]6770-her interlocutor . What [the Professor]4071-the professor had said this afternoon , had brought [her]211-hadria to a point whence [she]211-hadria had to review all these changes and developments of [her]211-hadria feeling . [She]211-hadria puzzled [herself]211-hadria profoundly . In remembering those few words , [she]211-hadria was conscious of a little thrill of — not joy ( the word was too strong ) , but of something akin to it . [She]211-hadria thought — and then laughed at [herself]211-hadria — that it had a resemblance to the sensation that is caused to the mind by the suggestion of some new and entrancingly interesting idea — say about astronomy ! And if [she]211-hadria consulted [her]211-hadria mere wishes in the matter , apart from all other considerations , [she]211-hadria would explore farther in this direction . Whether curiosity or sentiment actuated [her]211-hadria , [she]211-hadria could not detect . It would certainly be deeply exciting to find out what [her]211-hadria own nature really was , and still more so to gain greater insight into [his]181-professor theobald . Was this heartless , cold - blooded ? Or was it that [she]211-hadria felt a lurking capacity for a feeling stronger than — or at any rate different from — any that [she]211-hadria had hitherto felt ? This was a secret that [she]211-hadria could not discover . [Hadria]211-hadria gave a frightened start . Was [she]211-hadria finding [herself]211-hadria to be bad in a way that [she]211-hadria had never suspected ? If [she]211-hadria could but fully and completely escape from tradition , so that [her]211-hadria judgment might be quite unhampered . Tradition seemed either to make [human beings]4313-human beings blindly submissive , or to tempt [them]4313-human beings to act out of an equally blind opposition to its canons . [One]329-one could never be entirely independent . In [her]211-hadria confusion , [she]211-hadria longed to turn to some clear mind and sound conscience , not so much for advice , as in order to test the effect upon such a mind and conscience of the whole situation . [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue was [the only person upon whose judgment and feeling]6774-the only person upon whose judgment and feeling [she]211-hadria could absolutely rely . What would [he]116-professor fortescue think of [her]211-hadria ? [His]116-professor fortescue impression would be the best possible guide , for [no one]383-no one opposed more strongly than [he]116-professor fortescue did the vulgar notion of proprietary rights between [husband]1286-husband and [wife]1287-wife , [no one]383-no one asserted more absolutely the independence of [the individual]4889-the individual . Yet [Hadria]211-hadria could not imagine that [he]116-professor fortescue would be anything but profoundly sorry , if [he]116-professor fortescue knew the recklessness of [her]211-hadria feeling , and the nature of [her]211-hadria sentiment for [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . But then [he]116-professor fortescue did not know how [she]211-hadria stood ; [he]116-professor fortescue did not know that the blue hopeful distance of life had disappeared ; that even the middle - distance had been cut off , and that the sticks and stones and details of a very speckly foreground now confronted [her]211-hadria immovably . [She]211-hadria would like to learn how [many women of [her]211-hadria temperament]6780-many women of her temperament , placed in [her]211-hadria position , would stop to enquire very closely into the right and wrong of the matter , when for a moment , a little avenue seemed on the point of opening , misty and blue , leading the eye to hidden perilous distances . And then [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had , after all , many fine qualities . [He]181-professor theobald was complex , and [he]181-professor theobald had faults like the rest of [us]6781-us ; but the more one knew [him]181-professor theobald , the more [one]329-one felt [his]181-professor theobald kindness of heart ( how good [he]181-professor theobald was to [little Martha]129-martha ) , [his]181-professor theobald readiness to help [others]432-others , [his]181-professor theobald breadth of view and [his]181-professor theobald sympathy . These were not common qualities . [He]181-professor theobald was [a mall whom one]6784-a mall whom one could admire , despite certain traits that made [one]329-one shrink a little , at times . These moreover had disappeared of late . They were accidental rather than intrinsic . It was a matter of daily observation that [people]3687-people catch superficial modes of thought and speech , just as [they]3687-people catch accent , or as [women who have given no thought to the art of dress]6787-women who have given no thought to the art of dress , sometimes misrepresent [themselves]6787-women who have given no thought to the art of dress , by adopting , unmodified , whatever happens to be in the fashion . [Hadria]211-hadria had a wistful desire to be able to respect [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald without reserve , to believe in [him]181-professor theobald thoroughly , to think [him]181-professor theobald noble in calibre and fine in fibre . [She]211-hadria had a vague idea that emphatic statement could conduce to making all this true . [She]211-hadria had never met [him]181-professor theobald alone since that day of the picnic , except for a few chance minutes , when [he]181-professor theobald had expressed over again , rather in tone than in words , the sentiment before implied . [Algitha]81-algitha and [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria were relieved to see that [Hadria]211-hadria had , after all , taken [their]6787-women who have given no thought to the art of dress advice . Without making any violent or obvious change in [her]211-hadria conduct , [she]211-hadria had ceased to cause [[her]211-hadria friends]4444-her friends anxiety . Something in [her]211-hadria manner had changed . [Claude Moreton]178-claude moreton felt it instantly . [He]178-claude moreton spoke of leaving [Craddock Place]29-craddock place , but [he]178-claude moreton lingered on . [The house]296-the house had begun to empty . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton wished to have some time to [herself]176-lady engleton . [She]176-lady engleton was painting a new picture . But [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald remained . [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming went away to stay with [[his]159-joseph fleming married sister]6790-his married sister . About this time [Hubert]118-hubert had to go abroad to attend to some business matters of a serious and tedious character , connected with a law - suit in which [he]118-hubert was professionally interested . From some instinct which [Hadria]211-hadria found difficult to account for , [she]211-hadria avoided meeting [the Professor]4071-the professor alone . Yet the whole interest of the day centred in the prospect of seeing [him]4071-the professor . If by chance , [she]211-hadria missed [him]4071-the professor , [she]211-hadria felt flat and dull , and found [herself]211-hadria going over in [her]211-hadria mind every detail of [their]3064-their last meeting . [He]4071-the professor had the art of making [his]4071-the professor most trifling remark interesting . Even [his]4071-the professor comments on the weather had a colour and quality of [their]3064-their own . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton admired [his]4071-the professor lightness of touch . “[3062-my dear lady] Did [you]3063-you know that [[our]3064-their amiable [Professor]181-professor theobald]3065-our amiable professor shews [his]181-professor theobald devotion to [you]3063-you , by devotion to [[your]3063-you protégée]3066-your protégée ? ” [she]176-lady engleton asked one day , when [she]176-lady engleton met [Hadria]211-hadria returning from [the Priory]1664-the priory with [the two boys , whose holidays were not yet over]6793-the two boys , whose holidays were not yet over . “[181-professor theobald] [I]0-i saw [him]181-professor theobald coming out of [[the child]4983-the child 's cottage]3068-the child 's cottage this morning , and [she]0-i shewed [me]0-i the toy [he]181-professor theobald had given [her]0-i . ” “[0-i] [He]181-professor theobald is very fond of [her]0-i , [I]0-i know , ” said [Hadria]211-hadria . “[181-professor theobald] [He]181-professor theobald gives [her]0-i lots of things ! ” cried [Jack]277-jack , opening round and envious eyes . “[181-professor theobald] How do [you]181-professor theobald know , [sir]5634-sir ? ” enquired [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “[181-professor theobald] Because [Mary]128-mary says so , ” [Jack]277-jack returned . [Hadria]211-hadria was pleased at the kindness which the act seemed to indicate . [The doctor]1471-the doctor had ordered [her]211-hadria to be in the open air as much as possible , and to take a walk every day . Sometimes [she]211-hadria would walk with [the boys]3870-the boys , sometimes alone . In either case , the thought of [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald pursued [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria often grew wearied with it , but it could not be banished . If [she]211-hadria saw [a distant figure on the road , a little sick , excited stir of the heart]6796-a distant figure on the road , a little sick , excited stir of the heart , betrayed [her]211-hadria suspicion that it might be [he]181-professor theobald . [She]211-hadria could not sincerely wish [herself]211-hadria free from the strange infatuation , for the thought of life without it , troublesome and fatiguing though it was , seemed inexpressibly dull . It had taken the colour out of everything . It had altered the very face of nature , in [her]211-hadria eyes . [Her]211-hadria hope had been to escape loneliness , but with this preposterous secret , [she]211-hadria was lonelier than [she]211-hadria had ever been before . [She]211-hadria could no longer make [a confidante of [herself]211-hadria]6797-a confidante of herself . [She]211-hadria was afraid of [her]211-hadria own ridicule , [her]211-hadria own blame , above all of finding [herself]211-hadria confronted with some accusation against [the Professor]4071-the professor , some overpowering reason for thinking poorly of [him]4071-the professor . Whenever [they]6799-they met , [she]211-hadria was in terror lest [he]4071-the professor should leave [her]211-hadria no alternative . [She]211-hadria often opened conversational channels by which [he]4071-the professor could escape [his]4071-the professor unknown peril , and [she]211-hadria would hold [her]211-hadria breath till it was over . [She]211-hadria dreaded [the cool - headed , ruthless critic]6800-the cool - headed , ruthless critic , lurking within [her]211-hadria own consciousness , who would hear of no ingenious explanations of words or conduct . But [she]211-hadria would not admit to this dread — that would have been to admit everything . [She]211-hadria had not the satisfaction of openly thinking the matter out , for the suspicion that so profoundly saddened [her]211-hadria , must be kept scrupulously hidden . [Hadria]211-hadria was filled with dismay when [she]211-hadria dared to glance at the future . No wonder [Valeria]109-valeria had warned [her]211-hadria against playing with fire ! Was it always like this when [people]3687-people fell in love ? What a ridiculous , uncomfortable , outrageous thing it was ! How destructive to common sense and sanity and everything that kept life running on reasonable lines . A poor joke at best , and oh , how stale ! “[128-mary] Shall [I]0-i tell [you]3070-you [your]3070-you ruling passion , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley ? ” “[0-i] If [you]3070-you can , [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald . ” Before [them]6802-them stretched [a woodland glade]6803-a woodland glade . The broad fronds of the bracken made bright patches of light where the sun caught them , and tall plants , such as hemlock and wild parsley , stood out , almost white against the shade ; the flies and midges moving round [them]6802-them in the warmth . At some distance behind , the sound of voices could be heard through the windings of the wood . There were snatches of song and laughter . “[181-professor theobald] [Your]3070-you ruling passion is power over [others]432-others . ” “[3070-you] It has been sadly thwarted then , ” [she]154-mrs. temperley answered , with a nervous laugh . “[3070-you] Thwarted ? Surely not . What more can [you]3070-you want than to touch the emotions of [every one who comes across [your]3070-you path]3072-every one who comes across your path ? It is a splendid power , and ought to be more satisfying to [the possessor]4766-the possessor than a gift of any other kind . ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald waited for [her]154-mrs. temperley reply , but [she]154-mrs. temperley made none . [He]181-professor theobald looked at [her]154-mrs. temperley fixedly , eagerly . [She]154-mrs. temperley could do nothing but walk on in silence . “[3074-even an actor] [Even an actor]3074-even an actor does not impress [himself]3074-even an actor so directly upon [[his]3074-even an actor fellows]951-his fellows as [a woman]3753-a woman of — well , [a woman like [yourself]3070-you]3077-a woman like yourself . [A painter]2603-a painter , [a writer]3079-a writer , [a musician]3080-a musician , never comes in touch at all with [[his]3074-even an actor public]3081-his public . [We]3082-we hear [his]3074-even an actor name , [we]3082-we admire or [we]3082-we decry [his]3074-even an actor works , but [the man]3754-the man or [the woman who has toiled , and felt , and lived]3084-the woman who has toiled , and felt , and lived , is unknown to [us]3082-we . [He]3074-even an actor is lost in [his]3074-even an actor work . ” [Hadria]211-hadria gave a murmur of assent . “[3074-even an actor] But [you]3070-you , [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , have a very different story to tell . It is [you]3070-you , [yourself]3070-you , [your]3070-you personality , in all its many - sided charm that [we]3082-we all bow to ; it is [you]3070-you , not [your]3070-you achievements that — that [we]3082-we love . ” [Hadria]211-hadria cleared [her]211-hadria throat ; the words would not come . A rebellious little nerve was twitching at [her]211-hadria eye - lid . After all , what in heaven 's name was [she]211-hadria to say ? It was too foolish to pretend to misunderstand ; for tone , look , manner all told the same story ; yet even now there was nothing absolutely definite to reply to , and [her]211-hadria cleverness of retort had deserted [her]211-hadria . “[154-mrs. temperley] Ah ! [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley — [Hadria]211-hadria — ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had stopped short in the path , and then [Hadria]211-hadria made some drowning effort to resist the force that [she]211-hadria still feared . But it was in vain . [She]211-hadria stood before [him]181-professor theobald , paler even than usual , with [her]211-hadria head held high , but eye - lids that drooped and lips that trembled . The movement of the leaves made faint quivering little shadows on [her]211-hadria white gown , and stirred delicately over the lace at [her]211-hadria throat . The emotion that possessed [her]211-hadria , the mixture of joy and dismay and even terror , passed across [her]211-hadria face , in the moment 's silence . [The two figures]450-the two figures stood opposite to [one another]3945-one another ; [Hadria]211-hadria drawing a little away , swayed slightly backward , [the Professor]4071-the professor eagerly bending forward . [He]4071-the professor was on the point of speaking , when there came floating through the wood , the sound of [a woman]3753-a woman 's voice singing . The voice was swiftly recognised by [them]450-the two figures both , and the song . [Hadria]211-hadria 's eye - lids lifted for a second , and [her]211-hadria breathing quickened . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald advanced a step . [Hadria]211-hadria drew back . The sweet cadence died away . A bird 's note took up the dropped thread of music . [The Professor]4071-the professor broke into passionate speech . “[154-mrs. temperley] [My]0-i cause is pleaded in [your]3085-you own language , [Hadria]211-hadria , [Hadria]211-hadria ; listen to it , listen . [You]3085-you know what is in [my]0-i heart ; [I]0-i ca n't apologize for feeling it , for [I]0-i have no choice ; [no man]4555-no man has where [you]3085-you are concerned , as [you]3085-you must have discovered long ago . And [I]0-i do not apologize for telling [you]3085-you the truth , [you]3085-you know it does [you]3085-you no wrong . This is no news to [you]3085-you ; [you]3085-you must have guessed it from the first . [Your]3085-you coldness , [your]3085-you rebuffs , betrayed that [you]3085-you did . But , ah ! [I]0-i have struggled long enough . [I]0-i can keep silence no longer . [I]0-i have thought of late that [your]3085-you feeling for [me]0-i had changed ; a thousand things have made [me]0-i hope — good heavens , if [you]3085-you knew what that means to [a man who had lost it]3087-a man who had lost it ! Ah ! speak — don't look like that , [Hadria,—what]278-hadria,—what is there in [me]0-i that [you]3085-you always turn from ? Speak , speak ! ” “[278-hadria,—what] Ah ! life is horribly difficult ! ” [she]211-hadria exclaimed . “[278-hadria,—what] [I]0-i wish to heaven [I]0-i had never budged from the traditions in which [I]0-i was educated — either that , or that [everybody]3781-everybody had discarded them . [I]0-i feel one way and think another . ” “[0-i] Then [you]3085-you do love [me]0-i , [Hadria]211-hadria , ” [he]3085-you cried . [Her]211-hadria instinct was to deny the truth , but there seemed to [her]211-hadria something mean in concealment , especially if [she]211-hadria were to blame , especially if [those who respected tradition , and made it their guide and rule through thick and thin , in the very teeth of reason]6809-those who respected tradition , and made it their guide and rule through thick and thin , in the very teeth of reason , were right after all , as it seemed to [her]211-hadria , at this moment , that [they]6809-those who respected tradition , and made it their guide and rule through thick and thin , in the very teeth of reason were . If there were evil in this strange passion , let [her]211-hadria at least acknowledge [her]211-hadria share in it . Let [her]211-hadria not “[3085-you] assume a virtue though [she]3089-she had it not . ” [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald was watching [her]211-hadria face , as for a verdict of life and death . “[3089-she] Oh , answer [me]0-i , answer [me]0-i — Yes or no , yes or no ? ” [She]211-hadria had raised [her]211-hadria eyes for a moment , about to speak ; the words were stifled at their birth , for the next instant [she]211-hadria was in [his]3085-you arms . Again came the voice of [the singer]6810-the singer , nearer this time . The song was hummed softly . THE need for vigilance over that hidden distrust was more peremptory now than ever . The confession once made , the die once cast , anything but complete faith and respect became intolerable . Outwardly , affairs seemed to run on very much as before . But [Hadria]211-hadria could scarcely believe that [she]211-hadria was living in [the same world]6811-the same world . The new fact walked before [her]211-hadria , everywhere . [She]211-hadria did not dare to examine it closely . [She]211-hadria told [herself]211-hadria that a great joy had come to [her]211-hadria , or rather that [she]211-hadria had taken the joy in spite of everything and [everybody]3781-everybody . [She]211-hadria would order [her]211-hadria affections exactly as [she]211-hadria chose . If only [she]211-hadria could leave [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene ! [Hubert]118-hubert and [[her]211-hadria parents]3931-her parents considered the opinion of [the public]4347-the public as of more importance than anything else in life ; for [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's sake [she]211-hadria was forced to acquiesce ; otherwise there was absolutely no reason why [she]211-hadria and [Hubert]118-hubert should live under the same roof . It was a mere ceremony kept up on account of [others]432-others . That had been acknowledged by [him]118-hubert in so many words . And a wretched , ridiculous , irksome ceremony it was for [them]6817-them both . [Hadria]211-hadria refused now to meet [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald at [the Cottage]1763-the cottage . [His]181-professor theobald visits [there]571-there , which had been timed to meet [her]211-hadria , must be paid at a different hour . [He]181-professor theobald remonstrated in vain . [She]211-hadria shewed various other inconsistencies , as [he]181-professor theobald called them . [He]181-professor theobald used to laugh affectionately at [her]211-hadria “[3089-she] glimpses of conscience , ” but said [he]181-professor theobald cared nothing for these trifles , since [he]181-professor theobald had [her]211-hadria assurance that [she]211-hadria loved [him]181-professor theobald . How [he]181-professor theobald had waited and longed for that ! How hopeless , how impossible it had seemed . [He]181-professor theobald professed to have fallen in love at first sight . [He]181-professor theobald even declared that [Hadria]211-hadria had done the same , though in a different way , without knowing it . [Her]211-hadria mind had resisted and , for the time , kept [her]211-hadria feelings in abeyance . [He]181-professor theobald had watched the struggle . [Her]211-hadria heart , [he]181-professor theobald rejoiced to believe , had responded to [him]181-professor theobald from the beginning . By dint of repeating this very often , [he]181-professor theobald had half convinced [Hadria]211-hadria that it was so . [She]211-hadria preferred to think that [her]211-hadria feeling was of the long - standing and resistless kind . Sometimes [she]211-hadria had intervals of reckless happiness , when all doubts were kept at bay , and the condition of belief that [she]211-hadria assiduously cultivated , remained with [her]211-hadria freely . [She]211-hadria felt no secret tug at the tether . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald would then be at [his]181-professor theobald best ; grave , thoughtful , gentle , considerate , responsive to every mood . When [they]6820-they met at [Craddock Place]29-craddock place and elsewhere , [Hadria]211-hadria suffered miseries of anxiety . [She]211-hadria was terrified lest [he]181-professor theobald should do or say something in bad taste , and that [she]211-hadria would see [her]211-hadria own impression confirmed on the faces of [others]432-others . [She]211-hadria put it to [herself]211-hadria that [she]211-hadria was afraid [people]3687-people would not understand [him]181-professor theobald as [she]211-hadria did . The history of [his]181-professor theobald past life , as [he]181-professor theobald had related it to [her]211-hadria , appealed overpoweringly to all that was womanly and protective in [her]211-hadria nature . [He]181-professor theobald was emotional by temperament , but circumstance had doomed [him]181-professor theobald to repression and solitude . This call on [her]211-hadria sympathy did more than anything to set [Hadria]211-hadria 's mind at rest . [She]211-hadria gave a vast sigh when that feeling of confidence became confirmed . Life , then , need no longer be ridiculous ! Hard and cruel it might be , full of lost dreams , but at least there would be something in it that was perfect . [This new emotional centre]6823-this new emotional centre offered the human summun bonum : release from [oneself]6824-oneself . [Hadria]211-hadria and [the Professor]4071-the professor met , one morning , in [the gardens of [the Priory]1664-the priory]2350-the gardens of the priory . [Hadria]211-hadria had been strolling down [the yew avenue]2414-the yew avenue , [her]211-hadria thoughts full of [him]181-professor theobald , as usual . [She]211-hadria reached the seat at the end where once [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue had found [her]211-hadria — centuries ago , it seemed to [her]211-hadria now . How different was this meeting ! [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald came by the path through [the thick shrubberies]6829-the thick shrubberies , behind the seat . There was a small space of grass at the back . Here [he]181-professor theobald stood , bending over the seat , and though [he]181-professor theobald was usually prudent , [he]181-professor theobald did not even assure [himself]181-professor theobald that [no one]383-no one was in sight , before drawing [Hadria]211-hadria 's head gently back , and stooping to kiss [her]211-hadria on the cheek , while [he]181-professor theobald imprisoned a hand in each of [his]181-professor theobald .
