With a sudden strong movement , [he]3291-he flung [his]3291-he arms round [her]129-martha and clasped [her]129-martha in an embrace , as fierce and revengeful as the sweep of the wind which sends great trees crashing to the ground , and ships to [the bottom of [the sea]1589-the sea]3296-the bottom of the sea . “ [You]3291-he do n't love [me]3291-he ? ”[3291-he] [he]3291-he enquired . “ Let [me]3291-he go , let [me]3291-he go — [coward — madman]7003-coward — madman ! ”[3291-he] “ [You]3291-he do n't love [me]3291-he ? ”[3291-he] [he]3291-he repeated . “ [I]3291-he hate [you]3291-he — let [me]3291-he go ! ”[3291-he] “ If this is the last time — ”[3291-he] “ [I]3291-he wish [I]3291-he could kill [you]3291-he ! ”[3291-he] “ Ah , that is the sort of woman [I]3291-he like ! ”[3291-he] “ [You]3291-he make [me]3291-he know what it is to feel like [a murderess]7004-a murderess ! ”[3291-he] “ And to look like one , by heaven ! ”[3291-he] [She]3291-he wrenched [herself]3291-he away , with a furious effort . “ [Coward]7005-coward ! ”[3291-he] [she]3291-he cried . “ [I]3291-he did right to mistrust [you]3298-you ! ”[3291-he] [Little Martha]129-martha ran up and offered [her]129-martha a wild heartsease which [she]129-martha had found on one of the graves . [Hadria]211-hadria , trembling and white , stooped instinctively to take the flower , and as [she]211-hadria did so , the whole significance of the afternoon 's revelation broke over [her]211-hadria , with fresh intensity . [[His]3298-you child]3299-his child ! [I]211-hadria think of taking [the little one]7009-the little one [myself]211-hadria . [You]3298-you are going to revenge [yourself]3298-you like that ? ”[211-hadria] “ [You]3298-you have made [me]211-hadria feel [my]211-hadria responsibilities towards [[my]211-hadria child]7012-my child , as [I]211-hadria fear [I]211-hadria did not feel them before . [I]211-hadria have made up [my]211-hadria mind . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria stood before [him]3303-he , white as the gravestone . “ [You]3303-he said that vengeance was futile . So it is . Leave [her]4983-the child to [me]3303-he . ”[3303-he] But [the Professor]4071-the professor shook [his]4071-the professor head . “ How do [I]4071-the professor know [you]4071-the professor have told [me]4071-the professor the truth ? ”[4071-the professor] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed , with a flash of fury . “ Do [you]211-hadria mean to dispute it ? ”[3303-he] [he]3303-he asked . [She]211-hadria was silent . “ [I]3303-he think [you]211-hadria would find that a mistaken policy , ”[3303-he] [he]3303-he said , watching [her]211-hadria face . “ [I]211-hadria do n't believe [you]4071-the professor can take [her]4983-the child away ! ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [I]211-hadria am acting for [[her]4983-the child mother]520-her mother , and [[her]4983-the child mother]520-her mother , not having made [herself]520-her mother into [[your]4071-the professor legal property]7017-your legal property , has some legal right to [[her]520-her mother own child]7018-her own child . Would [you]211-hadria have it interfere with [his]7019-a father awakening aspirations to do [his]7019-a father duty towards [[his]7019-a father child]3299-his child ? What a dreadful thought ! And then , [I]4071-the professor think [you]211-hadria have some special views on the education of [the little one]7009-the little one which [I]4071-the professor can not entirely approve . After all , [a woman]3753-a woman has probably to be [a wife]1373-a wife and [mother]3851-mother , on the good old terms that have served [the world]334-the world for a fair number of centuries , when one comes to consider it : it is a pity to allow [her]3753-a woman to grow up without those dogmas and sentiments that may help to make the position tolerable , if not always satisfactory , to [her]3753-a woman . Though , as [a philosopher]7026-a philosopher , [one]7027-one may see the absurdity of popular prejudices , yet as [a practical man]7028-a practical man , one feels the inexpediency of disturbing the ideas upon which the system depends , and thus adding to the number of malcontents . All very well for [those who think things out for [themselves]7029-those who think things out for themselves]7029-those who think things out for themselves ; but the education of [a girl]3734-a girl should be on the old lines , believe [me]4071-the professor . [You]211-hadria will not believe [me]4071-the professor , [I]4071-the professor know , so [I]4071-the professor think it better , for this as well as for other reasons , to take [[my]4071-the professor daughter]7031-my daughter under [my]4071-the professor own care . [Martha]129-martha drew away , and struck [[her]129-martha father]609-her father a sturdy blow on the face . [He]181-professor theobald told [his]181-professor theobald story quietly , and without an effort to excuse [himself]181-professor theobald . “ Of course , though [I]176-lady engleton ca n't exonerate [you]181-professor theobald , [Professor]181-professor theobald , [I]176-lady engleton blame [her]176-lady engleton more than [you]181-professor theobald , ”[176-lady engleton] [she]176-lady engleton said finally , “ for [her]176-lady engleton standard in the matter was so different from your's — [you]181-professor theobald being [a man]3704-a man . ”[176-lady engleton] [The Professor]4071-the professor suppressed a smile . [You]176-lady engleton were so devoted to [the little girl]5857-the little girl , and it does seem terribly hard that [she]5857-the little girl should be taken away from [you]176-lady engleton . ”[211-hadria] “ It was [my]211-hadria last chance , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria muttered , half audibly . “ Then [I]211-hadria suppose [you]176-lady engleton will not attempt to resist ? ”[211-hadria] “ No , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [He]4983-the child thinks of leaving [Martha]129-martha with [you]176-lady engleton for another month . ”[211-hadria] “ Really ? It has not struck [him]4983-the child that perhaps [I]176-lady engleton may not keep [her]129-martha for another month . Now that it is once established that [Martha]129-martha is to be regarded as under [his]4983-the child guardianship and authority , and that [my]176-lady engleton jurisdiction ceases , [he]4983-the child must take [her]129-martha at once . [I]176-lady engleton will certainly not act for [him]4983-the child in that matter . Since [you]176-lady engleton are in [his]4983-the child confidence , would [you]176-lady engleton kindly tell [him]4983-the child that ? ”[176-lady engleton] [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton looked surprised . “ Certainly ; [I]176-lady engleton suppose [he]4983-the child and [[his]4983-the child sister]351-his sister will look after [the child]4983-the child . ”[176-lady engleton] “ [I]211-hadria shall send [Martha]129-martha up with [Hannah]212-hannah . ”[211-hadria] “ It will astonish [him]4983-the child . ”[211-hadria] “ Does [he]4983-the child really think [I]176-lady engleton am going to act as [[his]4983-the child deputy]7062-his deputy ? ”[176-lady engleton] “ [He]4983-the child thought [you]176-lady engleton would be glad to have [Martha]129-martha as long as possible . ”[211-hadria] “ As [the child of [Ellen Jervis]184-ellen jervis]1765-the child of ellen jervis , yes — not as [[his]4983-the child child]3299-his child . ”[211-hadria] “ [I]176-lady engleton do n't see that it matters much , [myself]176-lady engleton , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , “ however , [I]176-lady engleton will let [him]4983-the child know . ”[176-lady engleton] “ By telegram , please , because [Martha]129-martha will be sent to - morrow . ”[211-hadria] “ What breathless haste ! ”[211-hadria] “ Why delay ? [Hannah]212-hannah will be [there]571-there — [she]212-hannah knows everything about [her]212-hannah charge ; and if [she]212-hannah is only allowed to stay — ”[211-hadria] “ [He]4983-the child told [me]211-hadria [he]4983-the child meant to keep [her]129-martha . ”[211-hadria] “ [I]211-hadria am thankful for that ! ”[211-hadria] By this time , the story had flown through [the village]1124-the village ; nothing else was talked of . The excitement was intense . Gossip ran high in [hall]3324-hall and [cottage]3325-cottage . [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue alone could not be drawn into the discussion . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton took [him]116-professor fortescue aside and asked what [he]116-professor fortescue really thought about it . All [he]116-professor fortescue would say was that the whole affair was deeply tragic . [He]116-professor fortescue had no knowledge of the circumstances and feelings involved , and [his]116-professor fortescue judgment must therefore be useless . It seemed more practical to try to help [[one]329-one 's fellows]2089-one 's fellows to resist sin , than to shriek at [convicted sinners]3328-convicted sinners . [His]116-professor fortescue departure had been fixed for the following morning . “ So [you]211-hadria and [poor little [Martha]129-martha]7066-poor little martha will go up together by [the afternoon train]7067-the afternoon train , [I]176-lady engleton suppose , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . [Hadria]211-hadria spent the rest of the day at [[Martha]129-martha 's cottage]6954-martha 's cottage . There were many preparations to make . [Hannah]212-hannah was bustling about , [her]212-hannah eyes red with weeping . [She]212-hannah was heart - broken . [She]212-hannah declared that [she]212-hannah could never live with “ [that bad man]7068-that bad man . ”[212-hannah] But [Hadria]211-hadria persuaded [her]212-hannah , for [Martha]129-martha 's sake , to remain . And [Hannah]212-hannah , with another burst of tears , gave an assurance which amounted to a pledge , that [she]212-hannah would take a situation with [the Father of [Evil]3330-evil [himself]134-father]134-father , rather than desert [the blessed child]3331-the blessed child . “ [I]211-hadria wonder if [Martha]129-martha realizes at all what is going to happen , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria sadly , as [she]211-hadria stood watching [the little girl]5857-the little girl playing with [her]5857-the little girl toys . [Martha]129-martha was talking volubly to [the blue man]3333-the blue man . [He]3333-the blue man still clung to a precarious existence ( though [he]3333-the blue man was seriously chipped and faded since the Paris days ) , and had as determined a centre of gravity as ever . “ [I]212-hannah do n't think [she]211-hadria understands , [ma'am]1503-ma'am , ”[212-hannah] said [Hannah]212-hannah . “ [I]212-hannah kep ' on tellin ' [her]211-hadria , and once [she]211-hadria cried and said [she]211-hadria did not want to go , but [she]211-hadria soon forgot it . ”[212-hannah] [Hadria]211-hadria remained till it was time to dress for dinner . [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue had promised to dine with [her]211-hadria and [Valeria]109-valeria on this last evening . [Little Martha]129-martha had been put early to bed , in order that [she]129-martha might have a long rest before the morrow 's journey . The golden curls lay like strands of silk on the pillow , the bright eyes were closed in healthful slumber . [The child]4983-the child lay , the very image of fresh and pure and sweet human life , with no thought and no dread of the uncertain future that loomed before [her]4983-the child . [Hannah]212-hannah had gone [upstairs]4836-upstairs to pack [her]212-hannah own belongings . The little window was open , as usual , letting the caressing air wander in , as sweet and fresh as the little body and soul to which it had ministered from the beginning . The busy , loud - ticking clock was working on with cheerful unconcern , as if this were just like every other day whose passing moments it had registered . The hands were pointing towards seven , and the dinner hour was half - past seven . [Hadria]211-hadria stood looking down at [the sleeping child]3336-the sleeping child , [her]211-hadria hands resting on the low rail of the cot . There was a desolate look in [her]211-hadria eyes , and something more terrible still , almost beyond definition . It was like the last white glow of some vast fire that has been extinguished . Suddenly — as something that gives way by the run , after a long resistance — [she]211-hadria dropped upon [her]211-hadria knees beside the cot with a slight cry , and broke into a silent storm of sobs , deep and suppressed . The stillness of [the room]379-the room was unbroken , and [one]329-one could hear the loud tick - tack of the little clock telling off the seconds with business - like exactness . THE evening was sultry . Although the windows of [the dining - room]1265-the dining - room were wide open , not a breath of air came in from [the garden]3867-the garden . A dull , muggy atmosphere brooded sullenly among the masses of the evergreens , and in the thick summer foliage of the old walnut tree on [the lawn]1843-the lawn . “ How oppressive it is ! ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria exclaimed . [She]109-valeria had been asked to allow [a niece of [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux , who was to join [some friends in [Italy]11-italy]3343-some friends in italy , to make the journey under [[her]109-valeria escort]3344-her escort]3342-a niece of madame bertaux , who was to join some friends in italy , to make the journey under her escort , and the date of [her]109-valeria departure was therefore fixed . [She]109-valeria had decided to return to [town]4255-town on the morrow , to make [her]109-valeria preparations . [Valeria]109-valeria declared impulsively that [she]109-valeria would stay at [home]3770-home , after all . [She]109-valeria could not bear to leave [Hadria]211-hadria for so many lonely months . “ Oh , no , no , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria in dismay , “ do n't let [me]211-hadria begin already to impoverish other lives ! ”[211-hadria] [Valeria]109-valeria remonstrated but [Hadria]211-hadria persisted . “ At least [I]211-hadria have learnt that lesson , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . “ [I]211-hadria should have been [a fool]1606-a fool if [I]211-hadria had n't , for [my]211-hadria life has been a sermon on the text . ”[211-hadria] [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue gave a little frown , as [he]116-professor fortescue often did when some painful idea passed through [his]116-professor fortescue mind . “ It is happening everywhere , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ the poor , sterile lives exhaust [the strong and full ones]7071-the strong and full ones . [I]211-hadria will not be one of [those vampire souls]7072-those vampire souls , at least not while [I]211-hadria have [my]211-hadria senses about [me]211-hadria . ”[211-hadria] Again , the little frown of pain contracted [the Professor]4071-the professor 's brow . The dusk had invaded the dinner table , but [they]3348-they had not thought of candles . [They]3348-they went straight out to [the still garden]3349-the still garden . [Valeria]109-valeria had a fan , with which [she]109-valeria vainly tried to overcome the expression of the atmosphere . [She]109-valeria was very low - spirited . [Hadria]211-hadria looked ill and exhausted . [Little Martha]129-martha 's name was not mentioned . It was too sore a subject . “ [I]109-valeria ca n't bear the idea of leaving [you]211-hadria , [Hadria]211-hadria , especially when [you]211-hadria talk like that . [I]109-valeria wish , how [I]109-valeria wish , that some way could be found out of this labyrinth . Is this sort of thing to be the end of all the grand new hopes and efforts of [women]606-women ? Is all [our]3348-they force to be killed and overwhelmed in this absurd way ? ”[109-valeria] “ Ah , no , not all , in heaven 's name ! ”[109-valeria] “ But if [women]606-women wo n't repudiate , in practice , the claims that [they]606-women hold to be unjust , in theory , how can [they]606-women hope to escape ? [We]3348-they may talk to all eternity , if [we]3348-they do n't act . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria shrugged [her]211-hadria shoulders . “ [Your]211-hadria reasoning is indisputable , but what can [one]329-one do ? There are cases — in short , some things are impossible ! ”[211-hadria] [Valeria]109-valeria was silent . “ [I]109-valeria have thought , at times , that [you]211-hadria might make a better stand , ”[109-valeria] [she]109-valeria said at last , clinging still to [her]109-valeria theory of the sovereignty of the will . [Hadria]211-hadria did not reply . [The Professor]4071-the professor shook [his]4071-the professor head . “ [You]211-hadria know [my]211-hadria present conditions , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , after a silence . “ [I]211-hadria ca n't overcome them . But perhaps [some one else in [my]211-hadria place]7076-some one else in my place might overcome [them]7077-them . [I]211-hadria confess [I]211-hadria do n't see how . Do [you]211-hadria ? ”[211-hadria] [Valeria]109-valeria hesitated . [She]109-valeria made some vague statement about strength of character , and holding on through storm and stress to [one]329-one 's purpose ; had not this been the history of all lives worth living ? [Hadria]211-hadria agreed , but pressed the practical question . And that [Valeria]109-valeria could not answer . [She]109-valeria could not bring [herself]109-valeria to say that [the doctor]1471-the doctor 's warnings ought to be disregarded by [Hadria]211-hadria , at the risk of [[her]109-valeria mother]520-her mother 's life . It was not merely a risk , but a practical certainty that any further shock or trouble would be fatal . [Valeria]109-valeria was tongue - tied . “ Now do [you]211-hadria see why [I]211-hadria feel so terrified when [anyone]806-anyone proposes to narrow down [his]806-anyone existence , even in the smallest particular , for [my]211-hadria sake ? ”[211-hadria] asked [Hadria]211-hadria . “ It is because [I]211-hadria see what awful power [a human being]668-a human being may acquire of ravaging and of ruling other lives , and [I]211-hadria do n't want to acquire that power . [I]211-hadria see that the tyranny may be perfectly well - intentioned , and indeed scarcely to be called tyranny , for it is but half conscious , yet only the more irresistible for that . ”[211-hadria] “ It is [one]329-one 's own fault if [one]329-one submits to conscious tyranny , ”[4071-the professor] [the Professor]4071-the professor put in , “ and [I]4071-the professor think [tyrant]7082-tyrant and [victim]7083-victim are then much on a par . ”[4071-the professor] “ A mere demand can be resisted , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria added ; “ it is grief , real grief , however unreasonable , that brings [people]3687-people to [their]3687-people knees . But , oh , may the day hasten , when [people]3687-people shall cease to grieve when [others]432-others claim [their]3687-people freedom ! ”[211-hadria] [Valeria]109-valeria smiled . “ [I]109-valeria do n't think [you]211-hadria are in much danger of grudging liberty to [[your]211-hadria neighbours]7087-your neighbours , [Hadria]211-hadria ; so [you]211-hadria need not be so frightened of becoming [a vampire]7088-a vampire , as [I]109-valeria think [you]211-hadria call it . ”[109-valeria] “ Not now , but how can one tell what the result of years and years of monotonous existence may be , or the effect of example ? How did it happen that [[my]109-valeria mother]4254-my mother came to feel aggrieved if [[her]4254-my mother daughters]364-her daughters claimed some right of choice in the ordering of [their]364-her daughters lives ? [I]109-valeria suppose it is because [[her]364-her daughters mother]520-her mother felt aggrieved if [she]520-her mother ventured to call [her]520-her mother soul [her]520-her mother own . ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria laughed . “ But it is true , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [Very few of [us]7093-us]7092-very few of us , if any , are in the least original as regards [our]7093-us sorrowing . [We]7093-us follow the fashion . [We]7093-us are not so presumptuous as to decide for [ourselves]7093-us what shall afflict [us]7093-us . ”[211-hadria] “ Or what shall transport [us]7093-us with joy , ”[109-valeria] added [Valeria]109-valeria , with a shrug . “ Still less perhaps . Tradition says ‘ Weep , this is the moment , ’ or ‘ Rejoice , the hour has come , ’ and [we]7093-us chant [our]7093-us dirge or kindle [our]7093-us bonfires accordingly . Why , it means a little martyrdom to [the occasional sinner who selects [his]7094-the occasional sinner who selects his own occasion for sorrow or for joy own occasion for sorrow or for joy]7094-the occasional sinner who selects his own occasion for sorrow or for joy . ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria laughed at the notion of [Hadria]211-hadria 's being under the dictatorship of tradition , or of anything else , as to [her]211-hadria emotions . But [Hadria]211-hadria held that [everybody]3781-everybody was more or less subject to the thraldom . And the thraldom increased as the mind and the experience narrowed . And as the narrowing process progressed , [she]211-hadria said , the exhausting or vampire quality grew and grew . “ [I]211-hadria have seen it , [I]211-hadria have seen it ! [Those who have been starved in life]7095-those who have been starved in life , levy a sort of tax on the plenty of [others]432-others , in the instinctive effort to replenish [their]7095-those who have been starved in life own empty treasure - house . Only that is impossible . [One]329-one can gain no riches in that fashion . [One]329-one can only reduce [one]329-one 's victim to a beggary like [one]329-one 's own . ”[211-hadria] [Valeria]109-valeria was perturbed . “ The more [I]109-valeria see of life , the more bitter a thing it seems to be [a woman]3753-a woman ! And one of the discouraging features of it is , that [women]606-women are so ready to oppress [each other]4561-each other ! ”[109-valeria] “ Because [they]606-women have [themselves]606-women suffered oppression , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ It is a law that [we]7104-we can not evade ; if [we]7104-we are injured , [we]7104-we pay back the injury , whether [we]7104-we will or not , upon [[our]7104-we neighbours]7105-our neighbours . If [we]7104-we are blessed , [we]7104-we bless , but if [we]7104-we are cursed , [we]7104-we curse . ”[4071-the professor] “ These moral laws , or laws of nature , or whatever one likes to call them , seem to be stern as death ! ”[109-valeria] exclaimed [Valeria]109-valeria . “ [I]109-valeria suppose [we]7104-we are all inheriting the curse that has been laid upon [[our]7104-we mothers]7106-our mothers through so many ages . ”[109-valeria] “ [We]7104-we are not free from the shades of [[our]7104-we grandmothers]7107-our grandmothers , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ only [I]211-hadria hope a little ( when [I]211-hadria have not been to [the Vicarage]4698-the vicarage for some time ) that [we]7104-we may be less of a hindrance and an obsession to [[our]7104-we granddaughters]7109-our granddaughters than [[our]7104-we grandmothers]7107-our grandmothers have been to [us]7104-we . ”[211-hadria] “ Ah ! that way lies hope ! ”[4071-the professor] cried [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ [I]4071-the professor wish , [I]4071-the professor wish [I]4071-the professor could believe ! ”[4071-the professor] [Valeria]109-valeria exclaimed . “ But [I]109-valeria was born ten years too early for the faith of [this generation]7111-this generation . ”[109-valeria] “ It is [you]211-hadria who have helped to give [this generation]7111-this generation [its]7111-this generation faith , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ But have [you]211-hadria real hope and real faith , in [your]211-hadria heart of hearts ? Tell [me]211-hadria , [Hadria]211-hadria . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria looked startled . “ Ah ! [I]211-hadria knew it . [Women]606-women do n't really believe that the cloud will lift . If [they]606-women really believed what [they]606-women profess , [they]606-women would prove it . [They]606-women would not submit and resign [themselves]606-women . Oh , why do n't [you]211-hadria shew what [a woman]3753-a woman can do , [Hadria]211-hadria ? ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria gave a faint smile . [She]211-hadria did not speak for some time , and when [she]211-hadria did , [her]211-hadria words seemed to have no direct reference to [Valeria]109-valeria 's question . “ [I]211-hadria believe that there are thousands and thousands of women whose lives have run on parallel lines with [mine]211-hadria . ”[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria recalled a strange and grotesque vision , or waking - dream , that [she]211-hadria had dreamt a few nights before : of a vast abyss , black and silent , which had to be filled up to the top with the bodies of [women]606-women , hurled down to the depths of [the pit of darkness]3359-the pit of darkness , in order that [the survivors]3360-the survivors might , at last , walk over in safety . Human bodies take but little room , and [the abyss]3361-the abyss seemed to swallow [them]3362-them , as some greedy animal its prey . But [Hadria]211-hadria knew , in [her]211-hadria dream , that some day it would have claimed [its last victim]3363-its last victim , and the surface would be level and solid , so that [people]3687-people would come and go , scarcely remembering that beneath [their]3687-people feet was once a chasm into which throbbing lives had to descend , to darkness and a living death . [Valeria]109-valeria looked anxious and ill at ease . [She]109-valeria watched [Hadria]211-hadria 's face . [She]109-valeria was longing to urge [her]211-hadria to leave [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene , but was deterred by the knowledge of the uselessness of such advice . [Hadria]211-hadria could not take it . “ [I]109-valeria chafe against these situations ! ”[109-valeria] cried [Valeria]109-valeria . “ [I]109-valeria am so unused , in [my]109-valeria own life , to such tethers and limitations . [They]7115-they would drive [me]109-valeria crazy ! ”[109-valeria] “ Oh , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed , with an amused smile , “ this is a new cry ! ”[211-hadria] “ [I]109-valeria do n't care , ”[109-valeria] said [Valeria]109-valeria discontentedly . “ [I]211-hadria never supposed that one could be tied hand and foot , in this way . [I]211-hadria should never stand it . It is intolerable ! ”[211-hadria] “ These are what [you]4071-the professor have frequently commended to [me]211-hadria as ‘ [home]3770-home ties , ’ ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ Oh , but it is impossible ! ”[211-hadria] “ [You]211-hadria attack [the family]360-the family ! ”[4071-the professor] cried [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ If [the family]360-the family makes itself ridiculous — ? ”[4071-the professor] [The Professor]4071-the professor and [Hadria]211-hadria laughed . [Valeria]109-valeria was growing excited . “ The natural instinct of [man]332-man to get [his]332-man fun at [[his]332-man neighbour]2095-his neighbour 's expense meets with wholesome rebuffs in [the outer world]7121-the outer world , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor , “ but in [the family]360-the family it has [its]360-the family chance . That 's why [the family]360-the family is so popular . ”[4071-the professor] [Valeria]109-valeria , with [her]109-valeria wonted capriciousness , veered round in defence of the institution that [she]109-valeria had been just jeering at . “ Well , after all , it is the order of Nature to have one 's fun at the expense of [someone]4160-someone , and [I]109-valeria do n't believe [we]7125-we shall ever be able to practise any other principle , [I]109-valeria mean on a national scale , however much [we]7125-we may progress . ”[109-valeria] “ Oh , but [we]7125-we sha n't progress unless [we]7125-we do , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . “ [You]109-valeria are always paradoxical . ”[4071-the professor] “ There is no paradox here . [I]109-valeria am just as certain as [I]109-valeria am of [my]109-valeria own existence , that real , solid , permanent progress is impossible to [any people]7126-any people until [they]7126-any people recognise , as a mere truism , that whatever is gained by cruelty , be it towards [the humblest thing alive]7127-the humblest thing alive , is not gain , but the worst of loss . ”[109-valeria] “ Oh , [you]4071-the professor always go too far ! ”[109-valeria] cried [Valeria]109-valeria . “ [I]4071-the professor do n't admit that in a horror of cruelty , it is possible to go too far , ”[4071-the professor] [the Professor]4071-the professor replied . “ Cruelty is the one unpardonable sin . ”[4071-the professor] [He]4071-the professor passed [his]4071-the professor hand across [his]4071-the professor brow , with a weary gesture , as if the pressure of misery and tumult and anguish in [the world]334-the world , were more than [he]4071-the professor could bear . “ [You]211-hadria wo n't give up [your]211-hadria music , [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[109-valeria] [Valeria]109-valeria said , at the end of a long cogitation . “ It is a forlorn sort of pursuit , ”[109-valeria] [Hadria]211-hadria answered , with a whimsical smile , “ but [I]211-hadria will do all [I]211-hadria can . ”[211-hadria] [Valeria]109-valeria seemed relieved . “ And [you]211-hadria will not give up hope ? ”[109-valeria] “ Hope ? Of what ? ”[109-valeria] “ Oh , of — of—. What an absurd question ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria smiled . “ It is better to face facts , [I]211-hadria think , than to shroud them away . After all , it is only by the rarest chance that character and conditions happen to suit each other so well that the powers can be developed . [They]7128-they are generally crushed . One more or less—. ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria gave a shrug . [The Professor]4071-the professor broke in , abruptly . “ It is exactly the one more or less that sends the balance up or down , that decides the fate of [men]3698-men and [nations]7130-nations . [An individual]7131-an individual often counts more than a generation . If that were not so , nothing would be possible , and hope would be insane . ”[4071-the professor] “ Perhaps it is ! ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria beneath [her]211-hadria breath . [The Professor]4071-the professor had risen . [He]4071-the professor heard the last words , but made no remonstrance . Yet there was a something in [his]4071-the professor expression that gave comfort . “ [I]4071-the professor fear [I]4071-the professor shall have to be going back , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said , looking at [his]4071-the professor watch . As [he]4071-the professor spoke , the first notes of a nightingale stole out of the shrubbery . Voices were hushed , and [the three]6873-the three stood listening spellbound , to the wonderful impassioned song . [Hadria]211-hadria marvelled at its strange serenity , despite the passion , and speculated vaguely as to the possibility of a paradox of the same kind in the soul of [a human being]668-a human being . Passion and serenity ? Had not [the Professor]4071-the professor combined these apparent contradictions ? There was ecstasy so supreme in the bird 's note that it had become calm again , like great heat that affects the senses , as with frost , or a flooded river that runs swift and smooth for very fulness . Presently , a second nightingale began to answer from a distant tree , and [the garden]3867-the garden was filled with the wild music . One or two stars had already twinkled out . “ [I]4071-the professor ought really to be going , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . But [he]4071-the professor lingered still . [His]4071-the professor eyes wandered anxiously to [Hadria]211-hadria 's white face . [He]4071-the professor said good - night to [Valeria]109-valeria , and then [he]4071-the professor and [Hadria]211-hadria walked to the gate together . “ [You]4071-the professor will come back and see [us]6873-the three at [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene soon after [you]4071-the professor return , wo n't [you]4071-the professor ? ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said wistfully . “ Of course [I]211-hadria will . And [I]211-hadria hope that meanwhile , [you]4071-the professor will set to work to get strong and well . All [your]4071-the professor leisure ought to be devoted to that object , for the present . [I]211-hadria should be so delighted to hear from [you]4071-the professor now and again , when [you]4071-the professor have a spare moment and the spirit moves [you]4071-the professor . [I]211-hadria will write and tell [you]4071-the professor how [I]211-hadria fare , if [I]211-hadria may . If , at any time , [I]211-hadria can be of service to [you]4071-the professor , do n't forget how great a pleasure it would be to [me]211-hadria to render it . [I]211-hadria hope if ever [I]211-hadria come back to [England]14-england — ”[211-hadria] “ When [you]211-hadria come back , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria corrected , hastily . — “ that [we]3378-we may meet [oftener]7132-oftener . ”[211-hadria] “ Indeed , that will be something to look forward to ! ”[3378-we] [They]3378-we exchanged the hearty , lingering handshake of trusty friendship and deep affection . The last words , the last good wishes , were spoken , the last wistful effort was made of [two human souls]3379-two human souls to bid [each other]4561-each other be of good cheer , and to bring to [one another comfort and hope]3381-one another comfort and hope . [Hadria]211-hadria leant on the gate , [a lonely figure in the dim star - light]3382-a lonely figure in the dim star - light , watching the form that had already become shadowy , retreating along [the road]4037-the road and gradually losing itself in the darkness . [AUTUMN]283-autumn had come round again . [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene had calmed down after the exciting event of the summer . [[Martha]129-martha 's little cottage]3384-martha 's little cottage was now standing empty , the virginia creeper trailing wildly , in thick festoons and dangling sprays over [the porch]1117-the porch and creeping up round the windows , even threatening to cover them with a ruddy screen , since now the bright little face no longer looked out of the latticed panes , and [the cottage]1763-the cottage was given over to dust and spiders . [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley was often seen by [the villagers]2235-the villagers passing along [the road]4037-the road towards [Craddock]23-craddock . [She]154-mrs. temperley would sometimes pause at [the cottage]1763-the cottage , to gather a few of the flowers that still came up in [the tiny garden]3390-the tiny garden . It was said that [she]154-mrs. temperley gathered them to lay on [[Ellen Jervis]184-ellen jervis 's grave]3391-ellen jervis 's grave . “ [Dear]2230-dear , [dear]2230-dear , [she]154-mrs. temperley do take on about [that child]2190-that child ! ”[155-dodge] [Dodge]155-dodge used to say , as [she]155-dodge passed up [[the street]5996-the street of [Craddock]23-craddock]3393-the street of craddock . And [Mrs. Gullick]156-mrs. gullick , [good soul]3394-good soul , would shake [her]156-mrs. gullick head and express [her]156-mrs. gullick sympathy , in spite of not “ holding ”[156-mrs. gullick] with [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley 's “ ways . ”[156-mrs. gullick] [[Her]156-mrs. gullick poorer neighbours]4739-her poorer neighbours understood far more than [the others]303-the others could understand , how sorely [she]156-mrs. gullick was grieving about [the child]4983-the child . Because [she]156-mrs. gullick said nothing on the subject , it was generally supposed that [she]156-mrs. gullick had ceased to care . After all , it was an act of charity that [she]156-mrs. gullick had undertaken , on an impulse , and it was quite as well that [she]156-mrs. gullick should be relieved of the responsibility . [Hannah]212-hannah used to write regularly , to let [her]212-hannah know how [Martha]129-martha was . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had directed [Hannah]212-hannah to do this . [The nurse]1797-the nurse had to admit that [he]181-professor theobald was very good and very devoted to [the child]4983-the child . [She]156-mrs. gullick throve in [[her]156-mrs. gullick new home]6110-her new home , and seemed perfectly happy . [Hadria]211-hadria was now delivered over to the tender mercies of [her]211-hadria own thoughts . [Her]211-hadria memories burnt , as corrosive acids , in [her]211-hadria brain . [She]211-hadria could find no shadow of protection from [her]211-hadria own contempt . There was not one nook or cranny into which that ruthless self - knowledge could not throw its cruel glare . In the hours of darkness , in the haunted hours of the early morning , [she]211-hadria and [her]211-hadria memories played horrible games with [one another]3945-one another . [She]211-hadria was hunted , [they]3402-they [the hunters]3403-the hunters . There was no thought on which [she]211-hadria could rest , no consoling remembrance . [She]211-hadria often wished that [she]211-hadria had followed [her]211-hadria frequent impulse to tell [Miss Du]109-valeria Prel the whole wretched story . But [she]211-hadria could not force [herself]211-hadria to touch the subject through the painful medium of speech . [Valeria]109-valeria knew that [Hadria]211-hadria was capable of any outward law - breaking , but [she]109-valeria would never be prepared for the breaking of [her]109-valeria own inner law , the real canon on which [she]109-valeria had always laid so much stress . And then [she]109-valeria had shrunk from the idea of betraying a secret not solely [her]109-valeria own . If [she]109-valeria told the story , [Valeria]109-valeria would certainly guess the name . [She]109-valeria felt a still greater longing that [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue should know the facts ; [he]116-professor fortescue would be able to help [her]109-valeria to face it all , and to take the memory into [her]109-valeria life and let its pain eat out what was base and evil in [her]109-valeria soul . [He]116-professor fortescue would give [her]109-valeria hope ; [his]116-professor fortescue experience , [his]116-professor fortescue extraordinary sympathy , would enable [him]116-professor fortescue to understand it all , better than [she]109-valeria did [herself]109-valeria . If [he]116-professor fortescue would look at this miserable episode unflinchingly , and still hold out [his]116-professor fortescue hand to [her]109-valeria , as [she]109-valeria knew [he]116-professor fortescue would , and still believe in [her]109-valeria , then [she]109-valeria might believe still in [herself]109-valeria , in [her]109-valeria power of rising after this lost illusion , this shock of self - detection , and of going on again , sadder , and perhaps stronger ; but if [he]116-professor fortescue thought that since [she]109-valeria was capable of a real treason against [[her]109-valeria gods]3404-her gods , that [she]109-valeria was radically unsound at heart , and a mass of sophistication , then — [Hadria]211-hadria buried [her]211-hadria face in the pillow . [She]211-hadria went through so often now , these paroxysms of agony . Do what [she]211-hadria would , look where [she]211-hadria might , [she]211-hadria saw no relief . [She]211-hadria was afraid to trust [herself]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria was afraid to accept [her]211-hadria own suggestions of comfort , if ever a ray of it came to [her]211-hadria , lest it should be but another form of self - deception , another proof of moral instability . In [her]211-hadria eternal tossing to and fro , in mental anguish , the despairing idea often assailed [her]211-hadria : that after all , it did not matter what [she]211-hadria did or thought . [She]211-hadria was but [an atom of the vast whole , a drop in the ocean of human life]3405-an atom of the vast whole , a drop in the ocean of human life . [She]211-hadria had no end or motive in anything . [She]211-hadria could go on doing what had to be done to the last , glad if [she]211-hadria might bring a little pleasure in so acting , but beyond that , what was there to consider ? The wounds to [her]211-hadria vanity and [her]211-hadria pride ached a little , at times , but the infinitely deeper hurt of disillusion overwhelmed the lesser feeling . [She]211-hadria was too profoundly sad to care for that trivial mortification . Sometimes , [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue used to write to [Hadria]211-hadria , and [she]211-hadria looked forward to these letters as to nothing else . [She]211-hadria heard from [Valeria]109-valeria also , who had met [the Professor at [Siena]281-siena]3406-the professor at siena . [She]109-valeria said [he]3406-the professor at siena did not look as well as [she]109-valeria had hoped to find [him]3406-the professor at siena . [She]109-valeria could not see that [he]3406-the professor at siena had gained at all , since leaving [England]14-england . [He]3406-the professor at siena was cheerful , and enjoying [sunny Italy]11-italy as much as [his]3406-the professor at siena strength would allow . [Valeria]109-valeria was shocked to notice how very weak [he]3406-the professor at siena was . [He]3406-the professor at siena had a look in [his]3406-the professor at siena face that [she]109-valeria could not bear to see . If [he]3406-the professor at siena did not improve soon , [she]109-valeria thought of trying to persuade [him]3406-the professor at siena to return [home]3770-home to see [[his]3406-the professor at siena doctor]6863-his doctor again . When [one]329-one was ill , [home]3770-home was the best place after all . “ [You]3406-the professor at siena and [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , ”[109-valeria] [she]109-valeria said , in closing [her]109-valeria letter , “ are [the two people [I]109-valeria love in [the world]334-the world]7136-the two people i love in the world . [You]3406-the professor at siena are all that [I]109-valeria have in life to cling to . Write to [me]109-valeria , dearest [Hadria]211-hadria , for [I]109-valeria am very anxious and wretched . ”[109-valeria] The affairs of life and death mix themselves incongruously enough , in [this confused world]3411-this confused world . The next news that stirred the repose of [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene , was that of [Algitha]81-algitha 's engagement to [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred . In spite of [his]3406-the professor at siena socialistic views , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was satisfied with the marriage , because [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred was well - connected and had good expectations . [The mother]578-the mother had feared that [Algitha]81-algitha would never marry at all , and [she]578-the mother not only raised no objection , but seemed relieved . [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred had come down to stay at [the Red House]34-the red house , during one of [Algitha]81-algitha 's holidays , and it was then that the betrothal had taken place . The marriage promised to be happy , for [the couple]3413-the couple were deeply attached and had interests in common . [They]3413-the couple intended to continue to work on the same lines after [they]3413-the couple were married . [Both parents]3414-both parents were favourably impressed by [the son - in - law elect]3415-the son - in - law elect , and [the Cottage]1763-the cottage became the scene of exciting arguments on the subject of socialism . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton insisted on holding [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred responsible for every sort of theory that had ever been attributed not merely to [socialists]3417-socialists , but to [communists]3418-communists , [anarchists]3419-anarchists , [collectivists]3420-collectivists , [nihilists]3421-nihilists , and the rest ; and nothing would persuade [him]89-mr. fullerton that [the young man]4116-the young man was not guilty of all these contradictory enormities of thought . [Wilfrid]83-fred 's personality , however , overcame every prejudice against [him]4116-the young man , on this account , after the first meeting . [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming , among others , congratulated [Algitha]81-algitha heartily on [her]81-algitha engagement . “ [I]159-joseph fleming can see [you]81-algitha are very happy , ”[159-joseph fleming] [he]159-joseph fleming said naïvely . [She]81-algitha laughed and coloured . “ Indeed [I]81-algitha ought to be . Life is gloriously worth living , when it is lived in the presence of [good and generous souls]7138-good and generous souls . ”[81-algitha] “ [I]159-joseph fleming wish [I]159-joseph fleming had married , ”[159-joseph fleming] said [Joseph]159-joseph fleming pensively . “ It is not too late to mend , ”[81-algitha] suggested [Algitha]81-algitha . “ How reckless [you]4116-the young man are ! ”[313-her sister] exclaimed [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister . “ How can [you]4116-the young man recommend marriage in the abstract ? Little changes had taken place in [the village]1124-the village , through death or marriage or departure . [Dodge]155-dodge had laid to rest [many victims of influenza]3430-many victims of influenza , which visited [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood with great severity . Among [the slain]3432-the slain , [poor [Dodge]155-dodge]3433-poor dodge had to number [[his]3433-poor dodge own wife]3434-his own wife . [The old man]4209-the old man was broken down with [his]4209-the old man loss . Sometimes , returning through [the Craddock Woods]76-the craddock woods , [Hadria]211-hadria would pass through [the churchyard]1413-the churchyard on [her]211-hadria way [home]3770-home , after [her]211-hadria walk , and there [she]211-hadria would come upon [Dodge]155-dodge patiently at work upon [some new grave]3438-some new grave , the sound of [his]4209-the old man pickaxe breaking the autumn silence , ominously . [His]4209-the old man head was more bent than of yore , and [his]4209-the old man hair was whiter . [His]4209-the old man old face would brighten up when [he]4209-the old man heard [Hadria]211-hadria 's footstep , and [he]4209-the old man would pause , a moment or two , for a gossip . The conversation generally turned upon [his]4209-the old man old “ missus , ”[4209-the old man] who was buried under a yew tree , near the wicket gate . Then [he]4209-the old man would ask after [Hadria]211-hadria 's belongings ; about [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father and [mother]3851-mother , about [Hubert]118-hubert , and [the boys]3870-the boys . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton had made [the gravedigger]4776-the gravedigger 's acquaintance , and won [his]89-mr. fullerton hearty regard by many a chat and many a little kindness . [Dodge]155-dodge had never ceased to regret that [Martha]129-martha had been taken away from [Craddock]23-craddock . [The place]981-the place seemed as if [it]981-the place had gone to sleep , [he]4209-the old man said . Things were n't as they used to be . [Hadria]211-hadria would often go to see [the old man]4209-the old man , trying to cheer [him]4209-the old man and minister to [his]4209-the old man growing ailments . [His]4209-the old man shrewdness was remarkable . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton quoted [Dodge]155-dodge as an authority on matters of practical philosophy , and [the old gravedigger]4772-the old gravedigger became a sort of oracle at [the Cottage]1763-the cottage . [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred complained that [he]4209-the old man was incessantly confronted with some saying of [Dodge]155-dodge , and from this there was no appeal . The news from [Italy]11-italy was still far from reassuring . [Valeria]109-valeria was terribly anxious . But [she]109-valeria felt thankful , [she]109-valeria said , to be with [the invalid]6530-the invalid and able to look after [him]4209-the old man . [The doctors]3448-the doctors would not hear of [his]4209-the old man returning to [England]14-england at the approach of winter . It would be sheer suicide . [He]4209-the old man must go further [south]6864-south . [Valeria]109-valeria had met [some old friends]3450-some old friends , among [them]3450-some old friends [Madame Bertaux]195-madame bertaux , and [they]3451-they had decided to go on together , perhaps to [Naples]77-naples or [Sorrento]78-sorrento . [[Her]109-valeria friends]4444-her friends had all fallen in love with [the Professor]4071-the professor , as [every one]913-every one did . [They]4444-her friends were a great help and comfort to [her]109-valeria . If it were not for the terrible foreboding , [Valeria]109-valeria said [she]109-valeria would be perfectly happy . [The Professor]4071-the professor 's presence seemed to change the very atmosphere . [He]4071-the professor spoke often about [Hadria]211-hadria , and over and over again asked [Valeria]109-valeria to watch over [her]211-hadria and help [her]211-hadria . And [he]4071-the professor spoke often about [[his]4071-the professor wife]573-his wife . [Valeria]109-valeria confessed that , at one time , [she]109-valeria used to be horribly and shamefully jealous of [this wife , whom [he]4071-the professor worshipped so faithfully]3457-this wife , whom he worshipped so faithfully , but now that feeling had left [her]109-valeria . [She]109-valeria was thankful for the great privilege of [his]4071-the professor friendship . A new tone had come over [Valeria]109-valeria 's letters , of late ; the desperate , almost bitter element had passed away , and something approaching serenity had taken its place . [No one]383-no one , [she]109-valeria said , could be in [the Professor]4071-the professor 's presence every day , and remain exactly the same as before . [She]109-valeria saw [his]4071-the professor potent , silent influence upon [every creature who crossed [his]4071-the professor path]3460-every creature who crossed his path . [He]4071-the professor came and went among [[his]4071-the professor fellows]951-his fellows , quietly , beneficently , and each was the better for having met [him]4071-the professor , more or less , according to the fineness and sensitiveness of the nature . “ [My]109-valeria love for [him]4071-the professor , ”[109-valeria] said [Valeria]109-valeria , “ used at one time to be a great trouble to [me]109-valeria . It made [me]109-valeria restless and unhappy . Now [I]109-valeria am glad of it , and though there must be an element of pain in a hopeless love , yet [I]109-valeria hold [myself]109-valeria fortunate to have cherished it . ”[109-valeria] [Hadria]211-hadria received this letter from [the postman]3462-the postman when [she]211-hadria was coming out of [[Dodge]155-dodge 's cottage]3463-dodge 's cottage . It threw [her]211-hadria into a conflict of strong and painful feeling : foreboding , heart - sickness , a longing so strong to see [[her]211-hadria friends]4444-her friends that it seemed as if [she]211-hadria must pack up instantly and go to [them]4444-her friends , and through it all , a sense of loneliness that was almost unbearable . How [she]211-hadria envied [Valeria]109-valeria ! To love with [her]211-hadria whole heart , without a shadow of doubt ; to have that element of warmth in [her]211-hadria life which could never fail [her]211-hadria , like sunshine to [the earth]2009-the earth . Among the cruelest elements of [Hadria]211-hadria 's experience had been that emptying of [her]211-hadria heart ; the rebuff to the need for love , the conviction that [she]211-hadria was to go through life without its supreme emotion . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had thrown away what might have been a master - passion . The outlook was so blank and cold , so unutterably lonely ! [She]211-hadria looked back to the days at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , as if several lifetimes had passed between [her]211-hadria and [them]3466-them . What illusions [they]3466-them had all harboured in those strange old days ! “ Do [you]81-algitha remember [our]7151-our famous discussion on [Emerson]87-emerson in [the garret]293-the garret ? ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said to [Algitha]81-algitha . “ Do [I]211-hadria ? It is one of the episodes of [our]7151-our youth that stands out most distinctly . ”[211-hadria] “ And how about [Emerson]87-emerson 's doctrine ? Are [we]7151-our the makers of [our]7151-our circumstances ? Does [our]7151-our fate ‘ fit [us]7151-our like a glove ? ’ ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha looked thoughtful . “ [I]81-algitha doubt it , ”[81-algitha] [she]81-algitha said . “ Yet [you]81-algitha have brilliantly done what [you]81-algitha meant to do . ”[81-algitha] “ [My]81-algitha own experience does not overshadow [my]81-algitha judgment entirely , [I]81-algitha hope , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . “ [I]81-algitha have seen too much of a certain tragic side of life to be able to lay down a law of that sort . [I]81-algitha ca n't believe , for instance , that among [all those millions in [the East End]46-the east end]7153-all those millions in the east end , [not one man]7154-not one man or [woman]3844-woman , for all these ages , was born with great capacities , which better conditions might have allowed to come to fruition . [I]81-algitha think [you]118-hubert were right , after all . It is a matter of relation . ”[81-algitha] The autumn was unusually fine , and the colours sumptuous beyond description . The vast old trees that grew so tall and strong , in the genial English soil , burnt away [their]3467-their summer life in a grand conflagration . [Hubert]118-hubert had successfully carried the day with regard to the important case which had taken [him]118-hubert abroad , and had now returned to [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene . [Henriette]142-henriette came to stay at [the Red House]34-the red house . [She]142-henriette followed [[her]142-henriette brother]309-her brother , one day , into [the smoking - room]3469-the smoking - room , and there , with much tact and circumlocution , gave [him]309-her brother to understand that [she]142-henriette thought [Hadria]211-hadria was becoming more sensible ; that [she]211-hadria was growing more like [other people]3849-other people , less opinionated , wiser , and better in every way . “ [Hadria]211-hadria was always very sweet , of course , ”[142-henriette] said [Henriette]142-henriette , “ but [she]211-hadria had the faults of [her]211-hadria qualities , as [we]7156-we all have . [You]118-hubert have had [your]118-hubert trials , dear [Hubert]118-hubert , but [I]142-henriette rejoice to believe that [Hadria]211-hadria will give [you]118-hubert little further cause for pain or regret . ”[142-henriette] [Hubert]118-hubert made no reply . [He]118-hubert placed the tips of [his]118-hubert fingers together and looked into the fire . “ [I]118-hubert think that the companionship of [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton has been of great service to [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert observed , after a long pause . “ Unquestionably , ”[142-henriette] assented [Henriette]142-henriette . “ [She]176-lady engleton has had an enormous influence upon [her]176-lady engleton . [She]176-lady engleton has taught [Hadria]211-hadria to see that one may hold [one]329-one 's own ideas quietly , without flying in [everybody]3781-everybody 's face . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton is [a pronounced agnostic]7159-a pronounced agnostic , yet [she]176-lady engleton never misses a Sunday at [Craddock Church]33-craddock church , and [I]142-henriette am glad to see that [Hadria]211-hadria is following [her]176-lady engleton example . It must be a great satisfaction to [you]118-hubert , [Hubert]118-hubert . [People]3687-people used to talk unpleasantly about [Hadria]211-hadria 's extremely irregular attendance . It is such a mistake to offend [people]3687-people 's ideas , in a small place like this . ”[142-henriette] “ That is what [I]118-hubert told [Hadria]211-hadria , ”[118-hubert] said [Hubert]118-hubert , “ and [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother has been speaking seriously to [her]211-hadria on the subject . [Hadria]211-hadria made no opposition , rather to [my]118-hubert surprise . [She]211-hadria said that [she]211-hadria would go as regularly as [our]7163-our dining - room clock , if it gave [us]7163-our all so much satisfaction . ”[118-hubert] “ How charming ! ”[142-henriette] cried [Henriette]142-henriette benevolently , “ and how characteristic ! ”[142-henriette] As [Hadria]211-hadria sank in faith and hope , [she]211-hadria rose in the opinion of [[her]211-hadria neighbours]1818-her neighbours . [She]211-hadria was never nearer to universal unbelief than now , when [the orthodox]5549-the orthodox began to smile upon [her]211-hadria . Life presented itself to [her]211-hadria as a mere welter of confused forces . If goodness , or aspiration , or any godlike thing arose , for a moment — like [some shipwrecked soul with hands outstretched above the waves]3473-some shipwrecked soul with hands outstretched above the waves — swiftly it sank again submerged , leaving only a faint ripple on the surface , soon overswept and obliterated . [She]211-hadria could detect no light on the face of [the troubled waters]5227-the troubled waters . Looking around [her]211-hadria at other lives , [she]211-hadria saw the story written in different characters , but always the same ; hope , struggle , failure . The pathos of old age wrung [her]211-hadria heart ; the sorrows of [the poor]543-the poor , [the lonely]3476-the lonely , the illusions of [the seeker after wealth]3477-the seeker after wealth , the utter vanity of the objects of [men]3698-men 's pursuit , and the end of it all ! “ [I]81-algitha wonder what is the secret of success , [Hadria]211-hadria ? ”[81-algitha] “ Speaking generally , [I]81-algitha should say to have a petty aim . ”[81-algitha] “ Then if [one]329-one succeeds after a long struggle , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha pensively . “ [One]329-one finds it , [I]81-algitha doubt not , the dismalest of failures . ”[81-algitha] A great cloud of darkness seemed to have descended over [the earth]2009-the earth . [Hadria]211-hadria felt cut off even from Nature . The splendours of the autumn appeared at a vast distance from [her]211-hadria . [They]3480-they belonged to [another world]2583-another world . [She]211-hadria could not get near [them]3480-they . [Mother earth]3482-mother earth had deserted [[her]3482-mother earth child]1838-her child . A superficial apathy was creeping over [her]211-hadria , below which burnt a slow fire of pain . But the greater the apathy , which expressed itself outwardly in a sort of cheerful readiness to take things as they came , the more delighted [everybody]3781-everybody appeared to be with [the repentant sinner]3485-the repentant sinner . [[Her]211-hadria associates]4518-her associates seemed to desire earnestly that [she]211-hadria should go to [church]1153-church , as [they]4518-her associates did , in [her]211-hadria best bonnet — and why not ? [She]211-hadria would get a best bonnet , as ridiculous as [they]4518-her associates pleased , and let [Mr. Walker]217-mr. walker do [his]217-mr. walker worst . What did it matter ? Who was the better or the worse for what [she]211-hadria thought or how [she]211-hadria acted ? What mattered it , whether [she]211-hadria were consistent or not ? What mattered it if [she]211-hadria seemed , by [her]211-hadria actions , to proclaim [her]211-hadria belief in dogmas that meant nothing to [her]211-hadria , except as interesting products of [the human mind]3488-the human mind ? [She]211-hadria had not enough faith to make it worth while to stand alone . [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton said [he]157-lord engleton thought it right to go to [church]1153-church regularly , for the sake of setting an example to [the masses]3490-the masses , a sentiment which always used to afford [Hadria]211-hadria more amusement than many intentional witticisms . [She]211-hadria went often to the later service , when the autumn twilight lay heavy and sad upon [the churchyard]1413-the churchyard , and the peace of evening stole in through the windows of [the church]1115-the church . Then , as the sublime poetry of psalmist or [prophet]3493-prophet rolled through the Norman arches , or the notes of the organ stole out of [the shadowed chancel]3494-the shadowed chancel , a spirit of repose would creep into the heart of [the listener]1121-the listener , and the tired thoughts would take a more rhythmic march . [She]211-hadria felt nearer to [[her]211-hadria fellows]4821-her fellows , at such moments , than at any other . [Her]211-hadria heart went out to [them]4821-her fellows , in wistful sympathy . [They]4821-her fellows seemed to be standing together then , one and all , at the threshold of the great Mystery , and though [they]4821-her fellows might be parted ever so widely by circumstance , temperament , mental endowment , manner of thought , yet after all , [they]4821-her fellows were [brethren]3497-brethren and [fellow sufferers]3498-fellow sufferers ; [they]4821-her fellows shared the weakness , the longing , the struggle of life ; [they]4821-her fellows all had affections , ambitions , heart - breakings , sins , and victories ; the differences were slight and transient , in the presence of the vast unknown , the Ultimate Reality for which [they]4821-her fellows were all groping in the darkness . This sense of brotherhood was strongest with regard to [the poorer members of [the congregation]1116-the congregation]3499-the poorer members of the congregation : [the labourers]5962-the labourers with [their]5962-the labourers toil - stained hands and bent heads , [the wives]3275-the wives , [the weary mothers]3503-the weary mothers , [their]4821-her fellows faces seamed with the ceaseless strain of child - bearing , and hard work , and care and worry . In [their]4821-her fellows prematurely ageing faces , in [their]4821-her fellows furrowed brows , [Hadria]211-hadria could trace the marks of Life 's bare and ruthless hand , which had pressed so heavily on [those whose task it had been to bestow the terrible gift]3504-those whose task it had been to bestow the terrible gift . Here the burden had crushed soul and flesh ; here that insensate spirit of Life had worked its will , gratified [its]3505-its rage to produce and reproduce , it mattered not what in the semblance of [the human]3506-the human , so long only as that wretched semblance repeated itself , and repeated itself again , ad nauseum , while it destroyed the creatures which it used for its wild purpose — And the same savage story was written , once more , on the faces of [the better dressed women]3507-the better dressed women : worry , weariness , apathy , strain ; these were marked unmistakeably , after the first freshness of youth had been driven away , and the features began to take the mould of the habitual thoughts and the habitual impressions . And on these faces , there was a certain pettiness and coldness not observable on [those of [the poorer women]3509-the poorer women]3508-those of the poorer women . Often , when [one of [the neighbours]1469-the neighbours]3510-one of the neighbours called and found [Hadria]211-hadria alone , some chance word of womanly sympathy would touch a spring , and then a sad , narrow little story of trouble and difficulty would be poured out ; a revelation of the bewildered , toiling , futile existences that were being passed beneath a smooth appearance ; of the heart - ache and heroism and misplaced sacrifice , of the ruined lives that a little common sense and common kindness might have saved ; the unending pain and trouble about matters entirely trivial , entirely absurd ; the ceaseless travail to bring forth new elements of trouble for [those who must inherit the deeds of to - day]3512-those who must inherit the deeds of to - day ; the burdened existences agonizing to give birth to new existences , equally burdened , which in [their]4821-her fellows turn , were to repeat the ceaseless oblation to [the gods of Life]3513-the gods of life . “ Futile ? ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . “ [I]176-lady engleton think [women]606-women are generally [fools]5590-fools , entre nous ; that is why [they]606-women so often fill [their]606-women lives with sound and fury , accomplishing nothing . ”[176-lady engleton] [Hadria]211-hadria felt that this was a description of [her]211-hadria own life , as well as that of [most of [[her]211-hadria neighbours]1818-her neighbours]3514-most of her neighbours . “ [I]211-hadria can understand so well how it is that [women]606-women become conventional , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said , apparently without direct reference to the last remark , “ it is so useless to take the trouble to act on [one]329-one 's own initiative . It annoys [everybody]3781-everybody frightfully , and it accomplishes nothing , as [you]176-lady engleton say . ”[211-hadria] “ [[My]176-lady engleton dear]3722-my dear [Hadria]211-hadria , [you]211-hadria alarm [me]176-lady engleton ! ”[176-lady engleton] cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , laughing . “ [You]211-hadria must really be very ill indeed , if [you]211-hadria have come to this conclusion ! ”[176-lady engleton] In looking over some old papers and books , one afternoon , [Hadria]211-hadria came upon the little composition called Futility , which a mood had called forth at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , years ago . [She]211-hadria had almost forgotten about it , and in trying it over , [she]211-hadria found that it was like trying over the work of [some other person]3516-some other person . It expressed with great exactness the feelings that overwhelmed [her]211-hadria now , whenever [she]211-hadria let [her]211-hadria imagination dwell upon the lives of [women , of whatever class and whatever kind]3517-women , of whatever class and whatever kind . Futility ! The mournful composition , with its strange modern character , its suggestion of striving and confusion and pain , expressed as only music could express , the yearning and the sadness that burden so many [a woman]3753-a woman 's heart to - day . [She]211-hadria knew that the music was good , and that now [she]211-hadria could compose music infinitely better . The sharpness of longing for [her]211-hadria lost art cut through [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria half turned from the piano and then went back , as a moth to the flame . How was this eternal tumult to be stilled ? Facts were definite and clear , there was no room for doubt or for hope . These facts then had to be dealt with . How did [other women]4882-other women deal with [them]3520-them ? Not so much better than [she]211-hadria did , after all , as it appeared when [one]329-one was allowed to see beneath the amiable surface of [their]4882-other women lives . [They]4882-other women were all spinning round and round , in a dizzy little circle , all whirling and toiling and troubling , to no purpose . Even [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , who appeared so bright and satisfied , had [her]176-lady engleton secret misery which spoilt [her]176-lady engleton life . [She]211-hadria had beauty , talent , wealth , everything to make existence pleasant and satisfactory , but [she]211-hadria had allowed externals and unessentials to encroach upon it , to govern [her]211-hadria actions , to usurp the place of [her]211-hadria best powers , to creep into [her]211-hadria motives , till there was little germ and heart of reality left , and [she]211-hadria was beginning to feel starved and aimless in the midst of what might have been plenty . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had turned to [[her]176-lady engleton neighbour]937-her neighbour at [the Red House]4718-the red house in an instinctive search for sympathy , as the more genuine side of [her]176-lady engleton nature began to cry out against the emptiness of [her]176-lady engleton graceful and ornate existence . [Hadria]211-hadria was startled by the revelation . [Hubert]118-hubert had always held up [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton as a model of virtue and wisdom , and perfect contentment . Yet [she]211-hadria too , it turned out , for all [her]211-hadria smiles and [her]211-hadria cheerfulness , was busy and weary with futilities . [She]211-hadria too , like [the fifty daughters of [Danaus]285-danaus]3524-the fifty daughters of danaus , was condemned to [the idiot]3525-the idiot 's labour of eternally drawing water in sieves from [fathomless wells]3526-fathomless wells . [ALGITHA]81-algitha 'S marriage took place almost immediately . There was no reason for delay . [She]81-algitha stayed at [the Cottage]1763-the cottage , and was married at [Craddock Church]33-craddock church , on one of the loveliest mornings of the year , as [the villagers]2235-the villagers noticed with satisfaction . [Both sisters]3874-both sisters had become favourites in [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood among [the poorer people]3531-the poorer people , and [the inhabitants]916-the inhabitants mustered to see the wedding . It was only for [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother 's sake that [Algitha]81-algitha had consented to a conventional ceremony . [She]520-her mother said that [she]520-her mother and [Wilfrid]83-fred both hated the whole barbaric show . [They]3874-both sisters submitted only because there was no help for it . [[Algitha]81-algitha 's mother]3534-algitha 's mother would have broken [her]3534-algitha 's mother heart if [they]3874-both sisters had been bound merely by the legal tie , as [she]520-her mother and [Wilfrid]83-fred desired . “ Indeed , the only tie that [we]3413-the couple respect is that of [our]3413-the couple love and faith . If that failed , [we]3413-the couple should scorn to hold [one another]3945-one another in unwilling bondage . [We]3413-the couple are not entirely without self - respect . ”[520-her mother] [The couple]3413-the couple were to take a tour in [Italy]11-italy , where [they]3413-the couple hoped to meet [Valeria]109-valeria and [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming was married , almost at the same time , to [[his]159-joseph fleming merry Irish girl]3536-his merry irish girl . The winter came suddenly . Some terrific gales had robbed the trees of their lingering yellow leaves , and the bare branches already shewed their exquisite tracery against the sky . Heavy rain followed , and [the river]437-the river was swollen , and there were floods that made [the whole country]406-the whole country damp , and rank , and terribly depressing . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton felt the influence of the weather , and complained of neuralgia and other ailments . [She]97-mrs. fullerton needed watching very carefully , and plenty of cheerful companionship . This was hard to supply . In struggling to belie [her]97-mrs. fullerton feelings , day after day , [Hadria]211-hadria feared , at times , that [she]97-mrs. fullerton would break down disastrously . [She]211-hadria was frightened at the strange haunting ideas that came to [her]211-hadria , the dread and nameless horror that began to prey upon [her]211-hadria , try as [she]211-hadria would to protect [herself]211-hadria from these nerve - torments , which [she]211-hadria could trace so clearly to [their]3539-their causes . If only , instead of making [one half insane and stupid]3540-one half insane and stupid , the strain of grief would but kill one outright , and be done with it ! [Old Dodge]286-old dodge was [a good friend to [Hadria]211-hadria]3541-a good friend to hadria , at this time . [He]286-old dodge saw that something was seriously wrong , and [he]286-old dodge managed to convey [his]286-old dodge affectionate concern in a thousand little kindly ways that brought comfort to [her]211-hadria loneliness , and often filled [her]211-hadria eyes with sudden tears . Nor was [he]286-old dodge [the only friend [she]211-hadria had in [the village]1124-the village]3542-the only friend she had in the village , whose sympathy was given in generous measure . [Hadria]211-hadria had been able to be of use , at the time of the disastrous epidemic which had carried off [so many of [the population]1644-the population]3544-so many of the population , and since then had been admitted to more intimate relationship with [the people]4302-the people ; learning [their]4302-the people troubles and [their]4302-the people joys , [their]4302-the people anxieties , and the strange pathos of [their]4302-the people lives . [She]211-hadria learnt , at this time , the quality of English kindness and English sympathy , which [Valeria]109-valeria used to say was equalled nowhere in [the world]334-the world . Before the end of the winter , [Algitha]81-algitha and [[her]81-algitha husband]553-her husband returned . “ [I]286-old dodge 'm real glad , [mum]1416-mum , that [I]286-old dodge be , ”[286-old dodge] said [Dodge]286-old dodge , “ to think as [you]1416-mum has [[your]1416-mum sister]1388-your sister with [you]1416-mum again . There ai n't [nobody]3732-nobody like [one 's kith and kin]7175-one 's kith and kin , wen things is n't quite as they should be , as one may say . [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton — which [I]286-old dodge means [Mrs. Burton]287-mrs. burton — is sure to do [you]1416-mum a sight o ' good , bless ' er . ”[286-old dodge] [Dodge]286-old dodge was right . [Algitha]81-algitha 's healthy nature , strengthened by happiness and success , was of infinite help to [Hadria]211-hadria , in [her]211-hadria efforts to shake off the symptoms that had made [her]211-hadria frightened of [herself]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria did not know what tricks exhausted nerves might play upon [her]211-hadria , or what tortures [they]3549-they had in store for [her]211-hadria . [Algitha]81-algitha 's judgments were inclined to be definite and clear - cut to the point of hardness . [She]211-hadria did not know the meaning of over - wrought nerves , nor the difficulties of a nature more imaginative than [her]211-hadria own . [She]211-hadria had found [her]211-hadria will - power sufficient to meet all the emergencies of [her]211-hadria life , and [she]211-hadria was disposed to feel a little contemptuous , especially of late , at a persistent condition of difficulty and confusion . [Her]211-hadria impulse was to attack such a condition and bring it to order , by force of will . The active temperament is almost bound to misunderstand the imaginative or artistic spirit and its difficulties . [A real cul de sac]3550-a real cul de sac was to [Algitha]81-algitha almost unthinkable . There must be some means of finding one 's way out . [Hadria]211-hadria 's present attitude amazed and irritated [her]81-algitha . [She]211-hadria objected to [her]211-hadria regular church - going , as dishonest . Was [she]211-hadria not , for the sake of peace and quietness , professing that which [she]211-hadria did not believe ? And how was it that [she]211-hadria was growing more into favour with [the Jordans]288-the jordans and [Walkers]284-miss walkers and [all the narrow , wooden - headed people]3551-all the narrow , wooden - headed people ? Surely an ominous sign . After the long self - suppression , the long playing of a fatiguing rôle , [Hadria]211-hadria felt an unspeakable relief in [Algitha]81-algitha 's presence . To [her]211-hadria , at least , [she]211-hadria need not assume a false cheerfulness . [Algitha]81-algitha noticed , with anxiety , the change that was coming over [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister , the spirit of tired acquiescence , the insidious creeping in of a slightly cynical view of things , in place of the brave , believing , imaginative outlook that [she]211-hadria had once held towards life . This cynicism was more or less superficial however , as [Algitha]81-algitha found when [they]3553-they had a long and intimate conversation , one evening in [[Hadria]211-hadria 's room]3863-hadria 's room , by [her]211-hadria fire ; but it was painful to [Algitha]81-algitha to hear the hopeless tones of [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister 's voice , now that [she]211-hadria was speaking simply and sincerely , without bitterness , but without what is usually called resignation . “ No ; [I]211-hadria do n't think it is all for the best , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [I]211-hadria think , as far as [my]211-hadria influence goes , it is all for the worst . What fatal argument [my]211-hadria life will give to those who are seeking reasons to hold [our]3553-they sex in the old bondage ! [My]211-hadria struggles , [my]211-hadria failure , will add to the staggering weight that [we]3553-they all stumble under . [I]211-hadria have hindered more — that is the bitter thing — by having tried and failed , than if [I]211-hadria had never tried at all . [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker , [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon [herself]91-mrs. gordon , has given less arguments to [the oppressors]7176-the oppressors than [I.]211-hadria ”[211-hadria] “ But why ? But how ? ”[81-algitha] cried [Algitha]81-algitha incredulously . “ Because [no one]383-no one can point to [them]7176-the oppressors , as [they]7176-the oppressors will to [me]211-hadria , and say , ‘ See , what a ghastly failure ! See how feeble after all , are [these pretentious women of the new order]7178-these pretentious women of the new order , who begin by denying the sufficiency of the life assigned [them]7178-these pretentious women of the new order , by common consent , and end by failing in that and in the other which [they]7178-these pretentious women of the new order aspire to . What has become of all the talent and all the theories and resolves ? ’ And so [the next girl who dares to have ambitions , and dares to scorn the rôle of adventuress that society]7179-the next girl who dares to have ambitions , and dares to scorn the rôle of adventuress that society allots to [her]7179-the next girl who dares to have ambitions , and dares to scorn the rôle of adventuress that society , will have the harder fate because of [my]211-hadria attempt . Now nothing in [the whole world]6921-the whole world , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , [her]211-hadria voice losing the even tones in which [she]211-hadria had been speaking , “ nothing in [the whole world]6921-the whole world will ever persuade [me]211-hadria that that is all for the best ! ”[211-hadria] “ [I]211-hadria never said it was , but when a thing has to be , why not make the best of it ? ”[211-hadria] “ And so persuade [people]3687-people that all is well , when all is not well ! That 's exactly what [women]606-women always do and always have done , and plume [themselves]606-women upon it . And so this ridiculous farce is kept up , because [these wretched women]7184-these wretched women go smiling about [the world]334-the world , hugging [their]7184-these wretched women stupid resignation to [their]7184-these wretched women hearts , and pampering up [their]7184-these wretched women sickly virtue , at the expense of [their]7184-these wretched women sex . Hang [their]7184-these wretched women virtue ! ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha laughed . “ It is somewhat self - regarding certainly , in spite of the incessant renunciation and sacrifice . ”[81-algitha] “ Oh , self - sacrifice in [a woman]3753-a woman , is always [her]3753-a woman easiest course .
