It is the nearest approach to luxury that [society]367-society allows [her]3753-a woman , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , irascibly . “ It is most refreshing to hear [you]211-hadria exaggerate , once more , with the old vigour , ”[313-her sister] [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister cried . “ If [I]211-hadria have a foible , it is under - statement , ”[211-hadria] returned [Hadria]211-hadria , with a half - smile . “ Then [I]81-algitha think [you]211-hadria have n't a foible , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . “ That [I]81-algitha am ready to admit ; but seriously , [women]606-women seem bent on proving that [you]211-hadria may treat [them]606-women as [you]211-hadria like , but [they]606-women will ‘ never desert [Mr. Micawber]289-mr. micawber . ’ ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha smiled . “ [They]606-women are so mortally afraid of getting off the line and doing what might not be quite right . [They]606-women take such a morbid interest in [[their]606-women own characters]7189-their own characters . [They]606-women are so particular about [their]606-women souls . [The female soul]7190-the female soul is such a delicate creation — like a bonnet . Look at [a woman]3753-a woman trimming and poking at [her]3753-a woman bonnet — that 's exactly how [she]3753-a woman goes on with [her]3753-a woman soul . ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha laughed and shrugged [her]81-algitha shoulders . “ It has trained [her]3753-a woman in a sort of heroism , at any rate , ”[81-algitha] [she]81-algitha said . “ Heroism ! talk of [Spartan boys]7192-spartan boys , [they]7192-spartan boys are not in it ! [A woman]3753-a woman will endure martyrdom with the expression of [a seraph,—an extremely aggravating seraph]7194-a seraph,—an extremely aggravating seraph . [She]3753-a woman looks after [her]3753-a woman soul as if it were the ultimate fact of [the universe]420-the universe . [She]3753-a woman will trim and preen that ridiculous soul , though the heavens fall and the rest of [her]3753-a woman sex perish . ”[81-algitha] “ Come now , [I]211-hadria think there are exceptions . ”[211-hadria] “ A few , but very few . It is a point of honour , a sacred canon . [Women]606-women will go on patiently drawing water in sieves , and pretend [they]606-women are usefully employed because it tires [them]606-women ! ”[81-algitha] “ [They]606-women believe it , ”[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . “ Perhaps so . But it 's very silly . ”[81-algitha] “ It is really well meant . It is a submission to the supposed will of heaven . ”[81-algitha] “ A poor compliment to [Heaven]167-heaven ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed . “ Well , it is not , of course , [your]211-hadria conception nor mine of the will of heaven , but it is [their]606-women 's . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria shrugged [her]211-hadria shoulders . “ [I]211-hadria wish [women]606-women would think a little less of Heaven in the abstract , and a little more of [one another]3945-one another , in the concrete . ”[211-hadria] “ [Nobody]3732-nobody has ever taught [them]606-women to think of [one another]3945-one another ; on the contrary , [they]606-women have always been trained to think of [men]3698-men , and of Heaven , and [their]606-women souls . That training accounts for [their]606-women attitude towards [their]606-women own sex . ”[81-algitha] “ [I]81-algitha suppose so . A spirit of sisterhood among [women]606-women would have sadly upset the social scheme , as it has been hitherto conceived . Indeed the social scheme has made such a spirit well - nigh impossible . ”[81-algitha] “ [A conquering race]7203-a conquering race , if it is wise , governs [[its]7203-a conquering race subjects]7204-its subjects largely through [their]7204-its subjects internecine squabbles and jealousies . But what if [they]7204-its subjects combine — ? ”[211-hadria] “ Ah ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria drew a deep sigh . “ [I]211-hadria wish the moment of sisterhood were a little nearer . ”[211-hadria] “ Heaven hasten it ! ”[81-algitha] cried [Algitha]81-algitha . “ Perhaps it is nearer than [we]7205-we imagine . [Women]606-women are [quick learners]7207-quick learners , when [they]606-women begin . But , oh , it is hard sometimes to make [them]606-women begin . [They]606-women are so annoyingly abject ; so painfully diffident . It is [their]606-women pride to be humble . The virtuous worm wo n't even turn ! ”[81-algitha] “ Poor worm ! It sometimes permits [itself]7208-itself the relief of verbal expression ! ”[81-algitha] observed [Algitha]81-algitha . [Hadria]211-hadria laughed . “ There are smiling , villainous worms , who deny [themselves]606-women even that ! ”[211-hadria] After a long silence , [Algitha]81-algitha taking the poker in [her]81-algitha hand and altering the position of some of the coals , asked what [Hadria]211-hadria meant to do in the future ; how [she]211-hadria was going to “ turn , ”[81-algitha] if that was [her]211-hadria intention . “ Oh , [I]211-hadria can not even turn ! ”[211-hadria] replied [Hadria]211-hadria . “ [Necessity]290-necessity knows no law . The one thing [I]81-algitha wo n't do , is to be virtuously resigned . And [I]81-algitha wo n't ‘ make the best of it . ’ ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha laughed . “ [I]81-algitha am relieved to hear so wrong - headed a sentiment from [you]81-algitha . It sounds more like [your]81-algitha old self . ”[81-algitha] “ [I]211-hadria wo n't be called wrong - headed on this account , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ If [my]3557-i life is to bear testimony to the truth , its refrain ought to be , ‘ This is wrong , this is futile , this is cruel , this is damnable . ’ [I]3557-i shall warn [every young woman [I]3557-i come across]7209-every young woman i come across , to beware , as [she]7209-every young woman i come across grows older , and has [people]3687-people in [her]7209-every young woman i come across clutches , not to express [her]7209-every young woman i come across affection by making unlimited demands on [the beloved objects]7211-the beloved objects . nor by turning [the world]334-the world into [a prison - house]7213-a prison - house for [those whom [she]7209-every young woman i come across honours with [her]7209-every young woman i come across devotion]7214-those whom she honours with her devotion . The hope of the future lies in [the rising generation]7215-the rising generation . [You]7216-you ca n't alter [those who have matured in the old ideas]7217-those who have matured in the old ideas . It is for [us]7218-us to warn . [I]3557-i wo n't pretend to think that things are all right , when [I]3557-i know they are not all right . That would be mean . What is called making the best of it , would testify all the wrong way . [My]3557-i life , instead of being a warning , would be a sort of a trap . Let [me]3557-i at least play the humble role of [scarcecrow]7219-scarcecrow . [I]3557-i am in excellent condition for it , ”[3557-i] [she]3557-i added , grasping [her]3557-i thin wrist . [Algitha]81-algitha shook [her]81-algitha head anxiously . “ [I]3557-i fear , ”[3557-i] [she]3557-i said , “ that the moral that [most people]4077-most people will draw will be : ‘ Follow in the path of [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , however distasteful it may seem to [you]7216-you , and whatever temptations [you]7216-you feel towards a more independent life . If [you]7216-you do n't , [you]7216-you will come to grief . ’ ”[3557-i] “ Then [you]7216-you think it would be better to be ‘ resigned , ’ and look after [one]329-one 's own soul ? ”[81-algitha] “ Heaven knows what would be better ! ”[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha exclaimed . “ But one thing is certain , [you]7216-you ought to look after [your]7216-you body , for the present at any rate . ”[81-algitha] [HADRIA]211-hadria had found the autumn saddening , and the winter tempt [her]211-hadria to morbid thoughts , but the coming of spring made [her]211-hadria desperate . It would not allow [her]211-hadria to be passive , it would not permit [her]211-hadria emotions to lie prone and exhausted . Everything was waking , and [she]211-hadria must wake too , to the bitterest regret and the keenest longings of which [she]211-hadria was capable . [She]211-hadria had tried to avoid everything that would arouse these futile emotions ; [she]211-hadria had attempted to organise [her]211-hadria life on new lines , persisting in [her]211-hadria attitude of non - surrender , but winning , as far as [she]211-hadria was able , the rest that , at present , could only be achieved by means of a sort of inward apathy . It was an instinctive effort of self - preservation . [She]211-hadria was like a fierce fire , over which ashes have been heaped to keep down the flames , and check its ardour . [She]211-hadria had to eat [her]211-hadria heart out in dullness , to avoid its flaming out in madness . But the spring came and carried [her]211-hadria away on its torrent . [She]211-hadria might as well have tried to resist an avalanche . [She]211-hadria thought that [she]211-hadria had given up all serious thought of music ; the surrender was necessary , and [she]211-hadria had judged it folly to tempt [herself]211-hadria by further dallying with it . It was too strong for [her]211-hadria . And the despair that it awoke seemed to break up [her]211-hadria whole existence , and render [her]211-hadria unfit for [her]211-hadria daily task . But now [she]211-hadria found that , once more , [she]211-hadria had underrated the strength of [her]211-hadria own impulses . For some time [she]211-hadria resisted , but one day , the sun shone out strong and genial , the budding trees spread their branches to the warm air , a blackbird warbled ecstatically from among the Priory shrubberies , and [Hadria]211-hadria passed into [the garden of the Griffins]3558-the garden of the griffins . [The caretaker]1693-the caretaker smiled , when [she]1693-the caretaker saw [who stood on the doorstep]3560-who stood on the doorstep . “ Why [ma'am]1503-ma'am , [I]1693-the caretaker thought [you]1503-ma'am was never coming again to play on the piano : [I]1693-the caretaker have missed it , that [I]1693-the caretaker have . It makes [the old place]3181-the old place seem that cheerful — [I]1693-the caretaker can almost fancy it 's [[my]1693-the caretaker poor young mistress]7224-my poor young mistress come back again . [She]7224-my poor young mistress used to sit and play on that piano , by the hour together . ”[1693-the caretaker] “ [I]211-hadria am glad [you]4547-the woman have enjoyed it , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria gently . The blinds were pulled up in [the drawing - room]737-the drawing - room , the piano was uncovered , the windows thrown open to [the terrace]1680-the terrace . “ [You]1503-ma'am have n't had much time for playing since [[your]1503-ma'am mamma]7225-your mamma has been ill , ”[4547-the woman] [the woman]4547-the woman continued , dusting the keys and setting up the music - rest . “ To - day [[my]211-hadria mother]4254-my mother has [a visitor]4809-a visitor ; [Mrs. Joseph Fleming]291-joseph is spending the afternoon with [her]4809-a visitor , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . “ To be sure , [ma'am]1503-ma'am , to be sure , [a nice young lady]7229-a nice young lady , and so cheerful , ”[753-the good woman] said [the good woman]753-the good woman , bustling off to wind up the tall old clock with the wise - looking face , that had been allowed to run down since [Hadria]211-hadria 's last visit . “ Seems more cheerful like , ”[1693-the caretaker] observed [the caretaker]1693-the caretaker , as the steady tick - tack began to sound through [the quiet room]3566-the quiet room . “ And have [you]1503-ma'am fed [my]211-hadria birds regularly , [Mrs. Williams]183-mrs. williams ? ”[211-hadria] asked [Hadria]211-hadria , taking off [her]211-hadria hat and standing at the open window looking out to [the terrace]1680-the terrace . “ Yes indeed , [ma'am]1503-ma'am , every day , just as [you]1503-ma'am used to do when [you]1503-ma'am came [yourself]1503-ma'am . And they has got so tame ; they almost eats out of [my]211-hadria hand . ”[211-hadria] “ And [[my]1693-the caretaker robin]7231-my robin ? [I]1693-the caretaker hope [he]7231-my robin has not deserted [us]7232-us . ”[1693-the caretaker] “ Oh , no , [he]7231-my robin comes right into [the room]379-the room sometimes and hops about , just as [he]7231-my robin did that afternoon , the last time [you]1503-ma'am was [here]3762-here ! [I]1693-the caretaker think it 's the same bird , for [he]7231-my robin likes to perch on that table and pick up the crumbs . ”[1693-the caretaker] “ [Poor little soul]2185-poor little soul ! If [you]1503-ma'am will give [me]1693-the caretaker a scrap of bread , [Mrs. Williams]183-mrs. williams — ”[1693-the caretaker] [The caretaker]1693-the caretaker left [the room]379-the room , and returned with a thick slice , which [Hadria]211-hadria crumbled and scattered on the window - sill , as [she]211-hadria stepped out to [the terrace]1680-the terrace . [The calm old mansion]3571-the calm old mansion with [its]3571-the calm old mansion delicate outlines , [its]3571-the calm old mansion dreamy exquisite stateliness , spoke of rest and sweet serenity . [The place]981-the place had the melancholy but also the repose of greatness . It was rich in all that lies nearest to the heart of that mysterious , dual - faced divinity that [we]3573-we call beauty , compounded of sorrow and delight . Ah ! if only [its owner]559-its owner could come and take up [[his]559-its owner abode [here]3762-here]3575-his abode here . If only [he]559-its owner would get well ! [Hadria]211-hadria 's thoughts wandered backwards to that wonderful evening , when [she]211-hadria had played to [him]559-its owner and [Algitha]81-algitha , and [they]3577-they had all watched the sunset afterwards , from [the terrace]1680-the terrace . How long was it since [she]211-hadria had touched the piano in [this old drawing - room]3579-this old drawing - room ? Never since [she]211-hadria returned from [Pari]79-pari . Even [[her]211-hadria own piano at [home]3770-home]3580-her own piano at home had been almost equally silent . [She]211-hadria believed that [she]211-hadria had not only quite abandoned hope with regard to music , but that [she]211-hadria had prepared [herself]211-hadria to face the inevitable decay of power , the inevitable proofs of [her]211-hadria loss , as time went on . But so far , [she]211-hadria had only had proofs that [she]211-hadria could do astonishingly much if [she]211-hadria had the chance . To - day , for the first time , the final ordeal had to be gone through . And [her]211-hadria imagination had never conceived its horror . [She]211-hadria was to be taken at [her]211-hadria word . The neglected gift was beginning to show signs of decay and enfeeblement . It had given fair warning for many a year , by the persistent appeal that it made , the persistent pain that it caused ; but the famine had told upon it at last . [It]3582-it was dying . As this fact insinuated itself into the consciousness , in the teeth of a wild effort to deny it , despair flamed up , fierce and violent . [She]211-hadria regretted that [she]211-hadria had not thrown up everything long ago , rather than endure this lingering death ; [she]211-hadria cursed [her]211-hadria hesitation , [she]211-hadria cursed [her]211-hadria fate , [her]211-hadria training , [her]211-hadria circumstances , [she]211-hadria cursed [herself]211-hadria . Whatever there was to curse , [she]211-hadria cursed . What hideous nonsense to imagine [herself]211-hadria ready to face this last insult of fate ! [She]211-hadria was like [a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot]3583-a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot , and knows what [he]3583-a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot has undertaken only when the flames begin to curl about [his]3583-a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot feet . [She]211-hadria had offered up [her]211-hadria power , [her]211-hadria imperious creative instinct , to the Lares and [Penates]292-penates ; [those greedy little godlets whom there was no appeasing while an inch of one remained that they could tear to pieces]3584-those greedy little godlets whom there was no appeasing while an inch of one remained that they could tear to pieces . [She]211-hadria clenched [her]211-hadria hands , in agony . [The whole being]3585-the whole being recoiled now , at the eleventh hour , as a fierce wild creature that [one tries to bury alive]3586-one tries to bury alive . [She]211-hadria looked back along the line of the past and saw , with too clear eyes , the whole insidious process , so stealthy that [she]211-hadria had hardly detected it , at the time . [She]211-hadria remembered those afternoons at [the Priory]31-the priory , when the restless , ill - trained power would assert itself , free for the moment , from the fetters and the dismemberment that awaited it in ordinary life . But like [a creature accustomed to the yoke]3587-a creature accustomed to the yoke , [she]211-hadria had found it increasingly difficult to use the moments of opportunity when they came . The force of daily usage , the necessary bending of thoughts in certain habitual directions , had assisted the crippling process , and though the power still lay there , stiffer than of yore , yet the preliminary movements and readjustments used up time and strength , and then gradually , with the perpetual repetition of adverse habits , the whole process became slower , harder , crueler . “ Good heavens ! are all doors going to be shut against [me]211-hadria ? ”[211-hadria] It was more than [she]211-hadria could bear ! And yet it must be borne — unless — no , there was no “ unless . ”[211-hadria] It was of no use to coquet with thoughts of suicide . [She]211-hadria had thought all that out long ago , and had sought , at more than one crisis of desperate misery , for refuge from the horror and the insults of life . But there were always [others to be considered]3588-others to be considered . [She]211-hadria could not strike [them]3588-others to be considered so terrible a blow . Retreat was ruthlessly cut off . Nothing remained but the endurance of a conscious slow decay ; nothing but increasing loss and feebleness , as the surly years went by . [They]3589-they were going , going , these years of life , slipping away with [their]3589-they spoils . [Youth]172-youth was departing , everything was vanishing ; [her]211-hadria very self , bit by bit , slowly but surely , till [the House of Life]3590-the house of life would grow narrow and shrunken to the sight , the roof descend . The gruesome old story of [the imprisoned prince]3591-the imprisoned prince flashed into [her]211-hadria mind ; [the wretched captive]3592-the wretched captive , young and life - loving , who used to wake up , each morning , to find that of the original seven windows of [[his]3591-the imprisoned prince dungeon]3593-his dungeon , one had disappeared , while the walls had advanced a foot , and to - morrow yet another foot , till at length the last window had closed up , and the walls shrank together and crushed [him]3591-the imprisoned prince to death . “ [I]211-hadria ca n't , [I]211-hadria ca n't endure it ! ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria had leaned forward against the key - board , which gave forth a loud crash of discordant notes , strangely expressive of the fall and failure of [her]211-hadria spirit . [She]211-hadria remained thus motionless , while the airs wandered in from [the garden]3867-the garden , and a broad ray of sunlight showed the strange incessant gyrations of the dust atoms , that happened to lie within the revealing brightness . The silence was perfect . [Hadria]211-hadria raised [her]211-hadria head at last , and [her]211-hadria eyes wandered out to [the sweet old garden]3595-the sweet old garden , decked in the miraculous hues of spring . The unutterable loveliness brought , for a second , a strange , inconsequent sense of peace ; it seemed like a promise and a message from [an unknown god]3596-an unknown god . But after that momentary and inexplicable experience , the babble of thought went on as before . The old dream mounted again heavenwards , like a cloud at sunset ; wild fancies fashioned themselves in the brain . And then , in fantastic images , [Hadria]211-hadria seemed to see a panorama of [her]211-hadria own life and the general life pass before [her]211-hadria , in all their incongruity and confusion . The great mass of that life showed itself as prose , because the significance of things had not been grasped or suspected ; but here and there , the veil was pierced — by [some suffering soul]3597-some suffering soul , by [some poet]3598-some poet 's vision — and the darkness of [our]3599-we daily , pompous , careworn , ridiculous little existence made painfully visible . “ It is all absurd , all futile ! ”[3597-some suffering soul] ( so moved the procession of the thoughts ) ; “ and meanwhile the steady pulse of life beats on , not pausing while [we]3599-we battle out [our]3599-we days , not waiting while [we]3599-we decide how [we]3599-we shall live . [We]3599-we are possessed by a sentiment , an ideal , a religion ; old Time makes no comment , but moves quietly on ; [we]3599-we fling the thing aside as tawdry , insufficient ; the ideal is tarnished , experience of [the world]334-the world converts [us]3599-we — and still unmoved , [he]3596-an unknown god paces on . [We]3599-we are off on another chase ; another conception of things possesses [us]3599-we ; and still the beat of [his]3596-an unknown god footstep sounds in [our]3599-we ears , above the tumult . [We]3599-we think and aspire and dream , and meanwhile the fires grow cold upon the hearth , the daily cares and common needs plead eloquently for [our]3599-we undivided service ; the stupendous movement of Existence goes on unceasingly , at [our]3599-we doors ; [thousands]3718-thousands struggling for gold and fame and mere bread , and resorting to infamous devices to obtain them ; the great commercial currents flow and flow , according to [their]3718-thousands mystic laws ; the price of stocks goes up , goes down , and with them , the life and fate of [thousands]3718-thousands ; the inconsequent bells ring out from [Craddock Church]33-craddock church , and [the people]4302-the people congregate ; [the grave of [the schoolmistress]4793-the schoolmistress]7240-the grave of the schoolmistress sleeps in the sunshine , and the sound of the bells streams over [it]7240-the grave of the schoolmistress — meaning no irony — to lose itself in the quiet of [the hills]413-the hills ; rust and dust collect in [[one]329-one 's house]7244-one 's house , in [one]329-one 's soul ; and this and that , and that and this,—like the pendulum of the old time - piece , with its solemn tick — dock the moments of one 's life , with each its dull little claim and its tough little tether , and lead one decorously to the gateway of Eternity . ”[3597-some suffering soul] There was a flutter of wings , in [the room]379-the room . A robin hopped in at the window and perched daintily on the table - ledge , its delicate claws outlined against the whiteness of the dust - sheet , its head inquisitively on one side , as if it were asking the reason of [the musician]6156-the musician 's unusual silence . Suddenly , the little creature fluffed out its feathers , drew itself together , and warbled forth a rich ecstatic song , that seemed to be deliberately addressed to [its human companion]3602-its human companion . [Hadria]211-hadria raised [her]211-hadria bowed head . Up welled the swift unaccustomed tears , while [the robin]3603-the robin , with increasing enthusiasm , continued [his]3603-the robin song . [His]3603-the robin theme , doubtless , was of the flicker of sun - lit shrubberies , the warmth of summer , the glory of spring , the sweetness of the revolving seasons . For cure of heartache , [he]3603-the robin suggested the pleasantness of [garden nooks]3604-garden nooks , and the repose that lingers about a dew - sprinkled lawn . All these things were warmly commended to [the human being whose song of life had ceased]3605-the human being whose song of life had ceased . “ But they break [my]3603-the robin heart , [little singer]7246-little singer , [they]7247-they break [my]3603-the robin heart ! ”[3603-the robin] The robin lifted up its head and warbled more rapturously than ever . The tears were falling fast know , and silently . The thoughts ran on and on . “ [I]3603-the robin know it all , [I]3603-the robin know it all , and [my]3603-the robin heart is broken — and it is [my]3603-the robin own fault — and it does not matter — [the world]334-the world is full of broken hearts — and it does not matter , it does not matter . But , oh , if the pain might stop , if the pain might stop ! [The robin]3603-the robin sings now , because the spring is here ; but it is not always spring . And some day — perhaps not this winter , but some day — the dear little brown body will agonize — it will die alone , in [the horrible great universe]7250-the horrible great universe ; [one]329-one thinks little of [a robin]7252-a robin , but it agonizes all the same when its time comes ; it agonizes all the same . ”[3603-the robin] The thoughts were drowned , for a moment , in a flood of terrible , unbearable pity for all the sorrow of [the world]334-the world . [The robin]3603-the robin seemed to think that [he]3603-the robin had a mission to cheer [[his]3603-the robin companion]4118-his companion , for [he]3603-the robin warbled merrily on . And beside [him]3603-the robin , [the dust - motes]3609-the dust - motes danced the wildest of dances , in the shaft of sunshine . “ It is very lovely , it is very lovely — [the world]334-the world is a miracle , but it is all like a taunt , it is like an insult , this glory of [the world]334-the world . [I]3609-the dust - motes am born [a woman]3753-a woman , and to be born [a woman]3753-a woman is to be exquisitely sensitive to insult and to live under it always , always . [I]3609-the dust - motes wish that [I]3609-the dust - motes were as marble to the magic of Life , [I]3609-the dust - motes wish that [I]3609-the dust - motes cared for nothing and felt nothing . [I]3609-the dust - motes pray only that the dream and the longing may be killed , and killed quickly ! ”[3609-the dust - motes] In the silence , the bird 's note sounded clear and tender . The dance of [the dust - motes]3609-the dust - motes , like the great dance of Life itself , went on without ceasing . [The robin]3603-the robin seemed to insist on a brighter view of things . [He]3603-the robin urged [[his]3603-the robin companion]4118-his companion to take comfort . Had the spring not come ? “ But [you]4118-his companion do not understand , [you]4118-his companion do not understand , [little soul that sings]7257-little soul that sings — the spring is torturing [me]3603-the robin and taunting [me]3603-the robin . If only it would kill [me]3603-the robin ! ”[3603-the robin] [The robin]3603-the robin fluffed out [his]3603-the robin feathers , and began again to impart [his]3603-the robin sweet philosophy . [Hadria]211-hadria was shedding the first unchecked tears that [she]211-hadria had shed since [her]211-hadria earliest childhood . And then , for the second time to - day , that strange unexplained peace stole into [her]211-hadria heart . [Reason]196-cold reason came quickly and drove it away with a sneer , and the horror and the darkness closed round again . “ If [I]196-cold reason might only die , if [I]196-cold reason might only die ! ”[196-cold reason] But [the little bird]3614-the little bird sang on . “ QUITE hopeless ! ”[3614-the little bird] [Joseph Fleming]291-joseph repeated the words incredulously . “ Yes , ”[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , “ it is the terrible truth . ”[176-lady engleton] [The Professor]4071-the professor had been growing worse , and at length , [his]4071-the professor state became so alarming that [he]4071-the professor decided to return to [England]14-england . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria and [an old friend whom [she]109-valeria had met abroad]3616-an old friend whom she had met abroad , accompanied [him]4071-the professor . “ [I]291-joseph understand [they]7258-they are all at [the Priory]1664-the priory , ”[291-joseph] said [Joseph]291-joseph . “ Yes ; [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria telegraphed to [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley , and [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley and [I]291-joseph put [our]7260-our heads together and arranged matters as well as [we]7260-our could in the emergency , so that [the Professor]4071-the professor 's wish might be gratified . [He]4071-the professor desired to return to [the Priory]1664-the priory , where [his]4071-the professor boyhood was spent . ”[291-joseph] “ And is there really no hope ? ”[159-joseph fleming] “ None at all , [the doctor]1471-the doctor says . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ Dear [me]291-joseph , dear [me]291-joseph ! ”[291-joseph] cried [Joseph]291-joseph . “ And is [he]4071-the professor not expected to live through the summer ? ”[291-joseph] “ The summer ! ah no , [Mr. Fleming]159-joseph fleming , [he]4071-the professor is not expected to live many days . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ Dear [me]159-joseph fleming , dear [me]159-joseph fleming ! ”[159-joseph fleming] was all that [Joseph]159-joseph fleming could say . Then after a pause , [he]159-joseph fleming added , “ [I]159-joseph fleming fear [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley will feel it very much . [They]7264-they were [such old friends]5254-such old friends . ”[159-joseph fleming] “ Oh ! [poor woman]4273-poor woman , [she]4273-poor woman is heart - broken . ”[159-joseph fleming] [The Professor]4071-the professor lingered longer than [the doctor]1471-the doctor had expected . [He]4071-the professor was very weak , and could not bear the fatigue of seeing [many people]986-many people . But [he]4071-the professor was perfectly cheerful , and when feeling little better at times , [he]4071-the professor would laugh and joke in [his]4071-the professor old kindly way , and seemed to enjoy the fragment of life that still remained to [him]4071-the professor . “ [I]4071-the professor am so glad [I]4071-the professor have seen the spring again , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said , “ and hat [I]4071-the professor am here , in [the old home]6447-the old home . ”[4071-the professor] [He]4071-the professor liked to have the window thrown wide open , when the day was warm . Then [his]4071-the professor bed would be wheeled closer to it , so that the sunshine often lay across it , and the scent of the flowering shrubs and the odour of growth , as [he]4071-the professor called it , floated in upon [him]4071-the professor . [He]4071-the professor looked out into a world of exquisite greenery and of serene sky . [The room]379-the room was above [the drawing - room]737-the drawing - room , and if the drawing - room windows were open , [he]4071-the professor could hear [Hadria]211-hadria playing . [He]4071-the professor often used to ask for music . The request would come generally after an exhausting turn of pain , when [he]4071-the professor could not bear the fatigue of seeing [people]3687-people . “ [I]4071-the professor ca n't tell [you]7268-you what pleasure and comfort [your]7268-you music is to [me]4071-the professor , ”[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor used to say , again and again . “ It has been so ever since [I]4071-the professor knew [you]7268-you . When [I]4071-the professor think of [the thousands of poor devils who have to end [their]7269-the thousands of poor devils who have to end their lives in some wretched , lonely , sordid fashion , after hardships and struggles and very little hope lives in some wretched , lonely , sordid fashion , after hardships and struggles and very little hope]7269-the thousands of poor devils who have to end their lives in some wretched , lonely , sordid fashion , after hardships and struggles and very little hope , [I]4071-the professor ca n't help feeling that [I]4071-the professor am fortunate indeed , now and all through [my]4071-the professor life . [I]4071-the professor have grumbled at times , and there have been sharp experiences — few escape those — but take it all round , [I]4071-the professor have had [my]4071-the professor share of good things . ”[4071-the professor] [He]4071-the professor had one great satisfaction : that [he]4071-the professor had discovered , before the end of [his]4071-the professor days , the means which [he]4071-the professor had so long been seeking , of saving the death - agony of animals that are killed for food . Some day perhaps , [he]4071-the professor said , [men]3698-men might cease to be numbered among the beasts of prey , but till then , at least [[their]3698-men victims]6925-their victims might be spared as much pain as possible . [He]4071-the professor had overcome the difficulty of expense , which had always been the main obstacle to a practical solution of the problem . Henceforth there was no need for [any creature]3625-any creature to suffer , in dying for [man]332-man 's use . If [people]3687-people only knew and realized how much needless agony is inflicted on [these helpless creatures]3628-these helpless creatures , in order to supply the daily demands of [a vast flesh - eating population]3629-a vast flesh - eating population , [they]3687-people would feel that , as a matter of fact , [he]4071-the professor had been doing [the human race]3630-the human race a good turn as well as [[their]3630-the human race more friendless fellow - beings]3631-their more friendless fellow - beings . It was impossible to imagine that [men]3698-men and [women]606-women would not suffer at the thought of causing suffering to the helpless , if once [they]3687-people realized that suffering clearly . [Men]3698-men and [women]606-women were not devils ! [Theobald]181-professor theobald had always laughed at [him]4071-the professor for this part of [his]4071-the professor work , but [he]4071-the professor felt now , at the close of [his]4071-the professor life , that [he]4071-the professor could dwell upon that effort with more pleasure than on any other , although others had won [him]4071-the professor far more applause , and this had often brought [him]4071-the professor contempt . If only [he]4071-the professor could be sure that the discovery would not be wasted . “ It shall be [our]7270-our business to see that it is not , ”[109-valeria] said [Valeria]109-valeria , in a voice tremulous with unshed tears . [The Professor]4071-the professor heaved a sigh of relief , at this assurance . “ [My]4071-the professor earlier work is safe ; what [I]4071-the professor have done in other directions , is already a part of human knowledge and resource , but this is just the sort of thing that might be so easily lost and forgotten . These sufferings are hidden , and when [people]3687-people do not see a wrong , [they]3687-people do not think of it ; make [them]3687-people think , make [them]3687-people think ! ”[4071-the professor] A week had gone by since [the Professor]4071-the professor 's arrival at [the Priory]31-the priory . [He]4071-the professor was in great pain , but had intervals of respite . [He]4071-the professor liked , in those intervals , to see [[his]4071-the professor friends]4990-his friends . [They]4990-his friends could scarcely believe that [he]4071-the professor was dying , for [he]4071-the professor still seemed so full of interest in the affairs of life , and spoke of the future as if [he]4071-the professor would be there to see it . One of the most distressing interviews was with [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton , who could not be persuaded that [the invalid]6530-the invalid had but a short time to live . [The old man]4209-the old man believed that death meant , beyond all question , annihilation of the personality , and had absolutely no hope of meeting again . “ Do n't be too sure , [old friend]7272-old friend , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor ; “ do n't be too sure of anything , in [this mysterious universe]7273-this mysterious universe . ”[4071-the professor] The weather kept warm and genial , and this was favourable to [his]4071-the professor lingering among [them]4990-his friends a little longer . But [his]4071-the professor suffering , at times , was so great that [they]4990-his friends could scarcely wish for this delay . [Hadria]211-hadria used always to play to [him]4071-the professor during some part of the afternoon . [The robin]3603-the robin had become a constant visitor , and had found its way to the window of [the sick - room]6470-the sick - room , where crumbs had been scattered on the sill . [The Professor]4071-the professor took great pleasure in watching [the little creature]5088-the little creature . Sometimes [it]3603-the robin would come into [the room]379-the room and hop on to a chair or table , coquetting from perch to perch , and looking at [the invalid]6530-the invalid , with bright inquisitive eyes . The crumbs were put out at a certain hour each morning , and the bird had acquired the habit of arriving almost to the moment . If , by chance , the crumbs had been forgotten , the robin would flutter ostentatiously before the window , to remind [[his]3603-the robin friends]4990-his friends of [their]4990-his friends neglected duty . During the last few days , [Hadria]211-hadria had fancied that [the Professor]4071-the professor had divined [Valeria]109-valeria 's secret , or that [she]109-valeria had betrayed it . There was a peculiar , reverent tenderness in [his]4071-the professor manner towards [her]109-valeria , that was even more marked than usual . “ Ca n't [we]3650-we save [him]6530-the invalid ? ca n't [we]3650-we save [him]6530-the invalid , [Hadria]211-hadria ? ”[109-valeria] [she]109-valeria used to cry piteously , when [they]3650-we were alone . “ Surely , surely there is some hope . Science makes such professions ; why does n't it do something ? ”[109-valeria] “ Ah , do n't torture [yourself]211-hadria with false hope , dear [Valeria]109-valeria . ”[109-valeria] “ [The world]334-the world is monstrous , life is unbearable , ”[109-valeria] exclaimed [Valeria]109-valeria , with a despairing break in [her]109-valeria voice . But one afternoon , [she]109-valeria came out of [the sick - room]6470-the sick - room with a less distraught expression on [her]109-valeria worn face , though [her]109-valeria eyes shewed traces of tears . [The dying man]3652-the dying man used to speak often about [[his]3652-the dying man wife]573-his wife to [Hadria]211-hadria . This had been [[her]109-valeria room]4419-her room , and [he]3652-the dying man almost fancied [her]109-valeria presence about [him]3652-the dying man . “ Do [you]211-hadria know , ”[3652-the dying man] [he]3652-the dying man said , “ [I]3652-the dying man have found , of late , that many of [my]3652-the dying man old fixed ideas have been insidiously modifying . So many things that [I]3652-the dying man used to regard as preposterous have been borne in upon [me]3652-the dying man , in a singular fashion , as by no means so out of the question . [I]3652-the dying man have had one or two strange experiences and now a hope — [I]3652-the dying man might say a faith — has settled upon [me]3652-the dying man of an undying element in [our]7275-we personality . [I]3652-the dying man feel that [we]7275-we shall meet again those [we]7275-we have loved [here]3762-here — some time or another . ”[3652-the dying man] “ What [a sting that would take from the agony of parting]7277-a sting that would take from the agony of parting , ”[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria . “ And , after all , is it less rational to suppose that there is some survival of the Self , and that the wild , confused earthly experience is an element of a spiritual evolutionary process , than to suppose that [the whole universe]7278-the whole universe is chaotic and meaningless ? For what [we]7275-we call mind exists , and it must be contained in the sum - total of existence , or how could it arise out of it ? Therefore , some reasonable scheme appears more likely than a reasonless one . And then there is that other big fact that stares [us]7275-we in the face and puts [one]329-one 's fears to shame : human goodness . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria 's rebellious memory recalled the fact of human cruelty and wickedness to set against the goodness , but [she]211-hadria was silent . “ What earthly business has such a thing as goodness or pity to appear in [a fortuitous , mindless , soulless universe]7280-a fortuitous , mindless , soulless universe ? Where does it come from ? What is its origin ? Whence sprang the laws that gave it birth ? ”[211-hadria] “ It gives more argument to faith than any thing [I]211-hadria know , ”[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said , “ even if there had been but [one good man or woman]7281-one good man or woman since [the world]334-the world began . ”[211-hadria] “ Ah , yes ; the pity and tenderness that lie in the heart of [man , even of the worst]7283-man , even of the worst , if only they can be appealed to before [they]7283-man , even of the worst die , may teach [us]7275-we to hope all things . ”[211-hadria] There was a long silence . Through the open window , [they]3655-they could hear the soft cooing of the wood - pigeons . Among the big trees behind [the house]296-the house , there was [a populous rookery]3657-a populous rookery , noisy now with the squeaky voices of the young birds , and the deeper cawing of the parent rooks . “ [I]4071-the professor have been for many years without one gleam of hope , ”[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor slowly . “ It is only lately that some of [my]4071-the professor obstinate preconceptions have begun to yield to other suggestions and other thoughts , which have opened up a thousand possibilities and a thousand hopes . And [I]4071-the professor have not been false to [my]4071-the professor reason in this change ; [I]4071-the professor have but followed it more fearlessly and more faithfully . ”[4071-the professor] “ [I]211-hadria have sometimes thought , ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , “ that when [we]7275-we seem to cling most desperately to [our]7275-we reason , [we]7275-we are really refusing to accept its guidance into [unfamiliar regions]7284-unfamiliar regions . [We]7275-we confuse [the familiar]7285-the familiar with the reasonable . ”[211-hadria] “ Exactly . And [I]4071-the professor want [you]211-hadria to be on [your]211-hadria guard against that intellectual foible , which [I]4071-the professor believe has held [me]4071-the professor back in [a region of sadness and solitude]7286-a region of sadness and solitude that [I]4071-the professor need not have lingered in , but for that . ”[4071-the professor] There was a great commotion in [the rookery]3659-the rookery , and presently a flock of rooks swept across the window , in loud controversy , and away over [the garden]3867-the garden in a circle , and then up and up till [they]3661-they were a grey little patch of changing shape , in the blue of the sky . [The dying man]3652-the dying man followed [them]3661-they with [his]3652-the dying man eyes . [He]3652-the dying man had watched such streaming companies start forth from [the old rookery]3663-the old rookery , ever since [his]3652-the dying man boyhood . The memories of that time , and of the importunate thoughts that had haunted [him]3652-the dying man then , at the opening of life , returned to [him]3652-the dying man now . [He]3652-the dying man had accomplished a fraction of what [he]3652-the dying man had set out to attempt , with such high hopes . [His]3652-the dying man dream of personal happiness had failed ; many an illusion had been lost , many a bitterly - regretted deed had saddened [him]3652-the dying man , many an error had revenged itself upon [him]3652-the dying man . [He]3652-the dying man drew a deep sigh . “ And if the scheme of the universe be a reasonable one , ”[3652-the dying man] [he]3652-the dying man said half dreamily , “ then [one]329-one can account better for the lives that never fulfil themselves ; the apparent failure that saddens [one]329-one , in such numberless instances , especially among [women]606-women . For in that case , the failure is only apparent , however cruel and however great . If the effort has been sincere , and the thought bent upon the best that could be conceived by [the particular soul]7290-the particular soul , then that effort and that thought must play their part in the upward movement of the race . [I]3652-the dying man can not believe otherwise . ”[3652-the dying man] [Hadria]211-hadria 's head was bent . [Her]211-hadria lips moved , as if in an effort to speak , but no sound came . “ To believe that all the better and more generous hopes of [our]7291-we kind are to be lost and ineffectual , that genius is finally wasted , and goodness an exotic to be trampled under foot in the blind movements of Nature — that requires more power of faith than [I]211-hadria can muster . Once believe that thought is the main factor , the motive force of [the universe]420-the universe , then everything settles into its place , and [we]7291-we have room for hope ; indeed it insists upon admission ; it falls into the shadow of [our]7291-we life like that blessed ray of sunlight . ”[211-hadria] It lay across the bed , in a bright streak . “ The hope leads [me]211-hadria far . [My]211-hadria training has been all against it , but it comes to [me]211-hadria with greater and greater force . It makes [me]211-hadria feel that presently , when [we]7291-we have bid [one another]3945-one another farewell , it will not be for ever . [We]7291-we shall meet again , [dear Hadria]211-hadria , believe [me]211-hadria . ”[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria was struggling with [her]211-hadria tears , and could answer nothing . “ [I]211-hadria wish so much that [I]211-hadria could leave this hope , as a legacy to [you]211-hadria . [I]211-hadria wish [I]211-hadria could leave it to [Valeria]109-valeria . Take care of [her]109-valeria , wo n't [you]211-hadria ? [She]109-valeria is very solitary and very sad . ”[211-hadria] “ [I]211-hadria will , [I]211-hadria will , ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria murmured . “ Do not turn away from the light of rational hope , if any path should open up that leads that way . And help [her]109-valeria to do the same . When [you]211-hadria think of [me]211-hadria , let it be happily and with comfort . ”[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria was silently weeping . “ And hold fast to [your]211-hadria own colours . Do n't take sides , above all , with the powers that have oppressed [you]211-hadria . [They]7294-they are terrible powers , and yet [people]3687-people wo n't admit [their]3687-people strength , and so [they]3687-people are left unopposed . It is worse than folly to underrate the forces of [the enemy]435-the enemy . It is always worse than folly to deny facts in order to support a theory . Exhort [people]3687-people to face and conquer [them]3687-people . [You]211-hadria can help more than [you]211-hadria dream , even as things stand . [I]3664-i can not tell [you]211-hadria what [you]211-hadria have done for [me]3664-i , dear [Hadria]211-hadria . ”[3664-i] ( [He]3664-i held out [his]3664-i hand to [her]211-hadria . ) “ And the helpless , human and animal — how [they]7294-they wring [one]329-one 's heart ! Do not forget [them]7294-they ; be to [them]7294-they [a knight - errant]7299-a knight - errant . [You]211-hadria have suffered enough [yourself]211-hadria , to know well how to bind [their]7294-they wounds . ”[306-the speaker] [The speaker]306-the speaker paused , for a moment , to battle with a paroxysm of pain . “ There is so much anguish , ”[3664-i] [he]3664-i said presently , “ so much intolerable anguish , even when things seem smoothest . [The human spirit]7300-the human spirit craves for so much , and generally it gets so little . [The world]334-the world is full of tragedy ; and sympathy , a little common sympathy , can do so much to soften the worst of grief . It is for the lack of that , that [people]3687-people despair and go down . [I]3664-i commend [them]3687-people to [you]211-hadria . ”[3664-i] [The figure]3666-the figure lay motionless , as if asleep . The expression was one of utter peace . It seemed as if all the love and tenderness , all the breadth and beauty of the soul that had passed away , were shining out of the quieted face , from which all trace of suffering had vanished . The look of desolation that used , at times , to come into it , had entirely gone . [Hadria]211-hadria and [Valeria]109-valeria stood together , by the bedside . At the foot of the bed was a glass vase , holding a spray of wild cherry blossom ; [Hadria]211-hadria had brought it , to [the invalid]6530-the invalid 's delight , the day before . There were other offerings of fresh flowers ; a mass of azaleas from [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton ; bunches of daffodils that [Valeria]109-valeria had gathered in [the meadows]5896-the meadows ; and [old Dodge]286-old dodge had sent a handful of brown and yellow wallflower , from [[his]286-old dodge garden]3669-his garden . The blind had been raised a few inches , so as to let in the sunlight and the sweet air . It was a glorious morning . The few last hot days had brought everything out , with a rush . The boughs of the trees , that [the Professor]4071-the professor had loved so to watch during [his]4071-the professor illness , were swaying gently in the breeze , just as they had done when [his]4071-the professor eyes had been open to see [them]3671-them . The wood - pigeons were cooing , the young rooks cawing shrilly in [the rookery]3659-the rookery . [Valeria]109-valeria seemed to be stunned . [She]109-valeria stood gazing at the peaceful face , with a look of stony grief . “ [I]109-valeria ca n't understand it ! ”[109-valeria] [she]109-valeria exclaimed at last , with a wild gesture , “ [I]109-valeria ca n't believe [he]4071-the professor will never speak to [me]109-valeria again ! It 's a horrible dream — oh , but too horrible — ah , why ca n't [I]109-valeria die as well as [he]4071-the professor ? ”[109-valeria] [She]109-valeria threw [herself]109-valeria on [her]109-valeria knees , shaken with sobs , silent and passionate . [Hadria]211-hadria did not attempt to remonstrate or soothe [her]109-valeria . [She]109-valeria turned away , as a flood of bitter grief swept over [her]109-valeria , so that [she]109-valeria felt as [one drowning]3673-one drowning . Some minutes passed before [Valeria]109-valeria rose from [her]109-valeria knees , looking haggard and desolate . [Hadria]211-hadria went towards [her]109-valeria hastily . “ What 's that ? ”[109-valeria] cried [Valeria]109-valeria with a nervous start and a scared glance towards the window . “ The robin ! ”[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , and the tears started to [her]109-valeria eyes . The bird had hopped in at [his]3674-his usual hour , in a friendly fashion . [He]3674-his picked up a few stray crumbs that had been left on the sill from yesterday , and then , in little capricious flights from stage to stage , finally arrived at the rail of the bed , and stood looking from side to side , with black , bright eyes , at [the motionless figure]3675-the motionless figure . Hitherto it had been accustomed to a welcome . Why this strange silence ? The robin hopped round on the rail , polished [his]3674-his beak meditatively , fluffed out [his]3674-his feathers , and then , raising [his]3674-his head , sang a tender requiem .
